review_body: Beware the “Quick Size” ARE NOT THE SAME AS THE “SELECT-A-SIZE”! I’ve ordered cartons of the Bounty Select-A-Size paper towels in the “Family 2 rolls/package” from Amazon for several months now and been very happy. When I placed my most recent order, there was a message on Amazon’s webpage that said “this item has been replaced with a newer model”. Unfortunately the “newer model” has 15 fewer sheets/roll and costs $1.02 more/carton. The only way to distinguish between the original Bounty rolls and the “newer model” Bounty rolls is that the original ones say “Select-A-Size” on the package and the “newer model” packages say “Quick Size”.  This a very disappointing development from both Bounty and Amazon!

review_title: Buyer Beware: Smaller than Huge rolls but cost the same
review_body: The Grocery Store Shrink Ray strikes again. These "family" rolls were substituted in for the "Huge" rolls I had always been purchasing with my Bounty Dash button, and these rolls are about 10% smaller for the exact same price. The only saving grace? These are the same awesome quality Bounty paper towels that they're always been - just there's less of them. I will be retiring my Dash button and I will NOT be purchasing these again.
Bounty/amazon switched dash purchases from the huge to family. The price is the same but there is about 10% less paper.  I will be canceling my dash button!

These are NOT the select-a-size that I like and rebuy.  Each sheet is smaller and there are fewer on the roll than the Select-a-size Bounty.  Think that promoting these as a special for prime members is misleading.  I will not buy these from Amazon in future but will return to Target or Walmart to buy them.

review_title: Save your money and purchase the original Select a Size...you don't need the aggravation.
review_body: Sorry but these are really thin, scratchy and doesn't pick up anything.  You cannot get it to tear off the roll at the perforations correctly, but instead just tears where ever it wants. I am a lifetime user of Bounty (select a size), but if Bounty is changing to the Quick Size Paper Towels...they lost me as a customer.  Save your money and purchase the original Select a Size...you don't need the aggravation.  If I could give it a minus zero, I would.

review_title: Not the same quality as the ones I previously ordered.
review_body: In the past I always ordered the Bounty select a size huge rolls.  The last time I tried to do that I got a message that said they were no longer available and were being replaced with the Quick Size.  I decided to give them a try and I have been very disappointed.  The towels are thin and not very absorbent.  As a number of people have commented, they say select a size on the roll but they tear unevenly.  Sometimes you get two towels instead of one and sometimes they tear unevenly.  I am going back to ordering the ones I was originally using.  There is less waste and they do a better job.

review_title: Too expensive price changed in 24 hours
review_body: Paper towels are good not as large as I thought they would be by the description and they also were $7 cheaper the day after I bought them that really made me mad probably will not buy again
These came in tissue boxes marked Kleenex. Clearly inferior for the purpose of paper towels.

As the photo shows without ambiguity the “Family Size Rolls” do not contain the same amount of product as the Huge Rolls. The change in the “single sheet size” was indiscernible in using the product and doesn’t justify the manufacturer hiking the price on the Huge Rolls. Fewer towels = Buying more sooner. Greedy move.

review_title: Bounty is skimping somewhere and quality is going downhill.
review_body: I usually love this Bounty. But since they changed it to ‘quick size’ the quality has been lacking. I’ve had a hard time tearing sheets and this last set I got is noticeably less thick. I can squeeze the whole roll and it’s still smaller than the previous pack I bought. They say on the package the same amount of sheets. But something is really lacking. The thickness, absorbency and quality. Shame Bounty. I hope it goes back to better quality!!!

I followed the recommendation to order a 20 x 20 insert for an 18 x 18 cover.  The result had the look and feel of a basket ball with points.  It was ridiculously overstuffed.  It also tore the seam a bit near the zipper in the struggle to get it into the cover.  I reordered an 18 x 18 insert and now it's just right.  It looks and feels like a pillow should.  I would suggest ignoring the recommendations and ordering an insert the same size as the cover.  Other than that, the insert seems perfectly fine.  Be sure to push some stuffing into the corners if they're not completely filled.

Very nice pillow insert.  I ordered a size 20X20 for my pillow cases that were size 18X18 because people said to order a size up.  They pillows are very over stuffed in my opinion.  If I had to do it again I would have ordered 18x18, the same size as my covers.  I'm hoping that with some use they might break in.  Oh well,

Pillows arrived vacuum compressed and I allowed them 24 hours to expand/fluff.. These pillows are not even filled properly; at most, it's 3/4 full with huge empty spaces at all four corners. The empty spaces start at each corner and go inward for approximately 5 inches from EACH corner. Total emptiness and air. No amount of fluffing or arranging will make any of the cheap poly migrate towards the edges.. So, not only are these pillows not 24 x 24 and thus cannot fill a 24 x 24 pillow, they dont even fill out a 22 x 22 pillow because they're so underfilled.. Avoid at all costs, and buy something a little more expensive but quality. These are terrible.

These two pillow inserts I ordered are 18L.  They are supposed to be SQUARE not rectangle.  Now, just days before Christmas I have to rush around trying to find the correct ones.  They are nice and soft, but are not the right size, I ordered 18 x 18.  The package says 18L.  Not pleased

Have other inserts. I am always changing the pillow covers on my sofa & daybed. Want people to curl up & be comfortable.Noticed that guests were gravitating to two certain pillows. Then realized my family did too. It was these! They are full, supportive for those guests who want one behind their back. They are light weight, easily fluffed up to regally display the covers. I've ordered more to start replacing all my inserts with these. They also fit perfectly into the corners of my covers. After checking stores, these are underlined for the exceptional quality. Ah, that's just between us..don't tell the company!!

These were a great fit for my 18 x 18 pillow cover as well as a 17.5 x 17.5 pillow cover. They are pretty soft and fluffy, good quality. I would recommend purchasing this size if you are using the 18 x 18 cover and want a well stuffed and firm pillow. I have seen pictures of slouchy under filled pillows on pinterest so if that is the look you are going for, you should go with something a bit smaller, but I think that the 20 x 20 pillow and 18 x 18 cover combo is pretty standard. This is a great product, there are ones out there that are a bit cheaper but spend the three dollars extra and get this pillow insert because the quality is acceptable for the price. If you are looking to sleep on this pillow, you may want to opt for something a bit more expensive, but if you are using it as a throw pillow this is perfect and there is really no reason to splurge on anything fancier.

Picture is misleading.  The actual product doesn't have "ears".  It is roughly a square and you have to shake and pull the filling into the cover's "ears" - good luck.  The manufacturer says to buy a size larger than the pillow cover - i.e. 18" cover 20" filling.  Several reviews said this wasn't necessary, but I think the maker is right.  My 22" cover could have easily used a 24" stuffer, which might even have filled the currently hollow ears.  The filler is comfortable to lean against, but I will buy a shaped pillow stuffer from now on.
Do NOT follow the sizing recommendations. I have a cover that is 18x18, so I ordered the 20x20 insert. I can't get it into the cover. So now I have to return it and order the next smaller size.

Absolutely great!  I wanted a hypoallergenic stuffer pillow and so I ordered this one and it worked great!  I had a small problem in that I ordered the wrong size at first and I received immediate response from the company for returning them and getting the right size.  Five stars all the way!

review_title: Initially i gave a 2 star because i one of ...
review_body: Initially i gave a 2 star because i one of the pillows was a 12x20 instead of 18x18. I was contacted by the seller to fluff out/shake out the pillow because they are so compacted in the plastic that I could mistake the size. I thought that was crazy but I decided to check it further and sure enough the pillow shook out to be the 18x18!!  I've never had that happen before! I apologize to the seller....I did get what i paid for. For now on whenever you get stuffer pillows that have been compacted, make sure you completely open and shake them out before you ask to return it!

review_title: Add real character to a cozy space
review_body: They look lovely up in my daughter's attic room!

review_title: They were absolutely perfect! I bought two sets
review_body: Purchased these last minute for a wedding backdrop. They were absolutely perfect! I bought two sets. They linked together nicely. We put them on a slow fade setting and they were beautiful! The bride loved them.

review_title: ... pictures online of fairy lights with sheer curtains and loved the look
review_body: I saw a few pictures online of fairy lights with sheer curtains and loved the look. These lights in particular are perfect for what I was looking for. It gives off a warm cozy glow, and really adds a nice touch of oomph to the room. The only downside is that I needed to buy an extension cord to plug it in, the plug is nowhere near long enough to plug it in unless your outlets are near the ceiling for some strange reason. Not sure why they be designed this way, especially when these are designed to be hung, but hey with the extension cord I'm more than happy.

review_title: Very nice lights. They are hanging on my wall in ...
review_body: Very nice lights.  They are hanging on my wall in the back yard.  They have connectors that are easy to fit together.  I strung up 10 sets along the wall.  They are longer than I thought but it looked pretty draping on the ground.

These are so stunning I may just leave them up all year! I bought 3 strands and would honestly buy more if i needed them. I tested the waterproofing and they are definitely waterproof! I love all the different settings and the way they make my patio look. Just a heads up; do NOT take The twist ties off before you hang them up. I made the mistake of taking all the ties off and then had to untangle them for about half an hour lol. Both my mom and sister asked where I bought these lights so YES I would definitely refer these to others. You won’t be disappointed.
Beautiful!!!! I am obsessed!!

I bought this product to liven up my apartment, I love it! It arrived quickly and was easy to set up. The only issue I have was that the cord for the plug is WAY too short, I had to buy a chord extender so I could plug it in. But the lights are very soft, not too bright. Perfect! There are many different settings too for the lights to glow, or blink in. Definitely a bang for your buck👌🏽

review_title: It was a bummer because everything looked perfect until we connected the lights
review_body: This lights are so cute, but ran a but short . I only bought two for a party and they light up the living room quiet well. The only thing that didn't work out was the other set of other lights they were a lot dinner than the other set. In the second photo you can see the left side looks a lot brighter than the ones one the left. It was a bummer because everything looked perfect until we connected the lights, but still really cute lights for a chill ambiance vibe.

review_title: Light strands are farther apart than I was expecting..
review_body: Perfect! There is a downfall though, the reason I rated 4/5 instead of 5/5. The light strands are spread pretty far apart from each other. This may be perfect for some instances..but it was difficult for me because of the small space I was using. I folded the entire light strands (width wise) in half in an attempt to double the amount of lights (light strands closer together). It worked for the purpose of the look I was going for. If you want the light strands far apart, say for a wedding wall, then this is perfect. If you don't like them far apart, I would recommended buying double the about you're thinking and lapping them one over the other. Still a great purchase and I do not regret this purchase. I actually would still buy them again and may even buy a few more at a later time for a different event.

review_title: Great for Photography or Video Presentations where creative lighting is desired.
review_body: Very nice as a photography background!. There are several modes from flashing to slowly glowing etc... but i use them ON full strength in order to provide those beautiful orbs of out-of-focus lights in the background. Want interesting lighting for your portraits using that very special bokeh your new lense provides? This is it!. I purchased three of them so that I could have one in the background and one to the side and another in front of the subject to shoot through. The results are singular and portrait perfect.. If you like playing around with lighting and getting creative, get a set of these and start experimenting. I only wish there was an on and off switch built into the controller, but there isn't. It's just a mode-selector. You have to unplug it when you want it off.. It's nice a tall, I have them suspended from an 8' tall cross beam and they still barely touch the floor, so nice and long, easy to store when not in use.. Very pleased and would definitely recommend them for decorations, or as a creative touch for your photography or video work.

review_title: SECOND TIME with this SAME product and BOILING water speed ...
review_body: SECOND TIME with this SAME product and BOILING water spewed from the top on to garments and skin!! Water was NOT filled past the line, AND this started happening the third time using it BOTH TIMES.. I was written and asked to remove my first review if they sent me a new steamer and reimbursement for the inconvenience.. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT IT WILL NOT WORK PAST THE THIRD TIME USING IT.
great product！I love it！amazing！

I literally just received this item and tried it out on my first garment. I made sure to only fill to the max line and not tilt the steamer (per the instructions) and it kept spitting water out onto my shirt! Then when I gave up and turned it off, it started bubbling water out from the top and getting steaming hot water everywhere!!! I am super disappointed because this had manly good reviews... Not sure if I just got a bad one or what. 😣. The company reached out and supplied a newer model that did not have the same problem. I would suggest staying clear of this model and going with their newer model instead where they appear to have worked out the kinks.

review_title: I am so happy with my purchase!
review_body: I really hate ironing. I put more creases in my clothes then when I started ironing. I have a few dresses that are wrinkled after I wash them and I just love the dresses so I tried a steamer. I am beyond happy with my purchase. This is the best steamer. It is light and the wrinkles were gone in seconds. I love it!

review_title: I'm am also happy I purchased from this company because as many people ...
review_body: I was impressed on how well the steamer works.  I'm am also happy I purchased from this company because as many people know their employees are disabled.  I work with special needs children.  I would do anything to help our disadvantage people.  I hope everyone support this company.

I gave this product not one, but two chances. First time I bought it, worked fine the first time. Second time, it did nothing but spit hot water on my clothes. Wrote a bad review. Got a refund. No problem. The company iSteam reached out to me directly by email and offerred a free replacement. Good customer service I thought. Lets give them another shot. Received the product again and had the exact same results. Fine the first use, spit hot water the second use and burned my hand. The product isnt hard to use. You cut it off and on. Thats it. I do not understand all the positive reviews for an item that doesn't work. What are the odds of getting two faulty units?This product is bogus. This company is bogus and the reviews are probably bogus too. Do not buy.

review_title: Horrible steamer.  spits out clumps of water.  replacement is better.
review_body: horrible steamer.  it spits out water in clumps instead of steam (see photo below of curtain that I was trying to steam) - this was only the 3rd time that I tried steaming something.  only on the 1st time did it seem to work properly.  If I could I'd give it zero stars.  I tried to switch water type by using bottled water.  that didn't help.. update:  the seller reached out to me and sent me a replacement product.  The replacement seems to be doing much better than the original.  I've kept using bottled water to minimize the minerals in the water.  Also, I've tried to not let it run out of water when I'm in the middle of steaming... this is actually difficult to watch for as the reservoir is small and can only steam about 2 shirts before needing to pause and reload with more water.  It's better than the 1st product.. but it's just too much of a hassle to use it consistently.  Guess I'm back to using an iron for most things.

I’ve never used one of these! Always wanted one but thought what does it take to just get the iron out? Well, after the iron is pulling out the ironing board ugh! I would use a bath towel on my kitchen table to iron a top. I’m so glad I purchased this! After reading comments and looking at before and after pics, I thought I’d give it a shot!  So glad I did. I just received it today and had to try it fast. Well, the results are perfect! I’ve posted pics of a top I tried it on! Love the results!

review_title: Works reasonably well although not quite as well as an iron
review_body: Works decently well. I live in small space without real room for an iron and ironing board and my button up work shirts are always wrinkled after washing. This gets most of the wrinkles out in just a few minutes. Works best on cotton. My nylon/cotton blend shirt takes a bit more effort, but it still works pretty well. Nice compact size- could travel with it if you wanted to, and the cord is reasonably long as well. I can do about one long sleeve button up shirt on one water fill. It heats in about one minute. If you have more room to store it, I'd recommend getting a slightly bigger version but if you're going to travel I'd recommend this size.

review_title: So far so good. Just got it and tried it on my ...
review_body: So far so good.  Just got it and tried it on my new curtains and seems ti work pretty good.

There's not much more to say about these dry pads, they do a great job of picking up the dirt/lint and especially dust that brooms leave behind. I definitely recommend this product for those with allergies as the dust mites wreck havoc on my allergies and traditional sweeping does not do a thorough enough job cleaning.

I have been using this item for years. The pads in my most recent order are thinner and less fluffy than the product always been. It is the loft of the fabric that allows dirt, dust and debris to be trapped. These have less loft and, not surprisingly, perform less effectively. The pads are closer to those of store brands and other lower-cost items.. I contacted P&G customer relations, describing the decline in product quality. Their response was to inform me that there is no indication of change in manufacturing methods, nor plans to change the product. In no way did they seem concerned that there might be a defect in production. I was also informed that there is now available an extra thick version of the product that I might be interested in.. Pardon my cynicism, but it seems odd that after introducing an extra thick version of the standard product that the standard product apparently is now being made thinner and less effective than what had been the perfectly adequate original! Shame on you, P&G.

When sweeping just isn't enough to capture the dog hair, these do the trick. I tried the Walmart brand and nearly gave up until I read they weren't as good. For once, I would agree. When the sunlight streams in, I can see the hair and dust particles flying around and these little pads are like a magnet. I also use them to dust my stainless steel appliances that seem to attract everything. Very multipurpose!
In addition to sweeping the floor, I uses these to pickup small water spills in front of the sink and for dusting.

review_title: Picks up dust and holds it.
review_body: I use these more as dust cloths than floor cleaners. They catch and hold the dust rather than just pushing it around as with a regular cloth. I’ve tried the cheaper ones from the dollar stores but they’re just as bad as using a tissue.

The old lady wanted me to buy the box of 32 dry pads, but I said no way!  I went for this box of 52 and got a better deal. She was so stoked. You should have seen her whippin around like a psycho, cleaning and humming.  I bet she would say this pads are freakin great.

review_title: Not just for floors, bee hive beetle traps
review_body: These are very good quality. I have used them on Floors and they work exactly as they are designed to. One thing should be added to the description on the box under usage. Play sheet on top of frames in beehive box to trap house beetles.
Great buy I go through so many of these I like to buy in bulk.  Keeps my house dust free.
Works good for pet hair, but I always have to use it twice in an area to pick up the debris.

review_title: Great to pick up cat hair
review_body: Use them a lot.  With six cats you need a good picker upper.

review_title: Accurate & Inexpensive - My One Year Long Term Review
review_body: We have been using this Etekcity digital scale for a year now in our our home are very pleased with the scale so far. We had purchased this scale to replace our previous Sunbeam manual , Spring loaded bathroom scale which was horribly inaccurate and deliberated for a considerable amount of time between this scale and the FitBit Aria smart scale . In the end because of the huge price difference and very positive reviews on this scale made us go with this one. Design, Construction & Build. -------------------------------------. - The scale is feels heavy for its size mainly due to the thick, monolithic glass sheet stepping surface of the scale. - All our fears or cracked or broken glass due to stepping on it frequently, bumping or dropping it were unfounded in the past year ( we did all of them !)  , so its definitely sturdy and well built. - The two tone black-sliver finish on the scale looks ultra modern and chic. - The digital readouts are large and backlit in a pleasant not-too-strong blue which is visible both in light and complete darkness. I often check my weight on the scale during midnight bathroom visits.. Long Term Accuracy. ---------------------------. - When we initially purchased this scale i used a 10 lb Rice bag to measure its accuracy and it was always within 0.2 lb of 10 lb  with repeated tests, which is very accurate for a digital scale and well suited for measuring body weight. - Another pointer to the accuracy  of this scale is that the weight that we got for our toddler son from his pediatrician using a professional balance scale matches the results we got from this scale. I tried the same accuracy test today after a whole year of use & abuse:. 10 lb Basmati Rice Bag :  Scale Measured  = 10.4 lb. 6lb  Dumbbells  :  Scale Measured  = 5.8 lb. As you can see that even after one year the scale is fairly accurate , for all I know it might be 100% accurate as well as I have no way of certifying that the 10lb rice bag or the dumbbells are infact their true stated weights.. Battery Life. ----------------. - The scale is still using the two original AAA that came with the package even after a year of frequent, daily use  so I'd say its great!. Cons. ----------. -  About the only con about this scale is that the glass surface, being glass, needs frequent cleaning as it shows water stains. we usually wipe it with a damp cloth once every week so its not too bad. If you are going worry about keeping it spotless always then you'll going to have a hard time :). Overall we are very pleased with our purchase and couple of our family friends have also purchased it after seeing it in our home and can highly recommend this scale if your are looking for a good looking , inexpensive and accurate digital scale.

Received this on Wednesday. It worked for two days, then the display faded lighter and lighter and now it's Sunday (the 4th day of use, ever), there is no display other than a blue background. Tried new batteries. Tried different surface. Tried everything. Doesn't work. So, it's a completely useless paperweight. We are returning it. What a waste.. Update:. The seller immediately refunded our money and sent us a new scale free of charge. The new scale works great. It looks like the LED crystals were probably damaged in shipping, which isn't the seller's fault. Glad to see that this seller cares about the end customer experience at any cost.

I have been using this scale since the beginning of the year. So far it has managed to weigh with an accuracy of up to +/- 0.02 lbs which is more than acceptable for a simple body weight scale. Its auto on/auto off feature has been quite convenient. Since Etekcity reached out to me and asked me to do a review, I decided to break out official Department of Weights and Measures certified weights and placed thirty pounds on the scale. To little surprise, it weighed precisely thirty pounds. For the price, it cannot be beat.. For the love of God, please do not be silly like another reviewer on here and have this scale half on carpet and half on hard surface. On second thought, don't do that with any scale. If it doesn't break the scale, it will surely wear out (and destroy) the load cell inside any scale.

review_title: Died shortly after we got it
review_body: This scale worked for 10 days and then stopped working. The screen now lights up yet there are no numbers appearing to show your weight. I tried removing the batteries that came with it and testing them.They still had plenty of power. I tried Energizer brand name batteries. The Energizer batteries didn't fix the problem. I put back in the batteries that came with the scale and it still doesn't work. I looked for a way to change the contrast to see if maybe the black color for the numbers was somehow turned down or off - but there's no way to change it. So, unfortunately the scale turns on but does not show anything except a blank blue screen. I reported this to Amazon customer support and they gave a full refund right away. Thank you Amazon! I just wish the scale worked. You can see the photo of the problem.. UPDATE 5/7/2017: Shortly after receiving Amazon's refund, Etekcity sent a replacement scale for free and it has been working perfectly so far. That's excellent customer service and it's great to get the scale for free and to have one that works. I raised the rating to 3 stars... if the scale keeps working I will go higher still. Thanks for the super service Etekcity.

Better than expected. I recently had heart surgery and was told to watch my weight because of fluid retention. Well, I had an older analog scale and when I looked down to see the weight, I couldn't read it because of my bifocals. So I ordered this scale. I love the fact that after I step off of the scale, the weight is displayed for a little while so I can see the numbers. I highly recommend this scale and would purchase again.

We got 2 of these about a week ago. Pretty good overall. They look nice, have a very easy-to-read display, and come at a great price. just a few small negatives though. We keep then in the bathrooms and the black glass collects water spots. We have to wipe them off frequently.. And the accuracy varies up to about 2 pounds. We placed both right next to each other and they were 1.2 lbs apart. They're very dependent on the flatness of the surface they're placed on. Our bathrooms have 12" floor tiles. Just moving the scale a few inches to straddle tiles (which have slight thickness variations) changes the reading by up to 2 lbs.  Although as someone in another review pointed out, there appear to be a deceiving memory feature built-in that snaps the reading back to the same reading it gave you last time if it's within 0.6 lbs.  So it looks more consistent than it really is.  (You can fool that "feature" by picking up something that weighs a few pounds every other weighing so that each new reading is more than 0.6 difference.). Bottom line - it's a good bathroom scale for home use.  But don't put much faith in the fractional pound reading.  It would really be better if the scale just displayed whole pounds rather than anything to the right of the decimal point, as it's not accurate enough for that.  But it's good +/- 1 pound.. But as long as you leave it in the exact same place, you'll get a very consistent reading.

This scale constantly gives me different readings. For example: If i put the scale down, let it zero, then get on and weigh myself i can weigh 196.2. Then i pick it up and move it to another area of our wood floor(all flat!) i get 195. I have had up to 4lbs off just by picking it up and moving it a few inches away to get a secondary measure. I cant trust the readings! How do i know which one is right. Disappointed in this product and will be returning it.

Going with 5 stars for performance for the price. With caveat..... I find this Etekcity scale is accurate...very close to my doctor's scale, any way.  At home I weighed 202.6 and at the doctors office, 202.. More important to me is the fact that it is consistent with itself.  If i weigh myself throughout the day, i get good meaningful readings.  (See below, however).. However, the scale is designed to match your last weight within a certain period of time. No scale will weigh exactly the same all the time.  The movement of your body from one side to another will cause fluctuations as well as other factors.  Well, this scale figures if it gets a measurement within a few pounds of a previous measurement within (I guess here) an hour or 2 or so, it will give you same measure.  By the next day, not a problem, it will get your new weight.  If you weigh morning and evening, not a problem.  If within an hour or two (or three?) Then it will simply repeat your last weight...unless you reset the scale by weighing something else....I use a big thing of liquid laundry detergent if I need to weigh again for some reason. It measures the new weight, and then, after it zeroes out, I can step on scale and get new measurement.. Weighing once a day is plenty for me.  And if I want to measure twice...this scale does that we'll too.  If you want to get hour by hour weights, however, you will need to "reset" the scale by weighing something else...or simply hold something heavy for a measurement, then put it down and weigh again.. But, I seldom weigh more frequently, so I have to give this scale 5 stars.  Great performance for the price.

review_title: Exploded a few months after we got it
review_body: **Update - after I left my review, the company contacted me and offered me a full refund. So I have changed my rating to 3 stars. Great customer service, just still a bit leary of the scale.. Like so many others said, our scale exploded. I was in the room next to the bathroom where the scale is kept, and all of a sudden I heard a huge bang. I went in and this is what I found. Nothing was near it or touching it. I'm baffled as to how that could happen, but I'm just glad that no one was in the bathroom when it happened. I would not recommend this product.
Update. Customer service was awesome. My weight changes every time I get on. I gain or lose up to 5 lbs. I manually calibrate it over and over and it still doesn't work. I hate digital scales!!!

review_title: Do people really read trash bag reviews?
review_body: Is anyone actually reading a review on trash bags? Anyway. These are the only trash bags I buy, and they are cheaper on here than they are in my grocery store. They smell decent because of the Gain (who cares, right?) but also I have not had one break on me even with some questionably heavy things for a trash bag...and it keeps the trash from smelling bad in the time it takes to fill up. So. Five from me.

review_title: Let's be realistic if you have something really stinky in your trash and leave the lid open like I do you're still gonna smell it
review_body: These are the only trash bags I will buy. I guess I'm a bit of a Gain and Febreze nut anyway.. Let's be realistic if you have something really stinky in your trash and leave the lid open like I do you're still gonna smell it.. Once you tie it up it makes it bearable to bring to the trash. No issues with the tie bands or breaking and we usually shove the trash from the bathroom in plus a box or two where it ends up looking like the front picture or worse, i.e. pretty overstretched.. I think you'll dig it

review_title: Love the scented bags; may be too strong for some
review_body: These are the same quality as the other Glad bags. The scent is very strong at first --like holding a full box of dryer sheets in your hand--and mellows a bit after the bag's been opened, but it does have very good staying power even once the bag is full.  I love these because of the scent-- the last bag in the box is as fully scented as the first-- but if you're sensitive to strong chemical or perfume odors, these could potentially be overwhelming.

review_title: The only trash bags I buy
review_body: Like all Amazon Prime products, it arrives packaged professionally and on time. I rarely have a complaint with Amazon deliveries.. These are good trash bags. They're strong, and they work. I have NEVER had one break on me. Sure, they're a little hard to get on the trash can, but they never slip off, either. So you take the bad to get the good.. I don't care about the smell. In fact, I can't smell it. And the trash will still stink, but maybe it's not as bad as it would be without them. I don't know.. All I know if that these are good, strong bags.. They are a bit expensive, however, so you're paying for the quality. That's worth it to me.

These are so much better than other odor-guard trash bags that smell lemony and the trash still stinks when you use them. The gain scent does last at least 5 days as advertised. So even when you add moderately smelly garbage, the odor is not noticeable for days. I would buy these again over other brands and scents.

review_title: These have been great for our family
review_body: These have been great for our family. They are super durable, we haven't had a single one tear as we remove them from the bin. My only complaint is the smell. I hoped I would like the fresh scent but it turns out the smell grosses me out and now I associate that smell with garbage and I can always smell it when I walk into the kitchen. I prefer the light trashy scent compared to the loud Gain-ey disguised trashy scent.

Oh my goodness these trash bags smell incredible! I hate hate hate smelly garbage. These bags with gain scent and febreeze freshness really step up the freshness of the kitchen. I love putting in a new bag, you can really smell the difference. I wish they made these for small trashcans, I have two kids that wear a pullup or diapers and getting the fresh smell in the smaller trashcans would be amazing.. These bags are NOT the force flex bags, but these it a panel of that at the top to help with the bag not ripping when you tie it up.. I paid full price for this item and this is my honest and unbiased review.

These are the most durable trash bags I  have purchased - and my rubbish includes cat litter. The odour control is quite good. I have found that, with rubbish pickup twice a week, and mine including changing the litter completely for an indoor cat, that one is sufficient. Unlike other bags I have tried, I have had no trouble with breaks, and it does not leak if one puts in grease, fat from a pan, and the like.

The Glad OdorShield kitchen bags with Gain/Febreze work well. I haven't had one break on me yet even when I've had seriously stuffed trash bags full of heavy items. The ties are sturdy - none have broken on me yet! I don't really notice the Gain or Febreze scents so it's not bothersome to have that addition to the bag.

review_title: Product provides a fresh scent to trash can
review_body: Great combative pricing with grocery and box stores. No fighting traffic to buy basic household goods. Product provides a fresh scent  to help with trash can in-between cleanings and while waste is waiting to go out to the curb.So happy to find everything I need and not have to go out and spend extra dollars on gas to travel to the store and back.

review_title: The cheapest on Amazon. Great Quality
review_body: This is my second time buying these paper towel rolls. I absolutely love it. They are durable and the price is unbeatable. 24 rolls for $23.47! That's $0.98 a roll. I took a picture of me wetting the paper towel and holding something heavy on the middle so you can see these are not thin or of poor quality. These paper towels are great quality and I would definitely recommend this product.

review_title: Paper Towel Snob Converted. LOVE this stuff
review_body: These are freaking awesome! I am an absolute Paper Towel and toilet paper snob -- I REALLY prefer a soft yet sturdy product as they tend to work better and your need less to get the job done.. I was hesitant to purchase as I had never heard of this brand but the product is pretty close to Bounty in terms of strength and softness. I WILL purchase this product again

I didn't expect to ooh and aaahhh over paper towels, and yet......I had been switching around with Bounty and Brawny and Sparkle--hooker names for sure.  So, naturally, Plenty fit the bill.  I find them to be just as thick as the more expensive brands.  They don't tear into little pieces when you pull on them and so I am overjoyed--as much as one can be--with these.  I will get them again.

These are pretty good for the price. I have 4 kids and we go through A LOT of paper towels. I am comparing these to my favorite brand, which is Bounty. I bought these on a whim because of the price and reviews. I usually don't use anything but Bounty, every other brand has disappointed me. Once in a while I will use store brand if I am waiting on my next shipment. These paper towels are soft and quilted similar to Bounty. They have a lot better absorption than store brand, but not as thick as Bounty, and not as good absorption as Bounty. I have to use more towels for wet messes than I would with Bounty, probably 1.5 times the # of towels. The rolls are considered single roll size so I go through these much faster, obviously. Which is not a huge deal breaker for me but might be for some people. These are good for food/microwave/napkins but not my favorite for spills and kid messes. Overall I would buy again if they were on a good sale, but if not, I would rather pay a few dollars more for Bounty since I am probably saving money by using less towels with Bounty.

review_title: Durable and high quality for its price
review_body: Edit 8/17: I received the box with cute smiley face ❤️❤️❤️ I love this paper towels even more!. I've been using other product with similar quantity and similar price, but this was way better quality. It absorbs the liquid very well and very durable.

I spend an amazing amount of time cleaning up messes, cat puke, grandkid puke, dog accidents, you name it, my busy house has it.  There are heavily advertised products out there with big price takes that are promoted as "thicker," "thirstier," "stronger" but I just need clean up the mess, get the job done, and throw away cheap.  These more than satisfy all my needs AND they have the "select-a-size" feature of some of the very much higher priced products.  I can easily grab half a sheet to wipe a dirty two year old grandchild's face or grab several sheets to wipe up a dumped drink.

review_title: Better Than Expected... but need a MEGA SIZE
review_body: I primarily use the Bounty Select-a-Size Paper Towels, White, Huge Roll, 12 Count ... link below.  When I first began using the 'select-a-size' I didn't care for them.  However, I have changed my mind and now find it pretty handy to be able to select a smaller size towel.. I am always willing to try new products.  Price is a consideration, but I'm willing to pay for quality.  If I have a good towel then I use less.  Unfortunately, most vendors cater to the crowd that want the cheaper products... That said, I ordered a box of these towels to see how they would work out.  I was actually pleasantly surprised.  They are a full size towel and the absorbency is pretty good.  Not quite as good as Bounty, but much better than other towels I have used.. With the exception of one thing, I would definitely order more of these towels.  My problem with the towels are the rolls are too small.  I want a MEGA size.  I am the sole caregiver for my mother and have better things to do than to keep resupplying my paper towel dispenser.. If they come out with a Mega size I would definitely order them again.  Until then, I'm staying with the following:. ----> . Come on Plenty ... give Bounty some serious competition!

Really nice paper towels!! Wasn't sure about this brand as I had never heard of it...but I was looking for a good deal and saw lots of nice reviews, took a chance! Was not sorry!! Will buy more soon, Love being able to buy in bulk to avoid frequent trips to the mortar store!!

I am pleasantly surprised at the thickness and absorbency of these paper towels.  I usually purchase Viva...and they are very pricey.  These are just as absorbent and much less $$.  Next order, I'l check and see if they have larger rolls.  These are regular size and don't last for very ,ong in our household!
Towels are strong enough to use to dry your hands and later use again or for another task. My favorite, almost like buy one, use it, rinse if needed and use again for free.

Basic would be the best way to describe these towels.  They're indeed microfiber and a sufficient size to be a staple in any household for quick chores that require a soft towel (dish drying, electronics cleaning, window sill wipe downs, counter top cleaning, etc).  I do find them of lesser quality compared to my first set of microfiber towels my first set of microfiber towels I purchased in October 2016.. COMPARING EXPERIENCES. The Super Thicks maintain good form in the hands since they are more robust.  They are able to soak up more liquid since they are bigger and thicker.  They hold their edges well when you fold them over, kind of like soft sponges.  You can pretty much fold them into perfect rectangles and squares.  These honestly look and feel the same as when I originally bought them even after 6 months of usage and about 25 trips to the washer and dryer.  Folding them neatly in storage looks neat, clean, and organized.. The Basics feel much more like tissues.  Definitely they do the job, but I don't feel as confident going into cleaning jobs using these.  Squeezing the water out of these feels much like a paper towel or a tissue than a microfiber towel.  These just don't hold their form as well as the Super Thicks.  After even the first trip to the washer and dryer, these curl at the edges and don't fold over neatly.  They're just not as pleasant to work with.  Folding them neatly into storage takes some time since the edges do not fold over neatly.. VALUE. Super Thicks - currently at $25 for a 12-pack (at my purchase date: $20). Amazon Basics - $17 for a 36-pack. The Super Thicks average out to around $2 per towel while the Basics average out to less than $0.50 per towel.  So, you have the classic dilemma of quantity versus quality.  Do 4 Amazon Basic towels equal 1 Super Thick?  If you do a size comparison, the answer is most definitely "No".  You get more bang for your buck with the Amazon Basics based on the amount of material you receive.  If you appreciate quality and care for the small details, then I would recommend the Super Thicks.  If you're just on a budget and looking just for quantity, the I would go with the Amazon Basics.

review_title: Quality not good as the price
review_body: 4 parts were torn (blue cloth) and edges came off after washing. see images

These are a fantastic purchase! They are big plush and nice colors. I use these on my Swiffer dry and wet. They fit perfectly and worked like a dream. Other reviewers had said these were too thin but they are not. These are the same quality as others I have purchased at a much much higher price. I am so pleased with these towels.

These are amazing for cleaning and a great price! I’m mad at myself for not purchasing sooner. In an effort to reduce the crazy amount of paper towels we go through, I decided to purchase these. I use 1-2 a day for kitchen cleanup and put them in the laundry. They pick up little crumbs easily and don’t leave my quartz “streaky.” I have a super messy 10 month old and I clean his highchair with these and they work wondetfully. I also use these for dusting, they pick up everything. The only thing that was a negative was that the first time I washed them in warm water (per instructions), the yellow color bled onto the white and turned them an off white color. Not a big deal to me because I use these only for cleaning and wash them with only other cleaning rags but be careful not to wash the yellow rags with anything you care about! Ieven though instructions say to hang dry, I dry them on low with no issues. Last thing, most people know this but don’t ever use fabric softener with these, they won’t be as absorbant!

Don't buy these! They are thin and you can see through them. I have bought many of these from other sources and they have always been square; these are missing 1/4 of the cloth you can buy commonly for about the same price. I am probably sending back. disappointed!

review_title: Great price, Okay for general use, but absolutely should not be listed under Automotive Detailing Supplies
review_body: Quite frankly, these are terrible.  I'm a big fan of AmazonBasics in general, but they really dropped the ball on these.. I bought these because I was looking for a large volume of microfiber cloths for auto detailing purposes.  These actually came up when I searched for automotive detailing supplies, and given the great price I immediately jumped on them.. Well, this is one of those scenarios where "you get what you pay for."  Yes, they are very cheap.  But these are by far the worst feeling "microfiber" cloths I've ever felt.  The thing with microfiber is that you usually expect them to feel smooth to the touch.  With my other microfiber cloths, I can rub them all over my face and feel as though I'm bathing in baby puppies.  In contrast, if I did that with these the only thing I'd be able to imagine is being molested by a 60 year old lumberjack.. These are absolutely not fit for car detailing purposes, the only things I'd consider using them on is my wheels.  They are simply too rough, and I'd be seriously concerned about damaging my paint using these.  I'd honestly rather just use off the shelf paper towels.. If you're using them for general home use, they're very cheap and it may be more than fine for that.  But for auto detailing...STAY AWAY!

Well made and durable. Quick side note. I was not aware until a pro detailer told me that you need to wash all micro cloth and towels with a special microfiber detergent. I was not aware of this and I did some checking and sure enough it is true. If you use regular detergent and even worse (as it turns out) fabric softeners in the dryer it will clog up the microfibers making this just as bad as using an old t-shirt. I have washed these several times with the micro detergent and the towels and cloth still have that ultra grabby feel for dust and particles.. I now own a black truck so I am being careful about swirl marks. I hope this helps as I would have made the same error as everyone else. Chemical Guys sells it too and I bought a gallon so it will last me years. Don't ruin your micro cloth!

review_title: Excellent value for 33 cents per towel! They are not as thick as a cotton face towel so don't expect a thick/plush feel.
review_body: Excellent value for the money @ 33 cents per towel! They are fairly thin towels so don't expect a 5-star hotel plush thick face towel feel. As long as you know that, you won't be disappointed. I use them for car detailing, spill cleanup, window/mirror cleaning without any Windex, wiping glasses (reading or drinking), oil change rags, waxing my car, and general kitchen useage. Just don't use these as potholders because they are made of plastic, not cotton, so they will melt lol!

review_title: Just OK -- each towel has an annoying tag and they aren't as soft as other products.
review_body: I really, really wanted to like these.  My family has had such outstanding luck with AmazonBasics products and I think I can safely say that these towels are the first that I am not absolutely thrilled with.. First off.. that $%^@ing tag.  It has to go.  Amazon, please remove it for a future revision to this product.. Second.. I would be willing to pay a few extra dollars if these were shipped in a sealable bag rather than the 1-time use bag.. Third and lastly.. they just aren't as soft as the VibraWipe towels I've been using.  That's the deal breaker for me.. These are very difficult for me to recommend.  Giving 3 starts because they're not junk and you do get a ton of them for the price.  If they were a little softer and did not have a tag, I'd say they would be 4-star material.. Get the VibraWipes instead.

review_title: You need to wash first if you don't want lint-like dust everywhere
review_body: Note that you have to wash these first.  I mistakenly skipped this step when cleaning my car windows & mirrors, but even though these cloths work and do get items clean, they leave behind a lint-like dust and tiny strings unless you wash them first.  There is a paper label in the package advising to wash first, but I wished that had been more prominent in this item's description when purchasing.  While they are cheap and work, I would not buy again.

Not just a bad batch.  Check out all the one-star reviews where people have had the same bad experience.  For me, it just wasn't just the "Guaranteed Strong" version.  The ForceFlex also tears easily.  Some of the bags even come out of the box already torn.  I guess the people at Glad decided to improve the bottom line by making cheaper bags and then offsetting that by saying that they're guaranteed to be strong on the box.  I feel like I've been scammed.  Never buying Glad products again.

review_title: Good trash bag for normal household trash. Period.
review_body: Definitely stronger and more tear resistant than some trash bags I have used. Strong enough for most household trash. Not as sturdy as some bags for yard waste, and definitely not as strong as the 45 gallon and 55 gallon "contractor" trash bags, so expect damage if you stuff the bag with sticks or put in a bunch of big nails and then stuff the bag. But not going to split open if you throw a few staples or chicken bones in. Not going to break open if Junior drags the bag as he takes it out to the trash can.. You can fill the bag full enough that you need to tug on the ties to get it to close and it will probably stretch enough to get it tied so that nothing falls out. I have done this several times with no problems, but of course it depends on what is in the bag. Do not fill it to the brim with bricks or rocks or anything else that is not compressible and expect to pull it closed with no problems. This bag is not magic. It is just a very well designed and made trash bag.

review_title: These do not meet the standard of most GLAD Products.
review_body: I am hugely disappointed in these bags.  Other Glad products have been wonderful and I bought these for the quantity and price.  In preparing them to be placed in a tall kitchen trash can, it is IMPOSSIBLE to easily open the bag to prepare it for receiving trash.  In trying to unfurl, attempting to force air into the bag, pressing on it in order to release the "stick to itself" bag so it can be used, nothing happens!  Each and every single bag needs to be worked with in order to make it usable.  I may end up giving these away and ordering bags that don't cling together in a way that is impossible to dislodge the bond.

review_title: WHOA! What happened to the density?
review_body: I don't spend a lot of time thinking or buying trash bags. But when I opened this box and felt how thin they were I was extremely surprised. I buy a lot of name brand products. But when it doesn't matter, and an equal to or better than generic is available, I go generic. I used to buy Glad bags all the time. It does take a little time to compare mil ply, but I only had to do it once. The off brand I've bought for at least 5 yrs were thicker, cheaper & better. Oh well, only 89 to go.

Sturdy kitchen garbage bags. Not much to say about it. It's purpose, as well as how to use it is pretty obvious & self-explanatory.. In any case, it seems to be a pretty sturdy garbage bag. I've stuffed a few corrugated cardboard shipping boxes (ya know, like the kind that Amazon ships your orders in) into this bag without it tearing.. Personally, I use these bags for kitchen trash (egg shells, orange/lemon/lime peels, coffee grounds, etc.) and I use Costco's clear 30 gallon bags for recyclable items since they tend to be larger/need more space.. All in all, seems to be a great product!. ★☆★☆★ 5 STARS!!!!

review_title: Black handle inferior to the red handle bags?
review_body: This must have been a bad batch but every other bag I used burst at the seams!  Ugh!!!  The reason I buy Glad Kitchen bags is to ensure this doesn't happen.  Now, I have to either double the bags or use the 1/2 full because I never know when it's going to burst. Not cost effective! I can't return them because the time has expired.  I didn't use them right away. Already cancelled the next standing order!

review_title: Works great at coralling your trash!!!!!
review_body: These are strong and do not leak.  They hold a lot.  For some reason my household produces a great amount of trash and these work great to handle that.  I love that they have ties you pull and can tie up the garbage in the bag and put it in the big trashcan that goes out to the street.  Sometimes I find they can be hard to pull out of the trashcan usually when really heavy.  I try to watch the weight to avoid this issue which is just minor. I do not like the kind with twist ties since they do not hold and then your trash is exposed or falls out.  Does a great job corralling your trash.  Do not have a chemical smell or feel oily.  I actually used trashbags once that felt oily that made me wonder.

As with other reviewers here, I experienced the same issue of bags splitting completely down one seam when being initially handled.  For me, this occurred when removing them from the box one at a time, pulling them apart gently with two hands, and fluffing them just enough to overcome them static cling.  I notice the seam that always fails is the one nearest the next bag, so there may be a stutter in that part of Clorox' process.. The first three bags out of my box had this problem.  So will the rest, I fathom.  They never even made it to the trash can.  I guess I have 90 litter box liners now!  Please do NOT buy these or any Glad trash bags.

review_title: and we used to have great luck with them
review_body: These bags consistently rip. I've been getting these bags for years, and we used to have great luck with them. We started getting them with our subscribe and save with amazon, and probably the past 9 months, they have been horrible. I am looking for another option. We use them for household trash, and we do not stuff them so full they should be stressed. This is with regular fill the bag in the trash bin and when you try and take it out it completely rips around the top. The handles seem useless too due to this.

I've used Glad tall kitchen bags for years - the ones with the red drawstring. That's what I thought I ordered (see the picture). I got ones with a black drawstring - now I could live with the color but the bags are not as thick. The first bag actually leaked into my trash can and made a mess. The second one broke and made...another mess. I have 178 of these bags left and I think I am going to have to double them up to ensure no more accidents. I never had this problem with Glad bags before.

First off, I do like Brawny Paper Towels and would give 4 stars, but I'm very unhappy with these "XL" rolls. If you were getting the 24 Giant rolls on Subscribe & Save, you may want to go elsewhere for them; Amazon converted my order to these Giant rolls and I would be paying almost the same amount for approximately 4+ ROLLS LESS!  This isn't Amazon's fault, it lies solely on the manufacturer of Brawny.  I don't like the bait and switch with promises of giving me more.  Plus, I couldn't find any information about sheet counts on Brawny's website; instead I had to rely on customer images.. Old Giant Rolls: 117 sheets per roll x 24 rolls = 2,808 sheets total. New XL Rolls: 140 sheet per roll x 16 rolls = 2,240 sheets total. 568 sheets LESS!. I'll be shopping for another brand.

review_title: Supermarket packaging tricks still in practice at Brawny
review_body: I had the 24 pack box on subscribe and save and was changed to this. Previously box had 24 rolls of select a size sheets at 117 sheets per roll, 2808 sheets for around $29.  Now this box has 16 rolls w 140 sheets per roll, so 2240 select a size sheets for around $29. The old consumer supermarket tricks of reducing size but not price doesn't work when you have accounts with purchase history.

I'm going to jump in here too. I don't like the new XL rolls. They are too big. And I'm getting LESS for my money. Compared to the 24 Giant rolls I was getting. This pack won't even get me through a month. I'm cancelling my subscription.

review_title: How does this compare to Costco’s Kirkland towels?
review_body: I’ve been buying Costco’s Kirkland Signature paper towels in bulk for years, so was glad to try out these Brawny. How do they compare?. When holding the Kirkland towel roll side-by-side to the Brawny, they are nearly identical in size—same height with the Kirkland slightly wider. The Kirkland contains 160 sheets per roll whereas the Brawny contains 140 sheets. (That’s 20 more per Kirkland roll.) The size of the sheets is different, too. Kirkland’s are larger at just under 7” wide, while Brawny’s are 6”. Personally, I prefer the smaller sheets of Brawny because I often don’t need that many for a quick spill. And the great thing about select-a-size (pick-a-size, create-a-size, whatever you want to call it) is that you can link more than one sheet together to make a larger sheet should you need too.. While they are both 2-ply (two layers thick), I found that the Brawny had thicker layers. When holding both sheets up to the light, there was greater transparency on the Kirkland (meaning, more light passed through it). That makes the Brawny denser, thus tougher and more durable.. To test the absorption of the towels, I used a water bottle and put two equal squirts in the center of each. Interestingly, the size of the water circle was nearly identical on both. That said, the water circle on the Brawny was rounder and more contained. This shows that the density and pattern on the Brawny is better at distributing the wetness. However, the Kirkland held its ground at containing the wetness, just less elegantly and efficiently. For larger amounts of dampness, I would put my money on Brawny. Though Kirkland makes up for this by providing the wider sheet, and at 20 more sheets per roll, it gets the job done.. Overall, the Brawny has the better quality and density, and I much prefer the smaller individual sheets. However, the Brawny comes at a higher cost than the Kirkland. If you go on Costco’s site, you’ll see much higher ratings for the Brawny (they sell them there to) than the Kirkland, and there’s a reason for that. If money isn’t an issue, then Brawny is the better purchase. If you want savings, Kirkland does a decent job.

review_title: Good product, just less of it.
review_body: I really like Brawny paper towels, especially the pick a size.  I purchased this same 16XL Rolls on March 8th and thought I was getting the same product when I purchased them again in July.  However as others have mentioned you now receive less product.  I could tell as soon as I opened the box that the rolls were smaller.  The first box had 16 rolls with 156 sheets for a total of 1144 sq ft.  The recent box had 16 rolls with 140 sheets for a total of 1026.6 square feet.  It is still a good paper towel but I am annoyed when companies decrease the size or volume of their products but the packaging looks the same and the price is the same or higher.

Amazon switched my subscription to this one that has 20% less square footage than the previous product for the same or higher price. These rolls are extra thick, which is a bit of a tight fit in the holder and storage area. The actual product is ok, I'm just frustrated with the company that they would "upgrade" the product by supplying less value for the money. There's all kinds of marketing messages about how these rolls are so much bigger than other rolls, and they are trying to make it seem like such a great value, but the old product was a much better deal. If they had raised the price 25% it would have been more obvious I guess, so instead they shave off 20% of the quantity.

review_title: New packaging (changing from 24 rolls per box to 16 ...
review_body: New packaging (changing from 24 rolls per box to 16 rolls per box) equates to a 22% price hike, when based on square footage in each box.

review_title: Good product, but less sheets per roll then before
review_body: Brawny used to provide more sheets for a lower cost.  Yes, your product is good, but stop squeezing us Brawny, stop squeezing us; we might spite you and buy elsewhere, just because.
You get less and pay more

review_title: read the label...not the same as the XL 2=4
review_body: This is deceptive...130 sheets instead of the 140 sheets...I gave a raving review on the previous purchase...the packaging looks almost the same...look in the upper corner "12 more feet"  verses  "more feet" which is definitely a smaller package overall....I certainly was mislead...have to read ALL the information... low rating because of their promotional technique .... there are 5 or more packages  with everything the same except that little yellow square in the upper left corner...12 more feet, 20 more feet, 30 more feet, 40, 50,65 all look exactly the same except that and the fine print which tells you exactly how many sq. ft. and how many sheets there truly are.  They keep getting smaller:  This one is 117ft.  The 12 more is actually 128ft.  Sellers will often show you the larger number package of "More Feet" while sending you the smaller volume packages....maybe they are just careless...the manufacturers site shows all the varieties with the same packaging....tricky

review_title: "family size" is NOT equal to the "huge size" we all love. Didn't believe the reviews myself
review_body: Beware: "family size" is NOT equal to the "huge size" we all love.. Didn't believe the reviews myself, but when I unpacked the box the rolls were noticeably lighter. We go through these twice as fast as the huge size, which is a shame because it means we spend more time restocking and breaking down packing boxes.. I encourage everyone to write a review so that Amazon and Proctor & Gamble bring back the Bounty Huge size"! It has got to be the most ordered product on Amazon that they mucked with.

review_title: One of the two best brands
review_body: There are two brands of paper towel worth a darn, and this is one of them. These have an ability to double temporarily as a dish towel, where most brands fall apart. A great durable paper towel.

I am forever running out of paper towels so decided to order these family rolls. The 16 pack takes up quite a bit of room so be prepared to find a place to store them but last so much longer than the smaller ones, that it is worth it.
FANTASTIC paper towels
good pricing

review_title: I love having the paper towels delivered at my door
review_body: I love having the paper towels delivered at my door.  I can bypass the paper towels and toilet paper isle at the grocery store.  Love the product!
I really like the large roll and the automatic shipment. I don't run out of towels very often.  Fewer changes

review_title: I particularly love these towels as they are perforated to used half sheets.  tremendously handy and economical.
review_body: great way to shop.  this is the brand I always use.  Now it's easier to buy in bulk and have it delivered.  loved these paper towels
I love having papertowels delivered right to my home. Love bounty
Love the “select-a-size” feature of these

These are my favorite Paper Plates.  They are strong, stand up to liquids and you can even eat a steak on them if you don't use a serrated edge steak knife. They are completely safe for the microwave. Cleanup is a breeze considering you can just put them in the recycling bin (without food of course. Ha)  The value is great compared to heating a lot of water to do dishes for a group event.. Some time ago, I contacted Dixie to inquire about the coatings on their paper dishes... I was assured they do not use BPA plastics in their coatings.  From their website "Dixie® products are not manufactured with BPA or phthalates.". All in all, these Ultra Paper Plates are the king.  I've tried pretty much every kind of paper dishes out there and I always find myself returning to the Dixie Brand... even if they do cost a little more... you definitely get what you pay for when it comes to this item.

Gee, don't know what I can add to the umpteen other 5 star reviews - these are sturdy, well designed plates that help the lazy among us avoid doing the dishes! :-). Seriously, they hold up well, are easy to carry, and don't leak/soak through.. Know your prices, but Amazon beats my big box store every time.

review_title: This is a waste of the product
review_body: Two of the packs of plates came damaged. This is a waste of the product!

Good sturdy plate except the edge needs to be held with more than a few fingers. Should support with hand under plate. Otherwise, good product. Does not fall apart and leak liquid through. Size is plenty for a normal size meal.

review_title: Unfortunately we don't find them as sturdy. They are fine for sandwiches and/or dessert
review_body: We typically purchase our disposable plates from Samsclub and use Members Mark brand. We decided to order these and give them a try. Unfortunately we don't find them as sturdy. They are fine for sandwiches and/or dessert. However for a heavier meal, especially when microwaving, they do not hold up.. They are advertised as microwave safe, sturdy and cut resistant. However this is where they fall short.

We all know how strong Dixie plates are the hold up without spilling your food and the price is well worth it. You can't beat it. I am so happy that I found this products on Amazon because before I paid a lot just for 22 .

Super strong and durable. Our family uses these everyday whether to place food on or to cut veggies on. They are great. I just wish they would change the design. We have them on Subscribe and Save because we use them so frequently.

review_title: These are good ones. That means they aren't too thin and ...
review_body: They're plates and they're paper.  These are good ones.  That means they aren't too thin and don't transfer to the food easily during cooking and eating.  The strength is good, I don't find the need to double up very often.

These large Dixie plates are very sturdy paper plates!  We like using them, and that wasn't anything that I thought I would say about paper plates.  We're trying to transition from styrofoam to paper.
These are the best paper plates I have ever purchased. They are very large and strong and hold up even when there is a lot of food on the plate. From now on, I will not be buying any other brand.

review_title: the only thing you can say is always good and always
review_body: Dixie paper products, the only thing you can say is always good and always dependable
Thinner than I thought they’d be as a Dixie product.

review_title: They are big and sturdy. Does the job
review_body: I have these plates at home for back up or days when we don't want to wash dishes. They are big and sturdy. Does the job!
Are exactly what we expected.
Bulk buy and better than the grocery store
good deal
great
Love
Great deal and sturdy plates
Good

review_title: They have changed to product, now it's rough and thinner...  NOT HAPPY HERE!
review_body: I have been using Viva Paper Towels for as long as I can remember, they were always a little more but I LOVED the softness and strength of them.  Over the past 3 shipments the paper towels have been wrapped so tight that they are difficult to get off the roll, I dealt with it and used two hands (total inconvenience).  I called the company and asked if they were doing anything differently and the person who answered said that they weren't and apologized and said they would send me some coupons.  I was on autoship with Amazon and canceled that to use up my surplus, I just received my latest case of Viva Strong and Soft Paper Towels and they don't stick together but they aren't soft, quite rough and MUCH thinner.  I would call the company and ask again and complain about the paper towels, but they would probably just send me another DOLLAR coupon!  I can't even by a crappy roll of paper towels for a stinking dollar!  I'm quite sad as I haven't found anything to compare to the ORIGINAL.  I'm not sure what's going on but I would never use them to clean glass again as they are rough...

review_title: Will NEVER use anything else -- these are great!
review_body: I feel like everyone who uses Viva (original, NOT Vantage) comes away with the knowledge that all paper towels are NOT made equal.. We used to be the "bargain generic" family and would buy whatever was on sale at our local B&M big box retailer. The store brand was fine for me as long as it was select-a-size.. Well... let me say. Once we had our first child and mistakenly tried "Viva" I have forever been converted and will NEVER buy anything else. These are literally like soft little towels and make so much of a difference in both clean up of tables, counters and high chairs AS WELL as little hands and faces. I won't use anything else.

This is a great product and I will keep buying it over and over. However, I am removing it from my suscriptions since it brings no special benefit to my finances to buy it in bulk from Amazon.. It costs $5.98 to buy it at the store (one 6-pack). Buying it per case from Amazon costs $28.00 approx which ends up being over $7.00 per 6-pack.

review_title: You Have To Peel Each Sheet From The Roll! Terrible.
review_body: I had been ordering the Sparkle brand but for some reason Amazon removed it from Prime for a time and I had to chance this brand. The sheets are thin, not as soft as many other brands, but the biggest disappointment is that the paper cannot be easily removed from the roll. Rather than snapping a sheet from the roll as every other brand I have ever used you have to peel the edge loose from the roll, as if every sheet is sort of stuck lightly to the roll. Usually it takes two hands, hands which are often wet. Often a small piece simply tears off rather then the full sheet. Whatever they are doing in the manufacturing process it makes for a terrible product. Will never order again.

The packaging for these towels is AMAZING!!!  My 3 year old has not napped in months, but the GIANT amazon box that arrived must have been full of sleepy dust!  We threw in a favorite blankie and a couple pillows and BAM he was out for hours.. The paper towels also work wonderfully to get the sticky mess that his jam hands leave behind on every surface in our home.  Thanks Amazon for your AWESOME subscribe and save service!

review_title: The Best Paper Towels Money Can Buy
review_body: I absolutely love these paper towels. They are very strong yet soft. They are very absorbent. They don't easily break when they're wet. They're great for cleaning because they don't leave any lint. You can even blow your nose with these and they won't rip the skin off your nose.  In my opinion, these are the best paper towels money can buy. They can be expensive but you get what you pay for. I highly recommend VIVA Paper Towels.

review_title: Terrible towels - very hard to pull off roll - yes really...
review_body: Had to write this review as we're still working on this roll of paper towels and have mixed several other purchased cases of different brands in between..... because these are so hard to use. The towels are very hard to pull off the roll. So much so that you have to take them down and use two hands to pull them from themselves. For a lack of a better word they are "sticky" and don't roll without tearing.  Total cheap garbage towels. Will never buy them again.

review_title: Viva is the only towel purchase!
review_body: I love the softness and how strong Viva paper towels are. These are the soft, smooth towels. I don't care if there are patterns on my paper towels; I buy Viva for the quality and have very never purchased a brand that has the quality Viva has. I used these when I do my walks for everything from tissues when I have a cold to help me feel cool when I perspire. We have them, not just in the kitchen, but in both bathrooms and the laundry room.. They are great when used for cleaning mirrors or windows, wiping off the bathroom sink after cleaning it, as well as the toilet. They have wonderful capacity for cleaning up spills.They are great when used with furniture polish.You can't beat the overall us of these paper towls.

review_title: Very soft, but hard to get a sheet ripped off.
review_body: The paper towel itself is quite nice, very soft and cloth like. However, the biggest downfall and my reason for not repurchasing is that it "sticks" together and therefore you cannot pull one sheet off one-handed. I have two young girls (1 and 3 years old), so being able to grab a sheet of paper towel and ripping it off one handed is a must (and a deal breaker if not achievable). My girls have a pretty hard time getting a sheet and just end up tearing little pieces off, making a mess. You literally have to hold the roll with one hand, then separate the sheet from the roll with the other while pulling down. I wish these were more convenient as (like I said above) they feel quite nice. If you dont need to rip paper towel off one handed, then these would be great! Maybe when my girls are older and I don't constantly have a little one on my hip, I can try these again.

review_title: 3 years of using Viva paper towels makes it hard to switch to anything else
review_body: I've never really been a fan of using paper towels. I've tried to stick to washable towels and try to refrain from using paper, but there are plenty of times that they come in handy. It's been 3 years of sticking to Viva, after trying different big brand paper towels before that. Besides the durability, convenience of the choose-a-sheet indentations, and absorbency, the other reason I've stuck to viva is it's softness. Paper towels aren't meant to be soft, they are meant to be tough and able to clean well. Viva does that, but as a bonus is on the soft side. Since Viva is brought to you by the makers of Kleenex, I can understand why. The best paper towel I've used so far, highly recommended.

My wife went into labor a year and a half ago and that labor went very quickly....so quickly that she ended up giving birth on our bed in the presence of EMTs. We then went to the hospital where I stayed overnight with my wife and new baby girl. The next day,  once things had clamed down,  I went home to clean up before they came home. For those who have witnessed or gone through child birth, you know what a mess I arrived to.  For those who haven't, suffice to say there are many different types of fluids and a lot of them. Let's just say I was fully expecting to be purchasing a new mattress.  To my amazement, once I'd bagged our sheets and this mattress pad, our mattress was perfectly fine.  I bought another one immediately and will continue to use this brand as long as it exists.  I challenge anyone to put it through a more rigorous test and I'm positive it can stand up to some sweat or your child's pee in the middle of the night.  I could have posted a pic but it's better for everyone if I don't.

Bought our first one almost 8 months ago and have been happy with it.  In fact, I'm planning to buy our 4th today, along with a new mattress for our 2yo who is moving into her big-girl bed.  It blocks most accidents from reaching the mattress.  I wish it was 100%, but if the kids don't wake up right away after an accident, the liquid seems to seep through as it sits on the mattress for an hour or more.  I have yet to find a mattress protector that prevents this, and so far this is the best one I've tried.  Reviews are mixed on even more expensive options, so I don't think it's worth the investment in something fancier.  These are breathable, quiet, soft, and easy to get on and off the mattresses.  I put them in the washer and dryer, following the instructions carefully - especially LOW heat in the dryer and washing/drying them along with the sheets.. When accidents do seep through, I have had good luck spraying the mattress with a mixture of 1c hydrogen peroxide, 3tbs baking soda, and a few drops of liquid dish soap.  Let dry, vacuum, and the bed is ready to go!

As a U.S. wounded warrior with a spinal cord injury, I suffer from incontinence. Despite wearing Depend briefs, there's sometimes "excess" leakage, which has previously done considerable damage to my mattress. I've used numerous other mattress pads, and they bunch up and get pushed out from under me in my sleep. However, my number one complaint was the breathability aspect (or lack thereof), which routinely made me wake up drenched in sweat and subsequently despise my incontinence even more!. After searching around, I came upon this product and I've been using it for a couple weeks now. It has endured numerous "incidents" and never once has anything leaked through to the mattress.
