But its breathability is outstanding. It feels SO much better. Just this one product alone has changed my feelings about my incontinence. It was worth every single penny, and then some!. Just a quick side note: I was concerned about ordering this in a queen size because I have a queen size pillow top mattress PLUS a four inch memory foam topper, so I have to use king size sheets in order for the fitted sheet to fit right. But I took the plunge and ordered it in a queen anyways, and it fits perfectly!

I'd read mixed reviews so upon receipt of this pad I conducted my own test: I opened the queen size pad and in one corner I draped the pad over a large stainless steel stock pot. Into the middle of the pad/pot, I poured 1/2 cup of warm water and waited. The terry cloth seemed to make the wet spot larger by soaking up the water. I pulled the pad tight to simulate a flat bed, then let the water pool in the middle of the pad for about 5 min. I carefully felt underneath the pad and it was dry. I soaked up the rest of the water with a paper towel. I looked in the stock pot and.....no water......I am going to post 3 pictures I took.. I am satisfied this is waterproof. I'll now wash according to the specific directions and conduct another test with the stock pot to see if this pad is still waterproof. Will post an update on the out come. So far it's what I want !. Forgot to post update: I did wash according to directions and dried on low with 2 twin sheets. It took a long time to dry !!! But once it dried, I tried the same "test" as outlined above and water did not seep through the terry cloth top. So it's on the bed now doing what it's supposed to do: catch my coffee spills when they happen ! (dogs jump on the bed when I have a cup of java in my hand......)

review_title: It's waterproof, sure enough! Check out my review . . .
review_body: I did a video review of the SafeRest Mattress protector. I can't post a link here, but just go to YouTube and search for my username (which is also Dugroz there.). I tested it out by pouring water on it. It passed with perfect dryness with no water getting through to the mattress! Check it out. Can be machine washed & dried (on the lowest setting).

review_title: Great protector for extra long dorm room mattresses
review_body: Bought this for my daughters bed in her dorm.  The extra long was needed for the dorm beds and luckily the college warned us ahead of time.  The protector fit perfectly over the mattress and was not too tight so it slid off the corners or loose and bunching up.  The protector's top was also not stiff and crunchy under the sheets, so good for sleeping comfortably on.  it does have just enough room in the fit to get a mattress pad under it as well for thin mattress beds.  Great price also versus other bed and bath type stores.

Bought this as a mattress protector for a new foam mattress. The cover feels a bit  like terry cloth, except very thin.It is deep enough to fit over a twelve inch mattress with room to spare. There is no "vinyl" smell at all. Would buy again.

review_title: Works better than I ever imagined!
review_body: We got this in anticipation of co-sleeping with our first baby.  My husband (smart man) put it on a week before my due date just in case my water broke.  Little did we know that I would have a precipitous labor (very fast) and we wouldn't even make it to the hospital.  We delivered the baby with just the two of us and in the bed with this mattress topper.  Birth is a very messy process. This saved our very expensive thermarest mattress!  It is totally worth the money!  Great product!

I bought two of these mattress pads at the same time I purchased a new memory foam mattress for our guestroom.  We were replacing an old thinner mattress, and needed new pads that could accommodate a 13" mattress.  I also thought it was a good idea to get something hypoallergenic, as an added nicety for guests.  I wasn't looking for anything waterproof because I didn't want anything crinkly, but when I saw these I thought they were worth a try.. These pads are very nice.  They do not add any padding as some mattress pads do, but I didn't need that with our new mattress.  They have a terrycloth top and a soft liquid-proof barrier underneath.  That barrier is not crinkly or crackly at all.  When I first washed and dried them, it took them forever to dry...I realized pretty quickly that was a testament to their waterproof-ness, that the moisture wasn't evaporating through the waterproof layer where it was balled up in the dryer.  I threw them over the shower curtain rod, and by the next morning they were dry.  The waterproof barrier is also what protects the mattress from dust mites and dead skin and all the little gross things that work their way into our mattresses over the years.  You just need to wash it now and then.. If you want to protect your mattress from moisture or other detritus, I would definitely recommend this product.

review_title: Best of several we've tried by far
review_body: Our dog has an incontinence issue and has leaked on our bed before. It didn't take long until the vet recommended medication. During that time we learned that not all mattress protectors are created equal. We tried the Cool Shield first, which ended up leaking very easily. Second we tried the LinenSpa Lucid which was more waterproof but not perfect. It was slightly less breathable. After this one failed we got a new mattress and I read hundreds of reviews before purchasing this one over a year ago. The SafeRest breathes excellently and hasn't leaked. I tested it thoroughly first. I also tried the Beckham which is softer and thinner but a bit less breathable. My only very minor complaint with the SafeRest is that it stains fairly easily.  Do be sure to follow instructions for laundering, never use bleach. I'm willing to live with it permanently being slightly dingy even after washing as it works so well. None of the ones i tried were crinkly, but some were hotter to sleep on. If this one goes I'll buy another but spend the extra to get a full zippered encasement. I never found one that didn't have at least some bad reviews, and  this one is no exception. If you need severe waterproof protection your only option is usually vinyl. But if you get any brand that breathes and feels good under the sheets be sure to test it in case the coating is defective.
Product size has been reduced they're not huge Normie they're called family now

review_title: Awesome for cleaning house and spills
review_body: My “must have” household paper towels. Strong and super absorbent and love the select a size.
Good brand. Convenience to get this brand from Amazon.com. Just kind of pricy.
Great product have used for many years.
Love these. Larger than anything you can buy in the store. A staple at our house
Love them. Great having them delivered.

I love that I can order bulky items like this and have it easily delivered. When you are loading up groceries at the store, big items like this take up space in your shopping cart and vehicle, and it is awesome to have one less thing removed from my shopping list. The price was decent too.
The BEST paper towels ever!!  They do the job they were made for with ease and efficiency  They are the ONLY paper towel I use..

review_title: Bounty definitely is the quicker picker upper!
review_body: Love the larger roll and easy tear off. Pick your size based on your need. Strong and durable. Great price/value.

review_title: We use a lot of paper towels in our home ...
review_body: We use a lot of paper towels in our home and these fit the bill and last the longest and work as advertised !
These smell awful. As if they were dipped in a fish pond.

I had been subscribed to these paper towels through Amazon for months and they were fine - nice and sturdy. But we just opened a new box and they are HORRIBLE. They are noticeably thinner and fall apart when they get wet now. WTF Sparkle?? Unsubscribing.

Quality does not measure up to Bounty or Brawny.  These paper towels are larger that the select-a size of the other brands; but, you can see through them.  Very thin.  Less absorbent.  Will not re-purchase.

review_title: I ordered these thinking they were a great deal but I am so disappointed
review_body: I ordered these thinking they were a great deal but I am so disappointed. The paper towels are okay in quality but they smell like dead meat!! The first time I smelled the meat I figured I had left that one roll near some chicken or maybe somehow the water from the chicken had dripped onto that roll (even though I don't store the towels anywhere near my meat). I'm on my 4th roll now and it still smells. The smell is so terrible I can't use these towels anymore. My best guess is that these towels were stored under frozen meat in whichever factory they came from, hence why the stench is so deeply embedded in them. If you have to buy these, just hope you don't get this terrible batch like I did. I still have 20 rolls left just sitting around.

review_title: I am happy with the brand considering the price
review_body: I have just started using subscribe and save and went through different reviews to decide on which brand of paper towels we should sign up for.  After doing some research, I decided that we would try out sparkle.  I am used to buying a more expensive brand, but since we are trying to save some money, we went with this one.  I am happy with the brand considering the price.  It still holds up pretty well, but does not tackle tougher clean up as my other more pricey brand would do. I do like that it comes it plain white, since I am not a big fan of what I consider tacky patterns on most towels today. But, for the price, I believe that we will stick with this brand for a while.

Normally I am very pleased with this product, however, this time while using when you get near the end of roll the towels start tearing and shredding unlike in past and it has been like this with each package I open. If this is how the quality of the towels are heading I will be switching to another more reliable paper towel as this is wasteful and not worth the money paid for them.

These are usually pretty great value for the price! We've had 10+ deliveries over the last several years and, more often than not, these have done the trick with little issue.. Like some reviews have mentioned, a couple of the shipments have had an odd smell, not overpowering but a bit musty. I'd imagine this is related to how these boxes were stored and/or transported, so this is most likely a warehousing issue and I wouldn't hold this against the product overall necessarily. The only other minor gripe is the amount of dust these leave on our kitchen counter, just from sitting in the holder.. For the price, however, you cannot quibble too much!

I started buying these paper towels the day after I saw one of their commercials that pointed out how rarely one needs paper towels that can support a bowling ball. At my house, paper towels are used for soaking up spills and drying hands. These do a great job. I like that I can buy them in bulk and they show up at my front door in a reasonable amount of packaging. One less thing that I have to shop for weekly.

Paper towels are  good price?but for some reason I bought these more than  once and some of the rolls smell like eggs i let other people confirm and they do  smell like eggs..  I don't know why hopefully it's not a chemical  if so I will not order again..  Other than that they would be great .

I'm rating them 5 stars because they're a product that works at a great price. I've used cheap paper towels that rip in parts off the roll and disintegrate in your hands which is extremely infuriating, but these are cheap rolls that actually hold together and do what they need.. I mix between Sparkle and Bounty, and while obviously Bounty has a heartier build - I can't say it justifies the price in terms of use because I wouldn't say I need to use more Sparkle sheets to clean up the same mess I would with Bounty.

Pillows arrived vacuum compressed and I allowed them 24 hours to expand/fluff.. These pillows are not even filled properly; at most, it's 3/4 full with huge empty spaces at all four corners. The empty spaces start at each corner and go inward for approximately 5 inches from EACH corner. Total emptiness and air. No amount of fluffing or arranging will make any of the cheap poly migrate towards the edges.. So, not only are these pillows not 24 x 24 and thus cannot fill a 24 x 24 pillow, they dont even fill out a 22 x 22 pillow because they're so underfilled.. Avoid at all costs, and buy something a little more expensive but quality. These are terrible.

These two pillow inserts I ordered are 18L.  They are supposed to be SQUARE not rectangle.  Now, just days before Christmas I have to rush around trying to find the correct ones.  They are nice and soft, but are not the right size, I ordered 18 x 18.  The package says 18L.  Not pleased

review_title: Great affordable pillow made extremely well
review_body: Purchased this 18 x18 stuffer pillow for a pillow that was actually 17 x 17. It was a gift and I wanted it to look really stuffed. I also didn't want to mess around with filler, so I tried this instead. The pillow was great. It is well made, fit good, was affordable and extremely quick to assemble with no mess, and the final product looked and felt awesome. I would definitely recommend this product.

Have other inserts. I am always changing the pillow covers on my sofa & daybed. Want people to curl up & be comfortable.Noticed that guests were gravitating to two certain pillows. Then realized my family did too. It was these! They are full, supportive for those guests who want one behind their back. They are light weight, easily fluffed up to regally display the covers. I've ordered more to start replacing all my inserts with these. They also fit perfectly into the corners of my covers. After checking stores, these are underlined for the exceptional quality. Ah, that's just between us..don't tell the company!!

These were a great fit for my 18 x 18 pillow cover as well as a 17.5 x 17.5 pillow cover. They are pretty soft and fluffy, good quality. I would recommend purchasing this size if you are using the 18 x 18 cover and want a well stuffed and firm pillow. I have seen pictures of slouchy under filled pillows on pinterest so if that is the look you are going for, you should go with something a bit smaller, but I think that the 20 x 20 pillow and 18 x 18 cover combo is pretty standard. This is a great product, there are ones out there that are a bit cheaper but spend the three dollars extra and get this pillow insert because the quality is acceptable for the price. If you are looking to sleep on this pillow, you may want to opt for something a bit more expensive, but if you are using it as a throw pillow this is perfect and there is really no reason to splurge on anything fancier.

Picture is misleading.  The actual product doesn't have "ears".  It is roughly a square and you have to shake and pull the filling into the cover's "ears" - good luck.  The manufacturer says to buy a size larger than the pillow cover - i.e. 18" cover 20" filling.  Several reviews said this wasn't necessary, but I think the maker is right.  My 22" cover could have easily used a 24" stuffer, which might even have filled the currently hollow ears.  The filler is comfortable to lean against, but I will buy a shaped pillow stuffer from now on.

Nice overstuffed insert. Actually fills out my throw pillow cases. Tried to go the cheaper route previously with the less expensive inserts available through Amazon and was sooo disappointed as they didn't come even remotely close to filling the cases. These on the other hand are delightful and work really well. Seem to be holding up well without getting squished/deflated after 3 months of use
Great pillow insert...very full.  I use it for an accent pillow on couch and like that it is hypoallergenic for my grandchildren with allergies.
Do NOT follow the sizing recommendations. I have a cover that is 18x18, so I ordered the 20x20 insert. I can't get it into the cover. So now I have to return it and order the next smaller size.

review_title: Thick and Small and Short Sized
review_body: This pillow is a thick, puff ball that barely is 16 x 16 even though it is labeled as 18 x 18. If you push on it and totally squish it down, it might meet about a 17 x 17 size. But on it's own, it did NOT fill my 18 x 18 pillow case. Not even close. The corners of the case are hollow and floppy. So if you want a small, thick pillow, this stuffer is for you.

review_title: I would hate to see someone disappointed by this purchase
review_body: I bought this very early for a Christmas present. We hung the lights in our daughter's bedroom; they worked for a few hours, and then stopped. Now we get a message that it is too late to return. They weren't very expensive, but it is disappointing. I would hate to see someone disappointed by this purchase.

Happy with the length of the lights! Only bought 2 hoping it would cover my whole wall and did. Also happy that they can connect to each other if you have more than one set. I kind of thought they would be a bit brighter but for my room it turned out perfect. Also arrived fast! Ordered on Saturday night and arrived on Tuesday.

review_title: Beautiful lights that can be used in a variety of ways!
review_body: I love decorating my house with lights, even when it is not a holiday season. I like the way it brightens everything up, plus I think it's really relaxing to turn off the other house lights at night, and just have the string lights on. I have a few different types of string lights, but they are all the standard type; one long strand of cord, with white lights in a line. I definitely do not own anything like this one! I love that there are new uses for these lights. They can be hanged along a bay window, a sliding glass door, a bedroom doorway, behind the backboard of a bed, etc. They can also be used at more formal occasions, like at a wedding/reception, baby shower, engagement party, etc. Not to mention the price is really great for what you get. If you're looking to decorate for a special occasion, or just really enjoy decorating your house with lights (like me), than these are really nice lights to purchase.

review_title: Received an open & defective product, waste of time & money!
review_body: I bought these for a room redecoration project along with other items. I was dissapointed that the product arrived already opened and not sealed... the box was literally open already when I received the package. The lights were defective. I'm assuming that someone else returned them because they were defective and I had been sent their return. Not worth the $$ or time wasted.

On time shipping with bubble-wrap/airbags for additional cushioning, received unopened in original retail packaging and in new condition.. I purchased one (1) box of twinkle lights and am VERY PLEASED with the results.  My curtains are about 82" long x 125" wide with 20 grommets across the width of the curtains.  The lights were placed between black curtain panels and white sheer panels, placing one strand every two (2) grommets, and one set of lights accommodated the entire width of the curtains.  The results are more subtle than the seller's photo, but are absolutely BEAUTIFUL!  I keep the lights on 24-7 so at night the dimming effect of the sheers creates a candlelight glow and convenient night light.  During the day there is a warm glow, even with the bedroom light on.. • Each strand is individually zip tied to the base cord preventing the base cord and individual strands from unraveling.. • Each strand is individually gathered into a neat twisty tie preventing tangled messes.. • Tangled strands are easy to untangle and the lights are tough enough to resist the shaking and pulling without any damage or disconnections.. • The power cord reaches from 4" above my window opening to my floor with length to spare.. • The light control is located halfway between the first strand and the power adapter, very easy to reach.. • The light control is very easy to use, pressing once to change settings.. • I leave these lights for 24 hours a day and they have never gotten hot, flickered, shorted, or dimmed.. • Light cords are clear colored and visually appealing without sheers or other covering.. • LED is warm toned as described and easy on the eyes, especially for those of us who get migraines!. NOTE: To achieve the results shown on the sellers posting I would estimate two (2) possibly three (3) boxes of lights would be required.. Overall, I could not be more pleased with my purchase, I have no complaints and I don't feel like these lights are lacking in any way. I would recommend this product and seller based on my personal experience.

These lights are so beautiful. They were the perfect length for our living room windows and look so amazing. But two important things i want to mention , like the plug hangs too high up for if your power outlet is lower on the wall(we used an extension), also the description says these are warm white in color but we received a cool white.. OTHER THAN THAT... BEAUTIFUL!!

review_title: Product's plug was so short there was no possible way ...
review_body: Product's plug was so short there was no possible way I could hang the lights up and plug it into a socket. Tangled and messy. Broken when I received the package.

review_title: They were longer than I thought but beautiful!!
review_body: They were longer than I thought but beautiful!!! I tucked the strings up and the length wasn't an issue.  Easy to use and loved the different settings.  We were able to secure it with tape and use it during our wedding.  If you want a nice set of lights these are cute.. Remember my set in the picture was to long and I have the ends of the strings tucked up across the top.  If you want this many lights and they will be hanging freely you will need two sets or you will have less lights than what it looks like in my picture.
Love them! They're very long. So I ended up bringing some back up to the top. And

DO NOT BUY - Could not even hang these as they were a tangled mess. I spent an hour trying to sort out the strands but gave up.. Unfortunately I didn't keep the packaging to return. Big waste of money. I guess you could use them in a large jar as decoration due to them just being a tangled ball. Also, from what I could tell, the spacing in-between strands wouldn't allow it to look as full as the pictures show.

review_title: Not for use at an angle - YOU WILL BE BURNED
review_body: I purchased this steamer after doing only a moderate amount of research, but I assumed that 1,178 almost 5 star reviews could not lead me in the wrong direction - I was wrong. First, I appreciate this is a simple steamer meant to steam clothing, but the instructions were just lacking. I filled the body of the steamer with distilled water as instructed and put the top on and allowed the steamer to heat up only to discover I had put the top on backwards. I grabbed the top (not the steam part, but the area where it connects) and quickly found out how hot the device gets. I unplugged the whole thing and started from scratch.. After I got the top on correctly and the water was heated I then discovered I needed to add more water because I waited too long (seven minutes) and all the water had - surprise! - turned to steam. I unplugged the steamer, carefully took the top off and added more water, then plugged it back in and waited for the steam to reappear. Thinking nothing of it, I tipped the steamer at an angle to steam my knitting project that was laying flat on the floor and was instantly scalded with boiling hot water. That sucked.. I thought maybe I had filled the reservoir too full, but I checked and it was barely halfway full. Maybe I was having a moment of stupid optimism, but I decided to try again, only I thought I would tip the steamer just partially over - nope, boiling hot water again.. I did some more research and found another steamer for the same price that promises it can be used at any angle.

review_title: Keep it close and you’ll use constantly.
review_body: After years of the dreaded iron, I went to a pro steamer. It was an absolute pain. Nozzle had to be kept high. Water drips everywhere. I purchased this product with no preconceived ideas. It’s been fabulous. I keep it in my laundry room for a quick steam. Works great on every fabric I’ve tried. Dresses, dress shirts, polos, capris and, linen. I’ve used on all and am quite pleased. It’s small, lightweight and, I’m going to order another one because it’s fantastic!

Just got it. Tested it immediately. Amazing!!!!!!!. That little thing just made my day!. I have so many dresses I don’t wear just because I hate ironing, plus they always get messed up and look so old afterwards!. And I used my new little magical machine today that looks like a tea-pot hahaha but does so much amazing work in so little time!. I did have to refil the water tank few times but hey, I prefer that than having it heavy in my hand!. Goodness, makes me feel so dumb I didn’t have this in my home before.

This is a great little steamer, which I've had about 1 month. It heats up quickly and has worked really well. I've used it on hand-washed sweaters (cashmere and merino), t-shirts, and synthetic fabrics like rayon knits. I haven't had any issues that a few people mentioned, like spewing water. You definitely steam the garment vertically, which is how I thought all steamers worked. I just hang my clothes and steam away. If a garment needs minor steaming, I've actually held it up with one hand and steamed with the other. As for running out of steam quickly, I expected that. It is handheld, therefore small, so of course it can only hold so much water. (I use filtered.) I have yet had to refill it before finishing a garment or two. I've never done a dress, but I have done pants.. I would not use this for business attire, i.e., men's dress shirts. It just isn't designed for that, but it has really simplified my morning routine on workdays. (I also used the camelcamelcamel website so I could buy the steamer when it reached the price I was willing to pay.)

This couldn’t be easier to use. Open the top (following the instructions for which way to open or close), pour in water to just below the Max line, put the top back on, plug it in, flip the switch and wait for around 60 seconds. It’s very small so I end up needing to refill for every garment, but the size also lends itself to portability. I had the best results when I held the garment taught with one hand and used the steamer like an iron with the other. Despite giving a 5 star rating for durability, I can’t actually comment on it as I’ve only owned the steamer for a few days now. But overall, I am very happy with the product. The image I included is of a cotton and rayon shirt before and after using the steamer. It definitely works better on natura fibers and has a pretty difficult time with Polyester.

It works well, practical, easy to use and store. I had a bigger one before and it broke after years of use, I replaced it with this one and I am very pleased with the results since it's easier to handle. I will buy it again and recommend it. I use it mainly for blouses and my daughter's dresses. Some reviews almost kept me from buying they said that it wets your clothes. It didn't happen to me though but I followed all the directions of use, such as not filling it higher than the max line, and do not tilt it more than 45 degrees while using it, if you do that the water won't come out and wet your clothes. So simple just follow the directions. I'd like to know how long it would last but for the price I'm ok if it only lasts for a couple of years, I'll just buy a new one. I'm also very satisfied with the company because it employs people with different abilities!

review_title: Easy to use and gets the job done
review_body: This was the first clothes steamer I have ever bought.  I thought they would be difficult to use but the hardest thing about this one was twisting the lid off to put the water in. Even that was not very difficult once I got over the fear that I would break it.  I have weak wrists and hands so a lot of effort on my part does not equal a lot of effort on most people's part.. I did have to be careful not to tilt the steamer too much when I was using it, otherwise water comes out the nozzle and dribbles on the clothes.  This was something the instructions had warned about.  I just forgot while I was concentrating on maneuvering it to get some wrinkles out.  The steamer does allow for a little tilting, but too much allowed some of the water in the reservoir tank to drip on the clothes.. I found that it took more steam to get some of the wrinkles out than I expected.  Some of that is no doubt because of my total inexperience.  Some is probably because this is a home steamer and not a commercial steamer. In any event, the 10 minutes worth of steam went very quickly.  However,  it was easy and quick to add more water and continue with the steaming.. I found the instructions and directions that came with the packaging to be straightforward.  I had no trouble following the directions in order to disassemble the steamer to add water, and found the instructions on how to use the steamer to best advantage on wrinkled clothing to be helpful.  For instance, I followed the directions which said to steam my clothes while they were hanging up rather than laid flat and found that this worked very well.. All in all I would definitely recommend this product.

review_title: Great Portable Steamer, But Don't Expect Superior Qualities
review_body: This is a great product that teeters in between three and four stars. I gave it four because it does what I think it was designed for. I'll start with the negative and end with the positive.. -There's no pressure gauge. The steam emits at a set pace and you cannot adjust less or more output. It is what it is.. -The tank evaporates pretty quick. It's a travel steamer so plan on 5-8 minutes of use. They say 10 minutes, but that's stretching it in my opinion.. -You need to plug it in to use it. This is more of a desire than a complaint, but to be completely "portable", you'd think wireless would be the direction you'd aim for.. Now on to the good stuff.. -The ease of use is great. Plug this thing in, add water, wait 53 seconds, now steam your clothes. Done.. -The portability is great. This thing will fit in a carry-on bag if you need.. -The cost is worth the product. I don't know much about steamers, but this shouldn't break the bank.. If I have more thoughts, I'll update the review, but I give it a 4 out of 5 stars because there is nothing quite like this, but the technology needs to keep progressing. Bring me a wireless steamer with a pressure gauge, that uses less water somehow, and I'll give this product a 6 out of 5 stars,

I was super excited to use this instead of trying to iron clothes at the hotel. For my first trip to Washington DC, everything was fantastic. Then I went to Germany, and oops, this is only designed for a single voltage, and unlike many hair dryers and similar products does not have a selector switch for the voltage. As a result, this is basically worthless for those that travel.

This product was a gift, so I was not immediately aware of the issues it had upon its arrival.  The person I gifted this to recently provided me the honest review of this item:. It is cheaply made.  Within two uses of the steamer, it began leaking each time it was used.  The water inside, likely due to the leakage, doesn't even last for one small garment.  The leak coming out the steam end is hot enough to burn slightly, causing the use of this item to be done only with extreme caution.  Furthermore, the smell of the steamer is that of burning plastic or metal.  It is memorable to the smell of the electric plastic water kettles with the internal metal components that have a distinct smell upon usage.  It is essentially useless.
In addition to sweeping the floor, I uses these to pickup small water spills in front of the sink and for dusting.

review_title: Picks up dust and holds it.
review_body: I use these more as dust cloths than floor cleaners. They catch and hold the dust rather than just pushing it around as with a regular cloth. I’ve tried the cheaper ones from the dollar stores but they’re just as bad as using a tissue.

review_title: Handy and fast for picking up that fur/dust, etc.
review_body: Housekeeper uses them every other week or so alternating between a wet mopping and using the Swiffer. The boxes are easy to store and do a decent job of picking up various types of fur/lint/dust.

The old lady wanted me to buy the box of 32 dry pads, but I said no way!  I went for this box of 52 and got a better deal. She was so stoked. You should have seen her whippin around like a psycho, cleaning and humming.  I bet she would say this pads are freakin great.

review_title: Not just for floors, bee hive beetle traps
review_body: These are very good quality. I have used them on Floors and they work exactly as they are designed to. One thing should be added to the description on the box under usage. Play sheet on top of frames in beehive box to trap house beetles.

I love the product but will not be ordering again because we live in a front street apartment in a busy section of the city and the refills arrived in original thin packaging.  Bright green and name of product on package for anyone walking by to see.  What?  Why?

We are DOG people and have hard wood floors.  No other product has compared to the quality of the Swiffer sweeper!  We use this every day to keep our floors clear of dog hair.  I've tried all sort of other products - always go back to our Swiffer.
Works as intended. Picks up dirt really well. I attach it to my Swiffer and use hard floor cleaner.

review_title: Great for dog hair and light dirt and sand
review_body: I have a large dog that is a shedding machine.  These help me keep the dog hair under control between vacuumings.

review_title: This is a good product. It does a good job catching pet ...
review_body: This is a good product. It does a good job catching pet hair and it's faster that dragging the vacuum around every day

review_title: This scale was horrible. I wanted to replace my old scale with ...
review_body: This scale was horrible. I wanted to replace my old scale with this cool modern design. I wen't to test the Elekcity by placing a bag of cat food that weighed 11lbs.The Elekcity was right on the mark at 11lbs and so was my old scale. I went to weigh myself and I was over 2 pounds heavier on the Elekcity than my old scale.  I wasn't weighing myself on carpet either I was on tile. To be fair I moved my old scale in the same place where I weighed myself with the Elekcity. I moved both scales around my bathroom floor in six different places, in the center of the tile so that the scales were on the center of the tile and and not going over the edge touching the grout lines. The scales were on even surfaces in all six places. I did calibrate the Elekcity too. So, after the comparisons of both scales save your money the Elekcity is junk I sent it back the same day I received it. Also the Elekcity showed my weight 10lbs lighter it gave me several different readings. Junk! Junk! Junk!

I'm not sure why this gets such great reviews. It works somewhat, but seems to have poor sensors in it:. The weight it measures will vary depending on how and where you stand on it. If you want to weigh more, stand or just favor your weight a little on your heels. If you want to show less weight, then do the same towards your toes. If you want a consistent measurement, then try to stand in the same place in the same way every time. Also note that these "adjustments" can carry forward even if you are not leaning or favoring a side if you simply had done so last time. Stand in the middle, 181 several times in a row, lean back once and get 183, get back on and stand straight in the middle and now it's always 183. "Reset" by moving forward and it's either back to 181 or maybe even drops to 180 now and shows that consistently.. The decimals are also misleading in terms of how granular the measurement is. I don't think I've ever seen an odd number appear after the decimal point.. Overall, it does a crude but probably good enough job just to the point that I can't be bothered to return it.

review_title: They sent me a new scale and were very nice, but it does the same thing
review_body: I ordered this scale, and it was wavering between one weight, and another that was 10lbs more. I changed batteries and when that didn't work, I contacted etekcity.  They sent me a new scale and were very nice, but it does the same thing. I just don't think it's worth it if you're looking for something with any level of precision below 10lbs.  Also getting a different brand of food scale...I don't trust this brand anymore.

I was excited to get this highly-rated scale to replace the one I’ve had for 15 years. It looked great out of the box, but that’s the only compliment I can give.  At first, I couldn’t get it to calibrate to zero. I had to tap it hard enough to get the scale to come on at which point it registered the weight of the press rather than resetting to zero.  I took the batteries out and but them in which seems to be the equivalent of restarting a computer.  At first I thought I had solved the problem, so I proceeded to weigh myself multiple times without moving the scale.  None of the weights were the same. I tried with another person, same results.  I tried a 5 pound bag of flour and got an error message. I tried forcing a calibration and still had the same results.  Too many problems right out of the box.  Now I have to figure out how to mail it back when all I have is the absurdly oversized box Amazon shipped it in.

review_title: EXTREMELY disappointed--15 pounds worth of inaccuracy
review_body: The scale i recieved is inaccurate by roughly 15 pounds, give or take. I recieved my scale yesterday evening after I got home from an appointment with my doctor, and the scale was weighing me as 15 pounds heavier than I was at my appointment. I had not eaten or drunken any fluids between weighing myself at my appointment and on this new scale. I figured I would try it again ten minutes later and the reading was several pounds different than the previous reading. I did this for about half an hour, making sure to allow the scale to calibrate and ensuring that I wasn't just stepping on and off. I am extremely disappointed with this scale.

review_title: which is cool. What's odd about it is that nine times ...
review_body: This scale is slim and sleek, which is cool. What's odd about it is that nine times out of ten, it tells me a wrong weight first (usually about three pounds over, give or take), then I step off, then it flashes "C", then I go again and it gives me the right weight. I've gotten used to it as a quirk, but it's weird.. Also-- make sure you're always using on a hard, flat surface. I first tried it on a rug and got very confusing results.. ETA: This has basically stopped working. I weighed myself five times this morning and got a different weight (within a four-pound range, but I'm fairly sure none of them were close to right) every time. It was good while it lasted but I expect something like this to last more than ten months.

I am not even sure if this scale is accurate for anything, but for small weight changes, it sucks.  It seems to want to stick to certain weights even if you add or remove small amounts of a pound.. as for the number after the decimal, it jumps by .2 but actually seems to just like the values of .4 and .8 no matter what weight is on the scale.  LOOK FOR ANOTHER SCALE THIS ONE IS HORRIBLE if you are looking to accurately measure your weight.

review_title: Accurate - Affordable - Attractive. So far so good!
review_body: Though both my grandmothers' ancient dial scales still work great (I do have to dial them in occasionally as they like to stick at weird numbers when you get off) and I appreciate having been given them, they're bulky and not exactly the nicest things to look at so I finally decided to just give in and get a more modern scale. I didn't want to spend very much though, so the Etekcity caught my eye.. I tested it out when I got it, and compared my weight on it to the two other scales I have and the Etekcity was spot on to them on the same level surface in the same part of my house, maybe with a variation of like  .2 lbs but as the older scales don't show increments precisely like a digital scale I'm inclined to think it's not so much a variation as it is just being able to properly see the exact weight. I also weighed a few different objects across all three scales and weights remained the same there too. So accuracy is great here.. It feels really sturdy, which is important. I know tempered glass is strong and I'm nowhere near the max weight limit but standing on glass still kind of trips me out a little. I have noticed a little wobbling on the scale but my house is very old so it may be an ever so slightly uneven floor issue. I plan to try moving it around the house in a few different spots to see if it gets fully level somewhere else.

review_title: Good, But You Might Get Slightly Different Readings Every Now and Then
review_body: I was a little weary to get this scale from seeing other customer's reviews. Like the glass just randomly exploding. So far, so good there. It weighs pretty accurately. My only complaint is every now and then it'll give me different amounts. Not huge differences. But for example. In the morning I weighed myself and it says 157.5. I think, that can't be right. What?! But accept defeat because maybe I did gain weight or that I didn't lose any weight even though I've been trying and feel lighter. So 30 minutes later I decide. I'll just check it again to make sure because it just doesn't seem right. And my second weigh-in comes around 155.2. So I weigh myself a few times after that back to back to see if it changes and it stays at that 155.2. I'm not sure if this is something with the product. But I'm pretty sure you don't lose almost 3 pounds in 30 minutes. It's not that big of a deal to me because I'm getting a general idea of my weight and ever since that time of getting different weights, I weigh myself 2 or 3 times in a row to make sure I get the same number. About 95% of the time I do. But it's just something for a consumer and/or Etekcity to know. It'd be nice to have a 100% accuracy on the scale readings.

I'm really happy with this scale and have only one minor complaint with it:  Finding the sweet spot to turn it on can be a bit challenging at first.  However, that line in the middle seems to be the spot.  So, if you purchase this product, step on that line in the middle and it should turn on every time, on the first try.  Aside from that, I'm very, very pleased with it - especially since it uses standard AA batteries, unlike my previous scale which had weird batteries that were a lot harder to find.

review_title: The only trash bags I buy
review_body: Like all Amazon Prime products, it arrives packaged professionally and on time. I rarely have a complaint with Amazon deliveries.. These are good trash bags. They're strong, and they work. I have NEVER had one break on me. Sure, they're a little hard to get on the trash can, but they never slip off, either. So you take the bad to get the good.. I don't care about the smell. In fact, I can't smell it. And the trash will still stink, but maybe it's not as bad as it would be without them. I don't know.. All I know if that these are good, strong bags.. They are a bit expensive, however, so you're paying for the quality. That's worth it to me.

These are so much better than other odor-guard trash bags that smell lemony and the trash still stinks when you use them. The gain scent does last at least 5 days as advertised. So even when you add moderately smelly garbage, the odor is not noticeable for days. I would buy these again over other brands and scents.

review_title: These certainly are one tough trash bag. I am very happy with my purchase.
review_body: I love these trash bags. I know it is strange to "love a trash bag", but these are seriously awesome! They really do smell like gain when you first shake the bag out to put it into your trash can. Then, as you start filling the trash bag, it doesn't smell like trash mixed with gain. It just masks the odors and makes them virtually undetectable. I buy these every time because they work great for me!

review_title: These have been great for our family
review_body: These have been great for our family. They are super durable, we haven't had a single one tear as we remove them from the bin. My only complaint is the smell. I hoped I would like the fresh scent but it turns out the smell grosses me out and now I associate that smell with garbage and I can always smell it when I walk into the kitchen. I prefer the light trashy scent compared to the loud Gain-ey disguised trashy scent.

review_title: Worth Every Single Penny.  Smell Good. Sturdy. Trash Bag Love? Absolutely
review_body: Sturdy trash bags that smell really amazing.  I don't know how, but I never thought I'd enjoy a trash bag.  They work with the simple human 13 gallon trash cans and it's a great price in bulk. Amazon often has coupons attached to them and I also have them on my prime subscribe and save so I get another 15% off the discounted price.  Worth every single penny.

It really does have odor shield. It doesn't just attempt to mask the smell. You know how most scented trash bags attempt to mask the smell. So your kitchen smells like that scent and trash. No pleasant. This really does prevent the smell. However, it won't smell like febreeze, it just wont smell. Seems like a good trade off to me.

review_title: They suck but the smell isn’t overpowering
review_body: These trash bags are literally garbage. They rip around the top every time I pick them up. I have to double bag them whenever I take the trash out. That being said, at least I’m not scent bombed out of my kitchen every time I relive the trash can. The febreeze scent is more gentle than some other scented trash bags. Never buying these again, however.

I have been buying these bags for years. They are the only bags that don't let the bad garbage smells permeate and stink up the bin itself. The scents are really fake smelling, but since you are going to end associating them with garbage smell it doesn't really matter. If you use gain in your laundry I wouldn't recommend using the gain ones or your fresh laundry is going to remind you of garbage. I've pushed cardboard and stuff down in these bags without them tearing, VERY rarely have I poked a hole in one of these. I don't plan on switching bags!

Oh my goodness these trash bags smell incredible! I hate hate hate smelly garbage. These bags with gain scent and febreeze freshness really step up the freshness of the kitchen. I love putting in a new bag, you can really smell the difference. I wish they made these for small trashcans, I have two kids that wear a pullup or diapers and getting the fresh smell in the smaller trashcans would be amazing.. These bags are NOT the force flex bags, but these it a panel of that at the top to help with the bag not ripping when you tie it up.. I paid full price for this item and this is my honest and unbiased review.

These are the most durable trash bags I  have purchased - and my rubbish includes cat litter. The odour control is quite good. I have found that, with rubbish pickup twice a week, and mine including changing the litter completely for an indoor cat, that one is sufficient. Unlike other bags I have tried, I have had no trouble with breaks, and it does not leak if one puts in grease, fat from a pan, and the like.

review_title: Good quality for a great price!
review_body: These are the best priced paper towels I’ve found. And I do the math. Cost by square footage. It’s the only way to accurately measure cost with paper products. But these are also good quality. I would compare them to the Kirkland brand that Costco sells. And you receive a big box of them. So they don’t skimp. These last a while. Depending on your usage. And are as absorbent as any other comparable paper towel. They are not thin or flimsy. They are not the pick a size. Just the standard paper towel. Definitely good quality and worth the price. Better deal than the Alexa deal I was offered.

review_title: Just a total waste with these
review_body: Just a total waste with these. They are absorbent, but you do not get much in the package and I feel they were not worth the money spent. The whole role is flimsy and I don't feel they are nearly as good as the Costco brand I typically buy. Won't be purchasing these again.
Plenty should be called Not enough. Half or less than half  the size of any other real brand. So, if you think saving 7.00 is worth it... It is not. I will never buy these again.

They are everything I would expect from a paper towel!! FYI, I usually buy Bounty and was a "bounty girl" since time immemorial! But these do everything theirs does for less. So why not drop Bounty and buy Plenty??? PLENTY IS NOT (yet) SELECT-A-SIZE!!! And for some of the THINGS I use paper towels for, a full size would be a complete waste of paper!

review_title: One of these things is not like the other
review_body: I like these towels, but some rolls are short and won’t stay in the under the cabinet dispenser.

review_title: Not the great deal I thought it was
review_body: I never really paid much attention to paper towels, we just bought them and lived our lives. We use paper towels for day to day wipe ups, window cleaning and occasional spills. Plus they make handy napkins for those impromptu dinners when the dignitaries aren't scheduled to stop by lol.. The Plenty rolls are 52-2 ply sheets per roll @ $19.31 per 24 roll case. I found Brighton rolls elsewhere which are 85-2 ply sheets per roll @ $35.99 for a case of 30. So do the math, Plenty sheets are 11"x10.4" at 52 rolls gives you 540.8 linear inches of sheer wiping power. The Brighton is 11"x8.5" at 85 sheets which equals 722 linear inches. So even though the Brighton sheets are shorter you still get more bang per roll. We never use 100% paper towel absorbancy. The Plenty was costing us $.015 while the Brighton rolls are $.014 per sheet. Not much you would think, but when the average user spools 2-3 towels per wipe up and a single napkin is used 7 days per week x3 meals per person, you can see the savings add up.

review_title: Nice, thick paper towel for a good price.
review_body: Nice and thick. I plan to stick to these. I haven't tried to seriously scrub anything with these (the marketing copy says you can) although I did clean the fridge with these the other day. I've bought this brand before in local stores but the thickness was inconsistent. Either I got a counterfeit a few times or maybe I didn't always get "premium" because sometimes they were super thin. This lot from Amazon offers nice quality. If I ever end up trying to scrub something with these, I'll up my review to 5 stars if it works out.

review_title: Great Value for A great Paper Towel
review_body: These paper towels work great.  They are durable, clean up messes just like the more expensive paper towels.  I was skeptical when ordering these but decided to try them after reading how other reviewers really liked them. I am glad I tried these paper towels.  They do not fall apart when dealing with messes and clean up which is important to me with a disabled husband and 2 cats.  They have durability, a nice weight and do not fall apart when using.I will definitely be buying these again.  Keep ordering these.  I like that many rolls of paper towels are delivered straight t my door.

HAHAHA. I accidentally ordered WAY TOO MANY PAPER TOWELS. BUTTTT, I'm glad that I did. There are sooo many for the cheap price!. And they work really well. Their easily stored away too in any nook or cranny of your tiny apartment living. I've even used and reused the same paper towel. Their durable and great.. I use them to pick up all kinds of stuff, even wet clays, dog hair, caked on spaghetti sauce.. I've used these for my dog's accidents in the apartment and they work well.. I love Plenty ultra premium paper towels. Customer for life.. Also, I vape and use these napkins to wipe up leaking vape juice when I change out my tanks.

I usually buy a different brand that offers different sizes. When I got this in the mail I wasn't as satisfied because it felt like I was wasting paper towels due to the size of the towels being bigger than what I'm used to. I probably won't get these again and will go back to the other brand I was using. These were on sale so I thought I would check them out. They are OK if you don't mind not having an option to make the sheet size smaller.

review_title: Bad quality. Let off little hairs after very light use. Makes your glass look horribly scratched
review_body: At first they seemed great but after a week of light use for wiping down glass to get smudges off little strings started coming off. When I say light I mean once or twice a week on a small piece of glass.. Most clothes like this have never done that too me until I washed them but these started letting off so many strands the glass would come back worse looking then I wipe it down with other clothes I have and it's clean looking again.. Horrendous quality. Won't buy again. This is sad because usually I am satisfied with Amazon basics quality.

I thought I was getting a good deal for a 24 pack but you can get a better deal at Home Depot for a 24 pack at 8 bucks for microfiber cloths and they’re basically the same except all blue. The quality is what you would expect as you can see sunlight through them but they absorb well and get the job done. If you’re looking for a plush microfiber cloth buy something else but these are fine for around the house. I use the yellow in the kitchen, blue for general house cleaning and dusting, and white for the bathroom. I don’t use these on our cars, I like to use the chemical guys microfiber for our vechicles. As for washing them, I wash them in cold water with microfiber cleaner or sal suds as a detergent. No bleach, no fabric softener. I dry them on air or the lowest heat possible. They come out super clean with no stains. As long as you use just detergent and don’t heat dry them, they will last you a while and keep their shape well. Don’t wash them with cotton or anything else that has lint or you will end up with them catching all the lint.

review_title: Great value on a reusable cloth
review_body: These are perfect for the price. I prefer a thinner microfiber cloth, as I use them in the kitchen all the time and need something that will fit into glasses and small spaces. I have some of the heavier ones and they are not as comfortable for me to use . I do not put these in the dryer. I wash them with a light load unless heavily soiled (which is when I add them to a dark load) and air dry them and they are great and reusable.  I also always travel with one or two moistened and in a plastic baggie so I can wash up in a rest area and be more comfortable. One lives in the car to refresh the windows when needed, one lives in the bathroom to clean the fixtures, one has devoted its life to being a dust cloth, and the rest will get used as needed. Oh and incidentally, I never use fabric softener on them as it clogs the fibers.

review_title: Very good price for a set of 24 cleaning cloths - Nice colors to separate for different uses.
review_body: I do like these - they're a medium/light weight - great for everyday cleaning.  You get (or should get - I was short one cloth) 24 which is excellent for dividing up between kitchen, bathrooms, laundry room, etc.  One of '23' clothes I received has started to ravel after 1 week usage, so it will take some time to decide if the great price for these is as good as it seems.

These are awesome.  I used to go through a ton of paper towels for everyday cleaning until I bought these.  They are perfect for wiping up spills, washing windows, cleaning the bathroom and dusting.  I washed them before I used them and they shrunk a little bit, but they were huge to begin with, so it was no big deal.  A couple of them had a small flaw, like extra thread hanging from a corner.  They're cleaning cloths, so I don't need perfection.  I definitely recommend.

review_title: OK...could be much better for only a small increase in price.
review_body: Good for daily use.  I just wish that they were a touch thicker.  They are too thin to absorb the way you expect from microfiber.  But for what they are...and for the price...not a bad deal.  Could easily be better if the manufacturer would choose to make it so...for very little in cost. I get tired of companies that only worry about profit above all else.  I wouldn't even mind paying a little more...so than can keep their profit margins...just irritates me when something is advertised as a quality product that is so obviously not going to last very long.

review_title: One of the best things since sliced bread.
review_body: Really love these things!  I like that they come in three colors so that I can color code them for use: the white ones are used only for cleaning my glasses, mirrors and countertops, the yellow ones for cleaning around the house including the floors (these things tuck into the tabs of a Swiffer Wet) and the blue ones are used as wash cloths for the shower.  These absorb water like crazy and are easy to wring out and keep using to dry things.  I love using the blue ones in the shower, they take most of the water out of my hair, then I wring them out and use them to damp dry my body before putting on lotion.. The only reason these cloths are not getting five stars is because they do have very fine lint that shows up on the lenses of my glasses, but at least the lint can be blown off easily.  I would actually give them 4.5 stars if possible.  All in all, I would highly recommend these handy little things!

review_title: Great Quality at a Reasonable Price
review_body: These are great Microfiber towels.  So far I've purchased two (2) sets of these.  They are very soft and I'm not overly worried about scratching my 2016 Dodge Hellcat.  After I use them I toss them in the washing machine.  They come out clean and always hold up through the washing cycle.  At the price of these, if I have to throw one away every now because its too dirty to salvage it's no big deal.  I've mostly used these for cleaning my car but they could easily be used in the house to clean mirrors, windows, coffee tables, etc.

review_title: The product arrived on time and the packing was good. I've always bought micro fiber clothes from bed ...
review_body: The product arrived on time and the packing was good.I've always bought micro fiber clothes from bed bath and beyond, don't ask me why i don't know :) and this time i ordered it from amazon and i couldn't be happier.. I love the 3 different colors it came in(white,blue and yellow) and that has helped me with coordinating my cleaning routine with a color. For example - blue is to clean/buff my stainless steal appliances in the kitchen. Yellow is for dusting and white is for the bathrooms etc. and that way i can keep track of which ones need replacing, washing etc.I used the white ones for the bathroom because it is easier to clean and disinfect them (with bleach) which is what i prefer for bathroom cleaning cloths.. The absorption is great! my husband watered some of my house plants we have in the kitchen and one of them was so dry that the water was coming out of the saucer at the bottom. We didn't have anything around at the time to clean the water and to prevent further damage, used one of these microfiber clothes because it was close by and it quickly absorbed all the water! We both were so pleased.. If you follow their recommendation of washing this in cold water before first use - (this is only before the first use, you can throw them in the washer after that) i soaked them in cold water for an hour, rinsed them and line dried them and that definitely helped.. I would certainly recommend this product. they are way better that the ones you get in bed bath and beyond. Don't get me wrong, they are good too but these are even better :)

I use these to wash my face, dry off my hair, and as hand towels. I feel they are the perfect size for hand drying. It's a little big for my face and a little small for my hair but I make it work! I love how soft they are and how fast these towels dry. And there are so many of them I can use them for every room and switch them out for fresh daily towels. No grime or skill cells on my towels!

review_title: and we used to have great luck with them
review_body: These bags consistently rip. I've been getting these bags for years, and we used to have great luck with them. We started getting them with our subscribe and save with amazon, and probably the past 9 months, they have been horrible. I am looking for another option. We use them for household trash, and we do not stuff them so full they should be stressed. This is with regular fill the bag in the trash bin and when you try and take it out it completely rips around the top. The handles seem useless too due to this.

I've used Glad tall kitchen bags for years - the ones with the red drawstring. That's what I thought I ordered (see the picture). I got ones with a black drawstring - now I could live with the color but the bags are not as thick. The first bag actually leaked into my trash can and made a mess. The second one broke and made...another mess. I have 178 of these bags left and I think I am going to have to double them up to ensure no more accidents. I never had this problem with Glad bags before.

Terrible product. Guaranteed Strong? How about seams coming undone and all contents spilling out? How about sweeping up some kitty litter and having it spill out of the seam? How about putting recyclables in a bag and having them burst out the side of the bag? Contacted Glad and have to give tons of info to get any satisfaction from them. I will never buy these again.. Picture posted is not a STUFFED bag ... it's about half full and ripped wide open.. Annoyed? You bet I am. Not worth using.

Glad bags suck.  They're always wrinkled to the point of disintegration, and then they always tear, or leak, or one of the ties comes off.  If I line my can with them I know I'll get crap leaking through because they're so shoddy.  AND THEY SMELL LIKE DISINFECTANT OR SOME OTHER CHEMICAL  I'm switching to biodegradable bags anyway, instead of this plastic that's polluting our planet -- at least if those bags break, I won't be suffocating dolphins for thousands of years with non-biodegradable plastic.  PEACE!  (And don't ya go buying those evil Glad bags, ya hear?)

Nearly all of the bags are defective with a weak seam and tear on the top of one side.  As soon as it comes out of the box and put into the trash can, there's a hole on the side of the bag.  On garbage day, it's impossible to tie the drawstring without creating a gaping hole on the side of the bag that allows garbage to fall out.  With the previous box, we started noticing the bags were defective but thought it was just this box.  The next box we got had the same problem again.  We notified GLAD because it seems to be a manufacturing process they need to resolve because the box says "GUARANTEED STRONG".  In the meantime, I switched to one of their competitors and no longer have to deal with defective bags.

review_title: I have been using them for years and they have always been dependable and sturdy. I can count on them to hold up ...
review_body: These are my go to kitchen trash bags.  I have been using them for years and they have always been dependable and sturdy.  I can count on them to hold up to heavy things thrown in them, like cat litter, or odd shaped items and they will stretch more than many bags before any holes occur in the bag.  I have had them so heavy, I had to drag them and they held up fine.  I have had liquid in them and they have done well.  They fit perfectly in my trash can and the draw string holds tight and works well for me to hold on to when carrying out.  They seem to have more pull to them before they rip and tear which is what I have had major problems with in my garbage bags in the past.  I will continue to buy these as long as I can.  They are excellent in my opinion.

Umm... well it'll do. But it's not extremely strong. When I fill it all up with trash, a couple holes appear almost every time.. The plastic tears from too much pressure- not unusual pressure, but from things like the corner of a tissue box digging into it from the inside. It's not the most reliable, but for me, it's much better than nothing..  I desperately need to clean, organize and throw stuff away. That's why I purchased this. It was a decent price..  I just have to be careful not to put in too much stuff or heaviness or sharper items.... These bags do the job, but aren't particularly very durable. But they ARE stronger than shopping bags, so that counts right?

review_title: I am not glad I switched to Glad!
review_body: I switched from another brand to these mainly because of the deal and price offered with this mega-pak, but I was disappointed in the quality of the bags.. 6 of the first 10 bags I used were a disaster. The seams split which resulted in using another bag to clean up the mess. After contacting Glad online I was offered a same dollar value coupon to replace these pack of bags. It must have been a bad batch. The second box I replaced these with from a local store seems to work fine.

Trash bags have two responsibilities - not be a pain in the rear to put in trashcans, and to hold trash without tearing.  You know when you pull out a bag from the box and you shake it to catch the air and "inflate" the bag so that it can be tucked into the can?  There is some alien static cling that makes this impossible.  Once you have tried and failed - you will stick your hand into the trashbag, trying to sweep it open, and you will stick your thumb or finger right through the plastic.  There is "value," and then there is "cheap."  It's worth a few more dollars to not be completely annoyed by this chore.

I've been getting these bags for a long time and they have always been great. The last box seems to be different. When I pull the drawstrings to close the bag, the whole top part of the bag rips. The drawstrings are a different color so that's why a assume the materials are different. They used to have a red drawstring. I could fill the bag up, tie it and pull it out by the drawstrings and the bag never ripped. Very frustrating!

review_title: It’s not the same Product as last time
review_body: I Have ordered this one time before it was Fine. This order it’s changed to Very Bad paper feels like sand Paper & seems to leave a film on your hands. I no longer have the box it came in . Please notify the company it’s like a bate & switch. Please give me credit so I can order Bounty . Thank you Jeannette Cupone

This is a great paper towel. After ordering this 16 roll we run out of them 6 days faster than the 24 roll. Looking now at the 24 roll it has gone up thirty dollars. Please bring back the 24 roll at a fair price (maybe 1 or 2 dollars more if needed). We can not continue to purchase at this price.

I'm in love with paper towels.  They are just so handy and I love cleaning with them.  These are very nice and strong.  I love the select-a-size because I feel much better when choosing a small piece when I don't really need a full-size piece.  I use these with my weighted paper towel holder that clicks as I pull, rip, wipe wipe wipe, sparkle.. very satisfying.

review_title: Favorite Paper Towel Choice for Decades
review_body: Brawny has been "my paper towel choice" for many many years.  The pick-a-size works great (detaches easily) and is a smart way for me to not be wasteful.  Brawny brand absorbs and stays strong.  If I use a paper-towel to dry my just washed hands, I often lay it out on the counter to re-use and once dried, it still works!

review_title: Soaking wet. Have to put on dumpster.
review_body: Soaking wet.. Have to put on dumpster.

These paper towels do a good job of absorbing. Also like that they can be torn off in smaller sizes so as to minimize waste. Our consumption of paper towels has decreased and I attribute it to the smaller towel sizes. You can break off longer sheets if needed. This has saved us money while allowing us to purchase a good quality towel.

Love these paper towels.  Been paying  extra for them, because the roll was so large (on the automatic ship).  Just got my May shipment and the towels have shrunk dramatically!  Will be canceling this, no need to pay the extra money!

review_title: These towels are really good to have and use
review_body: These towels are really good to have and use. They work also windows and mirrors. Towels sometimes do not do that any more because of the lotion in them. I like the number also that you get in one package. Very good is what I will call them.

review_title: Great Paper Towels at a Sale Price
review_body: I love these Brawny paper towels that are pick-a-size allowing the use of a half sheet. It's the only paper towel I want to use. I can't always find them in my stores and when I do, they're so expensive that I have to wait for a sale. From now on, I'll buy this quantity from Amazon a few times per year.
Like the subscribe & save competitive price that includes having it delivered.  Brawny is very competitive with an top tier Paper towel.
Big rolls of quicker picker upper towels.
Usually lasts my family a month
great value, plenty of paper towels
I send these to my daughter.

review_title: Handy, when you don't want a big towel. Holds up well.
review_body: Handy to use when you don't need a big towel.
does the job as promised
Cleans-up dog pee well
Thick & great to use. Love the half-sheet availability.
shipped quickly my son loves the select a size I don't so I bought them for him. he was happy

I ordered 16 rolls of paper towels in July and the first 8 were fine but the second eight were completely ususable.  They have lint or dust or something all over them and can't be used.  A waste of money!  Will Amazon make good on these last eight paper towels or should I send them back or what?
Who needs trees when you can have awesome throwaway plates?  So convenient.  I don't have to do the dishes anymore.
Too big, I didn't realize they were so huge. They work well, but when chicken or anything that may "sweat" is on the plate have to double the plate cuz it gets wet right through plate.
I like these plates because they are heavy duty. They have lasted me several months and still have not used all of them. They arrived on time and white package very well. Would definitely recommend.
This month I received a box of brawny paper towels instead of the paper plates. Last month we got toilet paper. Obviously the inventory is incorrect and needs to be updated.

I had this on my subscribe and save. Product always came on time and undamaged. I stopped the subscription however in an attempt to use less disposable products. Nice designs that vary from shipment to shipment. No leaks and don’t break when using a knife to cut your food.

review_title: I love thes for when someone wants to eat after mid ...
review_body: Hello, I love thes for when someone wants to eat after mid nite ,a midnite sandwich / snack, ! Or in between meals , because it makes it easier on me at clean time, later!

review_title: Perfect Disposable Dinner Plate -- Great Price!
review_body: Seriously love these paper plates (perfect dinner plate size) and they are a better price on Amazon then the wholesale box stores. What's not to love?!
Um...wrong item was delivered.  I need the plates, not toilet paper, especially a brand that I don’t use! 🙄😡🤦🏻‍♀️

These are great for basic, everyday meals. They are a little too flimsy for meals heavy with sauce though. They seem to hold up, but you can definitely feel the bottom getting wet and absorbing the sauce. Overall they work just fine for a weeknight dinner and the plate is well worth the cost.
These are great plates for the price.  Very sturdy and a good size.  We buy them for our kids to eat on so we don’t have to do as many dishes:)
good quality
I received toilet paper instead of plates
Great plates for the price!

review_title: Cute design; sturdy and deep plates
review_body: We use Dixie paper plates everyday in our household. We typically buy the smaller 9 inch plates. These plates seem much bigger at 10 1/16th inch. The plates have a cute multi-colored triangle design on them. I honestly don't care about the design so much as the functionality of the plates. The plates are nice and deep and they are thick. They will hold a decent amount of food and you don't have to worry about a little juice or liquid leaking through. I have even cut a quick cucumber or hot dog on them (not really recommended if you are cutting more than a few slices though).. This listing is for 220 paper plates. This is a lot of paper plates and the box they come in will be a little heavy. I personally, love to buy a lot and have them in the house. Since we use mostly paper plates, it is always aggravating when you realize you just used your last one and don't have back up. These plates will last our family for a few months.. These are good paper plates and they are great for parties where you already have enough of a mess to clean up without having to wash plates too. However, I still like the 9 inch plates better. The 9 inch plates feel a little more sturdy in my hand. They also help with portion control. When you have a huge plate, you feel obligated to fill it up more. I would recommend these plates if you like larger plates.

review_title: Thicker and stronger than the store brand paper plates I usually buy
review_body: These 10 1/16" Everyday Paper Plates from Dixie really are thicker and stronger than the store brand paper plates I usually buy.. You get 220 paper plates in the box and they are in 5, separately wrapped, packages of 44 plates.. I usually buy the smaller size plates as a nod to portion control but this 10" plate is better for cook outs or when we have chips with our supper because it holds a good bit of food. They are deep enough to keep food from easily falling off the sides when walking with your plate. Dixie says they are five layers thick and they definitely feel thicker than the cheap plates I usually buy. They aren't as thick as say Chinet, but they are plenty thick enough for ordinary meals that don't require using a steak knife.. They have an interesting, colorful, diamond pattern printed on each plate. Not my favorite but it's OK and after all, you throw them away.. We don't use paper plates all the time but with teens and older kids who work odd shifts, we use a lot of them. I like these.

review_title: High, curved sides give me a sense of security
review_body: These Dixie plates are deeper than I expected, which is a good thing.  If you've got anything with a sauce, or is a little watery, this plate will definitely hold it.  Gives me a sense of security that its going to make it across my new outdoor rugs without a spill!  Plus there is a nice, wide, curved lip that created a very natural grip for a hand to hold.. NOTE:  The accent color is more ORANGE than red.  It's hard to see in the pictures.  This color will NOT match the red in your red/white/blue color scheme for July 4th.  But it will match your blue/orange color scheme for U of I Illini games!

review_title: Strong, attractive and microwavable disposable dinner plates
review_body: This is a pack of 220 paper plates.  These are very strong and don't bend under the weight of food.  They also do not soak through if something wet is on them.  The most amazing thing, and the one thing that has me sold on these the most, is that they are microwavable.  So many times I want to use a paper plate for something but it needs heating in a microwave, which means transferring the food from a bowl or another dish to a paper plate, which defeats the whole purpose of using a paper plate.. I also notice these are the same size as a standard dinner plate, unlike most other paper plates I've purchased lately.  These also have an attractive design on them.  These are a true substitute for a standard real dinner plate except you can throw these away when your finished using them.  For all these reasons I'm going to be purchasing these from now on, if they are available.

Dixie plates are a staple at back yard cookouts, parties and for easy quick meal where you don't feel like doing the dishes.  These plates are sturdy and won't easily bend or have liquid seep through.  The design is exclusive to Amazon and the diamonds on the side envoke a cool mid century modern vibe.  Since they are placed mainly on the side, they still stand out even with food on the plate.

If your family is also fond of summer BBQs, this is a great deal. It works out to about $0.09 per plate--well worth it! The plates are sturdy (way better than that flimsy styrofoam from back in the day) and large enough to fit a burger and a couple sides. They're also microwavable. Great product at great price, and a staple of my summertime pantry!

These are pretty standard paper plates. Well, standard for the good-quality ones. These are not the flopping cheapo plates that you take two of just to avoid them collapsing. But they aren't the super thick ones either. These are middle of the road, but good quality. No issues with wet foods soaking through, or making them flop. Recommended

I agree with the other reviewers! What on Earth is up with these towels? Forget one-handed use. It takes very careful and meticulous work to get each sheet loose from the roll. Once it’s loose, it tears in the most random place and you end up with wads of tiny paper. Also the lint is pretty annoying. I don’t like paper towels that are super loose either but the degree that these are stuck so tight almost seems like a smart-alek response to customers’ need for a tighter roll. Lol!

review_title: Terrible towels - very hard to pull off roll - yes really...
review_body: Had to write this review as we're still working on this roll of paper towels and have mixed several other purchased cases of different brands in between..... because these are so hard to use. The towels are very hard to pull off the roll. So much so that you have to take them down and use two hands to pull them from themselves. For a lack of a better word they are "sticky" and don't roll without tearing.  Total cheap garbage towels. Will never buy them again.

review_title: Not bad overall, but not for me
review_body: Let me first say that as paper towels go, these are very durable and absorbent.  And they do the job quite well.  My issue with them is using them in a countertop towel dispenser, which is very difficult.  The problem is that the towels stick to themselves and are very difficult to unwind.  Even when manually unwinding the next towel from the roll I would often tear the towel in the process.  It was that "stuck" to the roll.
