I am very pleased with this mattress protector. The sides are deep, so that it easily covers the sides of the mattress with the elastic band ending up underneath the mattress. The plastic sheet that makes it waterproof is covered by a fabric that feels sort of like a thin terry cloth, which means I can put the sheet directly on top, unlike a plastic mattress cover that I always cover with a regular fabric mattress cover because I hate the feel of the plastic right under the sheet.. One of our pets had an "accident" while sleeping on the bed this mattress protector was on. The mattress was completely protected, with all the wet being contained in the bedding and mattress protector. The mattress protector washed up well (be careful drying, low temps only) with no leftover stains or odor.. I am very satisfied with this product and highly recommend it.

review_title: Have had one on each of my children's beds for over a year and we're still happy with them!
review_body: Purchased two of these (about three months apart) and love them both.  They're not uncomfortable or loud, I wouldn't even know they were there if I hadn't put them on myself.  They're on a 9 year old's bed and a toddler's bed and neither one have had any accidents on them (yay!) so I can't speak for how they'll hold up in that situation, but I absolutely believe they'll work as expected!

review_title: Great purchase with an awesome warranty.
review_body: This mattress protector is very comfy and doesn't make any annoying plastic scrunchy sounds when you climb into bed. I got it for my toddler who is constantly wetting the bed lately. Works perfectly. It's a bit of a hassle to have to wash it everytime he pees the bed but I have to wash the sheets anyway so it isn't too much trouble. I do recommend buying two of these so you will always have a fresh one on hand. Heck, I may get a third because sometimes the toddler has accidents on my bed too! Definitely worth the price, especially the awesome warranty.

review_title: Extremely soft and no plastic feel
review_body: We recently decided to purchase a new mattress and wanted to ensure that it was adequately protected from our young children, in the event there was an "accident".  After a lot of research and reading reviews I opted for the SafeRest as nearly every review commented on how soft it was and the fact there wasn't a "plastic" feel.  I can confirm that this is definitely the case, it is extremely soft and there is no crunchy or unpleasant plastic feeling.  I can't comment how well it protects yet but after washing it I did notice that it did trap water in it, making me feel more comfortable with the level of protection it can provide.  Hopefully we don't need to truly put it to the test, but if we do I feel confident it will protect our mattress.

review_title: but I'm sure it'll be fine. The real measure of comfort is the kind ...
review_body: It says vinyl free, but some of the fabric does have that wind-repellant-like material. It reminds me of a pair of Adidas sport joggers I used to wear when I was in middle school. The cotton fabric on top (terry material) is really thin. I'll probably use this as a base, and then I'll be putting another sheet on top for warmth and protection. I'm not sure about the comfort yet, but I'm sure it'll be fine. The real measure of comfort is the kind of mattress you sleep on. Color and packaging are as expected.

These mattress protectors are amazing!! I literally have multiple for each and every bed in my house. I have three kids (seven, five and three) and let me just say that having these protectors have saved me a TON of time and money trying to clean urine and its atrocious smell out of their mattresses!!! Night time training is no joke, and being able to just pull these protectors off and throw them in the wash is amazing!! They are completley urine proof (tested every night by my five year olds stubborn bladder). The mattress does not get wet or have any kind of smell. My family has been using these for a year now, so trust me when I say these are totally awesome and worth every penny! Must buy, even if you don't have kids... I use them for my bed as well!

Two days after putting this on the bed, I got a full body rash and hives and welts. After going to the doctor twice and getting steroids, nothing worked. Then I read some of the reviews on here searching for hives and allergy and itching and discovered several other people who have experienced the same. There is some kind of chemical on here that is very damaging and toxic. I am sure not all shipments are defective, but I would say be extremely cautious about buying this product. I have contacted Amazon about removing this listing and will be contacting the company directly as well. Not okay. DO NOT BUY.. In addition, it’s loud as hell, crinkly, and makes your bed less comfortable. Relatively water resistant.

review_title: I suffer from bad allergies so I try to protect myself anyway I ...
review_body: I suffer from bad allergies so I try to protect myself anyway I can.  I had a mattress protector but felt it wasn't doing what it should.  I tried this one and can tell a difference when I wake up in the morning.  It's very comfortable too.  Just know it isn't one that zips the mattress up completely inside. Rather in sits on the mattress like a sheet would.  However, I bought them for my mattress and box springs and I could tell it made a difference immediately. Will buy for my other beds.

review_title: One of those buys you can feel good about
review_body: While we weren't so concerned about water protection, it certainly doesn't hurt.  After all, we were putting this on a new mattress.  We did want something hypoallergenic so that was a good selling point too... along with the good reviews.  Turns out to be an even better product that we'd hoped for... it's generously sized so that it easily fits around the mattress without having to get into some weird contortions trying to pull and tuck simultaneously.  While amply sized, it doesn't sag or bunch.  Best of all, it folds up into a much smaller bundle compared to our old mattress pads that were always a challenge to wash, dry, fold and store.  While well made, durable (so far) and soft... it's compact compared to some of the older pads.  We were impressed enough to buy two more!  Delivery was fast and packaging was good.

review_title: Definitely keeps pee off the bed!!
review_body: We're potty training our child and he has accidents still in the middle of the night. This is a picture of the mattress after my son had an accident on the bed on top of the mattress protector!! It was completely dry and clean still. No pee stains! This mattress protector works! And it was so easy to clean too in the washer :) Definitely buying it for ALL of my beds now.
Smells like dryer sheets, hard to tear, clingy, never going to use again.
me agrada mucho el producto tiene una maravillosa absorcion
Love these! Even better when a coupon is available!
Study and works well
These were very soft and didn't do a great job scrubbing.
Paper towels are very durable. Almost feel like cloth.
Best paper towels ever.  But just wish it was less pricey. :(
These are so much more absorbent and versatile than most other brands.

review_title: I hate these WEIRD paper towels
review_body: When I got these towels the I noticed how small the rolls were. Weird! Then the feel was equally as weird. They stick to themselves (hard to unroll), they stick on my calloused fingers. They are just so weird! I thought I needed to give time to adjust to their weirdness. But no, I hate them more every day and every time I open cabinet to see how many months before I can use them up and get normal paper towels. I have decided to donate them. Problem solved, money lost. I did not imagine a paper towel could be like these or I would have never ordered from Amazon in bulk. If you are thinking to order these paper towels you may want to find them somewhere and buy one roll to try.  Maybe you will find them wonderful....I find them weird and annoying.
Great deal and free shipping

review_title: Great product but disappointing customer service!
review_body: Yes like everyone else I went by the reviews and ordered this item. It was great when I started using it. We are an indian family and you know how much we like eating rice :) I actually recommended it to lot of my friends and 3-4 of them bought it as well. Happy times ended soon!. It only lasted for few months :( I started getting C6 error on the panel and it stopped working. I made several attempts to call customer service. And to my surprise there is no response or even acknowledgement! wow how can a great company which built such a good product have a horrible support ? I mean if you dont even care about customers who genuinely bought your product ...then please clearly call it out on your packaging!. we dont want to buy your products anymore if you are not standing by it as per the gaurantee! I hope some from support looks at this and makes an attempt to reach out!

So very sad to write this review. I originally had given this item 5 stars because when it worked, it was amazing. However, it broke after 6 weeks of use. Emailed the company and they gave us instructions to take it apart to fix a wiring issue. Fixed the issue for 2 uses then broke again. My husband has done this twice now. Seriously so sad. Not a good investment.

So I opened my new instant pot, super excited to try it out, unfortunately, it was clearly not new. It smelled like food had scrub marks, watermarks, and the utensil unfortunately, it was clearly not new. It smelled like food had scrub marks, watermarks,  and the accessories were in a beat up Ziploc bag. I am so disappointed!  I can't believe they felt like this was acceptable  :-(

Over the years, I have purchased hundreds of items from Amazon, and for the most part, got what I expected.  I never reviewed any of them.  But from the moment I received my Instant Pot, I felt that I had purchased something that not only exceeded my expectations, but will make my life easier (and more delicious)!. I am a holistic nutritionist and a follower of a lower carb/paleo/primal lifestyle (and yes, it is not only a food regimen, but a lifestyle).  Many of the meals I prepare require advance planning and preparation, and I am OK with that, realizing that it is an investment in my family's health and wellbeing.  I was looking for something that would support my food choices and perhaps make it a little less time-consuming.  I have used a crockpot extensively over the past years and while I appreciate the ease of use and the ability to put a meal on the table soon after I got home in the evening, there is that "everything tastes the same" factor I was running into with my family.. So I began thinking about ways to cook my meals faster and realized that a pressure cooker may be the answer.  But, I am scared of pressure cookers.  Even though my head tells me that people have been using them for many years with no problems, my heart said there was a strong chance I could blow up the entire kitchen, myself included.  I had no idea there were electric, programmable pressure cookers out there that would virtually eliminate that worry until I began researching them, first on Amazon, and then on other websites.  I eventually purchased the Instant Pot over the others because of the stainless steel insert (no aluminum), the size of the pot (I wanted a larger capacity), and the ease of use.. The day it arrived, I plugged it in and began reading the manual.  The manual was very helpful, even included a suggested trial run to familiarize one with the basics.  My first meal was potato soup (I know potatoes are not low carb or paleo, but once in a while you gotta have potato soup).  I was amazed at how easy and delicious it was to make this soup that would normally take a couple of hours.  I just coarsely chopped the vegetables, threw those in the pot, added the seasonings and the liquid, started the pressure cooker option, and in 20 minutes all I had to do was use my immersion blender to puree the soup, add some cheese, stir and it was ready to eat.  AND the soup was every bit as good as my slower version that keeps me tied to the kitchen to stir and monitor until it's done.  That is the hidden beauty of this appliance, that while it's cooking your food, you are free to do other things such as harass your kids to get their homework done.  No more watching over a pot!. My second recipe was lemon pepper chicken wings.  There is a searing option, so first I browned the wings in a bit of butter, then added lemon pepper, salt, and 2 more tablespoons of butter.  Put on the lid, set the pressure cooker for 25 minutes, and out came the most delicious, fall-of-the-bone wings just loaded with flavor.  The family went wild!. I also made mushroom gravy (no flour) pork chops in 30 minutes in the pressure cooker - the gravy was so good my son ate in on top of some gluten free noodles the next day for lunch - and a breakfast meat loaf in the slow cooker, also a winner.. I am also using this to reheat food since we don't use the microwave anymore and I'm finding that it seems easier and makes less of a mess than going stovetop.. That's a pretty long review for a first-timer but I am so enthusiastic about this product that I just had to share.
Bought it on Jun 01, 2016 , and now it is dead. The reason I purchased this one is because the previous one I got is dead only a little over 12month. Very bad quality.

It worked for about 2 weeks.  Then weird things started happening and I kept thinking I did something wrong because sometimes it worked and sometimes it did not.  Well here we are 7 months later and I now accept I do not trust this pot.  This was a bad purchase and now I am stuck with something that doesn't work and I do not trust.  I can not even begin to tell you how many meals this ruined before I finally have given up.  I bought this at around $75 and now they cost over $100.  There is no way I would buy this at $100.  I can not recommend that anyone purchase this.  I would rate this a do not buy.

review_title: Didn't Realize How Much I Needed the Mini !!
review_body: I've been using the 6 qt IP, but always had way too much food left over.  I bought the 3 qt mini for use in our camping trailer.  However, I ended up dragging it home and using it there.  It's a perfect size for just the wife and myself.  Things have gotten to the point that my wife says, "I don't want to cook.  Pull out the little pot (IP mini) and make dinner (spaghetti, soup, whatever)."  My fault for becoming proficient with the use of the Instant Pots.  When we have company to dinner, I use the 6 qt. IP.  I love it!  Just had to order a stainless 3 qt. liner pot for it (with a silicon lid) in case I need to put something in it in the refrigerator ... or use it to cook something separately.

review_title: Works Well but May Arrive Defective.
review_body: I received the Instant Pot (8Qt) as a birthday gift and really only used it to cook rice in bulk (it does a wonderful job). Recently I decided to try cooking beans in there, to discover that the Pot has a defective option for beans. Fortunately it is covered by a one year warranty, unfortunately that means I have to deal with their less than stellar customer service and I am currently still stuck with the effective product. All in all, the product works well when it works. If you purchase their product make sure the first thing you do is go through and try every option on the product, it would be unfortunate to discover a defect once the warranty has expired. (Also I apologize for filming in the vertical position, I figured their would be dead space if I recorded in the landscape position).

Update: On Prime Day of July 2016, I bought another one of these pressure cookers. So many times I have been in the middle of cooking and thought, boy would I really like another cooker! It got cumbersome pretty quickly having to empty the contents of one meal, cleaning the cooker, and then starting with another recipe for a side dish. Just thought I would update so that everyone knows how seriously awesome this machine is..  Background of my cooking experience: I received this when I was 23 years old last Christmas. I had this pressure cooker on my wishlist for almost a year because I couldn't afford or justify spending that much money on myself, especially because I did not know how well this would work out for me. I didn't start cooking until I was on my own in an apartment during college. About 6 years ago when my boyfriend would drive up to visit for the weekend, I realized I didn't know how to cook, and it was embarrassing. I made a great breakfast sandwich and a colorful salad for a couple more years before I took a dive into "real" cooking. For the next few years or so, my boyfriend would become my guinea pig for all the various, horrible meals I cooked, all so I could get more experience in the kitchen. Even though we're not together anymore, I like to think it wasn't because of what I put him through. I still wasn't as great at cooking as I wanted to be. That's where the pressure cooker came into play.. My mom bought me the cooker, the 6 quart size. She bought me a cookbook to go with it, the "Electric Pressure Cooker: 365 Quick & Easy, One Pot, Pressure Cooker Recipes For Easy Meals." This book is ESSENTIAL to go with this cooker. A necessity. You hear me? ESSENTIAL. This is because the "recipe book" that goes with it is not good, and I haven't used it at all. You, the reader, deserve a REAL cookbook. If you're already splurging on this pressure cooker, you might as well make the purchase worth it by buying the cookbook too. However, some of the add-ons from the pressure cooker actually include helpful information about how long/what settings to use on certain kinds of foods. I have used that. It also lists in detail what kinds of foods the settings are used for.. This is now the end of June and I can honestly say that I have used this pressure cooker weekly, multiple times a week sometimes, and even daily (depending on my schedule). Thanks to the cookbook listed above, cooking blogs, and Pinterest, I have made some AMAZING, delicious, and FAST recipes out of this thing. I am continually amazed by this machine. This has made cooking so much easier, faster, and a lot more fun for me, so that I no longer feel like all that I do once I get home from work is slave over cooking for my household.. This is not to say that the pressure cooker is completely intuitive. You will probably need to read the manual to learn about the different functions and settings. This is a complex cooker, and in order to take full advantage of the many things this baby can do, you should read the manual. Just look at it, will ya.. Some of the few things I have made with this pressure cooker is honey BBQ wings for game nights (fall-off-the-bone wings that were finished in the broiler), BBQ bacon meatloaf (my fiance's favorite recipe, says it is better than his mom's-- take THAT, Kathy), sausage and cheese soup (tastes like the flavors have been cooking all day when in actuality it's just TEN, yes you read correctly, ten minutes), cheesy garlic potatoes, couscous, quinoa, salmon, baked potatoes, pan-seared porkchops (perfection in this thing!), bacon, pork taquitos, meatballs, risotto, Italian Zuppa Toscana soup, baked beans (and not from the can), casseroles, chowder, Hawaiian BBQ chicken, and more. This one device has allowed me to feel like a master chef that delivers exquisite meals. All of the recipes are cooked straight in the pressure cooker, because it has so many different settings like saute, brown, simmer, etc. This helps tremendously when it is time to clean up. A one-pot cooking monster machine.. Some helpful tips: The pressure cooker has to warm up / preheat when you set it to cook something. As you will find out when you read the manual, actually setting the timer will delay your preheating from starting by however long you set the timer (can be useful in cases when you have other things cooking and want them to be finished at the same time). To start your pressure cooker, you need to hit the "manual" button (this is what I use no matter what I cook), adjust your pressure with the "adjust" button (also used when you click the "saute/browning" button-- adjusting the pressure for the saute function is the difference between "sauteing/browning" [normal], "thickening" ["less" mode], "stir-frying" ["high" mode], and "simmering" ["less" mode]), and then waiting for the confirmation beep that will happen after you are done adjusting your settings. Be sure to close the steam release valve when you are cooking with the pressure cooker. This can be done by turning the steam release up. To do a "quick release" after your countdown is done, turn off the cooker and release the pressure by turning the steam release down (be careful not to hover your hand over this part as the steam will shoot out). You will know when it is safe to open the lid when the silver float valve drops, and actually, you will be literally unable to open it before it drops. When it comes to safety, and basically everything else, this pressure cooker is not the pressure cooker your grandma used. When I am doing a "slow release" of pressure, I of course first down off the cooker and then place a cold wash rag on top of my cooker until the float valve drops. It is normal to sometimes see puffs of steam come out of your cooker while it is cooking something. Also, my mom didnt notice the "off" button on the bottom right for a while, so whenever she had to switch between functions she would literally unplug the cooker and then plug it back in. This is not necessary.. The only thing I haven't tried making in this is yogurt, but I plan to make it some day and will update this review afterwards.. Clean-up is so easy. Take out the pot and let it soak for a while. Trust me, when you let your cooker soak for a day, the crusts and stains of food will come right up with a little elbow grease. Be sure to clean the lid and take out the transparent rubbery part from the inside of the lid. Don't forget to clean the outside of the cooker either, as food can sometimes get stuck in the lip of the cooker.. After raving about this cooker to my mom, she bought one for herself, and we share recipes and knowledge about how to use the cooker with each other. It's a fun thing we get to bond about. I've actually convinced some co-workers to get one too, in particular one co-worker who is a caretaker for a disabled family member. She told me that cooking for him and her own immediate family was exhausting, especially because, in cases where he is on his own, using the stove or oven is too dangerous for him. When you're able to throw ingredients for a soup into the pressure cooker, and 10 minutes later (not counting pre-heat time) you have a delicious soup for days, it can really take off some of that pressure for some people.. Some other things that I like about the pressure cooker is that these recipes do not require a lot of ingredients, and you will probably have most of them stocked in your kitchen already.. The only drawback that I have experienced is it is not very intuitive if you have not used it before. But the userguide is helpful, and if you have any questions, you can comment and let me know!. I've included some pictures. A go-to easy recipe for potlucks that everybody loves is: 1 cup of water, a bag of frozen fully cooked meatballs on the steamer basket and cook those for five minutes. Use a quick release and remove meatballs. Discard cooking water. Add 18 oz of BBQ sauce, 18 oz. of grape jelly, and stir frequently on tge "saute" setting until combined into a sauce. Add your meatballs back in and change the settings to "keep warm." Voila. Sweet BBQ meatballs.. Pictures added show the bbq honey wings I made in the pressure cooker and then finished in the broiler. Other photo is bbq bacon meatloaf made in the cooker and then finished in the broiler. Last, the most amazing beef enchiladas--I cooked a 3 lb beef chuck roast in the pressure cooker and then rolled up the tortillas and finished in the oven. The last two pictures are from recipes found in the cookbook I listed. Happy cooking, everyone!

Piece of JUNK- lasted 60 days and  cooked 4 meals and then it wont come up to pressure. Tried everything, all it did was ruin a lasagna.. When it did work (the 4 times) it was great. I only used the manual settings. So my meals cost me 31 bucks each and the 'not so instant unreliable pot goes in the trash.. Seriously, buy something else.. 1 year warranty is useless. You pay for shipping both ways to Canada and back.
Arrived on time. Glad I read about the right size pilliw for cover. Also the email regarding about putting it in cover. Fits perfectly.

review_title: great quality, lots of fill and fluff
review_body: great quality, lots of fill and fluff, fit my cover perfectly corner to corner and they are both the same size 26 x 26
perfect for throw pillows! They're comfy to lay on too.
This pillow is not 18x18 as the description says.  It’s rectangular, not square.
Super fast shipment. The pillow inserts fit perfectly into the covers. Good quality product. Would and have made another purchase.
perfect.... and super fast delivery.

review_title: Kind of flimsy but you get what you paid for
review_body: Not high quality but served it's purpose just fine. I needed accent pillows for my bed and these are the perfect size. I didn't need a full, fluffy pillow since these are just for show.
This works great for an 18x18 throw pillow cover that I purchased for my mom

review_title: comfortable by itself, with a case.
review_body: Does very well for a pillow for the truck, when you want to take a nap.
Quick delivery - super soft and comfy - love it.
So handy for one or two items of clothing before you leave the house!  When full, it will easily steam at least 2-3 items before running out of water. Wayyy more convenient than ironing.

review_title: Great results, but small water reservoir means best used as travel steamer.
review_body: Works well, but know it’s best used as a travel steamer. Small water amount means you’ll have to keep refilling if you’re item is fairly wrinkled. GREAT on khaki pants.

review_title: Like it, but didn't love it!
review_body: I'm kind of disappointed with this product.  I really wanted to love it! I love how it's small, easy to travel with. I saw no difference when I was ironing my husband's shirts. I threw away the box and want to return it!
Great Steamer and I highly recommend this steamer great for steaming curtains and clothing as well.
This spits water everywhere. When steaming clothes it soaks the clothes
Awesome, works as good and better than the big systems. It can get into small areas. 👍🏼

review_title: Great product! The size is perfect for travel
review_body: Great product! The size is perfect for travel. Heats up quickly. I can steam one dress about knee length without refilling.
This is a great little steamer! It is small and compact. It is great for travel. It does have to be refilled for each garment but its perfect for what I need!

review_title: It worked alright, but I realized I really want ...
review_body: It worked alright, but I realized I really want a bigger one, that will do more clothes before I have to fill it with water again.  I don't need this for travel, so I'm going to purchase a bigger one for home.

review_title: Overall not a bad buy but I was looking for something more powerful
review_body: This steamer is small and convenient but it doesn’t steam very well. You have to go over your garment a number of times before the wrinkles come out. Overall not a bad buy but I was looking for something more powerful.

review_title: They looked fantastic and weathered well
review_body: Used these on the outside of our home for the holidays.  They looked fantastic and weathered well.  They are also very light-weight making them easy to mount.  Just make sure to keep them untangled.
I love these lights! They came in great condition and work very well and is also priced appropriately. It’s perfect use for backdrops/DIY Arcs/outdoor lighting/etc.. DO NOT REMOVE THE ZIP TIES!

Perfect for some ambiance around what will eventually be a kitchen table (that’s my desk in the picture). One light isn’t working but there’s so many it’s not noticeable. I may buy another for my bedroom.

These lights provide great warm light that’s perfect for the holidays or even just as an accent wall. No noticeable power usage after running them almost 24/7 for a month.. FYI once these stretch out they will cover a huge area. May want extra clips and/or tape handy if you’re picky about the final product.
So finally got them ! They tangled so bad like as soon as u set them down it's a huge freakin headache and! It's a short in them I thought they where all broke

I absolutely love these lights in my room. They have a very calming effect and you can choose from different patterns as to how the lights twinkle. They’re a little bigger than I thought ( will not fit on a regular size window more like a patio door)

Originally received the wrong lights (that gave off a blue color), but customer service was responsive and quickly sent me the warm colored lights for free! They are so pretty, and the different twinkling features are very cool. Now I have a pinterest-worthy reading nook!
Love these lights so much!  They are so cool. Got them for my daughters room and she just loves all the settings. She calls them her princess lights. Great price too.

Better than expected!!!! We used these for our GLOW Training Camp for kids and boy did they glow.  They were perfect! I loved the different light features. We used the twinkle. Would definitely purchase again. Also, the command hooks hung them beautifully and didn't leave any residue on the walls.

review_title: Easy to hang, beautiful to see lights.
review_body: Was so pleased with the lights that I bought them twice. Easy to plug one group into the other and it increased the pop of the curtain of light. Now outdoor barbeques can last into the evening.

review_title: I usually have problems with them tearing at the grommets so I was glad to find one with no rust metal one
review_body: I haven't had it up long but the show curtain liner was as expected. I usually have problems with them tearing at the grommets so I was glad to find one with no rust metal one. Good quality, hangs nicely.

Have only been using a few days so I don't know about the antibacterial aspect, but I do have high hopes that it will not mold.  I love that there was no smell upon opening the package and I like the clarity through the curtain which allows light to pass through it and my decorative fabric curtain. It's light so I'm glad it's weighted at bottom. Those might be magnets but my tub is plastic.

Very nice, lightweight shower curtain.  So far so good.  It stays in place, is easy to wipe clean and dries quickly.  There's no odor at all.  I hope it stays free of mildew or mold for a long time, and if it doesn't I'll be back to edit my review.
This is a thick shower curtain with magnets at the bottom seam to keep it weighted down. Great quality, especially for the price. Have had it a few months and no mildew. Will buy again!

this curtain really is anti-bacterial.  I had been changing out my shower curtain quarterly.....not since I purchased this one! It's easy to care for, magnets stick the curtain to the tub and not me. I would recommend this to anyone with a microbiology background!

The liner is a bit thicker and heavier than other, but one of the betters ones that I have used. The liner does not cling to you and easily holds position when placed where you would like it. One of the biggest positives is that it dries really well compared to others that I have used. I've only been using it for a short time but don't have any gripes as of yet.

This is a thick shower curtain.  It doesn’t smell like chemicals upon opening.  However, it is plastic.  I may have missed this in the description, but it is loud, and falls off my shower hooks so easily.  I would’ve preferred a rubbery material.  It’ll do, but I won’t buy it again.
I have been dealing w many previous shower curtains w molds growing. This one is perfect and i layer this with another fabric curtain outside
Cheap and lightweight. Doesn’t hang well. You get what you pay for I guess.

at first i was worried because it seems very light weight compared to our last liner from home depot. after hanging it and having it for about two weeks, i am very satisfied! very clean looking and no smell. (personally, i like the new shower curtain smell but i guess its bad for you.) i am a little concerned with the extra plastic around the magnetic weights. they seem like they will get slimey quickly but only time will tell.

It did great until my wife dropped a hairbrush on it & it shattered into a gazillion pieces all over the bathroom. Why they made a scale out of glass I'll never know, worse yet, why I bought a glass scale I'll never know.. UPDATE: Customer service contacted me about my review & refunded my money due to this issue. I raised my star rating based on the exceptional customer service. Thank you!

EDIT: I read a review on another scale about how to calibrate a scale like this. Decided to try it and it works perfectly now! To do this, press the scale until the screen says 0. Leave it alone until the screen goes blank. Repeat two more times. Now try! It should work!. (Old review) Despite being on a flat hard surface, this scale has weighed me drastically different weights within seconds of each other. Like 155, 144, 159, etc. I was weighed a week ago at 147 on a different scale, so it’s not even close. Will be returning, hope this was a one time defective one, but I won’t be re-buying to find out.

review_title: Just buy a name brand one
review_body: It sure if faulty or just a bad product. Hasn’t worked since taking it out the box. It’s just been sitting in the corner of my bathroom ever since. Step lightly then wait for it to read zero. Step on and it gives me an “err”. Then I step off. It turns off and then back on and shows a random weight for a few second.. S. And continues to shut off and on again unless I take out the batteries. 🤷‍♂️

review_title: Follows the malfunctioning trend of just about every other digital scale these days
review_body: Follows the malfunctioning trend of just about every other digital scale these days.. Works great for the first 5-10 uses. Then starts showing absolutely bizarre results.. Wish there was some workaround, but no matter what I try, it just continues showing strange results.

My old scale broke, so I was looking for a simple digital scale. I love the price, which is quite reasonable! The scale came with batteries, which was an unexpected bonus. The scale is quite easy to use and offers precise measurements. I would definitely buy the Etekcity Digital Body Weight Bathroom Scale again!

We have had the scale for some time now.  The product works as it should and looks very nice.  The scale feels sturdy under foot so there is a more accurate reading.  The display is large enough I don't have to put on my glasses and is quick so there is no waiting.  Even though it is in our basement bathroom, it has not suffered from rusting that other scales we've tried did.  It is still in perfect condition, even though I am a large person.. If you want any critical feedback, it would be you should make the corners rounded in the next model for people like me that tend to knock our toes on everything.

I just received my scale , I would think the time to do a review is at least a month or two I put the battery in I weighed myself I'm not the type to weight in weekly or daily. It's cute and small enough to slide under my space saver and not be in public to view.

Ridiculous. I've used it maybe once a month or so for seven months. Recently I decided to drop a few pounds, so I've started checking it more frequently. This thing just spits out broad approximations. In the last 90 seconds I've gained four pounds, lost two, then gained three back. I really have no idea what my actual weight has been all year. Time for another scale.

review_title: Excellent product from top to bottom.
review_body: Hadn't bought bathroom scales in 20+ years, so we were way overdue.  Did our research, decided on this Etekcity, ordered it off Amazon. It came in, we unpackaged it, set it up and, bam, there it was: totally awesome, clear and distinct numbers and registered perfect weight in seconds. Moreover, both my wife and I were concerned that the footprint would be a little too small for us - I am 6' and weight a little over 200 lbs, and my wife is 5'7" and weren't sure if it was going to be too "square" instead of the rectangle of our old analogue.  Don't worry, it's totally perfect.. I appreciate excellent craftsmanship, excellent service, and excellent products (especially nowadays). Buy this dog. You won't regret it.

review_title: Consistent, accurate, and easy to read.
review_body: I like this scale better than others I have had.  This was the least expensive of the ones I've purchased.  I tested it's consistency by getting on and off several times in a short period.  It alway reported the same weight.  It gave the same weight as on my doctor's office's scale during an hour period.  I have old eyes and the numbers are very easy to read without having to move around to see them.  It was easy to get it started.  It's attractive, lightweight, and my bi-fold linen closet door moves easily over it.
They work just fine.  Tough enough to scrub.
i'm vary happy good quality

DO NOT BUY THESE BAGS! GLAD bags are all we will ever buy, but we have NEVER had this problem! EVERY BAG RIPS DOWN THE SIDE UPON OPENING! There is no durability what-so-ever! Literally can't even use this bag for tissue paper let alone everyday household trash! I have no clue how these are rated 4.5 stars! Are they knock offs? Idk?! The scent isn't the greatest either...feels like my nose hairs are burning. I will be buying GLAD trash bags from the store from now on...I knew the price was too good to be true!

These last me FOREVER, and the light febreze scent is kind of nice when you take out a few days worth of food scraps and expect a nice nasty smell. The bags havn't ripped open on me yet when stuffing them. Will keep buying this particular Glad trash bag in the future

These bags have WAY too much scent in them. You can’t use them for anything besides the garbage can because of the intense smell. I was going to bring them in my luggage on vacation for dirty clothes, but everything in my luggage would have smelled like these bags. Yuck!  Plus the don’t stay up in my garbage can. They keep falling down and I haven’t had that problem with quality bags before.

review_title: These actually smell really nice when you first put them in which is great ...
review_body: These actually smell really nice when you first put them in which is great because you likely just pulled out some rotten bag to take out. These hold alot, I have pushed the limits of shoving down garbage and never broken a bag due to my laziness. We are a typical family so I expect 110 garbage bags to last quite awhile. Fits a standard kitchen type garbage can and tie closed.

review_title: Makes even an empty trash can smell. No thanks.
review_body: These bags work and everything, but "odorshield" is a bit of a stretch. The shielding is done by applying what is supposed to be a masking smell but has the effect of making even a clean and empty bag give off a way to pungent odor. If I wanted to smell my trash bag I'd throw away something from the fridge. Will NOT be buying these again.

review_title: I have no problem with Glad trash bags
review_body: I have no problem with Glad trash bags.  Glad is my favorite brand.  AND I kinda like the “scented” ones.  BUT….. No matter the brand, no matter how sweet it smells, when it comes to trash bags it’s the STRENTH that counts.. NOTE TO GLAD: When we users are carrying a bag full of garbage down a flight of stairs or two, along a walkway, and across a parking lot to the dumpster we don’t care how nicely scented that new bag smelled.  Rather, we want a STRONG bag that won’t break (spilling garbage and cat litter!) half-way through our journey.. NOTE TO SELF: Never, ever again buy trash bags based on their cutsie fragrance.

The smell is horrific. I can’t stand the fake chemical Febreeze odor that fills up my entire kitchen. The bags are regular glad bags and work well. Nonetheless I cannot get past the terrible smell that lingers with the trash and makes it all much worse.

review_title: But it's surprisingly good and satisfying
review_body: I didn't think that I would pay extra money for a trash bag that has some fragrance. But it's surprisingly good and satisfying! I like I smell something nice whenever I throw something in the trash can. Probably will buy them again.

I always buy just the cheapest trash bag. You know, it's a trash bag, you throw it any way, so why fancy one?. I bought this one and I love it. Now i understand why i cannot just pick the cheapest one. Better quality trash bag make you life easier. No need to worry of tear,spill. This is strong trash bag and it's GOOD!!

They smell pleasant and the price is good for two big rolls. only complaint is that a few bags have torn at the top after being tied but really it could have been how heavy it all was so I can't knock the bags.
cheaper that in the store. great buy.

Glad Tall Kitchen bags do the trick.  The Drawstring is a must for me as it serves as a nice handle when taking out the trash.  I live on the 4th floor of my building and take the stairs when taking out the trash so having a nice handle serves a great purpose!

I buy these monthly because it saves me time and money going to super centers. They’re strong and absorbent and not at all thin. You can use these to wipe your dogs paws too without irritation.

Great bottle, still looks brand new but about a month after using it a smell developed and i can't seem to get it out of the bottle. It's like a mix between clorien and mold, no matter how much I wash it the smell won't quit. So I stopped using it about a month after I bought it.

review_title: I never buy this product again.
review_body: I bought the Brita Longlast Replacement about a month ago.  Now it is not working, even not water go through.  The description said change every 120 gallon or about 6 months.  I have a 5 cups Brita pitcher and I use only about one gallon per day.  That means only 30 gallons water I used.  Amazon only give me 1month to claim replacement which past a few weeks ago.  I never buy this product again.

review_title: Water filter is not at par and doesn't filter out ...
review_body: Water filter is not at par and doesn't filter out any impurities. Brought a sample to the lab and the reading was 198 instead of 0.

review_title: This product has design fault in the filter seal ring
review_body: Update on Sep 2017. I have a new pitcher provided by Brita and the filter can fit and work well. However, after 4 months of use, the longlast filter started leaking out the internal materials slightly, and the dark dust/particles can be apparently found in the bottom of the pitcher or my cold water bottle. I still need to have a way to filter the faucet water, and so that now I use two filters. One longlast is inside the Brita pitcher, and another standard filter is inside the UltraMax dispenser. At least I didn't see any dark particles came out from the standard filter for recent many years. I replaced the longlast filter, but anyway, the water will be pouring to the UltraMax standard filter. I don't want to drink any dark particles in the water..  !! Stop using it before you double check if this filter can tightly fit and sit in your pitcher or dispenser!. This filter is poor designed and can result in leaking water from the filter seal ring gap because it cannot be tightly sealed in your pitcher. I'm not challenging the filter quality and water test certification it claimed, but the water leaked through filter seal ring is not filtered and may contaminate your filtered water. I own Brita UltraMax and it completely has no problem with original Brita filter replacement that can fit and seal tight and well. However, after replacing with Brita LongLast filter, the first thing I noticed is the water flow rate does not look like as slow as other posted comments. Then I figured out although I did use force and press firmly to insert the filter into the pitcher like what I did with original Brita filter, however, the LongLast filter just easily pops up without any external forces over and over again. Brita claims this filter can fit any Brita pitchers except Steam, so be careful and watch out loosen filter in your pitcher constantly to avoid spending much expensive money but just drink the unfiltered water.. I have bought two so I use another to check if this is just one filter faulty issue. However, the same issue happens to the second one. I'm wasting my money and cannot get clean water filtered.
Provides great tasting water, even if the filtering might be slow, these provide the best tasting water. I've tried generic filters, but none have matched the authentic Brita filters for taste.

review_title: which is nice (as opposed to putting a bowl over them to ...
review_body: First time trying these. When pre-soaking, they automatically sink, which is nice (as opposed to putting a bowl over them to prime them). I'd buy them again.
The filter takes more then 60  minutes to filter the water and fill the Pitcher.. This filter needs to be improved. I want Brits to send me 2 replacement filters.

review_title: These replacement filters work great a last longer than the little timer says they ...
review_body: Brita is a life saver living in a city with awful tasting water. These replacement filters work great a last longer than the little timer says they do. i keep them in until the water tastes like tap water then replace them. I have had no issues with these filters losing the carbon inside like i did with older brita filters

These are WAY better than the old model. No need to soak these you just rinse them for a while. There is no black carbon flakes from these like the old ones how they used to add up in the tank. These don't seep carbon at all. I also noticed my water tastes better with these ones. Idk if it's in my head but if it tastes better to me then I'm not complaining :)
We have been using the Brita system for years and the water is excellent!  These filters are the best and very convinient right out of the pitcher.  Would buy again and again!

review_body: Good quality and nice and thick. I got many more rolls of paper towels than I expected for the price. Make sure you have enough room! Lol

review_title: they are also breathable and allow the gel-top mattresses to keep us cool while sleeping
review_body: Due to health reasons, we recently purchased a King sized motorized bed. The kind that raises the head and feet up and down. It is two separate full size beds that are side by side and operate independently. We got the extra thick gel-top mattresses. These mattress protectors stay in place and although they are moisture proof, they are also breathable and allow the gel-top mattresses to keep us cool while sleeping. We would highly recommend these to anyone.

review_title: Everyone with a nice mattress needs this one!
review_body: This thing is so fantastic that I am coming right back to buy another one! I've shared the info for this product with a bunch of people already because it's the first that has an 'invisible' feel... no crunchy plastic sounds and no effect on dampening the natural feel of our pillowtop. Oh, and it's already been tested, got a juice spill on it, didn't bother to take it off until the next morning and the mattress was completely dry and stain free! What's more, washed the juice right off it in the bathtub and it's completely gone - no stain! The only thing with washing it is it takes hours to dry, but that's just part of its water proofing. The wet side takes hours to dry, although the underside remains dry just showing that it's doing it's job exactly!

I have pets and occasionally my cat will pee on the bed, which is awful. We just replaced our mattress and I wasn't taking any chances. This cover is soft, not plastic. It doesn't trap heat like the old vinyl mattress covers. And my cat peed on the bed and it went through all the blankets to the pad, but it protected the mattress! Great product!

Although the return window has closed I still feel I need to add comments. The mattress protector is a good product. I have had it since July 8,2018. I have washed it twice within the past 2 months. It does hold up. For me the problem was I would sweat with it on my bed. I will put it away as I just had a 30 day return window.

Great product! I have cats, and sometimes, they like to cough up hair balls on my bed! Ugh! Before, I had to steam vac my mattress to get the stain out, because it soaked through my sheets and mattress pad. With this one, I don't have that problem, and my mattress is completely protected. I've spilled drinks on my bed, and the mattress protector caught it all! I have allergies, and this is also a plus being hypoallergenic. I recommend this for anyone who has pets, especially, or who likes to eat and drink in their bed while watching their fave show.

This is more like a very nice bed sheet. It doesn't cover the entire bed like a bag, so the bottom is exposed. On top, it's super soft and I've spilled a bit of water on it to test it. The water sat on top for a minute or two and then absorbed into the soft top layer. But there's the under layer that protects the actual bed, so nothing seeped through. I would recommend washing it before first use to fluff the top soft layer a bit and get rid of the slight plastic smell that might occur. It wasn't strong, but it was there. If you don't wash it, the smell may go in a day or two and it is still super soft anyway. Great item, I just thought it was a full bed cover.

review_title: This one is completely comfortable. It didn't let any birthing goo through at ...
review_body: We purchased this in Queen size for my wife's third pregnancy expecting a homebirth. The second birth was also a homebirth and we used one of the old school crinkly plastic deals. Yeah, it protects the mattress, but you can barely sleep on it. This one is completely comfortable. It didn't let any birthing goo through at all! Our midwife saw it and said "Oh, that's pretty nice!" When we told her how comfortable and quiet it was, she immediately wanted to add it to her birth kit recommendations list. We also got a Twin size for our first daughter's bed, who is still working on the night time potty training. It's probably been washed fifty times and shows no sign of wearing out. Five stars, totally recommended!

I bought this with my 2 year old in mind. He moved to a big boy bed and needed something that would keep his new mattress safe. This protector is awesome!! Unfortunately we test out the waterproofness at least once a week even with night time diapers or when my husband forgets to put a diaper on for nap time. It has kept the mattress completely dry every time.  It washes well and does great in the dryer on low. I've never had any shrinkage!! It fits like a fitted sheet which is one reason I bought it. I was not dealing with zippering a mattress in. This protector feels like fabric and doesn't make any noise when laying on it. It's definitely breathable and doesn't make my little boy sweaty at night.. This product arrived fast, was new and I would definitely buy again. I've had it 7 months now and it still looks like new.

I wanted to love this (based on the great reviews), but ultimately I've returned it. Not only did it seem a bit too big (it will work well for deep mattresses or multiple layers of padding!), but I also found it a bit noisy. I didn't like that I could feel that I was sleeping on "plastic."  Ultimately, the looseness and noise factor were a turn-off and it was returned.

WOW! This thing is amazing. We have a 4 month old at home and have had several accidents with poop, pee, spit up, spilled food ourselves etc., but this protector is a beast! Not a single drop has gotten past it. I will only buy this protector moving forward for all our mattresses!
We love these! They're so thick and seem to last forever!

I was so excited to finally be able to purchase my instant pot for my birthday but was disappointed when it came. The first thing I noticed when I opened the lid was that it smelled like it had been used and the inner pot had water spots. I emptied the box it came in and it was missing all of the accessories listed on the box as well as the condensation collector, which the manual stated must be installed before use.

This thing is a real game changer! Perfectly cooks rice. Wonderfully steams broccoli. Excellent for shredded chicken (it just FALLS apart!). Cooking tip from experience:. Personally, I think their manual over estimates cooking times for vegetables. If I use their recommended cooking durations, a lot of times they turn to mush. For example: My personal ideal setting to lightly steam broccoli crowns is to use the "Steam" setting, set the timer to "0", then release pressure as soon as it's finished. This makes perfect broccoli that keeps the flowers in tact, and the stalks a pleasant "al dente" texture. This same setting works well for fresh cauliflower florets, keeping a nice firm texture but taking away the "mealiness" of raw cauliflower.

review_title: Bigger (8 qt) means more liquid required!!
review_body: I bought the 8 qt after doing a lot of research, but despite all my careful research there were some unexpected surprises. First, I was under the impression the only difference in the 6 and 8 was size. The 8 quart requires more water or liquid to reach pressure (2-2.5 cups vs. the 1-1.5 cups for the 6 qt)-- this can affect many recipes that call for only 1 cup of liquid! The 8 qt is really for cooking larger quantities, but I thought I could cook smaller portions in it too, and you can but, again, you have to add more liquid than some recipes require. You can get around this by doing PIP (pot in pot) cooking, but what a hassle if you want to sear or sauté something--you would have to do that in the inner pot, then transfer everything to the PIP smaller pot (which you have to figure out what to use and buy it), you can then add the amount of liquid to your dish, and if it is not 2 cups, then you would add 1 cup of water to the inner pot itself, so, combined you have enough liquids to reach pressure. The 8 qt, because it holds more, takes longer to release pressure naturally (and maybe a little longer with quick release, too). It is a wonderful size, and I thought it would be versatile, allowing me to cook large or small portions, but I am cooking for two and this is just too big since it requires the extra liquid. I exchanged it for a Duo60 without doing anything more than the Pressure Test. Please note, I spoke with customer service at Instant Pot because the Manual says the Pressure Test natural release time would be 15 minutes and it took 55! They said the manual has a misprint, the "3 mark" should read 3rd mark, not the number 3 because the 3 is 3 liters and the 3rd Mark is 3 cups, so yes, big difference. I thought the pot was defective, so was glad I called. Very nice people!! I gave the 8qt 4 stars because it is a wonderful appliance, the -1 star was for not explaining the differences better so people can make a more informed decision on which size to buy. Gotta love the ease of returns on Amazon,

Perfect addition to the Instant Pot family. This little pot does the same incredible job as it's bigger brother and sisters. Great for making the side dishes or smaller main dishes. If you haven't gotten on board the Instant Pot train, do not hesitate! This mini pot even makes yogurt. The benefits to pressure cooking are numerous, using the Instant Pot makes it incredibly easy. Can you tell I'm completely smitten with this little appliance?!. It proudly sits on my counter and is used nearly every single day.

I have been very happy with the way this cooks.  It makes zero noise except when releasing steam.  I was blown away to see high quality enamel around the top on the inside where you so often see teflon.. I had a very bad experience with the stainless pot (I don't know if it was the one that came with in the cooker or the spare I bought from same company) but the stainless steel pitted the first few uses and I had to exchange for a new one that has functioned without issue.. The irony is that I bought this because of the stainless steel.  I don't like using non-stick surfaces because they wear and you end up eating the teflon.  Now it appears I have eaten stainless steel instead!!. I expect this was a fluke and I expect to be happy with this product but I am disappointed that having now received the defective product and had a chance to assess the issue no one has contacted me to offer a refund.  As is clear in the photos... this was a major fail and who knows what has gotten into my system as a result.

review_title: Wish I got the 6QT instead of the 3QT
review_body: UPDATED - So I finally got the 6QT and oh. my. g... - so wonderful! Such a relief! I can cook 5 lbs of frozen chicken in ONE cycle and have food for my dog for the next week! Yay! And last night I finally made that famous "soccer mom spaghetti" (dump a box of pasta, one jar of sauce, a bag of frozen meatballs plus a jar of water in the pot then push a button) and - perfect. I made this same thing in the 3qt about a few times and it never came out right - first the pasta didn't cook, next time the sauce was too watery, etc. With the 6QT - cooked perfectly! And I have FIVE portions of leftovers instead of the 1-2 I had with the smaller I.P.. To put the 3qt vs 6qt in perspective: the 3qt pot does not actually cook 3 quarts because you can't fill it all the way to the top. There's a line that's oh, an inch or two below the lip that's the Max Fill line, because the pressure cooker needs extra room to do its thing. Then, if you're adding the trivet, you're losing another inch of space. So really your cooking space is more like 2 quarts, like a small sauce pan.. Imagine you're cooking ALL of your meals with nothing bigger than a sauce pan.. Then you've got the 6qt pot, which is like the big pots you use to boil pasta. Or make soup.. Pasta pot vs sauce pan. You see what I'm saying?. Anyway, now my problem is that I have to stop cooking so often because I have no more room in my freezer...  :). ********. ABOUT THE 3 QT DUO --- As Instant Pots go, I'll not reiterate what everyone else says but agree that it's a game changer, and totally revolutionizes your cooking. However, I have some regrets.... 3QT Too Small for Lazy Cooks Like Me --- When I to move into my Airstream trailer full time, I decided to get an Instant Pot as I thought it would help minimize the amount of cooking appliances I needed. And of course, being solo (plus a dog and cat) I figured the 3Qt was the better choice. After 7 months with it, I am desperate to trade my 3Qt for the 6QT. I like cooking, but I'm lazy and would prefer to make a large batch once and have left overs, than have to cook for every meal. Reheating leftovers is far easier to clean up than cooking a fresh meal. I'm lazy at cleaning, too.. Instant Pot Learning Curve --- Instant Pot cooking takes some getting used to, and while there is a great abundance of tips and such online, which are fabulous, about 95% of them are for 6QT or larger. Finding good, appropriate recipes for the 3QT is frustrating and has led to lots of failed meals, as ingredients plus liquids, cooking time, etc are all out of proportion.. Where Are All The Accessories for 3QT? --- In the same vein as above, there are tons and tons of accessories for the Instant Pot, but... they're all for 6QT, not a lot for 3QT. I'm starting to see more 3QT-sized accessories (like steam baskets, gaskets, lids, egg bites silicone molds, etc), but only from, like, a single manufacturer. As opposed to stuff for the 6 qt, where you've got a dozen steam baskets to choose from.. Home Cooked Dog Food --- Finally, as I'm traveling a lot city to city, I've started making food for my dog (an 80lb Labrador) as we could never find the brand of dog kibble that she liked and that was good for her. In this situation, the Instant Pot has been my savior, as it's soooo easy to just plop a bunch of raw, frozen chicken or other meats into the pot, slap on lid, push a button and within the hour, I've got tons of fall-off-the-bone meat for my pup's next breakfast (because I inevitably forget to cook for her the night before, and have to do it right at her mealtime). But normal instances when making a batch of her food, again, because I have the 3QT, I could only cook a portion of the meat, take it out, do a quick scrub of the pot before cooking the other portion - whereas with a 6QT that could be done with just one cycle.. In short, if you're thinking about getting a 3Qt for your first and only Instant Pot, don't! Just go for the 6Qt and make your life much easier.

review_title: If there was a 10 star option I'd choose it!
review_body: I kept hearing about electric pressure cookers but I always thought back to the noisy monster that mom used on our stove when I was a kid. The one that she wouldn't even allow me into the kitchen when she was using it. And that picture floating around Facebook of the pressure cooker lid embedded in someone's ceiling didn't help! But I read a lot of reviews and webpages and finally broke down and decided to try one.. I bought a PPCXL from Costco and jumped in with both feet. I made several delicious meals using recipes from the web and I canned peppers, jam, and applesauce using recipes from the included book. Then I found out that electric pressure cookers are not safe to can with even though the PPCXL company said it was and included a recipe book for home canning. I ended up having to throw away everything I had already canned and that just annoyed me to the point that I didn't want a product from that company in my home so I returned it and ordered the Instant Pot Duo 7-in-1. I chose this one because a) the company specifically says this product is not safe for pressure canning, it has a stainless steel pot instead of non-stick, and it has the yogurt function.. We’re trying to eliminate all non-stick cookware from our kitchen so going to the stainless pot here was a step in the right direction. I really didn’t think I would use the yogurt function much. I don’t dislike yogurt but it’s not something I ever wanted all the time either so I thought I’d try it once and then go back to buying the occasional container at the grocery store. I couldn’t have been more wrong! Even if I wasn’t cooking tons of other fabulous recipes in my IP, the yogurt feature alone has made the IP my one “can’t live without” kitchen appliance (I even took it RV camping with us!). The yogurt is crazy simple to make and so much healthier than the preservative and sweetener loaded stuff at the store. Milk and a starter (a tbsp. or two of yogurt) are all you need and the IP does all the work while you sleep!. I could go on and on about the yogurt, but then I wouldn’t have time to write about all of the other things you can make. Dishes like Pineapple Pepper Chicken (less than 1 hour including ALL prep and cook time!), Jambalaya (also less than an hour!), and absolutely melt in your mouth fall off the bone ribs. Yes, RIBS! In less than an hour! Want to make some desserts? How about cheesecake or dulce le’ leche? Homemade hummus in less than an hour? Not a problem! Bread? It can do that too!. This really is the most versatile appliance I own. And on those hot summer days when you don’t want to heat up the kitchen it’s a lifesaver! No more hot oven heating up the house for hours, just grab the IP!. If you’re still reading, what are you waiting for? Order yourself this miracle gadget now!. All of the attached photos are of food I've made in my Instant Pot. Pineapple Pepper Chicken, Crustless Quiche, Sausage & Spinach Scrambler, Beef Chili, Roasted Garlic Hummus, Sausage & Kraut, Boiled Peanuts, Yogurt, Jambalaya

I used it twice and it quit working while I was using it the second time.  Had to finish cooking my meal in my crockpot and eat it the following day.  Notified Amazon and they are sending a replacement and a return label with free shipping on the return and replacement instant pot.  I hope this one doesn't quit working.  If it does, I'm will probably get my money back and just use my crockpot instead.. I checked everything that the instruction book said to check.  Everything was fine.  Checked the outlet and it was fine too.  Plugged it into a different outlet with the same result.  It's such an expensive item to purchase and it quit working on second use.  We will see what happens when I get my replacement.  Just bummed.

This pot is designed to not work. The surface area of the pressure indicating valve is too small for the weight of the valve to be lifted by steam pressure. Result? The valve stays open and the pot simply boils away the liquid inside and does not build pressure. The "solution" is to use an implement of some sort to manually pull the indicating valve up into a sealed position once the pot starts to make steam. If this is not done, the valve will not lift and seal and water will simply boil away. It is important to note that this is not due to a dirty valve, a sticky valve, insufficient liquid or any malfunction. Rather, it is designed into the pot. Ours will be relegated to stock pot duty as we have found it to be totally unusable as a pressure cooker.

I have had my Instant Pot for just a few weeks shy of a year and really have enjoyed many good meals.  I have used it about a dozen times.  It just died.  I prepared my food as usual and turned it on (slow cooker setting which I always use) and left the room for only a minute when I heard it sizzling away.  Came back to find it smoking from just about everywhere.  I yanked the plug.....and was thankful I didn't leave the house.  It's now in the trash.  So just beware of leaving it unattended.  I will not be replacing it.

review_title: Not accurate or reliable, looks nice.
review_body: I bought this scale because it was listed as the number one scale on Amazon.  When I got it, I liked it.  It looks nice, it's light weight.. The problem is that I don't find it to be reliable. Over 2 days we tried it.  For both me, and my boyfriend, the weight has varied every time we use it, even when using just an hour apart, wearing the same clothes, on the same hard surface/location.  The variance for my boyfriend has been between 2 - 10 lbs.  For me, it has been 2-5 lbs different every time I use it.

It seems to work fine at first.  But slowly, as the weeks go by, it will start to give "incorrect" readings.. I can stand on it and get 1 weight, then get off and back on and get an entirely different weight.  I guess the load cell is failing.

Go for the standard version unless you have a big container that rarely gets empty. Also, I feel no difference in taste from the standard filter.

review_title: Too slow, even when filter is new, throwing these away
review_body: LATER: Okay, after a week of use I am throwing these longlast filters away, 1 unopened.. REASON: long wait for water to pass through. This morning I filled the pitcher and went to take a shower and do some other things. So, 20-30 min later, it was still not empty. Unfiltered water came out into my glass though I poured carefully, that's how full it was. I do keep a second ornamental non-Brita  pitcher that is usually full of already-filtered water when needed, but I just use the filtered water too much for these blue filters to work for me. I was surprised that it was so slow even in the first uses; the white filters are very fast when just replaced.. Changing stars from 2 to 1.. My objection is that instead of rinsing the new filter under the faucet, with these I am told to run and discard 3 pitchers full of filtered water. The filters are slower than the white ones, perhaps because they filter better, but whatever the reason it would take maybe 10 trips through the kitchen over 45 minutes to fill the pitcher 3 times. Not worth it. I'm going to assume that not doing this 3-pitcher routine just means I will drink some charcoal dust. My other alternative is to throw them away and drink unfiltered well water for 4 days until arrival of the new white ones I just ordered.. Also I just noticed what the recommended throughput is for each filter, after which replacement is recommended. For these triple-life filters it is 160 gallons ("about 6 months for the average family"); the white filters are comparable, 40 gallons, "about every 2 months for the average family". I guess average families don't drink much water, because I, only 1 person (plus I use it for the dogs' water dishes) go through more than a gallon a day. 160 gallons over a 180 day period, 6 months, is 0.9 gallon per day, for an entire family.. As far as cost compared to the regular white filters: let's use their numbers, which say the blue ones last for 6 months each,  and on cost $25.99 for two filters. You get 1 year for $25.99.. The older style white filters come in packs of 3 and  last, according to Brita, 2 months each,  $13.69 for three. So you get 6 months for $13.69, or 1 year for $27.48.. The white ones cost $1.51 more per year, but water runs through faster. Until Brita tells me that these new filters do a better job, and produce independent test results to prove it, I'll save my time and stick with the white ones.

I purchased these in an effort to save time & money. Money I did save, time however is another story. These filters take nearly an hour to run through my 18 cup water basin, which I have to fill about twice weekly. Also, the quality of the water does not seem as good as it does with the carbon filters. I will not likely purchase another set as I prefer the old style.

review_title: Don’t do it! Don’t waste the money!
review_body: Water flows through these so sslllooowwwwlllyyy. It takes literally hours to fill our gallon pitcher. It’s maddeningly painful to use these

While this fits inside of my smaller Brita pitcher, water barely filters through at the rate of a snail's pace. It seems as though there are air holes to allow for it to flow through faster, but the pin-sized holes in the filter don't align with the hole in the pitcher. Super disappointing, this was a total waste of money.

review_title: Longlast + better filtration sounded like a major plus
review_body: After years of using the standard filters, our doctor alerted us that the standard filters do not filter out lead.  I found the longlast filters, which Brita claims these filters do filter out lead.  Longlast + better filtration sounded like a major plus; however, these filters are completely clogged and unusable after only about two weeks.  How can these be marketed as longlast when they last 1/8 the time of the standard filters?  This is very disappointing and most certainty will drive me to a different brand of water filter.

The flow rate through these is terrible. It drips through at such a slow rate that it takes hours for the water to pass through the filter. I think these are a great idea but, unless I have just received a bad batch, they are not very practical.
