review_title: The inner pot is supposed to be made of STAINLESS steel and dishwasher safe.  Neither appeared to be true.
review_body: I put the inner pot in the dishwasher before first use.  It came out covered by rusty stains.  The inner pot is supposed to be made of STAINLESS steel and dishwasher safe.  Neither appeared to be true.  I had other dishes in the dishwasher and they all came out clean so it wasn't something in the water.  I'll post a photo here for others to see.  Because of that I never used the cooker, so I can't comment on its function.  I returned it immediately.

review_title: I have many friends who love theirs! I tried 5 different recipes
review_body: I purchased this Instant Pot with high hopes, I have many friends who love theirs!  I tried 5 different recipes, I didn't care for the result of the first 4.  On the 5th attempt to make something in it the whole unit shorted out in the middle of cooking time and will not turn back on.  I will be returning it today.  It made chili flavorless and watery, it made chicken and pork chops have a strange texture, and when I tried beef stew it was more like beef soup. I admit I am a pretty picky eater and love to cook, so I was hoping for an appliance that would make cooking easier and faster for my family of 6, but I was completely disappointed. I would not recommend it to anyone.

review_title: Prime Day 8-Quart Bargain Turned Out Not To Be A Bargain At All Due To It Being A Very Outdated Version of the Instant Pot
review_body: The model I received is an original version, not a 3rd generation of the 8-quart Instant Pot.. There is no such thing as a 3rd generation DUO 80 I found out. None. Due to an error on Instant Pot's website and copied by Amazon, it was advertised as a 3rd generation on Prime Day. I can't blame Amazon because they trusted the manufacturer's description... All 8 qt models as of this writing are the same. They have attached cords and lack other programmability features found on new, smaller models. I noticed this right out of the box when I saw that the power cord was hard-wired rather than the removable cord advertised in the product description. If that were the only difference in this old model and the current models, I could handle that. Unfortunately, the 8 quart models do not have the same programmability functions as the 3rd generation models found in 6 qt designs. If you want to know the differences, do a search on the instant pot website.. I returned it in favor of another 8 qt. brand that is more modern in every way and I'll keep my 6 qt. Instant Pot DUO 60 PLUS.

review_title: ABSOLUTE gamechanger for time-starved cooks, busy moms and weekly meal prep!
review_body: At first, I wasn't sure about all the fuss surrounding the Instant Pot. When I thought about pressure cookers, I thought of my grandmother standing over a stove, canning vegetables from the garden. Boy, was I wrong! This is hands down my new favorite kitchen appliance, and it has saved me so much time in the kitchen. Let me tell you: The Instant Pot is a total game changer for time-starved cooks, working moms, and anyone who doesn't have time to stand over a stove waiting for a pot to boil.. In the month or so that I've been using it, I've made a huge batch of 1-minute quinoa, steel cut oats, homemade refried beans, shredded salsa chicken, hardboiled eggs (for snacking & egg salad), tender thin-sliced steak and brown gravy, and even gluten-free pasta with meat sauce (all in one pot!). It's not always that the IP takes less time (because there is some time involved in coming up to pressure and releasing the pressure), but it's that you can walk away while the magic happens. It automatically kicks over to a warming function after cook time ends, so if you get busy doing something, your food will stay nice and warm!  (I actually picked up a rotisserie chicken from our local supermarket one afternoon, and came home and put it in the Instant Pot on the KEEP WARM function until dinner time. How awesome is that?). It's been really useful for meal prep, too! I am a big fan of cook once, eat twice type meals, and the IP is nice because a big batch of beans, quinoa, brown rice, soup, etc. doesn't necessarily take any extra time to cook. I was able to freeze single servings of quinoa, rice, beans, etc. to use on nights when I don't have time to cook.. There IS a learning curve when it comes to figuring out cooking times, converting recipes, etc., so I recommend joining the Instant Pot group on Facebook, following some food bloggers who share IP recipes, and downloading all the Kindle Unlimited books that you can get as you learn how to use it. Start with something simple, and you'll get the hang of it pretty quickly.. I've also heard a lot of people complain in FB groups about the silicone rings smelling like whatever you last cooked in the Instant Pot, so some people suggest having two rings: one for sweet and one for savory foods. It certainly doesn't affect the flavor of your food (at least, not in my experience) but if that bothers you, you might want to snag an extra silicone ring when you buy your IP.. Overall, I am BEYOND pleased with my purchase and I am happy to share that dinnertime is a little easier at my house thanks to the IP!

review_title: Im definitly not happy with this product
review_body: I've bought two in about a year and the last one is already broken again, it just simply dead and wont turn on, and i bout it in November 2016. Im definitly not happy with this product. I have one from Nesco for more than 4 years now and is still working perfectly.

review_title: It's pretty big and takes up a lot of counter space ...
review_body: Maybe I just dont have the patience to figure this thing out, but it seems to me that it's just not worth it. It's pretty big and takes up a lot of counter space for starters. Which isn't really a deal breaker since crockpots also take up a lot of space, but I figured it's worth mentioning. I got this because I clearly misunderstood the advertised cooking times. I thought a recipe that claimed to take 35 minutes really only took 35 minutes! (plus 10 minutes of prep time of course). Unfortunately, it takes 10-15 minutes for it to come up to pressure, 35 minutes to cook, and potentially up to 20 minutes to release pressure. In the end, it's just doesnt do what I needed it to do and I am returning it. If you are buying the Instat Pot for the purpose of giving you more a more hands off cooking experience; maybe to free up your hands/time so you can do something else, then I could see how this would work out for you. But if you are considering buying to make cooking "easier" and all around "faster", it's not really worth it IMO.

2 Malfunctioning (and one damaged) 8 qt Duo units were shipped to me.  Not until they sent me one from different stock did I get a properly functioning one.  LOOK OUT for faulty steam release valve/handles.  If you have the steam release handle pointing to the “sealing” position, steam should NOT be escaping from it while you do the “water test” and the pot comes up to pressure, or while it is cooking at pressure.  You should only be having steam escape out of that valve when you turn it toward “venting.”  This is seperate from the pink float valve.  It is normal for some steam to escape from the pink float valve until it pops up & the pot comes to pressure.. If the steam only stops coming out of the steam release valve/handle by pushing it past the spot marked “sealing,” where it feels like it’s NOT supposed to go, or if it keeps coming out no matter what you do, then learn from me: YOU have a DEFECTIVE one!  When I talked with the Instant Pot technical support with my last one, they told me to turn it off, unplug it, and not attempt to use it again.. I ordered mine during the pre-holiday/ Black Friday sales (Nov 2017).  The first I was shipped came badly dented in (probably shipping damage since the outside box was bashed in, too.)  The next two I was sent were BOTH defective.  It wasn’t until I requested I be sent a replacement from different stock, that I got a properly functioning one!  I’m so relieved to finally have a functioning one as of today, January 29th, 2018, two months later!  4th time’s the charm, I guess?  Seriously, it took them sending me 4 Instant Pots, and a lot of headache & my time before I got a properly functioning one.  I will say, that they did at least cover the shipping (as was Amazon’s responsibility since it was an Amazon fulfilled order) for all the replacements, and did even over-night ship one of the times (the third pot...by the fourth, I got the sense the customer service person suspected it was MY fault, so they seemed less eager to help.  I do have pictures & proof of the problematic units they shipped me, and verification that it was NOT user error or my fault.  I’m just so relieved that my 4th one works so I don’t have to deal with this anymore!). So, Quality Control Issues.. IF you get a functioning unit, these really are nice.  Seems everyone around me has one & loves them.  I may not have figured out that my second unit was defective, if it hadn’t been for me brining it to a group get-together where two other friends cooked the exact same recipe (with no problem) in their Instant Pots, while mine malfunctioned with it because of the defective steam release valve/handle, which caused the subsequent “burn” code when trying to come up to pressure.  I had suspected it might be defective before, but was having a hard time ruling out novice user error, or bad recipes, etc.. Pictures: 1) First one came dented in.  2 & 3) pictures from one of the units with defective steam release valve, in case Instant Pot sees this and wants that info. to help correct manufacturing/quality control problem.  4) Shows manual saying that the problem indicates “pressure control fails”and to “contact support.”  Also shows where I wrote ticket number from my call with Instant Pot technical support.. If I knew how to post videos, I have video of what it looks & sounds like doing the “water test” with the defective steam release valve.  Basically, it noisily spits steam and water out the steam release valve, even when it is in “sealing” position.. Hope my very bad luck helps things go better for someone else, especially if there are any other defective units still getting shipped to people!

review_title: My poor children, it's so bad I have a rule
review_body: If I could give this more stars I would!!! I am the worest cook in history. My poor children, it's so bad I have a rule, if I can't eat it, we order pizza. Which happens quite a lot in my house. Until I got this amazing invention!. I've had it for about 2 weeks now and all I can say is Oh. MY. GOD! Why am I just now finding out about this?. When I did cook, one of the best meals I used to make was chicken tikka, it would take me 3 hours or more and I'd have 300 dishes to do after. So I stopped making it. It pretty much was your basic food for a while. And it was the same things over and over and over agin. Blah.. Then my friend kept telling me about this and I was like, I don't need another dang appliance in my house that I won't use. She brought it over and showed me how to use it and cooked something that would normally take me two hours to cook, cooked in less the 45 mins. All I had to do was sauté, throw some stuff in there and turn it on.. So I bought one and now my chicken tikka is done in half the time!! And I only have one pot to clean!!!! I can't say anything negative about this bad boy. I'll never cook on my stove again!!!!

review_title: Just go ahead and buy it already!
review_body: Ok, so I've jumped on the instant pot bandwagon. My mom, my friend, the internet all convinced me that I need this pot. Now, I'm an instant pot lover. So what is it about this pot that makes it such an internet rage? Is it really just a glorified rice cooker? If there is a place that really knows how to make perfect rice, it would be China. Which is why I think its appropriate that this cooker is make there.. But its more than just a rice cooker. This pot has 7 different functions, and a plethora of recipes that can be concocted in those 7 functions. Its like an experimental cook’s dream machine. If you are familiar with a pressure cooker, this is exactly that, it has the pressure release valve that will scare the (*#!&) out of you every single time you switch it over. But don’t let that intimidate you out of this purchase. This is better than a crock pot, in that you can cook some of the same meals, like beans or pot roast in a fraction of the time.. No, its not instant, so, don’t get mad that your dry beans didn’t cook in 30 minutes, because that’s not realistic, but they will get done much faster than stovetop or crockpot. Now, lets talk about space. I have an RV, and this is perfect for making so many meals in this small kitchen space. Maybe you have a great big kitchen in a house and this is just another gadget that you can’t justify adding. I can understand that. But, if you already use the crockpot, rice cooker, and make lots of beans, maybe this would be a good upgrade to your kitchen appliances.. So, here I am, joining your mom, friend, and the internet into trying to talk you into buying your own instant pot. I hope my review helped you make that decision. I have no personal gain in whether you purchase this product or not, and I didn’t receive my instant pot for free (unfortunately). Happy experimenting!

It will take you a while to get the hang of this, accounting for the heat up and steam release time. When these are added to the cook time, most things are in no way instant. I have also had trouble getting them "done" as I learn it. I am close to sea level, so I don't think I should have to add time, but always use the top end of time ranges and then have to restart it because my food is not done. I do like it better than my crock pot because the temperature controls on them are so funky now they usually overcook if you don't keep a close eye, and I don't need to think as far in advance.. I would recommend getting multiple seals because it gets stinky fast if you cook chicken with skin on. I bought the color coded ones for when I attempt to do a non-savory dish. Another inner pot would be handy too if you want to store food in it or cook one thing then the next in short order.

review_title: I really liked these microfibre cleaning cloths
review_body: I really liked these microfibre cleaning cloths. I don't think they are the best cloths in the world but they are good value for the money. I love that they come in three different colours so I can use them for different chores ie White for dish cloths, blue for cleaning paintwork etc and yellow for dusting.

I love microfiber cloths for general housekeeping and cleaning electronic screens and eyeglass lenses (keep a couple separately specifically for this purpose and never get any chemicals on those). These are not as thick as some I purchased at Tarjay, but for the quantity, the price was great. Just be sure not to wash with anything else to preserve the texture and reduce lint collection. Also, don't use fabric softener--it affects the cloth's ability to absorb liquid for some reason.

review_body: A million uses, from dusting to degreasing... washable and cheap enough that if one gets really nasty you can just toss it.  Can't go wrong.

Que Garfield moments, okay we all hate stepping on a scale.  But if you're looking at scales you know you need one.  While those moments may be painful, this scale makes it easier.  not prancing around trying to get it to turn on, no awkward bouncing of numbers, step on, get weight and be done.  Stows anywhere and is sleek enough it doesn't offend the eyes.  The only scale I'll have in my house.

Very nice looking scale, easy to read, nice size, weight, batteries last a really long time. The bad news is you can weight your self 3-4 times in a row and get different readings. Sometimes as much as 1-2 lbs. this CANNOT be used on a soft surface. And is best on a super flat super hard floor. Finding the sweet spot is hard, if u shift weight to heel it weighs light and weight shifters to toes weighs more. But the. Then Again it's cheap.

review_title: Love it.  Nice sleek look and is very accurate.
review_body: Finally!!! I don't have to tap, then wait...then step on.  This just requires me to step on and voila!  My daughter loves weighing her toys....  She's a little crazy like that.  I went ahead and purchased one for my sister as her scale broke a few months ago and she kept meaning to get one..>Well why not have one delivered directly so you can stop forgetting to get one every time you go to the store.

While I can’t speak to the longevity of this product (I received it today), I can say the initial unboxing experience deserves five stars.. The box is unique. It’s minimal. Nothing special, it’s just pleasant to look at. The ‘wow’ factor for me is the cloth tape measure Etekcity includes  inside the package. It’s a great complimentary product and the fact it’s given without advertisement adds more value to me. This could have been another average purchase—expectations met, nothing more, nothing less. However, this product surpassed my anticipations, so they’ve earned this praise.. Despite a generic product, Etekcity found a way to differentiate themselves through pleasant, subtle surprises.

review_title: The scale occasionally is off by up to 3 pounds ...
review_body: The scale occasionally is off by up to 3 pounds.  Sometimes I'll step on it, step off, and try again - and get a completely different weight.  I've taken to weighing myself 3-5 times, and about 1 in 10 tries yields a different weight.  But you never know when it's going to be off, so you can never anticipate and adjust.  The attached photos show an example - over weighing myself repeatedly over about 5 minutes, I got three different results, with nothing to account for it.  I've been trying to make it work, but I give up.

review_title: Nicely designed and built bathroom scale.
review_body: Exactly what I was looking for.. It is easy to use and appears to be accurate and built solidly.. No on/off button... simply step on and hold still for a couple seconds for it to lock in and flash your weight in large #s (I don't need my glasses to read it).  It will flash for a few more seconds after you step off before going out.. There is a push button on the bottom to toggle between pounds and kilograms.. I had a different brand that lasted less than 2 years... one of the plastic feet broke off from sliding in and out from under my vanity over tile.  This one  has a better design of the feet that won't break under the same use.

I bought this scale because it was simple and had no bells and whistles like body fat monitoring and blue tooth record keeping. It works just fine, seems to be accurate, has an attractive design, and slides under my bathroom cabinet when I am not using it.  I didn't get a body tape measure though.
Do not buy this scale. Reads different numbers every time and says low battery even after changing to new batteries. Low quality product that should be avoided !

Absolutely no problems with it so far.  Amazing bathroom scale that works well on any hard floor.  The weight is accurate, the auto on is awesome, and it quickly gives you a reading.  The display is very clear and easy to read in any light conditions.  Not sure about battery life yet will update if I have any issues with that in the future.. This is a scale that doesn't have a ton of fancy features but does what it does well.  You stand on it and it gives you a weight.  It doesn't have any surprising features, but it does everything you would expect a scale to do.

This weekend, we managed to overstuff our kitchen garbage again, with half-empty yogurt containers and used coffee grinds and about half a cup of leftover skillet grease. It's freezing outside, and we couldn't bring ourselves to take it out last night. So I was certain, this morning I'd wake up to a terrible stink. But these Gain bags did their job and trapped the awful odor inside...and not in my kitchen. It was a pleasant surprise, and I'll be buying these again.

my trash usually stinks bad. I eat a lot of mayo and other sauces, and sometimes my eyes are bigger than my stomach ;D. This means that I'm often leaving big piles of sauces and condiments in the trash. The fumes fill my whole home (especially when we have Buffalo Fish night). I used to just spray the whole container down with febreeze twice a day, but now with these bags I don't need to go through that hassle! I can dump as much gravy and hummus in these things and not think twice about the pungent twang wrinkling my nose in the morning. Definitely a must buy for the house. Two thumbs up!

review_title: We do LOVE our 2 Brita Pitchers (not the same ones) we ...
review_body: Changed 2-Brita Pitcher's Filters on 9/21/207 to the Longlast Replacement Filters...besides the SLOW FLOW of H20 through the Filer we already have to change the Filters today on 10/16/2017 due to floaties and a weird sediment on the bottom of our drinking glasses coming THROUGH the Filters! We do LOVE our 2 Brita Pitchers (not the same ones)  we have been using for over the past12 years or more for everything from drinking, cooking, and making ice cubes!!! The NEW LONGLAST REPLACEMENT FILTERS need to be tested and improved before selling!!!!

review_title: These are brand name replacement filters for Brita pitchers. ...
review_body: These are brand name replacement filters for Brita pitchers.  My pitcher is over 6 years old and they still fit, so I imagine they would probably fit any Brita pitcher from then until now.  I've left some of these in for many months (possibly a year), and while they do lose some of their ability over that time, they still result in an noticeable improvement in my water. Five stars for doing exactly what it's designed for and making my old building's tap water palatable.

review_title: Two thirds of my monies worth.
review_body: The first 2 filters worked great,but the third worked horribly,the water was bitter and tasted worst if it remained in the pitcher for more than 6 hours.I had to keep throwing the water out and refilling it because it was so bitter.Washing the pitcher itself didn't change the way the water ended up tasting.The option to return it was there but the cost to reship the filter to brita didn't make any sense.
Really really really slow filter to the point that it's unusable.. I bought it to see if I could save some money but will go back to old normal Brita filters.. Don't buy this.

These fit perfectly in my Brita-compatible water pitcher.  They filter well and I am left with very clean drinking water.. While they don't require a long soak prior to use, they do need to be rinsed first and will require two to three pitchers-worth of water to pass through to prevent coal dust from showing up in your water.  This is typical of this type of filter.. I am satisfied with my purchase.
only lasted a month before clogging up. so much for saving money with a longlast filter. i will go back to regular filters

review_body: Do not buy these filters, they do not work. I used the filter for about a week until it completely stopped working, the flow through the filter became essentially zero.
The water passes through the filter very slowly.  It takes hours to filter.

review_body: They are quilted and thick, choose your sheet size, and huge rolls last my messy family of boys a good while! They will stay on my subscribe and save forever!

review_title: I was skeptical, but it really is quiet!
review_body: Haven't had to test the durability of the waterproof claim yet (will update if needed, baby comes any day now) but it is comfortable and actually completely quiet! I was so worried we'd be crinkling every time one of us moves at night but there is no sound! The top cover is very soft as well. Im glad we went with this cover!

review_title: Not what I had in mind, not a closed cover
review_body: Grr... found out when I got this that it isn't a full protector, it's "fitted sheet style." It's there in the item details, so I *guess* it's my fault for not noticing that? I honestly had no idea they even made such a thing. I don't see how a non-sealed cover would actually protect against dust mites and bed bugs though. Explains why the price was lower than I expected.

I have a king size memory foam mattress that is very heavy.  This mattress covers it perfectly and is deep enough to hold onto the corners and edges.  There is no odor or crinkling.  My mattress is allowed to breath and is now protected.  It even allows my sheets to cling to it so that the sheets do not pull up and create wrinkles on the sleeping surface.

I recently bought a new mattress and wanted to protect it the best way possible. This mattress protection washed up beautifully (iI probably didn’t need to wash it before using as there was no odor but I’m a little crazy like that). It fits perfectly and there was no tugging or pulling to get it on. Surprisingly, it’s very soft for a water proof cover and doesn’t make any crackling noise when you roll over! I’m exceedingly pleased!

Bought this because my cat was upset that I upgraded his litter box and didn't gradually make the switch. He ended up peeing on my bed. I was able to clean it through biocleaners and a deep cleaning vacuum but that was a lot of work. When I got this I put it on right away and behold the cat peed on it. I was so happy that it didn't seep into my bed at all. I did catch it while it was fresh so I don't know how it would fair after sitting a while. Washed the sheet as directed came out looking just as new. I do suspect that with my two cats jumping on my bed they will eventually puncture the sheet. So I will update this review at a future date. I have a pillow top mattress and I don't notice any excess noise from the sheet. It is comfortable to sleep on I also put a regular bed sheet over it.

What is there to say, it does what its intended to do.  Not many pros or cons to take into consideration.  It’s a good waterproof sheet for your bed.  The one advantage this item has is that it does not have that crinkly noise that some plastic sheets for twin or children’s' sized beds have.  While the laundry instructions say that it may be placed in a dryer, I wouldn't recommend it.  The water proof sheets for my children’s' crib sized mattresses have been rendered useless after placing in the dryer by accident (still useable as padding but they lose their ability to block liquids from getting to the mattress after being placed in a dryer) so I recommend hanging any of these types of products up to dry just to be on the safe side despite the laundry directions.  Also this particular item is very thin so frequent drying in a clothes dryer could potentially wear out the fabric.

review_title: Great protector, no sounds after washing.
review_body: It worked great for us. I haven't really had to put it to the test as far as any kind of liquid yet, hopefully never will. We have slept on it and we don't notice any plastic sounds at all. I was afraid it was going to have that sound when I first took it out of the packaging but after a quick wash and dry and putting it on the bed nothing at all. We don't even notice it.

review_title: Based on first impressions - will update after more use -UPDATE
review_body: The sheet is large enough to cover my foam mattress but it is not that quiet.  The terry cloth is not too soft if you want to use without a sheet over it, perhaps after it is washed it will get softer.  Fitted sheet over it, fit snug.  Will update after I wash it.. Update: Husband spilled an entire cup of water on the guest bed and the cover did its job protecting our memory foam mattress YEAY! Still have not washed it so not sure how it will hold up.  Will update once I wash it.

review_title: and it feels like sleeping on a plastic liner under sheets
review_body: Fits mattress well. The terry top side is soft but too thin, and it feels like sleeping on a plastic liner under sheets. It doesn’t breathe like PUL lined covers and gets hot. Does resist liquid and stains well as it completely blocks kids’ nighttime accidents from getting through to mattress.

This has saved my memory foam mattress more times than I can count. My toddler is accident prone, and has caused spills large and small. They have soaked all of our bedding all the way through the the mattress protector. The water pools on this layer, but never gets through to the mattress. It fits on the bed perfectly. Most of the time I forget it is there, until I am thanking it for saving my bed!

review_title: Quality is good. Stinkbug odor definitely is NOT!
review_body: Love the quality of the product...did NOT like the smell of stinkbugs. Defeats the purpose of 'cleaning' with the and was nauseating when used to dry hands. They've been sent to the shed to be used as 'grease rags' and even then you can smell that odor if the doors have been closed up! YUCK! I have more than one star because I actually REALLY like the product but...well...gross!

review_title: Paper Towel and Napkins for a More Frugal Lifestyle
review_body: I use these as both paper towels and napkins due to their soft texture.  The VIVA brand is softest brand of paper towels I have come across.  They clean up spills and as a choose a sheet it is perfect to use as napkins.  There are cheaper alternatives out there, they are not as soft and absorbent.

review_title: You get what you pay for
review_body: The only reason I gave two stars is because they dry things. But they leave paper residue. They are horrible quality and extremely difficult to tear. I do not recommend for cleaning either. Actually, I do not recommend at all.

These are nice paper towels. I use these to clean my guns instead of buying expensive cloth patches. They are strong and do not fall apart.. They feel like a cotton fabric. I was shocked that these paper towels were that good. You will not be disappointed  with these.
I really like these paper towels. Very strong so you use less of it to last you longer. Good strong tissue. Best of all, I got it at a really good low price along with Cotonelle paper towels.

These are pretty effective.  Considering the cost of these with Subscribe and Save versus Bounty and Brawny, these definitely help the budget.  They aren't as high of quality as those two but are decent for getting the job done.
These are my favorite paper towels because they are soft enough to wipe a baby’s mouth. I like to wet these are use them instead of baby wipes with chemicals.

Super absorbent. I'm finding that we don't use as many because we don't need as many. It cuts down drastically on waste and saves us tons of money. I would highly recommend this product and I am buying it again on subscription.
My absolute favorite paper towels. Love the cloth-like texture, love the "pick-a-size" feature. And love that I can buy in bulk as these rolls tend to go faster than other paper towels!
My family loves these paper towels.  They are strong and one will do the job of several of the others. We will order these on a regular basis.

review_title: Why did I wait so long????
review_body: My wife kept telling me we should get this. For months I resisted. We had a crock pot, so why bother? We finally got this on sale on black Friday, and I LOVE IT.  Quicker than a crock pot and better end results. You can season your protien and cook it with veggies (which take on the flavor as well). After using this, anything you cook in a crock pot seems like a warm, swampy product. Anything you cook in this is moist, flavorful, tender excellence in just a fraction of the time. Do not hesitate to buy this product - you will thank yourself for meals to come.

review_title: Disappointed I can't get my broken lid replaced after paying for 3 year protection plan.
review_body: I loved this item purchased in Aug of 2015, but when I accidentally dropped and broke the lid, and called for a replacement lid, I was told my only choice was to return the item. What happens to my extra two years of appliance protection I purchased (3 years worth but one had elapsed). Need I find all the little spoons and rack I didn't keep track of when I replace it to get my money refunded. I was told I couldn't return the extra lid I ordered for it, and gasket because I'd not purchased insurance for those two (small) items. Frustrated with this situation. I see these pots are still being sold, why can't they just replace my broken lid?. Please say it ain't so and the clerk I spoke with on the phone made a mistake.

review_title: Defective Seal, Poor Customer Service, Great Pressure Cooker When It Works
review_body: Loved this pot the first time I used it. It made broth in just a few hours. It made melt-in-your-mouth pot roast in about an hour. I used it about 5 or 6 times, and then the last time I used it steam leaked out the rim of the lid. I watched the help videos on instant pot's website and discovered my ring was slightly stretched--something they admit can happen, though they say infrequently. Since I was well within the warranty period, I contacted them for a replacement. It took two days for them to get back to me and when they did, it was simply to request a picture. A day later, they sent me a note saying they couldn't see the defect, but that perhaps there was a small cut in the ring that they couldn't see. I did not appreciate being treated in this manner. In person, I could clearly see what they could not in a photo--the ring stretched after use. (And not from improper handling.) They asked for my shipping information and my receipt, which I sent. I am waiting for a reply. I assume they will still replace the ring. (I will update here if they do not.) In the meantime, I ordered a replacement ring myself. I'd like to use my pot on a near daily basis and didn't want to have to wait for slow customer service. Replacement rings are over $10 each and the shipping time on them (even with PRIME) is about a month. Their response could have been quicker and more customer friendly, for sure. I don't mind the price of a new ring if they actually last 2 years. I will be upset if the sealing rings don't last for at least 18 months.

Highly recommend this machine!  I have used it to cook everything from cheesecake, hard boiled eggs, mashed potatoes, mac and cheese and ribs and it all turned out perfectly. I did purchase a second insert.  Try cooking mashed potatoes, cheesecake and ribs with one liner all on the same night and you would purchase a second one too!  My must have extras:  A second stainless steel liner, stainless steel strainer basket, spring form pan and freezer food containers.

review_title: IF YOU WANT GOOD HEALTHY FAST MEALS THEN YOUVE GOT NOTHING TO LOSE!
review_body: I love it! Wholesome food has just been turned into fast food in our house!!! My husband and I have jobs that sometimes require long hours without much notice. So getting home at 7pm when you've started at 7am can leave you exhausted. And when your hungry your first though is "uuuugh I don't want to have to cook and WAIT an hour or 2 for it to get done! No no!. I've seen and heard such amazing reviews I finally decided to try it.. I bought the 6qt and loved it so much that 2 weeks later I also bought the 8qt. I use the 6qt for my side dishes and the 8qt to cook my main meats!. The lid and inner pot go right in to the dishwasher (after you pull apart the sealing ring on the lid so it can be washed and sanitized properly) so next to no clean up. You can buy your meats in bulk. Just cut your portions, season then freeze! This pressure cooker will even cook from frozen!. Collard greens in 10 minutes. Macaroni and cheese from scratch 10 mins. Whole, free range pasture raised young chicken 30 mins and sooooo juicy! Cheesecake 20 mins! Whole rack of pork ribs 45 mins and literally falling off the bone. Thick porkchops in a cream of mushroom sauce made from scratch 15 mins!. I encourage you all to try this out and you'll wonder how you went without. We very rarely if ever eat fast food or go to a restaurant now. In the time it takes my husband to jump in the car drive down to get fast food, order, pay and head home whatever I threw in the Instant Pot has about 5 or 10 more mins until done. Same thing goes with a restaurant. In the amount of time it takes for my food to come out after you go in, wait to be seated, and finally order.......15 more mins at home and I'll have the same thing but I know the ingredients I used to make it. NON GMO, ORGANIC, FAIR TRADE and not irradiated with a microwave to reheat!. I love both of my Instant Pots. I come from a family of home cooked meals, back when moms and dads worked full time 40+ hrs a week, did homework with the 4 of us kids when they got home and then mom would cook a meal (mostly from scratch with appropriate ratios of veggies to meats to starchy foods) while dad washed behind her as she cooked! I'll always prefer the taste of healthy home cooked meals over processed any day.  But time and energy was fading and it became a challenge to be the same superwoman my mom was (minus the 4 kids)!!! And now I can fit nutritious home cooked meals for my husband and I into our 40-60hr work week!. It's two fold! The more healthy home cooked meals you eat the more energy you have and the better you sleep. Until you do it you have no idea what you're missing out on! Go on give it a go! If you know your way around a kitchen......you'll love all of the things you can do with this!  And just like cell phones and submitting mobile reviews on Amazon you'll wonder how you ever got along without it :-). THANK YOU AMAZON AND INSTANT POT!!!!

review_title: Works well, but recipe adjustments for 3-Qt pot nonexistent.
review_body: The three-quart pot works as easily as described.  Add about ten minutes time to what the recipes say for the pot to get up to pressure.. Only real complaint is that the company referred me to a recipe web site when I asked about adjusting recipes for the smaller pot.. (I know: adjusting quantity for a smaller batch is trivial, but is there a cook-time adjustment, or an adjustment for liquid quantities, as a higher percentage of the liquid will be lost during cooking in a smaller pot.)  The recommended website had ZERO information for adjusting for the smaller electric pressure cooker, and did not respond to my blog questions.

review_title: Saved me time. Saved my relationship. Saved my future kids from diabeetus
review_body: I wish I could give this more than 5 stars. It makes me really stop to think "hmm... all of those other things I have given five star ratings to weren't nearly as life-alteringly amazing as this. Did they even DESERVE five stars, in comparison? None of those other items have taught me the meaning of life, why should they get as many stars as my Instant Pot??". I absolutely despise spending a lot of time in the kitchen after work. I am tired, just want to pour a glass of wine, and binge watch Supernatural. I mean *cough* some other, more respectable, grown up television program. Anywho, my boyfriend can't cook to save his life, so that isn't much help either. I'd feel better eating something created out of real, edible foods rather than microwaved in a pouch with fake cheese, so I cook even when I stay over at his house.. This all put me in a difficult spot, thinking about our future. Well, crap. What's going to happen one day when I have kids? If my boyfriend doesn't sharpen his cooking game, I will be the one stuck cooking for our future children. It kills my soul having to cook for JUST ME ALONE after a long day's work, how am I going to pull that off? Turn into a parent who picks up Taco Bell on a regular basis? (Don't get me wrong, I love Taco Bell). Be a constantly cranky and frazzled mom who gets no rest? (I anticipate that anyway, who am I kidding?) Just when I was pondering the option of breaking up and finding a man who can cook (not really), INSTANT POT HAPPENED!. Dinner is done and ready to eat every time in less than an hour. Sometimes WAY less than an hour. I can't believe I survived 30 years without one! It would have been AMAZING back when I was in college! I am constantly learning new things I can whip up (sometimes trial and error, sometimes recipe books). I can throw frozen chicken breasts in it, seasoning, just hit poultry setting, adjust the time up a bit, and boom. Super tender amazing chicken. Something about handling raw chicken makes me too disgusted to eat it once it's cooked, so being able to throw it in frozen is such a relief.. My favorite is to cube up some steak, dust it in taco seasoning, throw it into the pot with black beans and salsa. hit "meat/stew", and serve it on top of some wild rice. If I am feeling fancy, put chopped lettuce and tomato on top. If I feel EXTRA fancy, brown some onions with the "saute" function before everything goes in. It is so good every time! When I his an Instant Pot creativity roadblock, I just default to that! Also love making oatmeal in it. pro tip: grease the pot with butter before you put all the oatmeal stuff in.. I have bought one for myself, one for my boyfriend's place, one for my mom and dad, and one for my brother. That man of mine is GOING to learn how to cook; even if it is just with the Instant Pot. I have ranted and raved about it to so many people that I've coerced two coworkers, my landlord's wife, my auntie, two separate cousins, and a handful of facebook friends to buy one. They all love it too! Aaahh! It's like we are starting an Instant Pot cult! WE WILL TURN YOU *HISSSSSS*. Man, these guys get a lot of free advertising LOL. But hey, you can't argue with the kind of ratings this thing gets. It's definitely for a reason!! Thank you, Instant Pot, for sparing my future kids a childhood filled with fast food and microwaved pouch meals!

I really love this appliance.  I have replaced my rice cooker and egg cooker, and put my large crock pot into storage.  This thing does all those things and more.  And, as a single person, the size of the Mini is perfect.  I still get leftovers, but not days and days of leftovers.  The stainless steel pot is so much easier to clean than my crock pot, both in the sink and the dishwasher.  I think I will be using my Instant Pot at least once a week for a long time.

review_title: The BEST kitchen appliance I have ever owned!
review_body: I bought the DUO 6 quart because it offered both low and high pressure cooking. I saw the Bluetooth Instant pot, and I like technology, but...who's gonna put the food in it? lol. I hate to cook. Been doing Blue Apron for a few months and I loved Blue Apron. I decided it was time to cook on my own, and boy is this the best appliance I have ever purchased. I have cooked more using the Instant Pot than I ever have. Seriously, I can't believe the flavor of the food. The first thing I made was chicken thighs with carrots, celery, and onions. In 20 minutes, I had a meal that was so tasty even my daughter was impressed (knowing how I cook). The chicken was tender, the carrots were soft not mushy, and the flavor was incredible. When I would use a crock pot, everything I made was mushy and it all tasted the same.. The food I made in the Instant Pot was so good, that 3 of my friends bought it too, one bought the 8 quart. The stainless steel pot, along with parts being available thru Amazon is why I chose this one. There are great websites dedicated to Instant Pot, that makes finding recipes a breeze. The best thing I have figured out is this.... Find a recipe you like and use the ingredients you like, just follow approx cook time. Easy really. The user manual kinda overwhelmed me, until I realized it was in several languages..lol After you read it, go to page 17 and do the water test. (I saved the water for my house plants) Then get cooking.. Clean up...I have Farberware stainless steel I received as a wedding gift (lots) of years ago and when I burned things, was a pain to clean. But I knew I did not want a Teflon pot insert. You can saute' right in the stainless steel pot, and then close it up to pressure cooks. Surprised to say, this is easy to clean, especially after I learned to "deglaze" it...Don't laugh...  :). Occasionally I put in dishwasher just to disinfect. I found that I am using the manual mode way more than any programmed buttons.. I can't recommend it enough, from someone who really hates cooking. This is the start of my new years resolution to get healthy. According to Dr Mercola, steaming food is very healthy.  You will not be disappointed!. Oh my...When I saw I could add pictures I was so excited.... Leg of lamb, Brussels sprout in 10 minutes and didn't stink up the house, fresh beets...17 minutes! Pork and Sauerkraut, I could go on. I really hope this helps anyone thinking about this pressure cooker. LOVE IT!. I'm buying an air fryer next....for the crispy things...healthy crispy things.. Have a great time cooking in this Instant Pot, it has changed my life.

I've used stovetop and electric pressure cookers for a long time, and was excited to get on the Instant Pot train - I've given them as gifts to my kids and knew they did more than traditional pressure cookers.  But after the second use, I had a problem: the contents would start the countdown and finish the recipe without ever actually sealing the lid.  I was disappointed and mad at myself for getting a "gadget". Right away, I emailed customer service. I got a very prompt reply from Tasha, and she worked with me for 2 days explaining what went wrong.  She also explained how my "fix" wasn't really a "fix", so I learned something I thought I already knew.  The problem was mine, but she never made me feel that way and walked me through a few tests.  Bottom line is there are some variables that will possibly make your pot seem defective - but customer service will walk you through your issue and teach you a few things along the way.  Don't hesitate to contact support! I have complete confidence in this appliance, because of their commitment to an excellent customer experience.  I also love the recipe support.  Thanks, Tasha!

These pillow inserts were perfect for the 18 x 18 inch covers I bought. These pillows are a little bit smaller than the pillow covers, but it doesn't look too bad with them on. They are actually really comfortable, and I think it's a great value!
Nice & plump! I purchased the 16 x 16, and the covers ( also 16 x 16 ) I purchased separately fit beautifully!! Very pleased with this purchase!
No weight or firmness to them. Had to return.
Perfect, overstuffed pillow for vanity pillow case!  Very pleased!

review_title: Extremely soft and holds its shape well.
review_body: Extremely soft and holds its shape well.
Love

review_title: holds it's shape better than down (unless it's a very overstuffed down pillow ...
review_body: So comfy as an accent pillow insert, holds it's shape better than down (unless it's a very overstuffed down pillow - which is far more expensive)
Shipping was fast and product was as I expected.
Working well with our pillow cover.

Love these pillows.  I ordered pillows and pillow cases.  Site recommends order one size up.  I read reviews and decided I would order 18x18 pillow stuffer and cases, glad I did as they are perfect.  I will be ordering more fillers for my sofa.  Good price, good product.

review_title: says it does a great job!
review_body: Got this for the wife, I believe she has steamed everything in the house!!! She loves it, says it does a great job!!
Excelent product
Great Little Steamer for the price. Can't beat it.
It’s really good, I guess I was expecting more but my expectations might have been too high.

review_title: It was so easy getting wrinkles out
review_body: I just finished using the steamer. It was so easy getting wrinkles out! The very wrinkled, light-weight blouse took about two minutes. The heavier linen jacket took longer but still came out perfect.
I love it! So easy to use!

review_title: without the normal wear and tear Irons can have on nice clothing. Very happy with this product
review_body: I received this product a few days ago and have been using it every night.  Keeps clothes Fresh and Clean, without the normal wear and tear Irons can have on nice clothing.. Very happy with this product, thank you!

review_title: Great steamer. I was so amazed how great this ...
review_body: Great steamer. I was so amazed how great this product worked. Its hand held so its easy to handle. My fiance had a blast steaming my dress for our engagement session. Great product for a great price..
Easy to use! Perfect for removing stubborn wrinkles, especially in folded clothes. Highly recommend

review_title: I bought this steamer as a gift so I can’t ...
review_body: I bought this steamer as a gift so I can’t rate it. However shipping was really fast. No issues with that at all.
I love these! Hung them behind plain white curtains and they add a beautiful glow to the room.

review_title: Super cute! Love these and all the various settings ...
review_body: Super cute! Love these and all the various settings they have. They were a bit too long for the space where I hung them but an easy zip tie fix. I want them in every room!
The best addition to my bedroom.  Beautiful! Easy to install!  Vibrant in color. Def worth it!

review_title: Perfect lighting, easy to put up
review_body: Used them for a backdrop on a makeshift photo booth during the holidays. Perfect lighting, easy to put up, simple packaging, and great length.

I bought these for our wedding. Loved them! Got many compliments. My only regret is that I should have brought another strand as the width was shorter then I thought. It all worked out but I will probably buy another strand anyway for future parties!
These lights are amazing! Way better than expected. They feel nice, good quality, bright and have a few different modes. They have a clear strand that looks good behind a curtain. Highly recommend!

review_title: I love these! I was worried that they wouldn't be ...
review_body: I love these! I was worried that they wouldn't be bright enough or cheaply made but they're actually really good. It comes with a little box that changes the rhythm of the lights which i think is so cute! I hung them up where the blinds usually go and i only have one curtain up at the moment, I'm waiting for my second one to arrive but for now this is what they look like during the day.

review_title: I put this up around my speakers and its a great accent piece for parties
review_body: can we say party central lights?  I put this up around my speakers and its a great accent piece for parties.
LOVE these!! using them for christmas, but i think we’ll find other excuses to use them throughout the year.
These are gorgeous and I love the different light settings it has! I’m thinking about buying more!

Love these towels! They are great price & quality. They clean up very well too! (I wash them separately from any other things) I use them to detail inside & outside of car, also for glass cleaning, and cleaning around the house. I will definitely be buying more!

review_title: Too much lint for cleaning glass
review_body: Seem to be fairly well made, and you get what you pay for. Probably good for most microfiber type cleaning tasks, but I bought these to clean glass and they leave behind lots of sparkly lint which makes them no good for this task.  For cleaning glass I recommend getting a waffle weave type microfiber cloth.

I had somehow hoped these would be lint free.  Can't use them on my windows because of the link they leave behind.  Many have said they are soft but I found them almost plastic feeling.  Definitely not soft.  Careful what you wash them with because the colors do fade when washed (though that didn't bother me). Size was plenty large.

I have only used a few so far but so far they are great. I have used them for my stainless steel appliances and for my TV/computer/camera screens. I will try and make sure I use a different color for each different application. After I use them I immediately toss them into my laundry bin to make sure i use them for nothing else till I was them. They are a nice size and feel like they are well made. 24 at this price, who can complain.

review_title: Not Worthy of the Amazon Name
review_body: These towels are smaller, thinner, and have a shorter nap than any other microfiber cloths I have used; they are virtually disposable.  Very disappointing, and I'm sorry to say that they do not live up to Amazon's normally high standards.  I have been very happy with my other AmazonBasics purchases, but I will not order these again, nor can I recommend them.

Pros:. Super cheap. Huge package. Great for cleaning the house. very absorbent. very durable. Cons:. These are NOT color fast. They definitely bleed. If you wash them together, they will transfer color onto each other, even after several washings.. If you dry them, it kind of wrecks them. I have accidentally thrown a couple in the dryer with other clothing.  Once they have been dried, they get sort of a velcro situation and stick to each other and themselves.. Contrary to what I've read here, they do still leave little lint particles on windows and mirrors, not horribly bad, but they are there nonetheless.. Lastly, the thing I don't like is how EVERYTHING sticks to them even after washing. I use them to wash the floors, etc. Even after washing there is always debris stuck in them (grass mostly) I don't want to spend time picking grass and junk out of a cleaning rag so I'm trying to keep the cloths I use for cleaning and dusting separate when I wash them. Kind of a pain, since the last thing I want to do is take special care of cleaning rags!
The cloths work very well. Ours came in three colors as indicated. Different colors are handy since we can allocate each color for a different purpose.

review_title: Awesome value, much better pricing than Walmart.
review_body: I didn't think these would be very high quality, but they're fantastic!  Just follow what the package says and wash them first, otherwise they're not terribly absorbent (not like a used microfiber is). These compare well with the expensive ones I get at O'Reilly and Walmart from the automotive cleaning section, but at a fraction of the price. Going to have to get more soon!

review_title: Really good for buffing out scratches and putting oil and conditioner ...
review_body: Use them for cleaning wood, screens, and my boots. Really good for buffing out scratches and putting oil and conditioner on my leather boots. They do initially have lint, so be aware.
Use to detail inside my truck and was windows/lights. Easy to clean in washer, but may lack a bit in quality although is affordable for someone who doesn't mind that.

Bought this to replace a scale that died, and it was so inexpensive I thought it would be cheap, but its not.  Works well, easy to read, the weight seems accurate (but I don't have anything to compare it to).  The only down side is that it is black so it gets dirty looking easily.  I wish I could get it in a gray.  I don't know how long the batteries last because I have only had it for a month or two, but it's easy enough to change the batteries.  I recommend.

review_title: not working right after the first week!
review_body: This scale stopped working correctly right after the first week. I am not even keeping it in the bathroom, so it has not been wet or anything. It is kept inside the box in which it was shipped and I took it out to use it every week. The only time it showed the right weight was the first time I used it. The next week, it started showing two different numbers. It has been showing random numbers ever since. Sometimes it shows 10 lbs over or less. My husband and son have been using it too and got the same missed up results.

review_title: ... part of my Prime deals and it had a good rating. Opened the package and read the instructions
review_body: Bought this scale as it was a part of my Prime deals and it had a good rating. Opened the package and read the instructions, took the plastic trip out of the battery compartment, the blue light came on and the scale read 0.00 lbs. Put it on the ground, stepped on then off and nothing happened. Stood on it and nothing happened. Broken out of the box. I will be trying to get a refund and purchase something not from Etekcity.

Love these scales, they are very sleek looking and attractive!  These digital scales are so much better than the ones we had which were not digital and had little slash marks for the graph!  They seem to work perfect for a great price!  Thanks...

review_title: Great scale that seems accurate through multiple weighings
review_body: Great scale that seems accurate through multiple weighings.  I like that you don't have to so that tap...wait... OK.  You just step on it and boom you got your weight!. Another great thing is that it stays lit and displaying the weight for a short while after stepping off the scale.  I like this because I can weight  myself in a position  that will provide  a more accurate  reading.. Can't  beat the price too.

review_title: You will not regret this purchase!!
review_body: This is the first product review I have felt compelled to write out of the hundreds of purchases I have made on Amazon.com....but wanted to share my delight. My scale came with explicit and super simple instructions on how to operate it and even came with batteries.  Also, the accuracy of the scale is important as I am competing in a contest with colleagues and ease of photography and accuracy of weight is important. I was also impressed with the other information that was provided about body weight in general,  what to expect,  etc. Overall, I highly recommend the Etekvity digital scale.

Works great! I was apprehensive in getting this one due to the low price point as I thought it may not work. But decided to give it try. Love it. It works perfectly and most importantly, it's very consistent. I can step on it 4 times in a row and get the same weight. My old one would vary a little each time.

review_title: Works ok, but doesn't seem that accurate.
review_body: For the money, this scale is a pretty good value, but it isn't perfect by any means.  It reads to the tenth of a pound, but I don't think that it accurately weighs to the tenth of a pound.  It always seems to say the same numbers.  I'll weigh my self and it will say 168.8.  Then I'll pick up something close by, but relatively light, like my phone, and it will still read 168.8.  Even though I know my phone probably weighs close to a pound.  As long as it is consistently wrong, though, it is still useful.

The right size, no extra (and unscientific) body-fat measurement or other hoopla: just a great, accurate scale.  Doesn't save your weights, so your nosey neighbors have to leave their curiosity unquenched.  Had mine for over a year now and no problems, even in a humid bathroom.  Display is easy to see.  Haven't even replaced the battery.  Don't have to step on and off it to "adjust" it.  Accurate to the doctor's scale. Excellent product.

My scale just arrived and I've used it once.  Hopefully this scale will be accurate and the batteries are going to be a lot simpler to change than the last one.  I'll have a better idea in a month or so.  The numbers are easy to see on this one.
Excellent quality i purchase this product all the time. Would diffently recommend'!
I really like this but they keep raising the price.
Great value!
"Good Product" Will Buy Again saves me $$'s also

review_title: I've bought these multiple times and they are great. Nice quality paper towels and they get the ...
review_body: I've bought these multiple times and they are great. Nice quality paper towels and they get the job done. I won't spend an extra $5 for Bounty and alike for the same thing. I highly recommend these.
Great for the price way better than store generic brands
Towles very good, but used too fast.  Should have a half size to save on amount used.
I prefer the full sheet paper towels. These work well for the price.

review_title: They are just as good as
review_body: Our family loves these paper towels! They are just as good as bounty

review_title: Already good product improved upon with new design
review_body: I like the new design which removes the need to soak the filters for 15 minutes.  Great improvement.. Overall, these perform that same as the old design.  They provide better tasting water for sure.  We can tell the difference when we use the filtered water vs. non-filtered, especially when making coffee and tea.. Good product.

review_title: Stopped working after a few weeks
review_body: Possibly a bad batch, but I bought this in July 2018 and it stopped working after about a month. After doing a Google search of fixing a filter, the first result brought me to the product page for the Longlast filter on Brita's website. Turns out everyone is having this problem and that's what all the comments are on. I can't believe I paid money for this. I'll probably go back to the regular filters.

review_title: Don't waste your money - these filters barely work
review_body: Don't waste your money - these filters barely work. Some reviews claim that the water runs through too fast, in our case...not at all.. SO ANNOYED.

The first filter worked well, but the next two were unusable.  They filter water very slowly and leak carbon so that every glass of water you pour has black dust swirling around the bottom.  I tried a number of different tricks to fix them - squeezing them or submerging them in water to remove any air bubbles trapped in the filter - but it didn't help.

review_title: This filter sucks. It worked for a month and then clogged ...
review_body: This filter sucks. It worked for a month and then clogged completely. I tried everything technique I could find online to unclog it but ended up having to throw it away. What a waste of money.

review_title: The difference in taste is surprising!
review_body: Oh my god!  The difference from drinking tap water is outstanding!  I couldn't stand drinking my city water because it had that horrible copper taste.  Luckily I was handed down an old Brita Pitcher from my brother and it needed some filters.  I purchased three of these and expect them to last me a year.  It's really simple to install and use.

Bought these for a water pitcher I previously purchased and it seems that not all of the water is filtering through the filter and it is coming through the sides even though it is in properly. What is the point if it is defective =(

The claim that these filters can last up to six months is nonsense. They become too slow to use within a month or two (and I live in a city with pretty clean municipal water--the filter shouldn't clog so quickly). They also leave far more carbon dust in the water than the regular Brita filters. These "longlife" filters are not worth the added expense--I wouldn't even buy them if they were the same price as the regular ones.

review_title: Did Not Last Long For Me!!!
review_body: I'm so disappointed! I bought this filter because it was supposed to last up to 6 months but it only lasted about 2 weeks. It now takes about 8 hours for just one round!

Love Brita. I recently did a heavy metal detox and am being very cautious about tap water. This has been so helpful. I replace it every 4 months because I use it so often. I have one in the fridge and one on the counter.

review_title: I've used this mattress protector every night for over a month and love it!!
review_body: I have had this product now for well over a month and have slept on it every night and washed it several times. I highly recommend it!  I have tried several mattress protectors because I have two small kids who love to hop into bed with me.  I decided to order the SafeRest protector because of the great reviews.  I needed a lightweight, waterproof protector that wouldn't make me sweat all night because everyone I've tried makes me extremely hot!!  I received my package quickly and washed it on the delicate cycle right away.  Fits my Leesa bed perfectly, I love it and will be purchasing more for the other beds in my home.

review_title: I also like that it's quiet and doesn't sound like you are ...
review_body: This work really well for my purpose in that I have a very old dog that sleeps with me and sometimes she has accidents. I have thought for sure it would soak through but when I've removed the cover the bed has no stains and was completely dry. I also like that it's quiet and doesn't sound like you are sleeping on anything plasticky. The only improvement is I would like it to be waterproof on the edges at least halfway down on the sides because sometimes accidents happen on the edge of the bed.

review_title: Protection doesn't hold up 3 months later.
review_body: Update: Changed to two stars because it now doesn't seem to do much at all, after a couple washes/month for 3 or 4 months, even with using a tech wash detergent to help with waterproofing. Still better than not having it on the mattress, but not by much.. Original review: Works well so far, my daughter has a couple accidents, nothing got to the mattress. I was hoping for a smooth surface, but it's terry cloth like instead.

This is the most comfortable mattress protector I have ever slept on.  All of the others that say they "breathe" and won't be hot, always are.  But, not this one - slept on it last night with no overheating, no crinkling, just complete comfort.  Haven't had to utilize the waterproof feature, and hopefully never will, but you can see the waterproof layer underneath, so I have no doubt it will work.. I will update with further information, if any changes.

review_title: Thank you for fast delivery of the perfect solution for a pregnant mother to be
review_body: Thank you for fast delivery of the perfect solution for a pregnant mother to be!  I hosted a young pregnant mother in my home,  due to go into labor at any time.  I purchased the mattress protector to save my guest bed mattress if her water broke during the night while she was sleeping.  Well....of course it did break in the middle of the night, and this protector did just what it was supposed to do.....kept the mattress clean, dry, and stain free.  Easy to strip from the bed and wash.  I hung it on a rack to dry, then ran it through the dryer with air only to soften and fluff.  An added bonus is the protector has such a nice backing on it, it hardly feels like a "rubber sheet".  And, with a flannel sheet over it, it's nearly undetectable.

This is my second one that I have purchased. The first one I bought for my bed and bought a second one for my toddler's bed. I can't quite comment on the waterproof aspect of it yet as I just put it on my son's bed and I don't have any problems in my bed. I like that it is not bulky, doesn't make the bed hotter, and doesn't make any noise. It's also affordable compared to many others I've looked at.

My mattress is HUGE, 14" to be exact, so it's hard to find sheets and protectors that fit it properly. This fits really nicely, I like the material it's made out of and it's comparable to the really expensive one we got from Mattress Firm. I haven't tested how water proof it is yet and quite frankly, I hope I never do.

We bought a new mattress for Christmas and wanted to protect it from our 4 small dogs. As pet lovers know, accidents happen. Guess what? Nothing got thru this mattress pad. The mattress doesn’t have a single mark on it. I would highly recommend this product to everyone, whether you have kids, pets, or are just accident prone. This will protect your mattress investment.

These are GREAT!  When my 4 year old has an accident this keeps the mattress completely clean and dry.  I had to order a second so we don't have to wait for it to get out of the laundry.  I saw some complain it takes a long time to dry but I do not have this problem.  Love, love, love it!  I'm sure I'll be purchasing a couple more when my daughter is out of diapers!!!!. Update!. These are still amazing so I purchased one for our bed since my little ones tend to migrate in the middle of the night and one had an accident in our bed. Just love them. Super durable and gets the job done.

review_title: Have one for every bed in our house.
review_body: I bought one of these when we transitioned our kiddo to a 'big kid' twin sized bed. It has held up perfectly and has never once failed to stop all liquids (spills, accidents, even vomit- ugh) from keeping the mattress clean. I eventually bought one for every bed in our home. With 5 pets and a child, you just can't be too careful! They are super easy to pull off and wash if needed, and have saved our beds from resentful/naughty pet messes as well. The great thing too, is that these are easily 3x as much as target, for the target brand. There is no way they could be any better for the price. Also- last thought- you would never know they are there- there is no plastic-y feel or sound. Highly recommend.

review_body: My cat got to the box before I could do a double take... We’re going to be using not just the paper towels! Lmao! 😹😂 They are great for the price and if we get mice... easy to wrap em up and... you can guess the rest...
