review_title: This is my favorite paper towel of all the ones I've used
review_body: This is my favorite paper towel of all the ones I've used.. We're trying to reduce the amount of trash we produce in our household, so cutting down on paper towels is one of the steps we're taking. I love these paper towels because they are SO LUXE and high quality. They are strong and soft and have high absorbing powers. I find that I have to use less because they absorb so well. I am also able to wring them out in water and reuse them because they hold up in water so well. They are strong like cloth and also soft against skin.. Each roll comes with 90 sheets and they last me quite a long time. I can go over a month on one roll. I am being extra conservative, but these are great quality.. NOTE: Like some other reviewers have mentioned, there is some fuzz that leaves a white fuzz residue. I don't use this paper towel to clean windows or mirrors because it leaves a trail. Not much, but it's there. I use it to tackle tough cleanups and spills. If I want perfect windows and mirrors, I use a lint-free towel. If you keep this in mind, you won't be disappointed with these towels.

review_title: The best paper towel by far
review_body: The best paper towel by far! What more can I say? These are super absorbent and durable yet also very soft, almost like the cloth of a t shirt. Perfect for messy children, pets, or husbands. In addition the great quality, the price was pretty good too. I have been purchasing household items more and more on Amazon lately and I couldn't be happier! Between the best prices, the money you save buying in bulk, plus the discount you get when using Subscribe and Save, you can really save a lot of money when you add it all up.

This is as cool as everyone says it is. But I'm deducting a star for two reasons, and I hope the manufacturer will take note. The major reason is that the metal edges around the inside of the lid, especially where they stick out (see photo), were not properly buffed out and had some very sharp edges. I got two small cuts on my fingers from them. Nothing serious, but this should NEVER happen in a product like this. It's a problem on the line. Second, the silicon gasket that seals the lid has a very strong, chemical smell out of the box. We have many silicon appliances, and I've never noticed anything like that. Washing in hot water and the "trial run" they suggest took care of it. But it makes a very bad first impression when you think that something with such a nasty smell is going to be intimately connected to a hot, high pressure cooking process. I emphasize that we are very happy with the purchase and with what we have prepared so far. This would be a 5-star review if not for the points I have raised.

review_title: * I like the pressure cooking feature
review_body: * I like the pressure cooking feature. It cuts down the traditional 45-minute adobo to 10 minutes.. * I wouldn't recommend cooking pasta in it, as it fills the steam collector quickly and makes a mess.. * Beans are all right, but make sure to have a lot of water to prevent burning the beans.. * Saute mode is nice, the tall pot keeps the oil from splattering on the top rim.. * One star less because the odor stays no matter how well you wash the pot, gasket, and lid.. * As long as you don't use abrasive scrubbing pads, the stainless steel pot retains its shine!. * Removable cord is convenient and is a safety feature!. * The noise it makes when opening and closing is cool and is akin to those fancy Japanese rice cookers.

review_title: No longer the product it once was
review_body: I've been an Instant Pot owner and user since the first ones were offered for sale in ~2014.  We really liked our first IP but we replaced it in 2015 when the Duo model was introduced in order to take advantage of some of its new features.  That IP lasted for two years and we used it a lot, both as a pressure cooker and as a slow cooker.  In September 2017 our Duo failed and we replaced it with the then current model which was known as V2 (version 2).. It didn't take very long for us to realize that something was wrong with our V2 Duo because it couldn't Slow Cook.  It would try but the temperature of the liquid in the pot was in the 150-160 degree range rather than 180-200 range.  After discussion with IP customer service, the pot was replaced with a new V3 model in January.. Unfortunately, the V3 IP appears to have the same or worse problems as did the V2 it replaced.  Our efforts to use it as a pressure cooker have resulted in "Burn" warnings for recipes we've used for years without problems.  Unfortunately, it also appears to be useless as a slow cooker.  Today I nearly ruined a simple pot roast because after 3 hours the slow cook function stopped heating even though the control panel showed that operations were normal.. I'm sure that the folks at IP will offer me a new pot; frankly, at this point I just want my money back. In the past 6 months I've ruined quite a few dinners because of cooking failures.  This is totally unacceptable and I hate to have to hover over my cooking utensil to ensure that it is working correctly.  If I can get my money back I'm going to buy a Breville.  Yes, it costs more but in this case I think you may well get what you pay for!

review_title: Die today, no display when plug-in power cord.
review_body: working fine until it dies..  Today the Pot die in the mid of cooking beans, and won't come back again..   plug-in the power cord into outlet, and no power and No display..   Only two and half month purchased and no more than 6 times use.  according the user manual, it may due to fuse burnt..   Since it exceed the return windows, I had to contact the Warranty, hope they can help, but still no answer

I absolutely love this thing. I have made everything from ribs, steak, soup, rice, eggs, to  crème brûlée and everything in between in this pot. It saves so much time cooking. I cooked/ prepped 90% of easter dinner in it. What a life and time saver. My husband and I love one pot meals and this does the trick. The only thing I don't like is the pot will hold the scent the last cooked meal, yuck. It doesn't alter the flavor of the next but thats kinda gross. This makes me wonder about the quality of the stainless steel. I thought the 8qt might be too big for just myself and hubby but it's great having the extra room when I need it.

review_title: Yougurt maker and SO much more
review_body: This kitchen tool is the cats meow!. Seriously!!!. I bought for the primary purpose of making yogurt. Which it does... perfectly!. But also have made several dishes as well as toasted an entire chicken in well under 30 minutes!  Everything comes out moist and flavorfully infused!. I made a pot of brown rice, the rice was plump and moist. Excellent. The cooking time was cut by approx 35%. I think the 6 quart all in one instaPot is the best kitchen tool I have ever had. It can replace your slow cooker, rice cooker and is easy to clean. I do recommend purchasing the extra lid gaskets. I did not, and I had a heck of a time Terri g my corned beef and cabbage smell out of the gasket. Will be ordering extras to havenone set aside just for yogurt making.. Oh.... and the yogurt? It is so creamy and delicious. You can leave in for just 8 hours for a healtybprobiotic yogurt that still had some natural sugar inherent to the mil.. Or cook for full 24 hours for the most heath benefits.. The full 24 hour yogurt cycle (standard setting) cooks off the rest of the sugars and develops billions and billions of super probiotic bacteria, that tastes like heaven! So creamy and delicious!. I start my morning with a couple of tablespoons of the probiotic yogurt topped with anti-inflammation raspbbrrrirs, blueberries,blackberries and sometimes a little bit of banana.. For added fiber, I often sprinkle some kashi crisp or other kashi cereal.. Amazing!

review_title: I’d give this 10 stars if I could!
review_body: Okay. This is quite possibly the coolest, most versatile kitchen gadget I’ve ever owned. I love it so much, that I’ve purchased 2 more for friends and relatives. What does it do? I think the real question is “What can’t it do?” I truly believe you could replace every cooking appliance (including your oven and stove top) and do EVERYTHING in the Instant Pot. I purchased two sizes for my own use: the mini 3-quart (which is my almost-every-day work horse for 2 person dishes) and the 8-quart (which I bring out to handle my dinner party dishes). I have also purchased no less than 5 Instant Pot recipe books, and everything I’ve tried has been fabulous. In the realm of kitchen appliances, there is no better investment than the Instant Pot. My hat’s off to the inventors of this amazing appliance. Highly recommended!!!

review_title: Fuse died after warranty expiration. No replaceable fuse!!
review_body: So, I loved using my previously purchased Instant Pot, but it died after 2 years.  The company told me it sounded like a blown fuse.  Unfortunately, they use a proprietary screw to access the fuse and I would not be able to change it myself.  Therefore, they recommended I purchase a new Instant Pot.  To make the new purchase less painful, the company’s representative said she would send me an invoice to my email address with a small price reduction.  Yet, I never received the invoice.  She told me to check my junk folder (but it wasn’t there).  The funny thing is that the customer service rep could send me emails each day and I would receive them.  But, whenever she would send me an email with the reduced-price invoice, it would, mysteriously, not make it to me.  I suspect she was just testing my patience (and she won).  I ended up paying full price for a new Instant Pot.. In short, the product is awesome, but the company appears to have a greed component.  The Instant Pot is definitely well-made and should stand up to many years of use—if not for the fuse that’s designed to fail right after the warranty expires.  If you can’t tolerate this type of behavior from a company, then don’t buy this product.  Otherwise, be prepared to buy a new Instant Pot every couple of years (like me).

review_title: Best Appliance I have ever owned especially in our RV
review_body: I have used a pressure cooker most of my married life (50+ years) but this is the best one I have ever had. No worry about the pressure being too high or too low because you can't get the stove heat adjusted just right. We live in an RV and having an appliance do more than one job is absolutely essential when you have a lack of storage space. I was able to get rid of my slow cooker and my pressure cooker and replace them both with this marvelous pot! This past weekend we went to a potluck and I made deviled eggs - using 2 dozen eggs. The one part of preparing the eggs is the hardboiling of them and the peeling. Most of the time the eggs do not peel well. This time I steamed them in the Instant Pot and they cooked beautifully and peeled with no problem. Every egg was perfectly cooked and peeled. If I didn't use it for anything else, it was well worth the price. I will be using it for lots of other cooking lots of other things. I have used the rice cooker and it makes wonderful and tasty rice that is not mushy or undercooked. I have cooked chicken and pork in it using both the slow cooker and the pressure cooker selections. I have not been disappointed with any the recipes I have cooked. I would definitely recommend purchasing one.

Ohhh man this thing is a game changer! My husband bought me the 8quart for an early Christmas gift, and it's AMAZING! I suck at remembering to take things out to defrost, so it's perfect for me. So far I made (in one pot) pork chili verde burritos, chicken and rice casserole, bbq shredded chicken sandwiches, and lastnight, a frozen solid pot roast! No joke, frozen pot roast turned into falling apart delicious goodness with potatos and carrots in 90 mins! It seriously took 4 mins to cook the potatos and carrots. Frozen chicken from costco in 15 mins. Ive  had almost no dishes to do all week long. It's friggin awesome. Can't say enough good stuff about it. I have a family of 3, but i bought the 8 quart, because i make leftovers for my husbands lunch the next day. And im so glad i got the bigger one. It's huge very large (about the size of a new wave oven) but worth the extra space you get inside. I could see myself being dissapointed  if I would have gone with the 6quart. Because you can only fill it up 2/3 of the way. All in all great buy, I'm giving away my crockpot. Makes food 10x better and faster. Also one thing to mention, is cabinets... when you push back the vent switch, there is alot of steam. I knew there was steam before I bought it ( thanks to schooling myself on YouTube videos before it arrived in the mail) but I was not aware of how much steam, and that it shoots out steam for a while. First time I used it, I pulled it away from my cabinets, but it still shot right up and got them wet with steam. Anyway, so I wanted to pre warn anybody, to make sure before you buy this that you have a place for it that is not directly over wood cabinetry. Anyway, good luck with your new purchase! Best gift I've ever gotten.

This is the best bathroom scale I have ever owned.  It is so accurate.  I check it often by my manual scale and it is always on point.  I would definitely buy this scale again.  I ordered this scale on Nov. 3, 1915.  I have now used it for nine months.  It is still the best bathroom scale I have owned because of its accuracy.  I also love the sleek design and the large digital display.  I would most definitely buy it again and I highly recommend this scale.

The weight seems to be right on track to the tenth of a pound. My only complaint is that every day when I pull it out to weigh myself, the first weight shown is always 2 or 3 pounds more than my actual weight and then when I weigh myself again and the correct weight shows. I'm not sure if it has anything to do with the way I lean it up against the wall when not in use?  Either way it is still good buy for not a lot of money .

Quality scale with ultra sleek modern look. Great lighted LCD display, and quick response when stepping on the scale. I purchase a scale from Walmart for about the same price and this item is 10 times better. Very secure when stepping on the scale and NO TIPPING! I cant count the number of times I nearly fell because my old scale tipped when you would step on it. Love this item!

After about half a year of almost daily use...I can honestly say that I have no gripes with this scale. It's accurate, easy to read, and the battery lasts long. What more could you want from a scale? I keep it in the bathroom under a shelf, and the humidity and moisture have not affected it. The scale turns off automatically after a period of inactivity. It turns on by itself when you step on it. Super convenient! I would definitely buy again.

review_title: Bought two. They weigh me different.
review_body: Bought two of these. They weigh me at 8/10 of a pounds difference on the same floor in the same clothes side by side. Having said that at least they both consistently weigh me at different weights. One scale sticks to the weight it initially weighed me at and the other one sticks to the different weight it initially weighed me at. Other than that issue good scale for the price.

Pros:. 1. It works.. 2. Unlike some scales, you get the same weight no matter where/how you stand on it.. 3. Unlike some scales, you get the same weight each time you step on it.. Cons:. 1. It may seem like nitpicking, but it would be good if the backlight brightness can be adjusted. While testing the scale, I had to keep looking at the number and the backlight caused an afterimage for around a minute.. 2. Not a fan of glass stuff, even if tampered. A bit worried it'd break and hurt me.

review_title: Less than 30 days, and has stopped working!! 😡
review_body: If I could leave no star I would. I've had this scale less than a month, and it's stopped accurately weighing. It displayed that my slender friend weighed 390 pounds. That my 11lb cat was 100lbs. It comes on by itself, and starts weighing... I don't know, the air I guess? And that's if it doesn't display error. I thought the biggest issue would be breaking it. And the return policy for this item is bogus. I've had this less then 30 days and it's not eligible for return?

I really like the scale at first, now it flashes different weights and doesn’t even register when I’m stepping on the scale, I tried to change the batteries and it still didn’t fix it. So now I’ve wasted my money on batteries and this defective scale. Also will mention I’ve only had it for a Month and it stayed tucked in the corner of my tile floored bathroom. UPDATE: contacted the company, they are sending me a new scale, their customer service is amazing and they made things right immediately, my opinion is completely changed!!

I ordered this a few weeks ago and have been using it once a week to track weight loss progress. I am very impressed with the sleek design (black glass, blue backlight, very thin) and it's sturdiness. It's easy to use, just step on it! I have had several similar scales but they were temperamental and had to be picked up and sat back down several times before turning on. This one definitely works well and I weighed my toddler for accuracy because she just had a physical and her weight was the same at home as at the doctors office. Great price too!

It accurately measures weight, but the screen is very dim. I tried replacing the batteries and it didn't fix it.. -Update 8/7/2018, I changed my rating to 5 stars because the seller took care of the problem.
Did not keep it's form at all.

review_body: I chose this over other lights because I can change the settings. Got to create a variety of moods in my living room. :)

These lights are dim... like really, really dim. You can really only see them if they're the ONLY light source - keep looking if you (like me) just want them to work alongside other lights. Definitely regret this purchase.

review_body: I love these. I hung them inside with a sheer curtain and it really gives the room a different look. Get you some command strips and hang them up.
Got this as a last minute Xmas decoration for outside of the house. Has worked out great so far through the rain and snow.

review_title: They looked amazing, and were very easy to work with
review_body: I purchased two sets of these lights for a portrait background for a fundraiser. They looked amazing, and were very easy to work with. I tacked them to the wall and used white sheer curtains over top.  I think one set would have been too sparse, so I am glad I purchased two. We had many compliments on our backdrop.
Better than expected, I can't believe how inexpensive this is. I was glad to see it has 3 magnets at the bottom which help it cling to the side of the tub.
So far I like my shower curtain liner. Only time will tell whether or not I will get any mildew. I really hope I don't. I have not had any luck with the other brands I've had in the past.
Love the material as it allows more light to shine through making the shower feel brighter.

review_title: Questionable value,appears very flimsy.  After showering I found my prior concerns unfounded.A great liner
review_body: It has no unpleasant or any other odor which is great but the curtain is very light weight with out substance so I doubt if it will stay. Inside my shower stall and prevent water from getting all over the floor.  After showering. I found this to be an excellent liner.It stayed in place and rinsed off well.

I really like this liner, it's thicker than most brands, crystal clear, it's smell free, with a weighted bottom (4 equally spaced and reinforced) which helps keep ALL the water in the shower. Spray some standard cleaner and rinse regularly and you'll have no reason to scrub it or buy another liner for a long time.
I love this shower curtain liner is mildew resistance. Less cleaning.  Good quality.

This shower curtain liner is exactly what I was looking for. It is steardy and lays well. It does have magnets to help it stay in place. When it is time to replace this one or others in the house, I will be buying more.

I took a chance on this after purchasing several that said they were no smell. Ugh...I hate opening up the package to that nasty, chemical smell. This was great. Nice weight to it and best of all, no yucky smell.

review_title: It's a shower curtain liner. It was in one ...
review_body: It's a shower curtain liner. It was in one piece when I took it out of the package. What more does one hope for?

review_title: Environmentally friendly liner lets in lots of light.
review_body: Clear shower curtain liners let in more light into the shower, which is really nice.  Solid color liners made the shower darker, so this was a nice change.  I love that this liner is so environmentally friendly!  Great price.
I ordered these years ago and they are still holding up just great! Such a great cleaning bargain with so many uses.

review_title: Bang for the buck,  but don't expect high quality.
review_body: Decent,  but not high quality.  Worth the price,  but if you're looking for high quality,  this is not the stuff. I'm happy with the purchase,  this time. Next time I'll get thicker and higher quality.
Needed cleaning cloths for cleaning people and odd jobs around the house.  These are perfect.  Washable.  And do a great job of cleaning anything.  Don't fall apart like most rags.

review_title: I would buy these again although I doubt I will need to for years.
review_body: These are a great value and have held up beautifully. I am very pleased with them. We have replaced paper towels with these and now keep only one roll of paper towels to clean up pet accidents. These cloths clean well, dry dishes well and were cheap.

review_title: You really do get what you pay for
review_body: Bought these for my son and his apartment because I honestly don't know if they will be used. They seem fine for a quick wipe of the counter or a very small mirror but for myself I need thicker larger cloths for actually cleaning.
Low quality and lose color after you wash it
Great for cleaning anything! Love these microfiber cloths. A word of advice is to wash them and then let them air dry!

I bought these thinking they would be lint-free, but they are not. Every time you wipe with these you leave a bunch of little lint balls the color of each towel. Do yourself a favor and fork out a little extra dough for lint-free, unless you want to pick little lint balls all day.

review_title: they're probably fine. I use microfiber cloths regularly to help dry ...
review_body: If you're just going to use these for drying dishes other light interior housework, they're probably fine. I use microfiber cloths regularly to help dry my car after a wash, and these are by far the flimsiest, most unimpressive cloths I've ever worked with. They're very thin and light so their water absorption potential is low. I can see these things getting thrashed easily with repeated use. I've moved on to other, thicker, more heavy-duty brands of microfiber clothes.

review_title: Wife of carving man on Microfiber Cleaning Cloths
review_body: Love these cloths for doing anything and everything.  I kept some for the kitchen and carving man got some for his man-cave areas.  They do shrink, but I knew they probably would.  They make very nice dish washing cloths and kitchen cleanup cloths.
Comparable to Sparkle. Product worked very well. No issues.
great very affordable
These jawns aware worth it. Other cheap paper towels are that draw. These jawns go mani

This product has always worked great for us.

Does well w shielding odor in the closed kitchen garbage can and the open top animal waste garbage bins as well. Its very easy to buy these because I use the dash button, they're also easy to open and loosely come out when dispensing, no violent tearing. They arrive like they're shown, "packaged" w stickers on the box! Glad to avoid wasted packaging.

review_title: Great idea for people on fixed incomes to save money
review_body: This is the second time I have bought these garbage bags.  I am a single woman who takes trash out several times a week and these are excellent for me because 1. There are 100 bags which is a good thing when you are on a fixed income.  2. The bags hold up very well even with used cat litter which can be heavy. 3. The fact that Febreeze is a added smell protection is a blessing. I will co continue buying this product every time I get low on garbage bags because this lasts several months with 100 bags even though I take garbage out 3-4 times a week.

I love these bags!  The Gain smell is awesome.  Every time I open my garbage cupboard, I can smell these bags and it is amazing.  Our garbage cans are in a pull-out drawer so they are hidden when not in use.  The smell is not over-powering because the garbage cans are in the cupboard.  If the cans were sitting out in the open, I could see that these may become too over-powering.  However, the smell seems to only last for a couple days.  If you take out your garbage less often than that, the smell starts to go away.  This also seems to cover up the garbage smell.

review_title: These certainly are one tough trash bag. I am very happy with my purchase.
review_body: I love these trash bags. I know it is strange to "love a trash bag", but these are seriously awesome! They really do smell like gain when you first shake the bag out to put it into your trash can. Then, as you start filling the trash bag, it doesn't smell like trash mixed with gain. It just masks the odors and makes them virtually undetectable. I buy these every time because they work great for me!

review_title: Worth Every Single Penny.  Smell Good. Sturdy. Trash Bag Love? Absolutely
review_body: Sturdy trash bags that smell really amazing.  I don't know how, but I never thought I'd enjoy a trash bag.  They work with the simple human 13 gallon trash cans and it's a great price in bulk. Amazon often has coupons attached to them and I also have them on my prime subscribe and save so I get another 15% off the discounted price.  Worth every single penny.

It really does have odor shield. It doesn't just attempt to mask the smell. You know how most scented trash bags attempt to mask the smell. So your kitchen smells like that scent and trash. No pleasant. This really does prevent the smell. However, it won't smell like febreeze, it just wont smell. Seems like a good trade off to me.

review_title: They suck but the smell isn’t overpowering
review_body: These trash bags are literally garbage. They rip around the top every time I pick them up. I have to double bag them whenever I take the trash out. That being said, at least I’m not scent bombed out of my kitchen every time I relive the trash can. The febreeze scent is more gentle than some other scented trash bags. Never buying these again, however.

I have been buying these bags for years. They are the only bags that don't let the bad garbage smells permeate and stink up the bin itself. The scents are really fake smelling, but since you are going to end associating them with garbage smell it doesn't really matter. If you use gain in your laundry I wouldn't recommend using the gain ones or your fresh laundry is going to remind you of garbage. I've pushed cardboard and stuff down in these bags without them tearing, VERY rarely have I poked a hole in one of these. I don't plan on switching bags!

these are trash! literally.  the ties break when we just start to pull them together to tie the bag up.  We have been through 1/2 the box and have only been able to tie TWO bags then both broke when we picked up the bag out of the bin.  NO NO NO ... never again.  Hefty all the way for us.

Good bags, OK at covering the smell but better than a non-scented bag! Only complaint is that the handle straps area little weak, that seems to be the only area that breaks. Also, I am 6'1" and with the strings double tied this still drags along the ground when taking the trash out. I suppose that is more of a sin of its size than anything, but would be nice not to have to hold an arm curl all the way to the dumpster with my excessive amounts of garbage.

review_title: This is our go-to garbage bag that we order regularly
review_body: Works well. This is our go-to garbage bag that we order regularly.

these bags are strong and can really hold a lot without breaking

review_title: sturdy, and last through cutting and foods with sauce
review_body: Strong, sturdy, and last through cutting and foods with sauce. Also a great price.
great price, I always use Dixie, durable for light meals
At this price, no more washing dishes.

review_title: The water tasted great with the original filter but I can hardly tell ...
review_body: These did not perform nearly as well as the original filtered that came with the pitcher. The water tasted great with the original filter but I can hardly tell the differences with these. The water has that tap taste and I can't taste any different than drinking directly from tap. I noticed from day one that these didn't seem to fit as tight as the original filter, so I'm not even sure if the water is actually being filtered. I own the 10 cup Brita pitcher. I'm very disappointed in these. Will not buy again.

review_title: I like that you only have to rinse these instead of ...
review_body: I like that you only have to rinse these instead of soak like the old ones. No carbon in my first pitcher

review_title: BUYER BEWARE: Filter may or may not fit.
review_body: I purchased two filters. The first one I opened didn't fit correctly at all. I compared it to a filter that I had bought with my water pitcher and they looked slightly different. I decided to open my other filter and it fit perfectly without having to add any pressure. However, I am disappointed that I paid for two filters and received a defective one. I don't want to 'take a gamble' and hope that my filter fits next time if I do end my purchasing this item again. Quality control really needs to step up their game. Only gave this two stars because one filter actually worked.

I like the new style, it drips the water through the filter faster so we don't have to wait while it slowly goes through in order to add more water. It fits just like the old style, no problem getting it into the pitcher. I also like that you don't have to soak the new filters for 15minutes in water unlike the old style.

review_title: Been using it past 10 yrs. this one tends ...
review_body: Been using it past 10 yrs. this one tends to pop out if jug is tilted too far, but other than that it works well.

review_title: Gets Fluoride Taste Out of My Water--Would Recommend!
review_body: Great deal for three replacement filters as compared to purchasing at the store.  These work well and get the fluoride taste out of my tap water, which is particularly bad in my apartment.  So I would recommend these filters for that purpose alone.

review_title: These Filters Work Well! Notice Improvement in Water / Ice Taste!
review_body: These work very well.  We have been using these nearly three months.  After we replaced this filter, there was a very noticeable improvement in the taste of water and ice cubes! I paid full price for these filters and have not been compensated in any way for this review.

I like this new-style brita filter.  They work well.  I had an older filter in my pitcher that I was using this to place, and the difference in taste was noticeable. It also works with the sensor on my pitcher that tells me when to change the filter.  Very good. I will purchase again.

I love this Brita pitcher more and more everyday. This tree pack of filters makes it even more affordable. These filters fit perfectly and will last me almost a years. I change them every three to four months depending on my use. The pitcher recommends changing every two mouths but I find they last a lot longer than that. I figure I will save over $400 a year not having to buy gallons and gallons of purified H2O.

I like the new handle on the top of the filter. I do not believe there's a proven scientific reason to drink filtered water. But just in case....After a few uses PUR filters take way too long. Does that mean they filter out stuff that is going to make me sick and die an early death? I'll stick to faster Brita for the "just in case" factor.
Really love the convenience of having these delivered in a subscription. Good quality generic paper towels.
Great price! Good paper towels!
Low price, high quality
These are as good as the “quicker picker upper” and about $10 less per case. Thank you Amazon!!!

review_title: Both a great buy and product!
review_body: This was my first time to try presto brand and I was not disappointed. I like the size of the roll, the thickness, and the quality of the towel.
Good quality and price.
Great quality. Came faster than I thought. Good for cleaning!
Great price and not flimsy
Like paper towel but hate adjust a size!
Good price but not the softest

I washed it per manufacturer instructions and still was noisy. It did fit perfectly over foam matress. Contacted seller twice and all I got was generic response twice which stated exactly what I had already done. Ended up buying another matress protector for my child's bed from bed, bath, and beyond.

review_title: and it was all shiny like the plastic I was trying to avoid
review_body: It was cheap so I thought I'd take a chance. But right as I was taking it out of the packaging, I noticed how un-stretchy and crinkly sounding it was. I looked at the underside, and it was all shiny like the plastic I was trying to avoid. If I'm going to have to sleep on it every night, I'd rather return it.

review_title: and when he has accidents he feels terribly. It became quite an issue in the middle ...
review_body: I wish I had found this sooner! My 9 year old  special needs son is working on not wetting the bed.  He's trying very hard, and when he has accidents he feels terribly.  It became quite an issue in the middle of the night to change all the sheets while he stood by embarrassed about about his accident, and wanting to go back to sleep.  For me, it was a huge pain in the neck to have to wash all of the sheets and the mattress pad so often (no washer in my house)!  Enter this mattress pad:  now when he has an accident, I whip off one pad and put down the other that I purchased. No fuss, no muss, no embarrassment, and no need to wash sheets!  It really works beautifully.  Definitely buy more than one!

I purchased The SafeRest Premium Mattress Protector in the Queen size. It fits our deep mattress perfectly. It is nice and smooth. There is no "crunchy, crinkly" feeling or even noises, like "back in the day" when you purchased anything that was waterproof etc. I am very pleased & happy with my purchase. I like the fact that it protects against bacteria, anything that guards against germs, bacteria, I appreciate!

review_title: I bought one for my toddler when we moved him ...
review_body: I bought one for my toddler when we moved him to a twin bed, just in case. He has had a handful of nighttime accidents over the last several months and we have had no leakage onto the mattress. Stays snug in the mattress, absorbs all wetness, and washes well. I bought a second one more recently so I could throw it on in the night and not have to remake the bed after i wash the first one. No crinkly plastic feel under the fitted sheet.. Update: 4/23/16 I recently bought a third mattress protector for our daughter who upgraded from toddler bed to a twin. We have had all kinds of kid bodily fluids on their beds and their mattresses are still pristine thanks to these mattress covers.

I have used this product for two weeks. Put it on the bed as soon as I received it and it does the job. The big cat spilled my drink all over the place, but there was none that reached the mattress. Dogs and cats that sleep with their "mamma" were the main reason for getting this. Thank you for a product that fits nicely (no shifting around) and works for me!

Absolutely the BEST you can buy... I've got 4, and with grandma in the house, these are amazing !  Not only have they helped in the case of nighttime accidents, but for the rest of the beds they are so soft and QUIET. I've never heard a sound contrary to other reviews. The ease of washing and drying is a major plus too ! I'll surely be back here to buy another if I ever need it.... you cant go wrong with this bed pad !

review_title: Hero Mattress Cover Uses Waterproof Super Power to Save Bed From Super Villain cat
review_body: Best waterproof mattress cover I've bought, and I've tried a lot. Unfortunately, I have a demon for a cat and he took to peeing on my bed. With this cover, no pee makes it to the mattress. It withstands frequent washing and drying. And it doesn't make that obnoxious plastic noise or feel annoying under the covers. Highly reccomend!

review_title: No More Wrinkly, Noisy Mattress Protectors for Me!
review_body: I just purchased a brand new memory foam mattress, and wanted to protect my investment. So far, I couldn't imagine a better mattress protector. It fits perfectly, and the sides are certainly deep enough for an even deeper mattress (mine is 8"). I put it on, put my sheets on, and I can't even tell it's there. Far superior to all the wrinkly plastic mattress protectors. Two weeks in, no noise.

Great mattress protector.  Does not make any noise when moving (it's not plastic or vinyl), and is completely water poof/sweat proof.  Does not make my hot while sleeping.  Good value for the price.  One caution - do not dry on high heat.  I had one for 10 years with no problems (warm wash & low heat) and then accidentally dried on high heat (the waterproof backing melted).  This is my second one and expect it to last for a very long time.

review_title: Superior to standard paper towel in my opinion, but the quality has gotten worse over time.
review_body: I've been using Viva paper towel for years. It always felt the most like cloth--it was incredibly absorbent and soft, came off the roll very easily, and was overall very pleasant to use. I prefer it by far to other kinds of paper towel.. However, starting a while back (I don't remember--maybe 6 months or more) the product began changing.. 1. The paper towel was tighter on the roll so you had to actually peel each piece off, and you often need to use both hands to do it or you might end up just ripping small bits off of the roll.. 2. The reason they rip more easily might be because the pieces feel a bit thinner and weaker. This is hard to quantify without having an old roll to compare, but they don't hold up quite as well for me.. 3. They feel rougher to the touch. That soft cloth feeling just wasn't the same.. 3. When I use them on or near my face, I notice that they now smell slightly of acetic acid (like vinegar), which is a scent I'm particularly averse to.. I haven't found another brand that I like as much as I used to like the old VIVA paper towels, but I'm starting to wonder if I'd be better off switching brands now that VIVA paper towels are not so nice anymore.. I keep holding out hope that they will return to their former quality, but as time goes on that seems less and less likely. I can't decide if it's worth lowering to 3 stars or not but have decided to leave it at 4 for now. They're still my preferred paper towel, there's just a lot to complain about that didn't used to be the case.

It seems like there is a premium version of every household product these days.  Raw organic dog food, heated toilet seats, that brand name boar bristle hair brush, Norwex dust cloths, diamond-encrusted electric toothbrushes with 13 modes and a tongue massager… We splurge on some of these and on others we definitely don’t.  One of our splurges?  These paper towels.. I purchased them for the first time in 2012 on a whim.  I had no idea you could fall so hard for paper towels and immediately became a loyal customer. Fast forward 6 years and we’re now a family of 5 plus dog, and we go through a crazy number of paper towels.  As a result, it got harder to justify the higher price and, over the years, I’ve occasionally tried going back to a cheaper brand.  I regretted it every time.. Here’s a little cost-benefit breakdown on these paper towels for others who struggle with the higher price point like I did:. - Baby’s face covered in pureed peas? 1 sheet.. - Baby who loves getting his face cleaned with these super soft paper towels?  Priceless.. - Toddler gallops through the kitchen with a runny nose? 1 sheet.. - Quickly grabbing a paper towel gentle enough for his nose, rather than running for a tissue while toddler spreads cold germs to siblings?  Priceless.. - Any one of our four dependents has an accident on the floor?  No one’s counting sheets here.. - Thick, durable paper towels providing an effective barrier between my hands and bodily fluids?  Priceless.. - Husband spills his humungous bottle of craft beer (again)? 6 sheets (seriously, these bottles are huge).. - Sticky mess quickly averted with highly absorbent paper towels and marital bliss restored?  Priceless.. - Sitting down for family dinner and need napkins?  5 sheets.. - Not buying paper napkins?  Legitimate cost savings!. Ok, I’m not necessarily saying these premium paper towels will save you money, but they can absolutely save your sanity.  The fact that they’re softer and thicker than most paper towels makes them our go-to paper product for just about everything.  One thing they’re not great at?  As other reviewers have mentioned, they leave lint on glass and other surfaces you polish.  I’ve also found that because they’re really absorbent, they tend to soak up a lot of cleaning product rather than spread it around.  For those jobs?  See the aforementioned Norwex cloths (thanks, Mom!).

I agree with the other reviewers! What on Earth is up with these towels? Forget one-handed use. It takes very careful and meticulous work to get each sheet loose from the roll. Once it’s loose, it tears in the most random place and you end up with wads of tiny paper. Also the lint is pretty annoying. I don’t like paper towels that are super loose either but the degree that these are stuck so tight almost seems like a smart-alek response to customers’ need for a tighter roll. Lol!

review_title: Not bad overall, but not for me
review_body: Let me first say that as paper towels go, these are very durable and absorbent.  And they do the job quite well.  My issue with them is using them in a countertop towel dispenser, which is very difficult.  The problem is that the towels stick to themselves and are very difficult to unwind.  Even when manually unwinding the next towel from the roll I would often tear the towel in the process.  It was that "stuck" to the roll.  In other words a towel dispenser is virtually useless apart from giving the roll a place to reside without falling over.. So I am going to go back to my Bounty paper towels that may not be as "good" but are far friendlier and easier to use at least in my case.

review_title: Not as big as they use to be but work well.
review_body: I am not typically one to use one specific brand of paper towels.  I tend to go with whatever the best deal is at the time.  I have recently used the Sparkle brand as they usually are reasonably priced and decent quality, although this time around, the Viva towels were cheaper at around a dollar per big roll.  These are select a sheet style and are decent quality and durable. They also clean and absorb well.  Like the Sparkle brand though, the big rolls aren't not as big as I would expect them to be and not the size big rolls used to be a few years ago.  The big rolls are almost the same size as what standard rolls use to be.. 4 stars

review_title: We've loved these Viva 'like cloth' napkins for about 8 years
review_body: We've loved these Viva 'like cloth' napkins for about 8 years and have preferred them over others all that time. We were both moaning when I accidentally bought a case of the 'Viva scrubs' paper towels, as they're not at all like cloth. So, since we're finally through those, I looked especially for 'like cloth'. I'm not sure if it's because they're 'Choose-a-Sheet' or because they changed the structure, but they're slightly thinner and courser than they were (we had some of the former 'like cloth' to compare them to). So, they get 4 instead of 5 stars from us now. However, they're still pretty nice. Unless we discover better, we'll be sticking with them.

review_title: Towels stick together. Have to peel them off the roll.
review_body: I don't know what they did to Viva, but these paper towels are useless. The sheets stick to each other and have to be peeled off of the roll. They do not absorb. They merely spread the water around. Don't bother attempting to wipe down your faucet, stove, tile or anything else that shines, because these towels leave water streaks on everything. Need to clean up a spill? Get a cloth unless you want to use half a roll of Viva, and even then, the surface will still be damp. Along with having to peel each sheet off of the roll, nearly half of the sheets tear as your peeling. I bought a full case. What a huge waste of money. Never again.

I recall when I first used Viva and was taken aback by how cloth-like they were. They seemed dramatically more luxurious than the other brands we have used.  Sometime later one of my daughters arrived for breakfast and commented "what is up with these paper towels? They are amazing!" When my younger daughter came for breakfast several minutes later she also noticed the feel of these and said "are these the kind of paper towels super rich people use?" And no, I don't normally make them use sandpaper!  Viva are a really nice substitute for table napkins.

Years and years ago I used these at my friend, Anjuli’s, house and I’ve never experienced a better paper towel. Thick. Absorbent. Soft. They leave behind a little more lint than most paper towels so just be aware if that’s an issue for you. For example I wouldn’t use them for painting. However they’re much softer than normal so they don’t scratch delicate surfaces like regular paper towels do.

The two things I'm most spoiled on are paper towels and water. Viva are thee best paper towels money can buy. Sure they might leave a little lint, but nothing is as strong, durable, and absorbent as these bad boys. I've tried all the others but nothing comes close to the quality. Who would have thought anyone could be passionate about paper towels?

review_title: A Good Product With Limited Utility
review_body: We jumped on the Instant Pot bandwagon and have given it a try preparing several meals with it. While it’s a perfectly decent product, we found that there are limitations to what a pressure cooker can do well.  In fact, so far I would say that we’ve found that while it is capable of cooking some dishes quickly, we haven’t found any that it’s done more than a fair job with. Typically, we found that texture and flavor were better when dishes were prepared in a more traditional manner.  We’ve also used the Instant Pot as a slow cooker using the optional glass lid. Again, it did a decent job but I wouldn’t say it matches the performance of a true slow cooker.. UPDATE: After six months with our Instant Pot, we gave it up and passed it on to a family member. We just didn’t find the utility in it.

review_title: Too many reviews not to have one!
review_body: I purchased this Instant Pot to make cooking quicker and easier for me now that I have been diagnosed with Celiac disease.. With all of the thousands of reviews here on Amazon I figured how could I go wrong. I didn't.. There are to many uses for this pot to mention in one single review. In fact I there is not much more that I could add to this review that hasn't already been said,. The functionality of this is pretty simple and straightforward. The cookbook that comes with this is pretty generic but will get you started on some simple items.. I have found numerous websites devoted to the use of the instant pot and many great gluten free recipes.. This will cook food fast as it says it will. One thing to note, you need to allow time for the first initial heat up before the timer starts. If you  get ahead of the book and skip over parts you might miss that part like I did. I thought something was wrong and it wasn't working. Just wait and the timer will start. It took mine 15 minutes to heat up the first time. Now I know.. Also a note about cooking gluten free pasta. You will have to adjust your water or moisture content. You will have to use less water than what is called for or you will have a mushy mess. Most gluten free recipes containing pasta will tell you what and how much to add. Do that and then tweak your own recipes,. You will love it and enjoy it once you have learned how to use it. Enjoy!. Yep, I PAID FULL PRICE. This is MY OPINION good or bad. I am not affiliated with anyone but me. I’m  AMZ Prime and I hope I helped you come to an easier decision.

Arrived pristinely packaged in full retail box with stronger shipping container surrounding it.. It works as described in the many online articles singing its praises. Ive been using it for speedily cooking chili, excellent rice, steel cut oats, and stews. The mini is exactly the same capacity as the cheap crock pot that I had, but produces much higher quality meals. Mainly because the crock pot would overcook anything put in it even on low, especially if it was anything under 100% full. This makes the instant even better at holding food to the next day as well, with its long 'keep warm' state. (10 hours after the sequence stops, on the model I received. Ive read that for some its models its as long as 99 hours.)

LOVE THIS!  I've been cooking for years and am pretty good at it, but have been getting bored, too busy etc etc - you know all the excuses one uses to "run out of time" so we must simply go out and get something from Taco Bell (Or fill in your favorite fast food restaurant).  Anyway, I had never even seen a pressure cooker in real life.  A few of my favorite bloggers (Paleo Parents, Nom Nom Paleo to name two right off the bat) had mentioned this wonderful device, but I didn't really take much notice of it b/c a) the cost and b) no frame of reference.  Then my dear mother asked me if I wanted one.  She had been reading about them and offered me one for Christmas.  I said SURE! (who wouldn't?)  It came.  Now what?  I started googling "how to cook with the Instant Pot" and found many websites and recipes to be very helpful.  I printed off a recipe, (read the manuals first of course) and started with Chicken and Dumplings.  AMAZING and FAST and DELICIOUS!  I was intrigued.  I bought Bob Warden's two cookbooks:  Great Food Fast and Slow Food Fast, and also Hip Pressure Cooking (I love real books)  I devoured those for techniques, tips etc and then I joined Instant Pot Community on Facebook.  I have been LOVING using this device.  I love to peruse the cookbooks, print off recipes from the Community, and then go to town.  It is so easy, the instructions are clear, there is plenty of help out there and everything I have made so far has turned out to be absolutely delicious!  I can even cook meat from frozen (a huge seller for me - read the first sentence!  I'm not always great at planning ahead)  Now I can pull out a recipe, put it on the table in a short time and know I'm feeding my family delicious, tasty and healthy meals.  This Instant Pot is worth its weight in gold.  I've made a roast (ooh-la-la!), Porcupine Meatballs (they've never turned out before, tonight they are outstanding!), Chicken and Dumplings (none better since my Gluten free-for-all days), Chicken and Wild Rice Soup, Beef Stew, hard boiled eggs (SO easy to peel), and my whole chicken is cooking right now as I type.  (I did the porcupine meatballs before I left for work so I would have something to heat up quick for dinner before my family heads out to watch basketball games).  The chicken we will eat, then I will make a few batches of bone broth tomorrow.  I can't believe this device is making cooking fun again!.I've not tried to do more with it than pressure cooking, although someone on the Instant Pot Community (Facebook) posted something about coconut yogurt in the IP.  Guess what I'm going to make this weekend (after making bone broth - and I'll have time b/c it won't take 24 hours like it would in a slow cooker!)?  You won't regret your purchase.  As Tony the Tiger used to say "It's Grrrrrrrreat!"

With much anticipation and excitement, I opened my 'new' instapot, and it was very visibly and obviously used! I am appalled and disgusted! There were greasy fingerprints all over the outside of the pot. Inside, smelled like old food, there was old crust and such on the outer rim! Not just that, but the measuring cup and recipe book was missing. I am very disgusted and disappointed.

When my husband gave me this as a Christmas gift, i thought..."hmm nice, but i already have two stove top pressure cookers that I really like, so kind of a waist".  Well i smiled graciously, and then thought I can't just send it back, i've got to give it a try first. Well, OMG.. this has truly revolutionized my time in the kitchen.  I don't have to stare at the pressure cooker to see when the pressure valve has popped up... I don't have to monitor the pot while under pressure to make sure the temp isn't too low or high... This machine is literally a put it in, turn it on, and leave it alone.  I find myself using it all of the time, like each day.  I cook complete meals in it, where with my stove top i just cooked up big batches of beans to later use in recipes.  I simply love the ease and convenience of this pot.. Pros... everything from timer mode, to being able to sauté in pot before adding other ingredients, to turn it on and walk away.  I love that the inner pot is stainless steel as that is important to my cooking.. Cons... my stove top cookers are 8 and 10 quart ... this is a 6 quart.  i wish it were bigger. Good for a meal a perhaps left overs for my family, but not big batch cooking.. Tips:  Get an extra inner pot so that if you are finished cooking one thing, you can immediately put the next pot in.  This has been my way of doing big batch cooking.  I prepare both pots at the same time, and just cook one after the other.  Also get the additional glass lid, great for steaming and storage.  I also got a steamer insert basket that worked great once i took the handles off.  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007SPKR8U?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00. Comparison to the 6 in one Instant.  They are very similar, but the 6-1 model i received, first of all didn't work, but secondly had i had a working model, the lid isn't the same.  The inside cover that protects the pop up valve is much smaller. Perhaps still a great pot, but for a bit extra i recommend the 7-1.

This is my second electric pressure cooker.  The first one worked well until the little button on the lid fell out and it wouldn't hold pressure anymore.  Over the years I've used stove top cookers and liked them ok, but after having an electric one, I felt I'd rather replace my "broken" one with electric rather than a stove top.  I'd been watching the infomercials on tv for another brand and was tempted to buy it, almost made the phone call, but stumbled upon the rating on Amazon, listing the Instant Pot as top rated.  I went back and read the reviews for the one on tv and while most seemed good, there were several negative ones.  The reviews for the Instant Pot were all good, and in reading nearly half of the [over] 300 reviews and finding them all positive, I decided to go with the Instant Pot even though it was more expensive.  When I got the notice that it had been shipped, I anxiously awaited it's arrival and had a pork roast ready and waiting!!  When it arrived, I went to YouTube to learn how long to cook the roast.  Most videos said about 45 minutes, so I sent the Instant Pot for 45 minutes and waited.  The first thing I noticed as it was cooking, was there was no sound and no smell.  Was It working?  I turned the release valve to Vent and sure enough, steam came out, so obviously it was working!  The no smell no sound thing could be good or bad depending on your point of view.  If you love the delicious smells of dinner cooking, your going to be disappointed, but if that's a non issue for you then it's not a problem.  At the end of the 45 minutes, I released the steam and opened the lid.  I was disappointed to find that the roast was not tender and yummy.  Fortunately, in my eagerness to try the IP out, I had started dinner early enough that I had plenty of time to run it through another 45 minutes.  After this second 45 minutes, I checked it again and still wasn't satisfied with it's doneness.  I put it on for another 30 minutes and when I opened the lid, I was Thrilled with the results!!  The fact that it ended up taking 2 hours for what I believed would take only 45 minutes was not a deterrent for me.  The roast was delicious, the vegetables I had put in after the first 45 minute go-round were done to perfection, and my husband was a very happy man that night!  From that night on, I used my Instant Pot every night for that first week.  I used it in slow cook mode twice and again found it needed extra time but did an excellent job of cooking a delicious meal.  My first electric pressure cooker had the non stick pot but in reading reviews for several brands, the requests and/or satisfaction with stainless steel pots was overwhelming, so that was one of the reasons I decided to go with the Instant Pot.  The stainless pot has a heavy, good quality feel to it and could even be used for cooking on the stove top if one wanted to do that.  I gave the Instant Pot a 5 star rating, but  would have preferred to give it 4 1/2 because of the longer cooking times required, but my stars got posted publicly before I could figure out how to do a half star.  In spite of the longer cooking times, I'm totally satisfied with the Instant Pot.  Meals take longer than they say, but still get finished much faster than cooking on the stove or oven, so I just make allowances for that extra time.  I love being able to put my food in the pot and walking away to go about my business without having to fuss with stirring and watching heat settings and all the things that go along with stove top or oven cooking.  I'm so happy with it, that I will be buying one for a wedding present for a good friend who just got married recently!  One thing I'd like to add, is that while I absolutely love the Instant Pot, I'm quite dissatisfied with the cookbook.  It's filled with things that I'm not likely to cook for my family.  While I do acknowledge that it's always fun to try new things, I'd like to see instructions for cooking more traditional things as well.

review_title: Don't be deterred by the 6 quart size. It's great for a large family!
review_body: I absolutely love this Instant Pot. I can make 2 dozen steamed (hard boiled) eggs that peel like a dream every time. It makes the most perfect baked potatoes. I made the most delicious stew that tasted like it had been simmering for hours. I was really disappointed that I couldn't find one with a larger capacity as we have a very large family. However, I discovered that the quick cooking makes it ideal for making a large meal. I made a very large corned beef roast the other day. I was able to cook the roast in the liquid first. Then I took the roast out and covered it with foil. I filled the IP completely with potatoes and carrots in the same juice the roast had cooked. They came out tasting just like I had made the entire thing together. This was a huge bonus because I usually can't fit very many potatoes and carrots around a roast in the crock pot. I ended up with at least double the sides for my family than can be accomplished in a crock pot. Unfortunately, I couldn't fit all of the extra cabbage on top. Not a worry. Only a minute by itself in the IP with the juice and I had an entire head of cabbage to go along with the rest. I truly love it!. Some of the reviews posted complaints about it not working or coming to pressure after the warranty had expired. Amazon offers a very reasonable extended warranty. I purchased one with this item to ensure that I wouldn't be out the money I invested if it should fail in the next two years.

review_title: Well I used this only 8 times and it's broken ...
review_body: Well I used this only 8 times and it's broken.  It won't pressurize or something.  I contacted Instant Pot and they want pictures of the ring inside.  If it is the ring then that reflects how cheaply this is made since I had used it only 8 times.  I tried to make brown rice and it's not doing anything.  I'm frustrated because we are beyond the return period through Amazon.

I've been using this pressure cooker for about a month now, and I love it.  It is nicely made and high quality.  The interior pot is good, heavy stainless steel.  The saute option works better than I expected.. It did take a couple of tries for me to learn how to use the buttons correctly (specifically, the adjust one), but now that I am doing it right, I don't understand why I had a problem to begin with.  It is simple.  Apparently, I don't understand simple.. I've cooked ribs in beer for for my husband, lemon garlic chicken, various soups, brown rice, and various beans.  Do note that the "rice" setting is for white rice, not brown, but my rice cooked beautifully with a manual setting.  As a vegetarian, I cook lots of beans and grains, and this pot makes it so easy.  I don't have to plan hours in advance.. I cooked split pea soup (I know some of you are saying "ewwwww!), and split peas are notorious for foaming.  I added a bit of oil to the pot and used two cups of split peas plus 1/4 cup of hulled barley, and the pot handled it beautifully.  The lid opens and locks easily, and the release value is easy to use if you are using a quick release.. I used to make my own yogurt but haven't done that for awhile.  However, this pot has a yogurt setting, so I'm going to try making my own again.. The high setting seems to have a lower psi than some stove-top pressure cookers, but that is not a problem for me.  I had a stove-top cooker that I used a few times, and got rid of.  It didn't set on my glass-top stove as evenly as it should so didn't work well, and it was hard to get the right temperature for the pot.  This electric one works much, much better for me.. Cleaning the little seal ring and getting the lid dry is a bit of a bother, but I think that is the nature of pressure cookers.  The recipe booklet could be more helpful than it is, but I've been checking out library pressure cooker cookbooks while deciding which I want to buy.  There is a chart of times for various meats, grains and beans, and vegetables, which is handy,. The pot comes with a little rack and a couple of utensils and a measuring cup made of plastic.  Because you are probably smarter than I am, you probably will not turn the pot to "saute" before taking out the utensils.  Bye-bye, little plastic measuring cup.  Fortunately, I noticed before I caused any real damage.. I wanted a pressure cooker, but now that I have one, I am using it more than I expected to.  And for me, electric is the way to go.

review_title: Don't let price fool you, EXCELLENT SCALE HERE!
review_body: Etekcity Digital Body Weight Scale with Step-On.. by Etekcity is a really, really nice scale so far.  I have another brand scale in my home and they both read the same result.  This scale came packaged nicely and is a very nice looking scale;  It's pretty!  I'm glad with this purchase so far and it even came with 2 brand new AAA batteries.  This is a very nice scale and I'm glade I made this purchase.

It is the nicest and best scale i have ever had,  it came on time and made with great quality,  it measures very accurately,  it also had a tape measurement with the package,  the price was really great and i am very happy with it.

review_title: If you want Swiss-made engineering, buy a Swiss-made scale, in the meantime this will serve its purpose.
review_body: I wanted an inexpensive scale that looked nice. That is exactly what I got. For the most part the readings seem pretty accurate, although I have seen the fluctuations others have mentioned on a few occasions. I weigh myself maybe three or four times a month and this gives me a pretty good idea about where I'm at. (I won't take points off because I don't like the numbers that I see!).  I have had it at least 6 months and still I like the design.. I too have concerns about free stuff for good reviews. If they publish all reviews, good and bad, I don't see the harm. Would someone who gave a negative review be given free products just like someone who sent a glowing review? It does make me wonder.

review_title: I've had it for 2 days and there's no accurate ...
review_body: I've had it for 2 days and there's no accurate reading it has given me three different weights within five minutes.. this is our third one and we still have not gotten an accurate reading

Great scale. Very accurate. You must step on it  to activate it then step off of it and back on to get your weight. The reviewers who complained of the numbers jumping around were probably not doing it right. I'm very pleased with this scale and it looks nice too.

So far so good , was told to weight myself everyday by dr. Recent quick weight gain seems to be accurate to the oz , nice clean looking scale  bright and easy to read , the only reason I didnt do a 5 star is the temperd glass top ,

Every time i step on this scale it displays a different weight total. I can also step on the scale and manipulate the weight displayed if I lean left or right or if I put one foot on one corner of the scale and one foot in the middle. Not accurate at all.

This is weird.  When I step on the scale it gives me one weight , then when I step off , let it go blank, and step on again it gives me a lower weight. (Obviously I choose the second weight as accurate ;-)  This happens every time and sort of defeats the purpose.  Wouldn’t buy this again.

You often get an incorrect reading the first time you step on it. Subsequent attempt give you a lower reading. Attractive and easy to use, but black color show dirt and smudges.. Update: Prompt reply from Etekcity said to tap lightly on the center of the scale, and when a "O" shows, then step on the scale. When I did this, the first weight shown was accurate.

review_title: I give this a strong + rating.
review_body: Attractive scale - very low profile.  I was a bit cautious because the deck is glass, so I made certain it was sitting firmly on its 4 "feet" before I weighed myself.  It reads in .2 Lb increments, but it locked on a weight reading quite quickly.  I tried it a few times, and it repeated the same weight, which is a good sign.  I would possibly rate it five stars if I had some known test weights for calibration, but I think this is 'weigh' better than an old dial type mechanical scale, and not very expensive, either.
Very plush...no odor...
Nice and full, soft "give"; ordering another

review_title: Not pretty, but does the job well.
review_body: They fit my pillow covers without issues.  Definitely a basic insert with all the stitching and everything showing, nothing pretty.  But it's just going inside the pillow so that isn't a huge deal.  Would buy again.
Are not well stuffed. Left until led corners in cover.
Definitely will not be buying this again. Pillow was very lumpy and uneven, feels very cheap.
Not as stuffed as I thought it would be so it leaves your pillows looking flat. Probably won't buy again.
Came quickly, love how fluffy these are. No smell from the bag either, so didn't have to air them out.
The insert pillow was as described. It fit my pillow cover well. Very satisfied with this products and I recommend
Great pillow and just what I needed for my handmade pillowcase!  Nice story quality that is much better than the discount stores carry.
A+
Very beautiful, used them in the foyer across the ceiling.  Gave off just the right amount of light and very festive!
One strip of lights does not work

review_title: These lights are amazing as I expected
review_body: These lights are amazing as I expected. Perfect for my living room. I put on my sofa, warm white light, it makes my sofa so different.  Have eight different modes, I like the waves mode most. I really enjoy my night with these cute lights.
Bought for my granddaughter’s college apartment! She loves then
I used these lights to decorate for Ramadan and it made the whole room look so festive.
super cute in my daughters room helps complete her little oasis

review_title: Nice but very long. Not ideal for your average window height.
review_body: They are really nice looking. The different settings are nice. Just wish there was a regualr on and off switch. Also these are super long. Even from my ceiling. Not ideal for a regualr window height. I just used push pins and mini clothes pins to hang them. Pair with some sheer curtians and it gives a nice chill vibe to any room.
Love the different patterns & the lighting. There's as short that causes a strands to cut in & put, which is a mega bummer.

review_title: they're still pretty but not what I
review_body: I ordered warm light and the box said warm light but they're white, they're still pretty but not what I wanted. In the picture it doesn't look white but in person it's white
Love these lights so much. Wish I had them before year ended. But I love how they look in my living room and will be keeping them up. Hope they work for years.
This liner is thicker than I can buy locally. It works great and it is easy to clean.

review_title: Definitely recommended and would buy again
review_body: As advertised, no odor at all.  Two small magnets on each end attaches securely to the tub.  Thicker than the standard cheap thin shower curtains, however, this makes it a bit stiffer when first used, but it’s getting more ‘flexible’ with time and use.  Definitely recommended and would buy again.
Very thick liner I love it and also have the magnets on it to stick to the tub excellent quality and it's mildew-resistant that is a bonus
This is the best shower liner I have found to date. I’m almost writing this review more for myself so i don’t forget than anything.

review_title: Fits perfectly, has no chemical odor and has a ...
review_body: Fits perfectly, has no chemical odor and has a one year guarantee. I have had this one before and it actually lasted about 18 mos before needing to give it a wash in the washing machine. I have found that I can do this a couple of times before needing to replace it.
The shower curtain was just one and I can’t thank you more, I would recommend is to family or friends.
I was impressed with it having no odor. I hate but g a shower curtain and when you open it the odor is awful.
What I like about this liner is that it has just the right amount of thickness and the grommets are made nice and sturdy.

review_title: Thick mildew resistant and anti bacterial.  I'd buy it again!
review_body: Works great.  Heavy weight so it doesn't slide all over.  Which there were two more magnets to grab tub but it really works just fine.
They're shower curtains.  What can I say?  They hang there quite nicely.
Precisely as advertised. Way cheaper than you can find in store.
Love these. Just the right size and thickness for quick clean ups. They pick up dust real well and clean without any cleaning products.
I was hoping these would be higher quality.  They are loosely woven and thin.  Dollar store quality.  I wish I would not have bought them.

review_title: Average quality, good to have around, wash well so far!!
review_body: Not bad for the price, I use them in the kitchen , keep one in the car for dusting.... Nice to have around the house, very multi-purpose. Just thick enough for most of the task, pretty absorbent. Few pieces edging are not perfectly done, but not seriously bad.

review_title: Perfect to replace my worn out rags.
review_body: I'm not sure why everyone else is complaining. My microfiber cloths have no holes in them. They aren't too thin either. I bought them for dusting and wiping down counters. For this they work great. People really need to think about what they are getting for $10 or less. It's a good deal.

I washed all of the towels, before using, smaller size is nice and they seem to be very absorbent! Plan to use them mostly in the kitchen, replacing my old worn out dish towels.. Going to try them for dusting and glass cleaning as well.

review_title: but these are great. Much better than normal cotton towels
review_body: It's difficult to get excited about kitchen towels, but these are great. Much better than normal cotton towels...would 100% recommend.

review_title: Exactly as advertised.  Microfiber cloths for anything you want to use them for.
review_body: They are what are advertised and are perfect.  I clean my interior and exterior with the appropriate sprays.

review_title: A very good value for many microfiber cloths.
review_body: A very good value for many microfiber cloths. I use them to dust furniture with and to rub polish haze from my cars.

review_title: Great to have on hand, many uses.
review_body: These work great, and can be used for literally everything from cleaning counters, to washing dishes, to washing your face. They do tend to pill a bit when washed, and you need to wash separate from other items if you use fabric softener on your other items, as these cannot be washed with fabric softener. But overall, very versatile and something great to have on hand.
Arrived on time. Will buy again
Great paper towels for the price.
Great Value!
Good deal
rolls are small. I prefer Bounty
Great quality and convenient ...delivery was very prompt!

These products do exactly what is promised but it does take many more to clean up spills. They are not as absorbent as many other brands. The value however, does make up for that small issue. Shipping in bulk saved time and even more in the gas and time it would take to drive and buy the product. Neatly packaged sturdy inner cardboard rolls. There were no tares or excess glue as with other brands. I will be repurchasing this product.
Not very absorbent.
Love this product, it's full sheet style and pretty thick! Great price!
Very good paper towels
I liked the individually wrapped rolls of paper towel since I store them in the garage.
Great product at a good price.
On time. Very good.
Great quality and good quantity package
Box arrived open and dirty!
weak
We love this brand..trusted & dependable. Great quality!
So nice to order in bulk!
The product is fine...Sam's brand is better and cheaper, so I switched.
nice

review_title: It's a trash bag and it holds trash.
review_body: The only drawback to these is that the top is a little loose and occasionally slips down in my trash can.  These hold up to a pretty significant amount of weight when carrying, and are flexible enough to carry out with a pizza box or two jammed inside.  The odorshield is nice but I don't notice it at all after I put the new bag in.  Good bargain that will last my single-person household a year or more!

These are a little stinky (well, it smells good but it's a little overwhelming) when you first put them in the bin but you don't really smell them after that.  I've been super impressed by how they keep smell down.  I have a 15 month old and all diapers just go right into the garbage and I never smell them anymore since switching to these gain scented bags!

review_title: Leaves your garbage can smelling so nice!
review_body: These garbage bags smell amazing.  I love the Gain scent, it's so strong with a nice fresh scent.  I have it in my kitchen and notice that it helps mask the funky garbage odor that you sometimes smell when walking by, or opening the trash can lid.  It's now the only garbage bags that I will use and no doubt will continue to order on Amazon.

These bags smell AMAZING!  Just wish they were available in a larger quantity than 100.  Price is high just for the 'smell' as I can get 200 bags for $16.57 thru Sams Club (no scent).  Sometimes I just splurge and buy them anyway.  Nice fresh scent for the office trash cans.

review_title: Only bags I get at the moment.
review_body: I have this item on Amazon's subscribe and save.  The smell is rather pleasant without being overpowering but we never had a problem with the garbage can smelling.  I get these because the price is good, they fit, they always work as intended, and they don't rip on the way out the door.

Love this product. I guess my whole family does too. Everybody comes to my house to borrow garbage bags. Good quality and quantity. The smell is great also. i don't think my husband would appreciate me if i stop ordering. lol he uses them religiously.

review_title: I love the smell of these
review_body: I love the smell of these...it doesn't last very long but it's a good smell. I've never had one break on me so they are pretty strong! We drink quite a bit of wine and beer and the bag gets pretty heavy and stays strong!

The 1st bag that was on the roll was fine. Every other bag after for about 20 (I then stopped looking) were sliced. Unfortunately I didn't discover this until taking a bag out of a full garbage can and having garbage spill all over my floor. Some bags were sliced under the ties, some 2/3 of the way down the back and other at the very bottom. Very strange.

WAY too strong of a scent on these.  Dear god they are sickening.  The chemicals that must be involved in these have got to be cancer inducing.  I won't be buying these again.  So horrible.  Not very large, too.

review_title: Doesn't smell like the "Gain" we all know and love.
review_body: I bought these bags hoping for that glorious GAIN smell we all know so well (and LOVE) - whether it's in your Febreeze plugins or it's your detergent. Unfortunately, for me, I didn't think the scent was comparable to the other Gain products I've purchased in the past. I won't be buying these again, as the regular Glad or Hefty bags work just fine and there's no weird smell that's supposed to be Gain.
Glad tall kitchen bags are awesome, they're strong and can hold lots of trash. I prefer this brand and style to the off brand garbage bags that just fall apart! They also helped lock in the odor.
Another satisfied customer
They are trash bags. They are good at it.
Best on the market and all around great product.
Best buy
CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE
These are great trash bags, really stretch in the right places and don't tear easily.  Great value for the cost.
Nice strong garbage bag.
So nice to order in bulk and not have to lug home from the store.  These are great bags and the only one we will use.
Every one so far is not sealed on one side don’t purchase this product every bag is defective
good price
Great price

review_title: Great product at great prices when deals come up
review_body: Always gets the job done
Great price, same stuff as shop rite at 25% discount. Goodbye brick and mortar.

review_title: Brawny Paper Towel rolls a bit too large, not a lot of value here
