review_body: I normally don't buy Brawny Paper Towels, unfortunately cost went up and availability went down on the brand I usually purchase.  These extra large Brawny towels are okay, based on price to quantity not a great value.  I use a lot of paper towels for my business, these rolls are going fast and will have to buy again very soon.  The towel is much thicker than other brands, not what I need though.  This will be my first and last Brawny purchase.
I always order this.
works great!
Always dependable!
Still my top choice of paper towels!
Good price for bags! Arrived as described.

review_title: The product itself is great, in hindsight this quantity isn't actually a great ...
review_body: The product itself is great, in hindsight this quantity isn't actually a great deal. Would reccomend just going to the store instead.
Wish that the bottom is thicker
Great deal and the bags smell great
Came as expected and could be purchased cheaper than in stores
Excellent bags. Very strong and the scent is pleasant to mask unpleasant trash smells without driving my allergies crazy!
Strong but the smell is unbearable
Perfect bulk buy for our kitchen trash can. Lasts a long time and fits nicely under the sink.

review_title: Scent is too strong for me
review_body: The smell makes me feel really sick. Had to buy new bags without the fabreeze..
The trash bags work fine - but the Febreeze smell STINKS. I definitely wouldn't get them again.

review_title: Ok but too big for me
review_body: Ok. But too big for me. I use these for Thanksgiving dinner
Love these Dixie Plates will be ordering again!
these plates are heavy duty and I use them every day.
I mean their plates! Can't go wrong with plates!
good deal

review_title: Love them so much, we continually order them.
review_body: Love them so much, we continually order them.
Kroger generic brand is same quality but much cheaper
Would be nice if they were a little stronger
Great sturdy plates. . . a little smaller than I expected.
Not as described, That's all I have to say.

review_title: Just okay - some improvement to water
review_body: Brita filters are just okay.  They do improve the water but when the filtered water is warm I can still taste undesirable flavors.  The pack I bought from a seller on Amazon was terrible, however.  The water had a strong charcoal taste no matter how many times I ran water through the filter.  I've read complaints online about this issue with Brita filters so apparently it happens sometimes.

Pretty easy to replace, but it freaks me out that on the packaging it says there may be carbon dust in the first 3 fillings. Worse yet, I doubt the people that use these bother to read the instructions, meaning if I am using a friend's Brita, I may be drinking carbon dust

review_title: Has Really extended the life of my Keurig Brewer
review_body: I use my Keurig a lot and was needing to replace those filters a lot more. Since buying and using my Brita pitcher to fill the Keurig it has  definitely saved me money and I feel prolonged the life of my Keurig  greatly as  they remove.. -chlorine. - copper. -magnesium. - zinc. Which can lead you to need to descaale your brewer more often.

review_title: Doesn't form a good seal and I have to re-seat the filter in ...
review_body: Doesn't form a good seal and I have to re-seat the filter in the slot every few days or the water just flows around it. At that point if I actually want to drink filtered water I have to toss the water already in the pitcher and start over.

Yeah, this is a Brita review, because why? Because these little boxes of charcoal make my disgusting, dirty hot tub smelling municipal chlorine and flouride bath straight from the sewer tap water taste like I'm drinking straight form the freshest mountain stream. These things work wonders!

review_title: doesnt really work. drains too slow to function.
review_body: Does not work. Filters water so slow. Takes nearly 30 mins to filter the water in the pitcher's reservoir.

review_title: Very convenient to have one filter that lasts as long ...
review_body: Very convenient to have one filter that lasts as long as three of the traditional ones... but the water takes much longer to pass through this filter.
they work whereas the other product which cost less is a case of you get what you pay for.

review_title: USE ONLY BRITA FILTERS FOR BRITA PRODUCTS.
review_body: Well I will never purchase non- Brita brand filters again.  USE ONLY BRITA FILTERS FOR BRITA PRODUCTS.  This seller is reputable and has great pricing.  Thank you.

These filters don't last at all. The first one I used only lasted a month. Usually they last us about three months. The second one lasted 2 days.m and it's telling me to change the filter. Complete waste of money.
We’ve always bought Bounty, because they are the best for your money.  However, these are just as strong and reliable.
I and my daughter approve. Replaced my Bounty habit.
Good quality
Like as much as Bounty and it's a bit cheaper!
Great!!!
Excellent product as a good price
works well, cheap
Love these !  So affordable .  Thanks

This was my first time purchasing these, but they seem to work as well as the Target brand which are my favorite.  I went ahead and signed up for Subscribe and Save, so that I don't have to worry about forgetting them the next time I am at the store.
They're ok just not as good as Bounty.

review_title: Solid mattress protector that you wont notice
review_body: This mattress protector looks and feels like a high quality product. I have not performed any specific waterproof tests or had any major spills, but have not had any small water/drink spills go through. I do not notice the mattress protector being on the bed at all (no crinkling plastic noise and no noticeable change is heat retention). Also, the protector stays on the mattress very well and doesn’t wrinkle up or shift when changing sheets. Overall, a solid product at a very good price.

I bought this to protect my mattress from liquids, dirt, and other hazards. As far as a protector goes it works wonderfully, which is also it’s saving grace for not getting a lower rating.. Alas, the claim that it “doesn’t change the feel of your mattress,” is debatable. The material feels like a $2 beach towel I would buy at CVS while on vacation because I forgot to pack an actual one. It’s also a touch noisy. I’ll pray that I can just put a fitted sheet on top of it and hope it solves my problems. I wasn’t enthused about the feeling of memory foam on my bare skin, but this material makes the foam feel like straight silk by comparison.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  I bought two of these when promoting my tall daughter from her crib to a low twin bed (skipped toddler bed).  We just returned from being out of town for Christmas for a few days and one of our cats peed on my daughter's bed.  I did throw away this cover (ordered another!) but my mattress is okay!!!!  If it will protect that well against stinky cat pee than it should hold up against just about anything.. The top fabric is very nice, a softer terry cloth type finish and it doesn't crinkle at all like you might expect a plastic mattress pad to.  The sides are deep enough to fit a very nice mattress, but it fits our plain mattress just fine.

review_title: Good size, even for thicker mattresses
review_body: It is as stated which with our potty training 2 year old is exactly what we needed. Good size, even for thicker mattresses. The material is nice, soft even, my daughter wanted to sleep on it without sheets. I haven't had to wash it yet (it's been a good week) but there is nothing to this point that would lead me to suspect that won't go well. I would recommend this to anyone looking. Very satisfied and well worth every penny.

review_title: Thin and water resistant at best
review_body: The "water proof" portion is resistant at best. It helped but didn't completely prevent leakage through to the mattress. This was intended to protect a mattress from an incontinent sleeper and just doesn't foot the bill.. But, it is thin, pliable, and easy to put on/off. It is also pretty easily cleanable (you can just throw it in the washer). I just wish it was a little more true to the product name.

review_title: I have a 4 year old and a two year old and occasional accidents happen and this protector does a fantastic job protecting our mattress
review_body: This is the second one I ordered for a different mattress. I have a 4 year old and a two year old and occasional accidents happen and this protector does a fantastic job protecting our mattress. It never leaks through to our mattress and what I like most about it is the material. It feels soft and does NOT make that plastic/vinyl sound when you move around on the bed. I highly reccomend this product.

Love these! We bought our first SafeRest mattress protector about a year ago. It is excellent quality, held up to the frequent washings and is perfect for our 3 y/o's bed. We bought this second one for our second son's bed..  I really like the texture of it under the fitted sheet. It doesn't feel like you're sleeping on plastic and it truly is waterproof. The lining is very similar to the waterproof side of our cloth diapers. We highly recommend this brand!

This mattress protector works so great! We just potty trained our toddler and he sleeps with us, so lots of accudents later this mattress protector lived up to its name! Our mattress still looks new thanks to this protector sheet. Also unlike many other protector sheets, it does not make us sweat more, it is breathable, and soft. Just mame sure to dry it on LOW or you can ruin the protection layer!

I wasn't expecting much honestly since it seems so thin, but this mattress protector is great! My husband is sensitive to heat, and he didn't notice any difference. I felt a bit hotter/noticed my sweating more, but it wasn't anything that kept me up past that first night where I was probably thinking about it more. I really like how thin it is, because we don't notice it over our sleep number mattress, and it doesnt crinkle or make noise at all (yay). I also haven't had to readjust it over the mattress since we put it on, which is frankly amazing. I would definitely buy it again for other beds. I haven't washed it yet, but I would definitely be careful and not dry it, as I think it could have some issues melting or something.

This mattress protector has lasted through multiple hot water washes without getting damaged, which is what I was looking for. It seems to be waterproof, which is also what I was looking for, more than anything. However, it seems to be similar to most protectors & makes the bed very hot to sleep on. It has a nice terry cloth top side which is soft, unlike some protectors I've felt before. For me, it's worth cranking down the air & dealing with, in order to ensure my expensive mattress is protected, in the event anything spills or one of my animals has an accident.

review_title: best paper towel on the market
review_body: Oh man, this viva stuff is the absolute pinnacle of paper towels.  It's so strong it feels like cotton. So absorbent it feels like cotton. So luxurious it feels like cotton.. A little expensive but worth every penny.

review_title: Excellent paper towels, and a lot of them.
review_body: Very good paper towels, and a lot of them! Thick, soft and absorbent. The only thing I don't like is the "select a size" feature where you can tear off half a towel, I find that to be a goofy notion. btw save the empty tubes in the center and stuff them with your dryer lint! When you want to start a fire in the fireplace, put one of the lint-stuffed tubes on your fireplace rack! Burns slowly, works great to light hard firewood!

These are my absolute favorite paper towels. They are soft enough to blow your nose if you need to, but strong enough to soak up spills and dirt and still be rinsable for reuse. I’ve accidentally bought the VIVA Advantage line (like a lot of people have accidentally done at least once) and they make me realize how good the original line is. The Choose-A-Sheet feature is also really awesome, so you can use smaller amount of towel.

We gave these a try as our other brand kept rising in cost.  At first we were skeptical because the rolls appeared smaller.  However, upon using these paper towels, we were delighted to find there was the same amount of towels on the roll.  It seems that because these are much more softer (and durable) that they pack tighter on the roll.  These paper towels are actually soft enough to use on your nose!  Great product!
I thought for "Big Plus" the rolls would be bigger, even though they may have more sheets, it seems about the size of a standard roll.. Quality of the towel is good, doesn't tear and absorbent.

review_title: These paper towels are the BEST paper towels you can buy
review_body: These paper towels are the BEST paper towels you can buy. They are choose a sheet which I love for small messes or larger ones. They are the softest paper towels I have ever used, but VERY durable. My husband as actually washed some dishes with them once and they didn't rip to shreds. I have them on my subscribe and save through amazon. If you are looking to change your paper towels , absolutely 100% change to Viva.

review_title: Saves money in the long run
review_body: A friend recommended these type of paper towels to me after I told her that I quit buying paper towels because some people in my house use 10 or more at a time.  These are great because they are sticky and harder to remove, so a person really has to work if they want to use five or six. It’s much easier just to grab one or two and clean up that way.  So the paper towels now last much longer in my house and I am happy about that.  And I’m finally buying paper towels again.

These towels are awkward to use. The sheets cling to the roll and will just rip if you try to pull it from a dispenser like a normal roll of paper towels. You have to carefully unroll each sheet, which will stretch. I find myself unwinding the roll for several sheets then winding it back up so I can get a sheet more easily when I need it. I will not buy these again.

These paper towels are the worst! They stick together, and do not come off the roll easily (I need two hands to grab a sheet, even using a dispenser). They leave lint on my windows. They break when I clean my counters. Didn't think I was picky about paper towels, but it turns out it really does make a difference. Lesson learned - we're going back to our usual trusted brand.

review_title: I like the paper towel but the rolls dont last long ...
review_body: I like the paper towel but the rolls dont last long enough and we dont use alot of paper towels. I prefer mega sized rolls. I do think the quality has changed some since these were first released. The use to be softer and now they kinda remind me of a line dried rag. They are pretty durable though and get the job done.

What a fantastic electric cooker!!!. First let me say,  I've used and owned a wide variety of pressure cookers (PC's) over the past 40+ years from the lowly Presto, a Fagor, All American canner and all the way up to the Mercedes of PC's the wonderful Kuhn Rikon Duomatic in a 5 qt and a 12 qt models.  I have owned 8 qt. electric PC's also but after they died young with flaked off and nasty teflon coated interiors that I was constantly replacing I swore I would NEVER buy another electric PC!  NEVER!  Well, a friend was convinced I didn't know what I was missing from not owning an Instant Pot with their s/s interior pot.  Since I have spent a truck load of money on these PC's over the years I could not believe this cooker could be any better than all the others.  Boy was I wrong!. The iPot is multi-functional, predictable and forgettable until you hear the beep!  I bought the 8 qt. because my two best PC's are 5 and 12 quarts.  The 5 being almost too small for two people and the 12 quart way too big for weeknight meals for two people so what I wanted was an 8 qt size and when I saw the introduction of the 8 qt. I leaped for it.  I have started making foods in this cooker I never even tried again after my first few unpleasant experiences in trying to cook them in the stove top models; i.e., rice, beans, veggies and  boiled EGGS for breakfast!  Who would have ever thought it could be so easy and CONSISTENT every single time and even produce boiled eggs that my husband likes in ONE MINUTE - soft and runny - just how he loves them every single time I make them.  I've also endeavored to learn to cook more meals in the iPot because I've learned that I can rely on the eventual outcome.  I must admit I've only used the slow cooking setting once.  I'm not too great at planning ahead so my go to first method of cooking is the pressure setting.  I've enjoyed the sauteed setting and the ability to do almost every step right in the PC because of the big s/s pan.  I've been rethinking the cooking process so I can cook the pasta, drain, keep warm and build the rest of the sauce/ingredients and return the pasta to the sauce for a one pot meal.  What a lovely helpmate this iPot has become. Less work, less clean up when the meal is finished and a perfect outcome.  Hooray!. I'm thrilled with this purchase and I hope this countertop miracle worker will keep on puffing and cooking those meals for years to come!  So glad I was one of the first people to buy the 8 qt, even if I did pay more money for it (LOL) than what it is selling for now!

We bought this larger capacity Instant Pot for our family's vacation home.  We feed such large crowds at our vacation home, that we needed a bigger Instant Pot than the one we have at our main home.  Our favorite recipe is making pork carnitias.  Yummy!!!  This Instant Pot makes tender, spicy carnitias every time.  Make sure to use a pork butt, as we've found it is the tenderest cut of port there is.  This also works great for homemade soups and broth.  Bone broth, and homemade chicken soup are so nourishing and have made a come-back.  Turns out, grandma really new what she was doing back in the day.  The Instant Pot helps you to make bone broth and soups quickly, cutting lots of hours out of the process.

Great little cooker!  I was looking for a rice cooker, then opted to try this as it's more versatile.  I have limited counter space and was reluctant to buy the 6qt.  It's just my husband and I now, so I felt I would not need to make larger meals.  The downside is, very few recipes for the mini and I am not courageous enough to alter the 6qt recipes. quite yet, but I will experiment some. The little cookbook that comes with it has some strange meals I would never like. Instruction manual is good, it took a few tries to make my Jasmine rice perfect, but I got it!  It is easy to use once you practice a little.  I did make some awesome shredded Mexican beef in it too.  Like all the bloggers say about these Instant Pots, don't give up and keep experimenting. I did buy extra rings to have on hand, that was good advice from some others.  There is a little colander bowl that fits perfectly in the 3qt for steaming you can buy here  on Amazon https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BR4GWN2/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o06_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1.  All in all, pretty happy with it, I use it about once a week.

review_title: Love it! I'm so glad they make a 3 ...
review_body: Love it! I'm so glad they make a 3 qt. The 6 is too big for two people with small appetites. I can cook a large chicken breast perfectly in 8 minutes."Baked" potatoes in minutes. Chicken salsa verde in 25 minutes shredded perfectly to wrap in tortillas.

review_title: fair warning: my expectations were high
review_body: first I should admit that my expectations were pretty high. I thought I would be throwing stuff into a pot and in an hour or so...bam! dinner!. I love my instant pot for cooking frozen meat when I forget to set it out. it's fantastic at cooking rice.  I appreciate the saute setting so I can make soup at work. and I like that when I don't feel like smoking  pulled pork (this is rare) I can pressure cook it and it's really tender.. I have yet find a recipe where things all cook together and come out right. the soups I make take just as long on the stovetop, usually with less steps. (the steps some of these recipes take to accomplish something in this pot... good god!). so it's not something I use daily.... or even weekly to be honest. but it is so so so handy when you want to eat and everything is frozen. like, worth 3 stars handy.

I had high hopes, a friend of mine owns two and uses almost everyday. The first one I ordered from Amazon wouldn't turn on. I returned it and ordered a second. The second one I received had an error on the screen and wouldn't work. I don't like that I have to give a negative review, but the quality control from this manufacturer should be much improved. I will not try this a third time.

review_title: I WOULD BUY THIS AGAIN IN A NEW YORK MINUTE
review_body: I've had this about a month and I love it.  I want to say that I bought another brand for 1/2 the price from QVC.  I liked it, but it wasn't real good quality, the pot was non-sick, and we all know non-stick wears out.  Due to other issues, I returned the cheap one to QVC and bought this one.. I LOVE THIS INSTANT POT!!  I didn't want to spend the money, but after reading the reviews I decided to buy it and I am so glad I did,  I want to say the quality of the Instant Pot is superb.  I really like the stainless steal pot.  It is good quality, plus it has a heavy plat on the bottom.  I can really tell the difference from the cheap one.  I would buy this again in a NY minute!  I've made pot roast in it in about an hour.  I made tomato sauce w/no meat in 5 min.  The rice comes out perfect.  The other night I decided to put an oven roast in it.  It was 4 1/2 lbs and may still have been a little frozen in the middle.  I put it in for 30 min.  the inside was only 40 deg., so I put it in for another 30 min and it read 150 deg.  I let it rest and put the duo pot on sauté and made my gravy.  When I sliced my roast it was perfectly pink all the way thru and is delicious!!  I haven't tried to yogurt yet, or slow cook or steam, but everything I cook comes out great.  I am getting ready to try my cheesecake in it.. I also highly recommend the following book:. Hip Pressure Cooking: Fast, Fresh, and Flavorful Hardcover  - September 2, 2014 by Laura D.A. Pazzaglia  (Author). She explains everything, plus gives the time for stovetop and electronic.  She also has done a video on the Instant Pot.  I have a stove top pressure cooker, buy never mastered it.  I have an electric stove and with the stovetop cooker, you have to get 2 burners going.  Once your pot comes to pressure, you have to have a 2nd burner at low heat and transfer it over.  The only problem is you have to babysit it to make sure it stays at pressure.  Just too much trouble for me.  That is why I use the Instant Pot all the time.  NO BABYSITTING!!!!. ALSO:  I just wanted to mention that it is normal for steam to escape when you are bringing it up to pressure.  My cheap one didn't mention it in the manual and I thought it was broken and sent it back to QVC, but I am so glad I did because this is much nicer.  I can feel the difference, even the way the lid locks in.  You will not be disappointed if you buy this.  It is well worth every penny (although I wish it was cheaper).

I've had my Duo60 for almost a month now and I love it.  Before getting it I made sure to read up on recipe ideas, how they differ from standard stove top pressure cookers, and I watched every video I could find on the subject.  I tend to do that with every kitchen product I buy so I know if I really want it beforehand, and what mistakes to avoid after it arrives.. Tonight as a last minute dinner idea I tossed in 4 frozen solid chicken legs and thighs, poured in some soy sauce, vinegar and Mirin; pressed the poultry button; and twenty-something minutes later I had perfectly cooked and flavorful Adobo.  Without my Instant Pot it probably would have been fast food instead.

All right, I rarely write a review, but this Instant Pot is too awesome not to add to the already incredibly convincing reviews about it.. I just receive my IP-DUO08 (the big one) last Thursday night.  Friday I cooked rice in it as the first thing...came out great.  Then I had 3 frozen chicken breasts, so I busted those out and did 'em up after the rice.  I've never had such perfectly cooked, hot (heat hot), tender and juicy chicken breasts.  And that was just for starters.... So then on Saturday I bought a 4.5 pound chuck roast.  I seared it up first just as you see people do it on the youtubes.  Just look up "Instant Pot" and whatever you want to cook, like "pot roast" or "chile", etc.  I seasoned it up w/ all the regular stuff...nothin' fancy...everyone will use whatever they like to use, so do your thing, it will all come out great in the end.. Then I set it on the high pressure meat setting along w/ 2 big chopped sweet yellow onions and let it go for about 35 mins.  After that I released the pressure and opened it up.  All was cooked great already, but then I added chopped up yellow skin taters and carrots which was all I had handy at the time.  Closed it back up again for another 15 mins.. I basically turned it into a big stew...and it turned out fantastic.  So easy and only took about 90 mins along w/ prepping time to clean and cut up everything first.. So today, since all the "stew" had already been wiped out, I seasoned and seared up 2 huge pork tenderloins.  Did same thing as with the chuck roast...pressure cooked them w/ a couple more onions for 35 mins, then opened it up again and added in all the rest of the carrots, onions, and taters I still had left over from before that I didn't use w/ the roast.. However...with the pork tenderloins I added in 3 cups of Mojo marinade to give it that Mojo flavor kick.  This was awesome...you all gotta do it.. Then I pressure cooked it all again for another 15 mins along w/ letting it de-pressurize naturally for about 10 mins afterwards.  Then I let out the rest of the steam pressure using the quick release valve and opened it up.. Again...absolutely amazing.  I basically created a shredded Mojo pork tenderloin stew that is incredible tasting.  Best thing I've ever made and it was only the 3rd thing I've cooked up yet w/ this pot.  I could have added all kinds of other stuff, celery, peppers, etc., but I just didn't have them at the time.  But now that I know how to use this thing w/ the basics and have the timing down, there's no limit to experimenting and cooking up great stuff.. And I do recommend getting the 8 quart size unit rather than the 6.  I have the 8 and it's just easy to tell that any unit smaller than this would make it difficult for good size stew type meals or other things like big roaster size chickens, or ribs, etc.  You gotta have the extra room for liquids and other things like lots of carrots, taters, onions, etc.  And with the 8 it seems just big enough for that kinda stuff.  I think if I had bought the 6 I would be frustrated w/ the smaller size, and there also might be more of a chance of overloading it and over pressurizing the smaller one if it's too loaded up.  Better to have the extra room in the 8 size.  Just sayin'.... Some pics are attached.

review_title: Why would you bake a pie or a cake in this thing when a regular oven works just fine? You can't possibly save any time
review_body: I bought this a few weeks ago, and was thoroughly intimidated by the apparent complexity and lack of information.  As one reviewer said, the manual doesn't tell you how high the cooking temperatures are or the length of various cycles.  And speaking of the manual, the manual Amazon sent shows items that don't match the pot.  The manual says to line up the arrow on the lid with the arrow on the pot and then turn counter-clockwise.  No arrows.  Had to turn clockwise to close.  My manual says in one place that selecting the function key (the food item you are cooking) will automatically set the pressure.  It doesn't.  If you want high pressure you have to also press the pressure button to raise it from low to high. It says that in a different place.. The other problem I have had is in finding recipes for items I want to cook.  I make milk braised pork shoulder ala Marcella Hazen but could only find a recipe for milk braised pork loin; I had to guess at cooking times.  The recipe book that comes with it is written for Chinese people and sometimes doesn't make sense.  I bought a recipe book, but it is full of recipes that I would never want to make.  Why would you bake a pie or a cake in this thing when a regular oven works just fine?  You can't possibly save any time.  I expect that it will be great for cooking lots of things, but the learning curve is steep.  There are blogs available that are helpful.. One thing that I give it low marks for is that it is much larger than it appears in pictures.  I thought I would be able to leave it out on the counter, but it takes up far too much room.  Luckily, I was able to rearrange one cupboard so I can put it away.

review_title: Is accurate, must be on hard ground!!
review_body: I was a little worried after I ordered this scale thinking that I would have accuracy issues as most of the poor reviews state, I tested it on hard concrete and got the same result each time I stepped on and off it,  linoleum on the other hand brought in different result, but +- 5lbs, it arrived a whole day sooner (even with 2day shipping) and is very sturdy, honestly if it breaks, ill order another

I have had these scales for a few days and so far it is accurate and consistent.. The design is sleek and modern. The instructions are very accurate and easy. to follow. So far this is a great product. If any problems occur I will update my. review.

review_title: It's sleek profile and design make this scale essentially a part of your floor.
review_body: The package arrived fast and in the as-advertised condition. The scale itself is very sharp looking, and was actually much lower profile (i.e. thickness/height from floor) than I thought it would be at the time I was ordering it. In fact, the scale's thinness and sleek profile are it's primary positive differentiator from other scales. When you think about it- in a no-frills, baseline bathroom scale, the size and design/appearance are the only real picking point (assuming it is accurate in measuring weight). This scale does, in fact, seem accurate in its weight measurements - I will update this review appropriately if that degrades over time. This particular model scale, at this price point, unsurprisingly has no other user functions or measurement modes (like calculating BMI, for instance). So if you are looking for a sleek, modern-looking digital scale that is accurate and reliable and hugs your floor to the maximum extent possible -- this product is a great choice.

I have put off buying a scale, because the ones I've looked at in stores just weren't accurate and gave different readings every 2 minutes.  This one turned out to be just what you want in a scale, accurate and consistent.  When I first got it I tested myself a half dozen times in a few minutes period and got the exact weight, to the tenth, every time.. Very pleased.

review_title: A great value on a great looking scale - and it's very accurate too!
review_body: I love this scale. After years of replacing the batteries in my wireless scale so I could see the readout at eye level, I finally got tired of it not working half the time and ordered this scale. So glad I did - it looks great and holds the readout for about 10 seconds after you get off so you can clearly see what the numbers are. This is helpful to us because the area where the scale needs to be is a bit small and you are right up against the wall when standing on it.

Fantastic scale!  This is very accurate (I weigh myself two or three times and get the same result) and I've compared to my mom's scale and the doctor, and it's spot on.  It's also silent which I love.  It's doesn't rock or make any sound when you hop on and there is no beep when it's ready.  Just a nice blue light, which lets my husband sleep through a morning weigh in :)  I would recommend this to everyone!

love this scale. once calibrated all you do is step on it and every time you get the same answer, not like my old one that you have to poke the front with your foot and wait for it to zero and then get back on to weigh yourself. Would like to buy one for the other bathroom but the old one still works.

Very accurate and the batteries last a LONG time even with every day use. I did get it on discount but I would buy it at full price if something ever happened to my original.. It has been weight tested by various sized people and the glass had no complaints even around 400lbs. You'll be okay.. Tested it after multiple doctor's visits too! Was an exact match every time.

I have three wrestlers at home who need to have their weight accurate.  This seems to be right on with the calibrated scale that they use for weigh ins.  We use it more as a reference.  It looks sharp, cleans up well, battery has been holding out...we have had it now for more then a month with multiple daily use.  Great product for the price.

I pulled my sheets off in a panic and lo and behold, there was a nice puddle sitting right on top of this mattress cover.. It's worth its weight in gold.  Actual gold, not kitten piddle.

review_title: Had a home birth - mattress is still spotless
review_body: I had a planned home birth recently, and one of my major concerns was protecting my mattress, since that can be a very messy affair.  This was one of the highest rated mattress covers, so I decided to try it, though I was still nervous.  I shouldn't have had any worries - this worked wonderfully, and my mattress is still spotless.

review_title: Excellent Protection For Your Mattress - A GREAT Value & Affordable Peace of Mind
review_body: We share our bed with two Old English Bulldogs, tend to eat, snack and drink in bed so a mattress protector is pretty essential for keeping out spills, Pet Dander and grime from our mattress. With a brand new Hybrid Memory Foam mattress from Loom & Leaf my spouse and I certainley wanted to protect it and purchasing this brand was a wise choice.. In the past we've used Sleep Tite protectors which were fine, although slept a bit hot and are twice the price so giving the SafeRest a shot was well worth doing. Some nice touches are:. * Soft Terry Top and Underside - protective material is in the middle. * Very thin. * Very well made stretch sides for any depth mattress. * Fitted Sheet Style elastic keeps the pad from shifting. * Great Price. * Breathes and does not sleep hot. Because most all mattress pads are only moisture and spill "Resistant" if you're looking to fully protect a new or existing mattress I look at it as a two tiered  strike. You need the full and complete stain/spill guard of a protection of pad - covered by a quality Mattress pad. We've used the Pinzon by Amazon on all our beds and they're marvelous, thick, plush and have wonderful support. In this way your mattress is both fully protected and comfy to boot.. My only gripe with the SafeRest is that it's not completely noiseless, without a top mattress pad expect to hear some crinkle but it's not obnoxious and can quickly be silenced by adding a plush mattress pad on top as suggested above. That said, the company was  fast to respond with a helpful tip which you can see under comments - Because packaging is so tight and it is, this saves space and reduces packaging  waste which I appreciate. After washing the Terry Loops will loosen up a bit and eliminate any noise.. Highly recommended.

I have a 1 year old and a 3 year old so I got these to protect the matress from night-time accidents. While there haven't been any pee accidents like I intended this to protect it has saved the matress from spilled cranberry juice and a couple of vommiting incidents. Great product!

review_title: Perfect for protection from our toddler, highly recommended!
review_body: After a couple of accidents while our toddler was napping in our bed we decided to purchase this. Wish we would have did it sooner! Absolutely waterproof and has protected our mattress from potty accidents with our toddler and spit up from our infant. Easy to put on and fits nicely under our sheets, can't even tell we have it on. I was worried that it would be really plastic like and be noisy due but it isn't at all. Highly recommend!!!

review_title: Ahhh. The perfect mattress pad for your bed.
review_body: I was in need of a new mattress pad. The one I had was about 10 years old. I put this on my bed, and the fit was perfect (and still is), and I slept so well with it that night. I would recommend it for any size bed.. The best money I spent on a mattress pad that will last me for several years. One thing I have noticed is how light weight it is compared to my old one.. Excellent value.

This mattress protector fits our pillow-top king size mattress perfectly. We've had other protectors that were too small, would cause our sheets to slide, or were so noisy that it'd make it difficult to go to sleep. None of these are issues with this one. This protector fits snug, is soft, makes no noise, and withstood our baby's diaper blowout and other child's sick night with ease. It is thinner than other mattress protectors which made it easier to clean in the washer too. This is definitely the best brand of mattress protector my family has ever used.

This fits our queen sized bed perfectly. I was worried because our new bed needed much deeper pockets than our old bed but this has deep enough pockets. Added bonus: there was no unpleasant odor fresh out of the packaging so I could put it immediately onto my bed rather than having to launder it first.

Mattress protector worked very well. It was put to the test the first time we used it. We just bought a new mattress and bought one of these protectors it fit the queen mattress snugly (as its supposed to.) A family member came to visit and we gave them that guest bed and they had an accident. It did not seep through to the mattress phew. This protector worked and saved the new mattress.

The reason we got this was because my cat has a tendency to person the bed when he's upset. Which doesn't happen too often anymore. But before I got this it was happening a lot. And it was a lot of trouble to get the smell out of the mattress. We've had this for a few months and I've washed it many times. This thing is still protecting the mattress! I will say that you have to find the stain within a couple hours or else is sweeps through onto the mattress. But other then that it's perfect! And it's not noisy!

review_title: I have always saved mine and put them in our yard waste pickup because they can be composted
review_body: THE SOFTEST PAPER TOWELS FOR ON-SITE MASSAGE.  Massage therapist who do corporate massage have used paper towels as a face cradle cover before many years.  The massages are short duration and not worth the laundry of a cloth FCC cover.  I've use just about everything out there , especially in the "pick a size" category.  Keep the low prices up and I will keep buying!. PS, I have always saved mine and put them in our yard waste pickup because they can be composted.

These are my favorite for everything: my stainless steal appliances, windows, use as a napkin, so soft I use them on my grandkids faces and hands. I even use them to wash dishes (instead of a smelly-sponge) they don’t tear and fall apart.

The rolls are smaller than sparkle but much more tight and dense ... the sparkle sheets are much bigger but the viva sheets contain just as much paper perhaps a bit more ... the viva is very soft ... I think this will be my new pick UPDATE you need twice as much even then they fall apart almost immediately - good tp tho
Ordered big sized rolls, but these are smaller than the regular sized ones!  Particularly "lenty"!

I have a hate/love relationship with these paper towels. They are great because they are think, good quality, and feel like cloth. BUT i hate how they are so compact, i almost always rip them when I pull one off....It might just be me, my husband says I rip them to angrily lol. ANYWAYS! Its a great brand , get the job done, good quality, and affordable,

I chose this brand to try when Amazon was back-ordered on my regular one. What a treat to find that Viva paper towels are as close to cloth as paper can possibly be! They are incredibly soft and strong and I love them. Others feel like sandpaper after using this product and I'll never switch back!

review_title: need a 3-person pit crew to rip one of the sheets away
review_body: You need a 3-person pit crew to rip one of the sheets away.  It's great once you've separated a sheet.  But there will be no more of that "grab a sheet, and tear with one hand". Whatever you need the sheet for, you'll need to drop everything else, and use both hands, and ask a partner to help.

I just got my paper towels today. They are significantly smaller in size than the ones I ordered previously. 100 choose a sheet rolls dropped to 90 count sheets... and they're slightly shorter too. I feel like I have been robbed of paper towels. Not a good value.

review_title: These are by far the best paper towels I've ever used
review_body: These are by far the best paper towels I've ever used. They are the softest and yet most durable paper towels. I get them wet and use them like I would a wash cloth to wipe my little guys faces and hands off. I order them through Subscribe and Save too, so I save a little bit on them that way! Highly recommend!

Can't pull these off the roll easily. Must use two hands. Also they leave lint wherever you use them. I bought a bunch of these because they were an Amazon choice. I won't buy them again. I have arthritis and having to use both hands to pull them off the roll is very annoying.

review_title: Fleeing my home naked and screaming with my instant pot cradled safely in my slippery arms
review_body: If my house caught on fire while I was in the shower, and I had only enough time to grab a robe, I would instead run to my kitchen, grab the instant pot, then flee my burning home, naked, wet, and screaming with shampoo in my eyes. That's how much I love my instant pot.. If you want to change your life, drastically and completely, then you must own this sleek and beautiful machine. I don't cook. I'm busy with a full-time job and a business, I'm single with no kids, and I am not especially romanced by food. It is basically fuel and I don't like doing lots of dishes just to eat a meal that took too much effort. However, when I realized I needed to put the bare minimum of effort into my nutrition, I asked around and heard about this mythical beast that made life simple and delicious. I dump in some rice and spices, or beans, press a few buttons, and move on with my life until the machine beeps. I know others who own multiple and make beautiful, elaborate, hearty meals with meats and other sides in their instant pots, so that is an option for those who love to cook as well.

I had a Cuisinart that does not hold as much, and the nonstick material was questionable.  The bigger size and the stainless steel of this Instant Pot make it well worth it.  I even convinced my household to get rid of our rice cooker, because this cooks rice really well.  Just pop the rice in for the 3 minute timer.  It takes about 8-10 minutes for the pressure to build up, and 8-10 minutes for the pressure to release, but it's still well worth it.  I'm actually using it right now to make an artichoke!  So easy.  I love the cute beeps when it closes so you know it is safely sealed and ready for the pressure.

review_title: 22 y/o Male Now Pressure Cooks Everything In His Life, Tune in for More.
review_body: I am a 22 year old male that frequents the gym so I make most of my meals ahead of time for the week. I AM OBSESSED WITH THIS THING. I literally go through my fridge and go "hmm, that will fit in the pot" and throw it in. BOOM, in 3/4 of the time whatever I through in the pot with a metric ton of season comes out delicious.. I'm vegan so I wanted to make a vegan chili. Have I ever made one before? No. Did I have a recipe? No. Threw 4 cans of beans, veggies, and wild rice up in this pot with sugar, spice, and a can of crushed tomatoes and veggie broth. I now have enough chili to feed the entirety of the Swiss army while everyone in my lab at work asks for the recipe.. Cooked a whole chicken in this too, cuz I could.

review_title: BEST SMALL APPLIANCE EVER!!! You'll use it constantly!! Not a shelf sitter. ;)
review_body: The BEST small kitchen appliance I own! I used my first one for 4 years and it was still going strong (until I set it on the stove and melted the cord and bottom ... woops). I could hardly wait to get my new one. I use it for everything. It makes the clearest, most wonderful soup broth I've ever seen, the pressure cooker function is easy to use and you don't have to worry about keeping the temp right, like those bummer stove top styles. I have used every function on it, repeatedly -even the yogurt making one- and everything turns out perfect. I literally cannot live without this tool. The best money you'll ever spend for a coooking device. I love it as much as my Kitchen Aide Mixer (and that's saying a LOT), but it's even better because I use it so much more. This thing does EVERYTHING! <3 If there were 10 stars, I'd totally give it 10!!  The one thing you may want is to get one of the Instant Pot cookbooks that are available, because the one that comes with it isn't all that great. However, I've used mine without an additional cookbook using my own ideas and recipes and have loved it.

I LOVE my new instant pot as soon as I got it a did the recommended test which helps you get accustomed to the machine and breaks the ice. I then could not wait and wanted to cook something.  I had 7 large frozen boneless and skinless chicken breasts from jewel and figured it says you can go straight from frozen to delicious meals in no time without thawing etc.  So I did it. I placed all 7 large straight from freezer chicken breasts into the pot and set the machine. In less than 40 minutes I had the moistest and perfectly falling apart cooked chicken breasts like I have never had before. the machine is a super star and I will use it for everything I can.  I love this thing and its my first pressure cooker ever. I did my research online for all models pro's and con;s and settled for this brand and I am very happy I did.  Solid well built unit with tons of options that others lack. Plus this unit comes in not only 4 quart and 6 quart like most others but also has an 8 quart which is the one I purchased and and very pleased that I did.  Can never have to big a pot for those special occasions when you need to cook more than usual. This 8 quart can also cook things down to as small as 1 cup of rice perfectly.  I will be making all my meals in the instant pot not only for the taste and tenderness but also for the 95% vitamin retention it renders within all foods cooked in it.

review_title: Amazing and well built machine! Incredible must-have for every kitchen.
review_body: I have only had my Instapot for about a week, yet I have cooked every dinner and most lunches with it.. This is simply incredible. It is the next best thing in my kitchen to my SINK!. I have experimented with lots of recipes: chicken, beef, bison, squash. All of them have come back DELISH!. Here are some quick and dirty recipes:. Chicken and Rice. - a frozen (preferrably ORGANIC) packet of chicken. Standard size from your store. It can be frozen. Yes, folks... yes. I took 100% rock hard frozen chicken from the fridge and put it in. And it came out to be the most tender delicious chicken ever.. - 1 cup rice. You can get fancy here. Mix with a rice medley/lentil mix. Throw in some Quinoa, whatever. - 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper. - 1 tablespoon pink himilayan sea salt. - 1 tablespoon garlic powder, or better yet a clove. Ah heck, you don't even have to be a pro-chef to make a delicious meal. You can use my recipe above and subsitiute it with beef, squash, bison, lamb or whatever.. This thing takes completely RAW ingredients and makes them delicious meal in 35 minutes. Thank you PRESSURE! And thank you Instant Pot!!!

Great quality!  Was thinking about sending this back after I ordered it.  Was at Costco and found the "As seen on TV" Power Pressure cooker XL for $50 less.  I was trying to figure out the difference and watched a few YouTube videos.  Here is what I liked: stainless steel pot vs aluminum non-stick coating pot (would never look clean after using), Pressure release assemble much simpler and easier to clean, internal lid is all stainless steel with no aluminum liner lid part. Two heating setting vs one.  I never used the Power Pressure but construction looked cheap and would not hold up near as well.  I really was planning on sending back to Amazon the Instant Pot after seen the lower priced Costco product but the Instant Pot quality was worth it to me.

DONT' EVEN BOTHER... I think the concept could have been good; however if has failed to deliver a meal. Just poor performance. I have been using pressure cookers for decades, I am following not only the specifications, but the directions in the booklets and cooking tables from their website. Even a simple beef-stew does not get done right.The juices get fully evaporated because the moisture/juices escape through the valve even when in the sealed position and in full pressure, so the meat comes out tough and dry. Last week I reached out through their website with questions and concerns, and was asked to fill out a ticket, which I did, I have never heard back. NOT A GOOD PRODUCT.. Irene

review_title: I want to buy one for every cook I know
review_body: AmazingPot they should call it. First recipe was Chicken and Wild Rice Soup. Very hearty. Get ready to spend on accessories: I like a second liner pot ($35) the glass lid for sautéing, a better base riser than it came with, as well as a stainless steamer basket. Also find that a silicone steamer with "feet" and "handles" is nice as you can use that to lift things out--such as cheesecake. Yup. You'll want the 7" dia  x 3" high pan for that!. You can set up the delay feature for foods like steel cut oats the night before--it cooks breakfast while we get ready. You'll need to get stainless or heatproof bowls though as this requires the "pot in pot" technique which saves on cleanup too.. You may never need your stove again except to finish certain recipes under the broiler. I also notice so many men seem to love it--the book by two guys with 500 recipes is worth getting too.. Yes you're in for $200 or more with all the extras--but you'd spend that on a session with a psychotherapist and this will change your life much more quickly. (Yes I am one; I know whereof I speak!).. I've given these as gifts a few times lately and other friends have joined the frenzy. We're planning an Instant Pot Challenge at the lake this summer!

review_title: So far so good, for western and Indian food
review_body: so, i bought this before the black friday sale. *sad face*. but, i had owned it a month by then and used it almost every day, so i suppose i got some good value out of full price!. i was originally looking for a slow cooker with a saute option. but i didn't like any that were on offer. they either had the non stick inserts or the very heavy ceramic covered stone inserts. and in either, i just didn't like the idea of the covering chipping away and mixing in with the food being cooked. then i came across the instant pot. at first i skipped over it, because that many positive reviews just didn't seem right. there are so many products here on amazon now that have these review-for-discount ratings that bump up products that i'm more skeptical about items than i used to be (there's got to be something amazon can do about their algorithm on this). but it kept coming up in searches, etc, and my friend had been raving about her electric pressure cooker as well (not ip, just electric pressure cooker), so i decided to investigate. i went to their site, saw some other ratings and reviews on the internet and after comparing models, decided on this one. along with the pot i also bought the glass lid for use when slow cooking.. the features that made me buy this were. 1. the stainless steel insert (ALL my cookware is stainless steel, with the exception of one le creuset dutch oven and a couple of iron griddles),. 2. the saute option,. 3. the slow cook option,. 4. the pressure cook option with manual adjustment options.. now, before i delve into my review, i should make it clear that i do cook a lot, western and indian (if you're desi like me and are wondering how this fares with indian dishes, read on). along with the cookware listed above, i also have conventional pressure cookers: good ol' fashioned hawkins and prestige pressure cookers, which i have used for almost 15 years without trouble; i still have these and still use them.. one of the first things i did with this was make a slow cooked chicken soup. it did wonderfully. i was thrilled that i could set the time and adjust the heat. i also used the saute option for onions and garlic before throwing everything in and slow cooking. a note for those who may have read some reviews stating that the cooker lid doesn't work in slow cook mode and gives the "lid" message. to use the original lid, you have to twist the lid to close position and turn the knob to vent. i guess the electronics of the cooker detects that the lid isn't secure if you just place the cover over it and don't turn it close. i'm actually very happy that i bought the glass lid because the cooker works seamlessly with it and i can see what's going on. most of my usage in the first few days was slow cooking different soups. they turn out great and the keep warm feature keeps the food at the right temperature to serve and eat without needing to heat the food again. and it's not super hot either, which my husband prefers. five stars.. the real test of the instant pot came when using it as a pressure cooker and this is where i had to knock one star off. at first, it did great. i pressure cooked soaked raw chickpeas. perfect result. then, when i realized it was not enough for the number of people i was cooking for, i followed it up immediately with pressure cooking unsoaked chickpeas. perfect again. i mixed the two batches and you couldn't tell the difference. five stars still.. then came the chicken curry. turn on saute, throw in onions, ginger, garlic, spices, brown to perfection. good so far. now, being a veteran pressure cooker user, i have made small to large batches of chicken and meat in my hawkins and have never had to worry that the cooker is too full. with this one, as soon as the level went beyond 2/3rds, i didn't get any pressure. okay. so it's electronic, so i'll keep the five stars and make sure the level stays below the recommended level. however, even when the level is half full, there are still days when it won't build pressure. the element heats, the timer begins and ends, but no pressure. one day the level was less than half and i still had to start and stop a couple of times before i actually got pressure. by this time the food was half cooked anyway, so not quite as convenient as i would have liked.. before you say "clean the lid and rim", i would have you know that i clean the lid every time, as recommended in the book, removing every part as described and washing and drying them thoroughly and i also clean out the rim which, if you own this, is hard to get under. but i clean it nonetheless (because i'm a clean freak). so, i'm sorry instant pot makers, but the pressure is a little unreliable. and for many of us who cook regularly and need things that just work, this doesn't qualify for me as that quite yet. for me it's been 50/50 on the pressure cook score.. that said, when used as a slow cooker or when pressure cooking beans like chickpeas, this thing is a champion.. another note for the indian cooks: i made gaadhe aloo in this to go with kachoris. peeled and rough chopped the potatoes, briefly sautéed the spices in the pot, threw the potatoes into the pot on slow cook, added water and left them to cook. when done, mashed up the potatoes right in the pot to create the thick gravy with chunks of potato. perfection. i haven't tried dal yet, but i will update when i do.. conclusion: i have owned this for a couple of months now and have used it a lot, almost every day. i love the convenience of it, love the slow cook and saute with adjustable options, ADORE the stainless steel insert, but only just like the pressure cooker. all in all, a good investment. so far. i would recommend.

review_title: The product itself is better than I expected
review_body: Ordered the Etekcity Digital Scale last night and it was sitting at my front door when I arrived home this evening. Speedy delivery! The product itself is better than I expected. I was a bit concerned about it being a glass scale, but it's solid. No worries about it breaking at all. It was quick to set up: simply pop in the batteries, sit it on a hard, flat surface and let the weighing begin!. I also loved the look of the scale. It is not bulky or intrusive like most scales. It's a very sleek, modern design, which is exactly what I was looking for.. So far, so good! I've only had it one day, but I love it.

review_title: DONT BUY!! SHATTERED AND CUT MY LEGS AFTER 3 WEEKS!
review_body: DONT BUY. AFTER THREE WEEKS, IT SHATTERED WHEN I STOOD ON IT AND IM 125 POUNDS UNDER THE WEIGHT LIMIT. MY LEGS WERE ALL CUT UP AND THANK GOD MY TODDLER WASNT IN THE ROOM WITH ME OTHERWISE HE WOULDVE GOTTEN INJURED TOO. I PLAN ON TAKING LEGAL ACTION AGAINST THIS COMPANY. VERY INFERIOR PRODUCT. I KNOW IT WAS ONLY $16 BUT I EXPECTED IT MAYBE TO STOP WORKING IF ANYTHING - NOT INJURE ME.

review_title: This scale is a keeper. Don't step on it if you're too heavy!
review_body: For once, this company made something practical. No fancy features (although connectivity with bluetooth would be a big plus). It uses standard batteries, not button batteries, so it last longer and the cost of owning it is far less than those using button batteries. Thumbs up!

I regret purchasing this scale. It is very inaccurate and unreliable. It gives me the same reading whether I’m not dressed or dressed and holding my keys and phone. I wish I had noticed earlier so I could return it. Total waste of money.

Very helpful product, well designed and works great. I enjoy it as one of many tools in the house. Also useful for weighing packages for shipping if they are heavier than 11 lbs. I get a kick out of the fact it is made of thick glass. Very durable.

I bought this scale to keep track of my weight loss progress. I love the digital display and it is a nice looking scale. It is a much better scale than my last one, however I have noticed that the reading is never the same number. I used it three or four times in a row and got a different number each time (always within a 5 lb frame). I will likely purchase a new scale in the future, as I would prefer an accurate reading each time.

review_title: Wonderfully accurate body weight scale for the price.
review_body: The Etekcity digital body weight bathroom scale has proven to be worth the money since day one. Upon arrival, I was able to confirm accuracy easily by placing a pair of 10lb hand weights on the scale. Even with moving the scale to different flat surfaces (hard wood, tile, etc) I was able to re-calibrate easily and get the same result numerous times. This scale replaced our finicky and frustrating older and more expensive scale without a second thought.  I highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for a well designed, accurate, and cost worthy scale and I look forward to purchasing more Etekcity products in the future.

At first, it was working fine. Then, after 2 months, it stopped working. I kept getting an "Err" message. I've contacted Etekcity and they've informed me that I could get a replacement, but would hve to pay shipping. Shipping alone would to California was more than $15 (for a $19 scale)! In other words, not worth it...

To kick off 2016, I bought my very first scale from Eteckcity and I can't be any happier with this purchase. It's beautifully designed and fits nicely into our modern home. When I first received it I tested its consistency, and after going on it five times in a row (letting it reset in between), it showed the same weight each time. I really like the blue backlight which makes it very easy to read the numbers.. For the quality it's priced extremely well ($18.88 at the time of this review). Go and get it, you'll be very happy with it like I am.. Oh, don't be nervous about the glass, it's very strong. I don't feel it flexing at all under my feet.

Great product!  Easy to read weight ( which measures to 1/10 of a pound in pounds and metric.)Thin, sleek looking, comfortable for overweight people. Best scale I have ever owned. Works great on carpet by putting a small piece of wood under it.
Perfect price! Perfect pillow inserts! Fluff fluff!

review_title: Nice pillow for your decorative covers
review_body: Not much to say since it's just an insert pillow but it has a good shape to it and a soft feel
fluffy fit my pillow cases PERFECTLY super super fluffy look great
Product just as described.
Good pillow.  Needed 20 x 20 to properly fit case ordered.

review_title: I am very happy with this purchase and will buy this product again
review_body: Arrived in time and was exactly as advertised.  The pillow is full and fluffy.  I am very happy with this purchase and will buy this product again.  I also love the fact that it is made in the USA.
I will re order
Happy with this stuffer pillow. No complaints. Thanks!

review_title: The foam does not fill ANY of the corners of ...
review_body: The foam does not fill ANY of the corners of the pillow. So when I stuffed this into the pillow cover, it looked as though it didn't fit. Couldn't massage the stuffing into the corners either.
Nice and soft. Perfect for the couch.
Nice lights, too long for my wall but I can see many great uses for them outside or in a taller space.
loved these hanging from the arbor at my daughters wedding.  made a beautiful spot behind the dance floor.
I bought these as decorations for my bridal shower. It was perfect! It looked amazing behind white sheer curtains. I would definitely recommend.

review_title: these are super cute and easy to use and attach to one ...
review_body: these are super cute and easy to use and attach to one another but problem is a lot of them dead lights
They do not look like they do in the picture..very spaced apart.

review_title: You need to use clips or pins to keep the ...
review_body: You need to use clips or pins to keep the lights up otherwise there is no way to hang them

review_title: But all in all it looked great.
review_body: Did come slightly damaged (one of the zip ties was broken). But all in all it looked great.

review_title: I NEVER THOUGHT I WOULD NEED INSTRUCTIONS TO HANG CHRISTMAS LIGHTS
review_body: ... but they managed a way to make it happen. Nonsense really.
Those look beautiful but in the picture are a bout 5 or more series.. Misleading image.

review_title: We bought three strands to string together and when we ...
review_body: We bought three strands to string together and when we do that the solid mode no longer works... they will only flash, flicker, blink, etc. Not sure if we are missing something but they are being returned.

review_title: There is no smell so it doesn't stink like some do
review_body: We had a difficult time with this shower curtain liner. There is no smell so it doesn't stink like some do. When the shower is on it would blow out of the shower stall pushing my shower curtain to move causing my floor to flood. I gave it to our daughter.
This shower curtain is nice. No mold! The magnets kind of suck and the holes where you hang it from aren't reenforced with anything -- hence the 4 stars. So far it's pretty good though!

review_title: Easy to install. Hangs nicely inside the tub.
review_body: Easy to install. Hangs nice. Have not had a chance to use it yet, but it looks like it will work great.

review_title: Heavy duty, so far no mold
review_body: Good value. The mold in Texas is outrageous and so far this has done a great job staying free and clear.
It’s stiff but work great doesn’t get all stained and mildewy. No chemical smell either. I bought a second one for another bathroom.

review_title: It's perfectly fine - a very very basic clear shower curtain
review_body: It's perfectly fine - a very very basic clear shower curtain. The only thing that makes it not 5 stars is there are no seams on the edges - it looks like someone just cut the material.  Otherwise, works fine.

review_title: So far so good! I have been using for a few months ...
review_body: So far so good! I have been using for a few months and have not seen any mildew! I like that it's clear also. Good purchase.
Got this because my old one had gotten stained over the past year or two.  This one shows no sign of staining!  I don't have a metal tub but it still sits fine in the tub.
Great product I would recommend to anyone. Fast shipping. I received this a day earlier than expected.
It’s a good quality curtain and I like the clear color. Not only can you tell it’s clean after repeated use but it just looks elegant.

review_title: oh they are pretty small in size too
review_body: Just OK they leave particles behind when doing mirrors or windows that you need to slap dust off. I won't buy them again...oh they are pretty small in size too.
I like being able to color code with cloths to clean certain areas to avoid cross contamination (i.e. bathroom, kitchen, dusting)

review_title: These are amazing! Cleaning glass is unbelievable easy now
review_body: These are amazing! Cleaning glass is unbelievable easy now. Dusting, especially Tec stuff is a breeze.  You have to try these!!!

I signed up for these microfiber cleaning cloths because they are so versatile and handy to have around.  Clean glasses with them, wash your mirrors, wipe down shower stalls to remove water spots, use as everyday dish towels, use them whenever you need a durable but scratch free cloth.  The uses are unlimited and the softness of the clothes will baby whatever you wipe whether it be your car or your sunglass lenses.

These are wonderful cloths for cleaning bathrooms, windows, kitchens, etc.  They wash beautifully and are ready for use again and again.  i use them on windows and they make the windows sparkle...without leaving any lint residue behind.  they are much more economical and ecologically friendly as i don't have to use paper towels that wind up in the landfills.  the price is right and i'm very happy with the cloths.

review_title: ... the house and they have done the job very nicely. They clean very well without leaving a lot ...
review_body: Bought these for the house and they have done the job very nicely.  They clean very well without leaving a lot of lint and then voila throw them in the washer and dryer and good to go again.

I've been using a disposable brand duster for many years now.  What a waste of money!  These microfiber cleaning cloths are wonderful!  We use them to wipe down surfaces, for polishing, and for dusting.  Instead of using hundreds of rolls of paper towels or disposable dusters, just use these and throw them in the washing machine when you're done.  Couldn't be easier or more affordable!  Great buy!
Works fine at good price but doesn't last long.

Can't beat the price nor the quantity! I use these for cleaning and dusting absolutely everything. The three colors is nice but unnecessary. I have three floors in my house so I just put the blue ones in the basement, the yellow ones on the ground floor and the white ones for the upstairs cleaning. There is no purpose to it but since there are three colors and three floors why not?
They’re just ok. The price was right and they do the job but after one wash (according to directions) they’re already fraying.
The inner tubes are too small for a standard paper towel holder --- VERY frustrating --- towel quality is great.  Price is great.  But the inside is too small

I have a rescue and unfortunately use quite a bit of paper towels. I have big messes to clean up on a daily basis and will use cloth to clean them. I usually go to Sams club or Wal-Mart however Sams club has soared on their prices as well as Wal-Mart but you cannot beat the quality. I can buy a 6 pack of Wal-Mart brand and it will last me a week to where the paper towels I ordered from Amazon have been gone for 2 days. They seem like they have good quality until you start to use them. They fall apart very easily and the rolls themselves are very small and loose. I cannot afford to make mistakes like that. I imagine they are alright if you do not use papertowels in the capacity that I do. Even if you have children or do a lot of housework they do not last. I was very very dissappointed as Amazon has great quality items but this is not one of them. Even though I have this rescue most of the supplies and food come out of my pocket..

review_title: Not enough paper towels per roll
review_body: I bought these because they were cheaper than the other brands. The problem is that there aren't as many paper towels per roll as the other brands and I go through these rolls much more quickly. I think I would end up spending more money buying these consistently than paying a little more upfront for a more expensive brand that would last longer.
Awesome deal
Great quality
I've really enjoyed them
This stuff is like sand paper
Great quality, and a low low price!

review_title: Paper Towel brand Plenty that got short of packaging material
review_body: The item arrived today. The packaging box top and bottom has at least 2 x 10 inches open or exposed areas. It's good that the paper towels are wrapped in its plastic. review_title: Important: if you bought the Advanced Brita Pitcher (with ...
review_body: Important: if you bought the Advanced Brita Pitcher (with another layer in the lid to redirect the water), you HAVE TO use the Advanced Filter! It is more expensive than the traditional one and I feel the water taste the same.

review_title: water doesn't taste as good as the two-month ones
review_body: water doesn't taste as good as the two-month ones. But the convenience is super of course. probably won't reorder but am using it for now.

This is for the "Longlast filter." I would give 0 stars if possible; I was beginning to think I was crazy for having bad luck with an incredible 2 purchases of this item, but it is true. I purchased first (because the price was good) what turned out to be a "returned" item on Amazon warehouse. These were Brita longlast filters in their original sealed packaging. First 1 filter, and then the second proceeded to become clogged and to filter water over a period of hours. Realizing I must have a defective item, I called Amazon, and they were kind enough to send a brand new replacement of the 2-pack blue "longlast" filter immediately. I installed my new filter as per usual, and in roughly 6 days now, the first one has stopped filtering. It is still filtering last night's water.. I've been a happy customer of Brita for over 10 years now, purchased several pitchers and moved from the original filter to the now improved standard filter with never a complaint.  Until now with their "longlast filter." It seems clear that there is some sort of defective strain in this product; I see now from albeit a couple of other reviewers that I am not the only person this has happened to. Many may get lucky, but I recommend not buying this filter.  I will be returning to the "standard filter."

I have been using Brita for the pass 17 years;when my Aunt introduced me to this product when I had my last son. I have seen the continued  improvements on their water filters and I am happy to say that my preference  has remain the same. Great tasting water that even my last son has stay using and safely  enjoys.

review_title: They are a terrible option for filtering
review_body: I followed the limited instructions. After flooding the filter with water and running 3 containers of water I started using filter.. The filter would not stay seated in the container. When adding water the filter would be floating in the container obviously not filtering anything.. Foe double the price these were a terrible option. If I could have I would have given these minus stars.
