It's temporary. I wouldn't chance washing it. I placed it on our memory foam mattress, and it gathers up every where, every night. When fixing the bed in the morning. You need to fix this,  plus the sheets. Doesn't stay in place. Doesn't breathe well. Gets hot at night.

I got my daughter a new mattress and I wanted to make sure it was protected from nighttime accidents, so I gave this a try. It is AWESOME! It doesn't sound crinkly and it feels soft underneath the sheet. Most important, it really works! She has had some big accidents at night, and this mattress protector has worked 100%! Not a drop of liquid has made it to the mattress, even when it happens in the middle of the night and she doesn't realize it until the morning. It works so well, I got a second one to use in case I need to remake the bed in the middle of the night.

I have a two year old that is patty training and we need it sometime for bed time accidents. This product does NOT work at all!!!!! My daughter had two accidents and her mattress is ruined . Every little drop when directed to the mattress, this thing did not help at all.... really disappointed.

review_title: i sleep comfortably. I had a kid tinkle in my bed
review_body: worth buying! I don't even notice that I have it on. It is water proof. I had to have an incasement on my mattress to keep the warranty from voiding and these along with the LINENSPA zippered encasement waterproof and dust mite protector, i sleep comfortably. I had a kid tinkle in my bed, and this was able to keep my incasement and my mattress safe from the accident! I was super happy. I would be buying this again for all my children. I am a hard person to please, but I love these!

I love this bedcover. It has a great feel. I also have a regular fitted sheet above it. It feels good and more luxurious. The material of the actual fitted sheet feels nice, I don't get any crinkling, and I recommend this to others, perfect size and fit. I think it would be practical to protect an expensive bed with this, even if there isn't a wetting problem. Thank you, SafeRest!

review_title: Great product. Purchased this for the daybed twin mattress ...
review_body: Great product. Purchased this for the daybed twin mattress so it would help protect it from spills and other mishaps. I was concerned about how comfortable it would be but I can honestly say I didn't even know I was sleeping on a waterproof mattress cover.  Very pleased with the quality and  performance.

When I purchased my memory foam mattress last year, I wanted to make sure I also purchased a cover to protect it...especially since if you don't protect it, you basically void your warranty.. I labored over what to get! I spent a lot of time searching and researching multiple brands, sites, price points, style, etc., etc., etc.  I almost decided on a full-zip style cover, until I realized it would probably be a pain in the rump for me to get in on and off the mattress.  I'm really glad I came to that conclusion, and even happier that I decided on this particular protector.  This protector fits like a fitted sheet and covers my 10" thick mattress easily with a little room to spare...yet it does not slip out of place.  It's fairly soft and flexible, so you don't really notice it once your sheet is placed over it.  I don't think it changed the feel of my mattress either.  I also love that I can just take it off my mattress, like you would a fitted sheet, and toss it in the laundry along with my other bedding.. I have recently purchased a new twin size memory foam mattress for my daughter.  Following the same logic as I did with my 1st memory foam mattress, I also wanted to purchase a protector for it.  Only this time, there was a LOT LESS searching I had to do for one!  All I had to do was look up my previous purchase from Amazon and select the appropriate size!  Yes, I liked it that much.  I now have a queen and a twin.  For anyone wondering...the twin mattress is 12" thick and the protector fits beautifully!. The only thing I can't comment on is how well they protect against fluids.  I haven't spilled anything on my mattress...and don't exactly wish to do so just for the sole purpose of testing it.  :)

This product fit the bed perfectly and has an 18" fitted elastic bottom skirt to tuck under the mattress, very handy since we have a 4" memory foam topper on our mattress making the whole thing pretty thick. It has a thin shield of plastic under the top cover which seems to be like light-weight terrycloth.  It is not quilted and very basic, but since it is under the sheets, no one would even know it was there.  I slept a week on it, and it never moved, lumped up, or slid around under the sheet.  There also is no crinkly sound from the plastic liner either.  It does the job and is a good foundation to keep everything in place and dry.  I would have given it a 5-star if the terrycloth upper was a bit heavier material.

review_title: Doesn't feel like a waterproof cover
review_body: This mattress cover is waterproof but it doesn't 'crinkle' when you get in or out of bed. The terry surface seems to breathe so it doesn't feel hot, even in the summer. We have a memory foam mattress and this cover is perfect for it. The cover allows the mattress to conform to the body's shape like it's designed to do, but will protect the mattress if anything spills on it. Bear in mind that this cover is not a cushioned mattress pad and it will not compensate for an uncomfortable mattress. In fact, you will hardly know it's on the bed. Until you spill something...

review_title: Great Protector (after Sheet is Placed on Top)
review_body: Size perfectly fit our king bed. It's terricloth and a little less smooth than regular protectors, so we were worried about that. It also sounded like we were laying on a bag of potato chips - this is our impression all before we put our sheets on. After the sheets were on, this protector was perfect. We can't hear it, it doesn't feel like there's anything there, and we feel secure knowing that it will prevent any accidents from ruining our new memory foam mattress. Recommend!

review_title: Pro - smaller sheets ... Con - less hefty
review_body: I like that you can tear a smaller sheet, but the paper is fairly flimsy. My wife prefers the Bounty heft. I don't use this stuff to wipe up big spills, but rather (a) to clean my espresso machine's brew-head and (b) to absorb bacon grease after cooking.  For those purposes, this is just fine.

Tl;dr: I used to LOVE Viva paper towels, and would swear by them, because they used to be the best, but they're trash now so don't buy them.. Years and years ago (probably 10 or 11 years ago) the product was way different, it really felt like cloth! It was soooo soft and strong, you could use it for anything! Cleaning up spills, blowing your nose, wrapping your sandwiches,  cleaning your car and even your baby! After changing the formula, making choose-a-size and printing designs, the quality is inconsistent at best, scratchy, both sides of the towels feel different, they leave lint behind, and it's been getting worse as the years pass. I wouldn't ever want to use these to blow my nose anymore, that nose would be chafed raw in 3 blows. For a long time I still bought them, trying to justify that they're still better than other brands, but I was delaying the inevitable, hoping they would get better again, and l don't think they ever will :(. Of course Kimberly-Clark will lie through their teeth about ever changing the formula in the first place. They are a corporation, they want sales, and they'll feign sympathy to try and keep the numbers up, and they'll keep peddling lower quality stuff for suckers like us to keep buying.. Please let me know if they change the formula back, or if there's another brand out there that makes a product like what these used to be!

review_title: Tear easy, very fuzzy, doesn't hold up well to being wet
review_body: I purchased these because I was having one of those couple of weeks.  My son was sick, couldn't make it into Costco (where I normally buy paper towels).  Then the AC died, and we had repair dudes in, who were awesome, but in the stress of making sure our son didn't make it out the front door I forgot to put paper towels on the list.  Twice.  And I didn't want to keep sending my husband back out, so I ordered these.  And I've got to say, I'm probably never going to do it again, but I can survive it until they are all used up.. First thing you notice when you pull these out of the box is that they are much fuzzier then most brands of paper towels.  I have attached a picture.  It's kind of like felt.  So, this is not desirable, from my perspective, if you are microwaving anything that you would use the paper towel over and don't want fibers stuck to it.  Or drying off an apple that you washed and again, don't want fibers stuck to it.. Next thing is that they tear super, super easy.  Not just when wet.  It tore two holes in the first roll I used just sliding it on our paper towel holder (it brushed up against the shorter bar of it), and this is not normally a problem I have, not with any other brand I've used.  It also comes apart easier when you are wiping up spills, which also isn't something I personally find desirable.  I need my paper towels to hold up to a lot because I am swimming in a constant sea of messes over here.  I have a very naughty kitty who's decided peeing and pooping outside of the litterbox is the world's best form of protest, his sometimes equally naughty feline sidekick, and a son who is a joy but loves to play in the sink and spill things all over pretty much everything.  So my paper towels need to not fall apart, because I use them a lot...and some of it, I don't want my fingers to come into contact with.  It's not quite as bad as toilet paper when it gets wet, but honestly, that's what it reminded me most of the way it started to come apart and turn to mush.. So, heads up. This was my experience with these in our household.

review_title: but these are so much better. They are so strong
review_body: I’m converted! I used to buy Bounty exclusively, but these are so much better. They are so strong, but so soft that you could use them to blow your nose. Have to be careful pulling off the sheets because they can stick together a bit and rip in the wrong place, but worth that extra split-second of effort.

review_title: Being able to order large amounts of top brands at Amazon and have them delivered free to my door is liberating for old folks
review_body: Viva are the best towels, I am very frugal with them because I was raised in Germany. I bought maybe 2 rolls a year. Yesterday I got 24 rolls delivered to my door thanks to Amazon Prime. I will have to be a little less frugal, lest I have to include them in my last will and testament.

These hold up way better than regular paper towels and I love the choose a size so I can dry hands or clean small spills with one but then choose more if I have a bigger mess. I love that these can be wrung out and used again too!

review_title: Impossible to tear from the roll!
review_body: I cannot even believe that I am reviewing paper towels but that is a testament to how much I hate these paper towels. Every single time I try to tear one from the roll (about a hundred times a day since I have a preschooler), the corner rips and the rest of the towel clings to the roll. It is infuriating. Sure, they are soft, but if you can't tear them easily, some product designer should be fired.
Love these, last a long time, durable, and love that there the half sheets. I had switched to a cheaper brand last month but switched back to these this week. Much better quality.

review_title: I have loved them in the past
review_body: I've been a HUGE fan of Viva paper towels for years and years.  I have loved them in the past.  But this most recent batch was such a disappointment!  They are so much thinner than in the past and far less absorbent.  They are really cheapening the brand.  Not happy!!

review_title: My wife initially didn't like these because they have a different texture from the ...
review_body: My wife initially didn't like these because they have a different texture from the ones we used to get. But then we had a baby and her mom came and stayed with us for a few weeks and LOVED THEM. Now my wife loves them too. Funny how that happens.

We both work for a living.  We have 2 kids that can be picky.  Needless to say, creating meals that satisfy my family that is also healthy can be a challenge.  After buying this and using it for a few months, it is one of the most valuable tools in the kitchen.  To me, every kitchen needs a toaster, microwave, Vitamix, good set of knives, a good nonstick skillet, a cast iron pan, and some triply stainless steel cookware.  For kitchen appliances, this is the fourth most used item in our kitchen next to our toaster, blender, and microwave.. Pros. Meat comes out tender and flavorful.  We have used chicken and beef and it works wonders.  I would say it has 90% of the taste of a crock pot meal, although you can also use this as a crock pot.. Stews and harder grains are a breeze.  Cooking beans is about as foolproof as it can get once you figure out the correct settings and liquid.  You don’t even need to soak the beans (although it helps).  Rice comes out as good as it does on my Zojirushi rice cooker in a quarter of the time from start to finish.  This may be the easiest method to make solid chicken stock.  You can cook smaller cuts of meat from frozen.  Harder vegetables like root vegetables cook up nice and tender.. Stainless steel bowl is generously sized and is easy to clean up.  You can put it in the dish washer with no worries other than possible discoloration.  The lid does not have any electronics so you can wash it under the sink.  Since you can take most of the unit apart, it is pretty easy to clean.  Cleaning was my biggest concern with the unit and it is quite easy.. The construction of the unit is solid.  The keep warm feature works very well.  The little pieces on the inside are also steel.  The only item I think that would possibly break would be the pressure cooker plastic relief valve.  As long as you aren’t body slamming the unit, it should hold up for 3-5 years with regular use.. If you prep your meal the night before, you can have many different types of healthy, fresh, one-dish meals ready for your family in under 30 minutes.. Cons. The unit does not calculate the heat up time and depressurization time.  If the manual says chicken will take 14 minutes to cook, it is considering the time once everything is heated up and is not counting the depressurization time.  Plan accordingly.. It is a pressure cooker so it takes a while to depressurize when it is done.  Usually, it takes a minute or two if you do it manually.  If you depressurize naturally, it can take 5 minutes or so.  The fuller the unit, the longer it takes to depressurize.. The silicone ring gets discolored and absorbs smells.  You have to replace this ring once or twice a year.. The unit can get very hot to the touch.  Duh.  Keep it out of reach of little ones.. The pot is stainless steel so you are likely to get stuck on food at some point of use.. Recipes are limited.  If you don’t know how to cook or experiment, you may get frustrated.. Searing in this unit is possible, but it is really weak to get a good quality sear.. Summary. Overall, I think this is an excellent unit.  Every kitchen should have one.  You can basically get crock pot food in a significantly faster time.  This unit shines with meat, soups, grains, hard veggies, and beans.  The unit will not replace every appliance in your house, but it serves its intended purpose quite well.  If I were to rank cooking appliances, you need a microwave first, then a toaster, then a good blender, then an electric pressure cooker, then a food processor, then a mixer.

review_title: Just another overjoyed Instant Pot user
review_body: My mother always used a pressure cooker. I have always made stews, pot roasts, pork for shredded pork and, well, after  forty-some odd years, I depend on a pressure cooker using one at least once a week. When I needed a new one, I checked out stainless steel stovetop on Amazon. In the "Customers Who Viewed This Item Also Viewed" section, I saw the Instant Pot.. The Instant Pot is everything they advertise. I will never again have to listen for the hiss-hiss to begin and then drop everything I'm doing and go adjust the electric stove knob in an attempt to get the interval of the pssst-pssst-pssst of the rocker set just right.. There are many advantages to the Instant Pot. What I've noticed so far is how much less liquid I have to use. It seems as if I need less spices. The Steam Vent handle is aafe, quick and a lot easier than picking up my old Presto stovetop PC and taking it to the dink and running cool water over it until the pressure is down and it's safe to open. Meat ends up tender, but not as stringy as that cooked in the stovetop PC. Clean up is as easy as they say. The User Interface (front panel controls and displays) are straightforward and intuitive. The handy one page reference guide is all you'll need after you've done a quick read-through of the manual.. And best of all, I won't have to depend on setting another timer or worry about mis-setting the timer, falling asleep and waking up to a Pressure Cooker run dry and have to go looking for Pressure Cookers on Amazon. Not that that's happened to me - just hypothetically speaking.

review_title: Stopped working after about 45 days and 10 uses. ...
review_body: Stopped working after about 45 days and 10 uses. I just opened a ticket, but I am concerned about the company honoring the warranty based on the reviews of many other people. I guess we will see what happens....

This thing cooks incredible ribs. Just pull the membrane back on the ribs, chop it up, toss it in the pressure cooker for 25-30 mins and then put some of that BBQ sauce on it, shove it in the oven and BROIL it for 2 mins or so on each side (to caramelize, it's already falling off the bone from the pressure cooker).  Done.  You've now just made super fast ribs that's better than what most average people can make.. Besides ribs, this thing has a host of easy to use functions like rice, beans, and you can even open the lid to sauteeing (which is what I do if I want to make some spaghetti sauce -- I would use the pot to saute up some onions, ground beef, bell peppers, mushrooms, and then dump in that good ol' Ragu/Prego sauce, season it to taste...and voila).. There's a lot more safety features and cool mechanisms with this thing so if safety is a concern, I wouldn't fret.. One thing to take note of, I recommend getting another of the silicone rubber sealant that goes on the inside of the pressure cooker lid (allows for sealing, so that the thing can pressurize properly).  It's sold here on Amazon, and also from the Instant Pot manufacturing site.  This sealant tends to develop a certain odor after awhile, and no matter how much I clean it, it's hard to get rid of.  I recommend stashing one or two extras and using those for specific groupings of food (e.g. one sealant for meats, another for soups, etc)...but then again, that's only if you're OCD like me.  I imagine most people wouldn't care because the food results you get out of this thing is sublime.

I bought this in April and gave it to my daughter after Mother's day. It worked beautifully then juse last week, it stopped. It just would not turn on. I want to return it, surely, the manufacturer or Amazon should have a longer warranty! I am very disappointed specially since it was not a cheap purchase. Thank you.
After a month, several of the buttons do not work. It is no longer fully functional.

I love food cooked in earthen pots, as it keeps the food warm, not hot. The food tastes much better, for a number of reasons. One of the criteria is use to check if the food is cooked healthy is by checking the time taken for the cooked food to start decaying. Anything cooked in earthen pot stays fresh a bit longer, than food cooked in metal containers. Why do I bring this up in this review. Well, this thing cooks food almost as is it were cooked in an earthen pot.. I have lived my life cooking rice in pressure cookers and why I dot like the texture, it's convenient and it's fast. The down side of it, is the rice gets compacted. Rice when cooked shouldn't stick to each other, as if it's glued together. When you take rice out of s pressure cooker, you only get baked cakes.. This thing cooks rice almost to perfection. Wonder what the magic is.. I have been using this for the last 3 months and I can't be more happier than this.. I haven't used this to cook Dhal, but I'm assuming it will be good as well

review_title: Timer tweaks; cooking time close to stovetop cooking
review_body: I bought this electric pressure cooker after doing research and looking at product recommendations. My first unit had a problem; it was replaced promptly in a very smooth transaction. My current unit beeps when its suppose to, goes through all its functions seamlessly. However, I have found that when I allow the unit to set the time for me for "meat" or "poultry" I don't get the tender fall-off-the-bone results that pressure cookers are famous for. I have adjusted the timer, always adding more minutes and results have been fine, but when you are feeding a hungry family its tough to say "l've set it for 15 more minutes" (on top of 35+ minutes on auto set). I keep tweaking the time and it's approaching stove top cooking. So what are the advantages? well, its self monitoring. You can set it and walk the dog. After cooking time is done, the unit goes into "warm" mode. It's sort of a cross between a fast crock pot and self monitoring stove top pressure cooker.  My mother had one of those old fashioned stove top pressure cookers that you prayed would never blow it's little free standing jiggling steam regulator, but she cooked up countless lip smacking fall-off-the-bone eveything meals with it. I am up to 40 minutes for a beef stew and about the same for chicken & rice. I have made both on stove top, with same flavors as a result and slightly better tenderness for the chicken. Not having to keep a close eye is the biggest advantage of this electric pressure cooker, I am still working on figuring out the the perfect cook times - its not the in the autosets! The unit is well made, has a good design, big easy to read buttons/readout, and it has various checks & balances so it's safer (it feels safer) than the stove top pressure cookers. The components are stainless steel, easy to clean & the lift-out inner pot goes from kitchen to dinner table to refrigerator. It's kind of a trade-off. Wish I could love it more.

Love my Instant Pot Duo Mini except the silicone seal on the lid.  Why does this require so much cleaning to try and keep the cooking smells out of it?  It is all over the internet about this.  You should not have to spend so much time soaking or steaming the liner to keep it from smelling.  This is a serious fault and the company really needs to fix this issue.  Now cooking in it for one or two is great (remember I have the mini).  I make yogurt, stews, flan, lemon curd, and so on without a problem.  Still use traditional pots for some things of course, but this pot is very efficient and the inner pot is very easy to clean.. So maker of the Instant Pot, get us all a seal that does not absorb the smell of whatever you are cooking.  This is a ridiculous product fault.

review_title: 8 quarts is too large for a family of 4.
review_body: The 8 quart size is too large for our family of 4. I take responsibility for buying an impractical size (darn you Black Friday!). It takes 15+ minutes to get up to steaming pressure/temp, so it is not quicker or more convenient for making dinner. Perhaps if you were making larger meals, like for a party or large family, there would be less air volume to pressurize and it would cook faster. I guess it makes for less dishes to clean up. We were hoping this was a "fire and forget" cooking device, like a really fast Crock Pot, that would make for less kitchen work in our busy evenings, but that hasn't been our experience so far. If you have been thinking of getting one, probably because of your social media friends over-posting about their Instant Pot meals, just remember, size matters.

review_title: But it is working really good for me
review_body: I read some reviews previously where some users mentioned that weight varies on scale and it is not proper. Even then I bought this product. But it is working really good for me. I will suggest to keep the scale on the flat and hard surface generally in kitchen or bathroom.  It shows me the exact weight. Product is easy to handle and nicely packed when received. Even you can change from LB to KG or vice versa.

review_title: Great looking scale that is accurate to the ounce.
review_body: Love this scale!!! Has the nice sleek look and is accurate to the T. How do I know this you ask. Well simply because I have tested several items where I already knew the exact weight and this scale was right on target. You can't beat the price.

review_title: exactly what was promised at a great value!
review_body: The sleek design of this scale is a major plus, I wanted something classy and inconspicuous. It's very easy to use, and the first set of batteries are included, which I also appreciated. It was as simple as inserting the batteries and stepping on the scale. If you wait for the numbers to balance out, they are highly accurate and stay displayed long enough to take note. This is exactly what I wanted - a simple, attractive, inexpensive scale for basic and accurate weight measurements.

review_title: Update from: I do not weight 250lbs!
review_body: Follow up on below: the company reached out on my negative review and sent me a brand new replacement. Working like a charm.. Original review:  This scale looks sleek and the numbers are easy to read. However within 4 months of buying it, the weight has become completely unreliable. I tried resetting between kilos and pounds, tried new batteries, tried a different surface in case bathroom tile wasn't level. Nothing fixed it.  Currently, its about 80lbs off, but not even that is reliable. Very disappointed since the other reviewers don't seem to have the problem.

review_title: This fabulous scale is totally a bargain.
review_body: This scale is perfect.  I really like the back lit dial, large digital numbers, and how durable the whole unit feels.  The unit also comes with a tape measure, so it is not necessary to order one on the side.  It worked delightfully right out of the box, and it also comes with really clear and concise use and care instructions.

review_title: Slim and light. Like me... not
review_body: Love the slim line light weight compared to my old digital scale and no more 9v battery!! Yay! The only thing I wish it had was the capability to remember previous weight, even just the last weigh in. But truly is great.

Very stylish. And quite accurate. I appreciate too that this accommodates higher weights. I got this for a friend who is a giant man, and this is a reasonably priced scale that goes high enough for him. But the item itself is not any larger than a standard scale. Looks great in his new apartment, too. I highly recommend not only this product, but also the brand Etekcity. I trust their quality and look forward to buying from them again.

review_title: It's not hideous like some off-white eighties scale with a spinning red dial
review_body: I mean... can you really review a scale? I use it to monitor my weight. I believe what it says. It's not hideous like some off-white eighties scale with a spinning red dial. It's really low so I can slide it anywhere I want. It's just pretty convenient. I don't understand the fancy $70 scales (do they do your taxes or something?) so this is a good choice as a low-cost, attractive option.

However, I was washing it, scrubbing it and finally replacing it every 4-6 months. With this new one, it still looks clean and new! I used to spray Tilex in my shower every 2 weeks to remove grime & mold, but since installing this new liner, I noticed I don't need Tilex any longer!

The liner has metal rings for durability and is thick enough to hold it shape and not blow inward during a shower (like the fancy curtain did).  Nice product.

review_title: Fits my old pitcher perfectly. Works great.
review_body: I 'inherited' an old Brita pitcher. This filter fit great. I did have to make sure I popped it in just right. We brought it with us during a 3-day hotel stay to ensure we had filtered water. During the 8-hour drive each way, we filled it up at gas stations and had clean water to drink on the road trip.  I got it to use for weekend trips as I have a water filter attached to my sink. So far it has worked great.

review_title: Longlast Filter took forever to filter water, was necessary to replace right away
review_body: Longlast Filter took forever to filter water. Purchased two of these. The first one worked effectively filtering in an efficient manner at first but slowing quite a bit over a 3 month period. The second filter took forever to filter water right out of the box warranting its immediate change. They were expensive compared to the standard filter but wanted the lead filtering aspect. Won't purchase again.

review_title: The Brita water filters filter out bad taste and bad ingredients from tap water
review_body: The Brita water filters filter out bad taste and bad ingredients from tap water. Riverside, California has undrinkable tap water and the Brita water system makes it taste better than bottled water.
Works as expected, came individually wrapped. Each one lasts a couple months of daily use.

Clean tasting water. I noticed that the water quality and taste was a lot better than the tap water I was drinking. That and the fact that I saw some particles swimming around when I was just drinking the tap water made this filter an immediate hit (I'll never know what I was truly drinking lol).. Super fast delivery and great deal. Saved a couple of bucks buying a three-pack!

review_title: Brita Water Filter Pitcher Advanced Replacement Filters.
review_body: I always keep one extra box of Brita Filters as replacements. Presoaking is not necessary and is no longer required. There are no more leaking carbon flecks due to a new mesh to prevent leaking. Been using Brita Filters for several years and have found them to be the best filters one can purchase.

I don't want to give the impression that it wrinkles under the sheet or anything because it doesn't.  it just isn't super tight.  I bought these for every bed in my house - 2 queens, 1 king, 1 twin, 1 full.  It fits most snuggly over the the pillowtop queen.  Also what I like about this is that it doesn't change the feel of my mattress.  It's not there to provide extra cushion or support, just to protect the mattress, and that's what it does.

The top is soft terry-cloth similar to a soft towel...not scratchy at all. It easily fits around a dorm mattress with a 3-inch foam pad under it. I highly recommend it!

Since I decided to purchase a new, expensive item like a mattress, I asked the company what mattress protector I should purchase, and they recommended this one.  I already have a nice mattress pad, but didn't have a protector.  It seems easy to wipe and works fine.

review_title: Excellent Mattress Cover - Exactly as Advertised
review_body: The product arrived on time, was well-packaged and very easy to place on top of the queen sized mattress.  The fit was excellent and the product provides the claimed protection.  I am quite pleased with the SafeRest Premium Hypoallergenic Mattress cover.  I would buy it again (if I needed more than one)!!

If you are looking for a very well made mattress protector that is waterproof, this is the one to get. I had this one many years ago and finally after so long, I had to replace it. I couldn't remember what the name of it was or who made it. Recently, I finally found it again, right here. I was extremely excited. I had been using bulky mattress pads that would tear on the sides after a very short time and I was replacing them often. I finally had to call that quits.I searched and was so relieved to find this one. The thing that I love the most about it... it's very lightweight but protects wonderfully. It's so easy to put on the bed and I have a huge, king size Tempur Pedic. It also doesn't take up all of my washer or dryer. I can actually wash it and my sheets together!. The other mattress covers I had were so huge and bulky and were so difficult to put into my washer, which is a heavy duty washer anyway. I'm completely happy to have this one back and would recommend it to anyone!

We just purchased a new mattress and wanted to purchase a good mattress protector.  My husband did lots of online research and decided to purchase this mattress protector.  We are very impressed.  Good quality and good price.  We will definitely be purchasing more for the other beds in our home.

review_title: A dry mattress is a happy mattress.
review_body: FINALLY A DRY MATTRESS... sorry.  Anyway my 12 year old son has a problem with bed wetting and I turned to this sheet out of desperation after having to buy a new mattress due to all the accidents on the old one.  I can report that after many accidents(unfortunately... but I guess fortunately for review purposes) and many washes this sheet still keeps the new mattress completely dry.. I see other reviews stating it didn't last through a wash and dry.  If you followed the wash instructions provided I don't see how this would happen, more than likely instructions weren't followed.  I know i'm guilty of "lazy laundry day" where everything gets cold water and high heat in the dryer just to get it done fast.  I'm happy I did it right for this sheet.. Bottom Line = If your looking for a dry mattress you'll love this sheet, as for all the other features(germ protection?) I can't say as I don't own a microscope.  Strongly recommend this product.

We purchased this for our son's college apartment. We live out of state from where he attends school, so it was so convenient to have it delivered directly to his apartment. He's been sleeping on it now for almost three months and loves it. Says he always looks forward to going to bed because it's so comfortable. I'll definitely be buying one of these for his mother and I within the year as our current mattress seems to be nearing it's end.

I purchased the twin size last year and have been so pleased with it that I just purchased the full size for another bed. My young son has accidents about once every month or so. This mattress protector does its job. In a year, we have not had a single leak through. It does not smell or feel plasticy and it washes very well- even in a hot cycle with a bit of bleach. If you are looking for a mattress PAD, this is not your solution. There is very little padding.

review_title: Great protection and holds up to washes
review_body: These are fantastic.  I can barely tell the cover is on the mattress.  I have two queen beds and have the covers on both.  They seem to hold up to washes very well.  I have had one for about seven months now and no trouble with the seams or the lining whatsoever.  Very much worth the cost.  The protection level hasn't been compromised even after some instances ocuring with our puppy, which was why we got one to begin with.  He's taken to the other bed and is now able to jump on it,  hence the second purchase.

review_body: We go through a lot of paper towels - but we recycle. When I looked at the price between these and other major brands these actually were cheaper! Shocked me. Viva paper towels are just the best.

My favorite paper towels. These have heft and feel soft like a cloth. Very absorbent.  Very luxe feel.  Anyone who tries these loves them.  Beat's Viva's "stronger" version.  I hope they never get rid of these.

review_title: Time is money and this saves a ton of time!
review_body: I bought this mainly because I kept hearing about it and it went on sale. I use it mostly for hard/soft boiled eggs and rice.. My old rice cooker could make rice and also soft or hard boiled eggs, but it was MUCH slower. Rice took 45 minutes and hard boiled eggs, 25 minutes.. The first thing I tried with the Instant Pot was 2 hard boiled eggs. They were ready in under 10 minutes total, from loading it with 1 cup of room temperature water to completely done. Amazing! Time is money and what I used to have to wait about 25 minutes for I can now do in under 10 minutes!. Rice took about 12 minutes for 2 cups.! I can literally have friends over and if we decide to have some rice with our dinner, I can make it and have it completely ready while they are practically still just pouring drinks. Amazing!. I also really like that the inner pot is stainless steel and not some non stick coating like my prior rice cooker was. I think it's healthier not to have coatings that could potentially flake off or leach in to your food.. I'm a single guy and bought the 6 quart version which seems just about the right size.. I'm excited to try cooking more dishes in my Instant Pot and it was money well-spent!. UPDATE: I even tried making pasta and it turned out great and in under 7 minutes total. I just added enough pasta for a single serving, some pasta sauce out of a jar, 1 cup of water. I used the Manual setting for 3 minutes. After it was done, I quick released the steam and presto, perfect pasta! Amazing.

review_title: Pressure and slow cooking as it should always have been.
review_body: Tonight was my first trial of the new Mini Instant Pot.  This is the second one I have and is well on its way to be my favorite.  Cooking for two, I seldom need the higher capacity of the larger models and haven't pressed to see how small a quantity I could cook without issues.  Tonight was my personal mix or whole grain rices with a 1 cup rice quantity.  It came out well.  I will try half the quantity next time to better match the needed quantity.. I cook at sea level and also at 6000 feet in the mountains.  The Instant Pot does pressure cooking by temperature, so I can use the same recipe at either altitude.  This new Mini will relieve me from carrying my one pot from one altitude to another.. From my standpoint, this is pressure cooking as it should have been.  No fussing with the burner flame and when there is steam enough ... just pick a cooking time and match it with the right liquid level for reproducible results.  I do less slow cooking because we like the that approach less, but again, it runs without constant attention.

review_title: Very poor customer service from Instant Pot, but great customer service from Amazon
review_body: I really like my Instant Pot but it stopped holding pressure after about a year of use, and I only use my a few times a month.  I contacted Instant Pot directly, which is what they request you to do in their paperwork, and never heard back from them. I waited about eight days and contacted Amazon.  Within 2 days I had my replacement.  I can access my support service ticket online with Instant Pot, but I still have not heard back from them.

A useful product, letting us cook beans in an evening instead of starting them one night (soaking) and finishing them the next (cooking for a couple hours). This completes the process in an hour or so. Various beans have been the most frequent occupant of the pot. Others include soups and stews, which are done in a jiffy.. Minus 2 stars for the confusing directions on how to set time or kind of cooking. Some day I'll make a million by taking a week to figure the directions out, and rewriting them into "useful and understandable". It's almost as if they don't want you to use the equipment.

I've owned the Instapot for more than a year now and use it on a weekly basis. I love this thing and have recommended it to many friends now. I use the pressure cook and slow cook options regularly! I even got rid of my stovetop pressure cooker, because I wasn't using it anymore. This one does the job perfectly well, with no noise, and no mess. I use the pressure cook function to make flan, meat, and beans. The slow cooker is fantastic for busy working families especially. No one feels like cooking when we get home from work, so I prep meals the night before, toss the in the Instapot in the morning before going to work, and leave it slow cooking throughout the day. The timer is great, because I can customize cooking times exactly how I want them. The saute feature is a huge bonus. A lot of slow cooker recipes require that you brown the meat first. It really saves the mess and hassle of browning it on the stove, and then transferring it over to the slow cooker. I simply use the saute feature to brown whatever I need, then turn it off, switch to slow cook mode, cover, and walk away. It's the best feeling to get home from work in the evening and have a home cooked meal ready to go!

What is there not to love about the instant pot? I have made tapioca dessert, broth, and bo kho, and they were delicious! It does cut down the cooking time for some foods (tapioca and broth), but not for others (bo kho). It does not radiate an insane amount of heat or have the aroma permeate the entire house (which might be a minus). We also made the best tasting Mac and cheese ever!!! Usually you would have to nurse and watch the water, like the water for the tapioca too. However, with the instant pot, you set the timer and come back when it goes off. The babysitting time is almost non-existent with the instant pot! :)

I was skeptical, but we bought this cooker.. Two racks of baby back ribs.  Apply rub.  Into the cooker with some water.  Set to 20  minutes.  Come on... Seriously?.  I cook or smoke ribs for at least four hours.. Beep... Done.  Open the lid.  The meat is literally falling off the bone.. Slather on some homemade sauce.  Under the broiler for 5 minutes.. Unreal.  They had the flavor and texture of ribs that cooked all day.. Now we're cooking refried beans.

review_title: Glad I decided to purchase my Instant Pot.
review_body: If you enjoy hard cooked eggs that practically peel themselves, delicious freshly made yogurt, perfectly cooked al dente pasta, and cooking meatloaf and mashed potatoes at the same time, in 15 minutes, then the Instant Pot Duo,  is what you need.  Love. The. Instant. Pot.. Just a few of the many things that I have made in the last two months.  Ramen noodles with beef Short Ribs and Egg, Korean Beef Short Ribs, Yogurt with Pears, Honey & Pistachios, Yogurt with Fresh Peach Preserves, Individual Breakfast Quiche, Lamb Tagine, Jambalaya, Seafood Pasta, Meatloaf and Mashed Potatoes......

What's all the fuss about?? If, as a number of people have said, there's 1) a steep learning curve, 2) it takes getting used to, 3) it's intimidating--then it's not a great product, or more likely, the instructions (such as they are) are poorly written. I found the instruction manual to be incomprehensible, and NO ONE in my house could replace and lock the lid (all educated adults). Clarity about the product was near nonexistent. It should not be difficult to write an understandable, straightforward manual. The IPot people failed to follow through. There's a golden book opportunity here for someone who knows how to teach, explain, simplify and otherwise make sense to people with new appliances. P.S. I put a new vacuum cleaner together yesterday with zero trouble. Whoever get this IP next at a discounted price: it's brand new and has never been used--but lots of luck--you'll need it..

review_title: I've had nothing but success with this.
review_body: I first made teriyaki chicken with vegetables and it was easy and delicious. The chicken was very tender. The next day I made beef enchiladas using stew beef chunks. After cooking, the sauté feature reduced the liquid much faster than my gas stove ever did. The enchiladas were amazingly good with a strong beef flavor combined with the enchilada sauce flavor. I've struggled with tough meat before, but the 20 minutes with the 3lbs of chicken and the 30 minutes with the 2.5lbs of stew beef resulted in perfectly tender meat. Cooking bone broth for 3 hours resulted in a very gelatinous broth (slow cooker takes many more hours).. The heating element and thick bottomed inner pan design provides perfectly even heat. The controls are very easy to use, but I suggest reading the first few pages of the manual to get a good idea of all the features. The way that it heats up to the selected pressure, keeps it there with very little steam escaping, and shuts off after the programmed time, produces great results every time. You can barely smell what it is cooking - I don't smell the food in the house the next day as a slow cooker can do. And I believe the claimed energy savings since it doesn't radiate much heat.. It is hard to cook great meals after coming home from work, but this has made it much easier and less error prone. And I love to hear my kids ask for seconds. It has exceeded my high expectations, even after I read all the other positive reviews.

Very easy to set up and use.  Large display--can read it even without nay glasses.  Easy instructions.  My old scale stopped working but now that I have this one I'm liking it better than my old one.

This is the best scale. It doesn't matter how you are standing on it it will read perfectly. My husband even stood on it with one foot and it came up with the same number. We truly put it to the test and it didn't falter even .1 lbs I am very impressed with this. Also it is made of glass however very durable my 4 children have dropped it several times and it hasn't even cracked. If you are looking for a great digital scale here it is.

Scale is very erratic in its readings.  I can weigh on it and it gives me a weight and 5 minutes later (without moving location of scale) I can weigh  on it again and it will be 1 pound or over the reading it gave 5 minutes ago.  Would not buy this product again or recommend it to anyone.

You don't have to tap to reset the scale like some other products.I like the color and it really feels well built.. It is good to have a weighing scale at home. I have been using it every other day and it helps me to keep my weight in check.

This also did not come with the body measurement tape as advertised. At this point I would've rather spent less money on a more basic scale that does the exact some thing and ordered the body tape separately instead of going for this product.

I washed them before I used them (gentle cycle/cold water); blue and yellow make green - all the white cloths are now green.. - There is a lot of shrinkage, after washing they are now 11.5" by 14.25".. - a few corners are frayed even before washing. NOTE: These are a little larger than some other microfiber cloths.  I like that about them, and they seem to be holding up to vigorous use.

I am confident with this new pad protection, this mattress will outlast us!  The quality is exactly what I wanted, and the price was even better than I expected. review_title: Saved our mattress a few times
review_body: Second size I've purchased of this brand. Great to have for newborns (probably kids in general) as you never know when they might spit up or leak through their diaper. Don't even notice it's there unlike some that can be plasticy and noisey. This has saved our mattress several times.

It went on quickly and was delivered promptly.  I have a 4 year old who is still struggling through sleeping without going potty.  We got these so we could take the pullups out of the equation and see if he can safely sleep through the night.  Haven't had an accident yet - but we'll find out soon whether these deserve the 5-star or not.. 11/28/2016 Update: We've been using these for almost a year now and I would say that they are definitely worth the 5 stars I gave them.  We've had multiple accidents from both of our boys, very bad pond-forming accidents.  And in every case they have held up and the mattresses are good as new.  We've washed them multiple times and they have held up.  Great product!

I love this mattress protector. I actually cut off the sides & use it inside a duvet cover to protect my bed from doggie accidents. I like this much better than the bed wetting pads that are thicker & heavier because it is so much lighter & cooler to sleep with. I use it on top of bed (like a comforter) instead of a mattress pad, so I want lighter & cooler during the summer months. It works great for my purpose. I have a queen size bed & bought the Cal King size, cut off the sides & put it inside a queen size duvet cover. Now my bed looks nice, is protected, & is easy to wash if needed.

Mine is 2 years old, replacing it because I want a clean new one but its still fully functional and pretty comfortable (for a mattress protector).  Younger me would sometimes puncture cheaper mattress protectors with my elbows lying face down and reading but this thing has held strong.

This really is a very soft mattress protector. At first I got a regular terrycloth protector, but it seemed scratchy, so I returned it. Based on the reviews here, I decided to shell out a few extra bucks for this one, and I’m glad I did. On this one the side facing up is silky soft and there is no crinkling sound at all.

This mattress protector is of excellent quality and is just what we were looking for. It is of much better quality than any of the other mattress protectors we have purchased in the past. I love the fact that is not "noisy" or "plastic-y" feeling under our sheets like others we have had. It also helps to keep our fitted sheet on the mattress better than the previous mattress protector that we had.. It fit our thick pillow-top Serta Queen mattress very well with plenty of extra room to spare, was so easy to stretch over the mattress, and so much softer than I expected!

review_title: Rest a little easier knowing the SafeRest in place
review_body: Queen Size SafeRest Premium Hypoallergenic Waterproof Mattress Protector - When my wife and I bought a new mattress we asked ourselves, "What about the dog. She is getting old and when she gets excited, she does what old dogs do when they are excited." And, yes we love her. And we have changed our sheets and bed pad when she had a accident on the bed. BUT NOT ON OUR NEW MATTRESS. NO! So a mattress protector was necessary. This one had the best rating, and having used it, I can see why. I did a "trial" with a small cup of water and it did not soak into the mattress. Now we rest a little easier knowing we have the SafeRest in place.

review_title: This will be on every bed in my home!
review_body: Four years ago I purchased this for my daughter's  first college apartment.  She does most of her homework in bed and has had lots of spills.  She also sublet her room while she was abroad. She is a bit of  a germphobe  so this pad has been washed frequently.  SHE LOVES THIS PAD!. After my daughter's  rave reviews and reading about the lady who gave birth on this pad...I ordered more!  I have a deep queen mattress with a 4 inch foam topper..... it fits!  This is a must have to protect a mattress.  It does not crunch so the waterproof quality is not obvious.
Best towels in my opinion. Soft, absorbent, and they cling to themselves on the roll, so if your holder is near a window or some other air source, they won't unroll themselves.
These are my go-to paper towels! Have more of a fabric texture as compared to your normal budget paper towels. You can use a lot less to do the same job. Highly recommend!

Two things I love about this product.  It is super soft and cloth-like.  Also, there's a static-cling such that I never pull too much from my mounted paper towel holder.  I never have to re-wind the extra towels back into the roll.

review_title: but they stick like glue on the roll
review_body: yes, they are strong, but they stick like glue on the roll, making it hard to grab one with one hand when your dealing with messy stuff in the kitchen, so that is aggravating. Also leaves fibers on cast iron when you try to gently wipe oil on them..

review_title: Unsurpassed quality, great price, and peace of mind!
review_body: The best paper towels ever, at a price that's even better. You know you'll use these, so why not stock up, and never worry about running out again. I plan to re-order when I'm down to my last 5 rolls! The choose a sheet Viva is really the way to go--always enough, yet never too much.

review_title: Possibly Poorer Quality than Smaller Quantities
review_body: I’m convinced that the quality of these towels is lower than the Viva paper towels that you buy in smaller quantities. They seemed flimsier and rougher than what I’d expect. For the price, they are decent enough, though.

They ought to be ashamed of themselves calling these "big plus" rolls. There's nothing big or plus about them.  This is the smallest roll of towels I've ever seen in my life.  And for the price they charge it's not like it was a great deal and it should be expected to be super tiny.  By the wording and sheet count they should be normal "big" size.

review_title: best paper towels - i used to be a bounty ...
review_body: best paper towels - i used to be a bounty person... this got recommended for using for my baby to dry his bum. they turned out to be so good, i started to use for everything, that was 4 years ago, and i still do.

A friend stayed at our house and commented that these were the softest paper towels ever. Good for general cleaning, wiping, etc. Not so good at absorbing messes. Still, strong and durable and don't feel like cheap paper towels.

review_title: viva are my favorite paper towels
review_body: I love Viva paper towels. Ordering them through Subscribe and Save is saving me time because the come monthly unless I move them to the following month.  Plus the price is as good as going to the Warehouse club except I don't have to take time out of my day to go get them.

review_title: INSTANT POT'S customer service lack of customer service
review_body: UPDATE: AMAZON IS AMAZING!  Their customer service is truly a dream!. I have been so excited to try the instant pot, and from the 1.5 things made in it before it broke twice it was fantastic.  The pressure sensor was faulty so by mistake I contacted Instant pot's customer  service.  After emailing and having a turn around time of 24 hours between responses, and multiple questions plus sending multiple pictures of how it was malfunctioning  (including pictures of stickers with serial numbers cut in half, to prove i cut it in half) they agreed to send out another base.... 7 to 10 business days shipping (note i recieved this through Amazon prime 2 day shipping)  after recieving the new base a week and a half later I set it up excited to try again.... BUT the lid was still giving me issues(having to hold the pressure valve with hot pad to release pressure) again I went back to customer service who again requested pictures of the issue, asking what I was cooking, and the amount of water and if i pushed it this way.  I reminded them of the pictures.  They expressed how apologetic they were (really I felt more as though I was questioned over their faulty product more than helped) and now again have to wait another 5 to 10 business days to get a replacement piece for the faulty lid.  They say they are concerned about it being faulty but have not asked once to have it sent back to them to review.. AGAIN I was so excited about this product and all the possibilities it had to offer but instant pot's customer service is extremely difficult to work with and here I am April 4th, and opened a problem with them middle of march and now will be waiting an additional 1.5 weeks to have a working appliance.. NOTE TO SELF: never go through instant pot's customer service and work only with amazon who would have made this a quick and easy switch.  Shame on me going through the actual company.. Once I am sent and used the actual non faulty product I am hoping to get the use and love everyone has for it.  Instant pot's customer service has truly left a pour taste in my mouth.  (The people I have talked to have been pleasant for the most part, other than the repetitive questioning of their own product, it is the process (or due diligence as was written to me via email) that is horrendous.)

This delivers. On everything. You want to cook it? This baby can handle it. I put in several packages of chicken thighs that were frozen into blocks. I added a few minutes to the preset poultry setting and it cooked all of them through so quickly! I love this and if it wasn't so expensive I'd buy another in a heart beat. I'm sure you could do gourmet meals with this, but I'm more of a dump it and forget it type of gal, and this thing makes dinner a breeze!! I can't emphasize enough how amazing this thing is. GET IT! It's not possible for you to regret it!. Update: This doesn't come to pressure anymore. I Googled it and I'm not doing any of the common mistakes. Everything is clean. I've done manual vs a preset time. Its not too much liquid or overly full. However now this only burns the bottom food and doesn't cook the rest at all. it will not pressure cook. At all. I'm going to try to contact the makers to get a return. Such a disappointment.

review_title: BEWARE: The most REVOLUTIONARY and ADDICTIVE kitchen appliance.
review_body: Is there any reason for me to even leave my reasons? You've probably read a million reviews already and have at least one friend who just won't stop talking about it. When I bought the IP it replaced my slow cooker, rice cooker, and stovetop pressure cooker.. DO: Buy the thing. DON'T: Leave it in the box for months because you are afraid of it.. DO: Find the Facebook IP group, download the IP recipe app, and if you want to really take it further find the freezer meal IP boot camps and get 30 meals prepared and frozen so all you have to do is pop them into the IP and in about 30-45 you have a hot, delicious dinner. I love having the freezer meals not only for my family, I still cook in between when I feel like it, but when others need a meal I have something ready to go.. You'll find you'll want more than one, and, really I'm not just justifying myself, when you have a meal cooking but need a side of vegetables or something like or rice or pasta you'll want to have another one. I am looking at the 3 qt now for sides. I have even thought of getting one a 3 qt. for my parents, who are elderly, so they can have freezer meals prepped ahead of time and all they have to do it pop it in the IP.

I was scared to ever try pressure cooking with the old-fashioned stove top type and was even pretty afraid of trying it the new electric style.  Turns out the new style is awesome!  Everything I've made in it so far was great and it was super easy to use and not at all risky or spooky.  It is pretty fast.  I do wish more recipes you see for it (especially like on the internet) did a better job of telling you the whole truth about how long they really take.  The pot takes a while to get up to full pressure (and some things need time to release the pressure slowly when the food is done), so you have to add that in to your cook time.  Too many recipes will say things like "3 minute steel cut oats".  But the truth is that you have to add in another 10 or 15 minutes for the pot to get up to pressure, then you have the 3 minutes of pressurized cooking, then you add in another 10 or 15 minutes for the pressure to release. Yeah, you hear about beans from dry to on the table in 20 minutes, but it's really beans start to finish in closer to 45 minutes to an hour. While it's still DRAMATICALLY faster and easier than the stovetop methods, it's not as lightning quick from fridge or pantry to table as many recipes make it sound.. I used it last night to make chicken broth from the carcass of a baked whole chicken.  Wow was it fast!  Instead of the really really slow process that it usually is to cook broth on the stove (like it's not crazy to have it cooking basically all day), it was done (and really really done really richly) in about 2 hours total, from dropping the chicken into the pot and plugging it in to putting finished broth in the fridge.  And it didn't require the wasted energy of having a stove burning all day or the having to keep a bit of an eye on a running stove all day.. I especially loved it for making potato soup, too.  It made soup from scratch fast enough to make it an easy convenient lunch meal.  No more canned soup for my house.  Fresh home made is quick and easy and delicious in the pressure cooker.

the beginning it was amazing, however i just bought it in February, and today is the April 1st, i did not even use this pot for more than 12 days... (imagine i do not cook with pressure cooker everyday... i only use it for 2-3 days/ per week), and it suddenly died....!!!!!!!  Now this should be covered by the warranty -- is there anyone who could help about this?!?!?

You think you don't need it unless you try it. My friend was raving about it, so I gave it a try and now am raving too! I love that it's compact and versatile - like a smartphone comparing to an average crock-pot or rice cooker.. It was the first time I tried buying "used" items from Amazon Warehouse (saved me $30) - I couldn't find any dents or defects other than on a box! Treated myself with buying a ceramic insert and now feel like I'm in heaven.. My favorite dish to make in it - just a simple chicken broth - come up the tastiest ever, thanks to pressure cooking! And I love that I don't have to look after it at all - I just turn it on, go to yoga and return to sip the best broth ever! It's also great to warm up food if you don't have a microwave oven.

review_title: So far everything we've tried has been excellent. We are partial to brown rice and this ...
review_body: We are giving the Instant Pot Duo 60 five stars as of this date. We ordered it in mid-December (shipped & received very quickly, as usual) while on vacation in California.  When we returned home we unpacked it and put it to the test. So far everything we've tried has been excellent. We are partial to brown rice and this pressure cooker has delivered a perfect batch twice, so far. 22 minutes at pressure, short cool down and voila! Perfectly done. Boneless chicken thighs in a savory sauce in 15 minutes plus about 10 minutes cool down. Fork tender. Yummy. Clean up is easy and the stainless steel pot remains in spotless new condition. That was an important factor in buying this highly praised cooker. We did not want a non-stick coating on the cook surface and it definitely does not need it, at least in our experience to date.. If you are considering an electric pressure cooker this one deserves a hard look. We love it.. One last note.. If you're accustomed to the steaming, hissing stove top cooker this thing may cause you to think it's not working. It is eerily quiet in operation. Keep the faith, you will be pleasantly surprised.

review_title: At first I was skeptical but it did not disappoint me at all
review_body: I purchased this Instant Pot Mini for trying out for different recipes such as vegetables and meat.  At first I was skeptical but it did not disappoint me at all.  It is true that you may have to cook longer like 30 min. if you want chicken or roast beef to be really tender or to make meat to be shredded.  But it does work well and it is very efficient for people who have not much time.  It turned out to be that you can make various cooked meal with left over vegetables with frozen chicken or beef that you can put them in the pot to cook together within short time period.  With less oil and less amount of sodium, you can make various dishes easily.  I wanted to choose 3Qt instead of 6 Qt to make it smaller, which is also the best choice.  The only thing that I did not like was when I made rice using the instant pot.  I still like making rice out of the Japanese rice cooker that I have.

review_title: Are the reviews out of whack? This is a very cheaply made product.
review_body: I bought this due to all the highly positive reviews. Got this last night, and attempted to cook rice using their instructions. What an unmitigated disaster. Over all impressions:. - The personification of "Made in China" cheap quality. The plastic had treads, the metal lining wore off the minute I tried to align the lid, the instructions are in poorly written English that leaves one confused as to whats what.. - The rice, even though I followed the instructions to the "T", ended up being burnt.. Going back today!

review_title: but I am SO glad friends and family talked me into trying this
review_body: I have always been intimidated by pressure cookers and complicated devices, but I am SO glad friends and family talked me into trying this!  It could not be easier to use!  I have had it for four days and I have already used it twice!  Once to make "rotisserie" chicken and once to make a bone broth from the remains.  Both items were VERY easy to make and clean up was a breeze!  I've used the saute and pressure functions and without spending a lot of extra time reading the manual.  Very happy with my Instant Pot!

review_title: Seems accurate and at a low price with "Step On"/instant weight reading technology
review_body: Easy to read due to the LED backlit screen.  Nice to have "step on " technology (I don't have to TARE it/wait for it to calibrate prior to using this scale).  Low price for an easy to use scale.

review_title: Great to have for a Goal in Mind
review_body: When a person is working out, it is good to have a goal set in mind. It is good to see how one progresses throughout time. This is a great item to have for one's personal use. This is a very accurate scale surprisingly and it is very helpful when wanting to know my personal weight as time progresses.

review_title: Inaccurate weight results completely unreliable - shows variance of 3-4 kgs for same person standing multiple times on it
review_body: Update 8/19: I got issued a full refund from the seller the customer service responded quickly good customer service.. Very inaccurate. There is a variation of over 3-4 kgs same day each time you stand on it shows different weight. I also figured out that placing it on different positions results in different weights. Not reliable at all, we needed a scale which tells weight in a consistent manner but this is highly inconsistent, and shows different weight same day for same person at same time if you just take reading 3 times it shows 3 different weights differing in weights around 3-4 kgs. Not recommended at all

review_title: The scale looks nice and sleek and is easy to start using
review_body: The scale looks nice and sleek and is easy to start using, but I'm knocking off 1 star because the scale does not respond quickly enough when I step on it when I want to tare it. It always takes two or three times of me stepping on the scale for the scale to register that it should turn on and tare.

You just hop on this scale; no tapping needed. I always felt dumb tapping my scale and waiting for the numbers to show up before I could step on. With this one, you just hop on. It automatically turns on and starts taking your measurement instantly. It's pretty accurate (+/- 1lb usually), as I weigh myself at the gym too with a mechanical slider scale.. It's a glass top, so it can get slippery. Just don't hop on directly out of the shower.. Extremely low profile; easy to hide under my sink, and can grab it with my foot whenever I want to use it.

I bought this scale as a replacement to another Etekcity scale. I was also sent a free replacement (which is why I'm willing to give 3 stars instead of less.). Testing all 3 back-to-back, one Etekcity scale says 190.2, another says 188.2, another says 186.6. Based upon this, it's pretty much impossible to tell what my actual weight is.

review_title: Good scale, especially if you can get it on sale
review_body: I think this is a great scale. The only reason I dropped it down a star was because (like other reviewers have mentioned), it has a tendency if your weight hasn't changed significantly to just revert to your last measured weight, probably to appear more consistent. It's really not a big deal, though, and I'd definitely recommend this scale to others who need a scale with a higher weight range. I should note, though: I haven't tested the numbers I've gotten against a medical scale (since I haven't been to the doctor lately), so I can't attest to its accuracy.

review_title: Can't beat it for the price
review_body: I've been using this scale for close to a year and have found it to be accurate, reliable, and relatively consistent.  As long as it is on a flat, hard surface (like a tile floor), the scale will nearly always give me the same reading if I step off and then back on within a few minutes.  It does tend to read about a half-pound heavier than a couple of other scales I have compared it to, but it is hard to say whether this one is high or the others are low.. It's a good looking scale with large, easy-to-read numbers, but there are no bells and whistles here.  If you want body composition, water weight, or even measurements down to a tenth of a pound, look elsewhere. Although the readout suggests that it will weigh in increments of .1 pound, it only reports in increments of .2 (100.2, 100.4, etc.).  For the price, it's great.  Just don't expect it to do all the things that a more expensive product provides.

review_title: I weighed myself three times in a row and got the same number each time - perfect! We've been using this scale for several month
review_body: Our old scale would display a different number every time you stood on it (within minutes) so I tested this scale numerous times. I weighed myself three times in a row and got the same number each time - perfect! We've been using this scale for several months now and are very happy with the quality. There is no need to turn it on or "zero" it, you simple just stand on it and it begins to check your weight,

review_title: Works well, is accurate, and the display stays ...
review_body: Works well, is accurate, and the display stays up for a moment, which is helpful on those mornings you haven't put your glasses on yet! Was worried about it being glass, but it seems to stand up to my husband and I so far.
Fits great with the pillow covers I bought. Good quality pillow

It seems nice but I haven't received the pillow cover yet to see how it fits.

Nice and firm.  Great filling.
Second time ordering.  Nice light set, but is difficult putting together.
THIS IS A SUPER WALL OF LIGHTS. I'll be purchasing another one for my other wall. Perfect.

review_body: I use it all the time.  In my classroom and at bridal faire shows for my photography.  Always an attention grabber

I love the lights and how beautiful they make my room look, but you have to position them in a certain way for them to come on. There is definitely some type of short going on in these lights I received which is why I took two stars away, but when they do turn on they look so good.

review_body: Product was exactly as expected, looked nice over my brick fireplace to create a babyshower back drop.
They look great. Fantastic deal. Wish they were easier to control from a distance, but I will be buying more :)
The product is quality and met the description exactly.  I put them in front of my curtains because they black out curtains and it added a soft light to the room that is very soothing.

review_title: This shower v curtain is the best we have owned

review_body: Have used this curtain as a liner for about a week now.  Freshly opened, there's zero chemical smell which is nice.  Liner lays well and isn't overly stiff.  Love it so far.

This shower curtain is perfect in every way. The length, the quality is exceptional. I see it’s probably going to be hard to keep in stock. You won’t be disappointed if you have this in your bathroom.
Great quality. I was looking for a thicker more durable shower curtain and am happy with this one
I purchased two of them, one to protect the material design on my material shower curtain one side and one on the backside of the shower curtain.  I love that there is no smell to the plastic.

review_body: so far this product is fantastic.  thick enough to hold onto the side of the tub and does not blow in while showering.  The magnets are a perfect strength.
Not sure what to say . It hangs like it should , and stops water like it should.
It is great. I can find nothing wrong at all with it. Even water runs off and no spots like some I have seen.
right length, and thickness, but basically this is your basic shower curtain liner.

These are thin and a rather poor quality, not what I expected. Maybe a little step up from what you'd get at a dollar store. If you''re used to getting these in yellow from the popular national warehouse store in packs of 36, trust me, you'll be disappointed too, as these are a much more inferior quality.
PERFECT! NICE TO CLEAN WITH THOSE CLOTHES!

Use these to wipe down the granite countertops in the kitchen once a day. The countertops have never looked as good. These apparently give a very light polish to the countertops. Also use on the glass cooktop, fridge and so on. Toss in the washer and medium dry. The colors have run (they are all tending towards dull) but are holding up well. Probably better if just came in white.
Microfiber works well lots of towels of microfiber great for cleaning dust or drying

review_title: these cloths are great. And they work just as they should as ...
review_body: For what you get with the little you spend, these cloths are great. And they work just as they should as well. I used them to clean my paintball lens (which can get pretty dirty and smudgy with all the paint that goes on it through the day). I used one cloth for the whole day and it worked perfect. I couldn't ask for more. My cat loves laying on the stack of them as well.
I didn't pay attention to the size. They're wash cloth size and too small for housework.
I used to purchase my towels at Walmart thinking that's where'd they'd be cheapest but these towels are way better quality for much less!! I'll never be buying them anywhere else

For the money, these MF cloths are an excellent all-purpose cloth to have around the house. I use it for my car when waxing/polishing and for my hardwood floors, in place of those costly Swiffer towels. After I'm done dusting around the house, I just run them under warm water to remove the dust and hang dry them, once they're dry I can re-use them on my floors again!
Nice Micro Fiber cloths at a great price.
Great towels just what I needed not cheaply made and worked great for th ed price.
Does not work very well. Did not get wrinkles out of my clothes
I can't believe I've lived almost 30 years without a steamer. This thing is a GAME CHANGER!
I have had the isteamer for a few weeks it is handy and I have had no issues with it.
