review_body: I downloaded the user manual.  Very helpful.  This steamer is very easy to use, very compact, lightweight.
Packs well for travel and heats up very quickly. Very happy with this product!
Bravo. Plug it in and start steaming. Thank you for the convience, quality, and results.. I can even pack it for my next trip. Just what I was looking for.

review_title: great for quick touch ups and getting the wrinkles out ...
review_body: Surprisingly quick and efficient steamer; great for quick touch ups and getting the wrinkles out of delicate fabrics.
The steamer is working great.  Had an issue and the customer service team took care of it right away.
I've been telling everyone I know to get this little rascal! It heats quickly and pulls out wrinkles within seconds. Highly recommend!
Does exactly what is advertised.  I steamed a large size tunic in about 3-4 minutes.  Better than an iron on knit fabrics.
Quick shipping and great quality

Very poor quality. Zero observability and it doesn't even tear on the perforated line.  I actually went to the store and bought paper towels there rather than use the ones that I ordered through Amazon

review_title: I KNOW paper towels and I burn through them.  These are a great deal BUT
review_body: You must be out of your fricken mind if you think that anyone is going to pay $80 for 24 rolls of paper towels.. Unless it's gold leaf, you really need to check your algorithim.. I mean, there's something really wrong with that.. I won't pay $3.33 for two rolls of BOUNTY, so guess what?. We still have cloth towels in this country!!!
Never again
I bought these paper towels because I thought they were comparable to bounty. They are not. I will not buy again...... I'm changing my review. Now I give these paper towels ****(4stars

I don't normally gush about paper towels, but I really am impressed by these. I'm comparing directly to Bounty brand bought at Costco, which are just fine. These Plenty Ultra Premium genuinely feel nicer, and work better. I was surprised the quality jump was so noticeable. The Plenty Ultra paper towels are thick but soft. You could use them as a facial tissue and not feel like they were harsh or scratchy, yet I also have used them to scrub out pans and they held up, scrubbed well, and didn't shred.. The rolls are not the oversized paper towel rolls we've gotten used to. They are standard sized rolls, so will fit in any paper towel holder you have. I haven't calculated the cost per quantity compared to those I got at Costco, but I certainly do like having this large packaged delivered to my door.

The Plenty Ultra Premium Paper Towels are above average paper towels.. I did the wet strength test with a 16 oz cup of water. The wet Plenty paper towel was able to lift and hold the vessel. I did some scrubbing with  a wet towel and it held up acceptably well. I was able to tear the wet paper towel with moderate force, so it won't replace a cloth towel,. The surface is soft. This is good for cleaning your face, but not so good if you need some abrasive force to clean a dirty counter top.. The case shipped by Amazon contains 24 rolls. For me, this will last months. I like having a big supply, but if you have limited storage space, this could be a problem. I suppose you can order the case and then give a six pack to your mother, your aunt, and your cousin.

The Plenty Ultra Premium paper towels are great!  I was leary of buying an off brand online without knowing how thick they are, because we all know those cheaper brands can be like tissue paper, and fall apart as soon as they get wet.  But I am completely happy with the Plenty brand, and I am going to order again on the auto ship option.

I am pleasantly surprised with these paper towels.  I am a Bounty select a size fan.  I love how thick Bounty paper towels and these are almost as good as the Bounty brand.  They are thick and they do clean up spills well.  I did not compare the pricing of these towels compared to the Bounty select a size but I am guessing that they will be considerably less since Bounty is one of the most expensive paper towel brands.  If these paper towels continue to perform as well as the first roll I have been using then I might be buying these from now on instead of the Bounty paper towels that I have been buying for years.

review_title: Nothing spectacular, but very nice overall
review_body: While nothing spectacular, they are certainly strong and absorbent.  They compare quiet favorably with the "house" brand in one of the major shopping clubs.  Depending on the price (they aren't currently available on Amazon for retain purchase, so I don't know what that would be), we'd certainly consider replacing what we've been using with these.  I just wish they came with the half-sheet option, rather than always having to use a full sheet or do a rough tear from the roll to get a small er piece.  Still, above average, and compares nicely with "store" brands as well as national brands.
I like Glad products.  It is strong and covers odors.
I thought I would like the Febreeze smell, but not so much. Won't be buying these again, though as tall kitchen bags they work.

Purchase for new mattress and was expecting more padding.  Perhaps I didn't read the description well...  The material is very nice and it is terry cloth which is a nice alternative to other materials.  This will provide a nice barrier between mattress and sheets.  I might purchase a padded mattress pad in the future to more protection and comfort.  Overall I think this is a good product and will protect our new memory foam type mattress without having a plastic mattress cover.

I like this product. I appreciate it slides far around the corners and tucks deep under the mattress,  helping it stay put, and not slide around.  It is very thin,  so I can feel my memory foam mattress when I lay down,  I don't feel a water resistant crunchy sheet. I can't comment on how it works withpills yet,  because it hasn't happened.  Also,  I'm sure this won't be true in every case,  but for some reason,  I ordered my sheet and it arrived the next day.  I don't know how they did that,  but thanks!  Will buy again for future mattresses.

review_title: I finally found a great mattress protector!
review_body: Very satisfied with this product. It does not crumple under my fitted bed sheet, in fact; it keeps the fitted sheet in place. Fits secure on my thick mattress. The terry cloth is comfortable (doesn't feel like plastic) and it does not make any noise when you turn or move on your bed. Water does not seep through from the top layer. Can't beat the price too. I surely recommend!

This mattress pad was tested within a week of having purchased it. My 2 year old granddaughter came to visit in the midst of potty training and slept through an accident (or two). The mattress is perfect and the pad washed and dried and went right back on the bed!!

I bought the Hypoallergenic mattress protector for my daughter dorm and even though it hasn't been used yet I can tell that this is an A quality product. .  I know this review doesn't say specifically how the product turned out but I can tell you that there wasn't any other like this in Amazon. I usually buy products by reviews but also by my gut and it has never let me down before.

Just what the college rental ordered. This was for my daughter's first adventure into college furnished apartment rental. At the advice of others we were encourage to protect her from he what nots left behind by others so with that a purchase of the bed cover .. The cover went on easily (2 people makes it faster ) and seem to be well made . With her memory foam mattress topper it made for a nice finished bed for her . She has spent a couple of nights on it and feedback so far has been favorable . Can't say much more other than good fit and ease of installation

review_title: No words to describe this protector
review_body: So far so good!  I really can't come up with the words for a glowing product review of a mattress protector.  Likewise I can't get myself to click the "I Love It!" 5-star button but don't let that leave you thinking the product is in any way deficient.  It fit our new Leesa mattress very well, doesn't make rustling noises in the night and supposedly protects us from accidental spills and cat revenge incidents.. I'm hoping not to test that last item but will post back here should we find ourselves using that feature.  The protector seems to be of good quality to us and is now hidden under sheets.  Not much more to sat.

I have had two different, expensive, memory foam mattresses. They are super comfy and awesome, but also highly, highly absorbent.. I also have a small child that shares the bed with me, and sometimes tries to bring in cups of milk or juice. This has saved my mattress from countless accidents, and has worked like a charm. It is not too hot, I don't really notice it at all. It fits well, and fits with a mattress topper, too.. My daughter is allergic to almost everything, but this has not bothered her incredibly sensitive skin once, even if she is directly on it when I'm making the bed.. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone concerned with spills or accidents, or who just wants to protect a nice mattress.

So far so good.  It's not as thick as the one I had bought from Denver Mattress; but appears to be very high quality regardless of the thickness.. I could tell when handling the material that it was very 'tough' so to speak.  I have not had any accidents happen yet, so time will tell.. Overall though, I'm happy with the price; and it fit my King Size bed perfectly.

review_title: The protector has a very thin layer of plastic which protect's from liquid spills and on top has a really nice and soft fabric
review_body: I bought this mainly to cover up some stains that i cant seem to get rid of from my mattress , plus to protect from further staining. The protector has a very thin layer of plastic which protect's from liquid spills and on top has a really nice and soft fabric. I have slept on this for a few day's now and can't even feel it, fit's really well on m,y queen mattress and is not too baggy or too tight. I have not yet washed / dry-cleaned it so no idea about how it holds after that.. But till now its a great product and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

I use A LOT of paper towels. These are by far my favorite brand.  They are like a cloth and work great for cleaning.  They are also nice and soft for washing little faces.
Ever since first using Viva paper towels, I haven’t been able to go back to any other brand.  These are so absorbent and tuff!  Finding them in bulk on Amazon was a definite plus!

These are my favorite paper towels.  They feel soft, yet they are strong and soak up a lot of liquid.  I'm in a wheelchair so buying bulky things like this in the grocery store can be difficult for me.  The subscription is so easy.
The thing I really like is the cloth-like texture and absorption. What I just dislike intensely however, these are all such thin rolls of towels.

review_body: Really nice quality and quantity for the price .. I gave it 4 stars is because some rolls leave this “dusty “ residue that my ocd find annoying

review_title: Viva is by far my favorite paper towel
review_body: Viva is by far my favorite paper towel , soft absorbent , works for me i don't like those that rip as your cleaning. Viva is strong and holds up

review_title: Pressure cooker 5 stars. Slow cooker ZERO stars!
review_body: Pressure cooker = 5 stars. Slow cooker = zero stars.. The pressure cooker is excellent. I can make creme brulee in 9 minutes (25 total if you count time ro pressurize and depressurize if using wet towel to speed process up).. If you are looking to buy this to replace your crock pot DON'T DO IT!!!!! On high it only goes to 186° F. I can make ghee in my cheap Hamilton Beach crock pot within 3-4 hrs. With this one it was still not done after 16 hrs! I finally gave up and went to bed. Stews are also not fully done in the same duration that a regular crock pot takes.. In summary, if you need this purely as a pressure cooker go for it. It's excellent! If you are getting it for the crock pot feature, forget it! Hang on to that old crock pot.

review_title: Convenient and easy to clean and use, but needed accessories are a bit expensive.
review_body: I bought this for my husband, as he does 95% of the cooking for the both of us and he likes kitchen gadgets.  He has an old-time huge steel stove-top pressure cooker that he uses on occasion, but for some reason it scares the crap out of me so I figured I would not be afraid to use the Instant Pot.  I bought the mini since it is just us.  My first try with it was a pot roast.  I bought a 2.5 lb roast, which left just enough room for the vegetables.  I followed the cooking timer table in the recipe book that came with the Instant Pot.  It said 15 minutes per lb for a roast, so I set the timer for 45 minutes just to give it a tad more time.  It actually took close to an hour and 15 minutes before it was ready, as I checked it and turned it back on, but still better than roasting it all day in the oven and heating up the house.  I then threw the vegetables in and in 10 minutes we had a great dinner!  I am looking forward to trying some different recipes and maybe coaxing my husband to use it.. Pros:. *Even though I bought the mini, it was larger than I thought it would be; just enough for dinner for 2 and leftovers the next day.. *Super easy to clean; just throw the stainless steel pan in the dishwasher and easily wipe down the rest with a damp cloth.. *Quiet!  Once you plug it in and turn it on, you can't even hear it.. Cons:. *Extra parts that are needed are super expensive, and some not available at all for the mini.  They could have thrown in a little steamer basket instead of a bunch of goofy plastic accessories that I won't even use.. *The cord is a little short, at only 36 inches.. *The steam release valve seems flimsy, but it does the job.  Just BE VERY CAREFUL when releasing the steam and don't put your hand or face anywhere near the top.  Just kind of stand back and flick it from the side.

review_title: Awesome product, great for people like me that can't cook...
review_body: I LOVE it!  My wife commutes so often dinner is up to me and she will only eat pizza so many times before I get "The Look".  So I decided to try this out. Wow, it's pretty easy and I am no cook. I like that I can brown right in the pot and just toss everything else on top and set it to cook. Lots of recipes on Pinterest and I'm told there is a whole following on Facebook.It does rice and it turned out pretty good.I've also done chicken breasts, boneless pork loin chops and salisbury steak meatballs. So far so good. I saw a couple of reviews of people saying the silicon ring in the lid started to smell like something they cooked. I didn't give the comment much credence but sure enough on the second dish I made I sues some strong spice and the next time I used the Instant Pot I could definitely smell it..and yes I clean it thoroughly every time I sue it. I don't getting any residual taste from it though so no worries, just thought it was interesting .

review_title: Must have gotten a bad one, still think the brand/product overall is very good
review_body: Must have a lemon here.  I had the more basic version of this pot and it performed well.  Gave to my sister in law and I wanted this one because of the increased options.  First issue was the lid did not lock and stay put.  Very different than my other Instant Pot which felt very secure when moved to the close position.  This pot you could move with one finger out of the close to open position.  This was scary because in pressure cooking that's a safety concern.. However, first use, I pressed on.  Loaded in my ingredients for soup/broth setting.  Hit the button and heard the 3 beeps.  Then it lost power after about two minutes.  I unplugged it, plugged in back in, nothing.  Waited a short while plugged it back in, got the power display.  I think this one is just a lemon and not representative of the overall product itself.. My experience with the earlier version has been great.  Returning this one...

Absolutely love my instant pot...both of them.  I bought the 8 quart pot first.  I loved it so much after using it once (on the Kahlua pork recipe in the included recipe book) that I bought the 6qt a week later so I can make a full meal  or a single pot meal with a dessert at one time quickly. Here are some pro's, cons, and tips I've discovered in the short, but fun time I've used my pots.  I'll start with the cons since there is only one.. Cons:. 1.  The stainless steel inner pot has has a few small "light spots".  No effect on cooking though.. Pros:. 1.  No spill-overs. The locking lid keeps juices and liquid inside the pot.. 2. Space saving.  Easily fits on my counter tops. 3. Time saving.  Meals cook in less than half the time than conventional methods.. 4. Safe Cooking.  The timer, included safety features (e.g. Auto shut off , lid lock etc.). 5.  Lots of cooking options: steam, pressure cooking, sautée/brown, rice, etc.  All work as phenomenally.  (I've used manual mostly, but I've tested several of the automatic functions.. 6.  Included product manual and recipe book guide users through the steps of using the pot.. 7.  Included rack and measuring cup are a great addition.  The rack makes lifting items out of the inner pot a breeze.. 8.  Option of using either high or low pressure allows for cooking an even wider variety of foods (some delicate foods work better with low pressure). Tips:. 1.  Recommend purchasing glass lid, additional sealing rings (at least one for savory and one for sweet dishes), steamer trays and 6 or 7 inch aluminum, casserole, springform or other oven safe pans for cooking in dishes that can be store in the cooking container.  These are also great for making desserts. The extra rings com in handy for keeping sweet flavors sweet and savory flavors savory in the pot.  The rings take on the smell of the foods you cook.  Washing and air drying after each use helps with this.  The glass lid is great for sautéing and slow cooking because it allows you to visually monitor the sautées or slow cooking.. 2.  For Cleaning I recommend rubbing the stainless steel inner pot with a half of lemon (with rind) after washing it in warm soapy water (though it is dishwasher safe).  Like many stainless steel pots, sometimes food leaves stains or film on the surface (e.g. Pasta film) even after washing.  Rubbing with a lemon half, rinsing and re-washing helps tremendously.  Helps with stainless steel steamer trays too.. 3.  If using the 8 quart on standard countertops with cabinets overhead, I've found that draping a towel across the cabinet door helps absorb steam from quick release.  I use a towel when using my 6 quart as well.. 4.  I recommend purchasing an instant pot specific cookbook.  The included book is good, but, it has mostly single item dishes.  I've noted that some books focus on "one-pot" meals which is a custom fit for the instant pot.. I definitely recommend the instant pot.  In fact I'm thinking of gifting a couple to friends.

review_title: which was easy but the entire ordeal was successful
review_body: The first time I used it was when company was visiting and it would not allow me to set the time for over 30 minutes, and the recipe required 1 hour!  I called company for assist and able to get representative quickly however, it did take them a while to figure out the entire machine needed to be reset.  They guided me step by step to reset it, which was easy but the entire ordeal was successful.  TIP: Try out all new electronic items before actually depending on them.. I also found that their instructions for "fall off the bone"  meat (roast, pork chops..)  on "Meat/Stew" setting cooks it for 45 minutes and the meat is done however, NOT close to "southern peoples, fall of the bone" expectations.  Therefore, I press the "Meat/Stew" button for the 45 min cooking as directed, then when alarm goes off I (do NOT open the lid) just push the "Meat/Stew" button again and let it cook  another 45 min.  I'm sure I could use the "manual" method to set it for 120 minutes however, apparently I'm too lazy to figure out how to use the manual option.

review_title: and the best mashed potatoes ever
review_body: This appliance changed my life! I want to give it more than 5 stars. It speeds up the time for cooking beans, rice, soups, and other dry grains, plus it seals in flavors and makes the final product have a more savory and complex flavor.. Mostly, I use it for soups and beans. I cook big pots of refried beans to eat as a nutritious and inexpensive staple throughout the week.. I have lost 20 lbs and saved hundreds of dollars on food in the 6 months since I purchased the Instant Pot.. My sister baked a cake in it. The cake was moist and delicious.. Additionally, I have made omelettes, steel cut oatmeal, rice pudding, and the best mashed potatoes ever.. The only con is that it comes with very limited recipes and you need a separate book or to join an online group for recipes.

I was so skeptical when I purchased this.... Specially because before buying the instant pot I did the horrible mistake of buying a Farberware  pressure cooker (from WalMart) which is HORRIBLE... programs are bad  instructions manual is useless... ended up selling  to buy the instant pot and no regrets on that!! super easy to use it, lots options, quick meals... White rice was done after 12 minutes!. I made a pork loin rost with potatoes and turned out amazing!!!!. It's really worth having this pressure cooker!!!!. I would definitely buy it again

review_title: Why did I wait SO long?  ((Update: I started making Natto with this pot! LOL))
review_body: UPDATE:  It's been almost 2 years since I bought this, still going very well.  I'm still discovering more things to make in this instant pot!  For all yogurt and/or natto (Japanese fermented beans) makers out there, get this pressure cooker if you're looking for one!. Few months ago, I was introduced to food called natto by my Japanese friend, and I fell in love.  I eat natto every morning with bowl of rice now.  Who would have thought! LOL.  Despite the stinky smell, it tastes great!  How should I describe it, hmmm... it's like stinky cheese, it smells so bad but tastes soooo good!  Is it also weird that I taste hint of coffee bean in the natto??  Well, it does for me, and I love it!. Anyways, I eat so much natto now, I started making it after researching and getting recipe on the internet.  You need pressure cooker and a warmer (like yogurt maker) to make natto, and this instant pot has both features.  I love it!!. So all you natto lovers out there, try making natto at home with organic, non-gmo soybeans, and get this instant pot.  Also, talk about all the health benefits of natto!  Go google it, you'll be surprised how good it does to your body.. I wanted this for so long!  But I was concerned if I would use it often enough to make my moneys worth.  So I waited like a year debating weather I should or shouldn't buy it.  I didn't want to buy it mostly because I had slow cooker at home sitting in cablinet only to come out once or twice a year during cold seasons, and thought this pressure cooker will do the same.  WRONG!!!! Wow.. I so regret waiting so long to buy this!  I use it at least once a week!  I'm having so much fun cooking with this pressure cooker.  If you are like me and wondering, DON'T.  Just buy it, and you'll know what to do with it almost every week if not everyday.

review_title: Good if you get one that isn't defective
review_body: I like it after getting a good one.  I bought two, one of them had some steam escaping from the vent when it was closed.  I emailed Instant Pot and asked if it was supposed to do that and rather saying yes or no, I got a detailed canned reply about all the tests they wanted me to do and send them a video!  No thanks.  Requested a return from Amazon which, as usual, was easy and accepted.  Only, 3 days later Amazon inexplicably enters another return for the 2nd Pot I bought.  Big hassle sorting that out and getting everything returned.. Anyway, if you get a good one, it works, I like it.  Minus a star for Instant Pot customer service email reply.

This is an updated review. After my initial purchase stopped working after a month. Etekcity replaced my scale at no cost. I am very pleased with the customer service and the new scale has been working fine.

This scale looks great, fits under the doors in my apartment (which makes for easy floor placement), and is both precise and accurate. There is a scale in the fitness center at my apartment that seems to vary much more widely than this scale does.. Battery replacement is simple, and changing from lb to kg is a simple task. The scale automatically turns on when stepped on, and turns off shortly after stepping off; it doesn't appear the battery is ever wasted. The lit LCD makes it easy to read in low light.

review_title: I weigh over 300lb too and it works fine for me
review_body: The weight registers 3-5 pounds above many other scales, but it's consistent. I've dropped things on it, dropped it, and used it every day for 2+ years and it's still going strong. I weigh over 300lb too and it works fine for me!

I like that it's electronic as they tend to be more accurate. It's compact and easily stored out of the way between weighings. It holds the final weight long enough for me to step off and lean over to read it clearly. Great deal for the price!

Looks nice and stylish, but the weight fluctuates so bad you can't trust the reading.  It will fluctuate by 2 pounds or so as you step on or off.  I have another brand of very reliable scales downstairs that I have to use because of the unreliability of these scales.  I'd return them if I hadn't already discarded the packaging material.

Awful and dangerous product! The scale shattered when my son stepped on it. And he only weighs 105 pounds.  The glass went everywhere and was sharp.  Prior to it shattering the scale was inaccurate.  Swinging as much a 5 pounds from weigh-ins just seconds apart.  5 pounds is a lot for someone dieting and trying to loose a few pounds a week.

After a week and a half I have had to return the scale to get a refund.  It has already malfunctioned and not usable.  Stepping on it to set to "O" was no longer working.  It would start at various weights.  Very disappointed.

Worst purchase ever. The instructions state to place scale on a hard, flat surface...every room in my house is a hard flat surface, yet in every room my weight is different by 5 to 10 lbs. In my bathroom if I move the scale one foot over from the place I had been choosing to weigh myself it says I'm 10 lbs heavier. Who knows what I really weigh. This is a horrible product, and very frustrating to someone trying really hard to lose weight, and believing they are until they move the scale to a different spot on the floor. I see the thousands of great reviews before mine, which is why I bought it in the first place, and wonder if I simply got a bad one out of a bunch of great ones. I don't know, but I hate it.

Not accurate at all. It says one thing the next then moments later it says a pound below that. This is all done on a hardwood floor. I weighed myself on a scale I know is accurate and this scale is off. Maybe mine is defective, I don’t know.

I bought this scale because it had a very good overall rating.  Amazon buyers got it right.  This is a very consistence and accurate scale.  My old scale could give me three different readings with three different tries and only went to .5 pounds.  This one is .2 pounds.  Very pleased.

I loved them at first, but I've only put them on three times and the middle 3 strands are completely out. I don't see anything wrong and haven't touched them since the last time I turned them on.

review_body: Working great so far been a couple months still crystal clear I love that easy to see through easy to clean and very sturdy definitely would purchase this again when time comes
Doesn't have smell and is very heavy gauge but is susceptible to soap scum

These are paper towels, so some of you might wonder what there even is to review. As anyone who bargain shops for whatever is on sale will tell you, though, not all paper towels are made alike. Some are fluffy and soft, some coarse and rough, some more absorbent than others, etc.. These fall on the softer side of things. They're fairly gentle on the hands, and even soft enough to wipe your face with (which is one of the product's selling points). Good absorbency, too. I cut tons of fresh fruits and veggies, so my cutting board is always covered in slop. These handled the mess just fine, with no tearing, leaking, or coming apart. They break down nicely in my compost as well.. If I had a criticism, it would be the cut of the individual towels. These are cut into your standard large paper towels, roughly 11 by 11 inches. However, I've really come to appreciate paper towels that are cut to half that width. In other words, two smaller towels rather than one larger towel. This allows you to save paper when you're only using them to clean up a very small mess or using them in place of napkins. With this brand, many times I used twice the towel I would have had they been perforated to a smaller size.. A minor gripe, perhaps, but those smaller sizes have become a big selling point to me. Do that and this gets five stars.. That minor personal issue aside, good brand that gets the job done with no fuss and no mess.

The name Plenty seams to fit because you do get quite a few rolls in the order and they're not expensive...however,.  I won't order again because they are So Thin. If you like a Confident feel to your paper towels, these aren't for you. That said, as THIN as they are, they surprisingly don't tear as easily as expected.

review_title: NOT SURE ABOUT COST VS QUANTITY , BUT GREAT QUALITY
review_body: I have to admit, I am thoroughly confused on pricing paper towels and toilet paper. There are different things to factor in like the amount of sheets, the size of the sheets, the rolls per pack, one or two sheets. Just when I think I have it all figured out, I realize I don’t. I am all about getting the best value for your money. Forever frugal, I always shop for the best deal in regards to price and quantity, yet the older I get; the more I factor in quality. You may be able to get more sheets for your money with a cheaper brand, but that often equals thinner, cheaper towels, which results in using more each time.. With that said, I won’t both disusing the price vs quantity issue. What I will speak of is the quality. PLENTY ULTRA PREMIUM PAPER TOWELS 52 FULL SHEETS PER ROLL, WHITE, 6 COUNT (PACK OF 4) is soft, sheet size wonderful, and a nice thickness. I was a bit shocked at the large box that showed up at my door. Though it states how many you will receive, I hadn’t realized how much that would actually be. It will be nice not to have to run to the store as often. The size of the roll is perfect – not too little or too large.. Product Information:. • Extra scrubbing power to help you battle through the toughest messes. • Now with Face-Friendly Softness to help keep faces nice and clean. • Stronger, softer and most absorbent all-purpose paper towel. • Extra scrubbing power to help you battle through the toughest of messes. • Now with Face-Friendly Softness to help keep their faces nice and clean. • Do more with less Our tree-saving technology uses less trees to make more great quality paper. • 247.9 Square Ft, 6 Rolls, 52 Full Sheets per roll, 11 inch x 10.4 inch. Product Description:. Plenty Premium Paper Towels are softer, stronger, and more absorbent than ever; Each roll has 52 2-ply sheets that arm you with extra scrubbing power to battle through tough messes, yet is gentle enough to clean messy faces and hands.

I actually like these paper towels quite well. They are just the right mix of durable and absorbent. Although they are not as soft as our normal brand, Viva, they are much thicker and more durable than Bounty.. Size: Is perfect, not to too big so that they fit in my kitchen dispenser, and not too little so I feel like I’m being ripped off.. Absorbent: They are on the thick side, so they pick up a lot.. Softness: Not very soft. I wouldn’t use these for your nose or sensitive skin, but they are softer than the leading brand.. Strength: While they are slightly softer than the leading brand, they are rough and strong enough to still add some scratching power when cleaning cabinets and such.. These towels are now my favorite for cleaning. They capture cleaners without becoming soggy or ripping. They are scratchy enough to handle light soil, and they are the right size and durability so I use less.

review_title: Now Arriving  Strongly  Scented~ Drawstring  Tears Off.
review_body: 8/7/17. Update with 3 stars removed  from  original review. After  never having  trouble with  ripping  with thsee kitchen  bags. We started having  the drawstring top tear off every  bad we tried to  lift  out of  two 13 gallon  cans we use. On for kitchen  trash and one for non-newsprint  ads that aren't recyclable.. When got to looking  at the bags to see why this continued to  happen.  I found  what looked to be a perforated line all around the bag. Both rolls had this line . What  the defect was from . I  don't  have  any idea but, I  cannot  see  a reason why  you  could  possibly  want  your drawstring to tear off and spill it's  contents.  We are fished with these bags now and couldn't  recomend these either.. Original  review. My grandmother has preferred to use Glad brand  trash bags for many  years.  These Glad kitchen  trash bags  were one of  the  first items  on our S&S list.. They are a pretty  good  quality  trash bag and, we haven't had any  problems  with  ripping.. 1 con that we have been noticing  is that these bags have gone from an unscented bag to one that had a light scent . Up until  this July's ( 7/17)  shipment  where it  now  has a very strong scent.  Grandma  doesn't  mind it much. So they are still okay with her.. Personally  as a migraine  headache  suffer  I  don't  care for many  scented products  because they often trigger a headache.  This was my experience with thsee stronger  scented bags unfortunately.. There is no mention of a  scent on the product  box . Leaving me to  wonder if  this is  from the  way Amazon  stores these bags in their warehouse;  or if it's  a manufacturing issue  during the production of the product ? Leaving  us with the  opinion  that  they are  a good product  for those who  don't  mind a strong  mystery  scent to them

I used to buy other competitors’ paper towel brands, and most brands worked for me well until I found and tried Brawny’s. It seems to me that Brawny lasts longer than others. The surface is slightly rougher, but that actually works better for tougher pickups and wiping rougher areas. The sheets feel thicker and that’s what makes this brand lasts longer. My main usage of this product is to clean the skillet with left over oil on and cleaning toilets and stuff in the bathroom. I noticed the absorbing power is also great when wiping off spills. For some lighter cleaning and pickup duty, I usually rinse off the used Brawny sheets under running water and reuse couple more times. I am impressed by how long it can last and hold the fibers to stay in shape over multiple usage. It’s also wasteful if I just toss the sheets away after one time use.. The current price with the coupon($4) is about $20 after S&S 15% off (16XL roll pack). That’s only $5 for 4 rolls and I think that’s a great deal for the quality paper towels. But I see the real saving in the product itself. Its long lasting quality is what’s saving me money over time because I could buy less frequently.. Overall, this is a great quality and value paper towel that lasts longer than any other brands I’ve tried. I would probably stick to this for a while until I find something way better in both quality and the price.

With filter rates this slow it's almost useless. Disappointing since this is supposed to be a long lasting, 6-month filter. It's going to be a long 6-months.

Having a toddler that climbs into bed with us and pets that sleep with us, I knew I wanted a mattress protector for our new mattress. I did not want something that was crinkly or noticeable. This is the perfect protector!  You can’t even tell it’s on the mattress!

Purchased this mattress protector due to a cat that's taken to urinating on the bed.  Has been washed at least 10-20 times now, and it's holding up great!  No stains on the mattress, comfortable to sleep on, and is deep enough to fit a queen-sized mattress with a giant pillowtop.  I may even be buying a second one to change them out when one is being washed!  Now hopefully I can re-train the cat to stop peeing on the bed...

This was so much better than expected.  The cover is soft and didn't smell of chemicals when I took it out of the packaging.  It easily fit over my pillow top mattress and the foam pad I have on top of that.  The quality is better than anticipated.  I'll definitely be buying one for every bed I have in the house.

review_title: Haven't "needed" it yet but it held up with tests. - UPDATED
review_body: We have a thick, padded mattress for our 4-year-old so we needed something thin and waterproof for occasional accidents. So far, he hasn't had any but I did test it by pouring water on it before and after washing it and it held up. I dried it in the dryer on air only even though the instructions state you can use low heat. I am happy with it and it fits his deep mattress well. I haven't had any problems with smell as other reviews have stated.. UPDATED 12/2014 - We have now had this for about a year and a half and it has held up very nicely. My son did end up having a few accidents including a few bloody noses and nothing went through. I wash it at least once a month on warm and dry it on low and it hasn't lost it waterproofness. Super happy with this. My only issue is the drying. When it comes out, it is still a bit damp (because the other stuff I put in with it dries quicker), but I hang it over the shower bar to finish air drying. Not a deal breaker for me.

review_title: The perfect, inexpensive, durable mattress protector.
review_body: Though I ordered new mattresses when we moved, I have this 'thing' about bed-bugs and just keeping a mattress protected.  To me, this is cheap insurance.  I've bought several of these, from king to twin and am 100%  satisfied.  I have 3 chinese crested rescues who sleep with me and though they're hairless, I like a protective barrier between their little paws and my mattress.  These seem to work as they should, they're inexpensive and wash/dry really well.  All in all, I've bought 5 of this same mattress protector, so yeah, I recommend.  It's a great product.

It is soft and supple and interferes in no way with our memory foam mattress. We can't even tell it's there. It's doing a pretty good job of staying in place (not shifting position or bunching up. It is a great product so far and it was a very reasonable price. I will leave it at 5 stars until it gives me a reason not to, but I'm confident I'll not ever have to re-visit this review.

It was actually my husband who insisted on buying an Instant Pot. I fought him on it for as long as I could, thinking that the last thing I needed was another appliance. This time, I have to admit that I was wrong. This machine has come to rescue quite a few times and I absolutely love it! The first time I cooked a beef roast in the Instant Pot, I was going out with some friends and wanted to make sure my husband and kids had food. Since I was rushing, I seasoned my roast with salt and pepper (nothing else), chopped a whole onion and put in a cup of beef broth. When I came back home, the first thing my son (who is a very picky eater) said was, "Dinner was really good!" This was a shock because everything he eats is "okay." My husband asked what I had done differently with the seasoning because the roast tasted like it had cooked for hours and it was amazing! When I told him how I prepared it, he said that it was impossible because it was more flavorful than any other that I've cooked. So, I no longer feel the need to season my beef roasts with a million different seasonings! If it's not broken, I'm not trying to fix it!. I know I just raved about a beef roast, but I have cooked chicken, pork, baked potatoes, and soups in my Instant Pot and everything turns out perfect so I have recommended these to all of my friends--even those who think they don't need another kitchen appliance.

I like to cook. This is by far the best kitchen device I have ever purchased. I have an 8 qt and a 6 qt on my center island counter. I've lost 30 lbs this year and I owe a lot of it to healthier eating using this device. I make batches of soups, stews, oatmeal, etc and freeze the extras. I make my own broths for soup fast and easy. It's a great rice cooker, slow cooker, but pressure is where it's at. My favorite recipes are making pot roast and french dip sandwiches with chuck roasts-- the meat is like butter. We buy Bob's Steel Cut Oats on Amazon and add apples, craisins, and bananas, for the best oatmeal ever. I didn't even like oatmeal before. Make real grits in minutes and hard boil a dozen eggs with fall off the egg shells. Hundreds if not thousand of recipes available online. Get one or even two!!

review_title: Join the Instant Pot craze. You won’t be disappointed.
review_body: Never knew an appliance could have such a cult following! I’ve had this for about 4 months. I use it at least 3x a week. It’s been such a great addition to my kitchen. I got rid of my slow cooker and rice cooker. I even bought an duo80 as a secondary for when I need a larger capacity or cooking two things at once.. But the 6 quart is what I use most often. We are a family of 4 (2 kids under 10) and so far I have felt the 6 quart has been perfect for us. It also comes to pressure a bit faster than the 8 quart.. I recommend joining some recipe groups on social media. So many ideas.. What I like most about this product:. 1) one pot cooking. Most recipes everything is cooked in one pot. From sautéing to browning, then pressure cooking. You don’t even have to pressure cook if you don’t want to.. 2) pretty much set it and forget it! Once you start it you can walk away and do stuff. And it’s a much shorter time than a slow cooker. So I don’t have to load it up in the morning before work.. 3) so many recipes are out there! So many! I’ve tried Indian Butter Chicken, spaghetti and meat sauce (with noodles), rice is so quick!, honey garlic chicken, chicken adobo, chicken pho ga, chicken soup, ribs, even cheesecake and banana bread.. 4) Cooking from frozen! When I’m in a pinch and not sure what to make I can always take out some frozen chicken to make something. In fact I keep a whole, pre-seasoned chicken in my freezer all the time (3-4 lb). I’ll pull that out. It takes about an hour and a half because I like to broil it after for 5–10 minutes.. Seems like a long time but it’s from frozen! Frozen!. 5) one pot cooking = One pot to cleaning

I recently purchased this item to replace a previous instapot that worked for two years but stopped pressurizing. I was excited when it went on sale on prime day so I immediately bought it. When the new one arrived, it had the same problem as the broken one and wouldn’t pressurize. I followed the recipes exactly as written. I called instapot to see if there was anything that could be done. After being on hold for over an hour I was given a ticket number because there was nothing they could do and told someone would contact me in 2 business days. After 7 business days and no contact I sent the item back to amazon after reading the reviews that instapot customer service was terrible. Instead of a refund I asked for a replacement. Big mistake. I had the same problem with the new one, No pressurizing. I never had this problem with my original one. I am finished with instapot and sending it back to Amazon. Only positive about this experience is Amazon’s amazing customer service.

review_title: When I hit the Pearly Gates I want this with me!
review_body: This thing deserves 100 stars. Over the years I have probably bought 10,000 dollars worth of merchandise from Amazon.  This Instant Pot stands high above everything else in terms of my customer satisfaction, there is no doubt it is the best thing I have ever purchased on Amazon.. I want this thing in my casket with me when I go, I'm that attached.

I have had this pot in my amazon cart for... a year.  My husband AND parents bought me one for Christmas this year! Basically I have made 2 things in the instant pot so far - French Onion Soup + Mashed Potatoes... The french onion soup was awesome! The potatoes took 2 tries... but the second time was awesome. There's a bit of a learning curve. It's nice to have friends/family members that the same pot. There's so many resources available online as well. I highly recommend this instant pot and cannot wait to make more recipes. :). Super easy... for the most part. One thing I've found to be true - I'll hear all my friends saying it took me 5 minutes to make potatoes... well yah, I set the instant pot on manual for 5 minutes but they did not take 5 minutes to cook. - It did take 5 minutes after the 10 minutes it took to build pressure. 20 minutes in total. Best advice would be, be patient and enjoy your new appliance.

review_title: Dinner ready in no time at all!
review_body: Not sure where I have been, or why i haven't heard of this pot long before now.  Great quality, stainless steel pot. At first I was a little intimidated because of horror stories of the old time pressure cookers that exploded, or caused bad burns.  This pot has over 10 safety features in place.. if you don't put the lid on right, it wont build steam.  if the pot has pressure in it, the lid can't be opened until all pressure is released.  I LOVE this pot!. early christmas gift and already cooked a rack of ribs in 30 minutes that fell off the bone, and tried a beef strogganoff  tonight that was delish!. was concerned noodles might not cook well, but they were perfect.I didnt need a pan to cook the meat, and a pan for the pasta, and a strainer for the noodles, NOPE!!!  all cooked in the same pot. pot has a saute button to brown  meats or saute veg.,  biggest con is having to figure out how much water for each type of  product your cooking and amount you are cooking and how much time.  just go online and type in instant pot recipes and you will get thousands to try. With time I'm sure it will become second nature.  haven't tried this yet, but you can cook a whole chicken that is frozen in about an hour!  thats amazing.  Can't even imagine how this could help working moms who come home and have dinner to cook. Saves time and money because instead of cooking the ribs in the oven several hours, it was done in 30 min., also will save extra money when I'm not heating up the house with the stove on, while the air conditioning is running.  It is also a crock pot, and has delay start function. Recommend checking out review questions as it answers a lot of normal questions, and check out some of the recipes on line to see how simple they can be.  Highly recommend

So, this handy gadget is most likely going to completely displace slow cookers in my kitchen. It really is (so far), as great as it's made out to be. My first dish in the Instant Pot was pasta sauce. The saute function worked beautifully for browning the meat, and the sauce was done in a grand total of two hours (browning, heating, cooking, depressurizing), vs the 6 to 8 hours it would have taken on the stove. The one downside to cooking the sauce in this vs on the stove top is that the sauce didn't reduce and thicken any, like it does on the stove, which is easily countered by making the base thicker to begin with. I'll be making cheesecake with it at some point (how could I not?), as well as yogurt. And pot roast, and bbq pulled pork, and soups and stews... There will be a bit of a learning curve with seasonings, you can't just sample and adjust in the middle of cooking with this unit.. The lid can be a little tricky to clean, there are a lot of little spots stuff can get into and you can't just drop it into a sink full of water. The insert you cook in is heavy stainless steel, with what appears to be an aluminum core bottom. I kind of wish there was some way to disable the chime that sounds when you open and close the lid, it scares my dog. The cookbook has some great looking recipes in it, but... Half of the cookbook is written in Kanji, and from the photos it looks like mostly different recipes than the English section.. I bought extra silicone seal rings with the unit, based on reviewer's recommendations. One ring will be for savory cooking, the other for sweets. I can see just a touch of discoloration of the seal ring from just the one use (no real surprise, tomato stains everything) but can't detect any absorbed smells yet.

I got bit by the bug. I had to see what all the fuss was about. I waited too long till it wasn't on sale, regretted it for weeks, then not only purchased it, but upgraded to the 8qt. It's quite large, but not overwhelming. I won't go into detail about why it's amazing - there are plenty of other reviews that will do that for you. Join the Facebook group. It's an incredible community with invaluable information. Check out HipPressureCooking.com if that doesn't convince you. Seriously though - a whole frozen $3 chicken to fall-off-the-bone deliciousness in under an hour? Juicy, tender BBQ ribs in 20 minutes? Kiss your crockpot goodbye, maybe your stove, and possibly even your oven. I can't even, y'all.

I love this thing.. Cooks perfect Jasmine rice in less than 15min. (3min high pressure + ~8min natural pressure release). Perfect steamed potatoes (10min high pressure + ~10min natural pressure release).. Get the OXO steel steamer with it.. There's a saute mode so you can start frying things before switching to closed cooking. Lots of possibilities.

review_title: After roughly a year of owning the product it no ...
review_body: After roughly a year of owning the product it no longer displays a weight on the scale, batteries changed, always stored well, never handled in a rough manner, used less than once a month. Now its just another piece of junk. Only reason I am giving this product 2 stars is because a representative contacted me as a result of listing 1 star previously.

This best-selling digital scale does NOT give you your weight.  At least, not the one I got.  It sort of guesses in the area of your correct weight.. I had it on a hard flat surface and during the space of 1/2 hr I got 8 or 10 readings varying from 211 to 223 lbs.

I bought this based on great reviews, but I feel like mine is faulty. When I tap it to zero it out it always reads some ridiculous weight like 298 or 147 or some random amount and simply will not zero! I tried it on several FLAT surfaces in my home and the result was the same. What the heck?!

review_title: Awesome scale, works like it should
review_body: Awesome scale, works like it should. The only issue I have is that the piece with the battery in it on the bottom popped out on its own and will not click and STAY back in. I just picked it up one day to sweep and mop in the bathroom and the piece was dangling out. Not sure if I should glue it back in, leave it, or buy a slightly nicer scale. Either way, not the WORST buy.

review_title: UPDATED REVIEW: Although it worked perfectly for the first ...

It actually shows that I gain or lose 4 pounds from one day to the next.. I was really looking forward to loving it, but I guess it's cheap for a reason.. SECOND UPDATE:. Contacted seller via twitter and they promptly sent me a replacement scale. Let's hope this time it works properly. Seller was extremely courteous and helpful.

I guess we will see how long it lasts. I really do not like it on the other hand because over 4 days I gained 4 lbs. Wonder if it was the pizza or the chocolate!

One time I will be 122lbs and the next I will be up to 142lbs. This product probably was whored review by an individual. I cannot believe this is a best seller..

review_title: Best paper towels I have used overall and worth the price premium for our household.
review_body: I will try not to waste your time here. These are the best paper towels I have ever used without question.. Sure you are thinking that all paper towels are the same. Nope...couldn't be further from the truth. We use paper towels a lot in our house. They are busy wiping our fingers during cooking, our napkins while eating, used to scrub a spill or to clean a mirror.. My favorite paper towel before I used these was Viva. They are expensive, smell and leave lint on surfaces. But they are also super soft and durable--just like cloths. Most often the smell issue bothered me the most. Go to wipe your mouth and it hits you--this is not a pleasant scent.. So thes Brawny paper towels manage to be soft but firm (useful for scrubbing). Have no smell, come off the roll normally (so you don't get stuck with more "sheets" than you wanted) and manage to soak up spills well. They even do a decent job leaving less lint on mirrors.. Between using rolls of these I have been switching to other brands to make sure I am sure of what I am reporting. I am serious that these are the best I have used--ever.

review_title: Stong and absorbent. The smaller sheet size results in less wasted towels.
review_body: This is a review of Brawny Pick-a-Size Paper Towels, 16XL Rolls.. I'm a big fan of pick-a-size paper towels. Many times when I need a paper towel, I really only need a piece of paper towel instead of an entire large sheet. With these towels, the perforations are closer together because each perforated sheet is shorter when compared to  "normal" full sheet sized paper towels. So I don't waste paper towels because I can rip off a smaller section at a time.. These are quite absorbent and definitely stronger than the el-cheapo bargain basement brands...Sparkle, I'm looking at you.. They cost more but these are strong, absorbent paper towels and the smaller sheet size let me grab a more appropriate size.

review_title: There’s a Reason Brawny is a Paper Towel Icon …
review_body: Paper towels, toilet paper and tissues are pretty much the same when it comes to quality.  You can go cheap, but there are consequences.  Brawny is a higher-end paper towel, but I feel its quality is worth the extra cost if you can avoid unnecessary waste.  The BRAWNY PICK-A-SIZE PAPER TOWEL offers a better paper towel and reduces unnecessary waste.. The quality of the Brawny towels are noticeable to the touch.  Bargain brands have a flimsy feel and a noticeably dimpled texture.  These single-ply Brawny towels are noticeably thicker with a smoother, softer texture.  They absorb more and are far more durable when wet.  I often use paper towels as a follow-up to Clorox wipes in the kitchen and bathrooms (the wipes don’t collect dust very well and leave wet streaks of chemicals).  Less expensive paper towels get soaked quicker and tear apart … I use half the number of Brawny towel segments to complete this task.  They Brawny towels also fare much better in eliminating streaks when cleaning windows and mirrors.. This particular size (140 sheets) is double the size of the standard Brawny roll.  The pick-a-size option is pretty standard these days, but it matters more when you’re paying more for quality … less waste.  As a person with dealing with allergies all my life, paper towels have been my go-to tissues for decades.  The ability to use half-sheets of absorbent towels that won’t tear apart or tear-up my nose day-after-day really matters to me.  I find it hard to argue the cost/benefit of these premium paper towels.

I just got a new puppy and this Brawny arrived just in time! It is super absorbent and very strong. I love that it tears off at a half sheet for small clean ups. I find I am using far less then before with my other brands. I can even scrub puppy poop off my tile and grout with antibacterial cleaner and they hold up without disintegrating. This is one tough paper towel and the only one I will buy from now on. I highly recommend this paper towel.

review_title: Alright, but not very soft compared to Viva
review_body: I've been using Viva paper towels so trying these Brawny towels were new for me.  I have to say they are lower in quality than Viva such that they aren't nearly as soft, nor do they absorb as much.  I suppose these Brawny's are okay if you do a significant amount of kitchen work such that cheaper towels would be acceptable, or if using these as shop/cleanup towels in the garage.  But for a lightweight user, I think I'll stick with Viva.

I rarely buy name brand paper towels.  First it seems like a waste when your teenagers go through them like it's no tomorrow.  Second, even when I use them, I tend to pull two or three sections.. My hubby first used these after cleaning my car.  He used one to clean my dashboard and the same one to clean out the dried Diet Dr. Pepper gunk in my cup holder.  He finally switched to another one when finishing up my tires.  Amazing. And he only switched because it was so dirty from the cup holder.  It held together.  Wow,. I started tearing the sheets in half when cleaning up in the kitchen.  Saves garbage and time.

We usually buy Kirkland paper towels from Costco. So I'm used to a thick towel at a good price. These are just as comparable in thickness and quality. I also like the ability to pull off a half sheet or a full sheet. The pricing is a little higher than Costco but you have to be a member to benefit from that pricing. Overall, a good quality towel.

review_title: Towels OK, but will not tear off where they should.
review_body: I confess, I bought these towels from a different source but wanted to let folks know.. I bought the Pick-a-size towels but AT LEAST 50% of the time they would NOT tear. where they should.  The towels themselves are fine, but if they won't tear off defeats. the purpose of Pick-a-size.

This is a premium paper towel that does its job well. The roll size is XL which is equivalent to about two regular-size rolls; 64.15 sq. ft. vs 2 x 38.10 sq. ft. Yet they are compressed enough to fit in our mounted holder.. It comes in a box holding eight two packs (16 rolls).. The convenience of having these delivered is worth it. Nothing takes up space in a shopping cart like paper towels so I was especially impressed with this method of maintaining a good supply.

review_title: These work fine with older Brita pitchers
review_body: I purchased this with fingers crossed that these replacement filters would actually fit my older pitcher. They do. They also don't seem to have the previous filter design's issue with bits of charcoal collecting at the bottom of the pitcher. Good job on Brita's part with backwards compatibility.
These work much better than the knock offs. I really can tell the difference. I'll never buy the cheap ones again.

We've used Brita filters for years and have always had plenty of the carbon crystals floating around in the water filling area (pre-filtering).  This is a new design in the filter and fit perfectly in our old unit.  Best part is there are very few loose carbon crystals.  They have redesigned the filter and they did it well.
Great value. Arrived promptly and work as advertised.
Love the fact that you don't have to go through the traditional "Brita ritual" of soaking, pre-filtering twice, etc. etc.

Worthless. Definitely do not purchase. Each filter lasted about three weeks before the water would no longer drain through rendering them useless. Apparently, there is a time consuming and involved process to very temporarily fix the filter, but soaking, massaging, rinsing and repeating is not on anyone’s list of things to do every week. Keep away.

review_title: Good new design for these filters
review_body: Nothing new except for the same excellent quality Brita water filters.  This new style definitely allows the water to filter down into the carafe (or whatever you are using) faster than the old syle.

review_title: Great filters for the Brita line of products!
review_body: Great value on this 3 pack of Brita filters. I compared to the local grocery store, who wanted 3 times the amount. Definitely worth it to stock up and buy through Amazon.com. This was my first time trying the new filters, and I was very pleased. I did not have to soak it in water for 15 min, which I had to do with prior model. I also noticed less of the black minerals floating in the water, compared to the older version. Maybe a way to enhance this product is to have the date built in on the filter, so that I will know when to replace it, since I lost the sticker on my actual Brita pitcher.

The filter works and filters the water to the same quality as the regular filters.  Main issue is it takes around 3 hours to filter the same volume of water it takes the regular filter 5 minutes too. Will be switching back.
