I bought a 14" deep mattress and it fit perfectly.  I've only had it a couple of weeks so I can't give a detailed review of it's durability.  I will update later after a couple of months.  Right now I am very happy with my purchase.

review_title: The Holy Grail for Eczema Sufferers at Night!
review_body: I've suffered from eczema my entire life. The first time I used one of these encasements was literally the first time I went to sleep without scratching my legs off to their bitter end. I had no idea the eczema on my legs was caused by a severe dust mite allergy. I now use their mattress encasement at home and take one of their mattress protectors to hotels. At home, I would also recommend using either bamboo or eucalyptus sheets. If you have really bad allergies and use cotton sheets, you need to wash them every couple of days.

I bought these to protect our new memory foam mattresses we just got for a new bunk bed setup.  Boy was I happy I invested the extra money for these!  Two days after having the girls sleep in their new beds my oldest yacked all over.  I wasn't sure how long she been sitting in it did before the other one came up and got us.  Stripped everything off and sure enough the mattress was totally dry!!!  Very happy, highly recommended.  After washing we just let it air dry.  Good to go for round two...

This is my second one of these. The first one I purchase from Raymars and Flannigans many years ago cost me over 100 dollars. Okay I din't know better then. So six years later and after much washing I needed a new one. I scouted amazon and found them yeah! same quality provides the same protection, only way cheaper Worth every penny

review_title: If you're like me and have an a-hole cat that turns to ...
review_body: Well, a mere 5 days after getting this, the cat decided to spew diarrhea all over my mattress. It soaked through the sheets and to the mattress protector, which kept it off the mattress. So it did exactly what I wanted it to.. There are some things to note about this:. It doesn't seal the entire mattress, it's basically a fitted sheet where the portion over the top of the mattress has a plastic-like barrier under a second fabric layer. Because of this, there's no protection on the sides of the mattress. If you're getting this to protect a mattress from a child's urine, it may not work if the kid floors near the edge, since it could run down the side of the bed and soak through the side.. If you're like me and have an a-hole cat that turns to your mattress every time it's feeling a little upset, then this mattress protector works great.. It is not 100% silent, but it is very quiet. It's not like those zipped thick plastic abominations from childhood, it's a very thin plastic barrier and makes minimal noise -- it's quiet enough that someone probably wouldn't even realize it's not the sheets. Since it's waterproof, that does mean it is going to block airflow up and down, so you'll get hot and sweaty if your room is already warm. But that hasn't been a problem for me.

This bedcover is very easy to put on and take off.  It is completely washable and dryable unless someone at home does not know how.  Just make sure all the water is drained from the material first and then put in the dryer.  It does not melt (Gee I hope someone I know really well reads this!), Please don't lay it on the couch to dry!  No, not the door either.  It does not melt!!!

The fabric is like a towel texture which I don't particularly like,looks kinda cheap but it does a pretty good job. I'm only giving 4 stars because it's not exactly sweat proof.  Our memory foam bed sweats my boyfriend A Lot,and unfortunately the musky smell seeped right thru to our memory foam bed.... Works well in the other areas advertised but if you sweat a lot the odor goes through quickly.

I have been looking and looking for some extra long twin mattress covers in the small town (comparatively speaking) I live in. Those that were available from the business we bought the mattresses from were way out of line on their cost and not exactly what I wanted. Amazon picked up on my search for sheets (which are not available at all here) and sent me information on your product. They are perfect. They fit perfect and were just what I was looking for. I like the terry cloth and liquid protection features. Thank you for being with Amazon where I do 99% of my shopping.

I bought this out of necessity and did lots of research into different company and products on amazon and finally decided on this one! I haven’t been disappointed! It’s super easy to wash ( I do cold or warm water) doesn’t make noise like other mattress protectors and the quality is pretty nice. I’d definitely repurchase and recommend to a friend!
My new favorite paper towels.  Will only buy these from here on out. Cloth-like but dissolves easily so not bad for the environment.
I hate theses paper towels!!! They stick together and don't rip properly.  The texture feels like cloth but they don't react that way.
Viva is a nice soft paper towel.  It feels good in your hand, and it can even serve as a paper napkin on occasion.
Like the paper towels.  I use them to replace the expensive napkins I was buying.  They are just the right size and soft and absorbent.

review_title: By far superior to any other paper towel
review_body: Thick and cloth-like.  By far superior to any other paper towel.  I've been using these for years and other paper towels just don't compare.

review_title: Couldn’t pass up this deal I love Viva paper towels and was spending way to much ...
review_body: Couldn’t pass up this deal I love Viva paper towels and was spending way to much at Walmart for them so will be buying again when I run out in a couple months

review_title: I had always used another product but ordered these and ...
review_body: I had always used another product but ordered these and they will be my paper towel of choice. Try them, you'll make them your towel of choice.
These are the best towels I've ever used & they'll always be the only towels I'll ever use. They're so durable and thick.

review_title: These are just the best paper towels out there
review_body: These are just the best paper towels out there. I HATE pockets in my paper towels. These are soft, super absorbent, and firm. and honestly, I feel like I'm rich when I use them.
Package came as expected. I get this delivered every two to three months and can’t complain.

I nabbed one of these bad boys on sale and it arrived quickly, efficiently packaged, and in working order. I made three dishes in it, details below. TLDR at bottom.. The same day that it arrived, I went grocery shopping and saw a 13# turkey on sale for $0.50/lb. I had to grab one and decided to test my new Instant Pot. I have never cooked my own turkey before but figured for $7, I was willing to try. Since the turkey was too big for the 8qt Instant Pot (according to the manual you want food to fit below a certain line), I cut off the poor bird's legs and stuffed it in the pot along with some water mixed with spices and powdered stock. The Instant Pot took maybe 40 minutes to pressurize and then cooked for my manual request of 60 minutes on high pressure. I checked the internal temp on the bird before removing and it was good to go. Folks, the meat was already falling off the bones, it was so tender. I decided to take the whole pot and dump it into a strainer resting over a larger bowl (to catch all the juices) and transferred the turkey to a pan to rest.. Next, I took some fingerling potatoes cut in halves along with about a cup of the saved juices and roughly followed the small roast potatoes recipe from the recipe book that was included. This also used to pressure cooker function, which I noticed took less time to pressurize this time (probably because it wasn't so stuffed). These potatoes came out perfectly cooked (and delicious) in about 30 minutes from start to finish, including prep.. Last, I decide to use the Saute function to make some gravy. The pot heats pretty quickly for this function, even if you haven't already been cooking. I used the remaining juices from the turkey, added flour,and whisked on high until incorporated, then turned back down to low to simmer. Bam - delicious gravy.. TLDR: I made a delicious Thanksgiving dinner in under 3 hours from start to finish on my first ever attempt AND with an unfamiliar appliance. I'm sold and can't wait to use it again.

review_title: Obviously it works well and we like it.
review_body: Obviously it works well and we like it... however, the toxic smell from the kinds of plastics used does not inspire trust. We want to be healthy not exposed to toxic materials.. I hope the Canadian creator will read this (seems like a nice guy), and work to be more environmentally and health conscious with his manufacturing and choice of materials... BPA/Resin and flame retardant triphenyl phosphate in the insulation on their wiring; it is an endocrine disruptor that off-gases when the device heats up.

I got this on Black Friday. I was VERY intimidated by it at first, and managed to screw up the first chunk of meat I tried to cook. But, I tried to cook a HUGE hunk of pork, from frozen, so it was completely my fault. Hard boiled eggs are ridiculously easy, and soups are quick to make. If you're cooking large pieces of meat (pulled pork, etc), do yourself a favor and thaw it, and then cut it into chunks first. It helps a LOT!. I haven't used this as a slow cooker yet, so can't speak to how it works for that...but LOVE the pressure cooker part!

This is what I ordered but got an older version- the 6 in 1.. That said, after trying one out for myself,  I bought one for each of my daughters and daughter's in laws.. Highly impressed with the ease of use and how quickly it heats up and begins coming on its own.. A flavorful low temp cooked and steamed beef stew in under 3 hours.. The stainless removable insert wiped clean with a paper towel,  even after flooring and braising the meat first.  Amazing!  The bottom of the cooking pot insert is made of a very thick stainless steel,  so gives a uniform and consistent  heating across the bottom.. I made cheesy ham and potato soup in 10 minutes -  minus the chopping time of the potatoes and ham of course. Tasted like it had simmered all day. Rich flavor were infused throughout.. So much easier and more versatile than a stove top pressure cooker that stays cool to the touch on the outside. At is a 3 temp adjustable slow cooker -  with or without steam; a pressure cooker, searing pot, rice cooker; vegetable and crab steamer;  yogurt maker; milk pasteurizer; and I read that the 7 in 1 could also be used as a canner since it's psi is higher than the 6 in 1. . Which is why I had ordered that one in particular.. In my 1st week,  I cooked pork ribs (from frozen state)  to the point of falling off the bone in less than 25 minutes on steam. I added sauce right at the end and let it finish with the steam vent opened.  Yummy!. Last night I cooked rice in 10 minutes start to finish, set it aside in a lidded casserole while I quickly seared 4 chicken breasts,  then put lid on and steamed them on medium. In 10 minutes they were fork tender.  I then put the chicken on top of the rice in the casserole dish,  covered the chicken  with homemade cherry bbq sauce and broiled it for 5 minutes . Paired with a toss salad, it was the perfect,  delicious,  healthy dinner!. The daughters and in-laws love theirs as well, making chicken stock in 10 minutes,  bbq pulled pork for sandwiches, split pea and ham soup from scratch in record time. . No more soaking dried beans overnight. .. This has become a permanent piece on the kitchen counter!

review_title: Like it a lot, but keep the manual handy
review_body: I really like this device.  It makes quite a few things just perfectly.  It has very high quality construction.  The cord has the same connectors as a standard computer cord, but is really heavy duty.  It has numerous safety features, like redundant pressure and temperature sensors, and a elegantly simple pressure activated interlock to prevent removing the lid when there there is pressure inside.  But the controls are difficult to use.  That kept it from getting 5 stars.. As to the controls, there is this very confusing "adjust" button.  It does different things for each of the about 7 basic selections.  For soups, saute, and slow cook it controls the temperature.  For porridge you use it to tell the pot that it is multi-grain porridge, rather than rice.  For poultry it changes the cooking time.  (Redundant with the +and - buttons.)  For rice it has no effect.  For multigrain, you can choose between 3 choices:40 minutes, 20 minutes and 45 minutes of warm soaking followed by 60 minutes of pressure.  For steam and manual, the instruction manual makes no mention of this button. For yogurt you can choose an option to first bring the milk to a boil.  But for all of this, you only see "less", "normal", or "more" on the panel.  You have to have the manual at hand to know what "less", "normal", and "more" mean in the selected mode.. There is a delay function that allows you to delay the start for some amount of time.  (The button is labeled "timer".) When you naively use it, it seems that you can only set the delay to a multiple of an hour.  But, if you read the manual, you will discover that after you have set the hours, you can push "timer" again, and then the + and - buttons will control the minutes.. After most of the functions have run to completion, the unit is in a keep-warm state that does what you would expect.  But an extra piece of paper that comes in the box says that you can turn the keep-warm feature off by double-pressing the selection button ("saute", etc.)  when you first start.. And, finally, this additional piece of paper tells you that you can silence the beeps by pressing and holding the "-" button for 3 seconds.. So you had better keep the manual and the addendum handy in your kitchen.  You are going to need it.

review_title: Not so much Instant as Eventually....but worth it
review_body: In truth, it's really an "Eventually Pot". I made a pea/mushroom risotto with a strip of cut-up bacon for my maiden voyage.. Here's how the instant pot works: you saute the things which need to be sauted (mushrooms, onions,) in it in its saute mode. Then you turn it on. And then--for first timers--- you scour the internet and the books to see why it's not working. After about 15 minutes it starts to hiss and finally you see that the 6 minute cooking time is on.. After 6 minutes you have a choice: you can let it sit until the steam has died away and then open and eat (Natural Pressure Release) .  OR you can release the steam and it will hiss and jet up to the ceiling (this is where you are thankful you did not put it under your wooden counters). Then when it's finished its long hissy fit, it gives you the go ahead to open the pot and serve.. So---next time I will relax and not bite my nails while I'm waiting for it to do its thing.. Next time I will start earlier and let the steam dissipate all by itself--Natural release.. The Eventually Pot is a good idea for combining soups and cassaroles and things like that. Once you are used to its ways and realize that the 6. minute cooking time includes about 30-45 minutes of girding its loins and ungirding its loins, I see that it can do a good job.  If I had not been a Nervous Nellie I would have sat down with a book and relaxed.  That's what I'll do next time, which will probably be tomorrow.. The risotto? Very good; not mushy. Cooked perfectly. Perfect consistency.  The actual amount of time I took stirring the risotto was a tiny fraction of the time I have took making the risotto in the traditional way.

review_title: Works very well, and very quiet when pressurized
review_body: Works fantastically.. I have so far tried the pressure cooker and the slow cooker options with very good results.. I am a long term pressure cooker user and own 3 other standard pot style pressure cookers, this is my first electric. I must say it is so very quiet when it's pressurized. You can barely hear it unlike the old fashioned models.. My one and only complaint is the rubber seal is susceptible to absorbing smells. After the first use, after it was washed, we started to notice a strange smell in the kitchen and it took a few days before we figured out where the smell was coming from. I found the obnoxious aroma coming from the lid. I figured it was perhaps splatter in the vent area that perhaps didn't get cleaned well enough. After washing the lid again, I realized the smell was actually coming from the rubber seal.  I washed the seal in warm soapy water several times, even soaked it for a bit...it's better but still not great. I now store the seal in a gallon zip lock bag when not in use. It doesn't seem to be a problem during cooking, as I cannot smell that funk during that time. I even tried pressure cooking some water w/ lemon and herbs to try to get a better smell permeated into the rubber, but no luck. Hopefully it will go away in time.

I bought this for the purpose of making yogurt.  I've been making yogurt for more than 30 years without a dedicated yogurt maker, but I thought, from the reviews, that this would be easier, since lately I've been having a bit of trouble keeping the incubation temperature consistent.  I also thought it might permit me to get rid of my large rice cooker, which I seldom use, and my old style non-electric pressure cooker, which I also rarely use.. I followed the yogurt instructions exactly.  As instructed, I pressed the yogurt setting, after placing the milk in the interior pan and closing the unit.  The yogurt did heat to the 180 F temperature.  After many many hours, it cooled to the 115 F temperature, and I added the culture, as per instructions.  After the appropriate number of hours, I opened it.  The milk was brown, and cooked onto the bottom of the pot.  I took its temperature, and it had heated to 143 degrees F, even though it had been at 115 when I added the culture.  Obviously, the overheating killed the culture.. If you want to make yogurt, I do not recommend this product. I cannot speak to its other uses, as I am returning it today.

review_title: Oh wait, did I mention how quiet this is?
review_body: OMGosh! Was curious about this product for a while, but didn't get one because we already had a stovetop pressure cooker. And a rice cooker. And a slow-cooker. Our daughter bought one and after she'd been using it I asked her. With 2 small children underfoot, she said it made a difference in a home cooked meal vs go-to-the-freezer-get-the-box. Since I bought one, have used it every week. Sometimes even twice a day! Can make "boiled" eggs very, very easily (use the rack, about 1-1/2 cups water & the rice setting - either pressure release). Had to make 2 batches of roasted butternut soup in under 2 hrs - nailed it! The ease and quietness of this is wonderful, too. One thing to remember, if new to pressure cooking, is to allow time for pressure building up and whatever pressure release time you're using (which is still shorter than making anything with a comparable result). The little recipe book that comes with it is good for getting you started, and has some decent recipes. Would also advise getting one of the well-reviewed cookbooks designed for an electric pressure cooker. I went ahead and bought the glass lid (for slow-cooking) because none of my other pot lids would fit. Of course :-) Is it necessary? Actually, not really, but is nice when it's serving time for a buffet. Is this multi-functional in a practical way? So far, I'd say yes. There are extra stainless steel (another plus)  inserts available, so changing from one method/dish to another can be done quickly and easily. Even without one (as in the case of the 2 batches of butternut soup), it's easy enough to empty, wash and get cooking again. Yes, the saute feature is great, too. If you want to know about the other features I haven't used yet, keep reading reviews because certainly, someone else has used them!

How did I not know about this gadget for so long? I read some random recipe online that mentioned "Instant Pot", and I didn't know what that was so I Googled it. What I saw amazed me. My pupils dilated. The hairs on my arms tingled and raised up. I had to have it. So what if I have 6 crock pots, a Foreman grill, 2 rice cookers, and one of those TFal Opti-Grill thingies. This was different! This was new! Once on hand, I had to search for something to cook. IMMEDIATELY! What! Can! I! Make?! Dude, I don't even know what the first thing I made was. All I remember is I cleaned the thing up and immediately made brown rice. Brown rice. The only kind of rice I fail at time after time. And you know what? It was perfect. The next thing I wondered was .. gee .. can I cook frozen stuff in this thing. You know what? YES! I plopped a bunch of frozen chicken in the thing with some onions, garlic, and chicken broth .. and you know what? I was awesome. So far I've used it as a pressure cooker (fresh and frozen), a rice cooker, and a slow cooker. If the food didn't come out exactly right, it's because I'm just making it up as I go along because I'm too excited to keep trying stuff.

If all you need is a no frills basic scale to tell you your weight in pounds or kilograms this is the scale you want. No Bluetooth, BMI, bone density calculations. Just "OMG, I gained 5 pounds better get to the gym more often!" simple. Checked the calibration right out of the box against a known weight and it was on the money. Easy to read lighted digital readout. I don't think you're going to find a better scale at this price.

review_title: BAD PRODUCT- Waste of $ - Gives a different weight reading (varies up to 6 lbs!!!) even if you step on and off with a minute!
review_body: The scale was brightly lit and attractively sleek...too bad it didn't work. It gave a different reading every time I got on and off. Within 5 mintues, my weight varied up to 6 lbs. from the reading a moment prior. This is worse scale I ever owned. The company had a nice card in the box with a phone # to call if you are unhappy with product. When I took the time to call them  - I was given no special accomodations for calling. I didn't need to waste time calling when I simply ended up just returning it via amazon. All they said was they would notify their engineering dept. (How does this impact me? I just need a scale and thought maybe they'd offer a coupon of something if I called them per their request to notify them if you arent satisfied. So I returned the item AND have a bad taste for customer service that asks you to call but does nothing to make it right for you other than referring you back to amazon's own wonderful return policy!

review_title: (whether you're pleased with the results or not is up to you
review_body: The scale is sleek and light. No fuss, no muss too. You just step on the thing and you get your weight, (whether you're pleased with the results or not is up to you!). Probably the nicest of it's kind I've ever had.

I was excited to use this scale, given the positive reviews, but the scale is anything but reliable. It hasn't given me the same weight twice, even 30 seconds apart. Unless I'm some modern medical marvel of fluctuating weight, the scale isn't accurate.. To account for natural shifts in body weight, I weigh myself at the same time every day. I count calories, I exercise regularly, the scale hasn't moved from its spot on the hardwood floor, and yet every time I weigh myself I get different results. Last week within a ten minute span, the scale registered my weight shifting from 168, 166.2, 167.4, and 166.8. A pair of eight pound weights measured in the same period weighed 16.2, 16.8, and 15.8. It seems like this scale has an error of +/- 2.0 lbs, which is just ridiculous.. I've tried following the recalibration instructions provided in the manual and by users on here multiple times, and it's still inaccurate. To ensure I wasn't being too hasty, I tried it again today. This morning at 8:08 AM, I weighed 163.8, 162.8, 163.4. Again, at 8:15 AM I weighed 164.8, 163.6, 164.4, and then finally 163.4.. Do I trust this scale? No.

Not thrilled with this product.  It reflected an accurate weight for about the first month but as of yesterday began showing that my weight was SIGNIFICANTLY lower than what it usually is supposed to be.  I'm fairly confident that I didn't lose 15 lbs over the course of an evening when I chose to have Chinese takeout for dinner.  I also let the scale reset and tried again and it showed me a 3 lbs weight difference from when I had stepped onto it moments before.. I'm not sure what might be the problem - I have it laid on the bathroom floor which is a hard (tile) surface.  I always step on and wait for the number to settle.

review_title: Very good scale. Use almost daily and no issues with ...
review_body: Very good scale. Use almost daily and no issues with the shatter problems others have seen. I have tested on level floors and slightly uneven floors and the results are the same. Great scale for the money.
Nice scale, easy to set up and get working. The bottom doesn't sit completely flat though so it shifts when you first stand on it, but this doesn't seem to affect the reading, so I'm happy.

review_title: I purchased 3 of these for wellness challenges at my ...
review_body: I purchased 3 of these for wellness challenges at my office. I had 2 people help me test them out to see if we could use more than 1 scale to weigh people simultaneously instead of one at a time. We placed the scales in the exact same locations and made sure all conditions were identical. The scales each gave a different weight every time we tested them.

review_title: Great scale! High quality. AAA batteries included.
review_body: Way better than all the other scales I have bought. This scale uses 2 AAA batteries which are included, rather than the tiny circular ones in other brands I have bought. I have been through 2 different scales in the past year and this one is way better. Its extremely accurate, and easy to use. It automatically turns on when you step on it, and the batteries have lasted weeks so far, as I weight myself every day. Great product, high quality
It stopped working 6 weeks after I received it.  The screen still lights up, but the weight will not read.  Past the window to return.

review_body: These work fine. I am disappointed that with all the settings, there is no off...they have to be unplugged. This is inconvenient where I have them.
So far, this product exceeds my expectations.
Perfect "protector" for my fancy shower curtain. Magnets and all. Good choice.

review_title: Awesome I have had this awhile no mildew
review_body: Awesome I have had this awhile no mildew. I have also washed it a lot and it has held up great too

Unfortunately, I had to return this item, but the material and quality of the product for exceeded my expectation.. reason for return. This is 72x72, which fits most of the showers.. It is a standard size. Because of redesign of my shower tall, the height increased about 4 inches, so 72x72 no longer fits mine.

review_title: Nice quality shower curtain liner with magnets at the bottom
review_body: Nice quality shower curtain liner with magnets at the bottom. It's opaque/frosted enough to add extra privacy to your existing curtain without blocking out too much light. Not sure how it'll be 6-12 months from now when I usually have to end up replacing these things due to mildew. We'll see...
These are advertised as heavy, but no where on the package does it say heavy. I have several showers, therefore several liners. These are the lightest weight of ANY of them
Does the job, nothing special, but exactly what I was looking for. A plastic shower curtain.
We love our new shower liner.  There was no chemical smell after opening it.
I like this shower curtain.  The depth is great but I wish a shorter length was available - I had to raise my shower rod considerable.  Still, I highly recommend.
This curtain is excellent!  No mildew build up!!!  Bathroom look great!!!

review_title: Good value. My only complaint is if you are ...
review_body: Good value. My only complaint is if you are cleaning something extra dirty, they are super hard to get clean. the dirt really clings/sticks tot he cloths
Great price. Theyre not very absorbent at all. Theses are far from the best microfiber rags I've used but they'll do.

review_title: Good quality and get the job done
review_body: Good quality and get the job done. Use them for all sorts of things and they do a great job. The only complaints are that after washing them the edging causes them to curl just a touch and they don't lay perfect flat without a little tugging. Good value. I'd buy them again, though I'm not sure when they'll wear out.

review_title: Use them daily for cleaning sensitive surfaces (sunglasses, MacBook screen, camera lens), hasn't scratched anything yet.
review_body: Use them daily for cleaning sensitive surfaces (sunglasses, MacBook screen, camera lens), hasn't scratched anything yet.

review_title: Works good but not as nice as the Costco yellow ones.
review_body: I ordered these to see if they compared to the bulk pack at Costco I usually get. They are a cheaper material (thinner) and are smaller. The plus to these is the colors. This way you can keep them separate for different jobs around the shop, house and bathroom. I would suggest the Costco yellow towels over these any day. Much more absorbent and last longer after multiple washes.

I would have given the towels five stars except for the lint. Don't bother using them right out of the box. They aren't even close to being lint free. Put them through the washing machine first. After that they work great and are cheap!

review_title: Could not believe the price on these Cloths?
review_body: If you read any decorating or womens magazines, e.g. Good Housekeeping, Women's Day, etc., you know that they recommend microfiber cleaning cloths. To get 24 for this price is amazing.  At first my husband wanted to know why so many, but then he wanted to know where I had put them.  I think he likes them also.  I would highly recommend them.  They attract dust rather than just move it from one place to the other.  Thanks Amazon for having these available.

My husband and daughter love these cloths.  They use them everywhere, and I love that they are inexpensive.  I have them on auto ship so we get fresh new ones every six months, and I can put the old ones in the garage for car cleaning or dog feet wiping.

review_title: Great for general uses and soft enough for gentle cleaning.
review_body: Very good feel and still great out of the wash. They are not abrasive enough to scrub hard to clean surfaces, but because of their softness they work well on delicate items like glasses and plexiglass. They work very well for cleaning fingerprints from glossy wood surfaces.. I have also used these with some very corrosive chemicals cleaning metal products and they hold up very well without shredding like others I have tried.

review_title: These are really cheap and are a good cleaner with or without sprays
review_body: These are really cheap and are a good cleaner with or without sprays. They are not the best but for the price I am happy with the compromise. I have bought numerous times and I will continue to do so.

review_title: Broke in no time and no returns
review_body: Broke after 3 months and no return available.  Do not buy - wish I could have given it 0 stars

review_title: Very good product! Took all the wrinkles out of a ...

review_title: It doesn't get better than these Brawny paper towels
review_body: It doesn't get better than these Brawny paper towels. I love that they truly do clean up any spill, and with these pick-a-size towels, you can take as much or as little as you need.  These packs are BIG - when they say XL, they mean it. Compared to the cheapy paper towels I was buying before, these are a dream. I'll be switching to these long-term.

These rolls are quite a bit larger than those we are accustomed to in my household. Also the Brawny has a lot more absorption than your average paper towel. As such, less is required for a given job. I also like the fact that the towels offer a couple different sizes to pull off the roll. All in all, I'm very satisfied with these.

review_title: An emergency coffee spill made me realize how good this paper towel really is!
review_body: I was planning on reviewing these towels yesterday.  I had used them around the house for a few weeks, and was pleased with them.  They worked well, seemed nice and absorbent, and I was impressed with the price, as compared to the big well known brand---they were a lot cheaper but seemed close in quality.  Then...an accident.... It's the kind of accident I have all the time.  Early morning coffee combined with sitting by the computer combined with being a klutz.  Coffee knocked over, spilled all over, getting close to the computer and the speaker and all sorts of things you don't want coffee on.  I grabbed the roll of Brawny I had near the computer for reviewing and quickly worked on the spill, and that made me realize I needed to up my review from good to great.  The Brawny absorbed the coffee spill better than any other paper towel I've tried in similar situations, and there have been too many similar situations.  It really has some extra quick absorbing power.. So---a great price, very good for regular cleaning use, and terrific at sudden spills!  I love it!

review_title: the most product at a good quality that you can get for its cost
review_body: This is my go to paper towel for the value - in my opinion, the most product at a good quality that you can get for its cost. Noticed that they discontinued the larger package with more rolls that I used to buy - sad, since that was really a great value, and enough to last my household of 4 almost a year.

I use paper towels not only for wiping up messes but also instead of napkins and facial tissue. I really like the pick-a-size so I can choose a smaller towel. They're two ply, thick, absorbent and durable; about all you'd want in a paper towel (or napkin or tissue...).. With subscribe and save these seem to be a pretty good price and buying them in bulk definitely saves money.

review_title: Great product to stock in pantry!
review_body: Excellent price and durable paper towels. This product holds up well for all of our family needs. We use this product from cleaning, wiping little faces, or absorbing wet messes. Actually, they get forgotten in pockets, go theough a wash cycle and remain in tact. Excellent product and will continue to stock in our pantry.

These Brawny paper towels deliver.  They are larger, thicker, and just better than most.  Though they may seem a bit expensive at first, you will likely use fewer towels over time as these pick up and absorb better, hold together better, and just do a better job than most "cheaper" towels. I had strayed away from Brawny, but these may pull me back. Simply a great paper towel and when needed, one wants something that does the job.. The rolls are huge and being able to tear off half sheets is economical. And with these a half sheet is often all you need. For other purposes you can tear larger sheets as well. (Other brands also allow this, though.) I think the price is fair for what you get, a lot of tough, durable towels that do a great job.  Also, if (like me) you often use towels as a simple "place mat" then these are thick.strong, and work well at that, also. Work great for lining shelves as well. Lots of uses for these.. Great paper towels!

review_body: I was quite surprised by this mattress cover. I had just put this cover on my new mattress and walked out of my room. My female dog was in heat which I did not know at the time. I won't go into details but the mattress cover prevented anything from getting on my new mattress. Thank you for that because if anything would have gotten on my mattress my warranty would have been voided!! I highly recommend this!!

I purchased this cover for my Costco memory foam mattress to make sure we do not have accidents when baby sleeps in our bed. It is very thin, does not smell and actually waterproof. Couple month later I purchased it for our spare bedroom foam mattress too.. I recommend it

Have one for each bed. Queen, twin and King. Never had a problem. My son has had accidents on them and never gone through to the mattress. They don't last forever though and do wear out. Especially if you wash them too frequently they will lose there waterproof ability but follow instructions!

So far, after one wash, it has held up.  It's soft, comfortable, and actually waterproof.. **Update  I have to say that the Queen size protector still remains waterproof after months of using, however, I docked a star because for some reason the Full size one has leaked through several times now when my son had accidents.  I don't know if this was a defective one, but I ordered another and will update again after using.  Disappointing, but hopefully this new one will work.

review_title: This product has been very useful and I would recommend to anyone that a person ...

My brother has just battled stage 4 Colon Cancer and after two years his digestive system is built differently then what we are born with.  I bough him a new mattress since he deserved one after all the chemotherapy and radiation, and even though he has some incontinence trouble at times knowing this product is built very well makes knowing that the brand new mattress is still very much brand new.

review_title: Very soft, great fit, waterproof and machine washable
review_body: Great fit, we have a new Sterns & Foster and two different stores (Macy's and Rooms To Go) tried to sell us very expensive bed covers telling us that a single spill on the bed would void the 10 year warranty. This SafeRest bed cover is not only waterproof and stain resistant it doesn't feel or sound like a waterproof mattress cover. It is soft, machine washable and will add years of life (and warranty) to our new mattress purchase.

My parents purchased 2 SafeRest Premium queen sized mattress covers after reading so many positive reviews, and they are very happy with their purchase. They have a 2” memory foam pad on top of their mattress and thIs covers everything securely. This is a quality mattress pad, protecting your mattress without sacrificing comfort. Highly recommend!!

Basic product but well made. Washes easily, and you can even put it in the dryer. Has saved the mattress many times. I don't work for the mfr, but I'd encourage you to buy two. That way when problems occur in the night, you put the second one on the bed and remake it, and don't have to strip the freshly remade bed in the morning to put back the newly washed mattress cover.

I ordered this specifically for use as a slow cooker, and I have to admit, I haven't used it for the other uses, which is why my review isn't as glowing as many of the others. My older slow cooker finally died, and I ordered one of the newer, digital models. What I found, and was confirmed by other reviewers, was that newer models, mandated by the FDA, cook at higher temperatures, so they are no longer really "slow cookers.". I ordered at least 3 different models and makes, and they all ruined my tried and true "old school" recipes that I used to make for years, you know the ones that you used to throw in before you left for work, and you came home and they were perfect. Not now. If I cooked my famous Tarragon Chicken in a new slow cooker, it was overcooked, dry, and stringy after only two or three hours. I was incredibly disappointed.. So, I heard wonderful things about the Instant Pot, and it was made in Canada, so I hoped they didn't have to go by FDA mandates. Imagine my disappointment when I found the same results with the slow cooker feature. My Tarragon Chicken couldn't go all day in this slow cooker either. The most it could go, even on the "low" setting, was about two hours max. Some of my "foodie" friends on a local food blog said to use the pressure cooker setting, but if I'd wanted a pressure cooker, that's what I'd buy. I realize I have that option, but I just wanted a real "slow cooker" like I had back in the day. I guess that's no longer and option. The FDA thinks we no longer no how to cook, even though we've been using slow cookers for decades, and have managed to live to tell the tale!. So, while the Instant Pot surely has many different functions that I haven't explored, and I probably will, what I bought it expressly for, what a big disappointment to me.

Love this for pressure cooking and regular cooking.  I have a stove top pressure cooker, which I like, but I love this one.  This is much more convenient to use since it has a timer on it and I don't have to sit and watch it while it is cooking.  I have replaced my rice cooker with this because the rice turns out even better in the pressure cooker.  I've noticed that when cooking rice, I do have to use a little less water than normal, otherwise, the rice is too soggy.  But, the rice turns out perfect once you get the hang of it.  I'm used to using a stove top pressure cooker and really don't use any special cookbooks to cook in this.  I like to be able to just throw a frozen piece of meat in the cooker and have a roast or something else cooked in a shorter time frame.  If the meat is frozen, just make sure you increase the time manually instead of using the pre-programmed setting or your food will not be done.  If you've been on the fence about getting a pressure cooker due to all of the horror stories of them exploding, if they did explode it is because they were not venting properly.  As long as you make sure the vent is venting correctly and the lid is on securely, you have nothing to worry about.  I purchased the stainless steel version and I also purchased a second stainless steel pot, because I use this a lot.  The stainless steel is very easy to clean and usually just soaking it in some hot, soapy water does the trick.  I use a non-scratching scrubber and some bar keeper's friend if there is some tough residue that just doesn't want to come out easily.  Haven't had any problems with it yet and have been using it for a while.  You might want to consider getting some of the Instant pot accessories like the glass lid, extra stainless steel pot, the silicone pot mini mitts, and an extra silicone gasket.  The silicone gasket tends to hold the odors of the food that you cooked, so I take mine out after using it and soak it to get rid of the odors and have the spare to cook in the pot again without having to wait.

I love my IP so much. I had a 5 quart Duo but wanted another one since many I know own several, even 4! So on cyber Monday I saw this 8 quart Duo Plus for such a sweet deal I snatched it up and so glad I did ! My first recipe in this one was a double recipe of fresh homemade Cranberry Sauce! So fast, easy and yummy! You can't go wrong with these wonderful pressure cookers! Don't be afraid. It's not your grandmothers old fashioned one. These have so many fail safes. One bit of advice is that if you are new to them and nervous and have Facebook then join the group on there called Instant Pot Community! So many members who are so helpful. I joined then for about 4 days read every post , gathered great information and then felt ready to use my IP and have been going strong since. I've seen one bad review on here and it makes me wonder why so critical and I don't believe the company ignored them. They always make things right and the people on the FB that ran into problems filed a ticket and things were made right so I wonder if the sour grape person works for another company, hmmm, lol, never know! As for me and millions other we love our IP's! Proud to be a pothead 😂. I love making tender fall apart roasts in mine! Beans, rice, casseroles , you name it! Next up will be yogurts '!. Enjoy cooking. As with anything there is a Learning curve. Study up quickly so you can avoid mistakes. I've never had a failure in mine. Nothing burned or sputtered because before hand I learned how to AVoid that! Go ahead. Buy one... or two... or more 🍚🤗

I had a regular pressure cooker I used in the past, which was so difficult to use that I just gave up on it, so I was dubious about this pot but the fact you could make yogurt in it too , as well as the rave reviews here convinced me to get it.. Wow..I would now say it's a kitchen must have for me, like my Vitamix. I am clumsy and hate struggling with things but even I could manage this lid and getting it off and on (you can't get it off until the pressure is too a certain level though).. So far I have made gluten free chicken and dumplings, tortilla soup, stew, and just chicken thighs.. Like another reviewer mentioned, for some reason the whole chicken or chicken with bones comes out better than the pure chicken meat by itself. You can't believe how quickly things cook and how tender the meat is. I'm looking forward to trying new recipes with this, making more old fashioned type comfort foods, and maybe even trying to make some persian dishes with this that usually take many hours to cook (like gorme sabzi, a stew of fried greens with dried lime and meat).. Wonderful product, very happy I got it.

review_title: It's a pain and a bulky disappointment.
review_body: We bought it in November and thought it was the answer to our rice cooker issue. After several months of using it, it's temperamental and the lid won't close after trying for 10 minutes. There is something with the sealing mechanism that is hindering its ability to close when plugged in. A cooking option was not chosen, it was simply plugged in. We're about 2 weeks past the return window so now we're stuck with a bulky kitchen item. Also, the coating at the rim of the lid is flaking off and I found pieces of that in my rice. One of the important features of this cooker was that the food would be free of plastics or coatings, however that was not the case. For the price, it should work flawlessly each time.

review_title: Fast, versatile and easy to use
review_body: What a great way to save time in cooking! Since I bought the 3-Quart model, there aren't that many accessories available for it yet (like pot cover). For a single person, the 3-qt. size is big enough, but most recipes (a ton of recipe books are available on Kindle) are portioned for the 6-qt. size and have to be scaled down. This thing is incredibly great at making rice and rice dishes, as well as hot cereals and grains like quinoa. Soups, stews and chilis are a breeze. The timer and modes of the unit make flawless pressure-cooking possible. Be careful not to fill the internal pot above the maximum fill line, or you'll make a mess. The whole thing is very well-built and seems like it will last a long time. I am using it to cook more than half of my meals, and that really surprises me. For vegans, this little pot opens up a method for making great vegan dishes quickly and easily. I have also used it to make some really great Thai and Indian curries as well as some Chinese recipes. I even made some bread pudding that turned out great. The internal stainless pot is very solid and easy to clean up (unless you burn something while sautéing). Make sure you have adequate liquid in the bottom of the pot when steaming.

I received the IP-DUO60 7-in-1 Instant Pot on 03/16/2016. I purchased it for two main reasons, Pot Roast and Corned Beef and Cabbage. I'm here to say it does an excellent job on both and I'm convinced it will do equally as well with other dishes. Now here's where I thought I might have a problem. When not in use I store the Instant Pot on a shelf next to the cellar stairs. This morning (07-19-2016) one of the three dogs thought it was OK to go poking around the shelf and somehow knocked the Instant Pot off the shelf and down the cellar stairs. FYI the stairs are cast cement. When I heard the racket I got up to investigate and was greeted by three dogs who denied any and all involvement in what had just happened. There at the bottom of the stairs was my Instant Pot with lid off and inner bowl out. My first thought was I'll have to go to Amazon and order a new one and maybe even upgrade to the 8 quart size. Not so fast, lets see if it still works. Brought it in the kitchen and added some water. Plugged it in and it came to life. After a few minutes it came up to pressure and did everything it was supposed to do none the worst for ware. I'm happy, the dogs are happy and corned beef and cabbage tonight.

Second one I bought. Use it all the time. I have to say that the newer DUO60 is a little more ruggedly built. The cord is thicker and can be removed. I have told dozens of people about this pot and know of at least 10 that have bought it. The price fluctuates so watch. Got new one on a special for $68 a few months ago. I really like that the insert it comes with is stainless steel without the coating. Don't be afraid of it, so easy to use. Get a good pressure cooker cookbook and start cooking. Easy. And you can donate your slow cooker cause this one does that too!

review_title: I love the end result when it works
review_body: I love the end result when it works.  In the beginning after 3 uses it worked flawlessly.  The third time not so.  The silicone seal prevented the cooker from starting up properly but luckily I had read some of the reviews and more than a couple people said to have some space seals on hand because it didn't last that long.  They were right.  I just used it yesterday with a NEW seal installed and it worked fine while making a pot roast but when it came time to add the raw potatoes after the roast was cooked it didn't want to start the 10 min cooking process.  I had to play with the lid to get it to work and start the cooking process.  The lid was on tight but now not sure if its another seal problem or is it the lid. Anyone have the same issues??

review_title: Makes cooking easier and more fun!
review_body: It was tricky to get started because the booklet really isn't all that helpful, but there is a ton of information (and recipes) available on line.  My daughters and I all love our Instant Pots.  Pasta, stews & soups, potatoes & sweet potatoes and other veggies, defrosting and warming up frozen meals, the pressure cooker function, the slow cooker function, the sauté function; it's all good.  So easy.  And easy to clean, too, even when I burned food on the bottom (because I wasn't following the directions for defrosting food).  Perfect pasta, every time, without standing over the pot to watch how it's doing. I love it!

review_title: Really nice, but it fails the consistency test.
review_body: After having this scale for a little over 6 months, it's obvious that it passes every test...except accuracy. It's got a sleek profile, nice to look at, easy to read numbers that light up. But it almost never displays the right weight first time around until you let it stabilize on a number, it holds that number for 5-10 seconds, then you step back on and it will display a different number (normally 3-4lbs less). The other issue here is that once in awhile, it's right the first time, so you go through the whole 30 second exercise to see if it changes. While we've gotten used to it, this is not what we want in a scale, so I'd say keep looking.. You'll know the first reading is off after you get off the scale, wait 5-10 seconds & see if a "C" (for correction ?) comes up in the display. If it does, then step back on & the next reading will be more accurate. This happens on both concrete & outdoor carpeting, wood flooring, etc.

I've had the same scale for about 20 years, it was time to upgrade! We've only had this scale for about 2 weeks but no complaints. We really like this scale, mostly because of the lighting. It is bright and clear to read. Also it was nice it already came with batteries.

Fluctuates between 5 pounds. I step on the scale (on a flat, hard surface) and get a different result. Every. Single. Time. Since weight loss is often about a pound or two - it's kind of useless. I could step on it 30 times, I would get 30 weights.

Following jaw surgery I was under strict instructions to monitor my weight.. This looked like a great scale for the job and I was very surprised when it was completely off. Not just totally different (close to 10 lbs off)  than the what the scale at the doctor said, but it would also go up and down. When I knew for a fact there was no way that my weight could be going up.. It was very frustrating MD I ended up going out to buy a new scale.. I wonder if anyone else had such an experience with this scale?

I got this scale right before my first kid was born. I was gaining weight with the stress and my wife's lack of mobility. It really helped me keep the weight at bay and after almost a year it is helping me lose weight again. The tempered glass is easy to keep clean and very pleasant to stand on. The display is huge and easy to read in the morning even before I put my contacts in. My son now loves to crawl up on the scale and weigh himself as well; he loves the light and watching the numbers blink.. The first test I did was to step in the scale multiple times in a row. Each time the weight came back exactly the same. I stepped with my weight centered on the front, the back, the sides, and always the same weight. My last scale was roughly 12 years old and it was so sensitive to where I stood. This scale is great. I really can't complain about anything.
It was as I expected and was promoted. I'm happy with my purchase so far.

I love that I don't have to tap the scale before stepping on it to get a reading.  This is my first scale accurate to a tenth of a pound.  A little disconcerting at first after being used to rounding to 1/2 pounds but I know I will appreciate the increased accuracy once I get used to it.  I do love the sleekness of the scare.

Amazing product. I love the look. I put a 5 pound weight to test it and it said 5.00 pounds exact (although it said “error” cause of course it needs more weight). But the fact that it was so precise is amazing! Would recommend to anyone!!!
Weight reading is 6lbs off. Replacement will take 2-7 days to ship, much to long to wait for something I needed when purchasing this.. Update: Replacement received and works great.
The product was defective ,every time I stepped on the scale it would read different numbers which is unusual for a weight scale to determine ones weight

review_body: Not a pillow I'd sleep with or anything, but it does the job. Especially if you're looking for a throw pillow for decoration, this will suffice. No need to spend the money on a nicer one unless you're planning on using it to sleep with.

I spend an amazing amount of time cleaning up messes, cat puke, grandkid puke, dog accidents, you name it, my busy house has it.  There are heavily advertised products out there with big price takes that are promoted as "thicker," "thirstier," "stronger" but I just need clean up the mess, get the job done, and throw away cheap.  These more than satisfy all my needs AND they have the "select-a-size" feature of some of the very much higher priced products. "Fits all Brita pitchers except stream and infinity."  Or, apparently, the one I have, which I have had for several years.. So I have 2 of these "long lasting" filters which will indeed last a very long time because they do NOT FIT my pitcher.

Filter doesn't even last 2 weeks let alone the 6 months the manufacture advertises.  Called them to complain they sent a replacement and the replacement had the same issue.  Water flow is so slow, that by the second week it's nearly unusable.  Buy the regular filter, these are just horrible.

We received the Brita water filter on time and it works perfectly as well. The price is unbeatable, so this purchase was definitely worth it.

When we received the Brita Pitcher, it came with a filter.  That filter worked great!  Our water at home is horrible and after we started using the Brita Pitcher, we no longer have to buy bottled water!  When it was time to change the filter, we bought a 3 count of filters from Amazon.  The first filter worked great but we have since changed and used the last two and with both filters, after one day, our water tasted HORRIBLE!  It had a really strong plastic taste!  We have since thrown all three of these filters away and have started back using bottled water.  Very disappointed!
Work as predicted, water tastes better than our tap.

Easy to install/remove, and the box has descriptive instructions if anything is unclear. I usually can notice the filter becoming less effective about 3 months, which is when i get a new one. Definitely worth having a brits filter versus buying bottled water.

review_title: My husband used to snore like a train
review_body: My husband used to snore like a train. Since we bought this mattress protector along with the 'all natural Liberty Bed from Amerisleep' his snoring is gone. I can finally get a good night sleep. I must add that he has also given up coffee, which may have contributed to this improvement in his sleep pattern. He used to have difficulty breathing at night, now he sleeps like a baby.

review_title: ... when you move on the bed but this is super quiet. We use it in our spare bedroom ...
review_body: I was concerned about hearing the plastic crinkle sounds when you move on the bed but this is super quiet. We use it in our spare bedroom over our futon as our dog spends time in there when we are out of the house and has had a couple of incidents as she has gotten older. Everything washes out really well(I always rinse first and then wash ASAP) and there have been no stains at all despite the white fabric.The fabric side has the texture of a low pile towel.. Overall, a great product.

The dog shredded our sheets and the mattress protector making himself a nest recently. I replaced our old protector with this one. It's nicely made with a soft terry cloth type of material on top. It doesn't feel or smell like plastic or vinyl at all, doesn't make crinkly noises, and it stays neatly put even with my husband's tossing and turning - a big plus!. I really like that the sides are a slightly stretchy material with elastic all the way around like a deep pocket fitted sheet,  instead of that weird papery "fabric" stuff with rings of skinny, dinky elastic that never lets you get a snug fit. It goes over our mattress just fine, and we have a pillow top mattress with a 4" memory foam topper that challenges deep pocket sheets.

2 accidents already happened to this Saferest since it was delivered. First my 9 yr old, who always takes naps on my bed, wet it and nothing reached the mattress. Then I spilled my drink on it and my mattress was still dry. What I love most about it is that when it gets soiled, I can wash and dry it very easily in my washer and dryer just like a regular sheet and it's good as new. I'm loving this product.

Everyone should have this mattress pad!!! I have purchased this mattress pad for every bed in my house. I have 5 kiddos including 2 who are newly potty trained. Not once has there been one drop of liquid on any of my mattresses. It is very soft and doesn't feel or sound like you are sleeping on plastic, which is what I first thought of a waterproof cover. This is soft as any other fabric cover and provides excellent protection. We have tested this first hand numerous times. It is very easy to wash and dry. You won't be disappointed.

review_title: it does not envelope the mattress like a slip on sock with a zipper would
review_body: The cover is very soft and provides some added cooling for my memory foam mattress. Do not buy this on the thoughts of this covering the entire mattress, it does not envelope the mattress like a slip on sock with a zipper would. It only covers the top of the mattress not the undercarriage. I only state this for those of you who are thinking they are getting full dust mite protection on their single mattress that would be above the floor and on an open bodied frame. This does leave the bottom of the mattress open to the air if it is resting on a frame. I have a 12" memory foam Signature Sleep that is resting above the floor on a Sleep Master metal frame.

review_title: I love how it fits the super thick mattress without any ...
review_body: This replaced a mattress pad that I got about a decade ago that wore out - not sure if it was the same brand or not. I love how it fits the super thick mattress without any issue and helps keep the sheets from shifting and doesn't have that plastic crinkle of so many waterproof liners. Do not dry it; let it air dry and it will last you longer. This is one of the few pads that you can use on a Tempurpedic bed without affecting the memory foam bed - memory phone needs body heat to be soft and support correctly.

review_title: This really prevents stains on your mattress!
review_body: My Boxer had an accident on our bed last night & this mattress protector did it’s job. The mattress protector soaked up the pee & our mattress is still stain free. I don’t get hot with it & neither does my hubbie who easily sweats.. Pic #1: the stain. Pic #2: our stain free mattress :). Pic #3: me holding up the cover against the light.. *i have this cover on our Saatva king size mattress that is 14.5 inches thick & it fits great!

This cover has passed all sorts of tests for parents of little ones.. Our toddler's "accidents" have not leaked through it once (and these are no tinkles I'm talking about).. Our toddler alsk moves all over the place, and yet the cover always stays firmly in place.. And lastly, I've washed it many times (I'm a clean freak, it's not that the cover has ever smelled or anything like that) and it still works as good as new.. Exactly what we were looking for at a very reasonable price.

review_title: they are very cool and can be washed many times and do their ...
review_body: This is my second set of these mattress protectors I have purchased for my Tempur-Pedic mattress.  They are vinyl free so therefore they don't make any noise, they are very cool and can be washed many times and do their job very well.  I did not hesitate to buy these again.  Try them you won't be disappointed!!  Ordering was easy and they were delivered fast via Amazon prime!!

I have a lot of kitchen appliances, basically everything you can imagine: vitamix blender, food processor, dehydrator, rice cooker, pressure cooker, waffle iron, juicer, etc. Needless to say my kitchen is full! That's the first plus of the Instant Pot, 3 of my appliances (plus some) are now in 1! More counter space! Yay!. I primarily eat at home and I cook A LOT. I only cook unprocessed, healthy, plant based foods so it can be quite time consuming and difficult at times. I'm a full time student, Mom to 4 pets, I work, have a boyfriend, train on my bike, and practice yoga daily. I'm SUPER busy which is reason number 2 why I decided to give the Instant Pot a go and it hasn't disappointed me! I've only had it for a week and I've already saved hours in the kitchen!. One other benefit that I wasn't planning on is less dishes and easier clean up. I can sauté garlic and onions, add in other ingredient, let it boil, then throw on the top and pressure cook it without ever changing pans and in 1/2 the amount of time. This makes my life so much easier!. Without any reservations I can say that the Instant Pot is the best kitchen appliance I have ever owned and I imagine the longer I have it the more I'll love it. I've used it every day since it's arrived, sometimes 3 times a day! I've made split pea soup, steel cut oats, millet porridge, sweet potatoes, rice, lentils, and I even tried my hand at making vegan yogurt for the first time, it was SO EASY and AMAZING! I'm just absolutely blown away with how great this thing is and how easy it is to use!. It's so great that I talked my Dad into getting one and he LOVES it! He's a bachelor who lives in a space that doesn't have an oven, or much of a kitchen right now which makes cooking difficult for obvious reasons. Thanks to the Instant Pot he's eating at home more often and he says he "doesn't even feel like he's cooking.". Long story short, everyone should own an Instant Pot! I wish I could give it more than 4 stars! And for the price I got it for on Cyber Monday?!?! I can't even believe it! It's already paid for itself!

review_title: Some Oatmeal recipes are amazing too. Cleans up fast if you can soak ...
review_body: Took some time to learn recipes but we use this all Winter long.  Beef stew in so little time.  Pea soup so yummy. There are a few tricks to using one so it helps if someone can guide you to the tips..venting, safely adding items, and getting recipes for press cookers.  I had no one that had one so I figured it all out.  As they say it is not rocket science, but it did take me a few tries.  There are tons of recipes now too.  I got used cook books on Amazon to try a few ideas. Our slow pot used to simmer while I was at work...Not now.  I do prep some meals in the AM.  Keep in frig and start this pot right when I get home.  Dinner in an hour that use to take all day.  Some Oatmeal recipes are amazing too. Cleans up fast if you can soak the stainless steel pot for 30 mins. after use.  But I have not had any issues with food sticking. Again, this is different than the old slow pots but well worth the effort if you can just take the time to learn. About a foot high.  Cord comes off for storage.  similar weight to the bigger slow cook pots.

review_title: buttons won't respond after only 6 months
review_body: I really really love this ..I"m not one to cook so I only use it for a few things I have learned how to make in it..plus it saves room being a rice cooker and slow cooker all in one..However..my first one came with a cracked handle. No problem..other then having to be patient waiting for a replacement  all was good. I use it probably 5 times a month..maybe less..and now the buttons on the front are starting to not respond. It did it a couple of weeks ago..I thought it was a fluke. Now it did it yesterday and today. I have to unplug it and let it reset. I store it unplugged so it's not always on. I bought it in Nov 2016 and my window for returning ended in Feb. Super unhappy that two in a row were defective and conveniently just a few months after I could return it to amazon. I would give it one star because it's totally unacceptable..but I know I love the product..IF IT WORKED! Amazon..please take a look into these..are you having a problem with them?..I don't know why I would get 2 in a row with problems.

Love love love my Instant Pot! I've had it for about 4 weeks and I use it about 4 to 5 times a week. I look online for different recipes and ideas how to use it. A lot of people say that it seems very overwhelming, but it's not bad at all. Just read the manual, look up recipes and ideas online, and try something simple like beans or rice for your first try. You'll get use to how it works. It's an awesome "toy"! I've made beans, rice, soups, roasts, whole chickens, cheese cakes, chili, homemade mac and cheese, bone broth, etc. Everything tastes so much better in the Insant Pot!

stopped working after an year.. Was good for a year.. The unit started  malfunctioning after a year.. The pressure cooking option would never turn on.. when connected to to AC outlet every once in a while it goes to saute mode automatically.. i cannot use it anymore. Also warranty is void after a year.

Love it!! This Instant Pot is my first of this brand. I highly recommend this brand because it is the "standard" among electric pressure cookers. Having owned a previous "other brand", I can say that this one is far superior over the other brands. I've cooked a variety of foods in it, and everything I've cooked has turned out beautifully. I have not found the inside container difficult to clean. After washing in hot soapy water, I put a little bit of water in the bottom, sprinkle it with "Bar-Keepers Friend powder" and use a dish cloth to clean the entire inside of the pot. After rinsing and drying, it looks brand new and no scratches at all.

review_title: A lot of fun. very versatile and easy to clean.
review_body: This is a winner at the $52 price point I got it for in November 2017.  I tend now to spend too much time cooking because it is just fun and satisfying to achieve so much in one pot. I also turn out too many calories... again because it is fun and so easy to clean up. I am still in the learning and experimenting phase, but have made some incredible soups just using up meats from the freezer and grains from the cupboards.  Today I made country ribs with homemade bbq sauce, all in the pot, from browning the meat and the onions, stirring up a bbq sauce from scratch. It turned out so perfectly I may never again waste money at a rib shack, where the chance of getting dried up ribs is pretty high. The 3 qt size works well for one person with leftovers for 1-2 more meals, or with soups, to freeze a couple of pints in addition to eating all you want for a couple of days. Sauteing is a little tricky because the bottom of the pan is slightly convex, so if you use only a small quantity of oil, it goes to the edges leaving the center without oil. I will shop for silicone grip pot holders that pinch in order to manage the hot stainless pot for tasks like stabilizing while stirring, and draining the extra oil needed before progressing from saute to pressure mode.

review_title: I am amazed!! Cooking with this is soooo easy
review_body: I am amazed!! Cooking with this is soooo easy!!! healthy meals quickly. Fall-apart, tender pot roast with vegetables in 1 hour. Meat comes out very tender and the vegetables aren't mushy just firm and cooked. Tender chicken, rice and vegetable dishes in 25 minutes. No added fat or salt needed you only need to add the right combo of veggies to et the taste you'll love.  Meat comes out tender and juicy every time. Only trick for me is how much liquid to add when cooking rice with vegetables and meat. I've found the more vegetables I add, I need less liquid to get the rice just right. clean up is simple. the stainless steel inner cooker is removable and cleans up like it non stick (easy cleanup probably has more to due with the cooking process) Wish I'b bought one of these years ago!

review_title: it looks like the cover is cracked and It will not hold ...
review_body: I purchased this for my daughter for x-mas. I came delivered to me in just a plastic bag which I thought was odd, but OK. My daughter just went to use it for the first time and is does not work, it looks like the cover is cracked and It will not hold the pressure. It has passed the return date, so I guess I will need to buy a new one, and check to make sure it works right away. very disapointing!. 4-12-2018: I want to be clear about this item, It turns out it was a used product which I was not aware of, but after speaking with an Amazon representative they are going to refund my money. Amazon has always done the right thing for me I have nothing but great words about them. Love, love ,love them

review_title: High quality double-wall stainless steel insert makes this Pressure Cooker an excellent option
review_body: I chose the Instant Pot pressure cooker because of the stainless steel insert. I generally avoid non-stick surfaces, choosing an iron skillet for most of my frying needs, and I did not want a pressure cooker with a non-stick surface. This Instant Pot cooker is a bit more expensive than many of the options with non-stick pots, but I think it's worth it. I am extremely impressed by the quality of the pot included. Most rice cookers and that sort of device have very thin pots which commonly leads to burning of food. This pot has a double walled base such as you would find on an expensive stove top cooking pot.. I have only made three things in the pot, so I cannot speak to the longevity of the cooker. However, I can say that the pot works exactly as you would hope that it does. First I made beef stew according to a recipe I found online. The meat was browned in the pot with the lid off and then other ingredients added and the entire dish then pressure cooked. It did a fine job, and the seemingly ubiquitous step of removing the meat and adding liquid to deglaze the pot caused all the food to be stirred off the bottom and the flavor included in the dish. Cleanup was a breeze. Then I made stew, using a very similar process. First the meat was browned in the pot, removed, and liquid added to deglaze. Then the remaining ingredients were added back and pressure cooked. Black beans which had only been soaked for an hour were cooked to tender, along with the meat, in 30 minutes on the "Beans and Soup" setting. Finally I cooked garbanzo beans for hummus. Those had soaked overnight and rinsed, and the same "beans and soup" setting used to cook. I put the rack in and placed the soaked beans in a steamer insert. They were tender and made great hummus after only 30 minutes of pressure cooking. (Note: soaked beans should not take as long as unsoaked beans, but I wanted them very soft for hummus). Note that getting up to pressure takes 12-15 minutes, depending on how much water and other ingredients are in the pot. cooking time is on top of that.. The device makes virtually no noise unless you have it set to "steam" (the weight is turned one way for steaming and the other way for pressure).. I never scrubbed the pot after any of these meals, although with the smooth stainless steel, you certainly could do so without destroying the surface.. I would definitely recommend this pot if you're considering an electronic pressure cooker. Staying away from non-stick and getting the better quality insert pot is, in my opinion, worth the extra $30 over other options.

I was so excited when I purchased my new Etekcity Digital Body Weight Scale.  The read out is very large and I am getting a little older and don't like to put my glasses on in the morning.  Over the first few months the scale worked very well.  It seemed like every time I stepped on the scale the number was either the same or lower than it was the previous day.  Then the Etekcity scale started to malfunction.  Over the past 2 months every time I step on the scale the number is the same or higher.  I was so mystified I had to bend lower to make sure I wasn't misreading the (formerly) easily readable display.  This inconsistency in performance is the only reason I do not rate the Etekcity Digital Body Weight Scale a perfect 5.  If performance improves I will return and update the rating.

review_title: Nice looking, easy to read, works perfect!
review_body: I love this scale.  It's easy to read in the light or dark.  It is also slim/flat so that it's more stable.  It looks beautiful as well.  I like that it has ounces as well as pounds since I'm trying to lose weight and need the added encouragement.  :D

review_title: Gotta use it at least twice before it works
review_body: It needs a lot of redos.  The first few times I use it, the weight is way off and different from the time before.  It's almost like it needs a warm up to work properly.  After 2-3 tries, I finally get a consistent number.

We have owned several scales in the past. But for the money this is the best. It looks great. Is accurate and the quality is fantastic. Also a few days ago I received and email from the manufacturer to make sure we were happy with our scale. For a scale!!!??? Wow, that was just fantastic customer relations. I highly recommend this scale.

Finally a scale that's accurate all of the time, is lightweight and feels sturdy! I like that you can also replace it with normal batteries, not some crazy off the wall battery you're going to have to find online.  It's bright and easy to see, and the glass top is truly stunning.  It was packaged well, and very easy to use directions.  I will gladly buy from this company again!!!

This scale is exactly what I wanted. It works well and it takes AAA batteries. My previous scale was fine but it used coin cell batteries that I never have so eventually I stopped using it when they died after the 3rd time.. This is a no frills scale. It tells you your weight and that's it but that's all it needs to do. Simple is better.

I wish I could give zero stars. This is the worse scale ever made. I maybe wouldn’t know this if I didn’t own two of them, not for kicks, it was for two different bathrooms. They are always almost a pound different from each other, within moments of being tested, and never consistently up or down. One day one could be up, and one day the other one can be up. I know this sounds crazy, that’s why I’m saying it’s the worse scale ever made. If they were each consistently up or down I could just weigh myself and deduct the weight or add the weight, but they’re not even consistently inconsistent. In addition,  if you weigh a dumbbell  on it, it is usually consistently correct. So apparently this scale is designed to weigh dumbbells and not humans. I know this sounds crazy, again that is why I am calling it the worse scale ever made. The amount of positive reviews are inexplicable. I refer to a different one star review that says the positive reviews are a scam, I completely I agree and suggest you find that review before you purchase this piece of garbage.

review_title: This is the best scale I have owned
review_body: This is the best scale I have owned. Now that being said I think I have owned about 3 with this being my third but it's really a great scale and very accurate. It's super simple to use, you step up onto it and you get a very quick reading! And if you step up again the reading is spot on the same! Solid purchase!

I weigh myself daily and was suspicious when it weighed the exact same weight for 10 days straight, to the ounce.  So then I tried testing it out on different areas of the house (all ceramic tile) and got huge variations in my weight.  Then I took the batteries out and replaced and more variation.  Not accurate at all.

review_title: Not the great deal I thought it was
review_body: I never really paid much attention to paper towels, we just bought them and lived our lives. We use paper towels for day to day wipe ups, window cleaning and occasional spills. Plus they make handy napkins for those impromptu dinners when the dignitaries aren't scheduled to stop by lol.. The Plenty rolls are 52-2 ply sheets per roll @ $19.31 per 24 roll case. I found Brighton rolls elsewhere which are 85-2 ply sheets per roll @ $35.99 for a case of 30. So do the math, Plenty sheets are 11"x10.4" at 52 rolls gives you 540.8 linear inches of sheer wiping power. The Brighton is 11"x8.5" at 85 sheets which equals 722 linear inches. So even though the Brighton sheets are shorter you still get more bang per roll. We never use 100% paper towel absorbancy. The Plenty was costing us $.015 while the Brighton rolls are $.014 per sheet. Not much you would think, but when the average user spools 2-3 towels per wipe up and a single napkin is used 7 days per week x3 meals per person, you can see the savings add up.
