review_body: Nice and thick. I plan to stick to these. I haven't tried to seriously scrub anything with these (the marketing copy says you can) although I did clean the fridge with these the other day. I've bought this brand before in local stores but the thickness was inconsistent. Either I got a counterfeit a few times or maybe I didn't always get "premium" because sometimes they were super thin. This lot from Amazon offers nice quality. If I ever end up trying to scrub something with these, I'll up my review to 5 stars if it works out.

I usually buy a different brand that offers different sizes. When I got this in the mail I wasn't as satisfied because it felt like I was wasting paper towels due to the size of the towels being bigger than what I'm used to. I probably won't get these again and will go back to the other brand I was using. These were on sale so I thought I would check them out. They are OK if you don't mind not having an option to make the sheet size smaller.

It would be great if they could come in select a size in the future but for now scissors work. So this month not only did I stock up for us but surprised my mother and she likes Plenty 2 :-).. Side note first order MIA. So I emailed Amazon they FIXED IT and within 48 hours we had our paper towels & TP Thank you Amazon CSR!

I will definitely be a repeat customer.

review_body: This works as expected and we are very happy with this product. We purchased this for a queen sized bed that our toddler often sleeps in. She is a light sleeper and needed something that would protect the bed and have the look and feel of typical bed sheets. We put this on under the fitted sheet, and you can not even tell it is there! It makes no noise, and you can not feel it under the fitted sheet.  We are 100% satisfied!

review_title: Saves my mattress whenever dogs have accidents!
review_body: The terry cloth cover absorbs any wetness and the waterproof backing prevents it from going through to the mattress. We love this because occasionally ours dogs will have accidents on the bed, yet our mattress still looks and smells brand new! Stains come out easily when washed. It's also great because my boyfriend sweats in his sleep. When we wash our sheets, we take off the cover and wash that too and there's never any sweat stains or musty smells on the mattress! I wash it every other week unless there's been an accident and it's still as effective as day one.

It does it’s job protecting a queen size memory foam mattress from body products. The fit is roomy, it’s easy to put on. Read the washing instructions. My original mattress cover was never exposed to a large quantity of liquid like urine or vomit.

review_title: Soft and really waterproof! Saved our mattress!
review_body: This is a terrific mattress cover. I was so impressed with just how waterproof it is, yet it feels soft! So many of these just feel like plastic and crunch when you lay on them but this has a nice material top and the other “plastic” side feels soft and smooth. My son got sick in the night and this cover absolutely saved his mattress. It washed up beautifully and I even dried it in the dryer (low heat). It was nice and soft and cleaned up so well. I’m getting one for all of our beds!

review_body: I purchased the full sized version of this mattress protector.  I was looking for something that would protect my mattress from spills, dust and my dog's shedding hair.  It appears to be of good quality.  If you're looking for a padded mattress pad, then this probably isn't the item for you.  There is no real padding in it.  It's about the thickness of a nice beach towel and has a terry-cloth texture.  This is exactly what I wanted as the top of my mattress has a nice pillow top on it.  I have a 14 inch deep mattress and it fit with a little room to spare.  I'm a fairly picky person and I haven't noticed any "noise" from this mattress pad.  I'm very happy with this item.

These are the best mattress covers I’ve seen. They work well and are easy to put on the bed. I don’t notice any noise like some protectors make and they don’t breakdown in the laundry like others I’ve had. To top it off, they’re inexpensive compared to lesser quality I’ve seen as well.

It washed and dried beautifully, slid right on the mattress without lots of tugging, has stayed in place -- no wadding up or weird lumps in the night -- and is perfectly comfortable.  In fact, I'm so happy with it, I'm going to buy a second one as soon as I finish this review!

The cover fits well as I did not have any issues with being too saggy or too tight.  I had no problems with washing and drying the cover.  Once on the bed with sheets, I found no issue with the cover making any noise.  I haven't tested the waterproof abilities (and hope I do not have to).

I bought this about 2 months ago.  I. Love. It.  My mother always used a pressure cooker, but the noise  used to drive me crazy.  This is sooo quiet, efficient and easy to use.  Plug and use.  You can saute your aromatics prior to starting the pressure cooker.  You can easily do manual times.  We are vegetarians and I am able to make our ethnic cuisine in minutes using this appliance. There are literally hundreds of recipes online.  I made black beans and garbanzo beans without soaking in less than an hour ( cook and cool down time).  Split beans in less time than that.  I have steamed potatoes, made steel cut oats  as well as apple sauce. I am still trying new recipes.  I even made pasta in a rush before my husband and I went out for the kids. It has the convenience of a slow cooker "dump and forget"  but allows you to do all the cooking in one pot and faster.  Stainless steel interior easy to clean.  Between this appliance and my Vitamix, I am in heaven.  If you like to cook, don't like slaving over a hot stove or oven and often are needing something fast - this is your appliance.

Really disappointed with this. The lid keeps scratching off the paint of the iron silo and its finding its way into the cooking pot and eventually into the food. Seems like every time I turn the lid, little pieces come out. Will be returning mine soon.

review_title: Whole Chicken in 20 Minutes? Sign. Me. Up.
review_body: I got this on the advice of world famous blogger, Nom Nom Paleo. I am quite impressed with this machine.. First, rice. I did a split test on this, comparing rice cooked in the Instant Pot with my stovetop version. I'm not picky about my rice, but I gotta say, the Instant Pot did it better, albeit not much faster, but better and without any fuss or guessing.. Second, yogurt. Can't say I'm super impressed. First attempt was a failure. I kept checking the temperature and found that Instant Pot quit heating at 170 degrees F, 10 degrees below boiling. I don't believe it was quite hot enough. The second attempt was much more successful - instead of using Instant Pot to heat the milk, I used the stovetop and let the milk and starter incubate in the Instant Pot ... for eight hours. Took longer, but whatever. Tastes great.. Pressure cooker. A whole chicken in 20 minutes. What's not to love about that? No, really, what's not to love? My chill is ON at dinner time now.. Steam. It worked. I wish I'd left my frozen veggies in the steamer longer, but we're not strangers to cold food. (Check it: Left over rice, left over chicken, steamed veggies in a bowl topped with a little Trader Joe's Masala in a jar. Good eats.). Haven't tried it with multigrain (wild rice) or slow cooker or porridge, but I'm not worried at all, and I'm getting to it. But first, another 20-minute chicken, please!

review_title: Would give it 5 stars if only...
review_body: I actually love the pressure cooker itself but I am having trouble getting it to lock properly. When I twist the lid shut and input the information for cooking, more times than not, it does not seal and lock. The little silver button that is supposed to pop up to show that it's locked never pops and I end up having to take the lid on and off a couple times before I can get it to work. It always works eventually but slows things down by 15 minutes each time because I have to wait the appropriate preheat time to see if it locks and then tinker with it and then when it finally does lock it has to preheat again then cook. After that it's AMAZING and I'm in love. This has just be an annoyance up till this point but I bought the product so that I could set it on timer while I work and if it doesn't end up locking and cooking on it's own that will not work out for me. I'll update my comments if I can get any answers from the company as to why it is doing this and how it can be addressed.

I was going to give this as a gift to my daughter but after reading all the positive reviews I decided to keep it myself. But while I was reading the manual and recipes that came with the unit, I wasn't so sure I made the right decision. I will be the first to say they are poorly written and not fun to read. I then went online and started searching for recipes for the Instant Pot and saw the fun and incredible things that can be done with it.. I am very familiar with pressure canning. This is something completely different. Pressure canning requires 30-90 minutes to pressure seal a jar and make it safe to store. The instant Pot is measured in a lot less time for cooking an item. White rice in 8 minutes? ( By the way, no one will walk by and lift the lid to see whats cooking...one of my pet peeves when I'm cooking rice.). Everyone on the reviews mentions a "learning curve". They are very correct, but they are fun lessons and easy to catch on.. If you are into making bone broth, this is the perfect tool. Instead of simmering the bones for 12-36 hours on the stove, the Instant Pot does it in 2-3 hours for the most nutritious bone broth. Just pack the Instant pot to the fill line with chicken, beef or any bones (pre cooked or fresh) and fill to the same line with water and a tablespoon of apple cider vinegar. Set on high pressure for 2-3 hours. Very good for healing broken bones or any joint pain.. I now feel good about ordering another one to give to my daughter.

I am having some difficulty with this pot. I want to love it, but it keeps failing me. First, as a slow cooker, I've just about written it off. It never gets hot enough, and even on high for 8-9 hrs, it will not slow cook a chicken for me. In my ancient crockpot (that finally fell apart) it would be falling off the bone in 4-5 hrs. So then I tried pressure cooking more often. My meat doesn't seem to be tender enough, but at least it's cooked. Until today. Today the pot acted like it was working, I heard the thing come up to pressure, but when I went to serve dinner, the chicken was still raw! I don't know why, because the pot came to pressure and started counting down the time, then released the pressure naturally. At a loss. Don't know if I have a dud??

This review is for my Instant Pot IP-DUO60. The IP-DUO60 is a little powerhouse machine. It functions as a pressure cooker, a slow cooker, a steamer, and so much more. This is my first pressure cooker so I wasn’t sure of how easy it would be to use, time settings, and what you can and can’t cook. I have had a hard time writing this review because how much I love it. I can’t decide which is the best features to tell you about. So I will just go with everything I have done so far with it.. Rice is 12 minutes to cook, Veggies are 3-4 to steam from fresh. You can even put frozen chicken in the pressure cooker and it will be ready in roughly 20 min. No more thawing out chicken.. The crock pot function is awesome too. I freezer cook so I can put it in first thing in the morning and I will have dinner ready when I walk through the door. But why is the IP-DUO60 different than a normal crock pot?  You can set it to come on an hour (or more) after you walk out the door and it won’t sit on warm for 2 hours and be overcooked! It will just be finishing up when you get home. (I only do this if it is still totally frozen – NEVER with thawed raw meat). Pros:. • 7 tools in 1 - Pressure Cooker, Slow Cooker, Rice Cooker, Saute/Browning, Yogurt Maker, Steamer & Warmer. • Stainless Steel removable interior pot. • Locking lid with Pressure valve.. Cons:. • At this time, I have not found a con to report. I will come back an update my review accordingly if the need arises.. Final Words:. I have put my crock pot up for special occasions now (things that are too large to go in the Instant Pot). I love the multi functionality of the Instant Pot. You can brown your meat right in the pot before slow cooking. LESS MESS is BEST! I am continuing to use the Instant Pot and learning about everything this machine can do. But what I do know, it will stay with me for a long time!

review_title: cool down time unless you release the pressure
review_body: I am a new user of InstantPot but I have learned a few basics that don't seem to be in the directions. First there is a 4 HOUR default when you pick "Pressure Cook". You have to count down with the "minus" sign to (say) 10 mins. for chicken in chunks. Then it takes 10 mins. to warm up, then it will begin the cook time. There is about a 10 or 15 min. cool down time unless you release the pressure. (I recommend tongs to do this as it spits a little). So "instant" isn't so instant. But if you want that tender pot roast in record time compared to a slow cooker or in the oven for hours, it is great. Also, be sure to use water or other liquid acording to directions which I don't if I am cooking an oven pot roast. I see raves about hard boiled eggs: I get mind done on the stove in less time than it takes the InstantPot to warm up. There is a great Lava Cake recipe on-line and that worked out deliciously. (Not the one in the recipe book which only makes one.) I like it, but it isn't the end all that the reviews say. Maybe I'll post agian after more than 4 usages.

I have had this product for a couple of years now.  When I first got it there weren't many recipes to be found to cook from.  But now!  Recipes are everywhere- facebook, on the website, and on many other sites.  Though my Instapot has many features, I usually just cook under pressure for the 30 minute default time.  Meat always falls off the bone, and seasoning is embedded in the food making everything delicious.  I have used it so much that the stainless steel liner is just now showing scrub marks and one or two tiny pitted places.  The other thing I am happy about with the new revolution in everyone getting one of these? Parts are readily available.  I can order a new liner, a glass lid, a new gasket for the pressure lid..love that.  I like this pressure cooker a bit better than the usual old school ones mostly because I have a steam vent that can be manually operated.  Also, it keeps food on warm when the cycle is finished, and gives you options (many many options) for controlling your process.  When I purchased this I was planning a complete kitchen remodel.  This was the handiest thing during that time.  It is my go-to appliance more often than not, and I still try new things all the time.  Mine has seen hard use for more than 2 years now and is still going strong.  You get a lot of bang for your buck here, and I highly, highly recommend this product to anyone.  From the simplest of recipes like pot roast to the more complicated recipes you will love the one pot convenience, the speedy cook time, and the easy cleanup.  I had researched several of these products before purchasing, and I am very happy with my choice.  Get it!

review_title: I wanted to give it 5 stars, but...
review_body: After almost a year, I can definitively say that this is one of my favorite kitchen electronics. As a mom of 6, I'm very busy and this takes a lot of pressure (no pun intended) off of me at mealtime. I have but one problem with it and that is the fact that it's not a good slow cooker. At all. I have tried it a few times and it has not done a good job. Low is more like warm, medium is very low, and high is more like a smidge above low. I have cooked things all day on high and the meat still isn't tender. The good thing is that it's a pressure cooker, so I just pressure cooker it at that point. But I wish it worked better. I bought this so that I could get rid of my rice cooker and slow cooker. But I wish I had kept my slow cooker now, because sometimes I just want to slow cook things and not have to worry with pressure cooking it too. As a rice cooker it does beautifully. If you are considering getting this appliance, I highly recommend it. But hold on to your slow cooker until you know if you need it. And check out Pinterest for recipes. There are tons out there!

After one week, whether morning or evening, the scale reads my weight as exactly the same, to the tenths of a pound.  This is crazy, given I've been on a 1,500 cal/day diet during that time.  I tested it by putting a bottle of Scope - est. 1 lb - and the scale read 0.0.  Surely seems defective to me.

I'd like to think we got a lemon. We couldn't get a consistent weight no matter where the scale was place or what/who was on it. It would range 1-100lbs different each time. Sent it back and ordered a different brand.

It looks very nice, but it is useless. The measurements are off - by dozens - even hundreds - of pounds - and completely inconsistent. I just took three measurements: 323.6, 273.6, 287.2. I actually weight 215 per my other scale which has been consistent for years.  I will not return it because it is not worth the trouble, but I strongly recommend against this scale. It fails at the one fundamental thing that a scale it supposed to do: weight stuff. Worse than useless - it's trash.

review_title: What a great weight scale for your home!
review_body: I purchased this top of the line scale from Amazon, and was amazed at the fast shipping. The product is everything I could expect or want from a scale. It's stylish, functional, and accurate. I'm confident it will help me attain the goal of dropping those pesky few pounds!. There are no buttons to activate, just step on and it reads your weight in two seconds. The backlit display is convenient too, it has big text and is very readable.. I am happy with this purchase and do reccomend it to anyone interested in buying a home scale.

It’s easy to use, accurate when compared to the Drs office and does not laugh or make any horrid creaking sounds when my fat butt stands on it. Very quick and easy to read also. Price was my largest reason for the purchase and I have not been let down.

I think this is a great scale.  It arrived two days earlier than the set time.  It was easy to setup and works great.  I think it's a quality item, and I would recommend it to anyone wanting a well-built scale.

I've had this for nearly a year and I'm still just as pleased with it as in the beginning.  It's accurate; I've tried weighing myself on different spots on the floor to see and it always comes out the same - my old scale would show different weights.  The low profile is great, as my closet door can open over it, and it continues to look as good as the day I bought it.

I am very impressed with the quality of this product for the price. It is very sturdy and it's nicely made. It came with batteries as well which is very nice.. Easy to use as you just step onto it and it weighs you, no on or off switch which I find very nice. I also like that you don't have to step once on it to activate. Just hop on and check that weight.. Quality and great price. Very pleased

review_title: I bought this scale on Jan 23, 2016. ...
review_body: I bought this scale on Jan 23, 2016. Frustrating since day 1. Here is how it worked: I'd step on it and record the weight. Step off, wait for it to post zero or turn off, step on it again and the weight would be a couple of pounds lower. Reaper the process a third time and the weight would be the same as the second measurement. This was the procedure I had to follow to get a consistent reading. I was planning to return it but never got to it. Today I dropped the scale from about six inches off the floor. It shattered into thousands of little splinters. Oh, yes, it is elegant.

Very nice scale at a decent price. Sleek design and works well.  Easy to read with back lighted numbers.  Weight flashes when stabilized and then stays on long enough to read it.  Especially nice is that it uses standard batteries.

Don't add up what you spend in a year on tissues, toilet paper, and paper towels unless you're willing to become sad over how many trees you've paid to murder.. That said, I was tickled that Amazon finally had a good deal on a subscribe-and-save paper towel. And it's pretty well reviewed.. I can say these are NOT as good as Bounty, but better than all the other brands... for the price of the cheapo store brand. I'm sold!

I have two SafeRest mattress protectors (for a full size futon and a twin) and they've worked out great.. They're basically a soft, rubberized fabric. Unlike plastic or vinyl protectors, it isn't stiff and stretches a little with the fabric. It's quiet when you lay on it and isn't hot to sleep on.  With a bottom sheet over it, you can't even tell it's there.. The fabric side faces up, so I'm glad it's washable if it gets wet. The rubber side faces down to protect the mattress. I haven't washed ours yet, so I can't comment on how well it cleans up.. The sides are made of stretchy fabric that wraps all the way around the bottom of the mattress. It fits very securely and there's enough material down the side to fit a pillow top or an extra mattress pad easily. It also fits slightly irregular size mattresses like my futon.. I was so pleased with the one for my futon that I ordered another for my son's twin size bed. Both have worked out great.

I recently noticed that after 4 years and 2 kids going through accidents that my saferest mattress protector wasn't working as well as it used to.  Even with a great warranty I would expect the material to start to break down after repeated washings.  I called re: the warranty and customer service was excellent.  They are sending a new one out.  For occasional mishaps this should no question last 10+ years.

I opened this and IMMEDIATELY put it back in the package. It looks and feels like one of those compressed kid hand towels you get from the dollar store. It was rough. Not plush. He'll it looked BAD. I'm returning because I do not think this will be comfortable or even work. Spend a little more and get a nicer one.

I have a cat that has separation anxiety. When I am gone very late she will wet my bed. I got this when I got my new mattress and put it on just in case. It does its job very well. The top absorbs the moisture but it didn't get through to the mattress. I recommend this product.

review_title: ... for about 2 weeks now and so far so good. It was better than my previous one
review_body: I've used this for about 2 weeks now and so far so good.  It was better than my previous one, which torn and ripped.  Just hoped that the fabric material extended through the entire sheeting.  The full enclosure would have been great since it would protect and keep the back of the mattress clean.

review_title: comfortable, water proof, feels good next to skin and protects your mattress 100% i would tell anyone to buy this mattress cover
review_body: works very well it is waterproof and it feels great next to your skin. now you do not have to sleep on a plastic mattress cover which is hot, loud, and tears easy. the premium cover is soft, durable, and feels so good to sleep on. i would recommend this to anyone.

review_title: Highly recommend, whether you sleep with pets
review_body: We have small dogs sleep in bed with us, so I purchased this to protect our mattress. Highly recommend, whether you sleep with pets, or not. I use this under a cushy mattress cover...but have used this alone, and it still makes for a great waterproof mattress cover.

I was a little hesitant to order this product! I thought it might be flimsy and not be able to keep up with the daily washings, I am please to say it has held up and the mattress is dry every morning even though the protector is not! I have only had it for a week but so far it has made life easier for me in cleaning up after my sons nightly accidents! It can also hold a surprising amount of liquid with no splash back or dribbles of urine on your feet! It's an awesome product and the shipping was fast and easy!

I waited to review this until I had a chance to see how it held up to a bedwetting/leaking toddler diaper... and the verdict is in: the mattress underneath was DRY despite the large wet spot, drenched sheets, wet blanket, you know.... Sooo relieved and so happy this cover was truly waterproof without being hot or loud. :D

I already have one of these in a queen size on our bed and have been very happy with it. Doesn't make a sound and doesn't smell. I ordered a twin size this week for my son's new mattress. It didn't have much of an odor taking it out of the packaging but I rather there be as least amount of chemicals as possible on my son's bed. So, per the care instructions that it came with, I washed it and put it in the dryer on low. Now my dryer is only 3 years old, and has a heat sensor on it. I've never had a problem with it running too hot. I went to put it on the bed and noticed the plastic type backing had melted together making it impossible to lay flat. I contacted customer support and they have been very easy to work with in resolving my problem. Would order again but I suggest air drying even if it says you can dry it on low.
Received as promised. Viva paper towels are the best!!
Not the best quality. Cheap feeling. Will be changing back to the Up and Up Target brand.

review_title: Not quite what we were used to
review_body: Not quite what we were used to, but they worked well.
Love the feel and durability. Only issue is that they can leave fibers depending on what you are cleaning.
I love this brand and I love even more that they get delivered to my doorstep
These really are the greatest paper towels ever!
My mom couldn't believe how much this was like cloth. No Linton when doing windows.
Only paper towel we use and so nice to have it delivered to our front door.
These rolls may look tiny, but they work so much better than normal paper towls. A little bit goes a long way
The roll clings making it very hard to pull off a sheet.  So annoying.  Threw out half the rolls and would never buy again.

Since I already owned both a pressure cooker and a slow cooker, I was not sure I really needed this. But I was intrigued by the reviews I read and videos I saw. The price was not unreasonable given its versatility so I went for it. I have not been disappointed, and have now given away my pressure cooker and slow cooker, saving space. A big advantage is being able to go from pressure cooking to slow cooking or visa-versa in the same utensil, as well as being able to brown ingredients in the same pot when slow cooking (this usually has to be done in a separate pan on the stove top).  And, when pressure cooking, you don't have to stand around and wait for the gauge to get to the right place and then adjust the heat. This happens automatically, though you still have to take a stab at timing (there's a manual to guide that) to ensure you cook it the way you want. The rice cooker makes wonderful, fluffy rice. I gave my traditional rice cooker away years ago because it took up space and was not any better than what I could do stove-top. This cooker does what it says, and since our family is mostly eating brown rice these days, which takes longer to steam, this pot is a wonderful time-saver.. At some point I may buy an additional liner pot so that I can slow or pressure cook one item and then set it aside as I make another part of the meal such as rice. I already purchased the glass lid that can be used for slow cooking so you can keep an eye on how things are cooking.. This cooker also makes yogurt and can pressure can small jars of food. I have tried neither of these yet but plan to do so at some time in the future.

review_title: Quick Release can cause damage to ceiling and cabinets
review_body: There is a problem with the Instant Pot, and probably all pressure cookers. On a Quick Release, where does the steam go, obviously to the ceiling, or to the cabinets.. The diverters, direct the steam over the floor, where the moisture could land on the floor. Also, there are problems with the diverters.. Instant Pot’s clueless CS, told me that this wasn’t a problem. I told him it was. He sent me 2 links. After I checked the first one, and returned to the on-line chat, the second link was gone.. Is it too much to ask, how to contain the steam, without doing any damage? Maybe a class-action lawsuit, about damaged ceilings and cabinets, will solve the problem.. This is 2018, design a pressure cooker that doesn’t have this problem.. I did make a good black bean soup in the IP.

review_title: ... stroganoff for our first meal and it came out great! The stainless steel pot was easy to clean ...
review_body: My wife and I made beef stroganoff for our first meal and it came out great! The stainless steel pot was easy to clean and they have great links for recipes on their web site. I prefer stainless steel to the non stick coatings because I don't think the non stick surfaces are safe health wise. Did you know you can make cheese cake in a pressure cooker! If you go to the manufactures web page to register your unit it will ask you for the model number and serial number. The model number is on a silver sticker on the side of the unit. The serial number however is on the bottom of the unit on a piece of tape. I only mention this because I had a hard time finding it and I was not able to find the serial number location in the manual. Other than that the instructions are easy to understand and in my opinion there was a lot of thought put into the design of this unit. Overall it was a very positive experience cooking with this unit and I look forward to using it on a regular basis! One other thing. The cover has arrows and a lock and unlock glyph to assist the user in installing and removing the cover. However the glyphs are black on black and not easy to see without the use of a flash light. So I took some white house paint and using a Q-tip just dabbed some white paint on the arrows to make it easier to install the lid and lock it. I also emailed the manufacturer and suggested that they highlight the arrows to make it easier to install the lid and lock it. But overall this is the best pressure cooker I have ever used and am really excited about preparing meals on a regular basis with it!

Have been using it for three weeks now and absolutely love it. I already own stove top pressure cookers and am not new to pressure cooking. I was hesitant to add one more appliance to the already crowded counter space but after seeing all the videos online I decided I could put it to good use. I cook vegetarian Indian food and this works out very well. I use the stackable cooking vessels that I use with my regular pressure cooker in this to make rice and another item at the same time. I invested in the taller steam racks so my rice vessel does not touch whatever is cooking at the bottom. A steamer basket from IKEA makes nice steamed vegetables. The most advantage for me is using a single vessel and not having to clean the stove (I am a moderately messy cook and Indian food helps facilitate that). The inner pot is easy to clean. After 6 months I plan to get the smaller 3 quart one as we are only two people in the house that don't eat much and don't like eating leftovers.

10/10 recommend this unit. I wouldn’t be thriving so well off-campus this semester had it not been for my Instant Pot. Without it, I likely would have never ventured on my own to make the following entrees/sides reliably and with great confidence:. Rice. Beans. Tso’s Chicken. Spaghetti. Mac ‘n cheese. Sloppy joy sandwich meat (contentious item I know). Now the above doesn’t seem like a lot, but coming from someone that previously couldn’t cook to save their life, I’d say I’m not doing that bad for being just 1 month into this school year in which I’m without a meal plan.. Did I mention that I’m saving a butload of $$$ no longer eating out?. Oh, and I can actually cook quite a few more things that I didn’t list above. The list solely included entrees/sides made with the Instant Pot... and I’m looking forward to broadening it, greatly!

review_title: Nice if you are cooking for 1 - 3 people
review_body: Had the 8 qt and found that I really would use a smaller one more.  When the 3 qt came out, I jumped on it.  I do use the 3 qt much more.

In my senior years, I've found a new way to cook.  I'm impressed with this wonderful cooking appliance.  Food not only cooks quickly, it cooks well, deliciously, tenderly and with less effort than the traditional methods of cooking.  Mind you, I love to cook, so I was apprehensive at first.  But, with age, it is a great helper.  I have baked, browned, made rice pudding, cooked 5 lb. pork roasts, stuffed peppers, etc. in this wonderful kitchen appliance.  I highly recommend the Instant Pot 8 qt. 7 in 1 pressure cooker.  We are only two, but I make enough to have left overs for several days and also to freeze a quart of whatever I make to have on a day that I am just too busy.  Or consider the hot, humid days of summer when you are not in the mood to cook.  Pull it out of the freezer...defrost, heat and eat.  I highly recommend the Instant Pot with 10 safety features.

review_title: Faster than fast food that’s good for you
review_body: This is the perfect size for a single person or a couple. I bought the mini along with the ekovana stackable stainless cooker inserts.. The mini is so kiss simple to use that it’s like it reads your mind, but the results turn you into a Michelin chef! I like the ability to either use the preprogrammed options or to use it manually. And the wide variety of things you can cook with this little powerhouse is incredible: aside from the usual type of meals you would expect, you are able to make yogurt, cheesecake, puddings, the list is only limited by your imagination!. And the clean up is so easy! This mini is small and easy to handle for cleaning: it’s not huge or heavy making it difficult to clean. Take out the liner ( stainless steel), hot soapy water - clean up done! Quick wipe down of the unit- done. It’s very easy to clean the seal, so it’s easier to clean up the IPot and liner than scrub out pots and pans. It’s like having a vacation with great food.. Even if you already have an IP or maybe a pressure cooker you need this mini for cooking sides or just for quickly cooking a meal; it’s fastee than fast foods and much healthier for you. There is no downside to this little IP. Happy cooking! 🤗

review_title: Otherwise this thing is amazing and I love it
review_body: BE WARNED!! The rubber ring that seals the pot picks up cooking smells that transfer to your next dish. If you think cumin from a lentil curry ruins pea soup (it does) this product is not for you. Apparently folks get around this hassle by storing the ring in coffee grinds or buying several to change out for dedicated flavor profiles (sweet, savory, etc.). After spending $100 on the unit itself, I'm not really enthusiastic about spending more money on extra rings. Otherwise this thing is amazing and I love it. The company should be upfront about this issue and include extra rings. I have the insurance, but I'm probably going to return within the Amazon acceptable return window. So disappointed in what is otherwise a terrific machine.

When I bought this Instant Pot during the frigid Montana winter, I thought it would come in handy for making comforting soups and stews on busy work nights, but it's become my favorite kitchen tool even during the warmer weather.  This is a quality made product and I am very happy with it.  Some reviewers recommend buying an extra silicone lid seal to use for cooking desserts, as the seal does absorb the fragrance of savory, herbal and garlic seasoned dishes, but I just remove the seal after use and spray it with white vinegar and wait a few minutes before rinsing and it cleans up practically odor free between uses.

review_title: If you want a basic scale that’s a close estimate then this is great, but if you’re looking for precision this is ...
review_body: I purchased this scale in the hopes of getting an accurate weight, but unfortunately this scale does not do that. It always shows weights in the same increments (.2 or .6) and I used an older scale to compare the accuracy. It also shows the same exact weight every day for several days in a row. If you want a basic scale that’s a close estimate then this is great, but if you’re looking for precision this is not. Pretty disappointed with my purchase.

After struggling with getting consistent weights with my home scale, I ordered this product.  First, it looks great.  Well designed, clean lines, and not intrusive in the bath area.  Secondly, it really gives consistent weights every time.  On most scales, if you step off and step on again you get a different weight, with this scale it almost always has given me the same weight again.  Very happy with this purchase and would recommend to others.

I just received this scale today. This scale looks more expensive than it is and that's always a plus. It's sturdy but not overly bulky and sits low to the ground, even allowing for my bathroom door to close over top of it without touching it. That was a must for a small bathroom without a lot of floor space. The blue backlight makes the numbers easy to see, even in a brightly lit space. Previous scales I've used have not turned on immediately when I've stood on them, but this one does. The scale came with the two AAA batteries it requires and you can choose between kg and lb by simply pressing a button on the back. We've already weighed two people and the scale seems to be accurate.

review_title: This scale is great. Nice backlight and unfortunately very accurate
review_body: This scale is great.  Nice backlight and unfortunately very accurate..lol

the first scale I ordered worked well for about a month then the PCB board started malfunctioning causing the scale to turn itself on all throughout the day displaying random numbers. HOWEVER it earned the  four stars from me because customer service went above and beyond to resolve the problem. Once the issue was determined I had a free replacement scale at my door step just days later. They really bent over backward to provide me with exceptional service. Hopeful the first scale was an anomaly and the replacement proves satisfactory. Time will tell.

review_title: A simple weight tracking feature would be nice.
review_body: The product looks high quality, and is pleasantly heavy. The weight reads quickly unlike other electric scales I've used which require you to stand still for a couple seconds before giving a weight. I appreciated the simple and fuss free yet elegant packaging. A simple weight tracking feature would be nice.

This was an excellent product. This scale is very simple and sleek, it also feels like extremely high quality. It responds quickly each time, there is no stepping on it, letting it 'warm up' and then getting back on to actually weight yourself like other scales I've used. You just hop on, and within a couple of seconds you know. Also extremely easy to switch to kg, all you do is press a button on the bottom (the only button on the whole scale, can't miss it).

review_title: Works great and can handle its own
review_body: Scale works great and actually supports my frame. Got one of those Fitbit Aria scales to aide in weight loss, only to find that it did not support my weight. That's where this bad boy comes in. I will be honest I was worried this thing would shatter under my feet when I stepped on it, but it took everything I had to offer. Works great with an accurate reading, along with being better for some of us on the larger side.

This scale wasn't for me. I was able to contact the support team tell them my issue and they gave me 2 options. For me, the scale was just always off numbers, and didn't give me a reliable number. It always switched on me.. It could have been just my order that was like this, but the Support team was totally understandable and was great too me!!! I'm giving it 3 stars, just because of the support team. They couldn't have been nicer and understandable.
I get on and I'm 20 pounds lighter, I get off and get back on and I'm 14 pounds lighter, on and off 3 or 4 times until I get one consistent number. It is just ridiculous.

review_body: Loving these pillow inserts so far; super soft and comfortable (fit perfectly with the 18x18 pillow covers I ordered from Amazon as well).
Comfy!

Not sure where all the 5 star reviews came from. Upon the review recommendations to go up to 18” for a 16” cover I ended up with a rounded accent pillow (not a good look). I ordered 2 inserts and the second one had all the stuffing shoved to the one side. After trying to adjust it so it would be even I ended up poking holes in the almost paper-like covering (I repaired it with white medical tape). I would’ve returned it but made adjustments to them since I needed them for a crochet pillow project. They did come in a timely fashion. I’m going to try and figure out how to flatten them a bit. Any suggestions?  Gave 3 stars because 2 1/2 is not an option.

Product is not 18x18, more like 17.5 or 17x18. Does not fill pillow cases properly, and is just frustrating. Holds shape okay, seems like it'll retain it's shape for a while. Smells odd. Not what I was told I was buying, but will do I suppose.

review_title: I love them, ordering another set
review_body: These are perfect for ambiance. People have commented that the plug is short... cmy sets plug reaches the outlet with no issues. The different modes are great and I am using them now for the holidays but I will keep them up all year and am adding a second set for more twinkle as there are only 13 strands. Also there is an odor that comes from the plastic when you open the box that quickly disappears when you take the lights out and let them air out.  They can be a little work to untangle, also...the strands are tied up for packaging and it's best to leave them tied until you have them hung as mentioned by others....all in all, they are pretty nice for the price. If you want Bright White you should look elsewhere because these are quite soft yellowish.
The lights didn’t work when I opened the packages & plugged them in.. I tried multiple outlets. Definitely test them before you unravel them.
Just get one from Walmart... to hard to untangle

review_title: Fantastic product. Lights are bright but not too bright ...
review_body: Fantastic product. Lights are bright but not too bright and a soft glow. Various settings so they can blink or dim, whatever you fancy.
wife loves them . put them on our back deck . just the right amount of light to sit a talk  and have a drink or to 420 by the stars
Great lights. Beautiful color. 1 suggestion: unravel lights one strand at a time. Don’t undo all zip ties at once.
I got these for my daughters room and she loves them! It gives such a nice boho feel to the room. Great quality and they look like they will last a very long time!

review_body: Perfect length & the magnets hold well! If you're looking for a clear shower liner, this is one!

This shower curtain liner has a pretty hefty and sturdy feel to it and the mildew resistant coating works well for a few months. It's the best one I've tried. There are cheaper options but this stays clean about twice as long.

Does the job.  Easily cleans off and non porous slick surface doesn't retain soaps and such.  No goo means no growth of the yuck.. Priced right and easy install.  The "cloth" or surface type liners provide opportunity for growth of the yuck....this one doesn't.

review_body: Good weight to it without the chemical smell. Has been building some calcium drops from hard water but still clear and can see through.

review_body: So far so good, but I wish it came in an XL length, we have high ceilings and I would rather have an 84 in shower curtain.
The fiber is pretty soft, and it works well as a cleaning element, I'd recommend this product.

They work great and I really like them. The one problem is that you can't dry them in the dryer (thus, my reason for 4 stars, instead of 5). However, I usually only wash 2-3 cloths at a time, so I just lay them across the top of the dryer and that works perfectly.
I still prefer old cotton t-shirts to polish my car. A good buy though. They will all be used.

review_body: Ordered a ton of these years ago. Holding up very well. I use them as Swiffer pads and then wash them. Works well for dust and light mopping.

Despite the tags telling me to wash on delicate and dry on low, I washed normal and dried normal.  They shrunk about half of their size and attracted a bunch of pills from other stuff. But they do the trick. Good enough!. Only drawback is there collect a lot of dog hair in the drier. So much so that I'm now trying to wash them separately.

review_body: Was expecting them to be as heavy as the ones from Sam's Club but they aren't.  Are okay but wouldn't buy again.

Had never owned one of these it’s amazing. I don’t dread and wrinkled item anymore. Thank you!

This product was small but not overly small as if I was trapped in some tiny world that was inevitably frustrating. Functionally small. Further, I was able to complete 2-3 shirts front and back per fill. As far as folks having the product spit water everywhere, I am an idiot and did not have this problem. I suggest using distilled water and not actually filling the tank over the maximum line (there is a sticker on the product reminding you of this). Place the nozzle close enough to the shirt (or pants, or whatever - I'm not judging) until you hear an appreciable hiss. Then you may proceed to remove large and entirely unwanted wrinkles from your clothes (or whatever, again). Perhaps you could consider the hissing sound like that of a medium sized snake encouraging you in your entirely adult efforts to not look like you are homeless. Choose your own adventure. I liked it.
Doesn’t hold much water and easily can leave white marks on your clothes even when you don’t fill the steamer all the way
DO NOT BUY. Works until the (short) return period is over then starts squirting scorching hot water everywhere.
Absolutely horrible, squirts white all over your clothes. Would not recommend to anyone. Very dissapointed.

review_title: This machine is well made and works wonderfully! It heats quickly and is strong enough to ...

review_body: My husband uses for his suits & shirts everyday and for his travels. Starts very fast and is so efficient that we ordered a 2nd one for home.

review_title: Wasted money I saved on them by using them to ...
review_body: Everything under these rolls of paper towels got extremely dusty.  Not so with name brand paper towels.  Wasted money I saved on them by using them to damp wipe canisters, coffee makers, etc., every day.

review_title: Durable. They dont rip! Great for price!
review_body: These are great paper towels! Durable AND you get 24 rolls for $23 as opposed to bountys 12 rolls for $27! These have lasted my family 3 months (and thats only because i use a lot of paper towels) buy them! They're really strong, they don't rip and last a long time. A++

These paper towels are great quality. They are strong enough for everyday use. I was skeptical buying them without being able to feel them or see them first. But, having dogs and cats in the house I always need a paper towel for something and these are always handy especially with the subscribe and save because it seemed i was always running out when I needed some. I live far from the store so running out for more isn't always an option. Have received these at least 4 times now and compared to other brands the quality exceeds the price which i am also happy with!

review_title: I've gotten a couple of these now and really love them. It is a great deal on paper ...
review_body: I've gotten a couple of these now and really love them.  It is a great deal on paper towels and lasts quite a while.  It doesn't absorb quite as well as the brand name, but is still very thick and durable.

review_title: Great product but roll are not as fat as Costco
review_body: Funny, the price is right but the rolls are small, way smaller than costco. Still a good deal that I did not have to wait in Costco line. I will buy again and will probably laugh again when we open the box and see the skinny rolls.

review_title: When another brand says “70% more” and you wonder what ...
review_body: When another brand says “70% more” and you wonder what company actually sells tiny rolls that are 70% smaller than everything else on the shelf...... these are those rolls.  Itty bitty and not worth saving the few cents a roll to get so much less.  How dissatisfied do you need to be to write a review for paper towels?

review_title: Nothing special but gets the job done

We've had the same holder for 6 years and this is the only one that we had problems with. The other thing is that I think I've gotten used to being able to tear just a half a sheet. For the price though, they get the job done.

review_title: Beautifully made, fits a 9" high Queen mattress
review_body: This product is everything it states it is!  Beautifully made, fits a 9" high Queen mattress, easily.  Most important for me, is that it's  breathable!  I have a first generation memory foam/latex mattress which I love but it makes you sweat, even in the winter here in New York;  purchased the SafeRest as a replacement for a very cheap and over-washed mattress cover.  Also have allergies, and have the added benefit of the protection against dust mites and bacteria.  Highly recommend for its quality, features, and price!

review_title: Feels and sounds close to regular fabric.
review_body: I like that although it is waterproof, it doesn't have a plastic or crinkly feel or sound. It feels close to regular fabric. I would have preferred the whole mattress being encased, but I understand for some this would present difficulties, such as when wanting to wash it. All said though I would buy again.

I was a little wary to get this for my partner and I as I saw most of the reviewers were buying this mattress protector for children, but once I got the mattress protector on our queen bed and under the fitted mattress sheet, I was really impressed. Zero plastic sound whatsoever, and no noticeable change in the feel of our mattress. My partner sleeps hot and tends to sweat especially during summer months, and I feel confident that this mattress protector is going to protect our mattress from him, haha! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a waterproof mattress protector that doesn't add any heat or additional padding.

I bought the King size about a year ago and it has held up great so I ordered a Queen size for a guest room. It is completely waterproof as advertised, we have spilled drinks a couple of times already and nothing seeped through the protector.

Very nice and has been tested with a cat accident, cat decided to pee on the bed and soaked through the sheets and covered quickly to this bed cover. I was worried too since it covered a new memory foam mattress and liquids can be a pain to get out of those mattresses. The cover cleaned nicely and no issues.

review_title: I am satisfied with the product
review_body: Arrived on time and boxed. A review said that this product was bought by people who had Temperpedic mattresses, so I bought. Yes, I am satisfied with the product. The only thing was it took forever to dry in the dryer due to the terry liner. No problem, success.

The mattress cover is not padded and as a result, our new mattress feels like it did in the store--wonderful. So many mattress covers are thickly padded and not meant to be used on a hybrid mattress with memory foam. There was a slight smell when I first opened the package, but after the recommended washing followed by air drying, it was fine. The elastic sides are generous and fit our 15" deep mattress perfectly. I have only used the cover for a week, but it is well made and I anticipate it will be useful for many years.

review_title: I've owned this for a week and I enjoy that it doesn't affect the original comfyness of the ...
review_body: I've owned this for a week and I enjoy that it doesn't affect the original comfyness of the mattress. It is not crinkly and it fits well. The material is a towelish material but you can't feel that with the sheet over it. I haven't exactly done anything wet in my bed, like spill soup or had my cat pee on it, so I can't attest to the waterproofness. I originally bought it so sweaty people don't turn my new mattress yellow bc that's gross.

Much better than the last mattress protector I had (which was twice the price). I can barely tell it's there. I haven't tested the waterproof aspect, but I think enough people have tested that I can feel confident. I would purchase another (and I maybe will!).

review_body: This is the difference between a nice mattress or one with piss stains from kids. It’s one thing to wake up in the middle of the night with someone peeing on you but when it’s on your cal king that you can’t easily clean - kiss the rest of your nights sleep goodbye

review_title: I’m not usually picky when it comes to paper towels and was sooo excited to get these because I used to love how soft and absorbent they were
review_body: Absolutely awful. I’m not usually picky when it comes to paper towels and was sooo excited to get these because I used to love how soft and absorbent they were. These are nothing close to soft and very thin. Extremely disappointed especially since I ordered in bulk!

review_title: I can set it and walk away, low maintenance!!
review_body: I am used to cooking with pressure cooker and never had an electric pressure cooker and never thought of getting one as I didn't care to understand the difference between both versions. Then my cousin told me he bought one of these and really likes it. So I was willing to give it a try and ordered a 3 quart version. Got delivered this afternoon and made dinner - mint rice pilaf - same recipe o use in the pressure cooker. In fact the rice cooked in the instapot turned out much better than the regular one I make using my pressure cooker on the stove. The 3 quart size is big enough for us and I am planning on trying various recipes soon.. The main thing I like about it is, I can set the setting and walk away and don't have to check on it multiple times or don't have to turn the stove off. Perfect to set it up and go for a shower and come and my food is ready. Happy so far and I am sure I will use it a lot.. I also paid $4 extra and got the warranty not sure it is helpful but thought I will get it anyways.. Now I need to search for more vegetarian recipes online and start cooking.

I bought this thinking it would save me a lot of trouble and room in the kitchen due to its many supposed functions but it's caused a lot more trouble than anything else.. First: note that you can use this to cook rice, but you have to use the pressure cook setting and rice does not come out as good as in a rice cooker.. Also note that this is NOT autosensing. You would think that the different buttons for "beans" or "soup" actually do different things, but they don't.. In fact, you will actually either burn your food or undercook it.. The temperature of the slow cooker for example, does not get high enough, even on the "high" setting. I've tried to use the setting to cook things for 6-10 hours and have been left with barely heated through food. (Trust me, I'm not doing anything wrong).. Actually, this whole thing doesn't work. Any recipe I follow specifically mentioning the instant pot burns the bottom or comes out wrong in some way. Mine doesn't seem defective; it just seems like a really crappy product for the price you pay. Save yourself the money and stay far away from the instant pot!!

I eagerl looked forward to receiving my Instant Pot.  I have now decide to "bite the bullet" and take the loss and buy a different one.  First, the instruction book that came with it had recipes for mouth-watering family favorites like TURNIP CAKE.  Seriously?  And, despite the buttons on the front for different kinds of foods, every recipe's instructions were for MANUAL settings and were quite involved.  I don't know about other people, but my point in buying is to accomplish a healthy meal easily and simply.  So I watched for recipe books to come out, and finally they started being released.  But guess what.  Their recipes were for MANUAL settings.  Really?  Are those buttons just decorative adornments?  So I contacted Customer Service about a refund and explained what I had encountered.  Their attitude could be summed as "Tough luck, sucka!"  They did not offer any information about the buttons.  I woud have chosen fewer stars but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt as a technologically correct product.  Just not why I buy a modern pressure cooker.

review_title: Not because there was something wrong but because this little appliance is soooooo amazing. I initially ordered this for a famil
review_body: This will be my 3rd Instant Pot order!  Not because there was something wrong but because this little appliance is soooooo amazing.  I initially ordered this for a family Christmas present a couple years ago as the price was severely cut and I thought it would make a nice rice cooker at least.  One of those spontaneous buys that turned out to be surprisingly GREAT!  The first thing we made with it was a soup and I cannot express enough how amazing the flavor was (as if it were cooking all day on slow but only took less than an hour).....I then moved on to throwing any and everything in the pot and again it created magic soup!  One day, we were depleted of food in the house and all I had was a bag of asparagus, broccoli, butternut squash and a severely hungry stomach so I threw the veggies in with a few seasonings/olive oil and to my surprise, probably one of the best soups (they are all great) we've made in the pot.  We have also made lots of rice in the pot and our kids prefer this rice over stove cooking and it does seem to be much moister (I'm grain free).  So, the following Christmas, I gifted this to my mother-in-law who is older now and has pretty serious diabetes - She loves it!  This year, I gifted the pot to my sister who has a very limited budget, little time being a single parent working long hours.....she too has now become an Instant Pot fan (and she has an impressive culinary background).  This is just the most amazing appliance ever!. Pros:. Pre-programmable buttons for different dishes. Very little time to make delicious foods. Compact enough to store in most cabinets. Cons:. I really don't have any but cleaning the lid (rubber rings) however this is to be expected with 'any' appliance, cooking tools.

I didn't know much about the instant pot when I purchased it, but I saw it half price on Amazon and decided to take a chance. Not only do I feel like I got a steal, but I do think that I would've been just as pleased had I payed full price. I'm very frugal, so to me, that says a lot about the quality and usefulness of this product. I use it a couple times a week, thanks to the myriad of free recipes on food blogs. I've also adapted some of my favorite recipes to cook in it. It's a wonderful luxury item and a worthy investment to those who try to cook all of their meals at home. It's sturdy as heck (I think it weighs like 15 lbs, no joke -- better start lifting weights! :) and has a cute jingle when you turn it on. I'm a huge fan.

I have not used all the features of this unit simply because the lid is a terrible addition to this otherwise good cooking device. It does not latch easily and the when you are attempting to latch  it will ping warning sound until you semi get it right. The outer covering on the unit  comes off easily until the unit is stripped off its cover.  So disappointed and I don't think it can last in this condition.

Okay, so I had been looking at this item for the past few months, but wasn't certain if I really needed it.  Until it went on sale!  Then, I had no excuse not to buy one.  I used it for the first time today.  It's incredibly easy to use, just read the directions and you're all set.  The only issue that I had is that it makes no noise. After I put my pork roast in the instant pot, I set the timer and stared at it for a few minutes, waiting.  There was no noise and the outside of the pot was at room temperature, so I assumed that it was not working.  I checked on it several times that hour and it remained quiet and cool to the touch.  When the time indicator reached zero, I let it cool down...and my pork roast was perfect!  This is my newest favorite kitchen gadget.

review_title: This is a very easy product to use
review_body: There are so many reviews for the Instant Pot, I didn't know anything about pressure cooking so I'm reviewing from that stand point.  I did think that the directions were a little overwhelming and confusing, when really they could have been much more simple.  This is a very easy product to use.. Mine came with the lid seal in place and the only thing I had to assemble was the little water condensation catcher...I don't even remember where that went?  After that, it was more important to read the recipes and the difference between quick release and slow release. My advice is to find a good youtube tutorial if you are having trouble.  I've seen on some FB pages people really screwing up there food... I'm not really sure how that happens. Just follow the directions.  Whole chicken is so easy, 3 -4 pound chicken, season, add 1 cup water or broth, then set for 25 min on manual, and walk away. You let it slow release, it's amazingly easy.  Try the poached eggs!. I still have a lot to experiment with, but so far, this thing is awesome. Loving it.

review_title: I get hungry just looking at the photo :) Great machine.
review_body: While I don't use this product myself my girlfriend absolutely loves it. She was on a "pressure cooker binge" for a few months after she got it and everything we ate came out of it. It is still working strong but we have started to eat out more. The pulled pork and chicken she made in this thing came out amazing. She has cooked rice and used it in "keep warm" mode for the cheese for a party we had. This thing is pretty cool. You just set it and forget it. I could even use it if she didn't cook. It has a few musical sounds that indicate the status of the cooker, like when it is done and when it is set. I hear these sounds and get hungry haha. Overall this was a GREAT purchase and so much better than any stove top pressure cooker. It is fully automatic.

review_title: Best way to make bone broth
review_body: This is the new trend amongst my friends and I'm hooked now too.  I mainly use it for bone broth.. Here are my notes on how to make it.. Set it to Manual >  240 min (4 hours). Timer  0:10. High pressure. Beef. Use joints & bones & ankle & trim / cheap cuts of meat - gives it flavor. It's called fond.. Put in the bones.. Fill it with cold water to cover bones. Don't fill it up all the way.. Add a little vinegar. Makes the water acidic. It leeches the minerals out of the bone.. Don't use salt it because the liquid will evaporate.. Chicken. Use chicken backs & knuckle bones. My friend had a good idea and searched InstantPot barley soup recipes for good recipes on how to make it.

Disappointed that this didn't even last a year.. Update: increased my rating as these guys refunded me more than a year later for this product. Good customer experience.

review_title: I am surprised that this junk has such good reviews and i became a target of them unfortunately
review_body: I am surprised that this junk has such good reviews and i became a target of them unfortunately. I have always used the traditional weighing scale but I don't know what struck me that I choose to buy this crap! It is such a moody machine, it gives us a different reading every time we use it, can't keep track of our weights anymore. I wish I could return it but it is an another painful process I don't wanna go through.
I bought this as a replacement for our old bathroom scale and I am very pleased with it.  I even weighed a new rifle and scope on it to check the weight and it was as advertised.

I especially like the convenience of the battery replacement.  My previous Weight Watchers scale used 3 AAA batteries, the third one being buried. under the screwed-down main cover.  The fact that it had corroded, made it impossible to remove to replace.

review_title: Love it.  The best scale I've tried so  far
review_body: I tried 2 of the "EatSmart" scales and found them to be erratic.Generally weighing 2 pounds or more heavy.  I confirmed this by weighing myself on 2 different beam type scales....... One at my Doctors office, and one at a Hospital health club, immediately after weighing on the "Eat Smart" scale.. This scale is much more accurate, has a smaller footprint, and in my opinion looks better, and is more sleek.  Further, the readings are more constant.

This product worked fine, but like most bathroom scales...I kept it in the bathroom.  One accidental knock against the wall and it shattered into a bunch of glass pieces everywhere.  I would save your money and get something more sturdy.

This scale is incredibly consistent. The first time I used this I intentionally weighed myself five times in a row expecting to have to "average" the results together. Not necessary as every reading was exactly the same down to the 10th of a pound. I continue to be impressed by how consistent the results are. I'm confident that this is highly accurate and trust the results that it gives me.

review_title: Cheap....But sometimes you get what you pay for.
review_body: If you buy this pack to use on a vehicle, make sure your vehicle is one of these colors. I have never seen a microfiber cloth that sheds as much as these do (fortunately I have a white car).. I think 10 cloths of decent quality would have been much better for my situation (use 3-4 to dry car, 1-2 to apply wax).. If they weren't so cheap I would have returned them, but it was honestly not worth the effort.

review_title: They had great reviews on amazon
review_body: Oh...my....gosh!  Where have these been all my life!?!  I'm saddened by the years of wet wipes I've been buying including the financial and environmental toll I've paid.  I was skeptical about how clean they'd get my surfaces, so I did some research.  They had great reviews on amazon, but I had to delve deeper.  I googled how well microfiber cleans bacteria and saw studies that said after a bacterial swab test of surfaces cleaned with traditional cleaner and cloth vs. microfiber the results were nearly identical.  Sold!  Worth a shot.  At $10 for 24 I can have a little basket in the kitchen and each bathroom.  Just wet, wipe, toss into laundry!  And the faucets and surfaces squeak and shine.  I use them in the kitchen and bathroom.  I reserve the yellow ones for the toilet seat.  I use a Lysol wipe for the obvious stuff (teenage boys, you know what I mean...), but if its not too bad, I'll go over with a wet microfiber.  If done daily cleaning is a snap!  Literally seconds.  And I hate to clean.  I usually wait til things are obviously in need of a go over, but since getting these cloths I actually look for things to wet and wipe.  Just did the inside of my microwave (zapped a little dish of water and lemon juice for a few minutes) then wiped out with the microfiber cloths.  I was having so much fun I did the outside of my fridge as well. And no, I have no affiliation with the cloths, lol.  I'm not paid to sell, I just couldn't be happier.

review_body: These are great. I normally by Up&Up brand, but these are a nice alternative. I hate select-a-size towels, and it seems Amazon only offers brand name towels in the select-a-size under S&S. The price point on these plus the full size sheets sold me!

review_body: Amount of bags for this price is unbeatable! Great bags AND they even have this slight nice smell to them as if they were slightly Gain scented? Anyway, definitely worth the bucks.

review_body: Great deal on excellent trash bags. Much better than the bargain bags you can buy. I always keep a stock of theses in the house.
I LOVE THESE GARBAGE BAGS. it's a magical experience. I love placing all my fresh garbage into one of these puppies. Sometimes I'll dance around it in joy after I get to use them. Woo hoo!

review_title: Just what you always wanted but were afraid to ask for! Ginormous paper towel rolls!
review_body: I wish they'd stop making "giant plus" rolls and just make giant rolls. How do they expect them to fit in all the towel holders on the market? Do they make a "giant plus" paper towel holder? If so, why don't they sell them with these ginormous paper towels? Hmm?
These are perfect for my (3 adults, 3 kids, 2 big dogs, 5 cats, 2 birds and a bunny! Lots of cleaning jobs and these stand up to almost all of them!
Product got here and all the rolls looked dirty. I canceled all other orders.

These paper towels are incredibly absorbent! I was shocked to find I only needed 1 roll for each deceased and dismembered animal that our cats bring us. You have no idea how hard it is to get baby rabbit blood off the floor until you are doing it at 12am pretty much in the dark. I only had to use two sheets to pick up the remaining body parts! These will make your floor SPARKLE!

review_title: It's like using toilet paper to wipe up spills
review_body: I didn't think it was possible to feel so strongly about paper towels. These are too thin. It's like using toilet paper to wipe up spills. They break apart when they get wet. They don't tear on the perforations. There is nothing about them that I like.

review_title: Excellent price vs. Brand name towels
review_body: These paper towels are an excellent alternative to the big brand names that cost so much money and go up in price yearly.. The select-a-size is a bit smaller than Bounty, but appears to be the same thickness. There is also a bit less embossing. Not that embossing adds any cleaning benefit anyways.. They clean just as well as the big brand names but at a much better price point. We try to get out paper towels for under $1 per roll.. With 3 rescue mutts we need a decent paper towel that won't break the bank. Sparkle gets our approval. More money for doggie treats!
Very pleased...Will probably set up a subscription to order again...
i ordered 2 cases and one case was short 4 rolls

review_title: Takes over an hour for water to filter
review_body: Takes FOREVER to filter! Tried both filters and they honestly take over an hour to filter through the full reservoir. Switched over to Pur Brand and I’m much happier, Pur also filters lead with their Max Ion filters. I don’t write many negative reviews, and take no pleasure in doing so, but this deserves it.
Item as described. Arrived on time. Replacement filters for my pitcher.
It did the job but it took SO long to filter water.
These work great in my old Brita pitcher

So I have been using this one versus the 30 day filter for about a week.  It takes forever for the water to filter!  Yesterday I timed it....took almost 30 min to get a full pitcher because it just dribbles..  I will probably have to toss it and purchase another 30 day.

review_title: I'm not sure these do any good what so ever
review_body: I'm not sure these do any good what so ever. I notice no different in taste or water quality. When I fill my pitcher, the water just runs right through at a rapid rate. I think I am wasting hard-earned money.
Love brita have been using them for years

I am very disappointed with these filters. I've had regular Brita filters for over a decade then bought one of these to reduce frequency of replacement but both of the filter that came in this order filter as an incredibly slow pace (~2 glasses of water filtered overnight) and often never full filter the reservoir.. Stick to the regular filters.
work great and lot cheaper
Works as advertised.  I also find that these filters don't have as many issues with the beads coming out or leaking of carbon (though I still prewash and dump flowthrough).
They are super soft for hands and faces, but also super absorbent and don't soak through very quickly. I have ditched my store bought paper towels and switched to using Presto! exclusively.

review_title: Very pleased at how absorbent and strong these were

will buy again great value

When we were ordering mattresses on Amazon, it was so nice to be able to go ahead & order waterproof mattress pads.  The price was awesome & I loved the fact that they were made in the USA!  I can't speak to the waterproof factor yet because we haven't had any spills or accidents in the short time we've used them.  However, we loved the soft fabric & the fact that there is no plastic, crinkly sound like you get when you buy a waterproof pad.  The reviews on this product were great, so I feel confident that they will protect our mattresses in the event of an accident.  I loved the fact that I didn't have to shop around at several stores.  It was so easy to be able to order from Amazon, get free shipping & a great product at a great price!

I couldn't find a Cal-king mattress protector anywhere in the stores. I went to amazon and found this SafeRest product. I have had the mattress pad for about 3 weeks. i have washed it once and it seemed to wash very well. I was hesitant at first because the price was very low compared to others I thought there must be a catch. It is thin but that is what I wanted. It does not feel like I have a mattress protector, doesn't crinkle or anything like some of the ones with plastic do. I just got it so i cannot say how well it will hold up to multiple waashings but so far so good, I was very impressed. Fit perfect!

review_title: Now all my beds are covered with this great product. The first one I bought is 3 ...
review_body: I just bought my 4th SafeRest Premium Mattress Cover. Now all my beds are covered with this great product. The first one I bought is 3 years old, it can be machine washed and dried over and over and still looks like new. I have a child who has huge accidents on occasion, and her mattress has never gotten wet. I like that it's not bulky like some mattress pads which take up a lot of room in the washer, and it is not noisy to lay on. No one in my family has complained that this mattress cover makes them feel hot.

Excellent mattress protector and completely waterproof,  as advertised. My not-yet-nighttime-potty-trained toddler put it to the ultimate test the first night on the bed and I'm pleased to report that our mattress survived the deluge dry as the desert. I was worried that this protector would rustle loudly as you move or trap body heat and leave you sweaty, but it does neither. All in all,  it's a great value.

Got a new mattress and figured it was a good idea to protect our investment. Got this protector which works great.. The sheet is fitted, not an entire enclosure - I don't think this this would protect you against bed bugs, but it wasn't made for that.. My main concern was that it would have that crinkley vinyl sound every time I moved on it. The top fabric is actually a nice velvety material and once I have a regular sheet on top of this protector, I don't hear a thing. The queen size fit perfectly on our queen mattress.

review_title: protects AND keeps me cool at night
review_body: Amazingly, I put this on my brand new mattress, and the very next day, my lovely child threw up in the bed.  I threw it in the wash with the sheets, and you cannot even tell, the mattress is in impeccable condition, and even though I washed this cover and sheets in super hot water, no shrinking, it's perfect.. The mattress itself is a temperpedic style and tends to heat up when you sleep.  With this on there, I don't even notice, it must help breathe, it's amazing.  THANK YOU for protecting my mattress, and my lovely child is feeling better, although a little sad he threw up in the bed.

review_title: SafeBest Premium Mattress Protector is great
review_body: Just as advertised. Easy to put on our new mattress, can't tell it's there. Great so far. Affordable as well. Mattress has a warranty that is not valid unless one uses a protector so this was a good value and less than ones sold at the mattress store.

I have a 6 & a 4 year old who are being weened off their pull ups. I was a bit apprehensive at first but decided to buy a couple of mattress covers to help with 'accidents'.. The cover was tested the second day they were fitted. They worked great with zero moisture penetrating the mattress. The cover has a nice felt like top layer which absorbs some of the moisture but underneath that is a plasticized layer that is impermeable.. I reccomend washing the cover after it gets visibly soiled or noticeably smells. It is easy to wash and gently dry along with the sheets and soiled pajamas.. I am really enjoying my purchase and highly reccomend the covers.

Simple fitted king size mattress protector went on without any fuss.. The plastic material will ensure no liquid can reach the mattress, and will keep your mattress protected for a very long time.  Be careful on cleaning, our last one was destroyed in the dryer over a few cleanings, not sure what brand it was.  Once the plastic coating starts to peel or flake off replace with a new one as it can no longer protect your mattress underneath.. Great value on this one.

I bought this mattress cover to help my mattress last longer and keep it from getting filled with dust mites etc.  I have another similar one, but I wanted a second one so I can make the bed with clean sheets while the washer is running with the dirty sheets.  So far, I like this one equally as well as my original one.  It is soft and does not make noise.  It easily covers my mattress which is about 11 inches deep.  The sides stretch a little to accommodate a variety of mattress thicknesses.  I have not tested the waterproof claim, but it probably is.
softer and stretchier than most other paper towels.
Soft and strong paper towels. I love them
Love these! Best for cleaning up messy toddler spills!
great value!  look forward to this package showing up!
