review_title: Really liked the other style better
review_body: Have been receiving the select-a-size for a while.  Really liked the other style better.
I HOPE I AM ABOUT DONE, IT'S TAKEN OVER 1/2 HOUR TO DO EACH ONE OF THESE, BUT LOVE THESE, THEY SOAK UP AND ARE GREAT FOR GREASE TOO.
The best paper towel on the market.
Softest, toughest paper towels available. This bulk buy is amazing.

I have had my Instant Pot for about 6 months.  I use it every single week. Sometimes I use it more than once per day. Yesterday I used it to make hard boiled eggs. Though I used to make eggs on the stove top, they are easy to make in the Instant Pot and they peel SO easily. After the eggs were done, I rinsed the pot and made potatoes.  I quartered red potatoes and cooked them on sauté with some herbs, beef broth,  and cocout oil.  I added some peeled carrots, cut in half.  I then cooked them on high pressure for 9 minutes.  They came out delicious and were such a welcome addition to our meal.  My children said they were their most favorite potatoes I've ever made.. Some of my favorite recipes for the Instant Pot include herbed chicken,  one pot pasta in meat sauce, and chili.  There are lots of recipes for chicken, beef, fish, and beans in healthy sauces that you can find on the Internet.  My favorite recipes were collected from various Facebook groups for Instant Pot users.. I was slightly intimidated when the Instant Pot first arrived, but I've since become adept at following recipes and even creating my own.  I've taken my Instant Pot foods to potlucks and received rave reviews.  I feel like being adventurous is easy with the Instant Pot and I've definitely tried many new things.  All were good,  most were great, and most were healthy.. I haven't cooked any desserts or yogurt in the Instant Pot, but I know that's something people use it for often.  I am planning to buy the new, larger, Instant Pot, and keep two.

review_title: Don't hesitate - get this now - you'll be glad you did!
review_body: Oh my gosh - do I adore this!! I have every kitchen gadget imaginable - so I hesitated on getting yet another kitchen toy. I have to say how incredibly happy I am that I did. This is the most amazing kitchen product I've ever used (apologies to my other beloved appliances that have been moved aside). Even my husband has decided to start using it too because he's seen me have so much fun with it - and has thoroughly enjoyed the delicious food I've been making.  I wasn't sure what size to buy - 6 qt or 8 qt - as there are only 2 of us to cook for. It's the perfect size. The 6 qt makes about 4 good sized servings. I've tried at least 5 of the 7 functions (still have to cook eggs and rice, jury is out on yoghurt at the moment). The best dish so far has been Pho. Never would I have ever tried making Pho - but it is fabulous using this pot (look up Instant Pot Faux Pho on the internet). I did buy extra gaskets at others recommendations. This looks to be a pretty sturdy piece of equipment for the home kitchen, but it isn't commercial grade (the outer jacket would have to be much sturdier).  I imagine this could very well be the only cooking appliance needed in a tiny home, camping trailer or other small kitchen.  I'm doing most of my cooking in this pot alone now.  I can't wait to try out some of the desserts - like the cheesecake - and some of the breads next. Have fun with your purchase. You'll be happier and healthier incorporating it into your culinary life.

I love this thing.  I wasn't sure, and I was afraid it was going to be a gimmicky thing I used 3 times and had to find a storage location for. I don't know how I lived without it.  Within a 2 hour period, I made vegetable stock (from frozen vegetable pieces), used the broth to cook black beans and then used the rest of the broth to make brown rice pilaf--for all of these, it took longer to measure the ingredients than it took me to push buttons.  Steel cut oats turn out perfectly, we braised some smoked chicken in about 20 minutes for perfect pulled chicken, and I love love LOVE the yogurt function.  My crockpots are going into the closet for use when I go to potlucks.

review_title: I gotta say this has been the best thing to come out of this household disaster
review_body: I purchased this because we had a foundation slab leak and cooking on my stove/oven was going to be very inconvenient until the repair/renovation on the downstairs was complete. I thought I might still be able to cook upstairs with this and decided to give it a shot. I gotta say this has been the best thing to come out of this household disaster. This one appliance makes it possible to do a one-pot meal even with recipes requiring browning, sauteeing, simmering, and pressure cooking. I received it only 3 days ago and prepared 2 meals with it. Both were ridiculously delicious and tasted as if I'd spent hours cooking. The UI couldn't be any easier and there are a lot of electric pressure cooker cookbooks out there for newbies like myself. I was thrilled to see my subscription to Kindle Unlimited gave me access to at least 10 of them. I'm now regretting my previous purchase of a crockpot a few months ago as this appliance will do that job, too. Tonight I made the best mushroom pot roast I've ever served. The appliance seared and browned the chuck roast beautifully, sauteed the onions, garlic and mushroom like a champ, and cooked the tough meat and potatoes liked I'd spent hours on it. No knife was needed as the meat and potatoes were fork-tender with 90 minutes of cooking. I was able to make an amazing gravy with the cooking liquid by removing the meat and potatoes and adding a corn starch/water slurry. I put the meat, potatoes, and gravy aside and then sauteed a pound of mushrooms in the pot, reducing the liquid and getting a nice browning on them. I put the meat/potatoes/gravy back in with the sauteed mushrooms and simmered for a few minutes. The results were incredible. I'm seriously in love with this electric pressure cooker.

review_title: Best Kitchen Appliance Ever-- while it lasts.
review_body: UPDATED 8/2017 I've dropped this 5 star rating to 2. It is a PHENOMENAL product. BUT IT DOESN'T LAST! I've come to totally rely on this appliance as much as my old rice cooker, steamer, and crockpot combined. Each of those lasts 5-15 years. This lasted me TWO. Not okay with this.. I have recommended this pot to numerous others, and just bought one for my mother-in-law getting ready to serve a mission. You seriously could get away with having this tool as your only cooking option for your kitchen. I wish I'd had it during our remodel!  I seriously do not need my old crockpot or pressure cooker, and only rarely use my old rice cooker/steamer anymore; pretty much only when I'm already using this guy for something I'm wanting to serve over rice. I take it camping and it's come in so handy for days when we're exhausted and just don't want to wait for hot coals to eat. I'm planning to see if I can just boil water in it on the sautee setting for making dehydrated meals this year. I can't imagine it wouldn't work perfectly for that. I could also just bring whole rolled oats and make hot cereal using the "porridge" function, too.. PROS. I LOVE that the lid locks on (no more spills in the car when transporting food! Hooray!). Love the carrying handle. Stainless steel pot makes cleanup SO easy. You can even use those metal scrubbers on it for tough burnt-on food... not that I ever burn my food.... 7 tools in 1. SO versatile it's crazy.. Saute feature is fantastic for browning meat before slow cooking, but also means you can make fried rice/rice pilafs in here. Or evaporate off any extra liquid from your dish at the end of cooking. Or brown your pulled pork at the end for that nice BBQ feel. Love it!. Seal/vent feature on the lid means you can lock in moisture for pressure cooking/slow-cooking something you don't want to dry out, OR you can open it up and let the liquids evaporate as you slow cook if it's turning out a bit too wet.. I love the timer function. You can put in your frozen ingredients in the morning, set the timer to start cooking in the afternoon, and have dinner done by the time you come home. Trust me, it's worth your time to read the user manual!. Pressure cooking ability means frozen meat isn't a deal breaker at dinner time. Throw it in anyway, it will be done in an hour or less (depending on what you're making). So awesome.. You can easily switch from one setting to another. Slow cook your dinner and find it's dinner time & not done? Pressure cook it the rest of the way. Pressure cooked meal turn out too moist? Turn it on saute and let the liquid evaporate out.. CONS. It only lasts a year or two. Something with a beautiful stainless steel pot, great quality exterior, shouldn't be disposable! I've had mine going on two years and it just stopped working. No warning, just dead. I've emailed the company but I've had many other friends with the same issue and they say there's a reason the warranty is only one year.

review_title: An extremely worthwhile addition to your kitchen!
review_body: Though we've had a 12qt stovetop pressure cooker for years, I was always terrified of using it because I was convinced I'd mess up and cause an explosion. While the Instant Pot has significantly less volume, we picked one up because it allows me to assist with making meals without worrying as much. It's been a fantastic item to have around for making stocks, quick meals, and even soft boiled eggs (which I love because I hate making them the standard way -- just use the IP's steam function for 2-3 minutes!).. Since the Instant Pot operates at a slightly lower PSI than stovetop pressure cookers, it does require increasing the cooking time slightly to compensate. Thankfully tons of recipes are readily available online that have been adjusted to appropriate cooking times for this device if you don't feel confident about modifying the times yourself.. That said, we compared our Duo v2 against our friend's Duo v1 after noticing it seemed like it took a bit to come to pressure and that it was running out of water when making meals unlike with our friend's unit. There are a couple physical differences like the cord and trivet, and they performed at different cooking speeds. We placed into each four eggs straight from the fridge in the accompanying trivet along with a cup of water and set them to steam for two minutes. The v1 got to pressure 31 seconds faster and ultimately finished 45 seconds before the v2. After cooling the eggs in ice baths for about 10 minutes, the results were close enough though the eggs from our v2 were slightly more cooked than the v1.. I don't know if this is just our unit or a difference between the v1 and the v2 models, but I would still recommend the Instant Pot for quick, easy, and delicious meals.

I am so glad I purchased this for myself as an early Christmas present. I cook dinner 6 nights a week and I easily use it twice a week. I've never owned a pressure cooker before, but I was in the market for a slow cooker, so I felt this was a solid purchase to make. We've cooked a variety of items in the pressure cooker, such as corned beef, short ribs, pork ribs, chili, bone broth, all of which came out wonderful (I highly recommend making short ribs). It was so nice to be able to brown my meats in the same pan that I use for the pressure/slow cooker. The slow cooker works great; I've never owned a slow cooker that had a timer that not only counts down and will switch to warm when done, but it'll also tell me how long it's been keeping the food warm inside. My husband uses it all the time to make rice (brown and jasmine). The only function we haven't gotten around to using in the 6 months we've owned it is the yogurt function, mostly because I've never made my own yogurt and I mostly use the Instant Pot for dinner. The vessel is easy to clean and guests always inquire about it as it sits on my counter top (it stands fairly tall imo).  The photo attached is what's in the slow cooker right now - a 4lb bone-in portion of pork shoulder.

review_title: Just go ahead and pull the trigger on this one, you wont be sorry.
review_body: I have a friend that is constantly talking about how great a pressure cooking is, I was skeptical... I stand corrected, I love this thing... best kitchen gadget I have bought in years.. The one function that got me to pull the trigger on this was the yogurt function, that was the first thing I made in it and have done a second batch since.. both turned out great.  A gallon of yogurt for the price of a gallon of milk... cant beat it. (This thing will pay for itself.). I can make an entire gallon of yogurt at one time with WAY less mess and hassle than the way I did it before.. I am one of those folks that always tosses the veg and meat trimmings into the freezer, then once I cant fit anything else Ill break out the giant stock pot and make a large batch of stock and freeze it into bags.. By the time all is said and done its a 24 hour process and there it a good deal of cleanup, since getting the pressure cooker I have simplified the process.... as soon as I have enough bits and pieces of veg and chicken or whatever.... to make a batch in the Ipot... in it all goes & 30 min on high pressure from frozen... and amazing stock, the much smaller batches make for much easier cleanup and the quality is soooo there.. Made some of the best pork ragu ever in 30 min instead of 3 hours. When it comes to meats, depending on what you make its a one or 2 step process. Cheaper cuts cook to fork tender in a few min compared to the 3 hours it takes the collegian to break down when going low and slow. If you want browning most of the time its going to take some oven/broiler time, but honestly who cares.. I'm in.. A couple of minor bad bits... you have to (like most pressure cookers) occasionally change the silicone seal... however good luck finding one. I did contact the manufacturer before buying this & they said they will be available again in about 6 weeks (from time of writing). Sometimes the pressure indicator sticks in the up position, but its not that big a deal. The unit should turn off after it scalds for the yogurt function rather than go to warm. I would of preferred an 8qt option rather than 6.. but its adequate.. If you are one of those that whines about stainless over non-stick, keep moving, nothing to see here... there are other brands available, for the ease of browning in SS over NS, I dont mind a soak in the sink on the rare occasion it needs it.. None of these things add up to much, the big tell for me is, would I buy it again? Absolutely! Just go ahead and pull the trigger on this one, you wont be sorry.

review_title: Nice unit and the perfect size for two people.
review_body: So far as I have only used this product only a couple of times, it has been a very good product.  I really like the 2 quart size, for small meals.  It takes a few seconds to get use to the setup, the instructions are not totally clear on all the so called programming.  Easy to clean also.

This might honestly be the best purchase I've made in a long time.. Since buying this pressure cooker, (I think 1-2 weeks ago, tops), I have made everything from chicken wings, pulled pork sandwhiches, pot roast, beef short rib, 2 kinds of chicken drumsticks and chicken soup!. That is a ton of food that I would normally not try because of low laborious the process is so laborious but this machine makes everything so easy. I'm cooking faster, more frequently and with way less clean-up.. Couple of things to note:. 1. Sometimes it takes a bit of wiggling around to get the lid on. Which would be fine, except it makes an annoying chiming sound everytime.. 2. It takes about 10-15 minutes to come up to high pressure and about 20-25 minutes for Natural Release.. 3. From my expereince, the cook times are about 1 minute too high. I just adjust to achieve maximum tenderness.. 4. I wish that I had 2 of these bad boys for the side dishes but it's easy to cook the sides while the machine works on the main course.. If you're new to pressure cooking, I'd recommend getting a cook book to go along with this. I purchased Bob Warden's Slow Food Fast - it's great but a bit simple. If you're looking for something slightly more intricate, I've heard good things about Miss Vickie's Big Book of Pressure Cooking (not sure if that's the exact title).. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend.
WE ARE VERY HAPPY WITH THE PRODUCT! AS NOT SURE HOW IT WOULD  BE SINCE THE PRICE SEEMED LOW -- GREAT PRICE AND A GREAT SCALE!! * ok - MAYBE THE NUMBERS ARE TOO HONEST / HA HA!

We liked this product at first and we've had it for only a month then my husband went to pull it out, it just tapped the side of the wall, and completely shattered. He wasn't standing on it (thankfully) and it did tap the wall but with hardly any force at all. We were so shocked. It was an accurate scale but that was really crazy and a bit frightening. Maybe we got a faulty one? I dunno. But please be careful.

Great quality. I wish we would have found Etekcity years ago. This scale holds a lot of weigh with no fear of cracking.. Easy to clean. My wife loves the ability to wipe off the glass with no problems.. Easy to use. My children like to check their weight and they are 9 and 7. Anyone can use this scale.. No assembly and no hassle. Open box, put in batteries, and it works great.

review_title: Very accurate and simple to use
review_body: I have another digital scale that is starting to malfunction. I’ve compared this new scale to my prior digital scale and at our doctors. The weight is exact and I trust it.

review_title: The scale itself is excellent and reading appears quickly and is stable.  This is all I expected out of a scale.
review_body: One suggestion - if you want to keep it in a carpeted bedroom, go to Home Depot or Lowes or Orchard Supply or whatever and ask for a scrap piece of wood to set the scale on rather than dragging into the bathroom to get an accurate reading.. The scale itself is excellent and reading appears quickly and is stable.  This is all I expected out of a scale. No complaints. It works. Easily readable display. Good price compared to others.

I bought this since it had some decent reviews. But now that I have been using it for awhile, I still have not been able to get it to be really consistent. When I step off and let it reset then step on again, the number changes within 6 lbs. depending on what part of the scale I stand on. I'm about 180s so I don't think I broke it, but its making it tough to track my actual weight gain and loss. Honestly, I got what I paid for so I am somewhat happy in that regard. If you want a consistent and highly accurate scale, I would suggest looking for a step up.

review_title: Great Looks - Easy to Use - Accurate
review_body: Nice slim and lightweight design.  This complements my bathroom decor, though perhaps options for different colors or see-through might be a good ordering option.  Large and bright backlit display showing the numbers, easy to read - a real plus in either a lit or dark room as the numbers show up very well with the blue backlit display.. Simple setup, take out of the box insert the batteries, use. This is pretty much all the easy to read and fully illustrated user documentation that comes with it has as well - some suggestions for proper use and details on three error codes that could be displayed are in the instruction document as well.  One instruction says to be sure and install the batteries in the correct polarity direction and this is my one negative observation - the markings for which way the batteries go in are very small and on the edge / lip of the compartment, not on the bottom of each battery area.  I am talking REAL small indicators. The direction is not shown in the instruction diagram either.  For reference or those without really good eyes, and perhaps 'obvious' is the negative, or flat side of the battery goes against the spring..  If you want to change the reading to kilos, the button on the back (clearly marked) is pressed to change back and forth from Lbs. to Kilo - defaulted to Lbs. for me.. Although this is slim and lightweight it is not fragile, I had no fear of just stepping right up onto it.  I have read several reviews indicating inaccurate readings when used several times.  For me this has not occurred or been noticed, I stepped on, noted my weight (which matched my doctors office calibrated scale), stepped off and then my wife stepped on it, again the weight shown matched the calibrated scale at the doctors office.  A few hours later I stepped on the scale again, same weight as noted before.

review_title: Nice looking, well functioning and I appreciate it uses ...

review_title: If you use it properly, this scale is 100% accurate.
review_body: I've been reading some of these other reviews and I suspect the users are not using the scale properly.  If you just stand on it and read the numbers, and then step off and zero it and step back on, it's quite likely you'll get slightly different weights.  The same thing happens with the 550 lb. medical quality digital scale in the office where I work.  On the other hand, if you stand on it and stay motionless for a few seconds until it stabilizes and the display begins to blink, you can step off and it retains the weight on the display, THAT is the correct, accurate weight.  If you zero it and repeat the process, you'll get exactly the same weight, time after time.  After reading some of these reviews I just did that, 5 times in a row, and got the same weight 5 times in a row, right down to the decimal place.. The scale looks modern and the lighted blue display is easy to read.  The price is right, what more could you want?  If you use it the way it was designed, on a hard surface like a tile bathroom floor, and if you give it time to stabilize and lock in the reading, you'll see that it's perfectly accurate.

review_title: Smaller sheets are convenient for lots of household uses
review_body: I buy this brand and also the Scott Pick-A-Size, and they're both pretty good. The Sparkle sheets are very slightly smaller and seem a little thicker than Scott's, but not enough to matter. Both brands are absorbent and tear cleanly off the roll. The small size sheet suits our needs well---drying hands, wiping small spills, acting as a napkin, covering food in the microwave, etc.. I usually consider paper towels a good value when I can get them for less than a buck a roll. Select-a-size paper towels are often more expensive than standard sheets, I keep these on Subscribe & Save---a bargain!

review_title: Comparable to Brawny in a size that's big, but not too big
review_body: We are not all that picky when it comes to paper towels, so long as they get the job done. And for the everyday messes that my family makes, these Sparkle paper towels work just fine. Right before trying out Sparkle, I had been using a similarly-sized roll of Brawny.  I took a moment to do a couple of basic tests. To me, these towels are basically identical, except I will say that Brawny felt a little bit more substantial. I would never have noticed unless I was doing a side by side comparison, but I do believe that Brawny is the slightest bit thicker. That said, as far as cleaning up a test spill of water on the countertop, both performed comparably well.  No complaints at all.. I tried the "Just White" version, though Sparkle also comes in prints and colors for those who like their paper towels a bit fancier. I'm fine with "just white," which, of course, still had the "thirst pockets" texture that I have come to expect from virtually all brands of paper towels.  The box I received contained a total of twenty-four "Giant+" rolls, each providing a total of 107 two-ply sheets. These twenty-four rolls came in twin packs, nicely packaged in a box within a box. None of the rolls were crushed or affected in any way, which is great considering how large the box was that arrived on my doorstep.. I am not entirely sure what constitutes "Giant+," but these measured up to my Brawny XL, which is also helpfully pick-a-size.  Most importantly, despite being "giant," this roll fit with no problem at all on my old wooden rack under the counter, which sometimes has trouble with the super-mega-huge rolls.  I guess "giant" is big but not too big, at least for us.  All in all, I would not hesitate to recommend the Sparkle brand. While on an incredibly nitpicky scale I would say that Brawny has a slight advantage based on my unscientific comparison, both performed equally well when it really mattered.  Recommended.

review_title: Not very substantial savings from Bounty
review_body: These paper towels did not turnout to be as useful as I thought.  They did not do a very good job protecting my hands from cleaning chemicals.  They were not very absorbent in spills. They were mostly useful as dinner napkins, but I am not likely to keep two rolls of paper towels on the counter for one general use.. Using paper towels for most cleaning uses around my house tends to protect me from flus and other uncouth diseases that come home from schools.  I am a long time fan of Bounty paper towels.  I especially like the select-a-size rolls and will always bring those home, or rather order them.  But we go through a lot of paper towels, maybe a case of 18 or 24 a month.  I have always preferred paper towels for most cleaning jobs and general uses around the house, especially the emergency sneezing attack cloth.  The cost gets pretty high.  But it pays off in the hygienic sense.. I had looked at these a few times in the store and considered them.  Maybe as dinner napkins (because we are napkin heathens most of the time), maybe for floor spills.  How could the paper towel matter with with of those uses?  A lot of paper towels get wasted.  It turns out that the napkin is fine, though e.v.e.r.y. single person at the table noticed it and m.e.n.t.i.o.n.e.d. it.  LOL.  But for the floor or spill use, these are not at all useful.  By time you get enough of them on the spill, half the roll is gone.. These were not really good for cleaning for me.  I use Lysol and spray bleach cleaners and like to not have to worry about my hands.  This paper towel just didn't cut it for cleaning either.

review_title: 12 packs of 2, good basic paper-towels with large rolls made to discourage waste, good performance for most tasks
review_body: These are pretty basic but they are practical, and often a good frugal choice. They are 2-ply, embossed with a circular motif that adds to their ability to absorb and stay durable, and solid white. Each sheet is right at 7 inches long which allows one to tear off whoever much they think they will need without much waste.. They aren't particularly soft when dry, but they soften up a bit when wet. That bit of rough texture makes them clean a counter or stovetop well, but other brands, like Viva, are better should you have to quickly stop some bleeding, dry some tears or wipe a little face.. The rolls are fairly big - I don't know that I would call them giant but they are about as big as will fit on some paper towel holders that are close to a One roll is enough for my 3 person family but use can really vary by what you do with them. I drain foods, clean up anything yucky, clean my fridge, occasionally dry a glass or a dish, and occasionally grab one for a napkin.. This comes as a big box that is very heavy.  It was too heavy for me, I had to have help with it.  The GP box is appropriate for storage, or you can take individual packs out to store.  (The GP container IS very thin corrugated cardboard that's against some regulations though.)  It has individually wrapped packs of 2 inside.

review_title: More Economical Helps Us Be More Eco Friendly
review_body: I’m really glad to have had the opportunity to try Sparkle Paper Towels and intend to keep getting them. We order as much as possible using Amazon’s Subscribe and Save service. The paper towels we’ve been ordering are thicker and feel softer, but I realize that they don’t necessarily absorb more than these Sparkle Paper Towels. The only real difference that I’ve been able to ascertain is when it comes to heavy scrubbing. The Sparkle towel breaks up sooner. However, since we’ve been attempting to behave in a more conscientious manner, more “green,” we’ve been using less paper products overall. For anything that requires scrubbing, we try to grab one of the many stashed dishcloths bought just for that purpose. For us, it’s a plus that these Sparkle towels don’t stand up as well as more expensive paper towels. It can only help reinforce getting into the more eco-friendly dishcloth habit. For the price difference and considering the (much fewer) uses we have for paper products, Sparkle Paper Towels are our best option.

For years I have bought the Bounty Big Rolls because I like their texture and I like the fact that they are so large and last longer. The only problem with them is that they don't fit well on a paper towel holder that mounts sideways on a counter - they're best on the standalone holders where you just slip them on top of the vertical bar.. These towels don't have that problem; they are also larger than the standard roll yet the still fit on the horizontal counter holders.. I also found them remarkably durable since I have usually found brands other than Bounty can tear apart easily or not absorb enough. That is not the issue with these.. The only reason for not getting 5 stars is that they are not quite as soft texture-wise as the Bounty. If that is something that matters to you, then take that into account.

review_title: Good quality, but a bit stiff
review_body: These towels do a great job of holding up, absorbing liquid spills and being easy to tear off just the right amount you need.  They do well when cleaning countertops, or even cleaning up a messy spill without falling apart like so many cheaper paper towels do.  The only complain I have with them is they are a bit on the rough side -- they aren't quite as soft as I have become used to with Bounty towels.. Another thing to note, they claim to be "Giant Plus" rolls, but I would call these a jumbo roll at best - again, I've seen the Bounty Giant Rolls and they have much more sheets on them than these do.  Though it seems everyone nowadays is playing pretty loose with the size moniker, so just be aware!. Overall, a good deal for towels that will get the job done - just a bit on the scratchy side!

review_title: Filters extremely slowly after about a month
review_body: I purchased 3 of these filters.  They are supposed to last 6 months.  After about a month they begin to filter extremely slowly.  It takes many hours to filter each fill.  Basically they become unusable.  Other customers have reported the same problem.

Our family has used Brita water filters for a long time, and with good reason. We're lucky to live in a city that has excellent tap water, but it's those trace amounts of unseen things (chlorine, heavy metals, etc.) that can be worrisome. This Brita Longlast pitcher replacement filter is good for 120 gallons, which translates to six months of use for the average family. It blocks out 99 percent of lead and now even more contaminants such as cadmium, mercury, and other pollutants that seep into groundwater.. Those who have used these filters  know that they're easy to install and take out. This one has a "pull top cap" that makes it particularly simple to push in or pull out as needed. More technical aspects of the filter include "activated carbon" that reduces the taste and odor of chlorine; adsorbents to reduce lead; and a "fibrous matrix" that prevents those black flecks that can show up in some water filters. Interestingly, the filter keeps in some fluoride, which is known to promote healthy teeth. The unhealthy aspects of fluoride in water has been noted over the years.. Brita is conscious about the environment. The company's filters are BPA free and (unbeknown to me until now) offers a way to recycle its filters, which people can learn about at brita.com/recycling. As noted on the box, using just one of these filters can save 900 water bottles.. For the heck of it, me and another family member did a water taste test, drinking both tap water and water that was purified through a Brita filter. The filtered water had no taste that I could discern, whereas the tap water had a slight taste that was only noticeable after several swallows. I would think people who live in an area where the water is much worse than ours would really benefit from these filters.. Lastly, this filter came with three stickers that help users know when to change the filter via a reset button on the pitcher. Our pitcher doesn't have this feature, but I'm sure the stickers are useful to those who have one.

One word - AMAZING!  We are so impressed with the Instant Pot 8qt.  My wife and I agree that the Instant Pot is absolutely one of the best kitchen gadgets/appliances we have purchased!  It is so quick and easy to use.  Love the fact that you can pretty much make your entire meal in one pot (sauté, brown, fry, etc.).  Add the ingredients and use the presets or manual controls.  Your food/meats will come out so tender, juicy and flavorful.  We have been telling everyone about the Instant Pot!  If you are debating on purchasing one - DO IT!  You will not regret it.  We have even been recommending the 5qt and 6qt Instant Pot to our single friends.

I am a farily experienced IP user and got the mini for side dishes and daily cooking for a household of 2.  It is perfect for us, and takes up less counter space than my 6 quart.  Perfect to make 1/2 gallon of yogurt, which I do weekly.  Using the IP does require a bit of learning but so worth it in the end.

When it works, it worked okay. The problem we have been having with it is that the lid doesn't seem to seal correctly and the pressure won't build up. I can fool around and lift and push the lid down and sometimes the pressure indicator will pop up. I have to hold the lid in this position until the pressure builds up enough to hold it up and in place. Once that happened, the food inside cooks properly. If that doesn't happen, the chicken doesn’t thaw, the roast doesn't cook, the rice never gets done, etc. We have had the unit since early 2015 but my wife almost always did all the cooking with it and she would complain off and on about its lack of functionality. I started cooking more lately and wanted to utilize this on most meals because it is supposed to make life simpler. That's when I notice the flaw and inconsistencies with the lid sealing. I cleaned the lid, the rubber seal; I boiled water to see if the stream would clean something out but to no avail, I can't get it to work properly. The unit isn't that old or has it been used every single day, I would think that the last thing we have done is worn it out. I think it is defective, at least the lid. I wished it did work, like I said, when it does pressure up, it cooks the heck out of the food, makes things very tender and delicious. I won't recommend this brand again but I would recommend pressure cooking.

review_title: This is like the microwave invention for our generation......
review_body: I was born and raised in Pennsylvania where we have quite a few crockpots recipes, first one I did in this was ham and string beans which only took 30 minutes to cook and tasted just like I had it in a crockpot for hours.  Today I did the traditional pork and sauerkraut for new years and I used the sautée to brown the pork then cooked it with kraut for 60 minutes.  All I can say is wow.... didn't need a knife to cut the pork, just comes apart and tastes like it cooked for hours.  I am looking forward to more meals in the future in this thing, would highly recommend to anyone.  I will be buying this as presents for family and friends, something they will be thanking me for for years to come.

So far I am very happy with this pot.  Very easy to use, very good, detailed instruction book.  Have found answers to all of my questions, so far, in this manual. Glad I finally made the purchase.  Love the saute feature so I don’t have to get another pan dirty.  Haven’t used the slow cook feature yet, but I’m sure it will work well as every other feature has so far.  I am single so this pot is perfect for me to make a meal plus a couple extra servings to freeze or have another day.  Should be great for a 2-3 person family.. Update 4/16/18:  not impressed with the slow cooker feature at all.  Low barely has the food warm after 2-1/2 hours.  Made chili using hi and my ip is not taking the temp to the 210 degrees the book states.  Otherwise, still love the cooker.  Saute is so convenient before pressure cooking.

review_title: Great purchase! Has held up well over the year and I would recommend it to anyone.
review_body: I purchased this several months to a year ago I am not sure exactly when. Since I could not get the 6-quart version at the time or there was a several week waiting list, I went with the 8-quart version. I am a single person and still I feel that the 8-quart is just fine for me. I'm glad to have the extra capacity if needed. So far I do not feel at all that I have gone wrong with this purchase. Also on the popular social media site that most of you probably spend a lot of time in every day there are more than one group of support. Lots of good recipes and I especially enjoy the Wendy's copycat chili recipe myself. I have made that several times over the year and it is great every time. If you want to make it extra-special look around and see if you can find some of that McCormick's Smokey barbecue flavor Chilli seasoning stuff in a bag. It's hard to find so you usually just have to go with the regular but it's a real treat if you find it.

I purchased the older model without the yogurt setting and was disappointed so I gave that one to my daughter and purchased this one to replace it. I use it constantly! Beans, rice, soups but mostly yogurt! I am vegan and vegan yogurt is very expensive. With this I can make my own. It's fresher and is as easy as pie. I just set it up and forget it. I have made yogurt in my dehydrator before and while that works this is SO much better. Now that I have my several batches, I am using the previous batch to make the next and the flavor just keeps getting better and better, tangy and delicious! Making chilies or soups with beans just requires a plan in the morning (I like to soak the beans a bit). I love the versatility of this device, far better and more flexible than a crock pot. You can saute your onions, garlic, whatever, add the rest of your ingredients set it and in less than 30 minutes you are sitting down to a hot meal. Such a great item for us procrastinators!

review_title: The 8 quart is a _LARGE_ device, be warned ...
review_body: The 8 quart is a _LARGE_ device, be warned.  If I was to re-purchase this, I might get the 6 quart.  That being said, if you are looking to make a lot of yogurt/soup/rice/beans, this is absolutely ideal.  I have had no problems making smaller amounts of these in it yet.. I'm on a budget, so originally this was quite an expensive purchase, but since now I can make beans from totally dry in a bag to ready to eat in an hour or so, I've saved a ton of money on food.

I ordered this Instant Pot DUO 7 in 1 after reading a lot of reviews and hearing from others how they like theirs.  I was as concerned as others thinking of the thought of a pressure cooker and how it could "blow up"....rest assured it won't!!  They are not the pressure cooker your mother or grandmother had.  There are so many safety features built into it  It isn't only a pressure cooker but it is a slow cooker, rice cooker, there is a bean setting, one for soup, one for meats, for poultry,  steamer, yogurt maker, porridge, multigrain,  etc.  It preserves and seals in the nutrients that you want to keep in your food.. Hands down....the greatest kitchen appliance ever!  I received this 2 days ago and cooked a stew from start to finish in under an hour, an almost 8 lb. turkey breast this morning in 1/2 hour and a full rack of meat falling off the bone ribs tonight in 30 minutes and also made my own turkey stock from the turkey this morning.  It is phenomenal!  It allows you to cook a healthy meal in a minimal amount of time.  Who would have thought turkey could cook in 1/2 hour?  You can even make cheesecakes in it that taste better than if you cooked them in the oven.  Want hard boiled eggs?  Put them in there and steam them.  Steamed vegetables take no time at all also.. It is a very sleek stainless steel design with black appliance with digital readings and buttons for all the functions.  The inner pot is stainless steel with a reinforced bottom that heats the food faster.  Cleanup is a breeze with the pot.. I would suggest when you buy it to buy an extra silicone ring just to have on hand.

I'll start out by saying the 8QT instant pot was better than I expected. Unlike some reviews, I found the controls very easy to use. The unit was packaged very well and arrived in perfect condition. Unpacking was also very easy. After washing the bowl and doing the initial water test I jumped right in an made a vegetable soup for the maiden voyage. I used the soup setting for a Tuscan Vegetable soup, it was warmed up and under pressure in about 6 minutes. The cook time was 30 minutes and an instant release was used. The vegetables were perfectly cooked. Cleanup was very easy. I dove right into a pork tenderloin. Using the saute feature I browned the pork and then 2 onions. Using the manual setting for 15 minutes, and then a 10 minute release and 5 minute rest, the pork was absolutely tender. Once of the tastiest tenderloins I have had. The cleanup was again very easy. I am well pleased with my purchase and plan on using this for batch vegetables, soups and roasts for multiple days. Great purchase, better than expected.

Great weight scale that will hopefully help me keep track of my weight and shed some pounds this new year after my other scale disappeared.. Having previously used analog weight scales and 1 not so good digital scale, I really like the feature where it will calculate my weight and blink and hold the number so I can see it clearly and remember it.. Only had it for a few days but it's working great so far.

review_title: Backlight started dimming, but I still consider this a quality product!
review_body: I would totally give this 5 stars, except for one reason: the backlight started being dim after only a few uses. The scale works wonderfully, but the backlight dimming has made it harder to read. It wasn't doing this at first, so I'm not sure why it is now.

review_title: I’ll bet I weigh less in Australia.
review_body: Yeah it works... a little too good. Apparently, I’m fat and it has no problem letting me every morning. Seriously the 200.02 sucks because I keep weighing myself every time I go pee to see if I’m 199.8. The thing is, pee doesn’t weigh very much. Don’t the Brits weigh in Stones? I’d like to see how many stones I weigh.

review_title: Not accurate or reliable, weight fluctuates wildly
review_body: I'm surprised this has so many positive reviews, this scale is neither reliable nor accurate. In a single night, it's told me my weight fluctuates by several pounds in either direction, and I have no idea which weight (if any) is correct. A minute ago it told me I'm now four pounds heavier than I was an hour ago, and I can assure you that hasn't actually been happening in real life, I would have noticed. Sad because it looks nice, but is totally useless. I'll be returning this.

review_title: Slight margin of error between scales
review_body: Moderately accurate scale. I compared two and they seem to differ by about 0.5lbs. Also, they seem fragile as one came chipped on the side and the ragged edge actually cut me. Consecutive weights are consistent, just the measure between scales differed slightly. Overall it's a nice looking scale that works, but you should just keep in mind a +/- 0.5lb margin of error.

review_title: Started behaving erratically after 6 months, warranty worthless as no one ever responds to claims.
review_body: Worked fine for about 6 months, then started behaving erratically.  Sent a warranty claim 1/10/2018, then a followup on 1/23/2018.  Nothing.  No response to either.  Warranty is worthless.. Update:  Etekcity contacted me and is sending a replacement.

review_title: Fast, reliable, and turns on when you stand on it instead of having to tap it on.
review_body: Fast and reliable. Unlike other scales, if I step off and on a few times in a row, it'll continue to show the same weight which leans itself to its reliability.  I just wish there was a faster way to switch from pounds to kg instead of having to press a button on the back of the scale.  It's also nice that it turns on and measures weight as soon as you stand on it instead of having to tap it to turn it on.

Received the scale in a timely manner.  Quite attractive, works great.  Easy to adjust if needed.  Was impressed it came with a battery.  Highly recommend this item for anyone needing a digital scale.

Don't be fooled by the 5 star reviews like I did.. Very inaccurate..totally different number every time I step on it..by lbs.. it's off by 20 to 40 pounds. Tried troubleshooting and still is giving me wrong and different numbers every time. Will be returning.

review_title: This scale is just perfect, we didn't need a "smart" scale
review_body: This scale is just perfect, we didn't need a "smart" scale, so for this price point and the functions required it was a great fit.  Looks to be well built and stylish.  Wife and I love it!!

review_body: They weren’t tangled when I got them & they work exactly like they are supposed too. But the flashing mode in my opinion is way to fast & kind of annoying. It’s like an impending seizure.

These are beautiful, exactly what I expected. They come with the ability to change the rate they flash with the push of a button. I put them on my wall, could be used to hang in many places. Great product!
Used these in my classroom’s decoration for beginning of the year!  The kids loved them!  I like the variety of twinkles!

review_title: These lights are great! I used these to decorate reading nooks 2 ...
review_body: These lights are great! I used these to decorate reading nooks 2 rooms and add the perfect amount of whimsy to the spaces. The different light settings are fun also.

review_body: Really like them.  I put them in my bedroom window.

daughter loves the light.s. easy to use and put up

review_title: I've had this liner for a while now and it ...
review_body: I've had this liner for a while now and it hasn't gotten mildew-y or have any other issues most curtain liners usually have.  The only thing I've noticed that is wrong is that the metal grommets have started to rust which isn't a huge deal, but shower curtains get wet and I would have assumed there would be some sort of protection against the rust on this.
Basic shower curtain.  Has no smell.  Good price.
Awesome curtains etc...thanks!

review_title: Works well and after having it up for about 5 ...
review_body: Works well and after having it up for about 5 months I don't see any signs of Mildew at all. Solid purchase for a cheap shower liner.
Very thick.. . Good quality

The cat and I love this shower curtain. He likes to sit between the inner and outer shower curtains and watch. I love it because it keeps clean and I can watch the cat. Silly reasons, but good enough for me.
Great curtain liner

review_title: but still in great condition. Totally recommended
review_body: I owe them for six months no. W and they have a tough use every week, but still in great condition. Totally recommended.

review_title: Doing a good job on household cleaing
review_body: One Word, Cheap.. Cheap on price, Cheap on quality, it is what it is. Disposable solution.. Doing a good job on household cleaing, no complain.. Observation from after a few wash:Looks like it can hold up better than what it advertised.
Good quality. Although, would replace the white color with darker one. Probably will buy again.

I love using microfiber cloths for cleaning eyeglasses and other delicate surfaces.  I bought this large packet to use as stocking stuffers, a couple in each stocking.  They were very popular.  Wash and dry, but I don't use fabric softener.  Probably could, but I don't want a residue on them.
Perfect car wash & wax towels, whether you wash them or throw them away after, they're great quality, no streaks or scratches. Will certainly buy this again.

review_title: The ones I got were 90/10 and pretty linty. Bought them to use on vehicles but ...
review_body: The ones I got were 90/10 and pretty linty. Bought them to use on vehicles but will probably use them for dishes and stuff instead. The 90/10 mix does make them feel softer to rough hands but they won't be able to pick up dirt like other microfiber rags.

Very cheap feeling clothes. Thin and are very small. Returned them and purchased another brand that feels much better.. Got 2 stars instead of 1 because they are indeed microfiber and do work, but not nearly as well as other brands.

review_title: ... had cheaper microfiber cloths before but these aren't ask good. Don't seem to absorb as good and the ...
review_body: I've had cheaper microfiber cloths before but these aren't ask good.  Don't seem to absorb as good and the white gets dingy really fast.
Very nice. Use them to clean iPad screens. Big. About 12x18. Very soft. Recommend.

review_title: You get what you pay for
review_body: Kind of thin. Tags are more difficult to rip off than they should be and you should rip of the tags before using these on your paint. I guess I got what I paid for so they aren't bad for the money.
I have tried several hand held steamers and this one is the best!
Works great and easy to use.
Works great!
Love it!  Heats up quickly!  Works great!  No issues with leaking, overflowing, etc.
Very pleased with my purchase.It heats up very quickly and steams out wrinkles.  I would recommend this
Great value and works great! Perfect for my son who’s going off to college and who’s not a fan of the iron. He loves it!

review_title: Great product as it is small and work as well ...
review_body: Great product as it is small and work as well as larger steamers. Used it for my travels and so far really happy with it.
Absolutely love it. Very lightweight and very fast and easy to use. Works wonderful
Very light weight. It is easy to use, just hang clothe on rack and steam away.. Thank you to your staff.

We get these on Subscribe and Save monthly. They are Great! They absorb well and are also effective for cleaning glass. The price is comparable to our wholesale  club but it's so much more convenient having them delivered.

review_title: An overall good value Had purchased these for our office which work ...
review_body: An overall good value  Had purchased these for our office which work just fine.  Some people prefer a thicker towel, but these are great for high volume areas were some preferences are not an issue.
Great deal! I used to only by Brawny. i have since switched. I love the price and the convenience of getting a bulk order and not having to worry about running out. These are great quality.
Like  towels because I bought them from the store before, rather stick to store bought cause u get them when u want them still waiting for them, otherwise they are good paper towels two thumbs up

I will say these paper towels are not quite up to par with Bounty but they do still get the job done. They still absorb spill liquids well. I do like how you get a big box of paper towels for a cheap price.
The paper towels are ok and absorb ok for the price. Are they a one sheet paper towel? No but do a few towels get the job done yes.
There was a great deal on these paper towels so I tried them. They are comparable to bounty. I will repurchase.
Great value.

review_title: Great product to help with kitchen smells
review_body: Always have loved Glad trash bags, the Febreeze is a bonus.  Smells good and keeps bad smells down in kitchen and laundry room.

Excellent trash bags. They are roomy, flexible and tie easily. A favorite choice. And they are strong.

review_body: These are good trash bags but they actually tear more easily than I expected. It doesn't take much for them to tear or rip.

I am not especially loyal to any one particular brand of paper towels - I want something that doesn't shred the minute it gets wet but since I go through so many rolls I also want a good value. These Sparkle paper towels are perfect for my needs. The select-a-size, which is pretty common among brands these days, works great for small spills and other quick uses around the house and in the garage. They leave no lint behind when cleaning glass or mirrors. I had a chance to compare these side by side with Brawny and the Sparkle paper towels performed equally well but usually offer a better value. The ability to buy in quantity means I will always have some on hand both at home and for events at my church and local community activities. Good performance and value...

Always searching for the right paper towel for cleaning, wiping spills and every day housekeeping use.  The the opportunity to obtain a roll(s) of Sparkle white giant plus, pick-a-size, paper towels the order was placed.  I like the fact you can pick-a-size paper towel sheet.  The “thirst pockets” sop up spills without issues.  A quality 2 ply paper towel at a reasonable price. In fact Sparkle Towels are slightly better than the name brand paper towels we currently use at a lesser cost (free Prime shipping), or available at additional discount through Amazon Subscribe & Save program with free shipping  We like Sparkle!. Additional information:. 24 Giant+ Rolls = 37 Regular Rolls. 107 Sheets/Roll

This review is for the Sparkle Paper Towels, 24 Giant Plus Rolls, Pick-A-Size, White. I received these today and they came in a seriously large box. Box in a box packaging from Amazon. As I was watching it being delivered I thought that this might be the most exercise the postman has gotten in quite some time.. I really like the smaller select a size of the towels. I really don't like the full sheet ones anymore. They seem like such a waste at times.. While the Sparkle are of good quality, they are not as good as the bounty select a size. Not by much mind you, but thought you may want to know.. I don't think anyone will be disappointed in these. Very absorbent.

This paper towel is not worth wasting money on. It is so thin that it do not hold even a little water and one have to use at least two sheets at once and then two more so, four A size sheets go to dustbin at once. Not worth it given the price and it's poor quality. also, It looks like it will come in one 24 pack, but when it arrived there were two rolls in one pack. It appears clearly from the picture as if it is one pack of 24. Where would I put it in my house if it is not one pack of 24. I had to use old pack of Bounty to store which I luckily didn't throw. I won't buy again.

I always choose the type of paper towels that are select-a-size, pick-a-size, etc. Often I don't need a large paper towel, so this option is perfect, and these particular paper towels fill the bill. My other thing is that the perforations between towels should not be so tough that it takes two hands to get a paper towel using a vertical dispenser. These Sparkle towels are all right in that regard as well. They have a very pretty spiral and diamond embossed pattern, so all in all, a great choice for me!

I like paper towels that let you choose how much you need. I frequently only need a small bit of paper towel and these paper towels let me tear off the amount I need. For the price, these are great paper towels. I don't want a super thin, cheap paper towel because it's useless once it gets wet and I don't need a super thick, towel-like paper towel. If I need an actual towel I will use an actual towel. These paper towels are a great thickness...not too thin and not unnecessarily thick. Just right.

review_title: not as sturdy or absorbent as the more popular brands, but much cheaper
review_body: These towels are cheaper than most of the competition. The half-size sheets are a great idea since I don't need the full towel for most jobs. For big cleanup jobs, these towels aren't as sturdy or absorbent as the more expensive towels, so I have to use 2 towels instead of 1. Since I don't have a lot of big cleanup jobs, I save money by using these cheap towels.

These are great.  I was hoping that these 24 rolls would last a family of 3-4 for a year, but I think it will go way beyond that.  They measure about 7 x 11 inches (aka select-a-size term that Bounty uses,) so you are not wasting as much.  Absorption is very decent as well.  They many not be as thick as those premium Bounty rolls, but they stand up to most jobs fairly well with a fraction of the cost.

These are not the best paper towels I have used, but they work well for the price.  For small spills in the kitchen, office or classroom, or to have while driving on vacation or camping, these are very affordable and efficient.  These don't fall apart when wet, either.

Love them! They aren't really tough or thick, but they do their job. This is the second time we've bought this, and it usually lasts around 6 months, give or take a month. Really awesome for the price.
Great

Great price.

review_body: The smell is awful

review_title: I really like these. The scent is not too strong but ...
review_body: I really like these.  The scent is not too strong but nice.  They are quite sturdy.
Nice.. durable trash bags

review_title: Expensive Yes: But Here's How to Triple the Life of the Refills
review_body: There are hundreds of reviewers who rightly complain about the price of these refills. I'm quick to join them. However, the Daiper Genie just flat-out works too well to retire so here's what we do to save money.. When the Genie gets full, I pull the bag out and use scissors to cut the bottom knot off and let all the dirty diapers fall into a trash bag or grocery bag, which I then tie up and toss in the outside garbage. I then simply retie the Genie Refill bag and use it again. It doubles (or triples) the life of the refills.

review_title: Grossest testament to the Diaper Genie
review_body: This is one of the grossest stories but is a testament to how well this product works. I am one who buys the environmentally friendly product most of the time but when our kid got to the stage of really stinky diapers, we couldn't take it and bought the Diaper Genie. After our kid was done with diapers, someone stashed the Genie in our garage to use for our next kid. Well about 2 years later, the next kid arrives and we pull the Genie out of the garage to dust off and use again. Guess what we found?! We found old diapers in it - not infested with bugs, not stinking outside the bag at all, and the bag was intact. They were in there for years and nobody noticed! Of course when we cut the bag off to throw it out, we were hit with quite the stench but it was remarkably contained all that time. We were very impressed and grossed out at the same time.

Many others have hit the highs (they work reasonably well) and lows (they’re expensive) of these bags. I have just one major concern to add. When I tear off a full section of bag, I end up with coin-sized bits of plastic bag on the floor. They’re hard to see because they’re virtually clear, but I pick them up as soon as I see them. The hazard is my infant finding one first and sticking it in her mouth. As you probably know, clingy plastic can easily block off a baby’s windpipe, and it would be hard to figure out (in time) why the baby isn’t breathing. I don’t know if the problem lies in the bags or in the newest incarnation of the Diaper Genie pail, but this didn’t happen with my older Diaper Genie.

Hah! Haha hahahahah haha ah...  one year supply.  *wipes tear from eye*  That was a good one.. Where do you find these dainty pooping babies you use for marketing purposes?  I'd imagine they also wipe themselves and swap out the bag when it gets full too.  My twins will blast through this box in two months, and they're in day care for half the day.. I hate paying these inflated prices for what is essentially the roll of bags you get in the produce department for free.  But I'll stop using my Diaper Genie when you pry it from my cold dead hands.  Regardless it's a decent price relative to what's out there and I've known since the first week of my kids lives that the advertised capacity of these things is just marketing poop.

review_title: Works great! Especially if you use this trick
review_body: Okay, it's not really a trick but it is basically common sense if you think about it. If this is your first baby then you might not even realize you can do this.. Let's be honest, this whole Diaper Genie concept is ingenious. Who wants to smell poopy diapers thrown in an inside trashcan or have to traipse up and down the stairs and walk them to the outside trashcan? Not me. That's where this little baby (no pun) comes in real handy. But alas, as many have stated before, the refills can become quite expensive real fast unless you use it correctly.. Bottom line (and only halfway through my rant, lol), only use it for the poopy diapers (aka #2). Why take up valuable space for just a pee (#1) diaper? Just throw the #1 diapers into whatever trash can you have nearby and take the garbage out as you normally would. In our case we have a small waste basket outside the little guy's room and once a day we empty it into the big trash can and take it outside to the even bigger trash can. And once a week and even bigger trash can (on wheels) comes and takes it to an even bigger trash can.. But for #2 diapers we use the Diaper Genie. Since he's a regular once a day kind of guy we don't usually have to empty the Genie but once a week. Which makes each refill last about 2 months and each 3-pack around 6 months. If you use it that way it isn't really much of a financial burden.. Now, someone else suggested, when the bag is full, cutting the bottom of the bag (where the knot is) and emptying the diapers into the trash can and then retying and reusing the genie bag over and over. To me that is just gross and possibly messy. I'm not that desperate and if you use it only for poopy diapers you should be fine.

We switched to the cheaper brand for a few weeks, and we are back to these! They are worth the extra for a couple of reasons: 1. the cheaper brands have thinner plastic so they smell worse 2. Not sure how to explain this exactly, but when I put a diaper in the cheaper liner, the liner would bunch up and have excess plastic go through the little hole in the Diaper Genie, meaning I was wasting a few inches every time I changed a diaper, so it really was not worth the cheaper price! Hope that helps you justify the additional cost!

review_title: There's no genie in my pail!
review_body: You thought poop bags were only for walking the dog? NOPE!. Some genius over at Playtex thought "Let's put a crap catcher, in a crap bag." BOOM! Diaper Genie was born. Why wouldn't customers want something like that? No one intends to walk the 100 ft. to their garbage to dispose of that small package of human waste. ...Exercise be danged!. It's better if we keep it all in a pail in our children's room, let it ferment a little. We want those babies to stack on top of each other until it hits capacity. It's like a poop filled jack in the box; you're hoping you're not caught with a diaper poking out the top. "Please make it fit!" you tell yourself as you try and shove one more poo present into the pail as hard as you can. You just hope it's your spouse that gets stuck with the one that doesn't make it in.. In the case you're the lucky one that doesn't make it fit, you turn into Poo Santa as you heft that long blue bag of caca over your shoulder and out that long 100 ft. walk the garbage. "HO HO HO," you say, as see your neighbors look at you with disgust from the smell the permeates everywhere like a skunk gone wild.. Let's get real though; this is a lazy man's dream for disposing of those poo pockets.. Smart of Playtex for thinking of a way to make me pay for it over and over and over again with their fancy round sack distributor. We wouldn't want to make it work with regular garbage bags, would we?. Over all, a decent product.. In Review:. * I rubbed this poo pail, and no genie came out.. * Poop is gross. Why not collect it?. * Playtex hit a home run. * Poo presents from Santa... some of us deserve that.. * I'm lazy

review_title: Diaper Genie pail, bags and filters a winning combo!
review_body: Diaper Genie pail, bags and filters a winning combo!  I've already given 5 stars for the Diaper Genie Elite and the carbon filters.  At 8 months we've just changed the filter once (I know you're supposed to do every 3 months but I always forget as there is no odor coming from the pail).  Even now that the boy is eating a lot of solids and his poos are stinkier and more solid, we still have no smell escaping.  The bags themselves are easy to change.  I'm not sure about the claim of "up to 270 diapers".  I guess "up to" can mean anywhere from 1 to 270.  We change rolls about once per month, maybe a little more frequently than that.  Amazon might not be the cheapest place to buy, although we have.  We usually get at Costco, which sells a 4-pack which is a little cheaper per roll.

review_title: Keep your marriage or single life odor and stress free
review_body: At first I was doubtful, since our apartment is located not far from the rubbish chute. But, if you have nosy neighbors and you don't want to wake them at night, the .  comes in very handy, especially if your little one has an upset stomach. The .  is highly recommended for the first years of a toddler. It helps to have one in the house and nannies and grandma are also relieved about the easiness of dirty diaper disposal. This system is practical, easy to clean and the odor stays inside. It helps keep your marriage odor free. If you are a single parent looking for a date, please check out .  and let us know, what you think.

review_title: There is a better, less expensive alternative.
review_body: Playtex Diaper Genie refills are probably more suitable to babies who are not yet consuming baby or table food.  As we all know, a baby's 'aroma therapy' (lol) becomes a lot stronger as they progress to solid foods, and the Diaper Genie did a substandard job at containing the odor after my child turned six months. Another Amazon customer recommended using Glad Odor Shield bags in lieu of the refills, and it works PERFECTLY (and is a more cost-effective alternative). Save the plastic ring that comes with the refills, and wrap the top of the plastic bag around the ring (Start with the bag inside of the ring and wrap it around the perimeter). Then, pull the draw string and tie it in a bow underneath the refill ring. Next, push the bottom of the bag through the opening of the Diaper Genie (the same opening you use to place soiled diapers inside of the genie). Finally, place the ring and plastic bag in the Diaper Genie, and it is ready for use. My baby is a little stinker :-), and I can now open the Diaper Genie without  being hit by a wave of funk in my face. :-) I paid  approximately $11 for a box of 80 Glad Odor Shield kitchen bags on Amazon, so this method is also saving me a lot of money.
Just what I was expecting.

A good price for Brita filters and I like Brita.

review_title: Both filters lasted less than a month with moderate use ...
review_body: Both filters lasted less than a month with moderate use. After that, water can hardly pass through the filters. It was taking all night to get water filtered through. I tried shaking the filters, put them under running water in hope of removing air bubbles perhaps. Eventually I had to toss them. This never happened with all the regular Brita filters I have bought.
These are great filters. They don't shed black small coal particles during the use like the older version of Brita filters used to do. I guess they came up with a better model..

review_title: A very effective way to have filtered water in your ...
review_body: A very effective way to have filtered water in your pitcher.  It seems to last a long time and the water quality is equal to delivered bottle water.. This is a convenient and cost effective way to drink clean water. One filter will last for months and the system tells you when to change the filter.
These cartridges were a perfect fit for my water purifier.  They are doing an excellent job.  I will order again.

We buy these filters regularly to use with our Brita pitcher. They came in original Brita package and work well, as expected. I prefer to buy the larger quantity package which usually comes out to be less $ per package, but for some reason, it turns out to be much cheaper to buy them in a three pack than say, the 12-count. Which is odd. Don't quite get that.

The fit is perfect, deep pockets for our plush mattresses. They do not slip, pull and the plastic protectant is silent and does not crack if properly taken care of.

review_title: I have one for every single bed in our house ...
review_body: I have one for every single bed in our house. I purchased the first one years ago and just purchased 3 more for our new house. Definitely 100% waterproof. Fits our gigantic mattress and smaller mattresses. You can’t go wrong buying this!!!

Well today it was put to the ultimate test when my black lab decided it would be a good idea to both pee and poop on our bed!! I had to throw the cover out because it was absolutely disgusting, but the mattress is in perfect shape!!!

review_title: Works but takes away feel of mattress
review_body: Works so far, I had dog pee and spilled juice saved by it. Both times I noticed within minutes of spill. I just slept with out it for one night while in wash and my mattress feels so much nicer without it. It definitely changes the feel of the mattress. I have a brand new loom and leaf but saatva and definitely need something higher end to bring the comfort back. Bottom line, you need these covers. This is a safe choice for function just dont think you'll never notice it's there.

Bought this at the same time as our new queen size Tuft & Needle mattress and couldn't be happier with both purchases. This mattress protector installed easilly and you can't even tell it's there. Completely protects our new mattress without being intrusive. A terrific value

This product is amazing! This is the second one I have purchased (the first from the mattress store when I bought my new mattress). This seller is selling them at a third of the cost of mattress stores!! The plastic backing protects from any liquid spills  (I like to drink coffee in bed) but the terry cloth upper surface is soft and comfortable under the sheet. I HIGHLY recommend this product. In addition it prevents dead skin cells from entering the mattress and therefore prevents dust mites!! When I purchased my mattress the store told me the average mattress doubles in weight in 10 years due to absorbtion of dead skins cells and this cover prevents that. LOVE IT!!!

review_title: This is a good product for accidents in bed
review_body: Finally a product that is really waterproof!  This is a good product for accidents in bed.  It kept it from leaking onto the mattress.  It also protects your mattress from dirt, dust, etc.  It is a tiny bit noisy at first use, but with some wear it goes away.  The only issue I have with it is that it can make you a little warm, hence the 4 stars.  If it would keep the body temperature cool, I would've given it 5 stars.

I purchased 2 twin size SafeRest Premium Hypoallergenic mattress covers several months ago, and have been delighted with them.  I use them in the beds my grandchildren use when they come for overnights.  They have been washed several times, and go through the laundry beautifully, and continue to fit the mattresses perfectly.  They don't have any "crinkly" sound or feel, but protect the mattress entirely.  Now I have purchased a queen size cover, and am sure it will perform just as well.

review_title: It feels great under the sheet and remains wrinkle free so the ...
review_body: We decided to order your mattress cover after reading the other reviews and shopping locally and finding "less for more $$".  It covers our 10" memory foam mattress perfectly.  It feels great under the sheet and remains wrinkle free so the made up bed looks good also.  We have not had it long enough to require laundering so I gave it a 5star rating based on the other reviews stating that it launders perfectly.  So to summarize we are very happy with our purchase and American Made is certainly a positive for us.  Thanks for making a good product.
