review_title: Might be the greatest Kitchen Invention Ever - Seriously, EVER
review_body: Nope, not exaggerating.  Greatest kitchen invention ever.  I have purposely waiting 4 months before writing a review for this. I wanted to see if my love affair with the Instant Pot was just a fling or true love.  It's true love.  This might have single handedly saved my marriage. Ok, perhaps that is an exaggeration, but not far from it.. I work full time.  So does my husband. I get home first and generally cook dinner.  I eat primarly vegetarian - no RED MEAT ever.  My husband eats primarily CARNIVORE style.  Cooking two seperate things has been a real pain and challenge, PLUS I know very little about cooking meat.  The instant pot has changed all of that.  I can make something for him FAST and easy, and not have to worry about ruining it.. Let me say, read the manual.  And then read it again and then keep close by as a reference.  I use this thing at least twice a week.  I cook things in it that are so simple and easy and taste like you have been slaving away in the kitchen.  The lifesaving part is how fast it is.  Yes, it's faster than cooking on the stove for the most part, PLUS you don't have to keep tending to whatever you are cooking.  Put it in and go.. I was very hesitant to pay this much for a "gadget" that I wasn't too sure about, but I hit a home run on this one.  There are many recipes on pinterest for the instant pot, plus I have purchased some books off of Amazon for it.  Once you get the hang of using it (there is not much learning curve - just follow the directions and use some common sense) you can think of many things that you cook on the stove or the crockpot that you will now do in the Instant Pot.  I really love it. I would give it 10 starts if I could.

review_title: Instant Pots Will Rule the World
review_body: This thing is amazing.  I got this on Black Friday for my girlfriend after hearing her casually mention it, but didn't really understand what you could do with it.  So far we've taken frozen chicken breast and about 30 minutes later we have delicious shredded chicken.  We've made soups, cooked potatoes and even have done hard-boiled eggs (they seriously came out perfect).  This thing is like a little miracle.  It is by far our new favorite toy much to the dismay of our slow cookers.  We did a 4-pound pork roast in less than an hour and it turned out very good as well.  You can even make hamburgers (we made Juicy Lucy's) with it!  This thing is so efficient and quick that I'm concerned that my g/f may just leave me for the Instant Pot so she can keep all the good food for herself.  Hell, if this thing had a sexual stimulation button it'd probably make it happen 10x faster than I could too.  Crazy good product!

review_title: I love my IP, but wish I had bought the 6 qt
review_body: I figured the 3 qt would be fine for a 1-2 person household.  And most of the time it is.  But it really only has a 2 qt capacity.  It is hard to find accessories that fit the 3 qt since it has a smaller inner diameter than the 6 qt.  I have trouble fitting "all in one" recipes such as beef stroganoff or pot roast into the 3 qt.  For the former, I have to cook the pasta separately, which loses some of the flavor.  For the latter, I have trouble fitting the potatoes and carrots in on top of the meat.  And trying to do PIP in the 3 qt is more difficult.  You can always cook less in a larger pot, but are often limited by size of the mini.  All in all, I love the purchase but wish I had gotten the standard 6 qt.

review_title: The machine that does it all!
review_body: I purchased this in November 2014 and at the time of this review have had it for 3 months and used it approximately 20 times.. This is a brilliant machine! When my slow cooker died a few months ago, I started the process of finding what I should replace it with. I'd heard of the Instant Pot on a blog and was intrigued by it enough to research some more. I had never used a pressure cooker and was concerned if I purchased the Instant Pot, I wouldn't use it for this. With such an expensive price tag it took me several weeks to decide to just go for it.. The functions I use the most are:. -pressure. -slow cook. -sauté. I love that I can save time and dishes by sautéing in the Instant Pot before pressure cooking or slow cooking. There are 3 adjustable heat settings for this function. The Instant Pot has so many variable settings, I can run it for as little or long as I want. It will automatically switch to he warm function when it is done. This was important to me since my old slow cooker did this which saved many dinners.. I've tried the pressure cooking portion of the Instant Pot several times now. At first I was terrified I would explode it. It's obviously not going to happen. There is a pressure release valve making it extremely safe in this mode. I've found that if I wanted to slow cook something and forgot to put it in, I can pressure cook it for a fraction of the time. It's been very experimental with this since the instruction books are very confusing on what to do with converting a slow cook recipe to pressure cook.. I've now been making bone broth several times a week on the pressure cook setting for 50 minutes with natural release. It's much more flavorful and is done in less than 1.5 hours compared to slow simmering for 8-10 hours. I've also made perfect hard boiled eggs, beef stew, braised beef and many other recipes. I'm a huge fan!. A couple downsides that I've found so far is that the shape of the pot is hard to put some roasts in it. The shape of the meat needs to be the opposite of the shape needed for a traditional slow cooker. The pot although dishwasher safe, does not come clean in the dishwasher. I've tried it many times and it's best to hand wash it. For broth and soups, the pressure cooker should never be filled more than 2/3 full. This means that the yield is much less than a traditional slow cooker or pot on the stove.

review_title: As a vegan, this is a god send
review_body: I recently became a vegan and some people on the vegan facebook groups were posting vegan instant pot recipes so I decided to buy one.. I first started using it twice a week, then three times a week, and now  I use it almost every day of the week!  It saves a lot of time because I can make rice or other recipes by loading up the stainless steel pot, hitting one or two buttons and walking away.  The pot does the rest, pressure cooking then holding the food hot until I'm ready to serve it (you can also specify that you want the food to cool down when you finish cooking).. It does a great job on rice and pretty much every recipe I've thrown at it... lentil curries and various soups.. This pot could save time for anyone, vegan or not.  Just take 10 minutes or so to prepare your recipe (usually just chopping stuff up), pop it in the pot, make one or two button selections (including cooking time) and your all set.. Apparently it also  a time delay feature which I've never used.. Pressure cooking is a very healthy way to prepare food, locking in flavor that might escape when cooking with a traditional pot.  Also, little or no danger of leaving a burner on (we all have those problems as we get older).  So I highly recommend the Instant Pot as many people do!

I have had the 5 qt for about a year and I love it, but always wondered why IP didn’t make a smaller one. When I saw the mini and it was on sale in immediately ordered it. It’s perfect for 1 or 2 people, takes up a lot less space and is cute to boot. I love the mini!
This is my second Instant Pot, I have the 6qt LUX and love it. This one is a bit smaller, and it has more features than my older LUX. I will use them both.

review_title: Instant Pot 7-in-1 Makes Cooking Much More Fun
review_body: I had never wanted a pressure cooker until I saw this one. I LOVE all it can do and the safety features that are built in to make it fool-proof. I can pressure cook perfectly or slow cook if I want. One of my favorite things is that it is TRULY an all-in-one pot. I get frustrated with crockpot recipes that require searing meat in another pan or cooking meats through in another pan prior to putting them in the crockpot. Who wants any more dishes to wash? With this, I can sear the meat first, then incorporate the meat and vegetables and liquid and let it do the rest all in one container. No oil splattering out of the skillet if the meat flops over while trying to sear it because the sides are high enough to prevent both the splattering or the flopping over. It cooks good sized pieces of roast. I even made mashed potatoes with no extra liquid to be poured out in a little over 10 minutes once the cut pieces were in the pot - 20 minutes tops. It usually takes 20 minutes for the potatoes in a stock pot once the water comes to a boil, then add the ingredients. No strainer required. One less dish to wash and the stovetop was free for preparing other items. I highly recommend this to any family needing a new crockpot and for newlyweds.

review_title: Works great as a pressure pot, but not at all as a slow cooker
review_body: I took a chance on this not knowing much about it.  The reviews were all positive and I have not been disappointed.  It reminds me of a small Presto electric pressure pot I had 35 years ago and I cried when it quit working and I couldn't replace it.  It took a long time for someone to come up with a replacement, but I'm sure glad they did.  I've used it at least twice a week since I got it.. Update:  I tried my first effort using it as a slow cooker.  It's been 4.5 hours and I can't get the temperature to rise above 164 degrees.  Definitely not hot enough to cook meat.  I had intended to get rid of my slow cooker, but I can see that I still will have to use it.  They shouldn't advertise it as a slow cooker if it doesn't perform as such.  I'm still entirely happy with it as a pressure cooker.

review_title: This is NOT Your Grandma’s Pressure Cooker
review_body: Although I’ve only had my IP for a few days, I am beyond pleased with its performance. It’s larger than it looks, so it will take up some counter space. Also, keep in mind these new appliances have shorter cords. Ideally, you should use it away from your cabinets due to the amount of steam they produce.. Most of the functions you’ll use WON’T be in the quick program buttons. The majority of users find it more practical to use the Pressure Cook (also referred to as manual) feature and set the time. Recipes generally don’t include the time it takes for the IP to get hot or build up pressure, and many don’t tell you how long it takes for full depressurization (when you can actually open the lid). It will depend on the quantity of food and liquid, as well as temperature, time, and pressure settings. You’ll get used to it. I cooked a 3-lb pork loin roast from start to finish in an hour and a half. It took about 10 minutes to get up to pressure, an hour to cook, and 20 minutes to release the pressure.. Speaking of pressure, there’s a knob on top of the lid that you turn to either vent or seal. This allows you to do what’s called a Quick Pressure Release. It’s fast, a bit loud, and steamy —  so be careful. This is a normal and frequently used feature, as some foods need to get out of the heat quickly. Other recipes, such as whole cuts of meat, generally allow time for what’s called a Natural Pressure Release (where the pot slowly releases pressure on it’s own). This is like the pressure cookers of the older generation. You just wait until the pressure pin drops and open the lid, being careful to tip it away from you.. There is a bit of a learning curve for the first few uses of any electric pressure cooker, so have some patience. I find the Facebook group “Instant Pot Community” to be extremely helpful.. This isn’t your grandma’s old pressure cooker. It’s smart, safe, and versatile. You can sauté your veggies in a little oil, throw in the meat, and reset the pot to pressure cook... resulting in a tasty meal in under an hour. AND, once it’s done cooking, it will keep your food warm for up to 10 hours. There is a delay feature, too. You can buy a variety of accessories to stack and cook different items in their own containers, or make egg bites, hard boiled eggs, cheesecakes, lasagna, and much more.. The recipe book that comes with the pot is minimal — just a teaser compared to what’s available online and in Facebook groups.. The power cord detaches from the base, so make sure it’s firmly plugged in when you start cooking. The silicone gasket on the lid will pick up odors, and many people buy extras to use with their different foods (savory or sweet). If you find yourself using the slow cooker feature a lot, you can opt to buy a clear lid (which is NOT used for pressure cooking).. I hope you enjoy your Instant Pot as much as I do! Don’t be afraid of it. I find it much less intimidating (pressure-wise) than my metal, stove top version.

review_title: Had it over a month and it's working good so far
review_body: Skeptical to buy b/c of other reviews, but the price was too good to pass up. Very stylish, lightweight, use it on porcelain tile. So far so good.. I tried testing the weight accuracy with a 5lb bag of flour and it wouldn't read it, but it read 10 lbs no problem and that was fairly accurate. This is my first digital scale so maybe none of them read under 10lbs? That I don't know.

Purchased this scale 7 months ago and it works great. The best part, it's only a fraction of the price compared to what you find in the store. Very sleek looking scale and fits perfectly under the bathroom sink. People from 100 LBS to 260 LBS have used the scale without any issues. If you are looking for a stylish glass scale, this is the way to go.

review_title: More of a magic 8-ball than a real scale
review_body: This scale is entirely inaccurate.  Every time I step on it, it gives a different reading, which can be as much as 15lbs off.  I replaced it within a month for a different scale, that didn't have this issue.

review_title: such an ease to use and is easy to store away with it being so thin
review_body: we've used multiple scales before and they've all been difficult to get to 0.0 or are heavy. this is lightweight, such an ease to use and is easy to store away with it being so thin. very happy with this product and would highly recommend to anyone who's looking for one.

review_title: Super-thin design, perfect for a small apartment bathroom
review_body: With regards to its basic function, as a scale, it functions wonderfully. There's no lag when you step on the scale, it measures your weight quickly, and the blue backlight makes the numbers easy to read. However, the most amazing thing about this scale is in its design. It is so thin, when laying on the floor, that my bathroom door can literally open over it! (see picture) This allows me to store it behind the door, completely out of the way, where I never have to worry about tripping over it or stepping on it unintentionally. Absolutely amazing for the space conscious.

This scale is wonderful. I've been successfully dieting and losing weight. Only problem is, I was using a scale at work...For weighing pallets, Doh!. This scale is easy to read and gives the readout quickly. Also, unlike an older scale I've used, I don't need to kick it with my toes to turn it on. Who ever thought that was a good idea? I only step on, get my weight and then I'm on with my day.
It weighs you. It seems accurate. It give the same reading if you step on it repeatedly in a 5 minute span (my old one was always saying something different). Seems dependable.

review_title: Trying to lose weight so saying I love my scale right now is going a bit far
review_body: Trying to lose weight so saying I love my scale right now is going a bit far... However, I do like the looks of the scale and it does seem to be accurate to the old weight scales in the doctor's office. For the money, has been a good buy.

So far so good!! I actually bought the scale when Amazon was having a sale, and it said the original value was somewhere between $40-50. Honestly I'm not sure the scale is worth that much; it pretty much as the same functionality as a scale you can purchase at your local store for $20 or less.. The nice feature of this scale that scales I've seen sold locally do not have, is the lighted background to make it easier to read. Considering the sale price (Right under $15) I definitely think it was a great buy.. I love the sleek and modern look of the scale, so far when I've tried it the readings seem accurate. So far, so good!

review_body: I wanted a small, sleek scale I can keep behind our bathroom. This works perfectly and doesn’t take too much room. I can store it easily too if I need to.

Have been using the shower curtain for a couple of weeks now. The weighted curtain keeps it from folding in on itself. Only concern is that the magnets do not seem to really stick to the tub (not a strong magnet); it is not a big issue as the weight itself keeps the shower curtain straight and flat, but would have liked the magnets to be more helpful.

review_title: I like the product and will continue using it while my ...
review_body: Over all, I like the product and will continue using it while my daughter is in diapers.  What I like about it; it actually seems to keep the smells inside…unless there’s a blowout and even double bagging the diaper doesn’t help.  That one should be taken out right away, lol.  I have not counted diapers so see if I can get 245 diapers w/in one container but it seems to fill up very quickly, not reaching 245; and I do wrap the diaper tight before throwing away.  The other not so convenient thing is you have to make the bag; meaning, you tie the knot at the end pull it to the bottom of the container.  When the diapers reach the top you have to pull through enough plastic to cut (blade provided on inside [pretty clever]) and the top of the one being discarded and tie the new one to pull down to the bottom and start the process over again.

review_title: Works great, doesn't fit in Munchkin pail
review_body: These do a great job holding in the smell. They're easy to cut and tie. I've read about people getting messed-up rolls, but haven't had any problems myself.. One thing to be aware of: these do not fit in Munchkin diaper pails. The Munchkin refills do fit in Diaper Genie pails, so one might be forgiven for expecting it to work the other way. It doesn't. These work in Diaper Genie only. I suspect that is an intentional part of Munchkin's design and not Diaper Genie's fault, but nevertheless it makes these less useful to me than the Munchkin refills that fit either one.

review_title: Quality material for these refill bags.
review_body: These replacement packs work perfectly with my Diaper Genie.  It's so nice to be able to buy these replacement bags in bulk online -- I have gone through 5 individual refills in the 7 months baby has been home.  I have never had an issue with the bags leaking or tearing -- I appreciate the quality material when I'm carrying these bags of messy diapers out of my house!  I appreciate how easy the refills are to open and place in the Diaper Genie as well.

review_title: There is something wrong with the item we received. ...
review_body: There is something wrong with the item we received. It’s two layers of the bag unrolling at once. It will last us half the usual length of time.. I posted this yesterday, but have to amend it after we started to actually use this ring overnight. Because it is a double layer unfolding we won’t be able to use even half. It just doesn’t come out as it should and we cannot place dirty diapers in it.. We usually buy these at another store and they work great. This was the first time we ordered it from Amazon. Not sure what happened.

review_title: The refill packs are a bit stingy in size and I feel like I only get 4-5 bags worth before the refill ...
review_body: This is obviously a necessary evil if you have a diaper genie. The refill packs are a bit stingy in size and I feel like I only get 4-5 bags worth before the refill runs out. The diaper genie itself isn't expensive but clearly they're making their money back on these refills. I'm not sure if there is any alternative aside from having a stinky diaper pail or running downstairs and throwing a diaper into the kitchen trash. That being said, the bags do contain the pee smell well and the poo smell containment is "OK". I don't usually put poo diapers in the genie, I really try to throw them away separately that same day with the kitchen trash. I empty my diaper genie once a week and that seems to work fine for us.

Makes life easy.. Strong enough to contain the poop.. Blue and transparent (not sure why transparent, I really dont want to see a bunch of diapers filled with pee and poo).... Holds a lot of diapers especially if you fold the diapers tightly (when you can) before dumping them.. However, your baby is gonna be changing diapers a lot, so the bags will be filled up in no time.... Note: You can use normal small garbage bags if the diaper genie refills runs out. But honestly, these packs just makes life much easier when you really don't want to have unnecessary dramas.

I’ve purchased these over the past five+ years from various retailers, including Amazon. They always do the trick and make dealing with dirty diapers very easy. For that I would give Diaper Genie products 5 stars. I purchased generic once and the quality was noticeably poorer, so I’ve been loyal to this brand. My last order, however, seemed to be defective. Every single insert I used from the package resulted in at least one instance of a bag split at the seams. Yuck 🤢! It was to the point where I would walk in my baby’s room, take a whiff, and know instantly the bag must have split...again. For that reoccurring and unpleasant inconvenience, I’m giving this four stars (consider it an average of a one star experience with years of five star experiences). I purchased my current lot of inserts from another retailer and everything has been fine. I’ll probably buy these from Amazon again in the future - perhaps it was just a bad batch. I’ll keep my fingers crossed.

The refills aren't bad, I feel like the plastic is generally a little thicker than the generic counterpart but sometimes this product can be cheaper than the generic one. You just have to calculate it, different deals sometimes. Basically it's having a continuous plastic bag so you don't have to keep finding a grocery bag to put the diapers in. If you don't mind have to constantly switch out plastic bags, just save yourself the money and skip the refills and the diaper genie in general.

In general, the diaper genie is good and very helpful for our nursery.. These refills are genuine and fit, so they get the job done.. My only gripes are the following two things:.   1.  I always find myself with a lot extra bag than there is space in my diaper genie.  Not wanting to be wasteful, once the diaper genie fills up, I just start dropping dirty diapers in and tying them off.  So I have a snake of diaper pouring out the top of the genie - not very nice looking..   2.  Difficult to explain, but there is a plastic horizontal "guard" that you pull the diaper bag around (it's left behind when you peel away the tab to open the refill).  They sometimes get awkwardly caught on the bag as I'm pushing a dirty diaper in - just a strange design choice that makes what should be super easy a little frustrating sometimes.

Help keep your nursery smelling fresh! - This is a lie!. Next lie - Diaper Genie refills have 7-layers that seal in odor. I bought these to use with a diaper genie that was a hand me down. Sadly this was a waste of $. Only  Diaper Genie refills guarantee Odor Lock System Performance*. - Where is this guarantee.. This smells so bad if the windows are closed even if I use an additional bag for the stinky diapers before throwing it into the genie it doesn't help.

review_title: Ordered 4 of them - they work great!
review_body: I have twin 2.5 year olds that are currently near the end of potty training (bedtime is our big challenge). They tend to sleep in any one of the 4 beds in the house, so I ordered 4 due to the great price and reviews. We live in the desert, so lots of water, and plenty of accidents at night. All 4 protectors have been washed multiple times, put in the dryer on medium heat (low heat when I remember!), and they are holding up great. No leakage issues, fit all 4 beds well (2 full size, 1 queen futon, and 1 king w/memory foam topper), and appear to be of high quality. I highly recommend this product, as the price is fantastic and it does exactly as it should - protects your mattress and memory foam. Great product!

This product works well! It doesn’t have a plastic smell and you can’t tell it’s underneath your sheets. It works great as a mattress protector. It absolutely prevents stains from leeching into your mattress. It washes easily and the stains come righr out of it. I am very pleased with this product.

review_title: Happy with product just days out of the bag.
review_body: The protector was generously sized, easily fitting over our 14 inch deep mattress with room to spare. The package opened with little smell. After a few minutes, couldn't even detect the scent. Only slept a few nights on it, but it is absolutely silent under the sheets. I notice no obvious feeling of it being there. I mainly am withholding a higher rating until I have used it for awhile and have washed it following use. My last protector (different brand) did separate the fabric from the waterproofing after two washings and being air dried. It continued to work, but didn't last the touted 10 years. Underlay fell apart in year 5. After spending $100 the first time, I wasn't too anxious to spend that much again. This feels like a solid value at this point.

review_title: Better comfort for Foam memory beds!
review_body: Can't attest to the waterproof nature of this mattress pad yet, but so far it is very comfortable. We purchased a very expensive mattress pad with our Tempur-pedic bed mostly because it gave us a special warranty for our mattress. That mattress pad ended up leaking and we did end up having to have our mattress replaced under warranty. I decided to look on Amazon for other mattress pad reviews to see if it made sense to purchase a different type of mattress pad. I picked this one due to it saying it was good with foam memory mattresses and it also had good reviews about it's waterproof capability etc. My husband and I spent a lot of money on this mattress and I think this is the first time we have actually been able to enjoy the comfort. We hadn't realized before that the mattress pad we were using was inhibiting the memory foam. I finally feel like my body is sinking into the mattress the way it is supposed to. I don't think we will go back to the very expensive mattress pad again even though this mattress pad may not protect our mattress with warranty what's the point of having an expensive mattress if you can't enjoy it? I will try to update this review once we are able to test out the waterproof ability. Also, no sweating!

So far, has exceeded my hopes! Our 2-year-old co-sleeps, and is just reaching the point where he is transitioning to the next size diaper, or needs an overnight as opposed to a regular. The first 3 nights we had this mattress protector, he leaked through his diaper. This mattress protector kept the liquid off of the mattress all 3 times, and still looks brand new after going through the washer and dryer 3 times in 3 days. We had to keep a mattress cover AND pads on our bed before, which caused me to sweat in the night. LOVE this mattress protector. It is cool and comfortable, I can't even tell it's on. I would definitely recommend this product. Fit our king size bed exactly, nice and tight.

I have allergies, so it was important that I have a mattress protector that helped eliminate dust, and kept the mattress from damp of any sort.  This is soft, and does not have any vinyl noise, like other waterproof mattress protectors I have tried.  It washes easily in my washer, and dries in the dryer, or line dry.  I had bought one months ago for my queen bed, and now when I changed to a king split, I knew which protector I needed.

So far so good! I purchased this mattress protector in anticipation of the arrival of my first born (King size) and it fits great and you wouldn't even know it is there. It does not make any noise at all which is what I was seeking in a waterproof mattress protector. I had purchased a different mattress protector originally and the thing was so noisy that the second it was on the bed it was removed and shoved back into its packaging for return. This one seems great so far and will hopefully hold up to spills and baby related accidents!

review_title: I am lax in writing reviews--I always have good intentions but my follow through is lousy
review_body: I am lax in writing reviews--I always have good intentions but my follow through is lousy. However, I love the Instant Pot so much I had to take the time to write this review.I had a stove top pressure cooker but I was always so scared of it that I ended up giving it away.  I have had the Instant Pot for about a month now and it has quickly become a staple in my kitchen. It has saved us money, actually, as all those times when my husband would say "Oh, let's just order out", I have been able to whip up a quick meal in the Instant Pot. I love that I can saute ingredients directly in the pot and then add the remaining ingredients and either pressure cook or slow cook depending on my schedule for the day (spaghetti sauce is slow cooking in the Pot as I write this). The Pot takes steel cut oats to a whole new level. I make a batch about twice a week and my hubby, who absolutely loathes oatmeal, happily devours this for breakfast. Yesterday, I made broccoli cheese soup--yum!. I have not tried the yogurt maker yet, but I am excited about that as I have two Dalton type yogurt makers with the individual cups. I rather prefer the idea of making one big batch in the Instant Pot. I also have heard that risotto is very good (and way less time consuming) made in the Instant Pot, so that is also on my list of things to try. I like the fact that the inner pot is stainless steel--I am not a big fan of the non stick stuff. I do wish that the see-through lid that is used for slow cooking was included, but, oh well, I needed it, so I bought it anyway. The Pot does take up a significant amount of counter space (for me, anyway, as my counter space is limited.) but I tend to leave it out on the counter, anyway, as I use it so often! I have already recommended this product to many people and I look forward to getting rid of many of my small kitchen appliances as this product does the job of so many!

review_title: This experienced PC user is SOLD!!
review_body: I resisted purchasing an electric pressure cooker for years. I've used stove top models for the past 25 years and I've always felt like they were adequate and it was not necessary to buy of these new-fangled multi-function showboats!  However I purchased the Instant Pot in the 6-qt model for a friend of mine, who doesn't do a lot of cooking and is a very busy working mother of two busy kids. I thought that this would help her to prepare quick, nutritious, easy meals for her family. When I got a good look at it, I decided to purchase the 8-quart model for myself to give it a go. I cannot tell you how happy I am that I broke down and bought it. This appliance is so much simpler to use. I can actually drink my wine while preparing my meals when using this. No more intense thinking about the best method for each entree or remembering to set timers (how long has it been at full pressure????), which is good for this middle-aged woman who has a healthy red wine habit and advanced multiple sclerosis (memory is not my forte).  I have made numerous dishes, mostly utilizing the PC function, combined with the saute function beforehand.  The greatest thing about this PC/multi-function appliance is how simplistic it is when compared to its (ancient) cousin, the stovetop pressure cooker.  Despite telling myself for years that my stovetop PCs (I have 3 of them) could do everything that the new electric models could do, it takes much more effort and there is a steeper learning curve. After using them for years, there was still the occasional scorched ingredients in the bottom of the cooker.  No more.  Yes, I know, you can use the PIP method. But that significantly decreases the capacity of your PC. You have to find a heatproof bowl/ casserole dish that fits into the PC and still holds a decent amount of food. I've made curries, pulled pork, numerous breakfast recipes, and all have turned out fantastic.  My stovetop models are still useful but this is my go-to cooker.  I can use the stovetop models I have to "bake" potatoes, quick steam veggies, hard boil eggs, etc while main dishes are cooking in the new Instant Pot.  Other advantages:. 1.  You only need a power supply to use it.  If you have a huge group at your home, it can go in the next room (in my case, the laundry room) and free up my cooktop and counter space.. 2.  It is silent.. 3.  There is NEVER anything scorched on the bottom.  The only time I use the PIP method is when I am putting something in ramekins or dessert pans such as springform pans, etc.. 4.  Non-PC users are no longer terrified in my kitchen.  I am sold!

review_title: Eggs, yogurt, and last minute dinners. Oh my!
review_body: I hemmed and hawed about getting yet another kitchen gadget (I already own a steamer - albeit on its last legs, a bread maker, and three slow cookers), but I do weekly meal prep and was looking for something to make large volume cooking a bit easier and more efficient.. I'm so glad I bought the instant pot, and it has come in even more handy than I imagined it would. In particular, I'm a huge fan of doing hard cooked eggs in it for a number of reasons. First, I live in a drought-prone area and I love that it uses SO much less water than boiling. Second, the eggs come out cooked to perfection every time. Third, they peel like a dream.. I've also used it to heat up soup from frozen in about 20 minutes, make crack-free cheesecake, cook tough items like barley and dry beans, and homemade yogurt. I've been making my own yogurt for several years now and my old method was fairly straightforward but time intensive. I used to heat up mason jars full of milk in the microwave (took about 20 minutes with constant stirring and checking temperature), let it cool to 110F, inoculate with starter, and incubate in the oven with the light on for 8 or so hours. However, this process rendered my oven unusable for the better part of a day which is problematic while doing meal prep! Now, I put the jars of milk in the instant pot, steam for 1 minute to scald, allow to cool, and use the yogurt function to incubate at the correct temperature for 8 hours.. I feel like I still have so much to explore with the instant pot, but I'm already in love. Of course, I'm sure similar results can be obtained using a traditional stovetop pressure cooker, but I'm pleased with the set and forget aspect and the ability to free up space on my normally crowded stovetop.. Overall, this was worth every penny of the $100 I spent on it. I hope it lasts me a very long time!

review_title: My only regret is that I waited so long to get one
review_body: This is the most used appliance in my house now! I hesitated buying it for so long, and now wish I'd bought it a year ago. It saves me so much time in the kitchen. The 6 quart is a good size and not too big. It saves electricity from not using my oven as much to cook, and it keeps the nutrients in the food by not nuking it in the microwave! I love the speed of it. Dry beans cooked in an hour, start to finish! Boiled cabbage is 15 minutes, start to finish without stinking up the house. A fully cooked chicken now takes about an hour start to finish, and we have sandwiches all week! Boston butt roast for pulled pork also cooks in less than an hour. I love that it also cooks frozen meats quickly, in case you forget to set it out to thaw. Rice is perfect and fluffy, and no boil-overs. Perfect boiled eggs, meatloaf, and more. It's really been a miracle worker! I can't wait to get some additional accessories like a cheesecake pan and bundt pan for it to make banana bread,desserts, and lasagna. (Once you buy it, join the IP Community on Facebook to get great tips and recipes.)

review_title: It was on sale for $124 and I have heard nothing but amazing things about it so I jumped and purchased it
review_body: I bought the Instant Pot IP-DUO60 in the beginning of December. It was on sale for $124 and I have heard nothing but amazing things about it so I jumped and purchased it. I am incredibly impressed with this kitchen tool, as it does virtually everything. The first thing I made was an entire chicken in 20 minutes, which was fall of the bone tender. Next I made hard boiled eggs, which peeled easier than any other hard boiled eggs I've ever made. Since then, I have made over 50 meals in this pot, and it works perfectly every single time.. The pot is built to last, and it is very heavy duty. The buttons are very self explanatory but I would recommend looking up recipes online to figure out how to use the built in functions to their maximum abilities.. I would recommend buying an extra inner pot because it is a hassle to cook a main dish and then clean the pot and then cook the side dish and I would also recommend buying an extra silicone sealing ring because it catches smells easily and it can make lighter foods such as yogurt smell funny.. I tell everyone I know how amazing the Instant Pot is, and how everyone should have it. This pot is truly a kitchen miracle once you learn how to properly use it. It is worth every single penny, and I promise you won't regret your purchase!

review_title: Does it all in no time!!! One pot wonder!
review_body: I hesitated to pull this out of the package after I got it because I was a little intimidated of using it. I'm so glad I finally did! This Instant Pot is amazing! It literally does it all...sautés, steams, cooks perfect rice, tender and flavorful meats, soups, stews, etc. and best of all...it's fast and easy to use. I haven't used my stove, microwave, or oven since I started using this instant Pot. With a quick review of the instruction manual and some recipies online I learned to use this quickly. As a busy working mom, this amazing appliance turned weeknight dinners around. Instead of spending tons of time in the kitchen after working a long day, I can have a delicious meal ready for my family in 30 minutes or less. Don't be intimidated by the Instant Pot...it makes delicious, flavorful meals and has made life so much easier!! I love this thing!

review_title: I'm a new convert to the instant pot!!
review_body: I have never owned a pressure cooker, and I really didn't want to invest in another kitchen cooker, but this thing is awesome!. There is a learning curve to using this pressure cooker, but it is well worth it!!  Being able to cook foods even from frozen is a huge time saver, since I can still prepare meat even if I forget to thaw it out.  And having foods come out tender after only 20-30 minutes cook time is amazing.  I can cook the main dish in the pressure cooker, and I don't have to tend to it all all while I prepare side dishes or a salad or sauce, etc.  There are tons of recipes on the internet although a cook book is also a good idea for beginners.. The pressure cooker yields the same results as a crockpot on say, a tough cut of meat, cooking it into a tender delicious meat, but in a fraction of the time.  Sometimes I just don't plan ahead, but I can still cook meat even from frozen, and it comes out great.  I can start it cooking, and then kind of "set it and forget it" while I tend to side dishes.  I don't have to keep an eye on it, or stir it.. Also, I found with some crock pot recipes, with ingredients like fruits or some of the chinese food recipes, they tended to kind of melt together and lose flavor if I started them before work and then came home for dinner.  That doesn't happen with the instant pot.  Less cooking time, so flavor stays fresher.  Chicken breast can dry out in a slow cooker, it doesn't happen with an instant pot.. It really does replace numerous appliances, it can be used as a rice cooker also, and can still function as a slow cooker.  It really does live up to the hype!. Also - the saute function is the bomb!  With a crockpot, if you want to brown the meat first, or cook bacon, it requires another pan.  With the instant pot, you get to literally do it all in one pot.  Plus you have the browning from the sauteing that adds another level of flavor.. Another thing is, I really think that with the pressure, the foods absorb more of the seasonings.  I have found foods just come out tasting better.  I made a Ropa Vieja that was just delicious, even though it was the same recipe I've used before.. I've used it to "bake" sweet potatoes, which took a lot less time than the oven, so dinner took a lot less time to prepare, and I didn't heat up the whole kitchen, another big plus.  While it is really "steaming" them (the skins are wet, not dry and crispy like they are in the oven), it really seemed to have more flavor!  My daughter was scraping the last of the sweet potato off the skins, when she usually just eats the middle and leaves a lot of sweet potato still attached to the skins.. I've only had mine for a couple of weeks, but I'm already a huge fan.  The IP has all the benefits of slow cooking, but so many more options!!

review_title: Giant appliance, but worth the space it will take up.
review_body: I've only used this pot a few times and I'm already SO happy that I bought it.  It cooked an whole chicken in 30 minutes...and it was tender and juicy.  I will say that I seem to be sacrificing a little bit of flavor with the pressure cooker setting.  Probably because it's not stewing in the spices for hours.  I think maybe using a marinade and letting it sit for the day would help.  Still worth every penny.. The 8 qt size is HUGE, so make sure you have space for it.  I thought I did and was wrong.  I had to store it without the top on, and shuffle several things around.. My absolute favorite thing about this product is that I can brown my meat before I start the slow cooker or pressure cooker cycle.  I browned a brisket, put in some broth and seasoning, pressure cooked for 50 minutes, then took out the brisket and set it to sauté to make the gravy.  All in one pot.  Awesome.

I have used white rice, porridge, bean/chili, and yogurt functions.. The rice it cooked was not as good as that cooked by the rice cooker we have, yet it was definitely OK.. The porridge was nice because our rice cooker can't even cook meung beans in the porridge. This cooker can handle all sorts of beans in addition to brown rice in the porridge if I set the time longer.. We used bean/chili to cook organic soybeans. Then we use a blender to make organic soy milk. Needless to say, it's very tasty.. We used yogurt function a few times. Each time it was a success.. This pot is truly very convenient. The "set it and forget it" function is especially useful/safe for a forgetful person like me. I would highly recommend it.

review_title: Well Reviewed For A Good Reason
review_body: This works as expected and better! For over a month, we've successfully made lots of fresh yogurt, steel cut oats, Beef Bourguignon, mashed potatoes, and have had many steaming and sterilization sessions. One thing we've learned is a "3 minute cook" is actually a 20 minute process; the cooker needs to heat to the correct temp, then cook, then release pressure. This is our first time with a pressure cooker, so perhaps other users know this process already. But, it's not a complaint of course, just information for a newbie. We've even placed a label maker reminder on the cooker to remind us to "reset pressure valve" to keep our learning process smooth.  Overall, it's a great addition to our food prep and goals of eating freshly made meals.  We bought this model because it was highly rated, and deservedly so.

review_title: Good but wish it actually had a memory function.
review_body: I really like almost everything about this scale. Its nice looking, it seems accurate and it was a good price. What I dont like is that it doesnt have a save function. Now I get that it does not have anything about saving weight in the product guide and I should have asked but its a scale and its the 21st century how hard would it have been to add a function to save 1-2 weight measurements. Its the whole effing reason you have a scale to see changes.

review_title: So far it’s working well. I will try to ...
review_body: So far it’s working well. I will try to update my review once I’ve had the item longer. My only complaint is I wish the display screen was slightly larger. It is a bit difficult to read as I have low vision.
Could never get the same weight twice. Other than that it was great. Tried replacing batteries. Didn't work.

The scale is very well constructed but the results are very inconsistent.. I have been to 2 different doctors at least twice a month for a few months now. I have had a steady decline in weight due to illness. With the results from 2 different offices and then the hospital before surgery my weights remained consistent.. We got the scale post operatively and tested weights. The scale read 5 pounds heavier for myself.  Then I used it the next day and I gained another 5 pounds. I proceeded to test the scale on the different parts of the bathroom floor and even the kitchen. My results were several different weights.. I went back to the physician very recently and my weight was 1 pound down from my preoperative weight. The scale gave me an 11 pound differential.. I would not recommend this scale unless you like playing games with your weight.

I bought this product 2 months ago going by the good reviews here. Initial 1st week, i was happy with the values it showed. Then i used almost after a month and i saw that i gained almost 6 pounds which could not be true. So for a small experiment, i stood again on the scale only to see that it should 3 pounds less. i and my husband repeated the same for almost 10 times with considerable gap and it never once showed one constant value. A week before i used my sister in law had checked hers, it showed 154 lbs for my sister in law, who is actually 145lbs, we went into believing (since she is a foodie) and my husband gave his upset sister a lecture on how to lose weight. LOL!. My bad, i lost the guarantee card which i did not even fill.

This scale is perfect for me, it's lightweight and consistently weighs me the same weight- unlike some scales that don't weigh consistently. Seems to be pretty sturdy.. Update after 18 months of use:. Until about 6 months ago, this was working well. Now, it weighs me drastically different weights if I step on then step off then step back on again, or if I weigh myself on one part of the floor then move it even a few feet over. I'm trashing this one and buying a more reliable brand.. But hey, if you need a scale that'll work for only a year and is pretty cheap, go for this one.

review_title: Nice price for a good scale.
review_body: Love the scale.  Very easy to weigh yourself and very accurate, right with my doctors scale.  Bought this because I decided to go on a diet, and loved the fact that it could hold bigger gals like me.

I was pretty excited to get this scale. It was ready to go, right out of the box. My kids stepped on and weighed themselves because they were so excited to have some new tech in the house. However, after about the third time we used the scale, it stopped working. It'll tell my 65 pound son that he weighs between 150 and 280. It'll say zero just sitting still, and then suddenly switch to displaying 384 pounds. If you want a product that lasts long term, maybe don't get this.

review_body: I hesitated buying this since it didn't include a BMI reading but then I thought, when was the last time that I actually used that settling anyway? It looks nice too and I just wipe it with a soft cloth when it gets a few water spots.
I've had several scakes, some relatively pricey. This is the best scale of them all so far. Doesn't do fancy things but does measure weight well and quickly.

review_title: Does its job, but needs slight improvement
review_body: I buy these refills for our . . They fit in the pail well and do what they are designed to do. My only suggestion for improvement would be to have the end of the bags be connected to the plastic ring somehow. I dislike when I get towards the end of the pack and I throw a diaper in and the whole bag falls into the pail. I feel so wasteful having to cut the life of a bag short because it won't stay in the ring. Sometimes I'll cut off the filled portion and the remaining bag isn't quite long enough and I end up pulling the whole rest of it out. If it was glued in there somehow, then I could use up every last inch of the bags without wasting any.. One tip I've seen people mention that I am going to reiterate is how to get more out of your bags. When it's time to empty, I push down whatever diapers are in the pail and squeeze out the extra air. I keep doing this until I have a compact air-free package of dirty diapers and then I cut the whole load off and tie it up. This will save you a lot of bag length. Try it next time and check out the difference between where you would have had to cut before and where you ended up cutting after pushing the air out. This technique will prolong the bags.

review_title: It keeps the poop smell in with less waste than the off-brand competition
review_body: These refills work to keep the poop smell in, and I guess that's pretty much all I'm looking for here. With one exception, which is why I've only give 4 stars. They really should somehow let you know when you're almost out of bag so you can continue to use the end vs being left with too little bag to use and having no choice but to waste it. I will say, though, that this is far superior to the cheaper off-brand version also sold on Amazon. The design for the off-brand bags allowed more bag to come out with each diaper inserted, resulting in SO much waste. The Playtex refills let you really stuff the diapers in, so you're wasting as little as possible.

review_title: Good product but a little expensive.
review_body: This product works great with our Diaper Genie 01210 Essentials Diaper Disposal System. It is easy to refill. It's nice that you can just tie off the end whenever you are ready to take out the trash. We have one child; he is 6 weeks old and goes through 8-10 diapers a day. One of these refills lasts us about 10 days (meaning the pack of 3 is about a one month supply). I have no complaints about the product itself or the functionality; however, I do think it is a little expensive. $19 a month seems crazy to spend on just the plastic bags I throw diapers in. I will be looking for a cheaper alternative, but like I said I am happy with the product itself.

The generic ones are terrible. The plastic top on the generic isn't tight enough, so you waste a bunch of bag every time you push a diaper in. These are designed better, but for some reason most of the packages come like the photo below - 8' of wasted product because it's folded over on the inside. So essentially this thing drives me crazy every week, whereas the generic annoys you every time you change a diaper.

review_title: The plastic is a good thickness and holds the diapers without splitting
review_body: These refills fit perfectly inside of the diaper genie. I've tried to tuck a regular trash bag into an empty canister when we've run out but it was too bulky and didn't allow the lid to close completely. I regretted trying to use a regular trash bag after just a handful of diapers. I've had an issue twice with trying to figure out where the bag begins when I've opened a new container, but was able to tuck the extra plastic back in without an issue. The plastic is a good thickness and holds the diapers without splitting, stretching, smelling, or leaking. I have recommended both the diaper genie and these refills to friends looking for diaper pails and intend to use the diaper genie and these refills with any future children I may have.

The first two containers we used without a problem. When I installed the 3rd container I started to smell something horrible in the room.  The plastic had ripped inside the genie.  This has happened a few times now with the 3rd container.  I also don't like how much plastic you end up wasting. These are also ridiculously expensive. I will be switching to a regular trash can with cheaper trash bags.

review_title: No compliants, gets the job done!
review_body: These work out pretty well for us. In the past two years, I can count on my hand the number of times the bag has split. I like that they are easy to use and empty. I wish it had some sort of anchor at the end of the bag, attaching it to the container so it wouldn't fall into the bin when the roll runs out. I haven't tried any alternatives and am not motivated to do so, so they must be fine for what they are. We do the subscription to help save a little on overall cost.

I've had these on subscribe and save for at least 5 years.  I'm just beginning to potty train my youngest and for the better part of 5 years this product worked great!  Lately however, the bags have been quick to get holes and I haven't done anything differently.  I sent a complaint in at the end of last year and since then have had numerous more problems.  I'm not sure if they changed their manufacturing process but something isn't the same.

review_title: Diaper Genie Elite and Diaper Genie Refill Review
review_body: We bought the diaper genie and in 3 days the pale was full, we were shocked because it says it can hold up to 250 diapers what they don't tell you is you have to cut off the bag and reload it when it's full. The problem lies with the bags being to narrow so you have to keep reloading and pulling the extra bag down every time the pale gets full. It's a pain however it's worth it to not smell dirty diapers in your room/house. For a brief week we used a closed lid garbage can and it made the entire room smell the seal is just not the same as the diaper genie. Would highly recommend the diaper genie. Also, this one in particular has a foot petal so easy when you have one hand holding the baby and a foot to open the lid...genius!

review_title: You will need this.  Many of these.  So much comes out of your child it is unbelievable.  Keep the smell at bay with this.
review_body: When you have a infant/toddler, you cannot ever not have extra DiaperGenie Refills (sorry for the double negative).  It doesn't even make sense to buy this in the store.  I save so much money here.. Here's a ProTip: instead of shredding your sensitive documents, tear them up and throw them in with a dirty diaper.  Nobody is going to be opening a blue sausage of diapers trying to steal your identity!

On the plus side, these don't seems to leak carbon as badly as the old ones. They also don't need a long soak in water before inserting, just a brief rinse.. On the bad side, these seem to filter slower than the old ones.. Overall, an improvement on the older filters!

review_body: This is the new design to replace the old filters. Fine, i bet it works great when the water actually goes through it. Whatever you did to the new design, this filter does not correctly sit in its intended housing in the pitcher. When i add water to the filling reservoir, the water travels through the filter but because of the design it is not seated firmly against the walls of its housing so water is able to get by and drip down the sides of the filter into the pitcher.. Horrible design flaw, ruins the point of the filter. I have noticed a huge difference in taste of my water now that it is not all being filtered. If i didn't have nasty water, i wouldn't care.. review_title: These mattress protectors are the best! I have bought a total of 12 of ...
review_body: These mattress protectors are the best!  I have bought a total of 12 of these now in different sizes for the whole family.  They protect your mattress without making you hot when sleeping on them.  These were actually recommended by the mattress store where I purchased my Temperpedic mattress.  I have been using these for three years now and love them!  They wash and dry so easily.  Thank you for putting them on such a great sale!  I bought more for my daughter and son's families as well.  Don't hesitate to buy these.  You won't be sorry!

Bought this for our daughters bed, before she even experienced any accidents, we have had no problems with accidents in the two years she's been in her bed with no diapers or pull ups. Once we put this on her bed, a month later she had an accident...this cover kept her one month old, brand new mattress completely dry. I was able to easily take it off with her sheets and throw them in the washer and put them back on her bed all within an hours time. This cover is wonderful, I love the cotton feel, there is no sound whatsoever to it having the waterproof under side, and it's held up so far in three washes and her mattress is still brand new!!

My son wet his bed for the first time since I put this mattress protector on his bed and it worked perfectly.  His mattress was completely dry!  My son actually woke up in the middle of the night this time because he felt the wetness (usually he sleeps through to the morning when he wets his bed).  So, I did catch it quickly and I think he woke because the protector kept the wetness contained.  I am very pleased!

review_title: Really great product. Washes and drys well
review_body: I bought a very expensive bed cover for my toddler when we bought his bed at a mattress store. This one has the same quality at a portion of the price. Plus it is big enough to fit over the bumper that is on the side of his bed to prevent him from falling out. Really great product. Washes and drys well.

I have been very happy with this product.  It has done everything promised without a plastic feel.  Keep in mind it is not a mattress pad but a protector.  If one likes the additional padding of a mattress pad, this protector CAN be used in tandem without any problem.  I wish I had known of this product when I first bought my mattress.  Definitely worth the price.

review_title: Bought this waterproof protector for my bed
review_body: Not much to say....it serves its purpose......I have a cat that pees on my bed during the day, so I bought this to cover the bed during the day so she or he doesn't pee on it....they peed on the Mattress cover once, and it protected my bed.....I removed the cover, and replaced it with a second one while I washed the first one....So I have one the bed wears during the day, and one clean to replace it if they pee.....GREAT product, serves its purpose.....they haven't peed on it lately.....Nasty territorial cats....(I have 2 that hate each other).....Don't laugh, this was easier that going up to bed at night and finding my bed peed on.....

review_title: SO happy I decided to give this pad a try!
review_body: Checked consumer reports and this was the top rated mattress pad. The reviews were all positive, so I decided to give it a try. When it arrived I was unsure, because it is made from like a fleece, I thought it would be hot. That was the last thing I needed!  But I love it!  We have it on our king size Temperpedic. It is not hot, it is comfortable, not noisey  (being waterproof) and my sheets fit better and stay in place better.  I am SO happy I decided to give this mattress pad a try!,

review_title: I put another layer of cotton padded mattress cover over this cover because I burn like a furnace at night
review_body: Does really seem to do its job as a dust mite protector.  I put another layer of cotton padded mattress cover over this cover because I burn like a furnace at night, so I was worried that I would be super extra hot with a waterproof layer under me.  I'm still a little warmer than usual with it, but it isn't noisy or anything, so I'll keep it.  I think someone who does not run extra hot at night would not notice the slightly higher temperature at all.

I chose this pad after reading other reviews....I like that is water proof but definitely does not have the crinkling sound when a person moves around in the bed...easily fits a hospital bed mattress...washes easy....would recommend it especially for people who are caregivers and have hospital beds in the home

I was looking for something to replace my crock pot and stumbled across Instant Pot. After reading some reviews and doing alittle research I decided to give it a whirl. I was not disappointed! I highly recommend following some facebook groups or even looking on Pinterest for insight and recipes. I love how it works, As a mom to two under two, spending hours on dinner is not something I can do. This has made it possible for me to make delicious, full meals that taste amazing and only spend a short amount of prep time on. The meat turns out so amazing and falls apart! I have also used it to make baked potatoes and sweet potatoes. Seriously makes them so quick and soft all the way through. I have also been able to save space because I have packed up my crock pot, rice cooker and egg steamer. This machine does it all!

review_title: This thing looks like R2D2 and is almost as handy to have around.
review_body: There are a thousand reviews on here that say the same thing, but let me add to it.  This thing is awesome.  I hesitated buying it as it's huge, and I'm generally cooking for one but so far it hasn't been an issue. I do a lot of what is called pot-in-pot cooking. I have a couple of small metal bowls that I use for cooking smaller quantities of rice & oatmeal.  I love that I don't have to babysit it like I do if I'm trying to make oatmeal on the stove. I cooked a whole butternut squash in it the other day and that was amazing.  I've also cooked one pot pasta which was great.  Garbanzo beans, beans and rice, potatoes and eggs.....it handles it all with ease. I love it. The photo is potato corn chowder, with brussels sprouts and garlic roasted in the. .  The two appliances complement each other perfectly.

Terrific Item..... they have replaced the non stick coating which some people complained about. I have not had food stick.. I still have to learn to use the other features, but the pressure cooker aspect is great.. It takes 10 to 15 minutes to warm up but that is not a problem. Some complained about that.. Really! You expected Instant Pressure?. The mesh basket which fits this item is also a great feature. Just snap off the handles with a pair of pliers to fit in pot.. No great skill or strength needed. I ordered 2 and used one with the handles on as a colander.. *If you get meat on sale (Chuck/Pork Chops, Chicken), put into pot with 1 cup water for 40 minutes and it comes apart like pulled pork consistency.

review_title: Great Appliance but recipes are for the bigger version.
review_body: Looks nice not too big. We got the 3 QT job.. Some good recipes and will replace most rice maker functions too.  Just note that the book is for all pots and if you follow one. do not forget 3 QTS will never hold a 7 QT recipe. Ever!. Good appliance.

After less than half a dozen uses, the steam release handle no longer works to seal in the steam, even when it is definitely closed. This resulted in a severly underdone roast and i am reluctant to try any more recipes until this problem is solved. This should not have happened. Amazon  should make it easier to report a problem with an item that they sell that can be fixed.

review_title: Not for crusty bread or baked potatoes. Great for stews & beans.
review_body: My mistake when ordering. I thought I could use it to bake bread and potatoes. Nope. Steamed bread? Yep! Steamed/boiled potatoes? Yep!  But, not what I hoped for.. AND forget the word instant and ignore the ridiculous cook times. The one cup minimum of liquid needs to come to a boil and release enough steam to pressurize the unit BEFORE the cook time starts. Afterwards meats and most other meals need 10-15 minutes of Natural Pressure Release before you can open the pot.. I still rate it 5 stars because it does what it does so well. I'm still glad I purchased it.. Tip: Don't buy a glass lid until you check what you already own.. Get recipes from proven sites, not random Pinterest posts or blogs. Good ones include; Amy and Jackie, Hip Pressure Cooking,  Pressure Luck, Frieda Loves Bread.

review_title: Perfect whole grain rice and lot's more
review_body: I wasn't sure if I'd like this Instant Pot IP-DUO60 7-in-1 or not. But, it is easy to use and I liked all the safety features and the larger size will make it more versatile than the smaller size. I grew up with my mother using a pressure cooker but I never really adopted using it as an adult but lately have decided to change that. The unit arrived quickly and was in good condition. It arrived in a cardboard box within the product box. The Instant Pot IP-DUO60 7-in-1 unit has a lot of nice features including ability for making yogurt and rice. After doing the initial test run I decided to try cooking whole grain rice. The included recipe booklet has both English and Chinese language broken up into 2 different sections. Interestingly, the pictures in the Chinese section was much bigger than in the English section. Anyways, I followed the whole grain rice English recipe which uses the manual mode and not the rice mode. I couldn't believe it - in about 30 minutes the whole grain rice came out perfect-the best I've ever had! I noticed that the unit came up to pressure very fast - faster than I can do on the stove with my traditional pressure cooker. It also didn't produce any steam or overflow liquid (like I've seen happen in my Cuisinart rice cooker which produced a horrible mess). It's handy that it has a little overflow container should any liquid come out. I also made vegetable soup which came out great. I do pay attention to the maximum fill line. It's so nice that once it's set you can leave it to it and don't have to watch over it. Nice feeling of freedom.

Pressure cooker meets slow cooker.  You need to re-learn all your recipes all over again (mostly by trial and error) or you will get a watery mess. I like that you can just forget about it after you start it, and things stay warm until you decide to return. I have an old slow cooker,  now collecting dust and taking up space. After the Instantpot honeymoon, I tried to store it away too, but it's so big (6qt) I could not find any shelf tall enough! Its forgotten once you move it down stairs -- maybe bring it up for the winter soups and stews. (see photo - 12 inches high with lid inverted.)

The biggest problem with this appliance is the slow-cooker function, which simply doesn't get hot enough. I was hoping I could get rid of my old slow-cooker and replace it with this, but I've found that even on high, the Instant Pot can't maintain already bubbling food at a simmer and doesn't work at all to cook meat, beans, or soup over an extended period. It's frustrating, because if the slow cooker temperature were about ten degrees hotter, the Instant Pot would be close to perfect. I love that I can use Saute to brown meat, then use the pressure cooker function to cook it into pot roast, all in the one pot with easy clean-up. Although I know other people swear by it as a rice cooker, I find it's just about as fast and easy to make rice on the stovetop, but for cooking beans, it's an absolute winner. All in all, its low slow-cooking temperature really limits its usefulness, but it's still worth having as a pressure cooker.

review_title: Join the cult of IP. Very well made. Have fun cooking in a new way.
review_body: I have a top of the line pressure canner, but it is too big and heavy to use for pressure cooking. This is a great tool for meal prep. Look for when it is a lightning deal for under 80 bucks and you will be happy all day. Apparently love of this thing is cult-like, so when you get one, look on FB if you do that sort of thing for IP groups. Lots of cool tips. If you have been humdrum about cooking, this might light the fire again. Also apparently the love of these things is so great there is even a trend for people to put decals on them to customize... seriously, it is a thing.. I don't judge.

Bought this to replace another scale that was totally off.  This one is great and I weight the same on this scale as I do at the one at work.  Love that it lights up so I don't have to turn on the light, just to read my weight.  It's simple, it's flat so you don't have to worry about not stepping exactly in the right spot.

review_title: The numbers fluctuate every second, depending where I move ...
review_body: The numbers fluctuate every second, depending where I move the scale.. Also I prefer a white scale to match my bathroom , not black , but it wasn’t an option. Still I like the large size numbers and I didn’t bother returning it.
This is my second Etekcity scale.The first was returned because of erratic (+/-2 pound) readings.My present scale has the same problem.Is this the accepted standard for digital scales?

I bought this scale for a weight loss app, dietbet, which required a digital scale. I honestly love it! I try tricking it all the time, and it never disappoints. It’s accurate, easy to hide/store, and the readout is clear. I keep it under my nightstand. Great purchase!
I just got this today and I was Impressed by the quality given the price was so cheap. I tried it multiple times and the weight was right on. Very happy with this purchase!

This scale is very inconsistent in the weights displayed.  Example: I can step on the scale(following directions) and get 158.4 lbs. shortly after weigh again and get 159.2, weigh again and get 158.0. I am on a weight loss program both dieting and walking several miles each day.  I cannot rely on this scale except see that I am within a certain weight range not to measure day to day weight loss. Very disappointing!
Works just as expected.  Accurate and reliable.  Just make sure it's on solid sound surface.  Best scale I have purchased.  Would recommend this product.

I was so excited to receive this product to give me a more accurate weight measurement.  However, each time you stand on it, it gives a different number ??  So, I am left confused as to which number is accurate ??  I don't know, if I am losing or gaining ??  I would return, but not worth the cost to ship it back :(  but VERY disappointed :(  Not worth your time to purchase or be frustrated :(

Extremely accurate and easy to use.  I like that it holds the reading for a few seconds after stepping off to give me a better view of the reading. It even weighs my cat accurately (I have a large cat).  Husband and I both like it.  We have balance issues so this scale with it's low to the floor profile and roomy standing area is ideal for us.

I wanted to love this- but it is super inaccurate, I can weight myself three times in a row and get totally different readings- thirty pounds apart!  It’s not just me it does the same for hubby- I would return it but I tossed the box.

This product is a crazy money maker for Playtex. A glorified plastic garbage bag in a not-so-fancy ring. I wish the missus would let me get rid of this thing.. I have tried other solutions to diaper pails, but the smell that leaks out of this thing when you open it is crazy bad. Maybe something that breathes (leaks) a little more wouldn’t be so bad

Okay, these things are crazy expensive.  As someone who uses plastic grocery bags for garbage bags in the kitchen, I hate the cost of OEM Diaper Genie stuff.  But it works.  Take it from someone who fudged it with the first kid, and used a half-broken diaper pail with plastic grocery bags for 2.5 years with our first kid... the extra cost is worth it.  There's pretty much no diaper-y smell unless you're opening the lid to put in newly soiled stuff.. I'm going to try to justify the cost by amortizing it over the 18 years the kid will live with us...

review_title: Works for Playtex Diaper Genie - NOT Munchkin Diaper pales.  (there is a difference)
review_body: These do the job - except make sure you are getting the right ones.  I didn't know there was a difference - but I thought we had the diaper genie when really we have the Munchkin Diaper Pale.  They are basically the same thing, but have different refill sizes.  These were too big and barely fit in my diaper pale.  Since I got it to work I didn't bother returning these.

I like the bags and that you can select the length of the bags. I just wish they would contain the smell better while in the diaper genie. It's not bad while the pail is closed but get the smell as soon as you open it. Also I wish the black stripe that warns you that it is almost gone would be longer. Or if a had a line not to pull after so that you could get use of as much as you can. I know once I pulled saw the black strip and though I could get the length of the pail but that was not the case. The rest came out and was unable to use a large chuck that could of probably fit 10 diapers or so. But aside from that it is easy to use and it does the job.

review_title: The Diaper Genie Refill's are for Fido.
review_body: You're gonna laugh!! My baby is 14, so I don't need this for him.  We got our first dog a few years ago.  He is the most amazing, smart, loving, beautiful lab/retriever you could ever ask for; BUT, his poop smells so bad, it's painful!  The only place we can dispose of "man's best friend's" poop, is in the garbage can - in our garage.  Trust me when I tell you the smell of one "offering" is hair curling, eye watering, dry heaving, fun.  Imagine a weeks worth!  I bought a diaper genie, these liners, and problem isn't solved on hot weeks; but, all other days/weeks it works like a charm. I have this product on auto ship, so I automatically get them once a month.  That's how necessary they are at our house.

I ordered a Playtex diaper system last August. When the included diaper genie ran out, I opened a second one.  The blue film was welded to the plastic housing and could not be used.  Frustrating, especially when you have a full diaper and no where to put it.  A mess!  So I calmed down, set the whole unit aside and opened another refill a week later.  Similar problem, but this time only an inch or so was welded to the shell and I was eventually able to pull it loose.  I then was able to use the refill.  Playtex has a quality problem.  I am sure that it is difficult to inspect for a bad weld, but I would buy someone else's product until they get it solved.  I am an old VP Operations for a medical  disposables company and most of the Playtex products are amazing,  but this one left me with stinky hands and a grandson asking what those new words meant that Pops said.

review_title: Years supply - that's funny. I probably go through about 2-3/month of these
review_body: You may as well buy in bulk.  Years supply - that's funny.  I probably go through about 2-3/month of these, and my guy is now 18mos old - so less diapers than a newborn.  They really do help with the smell of poopy diapers!  I wish there was a better way to end the roll, though... when it is at the end of its shelf life, you pull down to knot it and suddenly the rest of it just comes out and you wasted some bag.  But - small price to pay.

review_title: Why didn't I do this sooner.
review_body: We have our changing table in the guest room. That's where I have the TV and where I veg out. My wife came into the room a couple of months back. "OMG. This room stinks!" Guess I'd gotten used to it. We had the Safety 1st Easy Saver pail since my daughter was born 2 years before. I thought it worked ok, but my wife didn't agree. So, I bought this system. And don't know why I didn't do so sooner. No more smell. Wife is happy. I'm happy. The first two bag rings lasted us 48 days. Just put the 3rd ring in a few minutes ago, and ordered more. Because, even though this baby is almost out of diapers, we just found out last week we have another one on the way.

Really no complaints.  The odor is always near zero unless I am changing the bag. The only thing I have never liked about the design is the tube (bag) is too narrow, if it was a bit bigger it would hold considerably more diapers.  Was not a big deal at first with newborn diapers but now we are up to size 3 and it fills up so fast.  Still, I was skeptical, looked like an expensive gimmick, we own two and it's the only thing we use.

review_title: I am even happier about our decision to go with the most effective ...
review_body: We were told time and again how no one ever uses their Diaper Genie and to just take the trash outside.  I don't know who these people are any more and how they have such extra time to run each diaper to an outside trash can.  I would have been much angrier during the first three months of my child's life if I did not have a Diaper Genie (first world problems, obviously), and now that he is eating solid food, I am even happier about our decision to go with the most effective odor control system in diaper disposal.  Yes, the refills are expensive, but they do exactly what they say they will do.
It's a filter and it fits.  Arrived on time.

review_title: The first week was working fine after that the filter clogged
review_body: I thought was going to replace my water bottles so I bought Brita & this replacement. The first week was working fine after that the filter clogged. Bad experience so I back to my water bottles.
Great product! Best price.
So far so good. We'll see how long it lasts.

I opened one of these filters (the sealed individually-wrapped package it came in) and it was web inside. Not even just moist but actually wet. Really odd. Since I bought a three pack it's way past the return date by the time I discovered this... Disappointed and out a small chunk of money. :(

Truly disappointed. I was excited about a long lasting filter that removed 99% of lead. It doesn’t work. The water doesn’t go through the filter at all. This is the second Longlast filter I’ve bought. I thought maybe the first one I bought was defective and I’d just try another. Both defected and do not work. Not worth your time.

review_body: it's necessary to filter the tap water here, and brita water tastes good, and the filters remove those chemicals i can't name, from our water.  these filters last a long time, so i believe they're worth the protection of my health that they provide!
Use with my Brita water pitcher. Work great
Will purchase again.

Almost as good as bounty and a few dollars cheaper
great product for less the price!
