review_title: Great paper towel at a great price!
review_body: This is an excellent quality paper towel. The quantity is wonderful for the price.
Great product!

It's quiet (doesn't make that crinke noise that plastic or cheap vinyl makes)  it's soft & comfortable and fits my super deep mattress! And it does protect against liquids. The first day I put it on my brand new mattress my puppy peed on my bed and this mattress cover is the only thing that saved my brand new mattress from a big urine stain. It washed out easily and it kept my mattress dry and clean! I  would recommend this mattress cover to anyone.

I always thought a mattress protector was a mattress protector right? I mean, what's the big deal, as long as you have one on it really doesn't matter. Boy was I wrong!! I have purchased several brands for the 3 beds we had in our home, and most came from from Walmart because it is the only local superstore nearby. BIG mistake!! SafeRest outshines all the rest, they are made the way mattress protectors should be  made! No vinyl base to crinkle and make noise with each movement, no bunching up, soft to the touch, easy machine wash and dry AND they fit and protect well!! What more could you ask for! Best mattress protector I've ever purchased, and will be my go-to brand from now on!!

We bought this mattress pad to protect my 3-year-old's new mattress.  She is potty trained during the day, including naps, but has occasional accidents.  We have also had pull up leaks in the middle of the night.  The mattress looks as good as new, even with several accidents.  When we have an accident, we remove the mattress pad to wash it, and the mattress is completely dry.  We like this so much that we bought a second one, so we could immediately remake the bed.  We also bought one for our bed (King Size SafeRest Premium Hypoallergenic Waterproof Mattress Protector -...)  for times we let her nap in our bed or just to keep the dust mites out.  I have and will continue to recommend this product.  While we have only had this since Spetember 2012, it has endured several washings (without fabric softener as directed) and the product still looks like new.

review_title: Keep Mattress Dry without Getting in Your Way
review_body: Our son has problems with staying dry overnight. Even with Depends undergarments on, he still wets the bed often. In many cases, he wets it very badly. We had one of these for his twin bed, and it really did the job. I think only once a little bit got through, but that was a very severe one. Keep in mind this is only one time out of at least dozens. He recently got a full size bed, so we bought one in that size. We have been very happy with these. They are light-weight, easy to wash and dry, and you do not even notice it is on the bed. There is no smell (once you wash it initially), and there is no rustling from plastic like some protectors. It's very durable (survived many washes with no problems). I highly recommend this; it will protect your mattress and will not interfere with your comfort.

We have tried many different products. Up to now, thus has been the best. They have been getting washed daily (sometimes with bleach although not recommended), dried in dryer on normal heat, and still going strong! They are noiseless, comfty, and fit just right on the 8in and 4 in mattresses. Very satisfied!!

review_title: but so far we are very satisfied. Our bed is over 14 inches tall
review_body: We shall see how it stands up to wear and tear, but so far we are very satisfied. Our bed is over 14 inches tall, and our old sheets didn't fit, so I worried this wouldn't either, but it does with plenty of room. It's quiet and soft-- exactly what I wanted!

We purchased a very expensive non toxic mattress for our young son. This mattress cover proved it’s worth last night when he filled his training pants and leaked a bit. We put several layers of protection on the mattress exactly for this reason and the layer beneath this cover was dry.

I had my doubts at first, so I did a test to make sure it's both breathable and waterproof.. For breathable, I slept 1 night with this protector, and 1 night without.  Same temperature in the room both nights; didn't sweat anymore on my soft-ish mattress when I used the protector.  So yes for breathable.. For waterproof, my newborn daughter accidentally...  You get the idea.  And the mattress was completely dry underneath the protector.  So yes for waterproof.. Overall, a VERY good investment.

review_title: Good quality, easy to put on
review_body: I ordered this to protect a new 10" memory foam mattress. I have an old dog who periodically has issues with incontinence and our last bed was ruined by this. This mattress protector was easy to put on. The waterproof top (which is not noisy at all and has a soft top with waterproof backing, I believe) covers the entire top surface area well and the fitted sheet sides extend pretty far past our regular fitted sheet. It stays put well, even over the mattress protector bag that the mattress came with. It does not seem to interfere with the beds temperature at all- I tend to feel too hot at night and haven't had that issue with this bed and mattress cover despite the hot weather we've had lately.. Fortunately for me (but unfortunately for the review) the cover has not yet been put to the waterproof test. It seems that it will hold up well to at least a moderate amount of liquid. And I don't believe that the sides not being waterproof would be an issue for the average person. It seems to offer adequate protection for most uses, and perhaps helps with proper ventilation of the mattress by not wrapping the entire thing in a waterproof bag.

review_title: So far so good, it is for a brand new mattress in ...
review_body: So far so good, it is for a brand new mattress in a guest room, so I have not personally slept on it yet. But, our guests has not reported any issues and I've asked if they noticed a cover was on it (they did not). It has nice deep pockets, so it fits very securely.
I received my order on 6-15-18, I’m writing this review on 8-23-18 because i am just now placing another order. So they lasted a little over 2months.
Great price and great quality.
loved them

yep—everyone else is right; this thing is amazing.  the day i got it, i had in on the counter reading directions etc, and then started to make my dinner and began to run cold water over a frozen tuna steak to thaw but figured i’d take a leap of faith and try it in this guy.  i seasoned the frozen slab of tuna, stuck it in and four minutes later it came out pink in the middle and if not as though seared on the outside, at least baked.  crazy!!. —google it and make the crack chicken recipe for your family.. —i have twin 11 yr old boys, so even tho we’re not a large family, i make food in large batches to freeze individual portions later and i’m glad i went with the 8 quart.  that said, if you’re tight on kitchen storage space, take note of the dimensions of this behemoth.

review_title: The best black Friday gift I bought to myself!
review_body: Thanks to a Facebook group for AIP followers I bought the pot for past Black Friday when someone posted it was 50% off on Amazon. Great deal and the pot has been so useful for cooking vegetables in about 6 minutes. Everything takes a lot less amount of time to cook and since you need to use a very small amount of liquid to cook veggies you don't waste nutrients.  Still need to try it to cook meats but I recommend it greatly!

So many things can be cooked in this Instant Pot but even the simplest things like rice, taste better than my old steamer. All I really needed was a steamer but the first one I ordered came dented and I decided it was time to try pressure cooking. If you have a family, you should consider a larger pot, but my husband and I do not require more than what the mini has to offer.. Excellent quality and cleans up easily. I found a website where a couple tests out different times and pressure release methods on each recipe. I also bought 3 Kindle versions of vegetarian recipe books (.99 each!) because there is a lot of focus on meat in the book that comes with cooker.. It's a real time saver and takes the "fear" out of pressure cooking!

review_title: Very convenient!  Ordered a second unit but it was bad.
review_body: + Gets slow cooking things like beans/etc done about twice as fast as normal, and not having to monitor, add water, burn and set off the smoke detectors and ruin pans!. + Excellent build quality.  The stainless insert is amazing, I have not seen as high a quality metal/finish before.. - Slightly confusing function controls.  Not too bad, but prefer using manual mode most of the time.. - Some cooking instructions/recipes included have incorrect times.  Chickpeas took 50min not 35min!  Pretty far off.  We simply do a test run with our first batch of whatever we're cooking and then adjust and write the new, correct, time in the book.. - Doesn't work well for thick soups/etc, Lentil soup from recipe book burned a bit on the bottom.. Overall, very satisfied, instructions and recipes aside, it's great!. (Update 8/8/14). I bought another one of these because the first is working so well for my girlfriend!. However, I received the new one and the stainless insert was pitted and had rust all over the bottom!  It definitely was not safe to eat from.  I almost looked as if the unit had been used before, the packing was sloppy too.  Luckily Amazon has an awesome return service!  I was very surprised by the poor quality of what came after having got the first one which was perfect.  I hope the replacement is better, otherwise I'm going elsewhere!

review_title: Product Good, problem handling:not so much!
review_body: When it was working, this pressure cooker was easy to use. I used it, at least, 3 times per week. I purchased it dec. 1, 2015 and sadly 2 days ago it just stopped working.(noPr) I followed the troubleshooting tips, nothing, i put in a work ticket per instructions. I quickly received a reply with a list of 8 steps to a "simple" test. The 1st item was to check the same items i told them i already did. Yes, the test was simple but the watching the time and logging what was happening for 30 mins was a bit much. You were also told to make of video of this happening with pictures of the lid showing the sealing ring(which i replaced by the way) and a picture of the silver label on the back of the pot along with the copy of your purchase invoice. So, no, i have never made a video of anything and at 63 years old i don't feel the need to start now! I will be replacing my pressure cooker, as soon as i can, but not with this brand! It's too bad that their customer service procedure was not as good as their pressure cooker!

I like to cook, though being a single person cooking can be a bit of a pain. I used to own a seperate crock pot and pressure cooker; the PC was the type that needed babysitting. I saw this 3qt model and took a risk. It's much easier to use than I initially thought; the the buttons make using it as simple as using a microwave.. I like the stainless steel pot and trivet, and cooking one pot is something I'm already used to . I don't slow-cook as much as pressure cook, but this unit might change that. Like the seperate  rice and steamer settings, too; cooking rice has always been difficult, and I've developed a fondness for wild rice I can now indulge.. Will be donating the old pressure cooker and crock pot to Habitat for Humanity's ReStore; I think this little unit is a keeper

review_title: Mini Duo Mini 3 Quart: Works Well For Me. Great for Small Family & Those on a Diet
review_body: Love this Mini Instant Pot.  It does what its supposed to do, and occupy very little counter space. It's my go to for quick, small meal preparation and I'm glad I purchased it.  I deducted a star because I wished it was easier to clean-Food sticks to the bottom and needs to be soaked to be removed.. I do highly recommend the Mini if you have a small family, on a diet, or just being careful about the overuse of oils and butters in your foods.

I make bone broth in this monthly, and it's so easy. I'm sure it does many other great things, but this is what I wanted it to do, and it does it well. I just throw in a bunch of bones with a cut up carrot and celery, 1 tsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tbsp fish sauce, and fill it 2/3 full with water (covering bones). Run the soup cycle for 120 mins. I pour it into a beer pitcher and the rest goes into a silicone muffin pan that I freeze and have a bag of broth discs for later!

Once over the initial fear of using this little gem, I'm now a bit hooked.  I wouldn't cook all my meals in here as some claim to do, but as a meal prep person, I find this to be a perfect tool.  It's quick (once it heats up and once you get the pressure released... add 15-30 minutes to what IP recipes tell you), easy for clean up and also takes the place of other appliances in the kitchen so storage isn't a big deal.  If you meal prep or like to have a couple of evenings a week to come home, make a good meal and then sit around enjoying your evening then this gadget is worth the $$.

We live off the grid—solely solar. You’d think an electric appliance would be too energy costly to be practical. We purchased another brand at Costco knowing it could be returned if impractical. Surprisingly it proved very practical and much easier to use than a stovetop cooker. With this experience we wanted a cooker with s stainless steel pot which our first cooker doesn’t  have. The Insta Pot was highly recommended. We are very pleased with its whole concept. It is much easier to program and clean. If you put your food in hot it comes to pressure very quickly and uses little energy to maintain the setting. My wife let me be the first to use it. I made the app recipe for beef chile—outstanding. And I even cleaned up the pot afterward—quick and easy.  Five stars was a given—an off the grid keeper.

It's a nice sleek scale but it doesn't always start up easily.  For the first time in many years I weighed 106 pounds.  As happy as I was, I knew that was wrong.  But this doesn't happen very often.  Most times it's accurate and I think it's a decent scale overall.

Was using scale the wrong way - don't pick it up after each use because that's when it calibrates. If used properly, it's accurate. Also, customer service immediately responded to me with advice and offered a refund / new product. Great product.

review_title: A waste of money -- keeps turning on by itself, killing batteries
review_body: I just got mine and it seemed fine for the first couple hours.  Then it started turning on by itself , saying 0.0 but staying on for 30 seconds or so.  Then it'd turn itself back on about every 10-20 seconds, after going off.  Obviously this will eat up the batteries.  Even turning it upside down, it sill keeps turning on with nothing around it.  I'm in Bali so returning it is not a viable option, so I'm stuck.

This is a really good scale for an inexpensive price. Sleek and modern looking and so simple to use that I had no issues whatsoever.  I'd recommend it to a friend.  (Not five stars as this IS a very insexpensive simple scale, but it does the trick!)

review_title: ... a scale for our vacation place and it works fine. It reads 2 pounds heavier than the scale ...
review_body: We wanted a scale for our vacation place and it works fine. It reads 2 pounds heavier than the scale at home. As long as the 2 are close and give consistent reading . . . I can split the difference.
I really like this scale. It is slim and strong. The characters in the display are large and readable. The background color is blue and the numbers are black.

I'm giving it an extra star because it worked perfectly when it was new. Now, six months later, it seems it's no longer able to detect small changes (which is why I got it in the first place). I'm trying to lose weight at a steady pace of 1 pound a week, so measuring my day to day weight is crucial, but the scale can only measure differences of about 0.8 lbs. One week I the scale showed exactly 205.0 about six days in a row, which given that I don't count calories is impossible. So two stars, it's not a good scale.

This is a great digital scale; good value for the product.  I like it's sleek look, it looks nice in my bathroom.  It's also really easy to use.  The scale comes with batteries provided.  The company checked in with me upon delivery and a few days afterwards to make sure the scale was what I expected.  They also informed me of a warranty included on the scale.  So, if you're looking for a great digital scale and awesome customer service, look no further.

I keep one in each car, one in the office, one in each bath, the diaper bag, the kitchen, etc. They absorb water like you wouldn't believe and are cheap if you buy the large 24 pack.. -Electronics is a must.. -babys face after he eats.. -car windows.. -tables.. -floors.. -sweat off my hockey visor mid game.. -sweat off my face post game.. -cat drool off windows.. -dust off of anything.. -Bottom line: they are cheaply priced, they come 36 to a pack, they last forever.  Why wont you just buy them already!

review_body: I thought these were going to be cheap and man I was wrong, very nice towels. I've only had them for a short time but so far we love them

review_title: Love these! Hate the color yellow!
review_body: This is my first foray into the world of microfiber cleaning cloths. I would probably try to find a softer version for cleaning delicate electronics, but these work great for scrubbing household surfaces.. They do a great job--I use homemade cleaning spray (dish soap, orange oil, water) on counters, and just the wet cloths on sink faucets, mirrors, shower tiles, and everything else. They shine up my chrome faucet and stainless sink with almost no effort. The three colors allow me to designate cloths for the kitchen/bath/remainder of the house--since I wash them all together, I shouldn't care, but it is nice to know your kitchen counter cloth didn't scrub your shower scum. I draw the line at toilets, but I use them for pretty much everything else. They even got the stickiness off the buttons on the back of the stove. I had tried various cleaners, magic erasers, nothing worked until this. Now we finally have non-gross oven buttons! They have not managed to degrease the wall behind the stove, however, but I'm not sure anything will. (Previous owners clearly loved cooking meat and were not so fond of cleaning walls. Eventually a backsplash will probably be the only solution.). They haven't impressed me with their absorbency, but we have a stack of cotton prefold diapers for spills, and I doubt much will compete with those.. I generally wash and dry the cloths on normal cycles, though dryers are not recommended. They do cling to the other laundry and attract small bits of lint, but I'd rather deal with that then hanging them all to dry individually.. My only gripe is the yellow color. Blue and white are great colors for cleaning, but the yellow just makes me think of pee and cheese (not necessarily at the same time.) I assigned the yellows to the kitchen, hoping the cheese association would win out, but pretty much any other color would be preferable. Even pink. But aside from my personal issues with the color yellow, they work great!

I always used my shirt or a regular towel to clean my glasses or phone screen but was never able to get them 100% clear. With these microfiber towels, I can effortlessly fully clean my device and glasses now. Good quality product.
Nice size, work well, easy to wash and they hold up well (I've used and washed them several times over).  Good price for the quantity.

review_title: Softer than Zeus's beard. Tougher than The Rock's biceps, and more absorbent than Spongebob Squarepants
review_body: Look, there's no reason to even consider any other paper towel, than these quilted blankets of angel silk.  Feel the magic of a thousand leprechaun tribes with every sheet.  It's fitting that the competition is called "Bounty" because that poor excuse for a paper towel needs to be shot.  Plenty is enough. Plenty is all you need.  Stop being greedy by wanting anything more.. If you want the best paper towel ever, to win the lottery, and ride a unicorn straight to Narnia, then buy this product, and cross off one of these impossibly impossible achievements off your list.  With plenty paper towels, nothing is impossible.. Pros:. -Softer than Zeus's beard. -Tougher than The Rock's biceps. -More absorbent than Spongebob Squarepants. -I know I'm just reiterating the title, but it needs to be said again.. Cons:. -Does't make you breakfast in bed.  But it will clean up the mess, from being to messy while having breakfast in bed.

review_title: Although these are more expensive than the off brand refills- ...
review_body: Although these are more expensive than the off brand refills- they do seem to be more durable.  The bag is thicker and the smell is non existent.  I do have 4 different diaper genies in our house, and they are each different "types" of diaper genies and this brand fit all of them without a problem. We bounce back and forth between using these and the off brand- depending on how the mood sways us- but I know my husband much prefers the blue bag to the green bag when changing them out.

review_title: I really hate changing the dirty diapers
review_body: We got a diaper genie when we had a baby shower before my daughter was born and have been using it ever since. I really hate changing the dirty diapers, but it has to be done. The real nice thing about this diaper genie is the smell is gone after the diaper is shoved in. The refills are great--a lot to a refill ring, easy to load, easy to use and easy to remove. When other people are in the room, they do not notice it is there. Really keeps smells down. So I am a happy dad! Would recommend to everyone with children. Thanks!

review_title: Choose a lower price product because quality is not good
review_body: Apologies for the disgusting picture, but that is what happened to me today... I would suggest you but an equivalent product from another brand because the quality is not great... I am not sure if they changed the quality control because it used to be much better.

This product works great! I tried an off brand once, just to save money. After putting a couple of diapers in the pail, the pail began to stink so bad we had to empty it out much faster than the playtex. Will be sticking with playtex from now on. 3 packs of 270 for the price of $16.87 is a pretty good price. I've looked around at target, heb, Wal-Mart and other places and found a 2 pack of 160 for the price of $14 something. So this is the cheapest, and I will continue to buy from Amazon.

Having 2 children and changing many a poopy diaper with 3 diaper genes in the house (one in each bedroom and another in the bathroom of the main living area), ordering 3 a time is great, because it is always likely that when one is near empty the other two are as well.  I gave it 4 out of 5 stars for only 1 reason.  Always in the course of changing a poopy diaper and the black stripe appears on the plastic refill bag to tell me its nearing the end of the refill, i drop the diaper in, and the bag falls out of the refill holder and lands in the bottom of the genie, and its always with a poopy diaper.  There is no last minute catch to keep it from happening.  But i assure, you'll have a heck of a time getting the refill started.

The diaper genie itself is a highly over rated product in my opinion. The only way to keep the smell of dirty diapers out of your nursery is to dispose of them outside of your nursery. Since we bought one, we are in till them end. We keep the genie outside of the nursery door, so our babies room doesn't stink anymore. The positive review is for the price. So much cheaper than any other place.
I love diaper genie. I like having tons of refill because no one wants to be out of diaper genie bags!

review_title: I'm so glad these are on here
review_body: I'm so glad these are on here. It's much cheaper buying a three pack than it is buying a single one at the store. These bags (and the container) work great. I do, however, have a problem with maybe one out of 7 refills. When I initially open the refill, the bags gets stuck and tears. After I get it unstuck and pull more out, I don't have anymore problems. It's just that initial unraveling.

review_title: If I could, I'd give this product 10 stars!
review_body: These are perfect for kitty litter disposal in the Litter Locker II. When I buy half a dozen at a time from Amazon, I get free shipping and the cost per package is less than half the cost of individual Litter Locker refills at pet stores.. The Litter Locker and these refills are the perfect solution for odor free kitty litter disposal, especially for people who live in apartments and condos . Even with 2 very large cats, I only need to empty the Litter Locker once a week. These special bags truly do lock in odors until disposal.

I only bought the Playtex brand because I can't find the green label ones I usually get.  This are a thicker plastic they are harder to use in the genie.  They break more easily and in my opinion they don't hold the stink in as well as the off brand. Would not buy again.

review_title: We use this on our Foam Sweet Foam mattress
review_body: Does the job quietly and creates no difference in feel.  We use this on our Foam Sweet Foam mattress.  It has so far sustained all of the wonderful spills and stains associated with having a newborn.  We don't hear it, feel it, or have to readjust it once on.  The only time we even remember that it's there is when it's time to change the sheets and are immediately grateful to have one of these things.

I am 100% satisfied with this product- I got this mattress pad as added protection- having elderly dogs that are used to sleeping in the bed with us for years & have started to have potty issues-this is added protection for the mattress and very easy to clean up.  Also when the weather is so hot & sweaty it adds as extra protection- my mattress is always dry!  I was so satisfied that I got an additional one in a Queen size to put on the couch under our couch cover.  With all the family and dogs on the couch it keeps the couch itself dry and odor free!  No one can tell there is an added protector under the Couch Cover when they sit on the couch- doesn't make the Crinkle noise that other protectors usually make and actually adds another layer of cushion.  I recommend this product to any consumer with pets, puppies and kiddos to protect from occasional "potty" accidents-on the mattress and couch!

The weather is very hot currently and have only felt warm laying on this bed with the new cover on a couple of times so it's kinda hard to determine if the cover is contributing to this.  The mattress is new as well so I can't compare to sleeping on the mattress before or after the mattress cover.

review_title: but it's a little smaller than a queen size in your home) and it fits great! My husband has significant allergies and this mattr
review_body: We bought this for our camper (it has a queen bed, but it's a little smaller than a queen size in your home) and it fits great!  My husband has significant allergies and this mattress really helps with that!  We have 2 beds in our camper and the first one was great so we bought another one for the second bed.  Everyday Pure was wonderful to order from.  The product came earlier than expected which was great because we got it before our camping trip!

Great mattress protector! I had another brand that melted in the dryer, so I bought this on a recommendation from a friend. The first thing I noticed was how much nicer this product was, compared to the other protector I'd bought. No plastic cracking sound and it was soft and easy to put on the mattress. My 2 year old son quickly put it to the test just several days after I'd put it on his mattress! It kept the mattress dry and there were no problems washing and drying it. It came out of the dryer feeling exactly the same as it did when I took it out of it's packaging. Thanks for the great product!

review_title: Good size, no plastic crinkling noise
review_body: The product is a good size so easy to put on mattress. It doesn't have an overwhelming plastic smell like some, so you can use immediately. Also the waterproof material does not make a noise when you lie on it as some do.  There are specific washing instructions, basically no hot water or iron, but as long as I follow the recommendations I expect these will wear well. Happy enough with the product that I purchased two more.

review_title: Protectors like these were in the mattress store for almost double ...
review_body: I received my order quickly. I cannot say enough about the SafeRest protectors. I have had spills on them and various other accidents. Nothing reaches the mattress. You would never know that it has a protective backing when sleeping on it. But I also have a mattress pad on top. My previous ones have been washed many times on gentle cycle. I also put them in the dyer on low for several minutes with me monitoring. I then put it outside across my patio chairs to dry. We ordered new mattresses for three bedrooms and ordered these for them.  Protectors like these were in the mattress store for almost double the price. I highly recommend!

review_body: I just received it. I purchased it to replace a Thinner electronic scale that I’ve had for at least 10 years. I only wanted a scale that would weigh me. I didn’t need it to calculate my percent body fat or sync with my phone. I like that it is thin, but  the glass surface feels durable, and the readout area lights up in blue. It is an easy to read and simple to use scale. It uses 2 AAA batteries that are included and easy to replace (unlike my Thinner scale that I couldn’t replace the battery on). For $17 it is a great buy!

I have extremely pleased by this scale. It's fast. My old scale was one you'd have to tap to wake up, not so with this one. Step on, get the reading within seconds. It's slim profile males it feel like you're stepping onto the floor. It's elegant looking, and almost adds to my decor rather than being a clunky piece of equipment. Very pleased, would highly recommend.

I had originally received a faulty scale that had a high variance in measuring my weight. I would step on it 3 times in a row and receive weights of 211 lbs, 196 lbs, and 220 lbs, all within seconds of stepping off and stepping back on again.. After keeping in contact with the CEO of the company, I received a replacement that works perfectly. I now receive an accurate and consistent measurement after stepping on it several times. The scale is simple and easy to use! No complaints and I don't have to double check with any other scale to make sure that it is accurate.

I mean that’s sweet of it to say... but we all know that’s not possible. Oh well. If you want to buy something that will last about a year then this scale is for you. For me? Not so much.

Sparkle used to be one of the best paper towels on the market [my family purchased them for years, comparable in higher quality to Brawny]. and were priced reasonably.  Sparkle PTs went downhill once within the last few years as far as quality & value go, due to cheapening their product.  On my most recent order (late 4/2018), they changed the packaging label and very importantly they may have cheapened their product again.. I had three 2-roll big packages of the old Sparkle paper towels left from my last order, and received twelve 2-roll packages of the new & deliberately deteriorated version (same 107 2-ply sheets per roll and same 114.4 square feet area per package).  I have three observations after comparing the old higher-quality Sparkle paper towel rolls with the new cheapened product.  The new, lower quality Sparkle rolls are slightly lighter (less mass), contain thinner sheets (when held up to light), and are notably less dense & easier to squeeze vs. the old, better quality Sparkle paper towels.. I don't know why companies cheapen their product (redoing production lines & packaging designs costs big money, which they would be better putting into their product's quality) and it disgusts me when this happens.  I am sorry to say that Sparkle paper towels no longer sparkle in my opinon, after a double deliberate product decline [which benefits who?] from Georgia Pacific.  Note that Georgia Pacific makes both Brawny (hopefully still a fine-quality paper towel) and Sparkle paper towels (not so great any more), while Procter & Gamble makes Bounty -- which I don't understand why anyone would want to buy because they are not very strong or absorbent.  It might have been a highly educated business person who had this bright idea to cut cost by cutting quality . . . which may result in cut sales.  I would welcome a response from Georgia Pacific.

I like the select a size solid white rolls. The problem I have noticed besides the box being crushed is that in most of plastic packages I have opened the towels have a musty odor like they may have been wet and allowed to dry inside the plastic packaging. I have allergies and smells of this type bother me. I have thrown some away for that reason. I will not order this particular item again.

review_title: We thought we were getting a good deal and for a while we were
review_body: We thought we were getting a good deal and for a while we were. The price was good and the paper towels were just what you would want in a paper towel but the last 3 cases we have received the layers of the paper towels just fall apart and its extremely annoying when you have a crying baby in one arm and something spills so you reach for a paper towel only to have it fall apart as it comes off the holder. I was happy with this product but after the last order I decided to go ahead and cancel and look for something else.

review_title: The price is about $1.00 a roll after the Subscribe and Save discount.
review_body: I have been ordering these on Subscribe and Save for at least 2.5 years.  The price is about $1.00 a roll after the Subscribe and Save discount.  I pretty much have everything I can delivered to my door -- Thanks to Amazon!!  Use the Amazon app in the store to price check stuff, I find that most the time I can order it online and get it delivered cheaper than buying it at the store.............Paper towels are one of many items that I enjoy from Amazon.. he rolls are large and they are very absorbent.  Paper towels are much safer for cleaning up raw chicken juices and other messes you don't want on your kitchen/bathroom towel.  Box is big that they come in so you need to make room some place to store your paper towels.. Hope this was helpful - not a lot you can say about paper towels :-)

review_title: IT'S ONLY SPARKLE FOR MY HOUSE!!
review_body: I've tried a number of paper towel products.  Price is NOT all that matters!  I tried a cheaper brand and I hated it.  I don't care if Sparkle is a little more.  The quality of the towel is what matters.  Sparkle is sturdy.  It doesn't feel like thick toilet paper like some do.  Sparkle is good thick towels and you can even choose your size so it lasts longer.  I won't ever by anything but Sparkle again.  I assure you that you will love it too!

review_title: One of my favorite 'Saves' in my 'Subscribe & Save'
review_body: One of my favorite 'Saves' in my 'Subscribe & Save'. It's actually a TON of paper towels, so keep an eye on how many you have and when your next shipment sends. I wasn't paying attention one month and they sent more when I still had 17 rolls left!!! Haha GREAT deal, decent paper towels. They obviously aren't Bounty but they do the job. They are comparable to Costco's brand of paper towels. They're wrapped in twos so they are easy to stack up (particularly helpful when you order too many...) I will continue to order as long as they offer these!

I understand these aren't Bounty or Brawny. I understand these are a "bargain brand". I bought these because they were cheap. Normally I go to Costco for this type of stuff, but the previous "bargain brand" paper towel I bought off Amazon was almost as good as Costco brand, so I figured I would buy another bargain brand and not have to go to the store. These are terribly thin. It takes me four towels to clean my counter top, which is in no way a very large space. They tear when damp, and aren't very absorbent. Would definitely not buy this brand again. I'm only giving two stars because it was delivered at a reasonable pace and I didn't have to fight traffic for paper towels.

I keep buying these paper towels for the value.  Its just plain cheap vs the other expensive brands.  They are not nearly as soft or able to absorb like the other brands that are 3x the price but realistically, many people grab a whole handful and clean a tiny stain and toss in the trash.  The Sparkle brand is generally fine and does the job unless you're trying to soak up a whole bottle of water and when someone grabs a handful and tosses it in the trash you don't feel like you just lost $3 in in the trash can

I like the fact that there were so many of these for such a great price. I also like the fact that I don't have to step foot into a store to get what I need. It's an advantage to just be able to place the box into my storage, and only grab them when I need them. The rolls are also a good size too. What I do not like is the fact that they have a horrible odor. It turns my stomach every time.  I am not sure if it was just mine, as I have not seen any other reviews about this issue. But maybe the formula needs to change.

review_title: For those of us who like quality+price=good deal
review_body: For those of us who like quality+price=good deal, the Sparkle paper towels will make you happy. Our family has usually always used Sparkle paper towels. We've never been disappointed. Some of the more popular brands come with prices to match. Sparkle paper towels in my opinion are a good deal. I just purchased the 24 pack of Sparkle Papwer Towels Giant Rolls so I won't be needing paper towels for a while.

Love it, soft and doesn't feel weird under sheets, my only issue with this is that its almost like its made to wrap around the box spring and mattress whereas I have a mattress that doesn't need a box spring. so it have to super tuck the sides in

First thing I did was to read the washing instructions and wash the mattress cover.  The bed arrived a day later, great fit and you can't even tell that it's there.  Some of the really cushy pads get bumpy.  This one is very thin and unnoticeable. When summer comes, we will see if it feels hot but for now, it's great and the price was very economical.

review_title: Nice fitted sheet style mattress protector
review_body: So far we have had no problems out of this mattress protector. Bought for a child that still wets the bed (also still wears nightime protection). It's not been tested with a huge spill or big accident, but so far so good. I will say that it is just like a crib mattress protector in many ways. It does not zip up and encase the mattress, but rather fits on top like a fitted sheet. I didn't read the description well enough and did not realize this when I initially bought it (I made an assumption about it being an allergy encasement). Decided to keep it though, and it has been good so far.

Nice. Protects like it says it can. No spills going through as yet and still in use. Like the plush feeling on the surface.  Fits my bed like a fitted sheet but protects without plastic feeling of vinyl type. I can rest without feeling hot in my Caribbean climate.

We are very pleased with this mattress cover.  It is being used on a memory gel foam mattress that is 16" thick.  The cover easily fit, yet it has elastic in its construction that makes it fit the mattress.  The quality of construction is excellent.  Even when taking it out of its packaging, one gets the feeling that we made the right choice.ct. The cover has only been used for two weeks, thus the reason for four rather than five stars.  A test of its quality will come after the first washing.. .. Selecting this cover was somewhat difficult after reading the negative comments about it being "waterproof."  Since that was not a quality we required, we listened the the vast majority of customers who were pleased with this product.

The reviews I read didn't state that there was any crinkling noise, which is true, but it is not totally silent. With a sheet on top, moving/sliding in bed, or even just moving your hand across the sheet, it is quite noisy. My best description would be that it sounds like sandpaper being dragged across wood. I haven't yet washed it or tried to test its waterproofing.

My 15 year old dog is incontinent and he sleeps in my bed. I use disposable diapers on him but sometimes it leaks badly.  I have tried this mattress protector and it works great.  I use a product called zero odor which changes urine into something else.  So I don't have to wash the mattress protector very often.  The protector really prevents urine from soaking into the mattress.  It seems to help the, zero odor affected urine, to dry more quickly than if it soaked into the mattress.  So this mattress protector, and probably others, combined with zero odor is an effective way of dealing with incontinence in the bed.

review_title: His bed is a pretty thick pillow-top twin
review_body: We purchased 1 of these for our preschooler. His bed is a pretty thick pillow-top twin, so most mattress covers are a bit too snug, and I wasn't sure how this would fit or if it would be obnoxiously loud. This fits well, and it doesn't pop off even with all of his "creative" sleeping habits. It's nice and thin (and quiet), but he has had an accident after forgetting to put on his pull-ups once, and this pad did stop the mess from reaching the mattress, so we are definitely now purchasing a backup or 2.

review_title: We bought this for the rental house & so far it still fits after being used & washed /dried by the tenant after 5 months
review_body: We bought this for the rental house & so far it still fits after being used & washed /dried by the rentor. Just being able to use it AFTER a renter is a luxury. I still have to wash all of the detergent & softener out of it to be able to use it myself, but it may actually last for two sets of renters. That's a financial boon in my book.

review_title: Great quality but doesn't absorb as well as I thought it would
review_body: When I first bought this product, I noticed how it was thick enough to absorb any spills but it didn't have the scrunching or crinkling sound like many liners do. You don't even know it's there. The fit on my queen was perfect.. We had just gotten a puppy and she had a few accidents on our bed. The cover absorbed most of it, but only to a certain extent. It still penetrated down to the matrices. I would not recommend for a bed with a child that has accidents. Despite this, I highly recommend this product and will definitely purchase again.

review_title: I'm giving this thing 5 stars based solely on the ...
review_body: I'm giving this thing 5 stars based solely on the product being as described. Aside from that... I'M SCARED OF IT. This thing is intimidating, man. So much instruction.. endless possibilities, but no idea where to begin.. It's definitely got potential. I'm excited about the prospect of cooking one of the 9 million IP recipes I have seen on the countless Facebook pages I have joined... I just need to stop being a little bi.. well, y'know.. I did try cooking frozen chicken in it with my husband there for moral support. And it literally cooked 4 frozen breasts in about 16 minutes. Mind. Blown. Wish me luck on my future endeavors. I'm sure I'll put this thing through the wringer when I grow a set..

review_title: Great things about the Instant Pot
review_body: I have been using pressure cookers of different kinds for decades. A few weeks ago, my wife had one blow up on her and I decided to look into electric pressure cookers, finally deciding to buy the Instant Pot following the advice on this site and others.. It has been but a week but I am so impressed with it that I have to let everyone know.. Great things about the Instant Pot:. - It is easy to clean. And it is very light (the part that you have to clean, that is). Regular pressure cookers are monstrosities that have to be lifted with two hands and what not to clean.. - It is safe. Since the power is in control of the pot, there is no possibility that the pressure will rise to unsafe levels.. - You can set the time and forget it: you don't have to hover around or reduce the heat after the desired pressure is reached.. - There are lots of videos online.. -  It is ridiculous how simple cooking becomes with Instant Pot.. - It looks great on the counter.. - Everything that food touches is stainless steel.. - Interface is very simple.. - You can release the pressure fast if you want: just place a wet towel on top of the steam release gizmo and release the steam.

review_title: Awesome pressure cooker. We love it.
review_body: I use my Instant pot all of the time. I love the extra space over my other old 6 qt pressure cooker. I even poured water in without the inner pot. (Don;t recommend) This was about a couple days after I got it and thought I ruined it. I thought the inner pot was in and wasn't paying attention. I unplugged it. Dumped any residual water out. Unscrewed the bottom and dried it out with a hair dryer. Most of the water went straight through the bottom. Being impatient I did not let it dry out for a couple days. I was back in business about a half hour later after blow drying it out thoroughly. Food comes out great. Made some stuffed peppers in 3 minutes with some leftover taco meat from the night before. Put some cheese on, put lid back on to let it melt and they came out awesome! Added some sour cream and we were eating good. I mostly cook and my wife loves everything that comes out of our Instant Pot. Would recommend. Tons of recipes and accessories but you probably already know about that. It does take noticeably longer to heat up than our other 6 qt pressure cooker but that is to be expected. I bought this one because of the reviews and the stainless inner pot. Transitioning from non stick. Now all we use is stainless and cast iron. Definitely recommend this pressure cooker. I was worried after reading many reviews and they received dented models. Ours came without a blemish and we are extremely happy. It has earned a place on our counter.

review_title: The more I use this thing the more I find to like about it.
review_body: I must say I read with some skepticism all the breathless reviews on this thing. It may be relevant also to mention that I stumbled across this unit as I was searching for something simpler: a plain old crock pot. I'd never had one of those before but as a recent re-entrant into the ranks of bachelorhood I really needed a way to be able to cook long cook-time things (mainly stews, soups) without it taking my attention the entire time. I opted for this unit thinking that even if I only use it as a crock pot, the programming capabilities are quite bit more sophisticated than what any of the crock pots I found were offering. But in the shot time I've had it I've used it in a number of different ways besides just the crock pot feature. This unit is quite versatile. I've only used the pressure cooking feature a few times but I can say that parts works very nicely. As other reviewers have pointed out, the marketing team may have been heavily involved in crafting the claimed 70% time savings. It's a perfect marketing thing.. just enough truth to it to be confusing to the unsuspecting. Yes you probably save 70% of the actual cooking time this way, but by the time you add back in the time it takes to ramp up to pressure and the time it takes to ramp back down to ambient (less so when you do quick-release which is safe and simple) it's not quite in that range any more.. In the short time I've had this unit I have made more soups and better soups than ever before. All with very little effort. Beef stew is fantastic (I do think it's worth it to take the extra 10-15 minutes on the front end to saute the meat). The day I got it was a workday. I cam home from work and found it on the porch, and put it to use right away. After a long day at work I set the thing up to make a beef stew while I slept (in slow cooker mode). Woke up to a lovely stew the next morning, put some in the fridge for later and took some for lunch that day. Very good stew. Looking forward to experimenting with different seasonings for different versions of the stew, and to giving pot roast a try.. I do heartily recommend this unit. The only thing I could think of that I might ask for is to persuade the manufacturer to offer an earthenware version of the insert that the food cooks in. It comes with stainless, which seems to be of good quality and definitely does the job. Maybe the earthenware version wouldn't be up to the task of saute I don't know.

I love this Instant Pot 8qt PC. It does everything it claims to do. I've cooked ragu, corned beef, chocolate molten lava cake, creme brulee,  Chinese red bean dessert, pinto and red kidney beans and more. It has cut cooking time by more than half if done on the stove or oven but it does take around 20 minutes to come to pressure. To help cut the warm up time, I boil water before I put it into the PC. I also used the Cosori PC and it's night and day compared to the Instant Pot. The Cosori is so aggravating to use. It has problems cooking from the off setting. If you want to cook again after you just finished you have to jump though hoops.  You have to pull the plug and wait for the electronics to reset and hope it will work and even then it would not come to pressure or takes forever to come back to pressure.  With the Instant Pot, if the food is not cooked enough for you, all you need to do is just program it to cook again and it will without any problem.  Don't skimp. Pay the extra cost. The Instant Pot is 100 times better than other brands especially the Cosori. Believe me, I've used two Cosori and both worked the same. It was not defective. It's just does not work well. Theres a reason why the Instant Pot is rated the best because it is. Just buy it and you want regret it.

Today is the first day I used my Instant Pot.. I spent 2 days reading the manual before I dared try it..been a long time since I had a pressure cooker.. I made butternut squash and apple soup..prep time took longer than cooking time and the results were exactly what I hoped for...a fast lunch and more to freeze for a couple more meals.. I ordered a couple of cookbooks for the Instant Pot and am looking forward to Indian food at home.. I originally just wanted another rice cooker and vegetable steamer and bought this by accident.  When my daughter saw it (It's really large) she asked why I bought such a big one as I cook for myself.  This was on special and I didn't check it our sufficiently, but now i"m goad I got the bigger one.. The container works fine with fewer raw food ingredients than a larger family would use.. I love that its a crock pot,  along with being a vegetable steamer, pressure cooker and rice maker  as mine broke and I never replaced it even though I made a lot of crock pot meals.. Well worth the price.  And if you are thinking of the smaller one..reconsider and go big.  I can fit 5-6 ears of fresh corn into this to steam.

My friend recommended the Instant Pot to me, and I was eager to buy it since I HATE to cook. My husband was annoyed at me for purchasing what he thought was another gadget. Well, he gave it a try and is addicted to using it! We use it about 4-5 times a week and how easy! We threw fresh asparagus on the rack, covered it with raw shrimp with Cajun spice and 2 minutes later (yes 2!) out came the most beautiful dinner ever! We even made a cheesecake with the instant Pot which is one of my favorite uses! Highly recommend for people who hate to cook or like to get creative but have no time. You can even put frozen meats in it! It just adds a few minutes more to the cooking time! Hint; I look up recipes online and videos. They are everywhere now!

review_title: It does pretty much everything, very pleased!
review_body: I had this in my cart for over a year while I researched it, read reviews, talked with folks who had them. I finally took the plunge and I'm sad I missed out on a year of a great appliance.. One of the best features is when I do a roast. Let me preface with I do not like how a roast comes out in a crockpot. All meat done in a crockpot is done to death, soggy and shreds. I want a roast that is quick, gives me clean slices and this delivers. A great feature is before you cook your roast, you typically have to brown it on all sides in a pan on the stove. But with the instant pot you can brown in the pot itself, add onions cook them down a bit, deglaze then put your roast back in. Cook the designated time and follow the instructions for quick release or normal release (which is basically letting the meat rest in the pot while the pressure comes down as the heat is off so you don't lose all your juices and flavor) and you'll have a fantastic piece of meat.. Eggs - I live in a rural area and we are very water conservative. I always hate having to use so much water to hard boil eggs. I did a dozen eggs in 1 cup of water. Put them in, set it to low pressure for a time of 5 min and you have hard boiled eggs. And they peel wonderfully, even the very fresh eggs.. Yogurt - I've made my own yogurt for a couple of years now. Yes I'm a snob now. The yogurt comes out wonderful! The only thing I do not do is the initial heating of the milk. I do that in the microwave because you can get some scorching on the bottom and a skin on the top. So once I heat it I pour into the instant pot itself and place the inner pot into a bowl with ice to cool it down to 110 degrees, add my culture and put the pot back in and set the yogurt time for 11 hours. I do strain for about 30 min when done and it's perfect!. Chicken - I've done hot wings, chicken thighs (bone in) and chicken breasts. One thing consistent, the skin on the chicken never cooks up right to me. It's aways rubbery. On the wings I had to put the wings into the broiler to brown them up and crisp the skin. So I only do skinless chicken now.. Stock - Save those chicken bones and veggie pieces in your freezer as you prepare meals thru the month and then you can make a fast and very good stock.. Cook Delay Feature - This is great! I had a roast that I had marinating and as we all know, let your meat come up to room temp a bit before cooking. This roast needed to sit out about 45 min before cooking. So I put it in the pot with the whole red potatoes and set the delay. Worked like a charm. And I should touch on how quite the unit is. You'll hear a beep when it comes to pressure and starts the cooking process and a series of beeps when it's complete.. Do keep in mind it's a heavy heat appliance so some might not be able to run the microwave, the instant pot and have their fridge all going at once and not pop a fuse.. Would I buy this again - Yes. Would I recommend this product to friends and family - Yes.. If I could change one thing what would it be? - Have a cord lock on the back of the unit so if you move the instant pot while it's cooking the cord doesn't, A - short itself or B - pop out.. Edited - Forgot to add - be sure to download the InstantPot app. Some great ideas in there.

Amazing. I felt intimidated by it. Which to buy and how to use. I was wrong, it’s simple a great. Tons of recipes on the internet or FB groups. I recommend the duo. 6 QT for a small to medium size family. I went 8 QT because I have 3 kids and 2 will be teenage boys at some point.

review_title: In comparison with my doctor's scales, this scale is ...
review_body: In comparison with my doctor's scales, this scale is 3-5 pounds off from my actual weight! That is a SIGNIFICANT number for a person my size (4' 11").. -Calibrated scale multiple times, prior to use. -Tried different locations in the home- all with level, hard floors. -I've recently frequent the doctor's- 3 different offices in fact. My weight is 104/106 lbs according to their scales.. -This scale gives me an output of 100.8 lbs.. The design is sleek and simple. But that doesn't matter when I just want an accurate scale.

This scale is great. It powers on when you step on and powers off shortly after. It's aesthetically pleasing, I've not had to clean the glass at all. Occasionally it has issues zeroing out correctly when I first step on, which usually leaves me 10 lbs lighter. Simply stepping off and then back on again and the scale is good to go.
I've been using the scale for 2 months now and I love it! I can step on and off and it reads the same every time!
Excellent product! Very accurate right on with the scales at my doctors office. If it was to ever fail or get broken, I would not hesitate to purchase again. Digital readout is very easy to read.

review_title: New design doesn't work, results in only partial filtration.
review_body: This shouldn't be difficult to get right but surprisingly these filters do not work properly.  They are clearly a different design than the Brita filters which were produced in the past.  The new design is not an improvement, however.  Once installed these filters do not remain securely locked in place once a sufficient amount of water is filtered through them and has entered the bottom of the pitcher.  These filters float right out of their "secured" spot once a certain amount of water is beneath them.  Once that occurs the water in the bottom of the tank and the top mix rendering the filters and their filtering action useless.

This new design is top heavy and tends to fall out of place when the carafe is nearly empty. I find it unsanitary that I have to put it back in place so often. It's easier to hold onto, but I'll buy the old product if I can find it.

The Filters arrived as advertised in good condition.  We use these filters for all of our drinking water.  For the amount of water we use, each filter will last from 20 to 30 days before the filter action slows to the point that we replace it.  We have been using these filters several years and will continue to do so.
Nothing like clean water, easy to install
Avoid the longlast version!  Worked for about one week at a normal rate (filling 10 cup pitcher about once a day).  Now takes multiple hours.

This was perfect after our other mattress protector had finally stopped working from too many washes. We recently got a new puppy and she unfortunately would have an accident once in a blue moon if she was too tired to wake up and go potty outside. There have been no issues with leakage and we have a thick European plush mattress and it fits it perfectly.

And by kid I mean small children and drunken marines alike. This mattress protector has saved the guest bed from stains courtesy of nighttime accidents, drunken shenanigans, the flu, and bad hangovers. Remove, wash, place back on the bed and done. Simple. Easy. IDEAL. It really is ridiculously easy to clean and get on/off the bed. I've had other products that didn't hold up to washing well or were such a chore to get on and off the mattress that I didn't want to deal with them. And then I had the ones that were so cheap they wound up tearing and being useless. This product is easy on the wallet but worth a million bucks because it WORKS, and it works WELL. If you're going to go with a mattress protector, you've come to the right product. Don't waste your time or effort with anything else. Trust me. Your mattress will thank you.

We got one of these when my son started potty training and he just put it to the test last night after a couple of weeks of us putting it on the bed. I'll admit I was nervous when I was changing the sheets because the spot was about the size of a beach ball. I was very impressed though because our fitted sheet was soaked, and this liner was wet, but our mattress was bone dry! When I was putting a new fitted sheet down my husband asked if we needed to lay a towel down over the mattress, but I was happy to say "nope! The liner did it's job!" Just threw it in the wash this morning so we can put it back on for tonight. VERY SATISFIED!

review_title: Works great for pee accidents at night
review_body: My 5yo has started going to bed in his undies and has accidents every now and then.  This protector blocks liquid completely and it's topped with terry material so whatever the sheets don't soak up, it catches so there are no issues with urine going over the sides of the mattress as it's repelled by the waterproof layer.  I like it so much I plan on getting another set for my 5yo and 2 sets each for my 4 and 2yo to have on their beds (so there's an extra to put on while I'm washing the soiled one in case of accidents).

review_title: As good as the one I bought from tempurpedic.
review_body: I just bought a 3 inch memory foam mattress topper for a bed( which, honestly, makes it as comfortable as my other bed which is a tempurpedic.)  They recommended with the memory foam that I purchase a waterproof mattress protector which I did. This one is quite nice, fits the queen bed snugly, with the corners deep enough to handle the thicker mattresses, but stretchable to that they conform to a thinner mattress as well.  Actually it is very similar to the waterproof mattress protector I bought from Tempurpedic for the other bed at a far greater price.  I would buy again.

review_title: Sleeps better than an expensive mattress!
review_body: I wanted to sleep on this mattress a while before I gave my review. When I purchased this mattress I did a lot of research and had high hopes. I am here to tell you this mattress didn't disappoint. We purchased an Amerisleep Revere in January 2017 to the tune of $1,400.00. After 2 months of sleeping on it, I was hurting every morning. Just goes to show you expensive isn’t always better. This mattress arrived earlier than scheduled, quickly rose to the full 10 Inches and sleeps like a dream! Nice and cool. I would highly recommend. I have joint pain that usually keeps me up at night. I haven’t woken up with pain since I got this!

This pad did nothing to stop pee from leaking through from the very beginning. When I washed it, the supposedly water proof backing clumoed upon itself causing the material to buckle and not lay flat. Not recommended.

review_title: Well let just say that this is the best waterproof and comfortable material that I have ever purchased
review_body: Well let just say that this is the best waterproof and comfortable material that I have ever purchased.. I purchased this because my baby cat decided that my bed was his place to pee and sure enough the first day I set it on my mattress. my cat came and pee and it and thank God that it did not link through. I was so mad at my kitten,  I put it in the washer right away and it not only cleaned but there was no pee smell to it, that in it self is a miracle. Love it.

The actual mattress cover itself is good quality and fits very well on the mattress.. Problem is, the description is horribly inaccurate.. For starters, it is NOT VINYL-FREE!!! The top part is Vinyl-free, but the part that is directly on the mattress is definitely a vinyl like material, it may not be actual "Vinyl" but it is pretty close to it. Which that being said, "Noiseless" is a false claim, the Vinyl underneath is not sticky in any way, so its sliding around making the noise you would expect of fabric rubbing against vinyl.

This is a thin mattress protector, but it works to protect the mattress. For a waterproof mattress cover it is quiet. I did compare it to my REGULAR cotton mattress pad and my cotton one (non water proof) was quieter. But I changed it out anyway. My husband didn't know the difference and I don't notice noise when sleeping. I do not find a temperature difference with this pad. Good buy!

This Instant pot surprised me. It’s my third pot as I already own an 8qt Duo & 6qt Ultra.. I probably use this one the most. especially for oatmeal in the mornings, but I can cook a whole bag of beans in it, a whole chicken, and its perfect for my brown rice. I have to say that I'm impressed.

I was very hesitant to buy this because I didn't want another item cluttering my kitchen countertop. However, this is a life changer. My husband and  I follow the Renaissance Periodization diet templates so I am ALWAYS cooking chicken, meat, sweet potatoes, rice, etc. This cuts down on my food prep time so much, and I have bought several inserts and lids (I actually purchased the lids directly from instant pot) and I'm able to cook and then pop everything in the fridge. It's easy to figure out, and although seems intimidating at first it is well-made and will let you know if the top isn't on correctly or if there's some other issue with the pressure. Since it has a sautee and slow cook mode, it provides other options for cooking rather than just pressure cooking. I was happy this is a 2-1 in machine so I'm able to get rid of my slow cooker. Another feature that I really like is that once it shuts off, it will keep food warm for 10 hours so you can have food waiting on you when you wake up or get home from work if you set it beforehand. Really happy with this purchase and highly recommend it.

Nicely made.  Good control layout.  Clever design of steam control system.  My only complaint is the user's manual.  It's okay, but I have had questions about several of the settings that I could not answer from the manual.  I have been able to answer my questions by experimenting, however.  I have noticed that after using it about 5 times, I have a couple of small pits on the inside of the stainless steel pot.  Hopefully, this is merely cosmetic and not a sign of a failing s.s. coating.. It makes cheerful noises.  At the moment, we are using it to sterilize baby bottles more often than we are for making meals. It's very convenient as a bottle sterilizer, but be aware that you may need to choose "low pressure" for the "steam" setting so that the temperature doesn't damage plastic bottles.  A web search reveals that a lot of people has discovered this use for the Instant Pot.  I suppose other items needing sterilization could be processed in this way.. Be aware that the plastic measuring cup that comes with it is designed for measuring rice and is coordinated with the markings on the side of the pot.  It is NOT a one-cup measure.  Apparently, this minor weirdness has to do with its origin as a rice cooker.

This thing has completely changed my life.. I'm a slow cooker addict. No joke, I own 7 of them. I love hearty meals... roasts, stews, etc, so my slow cookers have been my BFF for years.. Only problem is that I stink at planning. I won't lie, there have been so many days that I meant to cook, but by the time I made it to the store, it was after noon and I had an 8 hour meal planned.. I was afraid to try this thing... but after weeks of searching out recipes, I gave in. After 1 meal, I was obsessed... I tried my beef stew. It takes me 8 hours in the slow cooker. After 45 minutes, we were sitting down to a delicious meal! I wasn't sure how the meat would cook, but it was PERFECT!. We recently went through a 30 day diet... (not sure I'm allowed to say the name!) After searching the internet, I was able to make 30 compliant meals.... 22 of them were made with my Instant Pot! There's no way my slow cookers would have worked... most of the ingredients for those meals were purchased just a couple of hours before dinner!

review_title: ... using my Instant Pot for a week now and love it! After considering buying one for a year ...
review_body: I've been using my Instant Pot for a week now and love it! After considering buying one for a year and then deciding to take the plunge on Black Friday, I am not disappointed with my purchase. I read many of the reviews before deciding to buy and the reviews are very helpful. I had planned to buy the 6 quart but the 8 quart Duo was on sale on Black Friday so that's what I bought. I'm glad I have the bigger size. As the reviews say, the instant pot does not prepare the foods instantly but it's very quick compared to many other cooking methods. It takes 10-20 min for the pot to come to pressure before it starts cooking the food (depends on how much liquid the recipe calls for). Once the cooking starts, it's fast for most things (3-20 min for the items I've made so far). There are some recipes that take longer- all depends on what you're making. Two of my biggest takeaways are: 1) buy multiple sealing rings. The sealing rings will take on the smells of the spices you cook with. I have a sealing ring for savory items (recipes using cumin, chili powder, garlic, etc.), 'sweet' items (like applesauce), and one for Indian recipes (which would be savory but I decided to designate one specifically for that type of food). I just ordered 2 more rings because I want to have a separate ring for savory recipes that don't use the spices I listed (ex chicken soup and vegetables).  2) Join some sort of beginners group on social media. I've found this so helpful. People post the recipes they use as well as questions. I would highly recommend this product!

review_title: Versatility, ease of use and cleaning
review_body: Oh my, my, my. I've only had this for about 2 weeks and am loving it ! So far I have made brown rice, lime chicken, Cuban black beans - and for the first time ever in my life - yogurt, several cheesecakes & lemon curd.  The buttons are easy to use and the instruction manual is easy to follow. I have had an electric pressure cooker (EPC) for several years and it has been great. But what I have found is that the EPC only has 1 temperature and only a 60 minute max cooking time. What I love about the Instant Pot (IP) is the versatility in choice of cooking styles and extended cooking times. But what really sold me and make me buy this IP, was the stainless steel inner pot - for health reasons. Be sure to check out the extra accessories that are available to use in your IP (such as spring form pan, strainer basket, sealing rings, silicon egg molds, glass lid, etc) as they will enhance & expand your IP experience. I definitely have recommended this product to several friends and it's just a matter of time before I wear them down :)  I know there are so many things I want to make and know that my IP will definitely be put to good use. Now will I ever use my original EPC ? Probably. But sadly it has been become a 2nd pressure cooker whenever I need one. That is, unless I add another IP to my arsenal. <3

So far I love it.  The instructions are crap, so go straight to the internet where you can pick up lots of great advice.  My first meal was chicken and noodles and it turned out great.  My family loved it and is ready for more.. Is it a huge time saver... maybe on some things.  I could have roasted some chicken breasts with vegetables, and made some noodles and gravy in the same amount of time, but I would have had a much bigger clean up and prep.  The dish was super yummy and easy, so that is a win in my book.  Don't be fooled by the cooking time.  Even if your cook time is only 5 minutes there is a good 15 minute time period in the beginning to build up pressure.  Just be prepared for that.. I can't wait to try more recipes.

While I'm not a fanatic, I use this machine a lot. Stews, beans, soups and meats mostly.  There's more that I can cook with it, but I'm not one to go as far as trying to bake a cake in a pressure cooker.  Why do I love it - cut/chop, throw in the pot, saute first (in the pot) if necessary, set the button and then forget it until it's done.  Stainless steel instead of nonstick makes me feel safer.  I have a smaller rice cooker (also stainless steel) that runs next to it.  Wait - did I mention re-heating in the Instant Pot? The steam function (with a little added water) re-heats just as fast as my microwave but with way more flavor.  Great for the winter, but I'll be back on the grill come April.

review_title: So great. So cute. Fits on the counter, unlike the bigger one.
review_body: I use this thing almost every day. I previously owned the 6 qt and have passed that along to my mom so that it stays in the family when I need to make a big pot of something. I'm currently single and the only meat eater in the house, so this 2 qt version is absolutely perfect for me. I often cook a pound of chicken or one cup of rice in it and it's perfect. This weekend I put five pounds of pork shoulder in the thing (it was a tight fit, I admit) and in 2.5 hours I had perfect pulled pork. I am an unrepentant member of the Instant Pot Cult.

We love the instant pot! I am not a brave home chef, but this was so easy and not at all scary! It cooks juicy flavorful chicken in 6 minutes. I will never cook chicken another way ever again. The 8 qt fit enough chicken to feed a party of 32 people pulled chicken sliders with enough leftovers to feed our small family for 2 weeks. I cooked boneless chicken breasts & thighs then used a handheld mixer to shred it. Added BBQ sauce and it was fantastic! Even small children that are picky eaters loved it.  They asked me to share the recipe at the dinner table. We usually like to add veggies to the ip while the chicken cooks so everything is ready at the same time. It is very easy to clean with dish soap and bartenders best friend powder cleaner for tough jobs. I usually put it in the dishwasher on the bottom rack and that is working great. I have converted 2 family members to join the ip life. My parents live close so I just cook theirs in my ip. We are so glad they invented this!

Perfect!  We had one of the old dial (manual) scales - which you never know exactly what weight you are or it changes slightly when you step on it a few times in a row - whereas this scale gave us the same exact reading (weight) whenever we stepped on it!  I was a little worried about it being “glass” and so thin, however, it feels very sturdy, safe, lightweight and quite nice when standing on it!  I have to say, we are also happy that our 2 year old likes to stand on it as she not only likes the display color, but to know that we can accurately know what she weighs too!  This was a great buy and I will recommend it to all my friends/family.

This scale is very inconvenient.  I have followed directions to a T and allot every time I use it I have to recalibrate it. The weight is off 10+ every other use and gives me a different weight each time.  I have brand new batteries and it's sitting on a hard flat surface/floor like it's supposed to without being moved.  I will be returning this item and purchasing something more reliable.
Okay, so, this scale doesn't give a reading as low as I'd like but that's my fault, not the scale's. Overall, seems to work great! Pretty basic but does what it needs to do. Good buy!

review_title: Feel fragile but seems strong enough. It gives a ...
review_body: Feel fragile but seems strong enough.  It gives a consistent weight when compared to itself.  Was a few lb's different fromn my Dr office, but that does not matter, because if it says you lost two lb's you did.

Cant go wrong with this scale.  Its does what it says.  The glass is durable and the color scheme is modern and pleasing.. I like that you can just stand on it and get your weight versus having to tap the surface to "wake" it up.  A nice little touch.  It is accurate.  I have tested it by stepping on it about 10 times within a half hour to measure its accuracy.  It fluctuated by .03 once or twice but overall very consistent.

review_title: Great product for a great price
review_body: Just received yesterday. It's a very Sleek design. And even though I just received it I managed to drop it on my tile floor and it's obviously durable because it's still in one piece. Hopefully it stays accurate.

review_title: Best scale I have ever owned!
review_body: This scale is great! I have a small space so the fact that it is lightweight and turns off after each use makes it easy to store. I like the accuracy of the scale and it is easy to read even without my glasses. I highly recommend this product.

review_title: The only thing I don't like about it is the sharp corners
review_body: I've had this for about a month.  I find it's accurate.  The weight doesn't vary by getting off and trying again ~ which can be really frustrating!  The only thing I don't like about it is the sharp corners, but I knew about that when I bought it.  It hasn't been a problem at all ~ no scratches or anything, but just more careful when toddlers visit.  If it fails in the future, I will update.

This scale is so cool looking.  I just want to lose weight now to try to impress it.  Just bought it last week and loving it so far.  If you want a modern, slick looking, high-tech piece of eye candy that happens to be a cool looking scale--this is it.

Gave as gift, well received no issues. the battery is lasting a long time and it gets used daily, seems accurate but hard to tell for certain. Smaller display than any other ones I've had. I should have opted for large display as the users are older but they can read it without thier glasses just fine, the blue backlight really help make up for seeing the numbers.
Great product.

review_body: The paper sheds. Good for the price but don't expect quality

This pillow fits perfectly in the pillow cover I purchased.  Great product!
Good quality and filling my pillow covers perfectly
way firmer and better quality than i had expected
Fit the pillow cases perfectly!

Product is just as described and arrived quickly. I ordered these to put inside some sequin decorative pillow cases I purchased for my niece and they are perfect. They are full yet not uncomfortably firm. The were easy to put into the cases.
