review_title: Worth every penny and then some!
review_body: Perfect for a gift or a quick little replacement. I bought this in pair with a custom picture design of a friends cat. Shes going to be so happy!
These are really nice and fluffy.

review_title: Perfect for all the messes my little ones make
review_body: This purchase has saved me so much money. Before I would use paper towels to clean up almost everything. These are reusable and durable. Perfect for all the messes my little ones make. Soft enough to use on delicate surfaces yet can scrub the crayon off the wall.
Perfect for cleaning, better than paper towels.
Towels hold together and don't fray especially when working on bike gears. Liked not having to worry about the fiber getting into my gears during cleanup.
Well if you're looking for 48 microfiber towels that are microfiber and... that are towels.... this is the product for you! all of them are soft and perfect for cleaning the car!
Great microfiber cloths. My husband complained bitterly when one of his cloths went missing, so I bought him this set. He wont run out anytime soon! Great quality and a good price.
Cloths are not that soft and feel like they might even be too abrasive for washing a car. Won't buy again.

review_title: Nice towels. Having a small supply is so handy
review_body: Nice towels.  Having a small supply is so handy.  I keep them around the office (coffee spills, etc.), in the car, and took some home.
Great price for truly lint free cloths.
no loose fibers fall off. seemed to be prewashed

These. Clean. Everything. I keep the blue ones in my kitchen, the yellow ones in the bathrooms, and the white are for miscellaneous cleaning. I've used them for everything from car detailing to toilets, from dog mess to mirrors. These towels are an incredible value. Highly recommended.
great price

Just received trash can from Simplehuman.  Tried putting it together and nothing worked! Others tried and still nothing works.  So aggravating to have to pack up large box and return from an upstairs apartment.  Quite angry.
Smell good and stretch to keep trash in
Love finding a good deal. Even better when you can find it in bulk.

Great deal. This will last a good bit too. We have a good bit of trash always having company. Dash button made it convenient to order. Received it quick. I definitely recommend.

review_title: Pretty hard to mess that up
review_body: Well it's a shower curtain liner. Pretty hard to mess that up.

review_title: Slightly stiff but nice and thick material
review_body: Very durable shower liner. Slightly stiff but nice and thick material.

Feels a bit thinner than Target/Bed Bath & Beyond's similar product.  There's an extra 2 inches or so at the edge of the curtain that goes beyond the width of my outer curtain.  I've never had this happen before with a shower curtain.

review_title: Received quickly after ordering in perfect condition.
review_body: It's a shower curtain liner, it does what it was made to do.. Received quickly after ordering in perfect condition.

review_title: ... my shower/ tub now we don't step on it like the old one
review_body: It fit my shower/ tub now we don't step on it like the old one. Most of all peace of mind and clean

review_title: No smell at all with this and it works just great.
review_body: Historically when changing out to a new curtain you get that overpowering plastic smell which allegedly is toxic.  No smell at all with this and it works just great.

review_title: which is awesome! Plus the magnets make sure that the curtain ...
review_body: These don't mold and mildew, which is awesome! Plus the magnets make sure that the curtain doesn't raise up and touch you like a scary shower ghost. Gross.

Good reliable bags. Will buy again

Very pretty but very hard to untangle the individual strands if they get tangled (took over an hour).
Can't say how much I love this especially for the price will definitely purchase again....

review_title: Loved this! Only thing I would change is that ...
review_body: Loved this!  Only thing I would change is that the connection between each strand was more evenly spaced.  But really showy!

review_title: These lights are the best they never get heated and i can have them ...
review_body: These lights are the best they never get heated and i can have them on for hours. I like how I can alternate the lighting. They are beautiful.
I really loved these! With 8 different and they all work very nicely. And just one button for simple use! In the packaging they are neatly organized so they won’t tangle as you place them.
I love the lights! Only complaint would be that the plug in part is at the tops of the lights and kinda bulky.
My daughter loves these lights. We like how they blink in several different modes. Easy to hang. Perfect and inexpensive to decorate a teenager's room!
Loved my light curtain! Will be using it for my YouTube videos! Great purchase for a great price!

review_title: Does not have a slow twinkle setting, and you ...
review_body: Does not have a slow twinkle setting, and you can’t switch it off during the day. Has to be unplugged which can be a nuisance. The settings are irritating
These work great!! I’m just concerned with the fact that I bought them new, and this is how they arrived....?

review_title: I like it; that is what 4 stars represent
review_body: I like it; that is what 4 stars represent. I mean seriously, "love it?" with 5 stars? I have to say that the transaction was pleasant and the company was/is quick to respond after the fact. So I guess I would give the whole transaction ***** five stars. Not up there with a cold beer and a grilled steak but a sense of satisfaction that I did everything possible to protect and preserve the national security.

Great mattress cover at a reasonable price. I was concerned after reading reciews about it making noise when you move or lay down. No noise at all with ours. There are cheaper ones out there that we have tried that do have noise issue and not good quality. This one has been used and washed for two months now and it's holding up great.

Bought this months ago and it still looks and feels brand new! So soft and protects our mattress. Washed it a couple times already and it has held up well. I will definitely buy another one when needed. Worth the price!

I like it so much I bought two! One for each kids bed. I have shopped at the stores and have not found a mattress protector that actually protects and doesn't make my kids sweat, until now! I actually stood In front of the mattress protectors at the store the other day and got on my phone and bought a second one of these Instead while trting to convince another woman to do the  same!! She wouldn't be sorry if she ended upistening:) I have washed it several times already and it is still brand new . It has not broken down in the washer or dryer a bit.

I originally bought this product to cover my childrens tempurpedic mattress.  I do own a "official" tempurpedic mattress waterproof protector on my bed and feel this product is as close to that as you can get at a fraction of the price.  I've been so happy with the way it held up and the quality that I just purchased another one for our guest bed.

review_title: ... cover ony Nova Foam king mattress and it is perfect! It works much better than the previous quilt ...
review_body: I placed this cover ony Nova Foam king mattress and it is perfect! It works much better than the previous quilt mattress cover I had. When you take the saferest pad out of the wrapper it seems like it might make a light crunch noise as you lay it onto the bed and fit it, but it does not. As soon as you put a sheet on top of it you can not tell there is a pad underneath. It's lightweight and cooling (we have had a few warm July days and it passes the test). I am very happy with my purchase.

Excellent mattress protection in a light weight package.  Stumbled onto these while struggling to wash and dry a much more expensive mattress cover that I had gotten from a name brand "bedding" store.  The thing weighed a ton wet and took hours to dry every time it did its job.  Unlike this little baby that is much lighter, but does just as great a job of absorbing the kids occasional accidental night wetting.  This thing washes and dries easily, protects my mattresses - and cost a fraction.  How great is that?

Works well and keeps my mattress dry when my nieces spend the night and have an accident, the top is made out of a material that feels like a towel which I didn't like at first but when you put the sheets over it you don't feel a thing it's thin so if you're looking for added padding this one isn't for you!!

review_title: Acts like a a normal bedsheet
review_body: Does the job.  I haven't had any accidents so I'm not sure if it works but there is comfort knowing that if there is an accident the bed is protected.  It is like a regular fitted sheet and doesn't feel stiff or plastic-like like some others I have tried.  There is no noise when moving around.

I purchased this item to protect the mattress of my nearly 90 year old mother.  It worked great...only problem...when she had an accident I had to wash and dry it so I could get it back on the bed that same day.  It washed up great.  It worked great...protecting the mattress.  My solution to prevent the rush laundry...I ordered another one!

review_title: This filter is awful! The water takes so long ...
review_body: This filter is awful! The water takes so long to filter through the top, at least an hour. And the water tastes the same as our tap water. This is not an improvement, Brita! I will be returning for a refund and buying the reliable Brita filters I've used for years.
These work perfectly in our Brita water filter pitcher. We use these for fresh water and to cut back on wasteful water bottles when at home. Water tastes great!
They fit perfectly and last a long time.
Love my Brita.  so the filters are perfect.
great water
They work, not much else to say about these.

review_title: Worked fine for few days then it started to take a ...
review_body: Worked fine for few days then it started to take a ​long time to filter.  Now it takes hours to filter a cup of water.
These fit well and are the original Brita brand.
This is a recurring purchase. This filters work great for my pitcher.
PErfect replacements.

I have only had scale a few days hence 4 stars.  So far it's working great.  Easy to set up and, since I had to put it behind the bathroom door, it's also great because when opening the door it slides right over scale.  Hopefully, it will soon tell me that I have lost a little weight!
On a flat, even surface, this scale will give myself and my wife different weights just seconds apart from the previous attempt. It gives a good indicator, but I would not say it is very accurate.

I am so happy with this product. It's super simply to use and is accurate. I love that the display is backlit since I haven't seen this on many other scales. You also have the ability to switch weight units (metric and imperial) via a button on the back of the scale. Pretty handy feature.. Overall very happy with the accurate readings, bright display, and clean glass of this scale.

I bought this scale in Dec 2017 and for about 6 months I had no issues and the readings were consistent. All of a sudden, the readings fluctuate 4-6lbs every time I step on the scale. It's incredibly frustrating, especially because it was working well-designed for a little while. I would suggest looking at a different scale.

review_title: Great looking but came with a problem.
review_body: Worked great at first. After about two months I stood on it, heard something inside go pop, no it's 10 lbs off. I've already tossed the box it came in. Haven't decided yet if it's worth it to send back.. My next scales will be a higher end product for sure.

I bought this scale after trying many before it. It works like a dream. I was impressed by the design and look after pulling it out of the box, as it is sleek and slim. Normally I slide a scale under something to keep it hidden away and out of the way, but I enjoy the look. The batteries come included, which is always a nice feature, as it saves a trip to the store. I tried it out right away, and when I first stepped on it, I got an accurate reading on a bright blue screen. I usually weigh myself in the dark at 4:30 in the morning before heading to the gym, so the lit display was perfect. I stepped on the scale 3 times and received the exact read out every time. I tried later, got the same, then tried 3 more times holding my cat. It was accurate every time. The design, accuracy and price make this an amazing scale in my opinion.

A relatively good scale. I'm only giving it for stars because it took a while to find a place in the house where it gave me an accurate reading. Although, that's probably all modern digital scales, it still bothered me. However, it works like a charm everyone we step on it.

review_title: I am really enjoying this very simple but elegant looking ...
review_body: I am really enjoying this very simple but elegant looking scale. I keep it in my bathroom and it has fallen over on its face side several times on bare bathroom floor without showing any signs of damage. Even though it is made of glass, it has proven to be very durable.

This scale will give you an average of seven different answers every morning. Some are completely outlandish, others might be right? Who really can know? This scale has a mind of its own and has been very unhelpful in the tracking of my weight while prepping for a competition!!

An amazingly sleek design.  I continue to "step-up" to stand on this product and realize just how much of a low profile it has.  Barely any step required.  The display is crisp blue and easy to read.  A great upgrade over the scales we replaced.  This product feel durable and well made.  I hope to enjoy them for years to come.  Enjoy as much as anyone can enjoy looking at their weight on a daily basis.

review_title: A steamer that doesn't steam out wrinkles
review_body: I was excited to use this product never owning a steamer before. I thought it would be great to take out wrinkles from hung curtains.  Alas,  though there was steam,  I could not get more than the wrinkles to soften on my sheer curtains.  If it can't get sheer fabric to unwrinkle, I have serious doubts that it can work magic on heavier fabrics. Another important point is that the steam lasts maybe 10 minutes. Then per the instructions, you must wait 15 minutes before filling. Um... that makes for a long session of steaming if you can't get the job done quickly. Unfortunately for me, I can't return this. I would not reccomend this item except to my frenemies to laugh at their frustration.
It's a great steamer. I love how small but powerful it is.

review_title: Product review: why i gave it Five Stars
review_body: Bought from amazon, It was bundled, shipped for free and arrived early. Also being double boxed and incased with foam there was no damage.. As for the product itself, It is very easy to understand how to use this item. There is an, AS SEEN ON TV brand that I have read negative reviews on. I have never tried it but the online reviews of this one (Instant Pot IP-DUO60) along with youtube videos of actual cooking made me choose this one over it. I opened it, cleaned it with a drop of soap on a wet paper towel and went right on to cooking a 13 bean chili. Right away I was stumped. Eager to use my new shiny appliance, I had not pre-soaked the beans over night. No worries said the cooking guide. Altho infomercial skip over the warm up time of the unit which in some cases could be up to 10 minutes, the overall cooking is fast. So I stuck the beans (4 cups of water to 1 cup beans and 1 TBS salt and let it pressure cook for 4 minutes and then stay warming for 10 more minutes. simple enough. That gave me time to thaw & brown the meat, chop the onions and open the 16 ounces of tomato paste/sauce. when done I was in a hurry so I used the pressure release switch. OK.. here is where safety is very important. Nothing locks on this item until pressure is formed and by all means that is great because you never need to worry if something is stuck where it's pressure or a malfunction elsewhere. Be careful, obviously the steam will be hot but also, it will rise to the ceiling if you do it real fast and my concern for people who have lower ceiling than mine would be that you could damage the ceiling with moisture even if not the first time but over a period of time. so using a dish rag for safety being my first time, I let the pressure/steam out slowly and removed the lid. Strained the beans, added meat, sauce, seasoning, onions and then set the inner pot back in and let it pressure cook for 30 minutes. Then I turned it off and 20 minutes cooling down it was minutes from fully releasing pressure but there again, I was getting hungry so I released the last tiny bit of pressure and then.. A very large, very tasty meal was ready and I had used my very first electric pressure cooker. I even put some it containers and took some family members some to try and not only did they like it, their kids did as well.. Clean up!. Cleaning was easy and I am careful not to make a mess and get it inside the inner pot that is not removable and is where the heating element is. The only thing I had any issue with was the main pot. There were some spots left on it and I just haven't went back to read the book and see if there is a special way to clean it. All I used was a dish ran and dawn soap. I'm not used to cooking/cleaning in aluminum.. Hopefully this helps.

I have a long history of wanting gadgets because I’ve heard a lot about them and they’re shiny and new. I held off on buying the instant pot for a long time because I have a slow cooker and a rice cooker, but eventually I caved and bought one. It is AMAZING. I started slow, with ribs and sweet potatoes. My obsession kicked into high gear when I bought Melissa Clark’s new cookbook, Dinner in an Instant. Dried bean soups ready in less than an hour! Delicious chicken soups and stews! I’ve used it at least twice a week with amazing results.. So why do I love it when my slow cooker has been gathering dust for years? It’s so quick and easy!. - Slow cooker recipes tend to be bland and mushy. Not so with the instant pot. If anything, the flavor is more concentrated.. - My slow cooker pot is heavy ceramic and is difficult and awkward to clean. The instant pot liner is lightweight and cools down quickly, so I can clean it before any food dries and sticks.. - Also, I’m not a morning person and the last thing I want to do after I wake up is prep raw meat and chop things for dinner. With the instant pot, I start dinner when I get home from work and it’s ready—usually within an hour and without constant monitoring.. Being able to sauté in the same pot is fantastic too for adding flavor. I haven’t tried the yogurt settting, but look forward to trying it. I ignore most of the presets and rely on manual. I’m an instant pot convert now and can’t stop raving about it to my friends and family. If you get an instant pot, do yourself a favor and pick up Melissa Clark’s cookbook too. If you’re at all a foodie, you’ll love her recipes. I haven’t been disappointed yet.

review_title: Everything we heard has been true.
review_body: Still learning all it can do, but so far does all it is expected to do. Great product. Get size suitable for family. Small size great for 2.

review_title: Should I have purchased smaller model?
review_body: I'm in love. Life is easier. Since it's so fast compared to a slow cooker I wonder if I should have bought the smaller model, but I've had it a few months now and actually think that since I jar up a lot of my soups, etc. I prefer to have the larger model. It is quite big, though. It requires a certain minimum amount of liquid, I can't recall what it is, but some recipes you'll find will list less water so you're going to have to adjust recipes by doubling or figuring out if you can just add more, otherwise it won't actually get the pressure high enough. I do end up doing the meat and veggies separately because it will overcook the veggies. Depends on what you're doing and what you're preference is.

review_title: Love my IP for simple meals for just me and heavenly yogurt that puts the store-bought stuff to shame!
review_body: I can’t say enough about how much I love the Instant Pot!. I haven’t purchased yogurt in the grocery store in about a year because I make my own that tastes leaps and bounds better than the store bought stuff. Sure, it’s a long process, but it’s mostly hands off!. I can throw a frozen chicken breast in with some salsa and seasonings and in no time have fall apart tasty chicken for a few quesadillas, tacos, nachos...which is great for when I want something tasty but don’t want to labor over some recipe that will make enough food for an army!. Mac and cheese in this thing is ridiculous! It takes MORE time to make the blue box stuff than in the IP...and the IP version is the creamiest and cheesiest ever! I take my whole pot and all the ingredients somewhat as a party trick when I take it as a dish and whip it up right there on the counter in no time flat and then keep the pot on warm to serve the cheesy goodness.. It takes some time to learn about it...read the instructions, study the recipes before you execute them, join the Facebook group to watch what people are doing with this thing (both right and wrong so you can avoid making the same mistakes!) and don’t jump in and make something super intricate on your first go at making something in it, and you’re set!. I’ve sold probably 10-20 of these to others after they’ve seen and/or eaten what’s been created by this magical machine :)

review_title: Fresh sodium-free beans, and more,  YAY!
review_body: Just throwing my 2 cents into the [instant] pot...  not like it really needs any more 5-star ratings, though.  this is a MUST have for apartment dwellers, and homeowners... a slow cooker, pressure pot, saucepan all in one ( you don't need to have the lid on to use it to saute stuff, so it is sort of a frying pan , as well!  We love being able to SAY NO TO CANNED BEANS FOREVER!  40 mins gives you great sodium-free (and more flavorful) beans.  Great for brown rice (rice/grains, in general, do need practice if you want to modify the rice:water ratio beyond the cookbook instructions.  easy cleanup (the lid and associated valves stay clear as long as you don't boil anything over by overfilling).  so, to clean, just pop off the lid and let is air dry.  scrub the SS  pot insert, dry and put it back together.

review_title: The quiet, fast helper in your kitchen.
review_body: So, I will repeat what others have said.  The pot is non-stick which forces a person to use lots of fat for saute mode.  Not nice.  For me, this pot runs very hot and fast.  The good news is that food is cooked very quickly and you never have to peek under the lid, stir at the stove or turn on the fan.  It's quiet and fast.  The bad news is that veggies will cook so fast that they become mushy quickly.  One minute on the veggies is about right.  I've also discovered that rather than letting the steam shoot up all over the ceiling etc., it works well to release the valve slowly with the enclosed ladle and direct the steam with the bowl of the spoon!  This works well for me.  Instant Pot needs to manufacture  an optional non-stick pot that withstands the rigors of heat and pressure - I would buy it just for the saute convenience.  The Instant Pot is totally quiet when cooking, doesn't throw off heat into the kitchen and cooks soups and stews just great.  I'm looking for some really flavorful, low fat recipes for the cooker.  Got any?

Overall this is a great pressure cooker. It seems to perform very well. Easy to clean up, etc.. I will purchase a smaller one for side dishes.. My only complaint is the time needed to actually cook the meals (from Instant Pot's recipes) is considerably longer than stated.. For instance - yesterday I made the curry chickpeas which was delicious - however, the total cook time was almost 2 hours.. I started my beef roast at 5pm and its now 5:36 and still showing "on" hasn't begun to countdown the 45 min cook time.. Very frustrating when you're trying to get dinner on the table at a decent hour.. Moving from scaling to venting is very precarious - adding a longer handle for safer rotation would be helpful.

review_title: I love my new Instant Pot cooker!
review_body: Love it! Used it right away. Had already watched some YouTube videos and learned a lot before it came in.  Made buffalo wings immediately (I washed it first) because already had them on hand. My husband really liked them. They were very good and tender. Actual pressure cooker time for 2.5 pounds of wings was 8 minutes - I kind of guessed because of what I had learned.  It also takes a few minutes for the pressure to build (depending how much and what all you have in there) so that needs to be included in the time factor. Before pressure cooking I used its Saute feature to brown them just a little. Also briefly crisped them under broiler before adding sauce (don't do this too long - don't want to overcook).  Just like some people like to sometimes brown meats a little because the crockpot doesn't, same thing here. Only instead of hours, it was only minutes - and very tender. Decided to go ahead and get the 8 quart instead of 6 quart and glad I did. It can cook a whole chicken in about 20 minutes and if you want to do some batch cooking. I will be using this almost every week.  It is a 7 in one pot.  It is also a slow cooker, rice cooker, sautes etc. I had always stayed away from pressure cookers because of olden-day pressure cooker war stories.  So glad I went ahead and tried it!

review_title: Who Would'veThought I'd Love Using a Pressure Cooker?
review_body: I never thought I would use one of these, but I love it.  Today in preparing for a BBQ, I used the Instant Pot to boil potatoes for potato salad, hard boiled 7 eggs, cooked ribs, and made corn on the cob. One of the factors for its success is the excellent stainless steel insert, which is extremely well-made, doesn't warp, and cleans up really easily between uses.  I always brown meat before braising or stewing, so I love this feature.  I've used it for pot roasts, short ribs, pasta casseroles, whole chicken, and many other dishes.  I found a good cook book , and checked out the many YouTube videos out there to get started. I reserve the fifth star because it's sometime tricky to get the silicone ring just right, but I'm better with practice.  I'm so happy with this product.

When we first found out we were expecting, I had hoped to avoid extra purchase for things that might not get used for very long or very often. A trash can for specifically made for diapers was definitely on this list. However, after talking to other parents and reading many reviews, we decided to get a Diaper Genie. Now that the baby is a few months old, I can say we are so happy with this purchase! These refills are very easy to use, and very convenient. However, I did notice that the price of the refills may be a little bit less at Costco, so if you shop there often you may want to do a quick price comparison.

I absolutely love my Diaper Genie and these refills! I find it so much easier to dispose of those smelly diapers! They are expensive, so to save money we started just using the Diaper Genie for the BM diapers. It keep the smell away, but the refills last longer! This is worth the money!

I switched to generic diaper pail bags to try to save money (I feel like these are overpriced), but they were so thin and flimsy that they were almost useless. Switched back to these and I’m so glad I did. They’re thicker and hold diapers so much better than other brands. Worth it in comparison.

A diaper pail was one thing that I didn't think I need before I delivered my baby girl. I went a few weeks tossing dirty diapers into a scented trash bag that was housed by a 2 gallon trash can. It was a pain trying to keep one hand on my squirmy baby and the other trying to get the diaper into the can.. A friend of mine gifted me her diaper genie she was through with. I had no idea how much I would love it. She said that the refills were expensive, so I was expecting to be paying an arm and a leg for these refills. I have calculated how long these refills last, but I don't seem to be blowing right through them. In any case, the bags work great, keep the smells in and make tossing into the trash a breeze!

Fairly happy with the Diaper Genie and the refills. The refills are a bit expensive. We have not really had a problem with odor but we change the bag daily and our son is only 2 months old. Not sure how it will be once he starts solids. It’s nice to only take the amount of bag you need out with out wasting a whole trash bag.

review_body: This is a LOT of paper towels. No, seriously -- a LOT. You know those big packs you buy at the grocery store? This is the equivalent of four of those. I'd ordered these without double-checking the quantity, and now we have enough paper towels to last us the full year. Still...a good deal, once I figure out where to store everything in this small apartment.

review_title: Can.t beat them for the $, just as good as costlier onesQ
review_body: I used to be a paper towel snob, however, necessity has changed my outlook on such things. I like these towels just as well as Bounty, my former all time brand user. They last just as long and even go through the washer without shredding, although I never Purposely put them in washer. Great product at a great price with subscribe and save. I highly recommend them to the cost conscious consumer.

review_title: Better than premium products for everyday use.
review_body: A regular item in our PrimePantry orders.  Love the select-a-size and the price. Who needs expensive premium paper towels to clean grandkids water paint brushes, kid or cat yak.  These do the job at a fraction of the price. They also take up less disposal space reducing lugging to curbside or transfer station.

We have three dogs and as such, use a tremendous amount of paper towels.  The Sparkle paper towels are well made and hold up against wet and dry spills.  The simple imprinted design gives them a bit of an appeal, without any inks to rub off on the counter or anywhere else.  These are a high quality item and the price for subscribe and save can't be beat!

review_title: Bad decision! Not only are these very thin
review_body: Ugh!  I had been buying another brand, but decided to try these based on positive reviews and wanting to save money.  Bad decision!  Not only are these very thin, they are almost impossible to tear off properly.  I tend to grab and pull with one hand, and the other brand always tore off on the dotted line very easily.  I don't think I have ever managed to tear one of these without it ripping across halfway through.  I have to use two hands, and even then it's hard to get it right.  Now I'm stuck with a whole case of these losers, but I'll definitely be switching back next purchase.  You really do get what you pay for!

review_title: MY FAV Paper Towels...especially at this price
review_body: Sparkle Giant Rolls are my favorite paper towel.  It is much easier to get 24 rolls from Amazon than to drag them from Walmart.  I love having them delivered and this is a great price.. They're very absorbent and I love these are wrapped just two in a package.  Keeps the others fresh and makes it easier to store them.

That's it--three subscriptions in a row, the entire box, every single roll, has been bent into a square (vs. round). Imagine driving with tires that aren't round. That's how these rolls work on dispensers--they barely move, won't spin. I have 3 year old twins and two pre-teen boys. Dealing with ripping paper towels and dispensers that fall over? No, thanks!

These paper towels work as well as their more expensive cousins and I love being able to order them in bulk. We get the giant box delivered to our doorstep with free shipping through subscribe and save every other month. With 3 small kids to take shopping it is so helpful to have these bulky necessities dropped at my doorstep!

This scale is easy to read, takes up minimal space, and seems to be quite accurate. I have checked it several times in comparison to the doctor's scale, and it's always been right on. I like that it's digital because it gives a more accurate reading. It's also attractive, which is nice because I keep it out to use frequently. A very good value.

Easy to set up and no silly dance tapping on and off to get a reading.  I had just taken my cat to the vet where kitty was weighed.  My cat decided to sit on the scale, and the weight matched the vet's scale.  Very pleased.

review_title: It is somewhat light weight and the blue lighting makes for an easy read. It immediately cuts on when you step ...
review_body: The product showed up brand new in the box, batteries included. It is somewhat light weight and the blue lighting makes for an easy read. It immediately cuts on when you step on it and is pretty accurate depending on where you stand. You have to center yourself on the scale to get the most accurate read. I've weighed myself on the scale in the morning at home (flat and hard surface) and then weighed myself at the gym (Planet Fitness) and it showed the same weight both times. I like this scale and it works very well for the price.

review_title: It is hard to find a good one that is affordable
review_body: I've been looking for a body scale since we moved to a new apartment in November. It is hard to find a good one that is affordable. This one is perfect! It works very well and easy to store. I stored in underneath my steel rack near the kitchen area. Definitely recommend it!

review_title: ... tells me how much I weigh and was a good price. Few complaints about needing to clean it
review_body: It tells me how much I weigh and was a good price.  Few complaints about needing to clean it, it's glass, it gets dirty like all other things made of glass.  Only potential issue, either scale of off by 20 pounds or my ass needs to lose some weight.

review_title: Pretty blue light and easy to read
review_body: Not sure if it’s the gym/diet my husband and I are on but every time we get on the scale we are 0-0.3 kg difference in weight from each other. He seems to think the scale is broke. I think it’s amazing. Time will tell.

Love the look of it, and arriving with batteries included was a plus! It works accurately every time for me if used correctly. I do exactly as the directions state and have not had any issues with inconsistent measurements. I was worried about it looking cheap since it was on sale for $18, but it looks like a high end-scale and still looks brand new and shiny after many uses.

review_title: Great Scale! I like that I do not have ...
review_body: Great Scale! I like that I do not have to kick it a little bit to turn it on.  Just step on it and with the blue light and larger numbers it is very easy to read.

review_title: Talk about bang for the buck, this scale is functional, attractive, and appears to be built to last!
review_body: I was looking for an inexpensive but quality bathroom scale and saw that this one had lots of great reviews and was offered at a really good price. I ordered the scale and it arrived quickly and came with the required batteries, which is always nice. The instructions were easy to understand (though this isn't really the sort of product that requires instructions, unless of course you were planning on putting the scale on carpet or abusing it).. As far as appearance, it's great. Simple, sleek, and feels sturdy. It works just as it should... You step on and it turns on, once the weight stabilizes (takes just a couple of seconds) it flashes the final number (to the decimal point!) and automatically shuts off after you step off and wait a few seconds. Blue backlit screen and large numbers make it easy to read. Highly recommend, especially for the price... Can't be beat!

review_title: My scale arrived when promised and in excellent condition. It is easy to use and the ...
review_body: My scale arrived when promised and in excellent condition. It is easy to use and the numbers can be read easily, even without my glasses. I highly recommend this scale. I almost did not read the instructions, I figured I knew now to use a scale. What was so important to learn is that the scale needs to be stored flat, not standing up.
Easy to use. Compact. Great for traveling
Stopped working after using 5 times!
This works amazing. I have used it on clothes and even my curtains..fantastic product!
MOLD INSIDE after only 3 uses. Not acceptable.
Should be zero stars.  All it does is spit out scalding water onto your clothes.
I like my new steamer. I wish it came in a bigger size. Works great otherwise.
happily surprised by this little steamer
Couldn't be happier! It's all it was described to be and more!
Great little gadget that, for the most part, makes ironing a thing of the past.
Very good and convenient steamer. Excellent, fast service as well.

review_title: Stop Waffling and Join the Instant Pot REVOLUTION!
review_body: Some friends of ours kept raving about the awesomeness of Instant Pot. How it would cook up anything in a hurry like tasty soups, veggies, whole sides of beef or whatever.. Our Instant Pot arrived about six weeks ago. My wife was immediately suspicious, eyeing the Instant Pot as if were a danger to our home and health ("PRESSURE COOKER?!?!. Don't those things blow up and k*ll people?!?!"). I told her I loved her, respected her point of view and promised to follow all safety instructions. Then she left the premises while I got the Pot set up and cooked up a tasty Butternut Squash soup. One of her faves, no less.. Since then:. 1. My lovely wife has fallen in love with Instant Pot;. 2. We've adopted favorite recipes and are trying new ones;. 3. We're eating healthier food;. 5. Eating more meals at home is making our bank account grow.. YES - It's easy to use. YES - You can cook all kinds of stuff in it. YES - There are THOUSANDS of recipes on YouTube videos and in FB Groups. YES - It's easy to clean. YES - Lazy people will love this thing. Stop reading reviews, order your Instant Pot and promise you'll cook three recipes in it. Trust me, you WILL be hooked.

I LOVE this thing! I am someone who enjoys cooking, and also loves cookware/gadgets. I have been wanting an instant pot for some time but was honestly a bit intimidated. I am so happy I finally took the plunge because after walking through the first use with the instruction manual in hand, this thing is a breeze! I can safely cook chicken from frozen in 20 minutes. Twenty minutes, people!! I have made so many different meals in my instant pot and each one comes out better than the next. Ribs come out falling off the bone, chicken is tender and perfectly cooked, chili tastes like it has been simmering on low for hours but it only took 15 minutes start to finish. It is so easy to clean, too, which is a major bonus. If you are at all interested in this product, take the plunge and buy it...it is so easy to use and so worth it!

review_title: Wife is feeding me like a King!
review_body: My wife went nuts when she got this gift. We also got her a good e-pressure cooker cookbook.. She has been making some great (mouthwatering) homemade meals, once or twice a week.. (I've been shoveling tons & tons of snow, but still gaining weight)!. She loves how fast it cooks and how easy it is to make great food.. The old stove top pressure cooker was donated..

THIS IS THE MOST AMAZING PIECE OF KITCHEN EQUIPMENT.  I bet I use it nearly daily!  Love looking up recipes and trying them!  So simple to use, and the food is sooo good that comes out of it - Meats are so tender and 'infused' with whatever seasonings you use...Just buy one already!!  You will not be disappointed!  I love mine SO MUCH SO, that I'm purchasing now, an 8 quart, as I made a little over 2# Rump Roast last night and it just fit.  If I made much bigger than that, I'm not sure what I would've done - So, I've only been playing with this for a month and a 1/2, but I've made the decision I need another!!  POT-HEADS unite!!

review_title: Multi- cooker makes for easier cleanup & faster meals
review_body: I've only made one meal in my Instant Pot so far,  but it was a great experience.  I was able to saute veggies/sear meat for my roast,  pressure cook the roast (in less than an hour!), and make gravy afterwards,  all in one pot. I usually just throw everything raw into the crock pot and skip the gravy because it's too much cleanup. But this was perfect.  I'm still learning,  but it seems to be a very valuable kitchen addition. I love that something that used to take all day,  can now be done from start to finish in under 2 hours with the same or better results.  Reading the  instruction manual helped me get more comfortable with the device.  I'm still a little intimidated by the quick release of the pressure cooker,  but I was able to maintain a safe distance when releasing by using a kitchen spoon.  I plan to update this review after more uses.

review_title: Awesome. Wow, what took me so long.........
review_body: Awesome........ I was sitting on the lawn chair when ups pulled up.  YAY. Took pictures of him bringing me the box.. So I did the test like the instant pot app had. Step by step instructions.. Then..... I did the saute on the pork loin, then added the onions and garlic, and broth.  I did the 55 minutes on the timer per one of the reviews from the recipe app.. Omg. The house smells delish. The pork loin is falling apart tender, I added a potatoe and even put in the apple.. Awesome.. The steam release works great, I opened it with a push of my tongs.. I think my crock pot is going into cold storage, along with my casserole crock. Can't wait to try the yogurt button and rice.  Wow.  Love this to the moon.. I added the picture of after the saute.

review_title: I've used this 8, 000 times since I've gotten ...
review_body: I've used this 8,000 times since I've gotten it. I use it for simple recipes and complicated ones. I use it when I have no idea what to make for dinner. I just search for "instant pot" and whatever I have in my fridge, and I've got tons of ideas, most of them ready in under an hour. It's a miracle! This is as close to a Star Trek replicator as I'll ever get in my lifetime.

review_title: Easy to clean stainless steel liner, short learning curve for cooking, food tastes delicious! Eggs peel easily!
review_body: I previously purchased the 5 quart Duo Instant Pot, and was so impressed with how it cooked food that I wanted a larger size. I got the 8-quart Duo Instant Pot on Black Friday, so that I could make larger pots of beans, soups and stews, and  I could have leftovers and freeze some for other days. The larger size is also better when you have a large family group and need to feed them! This stainless steel pot cleans so easily. I love good quality stainless steel. I use this Instant Pot not only many times per week but sometimes several times a day. So far today I have hard cooked a dozen eggs, I will be reheating some frozen soup later, and will probably make a pasta dish for when my son gets home from work tonight. The eggs peel so easily in the instant pot, that I will never hard boil eggs on the stove top again. Yesterday, I made some yogurt, which is delicious, and I know exactly what is in it. Since I use starter from the previous batch, the only cost for a gallon of yogurt is the cost of the gallon of milk needed. Studies have shown that yogurt is good for your heart long-term.

review_title: The easiest pressure cooker I have ever used.
review_body: The Instant Pot is easy to use, and extremely versatile.. I love that it's a slow cooker and a high and low pressure cooker all in one, with the ability to sear your foods right inside it before making roasts and soups.That means you can deglaze right in the pot, saving yourself from dirtying another pan and having to transfer the juices and veggies to your pressure cooker. It's very handy!. This is the most useful cooking appliance I own. If given the choice between keeping this or my stove, I'd pick my Instant Pot.. It has so many different abilities, I have only gotten around to trying half of them.. There have been no problems or glitches whatsoever with this machine in the two months I have had it.. As someone who hates wasting time and effort in the kitchen, I never got around to making things like ham and bean soup before.. This machine is so fast and efficient that I have made Goulash, ham and bean soup, and the most tender pot roast I have ever eaten in it!. If you are on the fence about buying one, I strongly urge you to pick one up.. The amount of money I can save by buying cheaper cuts of meat and making them soft and flavorful in this machine. has made the price I paid for this completely worth it.. I was skeptical about all the high reviews raving about this machine, but it's not just hype or influenced reviewing.. It really is a great little pot you'll want to tell people about.. I wholeheartedly recommend this handy little device!

It was overwhelming at first and I thought I was in a cock-pit.  Now I have had this for about a month I absolutely love it and it is quite easy and understandable. I love that it sautees, and then you add remaining ingredients.  I loved the chile I made and clean up was easy!  The stainless steel insert browns nicely, and then the steam helps remove the crusted remains.  I made corn bread in it, and I didn't realize it wouldn't brown. Tasty, but just looks different. Boiled eggs come out fantastic.  For our farm fresh eggs, the eggs peel easily and the inside has more of creamy and no green glow around the yolk edge.  I love soft boiled eggs, too, and Instant Pot gets them just right. Flavors are more enhanced, too.. I haven't tried my own tried and true recipes yet.  I recommend getting the Instant Pot cookbook with this. otherwise you won't know how long to cook your meal.. Actual cooking time for flavorful chile - 10 minutes but took another 20 to let the steam flow out.. My family loves that I'm trying new recipes and with easier cleanup, it's worth it.
As described.  Good quality.

review_title: Expensive. Bad for the Environment.  But Could Be Worse.
review_body: I use a Diaper Genie Elite step can to dispose of litter box waste and barf clean up from my CRF kitty. The cartridges are made of lightweight plastic. The bags are made of plastic. And it seems somehow irresponsible of me to take biodegradable messes and wrap them in plastic, but, dude, that stuff smells wicked bad.. These cartridges last longer and work better than the ones for the litter genie, and the frustration free packaging is just cardboard and paper, so at least I'm not compounding the plastics problem as much as I could be. Still, I wish playtex would come out with a degradable plastic version of this product.

review_title: One of those products where it's worth the extra money for the name brand
review_body: Used these right away and then we were given some of a generic version and never going with anything but playtex again.  The generic version did not work well at all.  The playtex refills have always been great.  Worth paying a little more for a good product.

review_title: These are sturdy and help keep smells at bay
review_body: Just what is needed for our multiple diaper genies.  These are sturdy and help keep smells at bay.  They last a decent amount of time and the only thing I don't like is the price.  I buy them because it is worth it to me to be able to use the Diaper Genie and have a room that doesn't smell like diapers.  It is just another expense in parenting an infant and Diaper Genie and refills are the best I have come across so far.

These go along with my Diaper Genie. The refills are convenient to use. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is the price. They are just a bit pricey. I am going to try a generic brand and see if I notice a difference; I will post a review on any product I try. So far, the baby is 4 weeks old, and we have gone through the starter pack that comes with the Genie and are probably about halfway through the first of 3 refill packs. They go fast!

review_title: These are not so much better than generics that they are a good value for ...
review_body: These are not so much better than generics that they are a good value for the cost. I recommend generic refills instead of the name brand. We tried, but they are really expensive and frankly seem like a waste for newborn twins at least. Maybe they will be better when the poop really starts to stink? Someone else will have to comment on that aspect. We may try again in the future if the generics ever start to smell. Functionally there was no different for an average couple.

review_title: Works for dog poop bags too!
review_body: I use the diaper genie for my dog poop bags after cleaning up around the yard, so the genie stays outside in all weather and these bags still work great. Follow the directions for install and you will have no problems. I find the 3-pack last me about a year, and I empty it about every 2-3 weeks.

review_title: This will last a few months
review_body: Sometimes these are hard to find. I have a very old diaper genie. I have to stack two on top of each other to match the height of the original sack holder. People who don't like genies probably only formula fed and only had stinky diapers. Haha.

I seriously love my diaper genie. I've used these since my daughter was born in January and I'm only on the second roll. They last quite a while and REALLY help with the smell. Diapers don't stink too bad when they're young, but once they sit in a trash can for a minute, you notice it. These really help for easy access of disposing diapers.

It works as advertised and keeps the smell in. I have had the bag split 1 or 2 times but that was when it was overfilled. It might be nice to have some kind of system to notify you of the recommended fullness so you have an idea of when to change the pail like a marking on the lining every 3 feet or something. I also wish these were less expensive. I have often wondered if I could devise a way to put a regular trash bag (maybe small kitchen sized?) in this pail so I don't have to spends so much on something I have to throw away. In the mean time this works and works well if used properly.

I cannot understand why the bags aren't attached to the plastic. There's no indication when you're close the the last bag like color change or ANYTHING to warn you that the bag is about to detach from the plastic and you're dealing with dirty diapers here.
Smells great and the price was good too. Will order again

I couldn't believe I was buying cleaning cloths, since that is what RAGS are for!  But desperate to inspire my kids in their chores, I thought some nice, new cloths would help.  High reviews were the tjpping point.. Now, *I* am the inspired one.  These hold a lot of liquid, are sturdy, wash nicely and scrub well.  Makes cleaning faster and easier.  I use them for everything.

I love these microfiber cloths.  I love that they come in a huge bundle. When cleaning, I like to change out my cloths often. I don't like to rinse with water and reuse. I just picture myself spreading the dirtiness around because the cloth has reached its saturation limit.  I like having the ability to preclean and then getting a fresh cloth to wipe dry. Sometimes I'll even do 3 or 4 cloths for one area.  With this huge bundle offered by Amazon, I have the flexibility to do so.

review_body: Love having these around the house, for I use far less paper towels now. I will say that they don't wash extremely well. (That being said, they are still totally useable.)

I used to work at a hospital in housekeeping. These rags are a lot like the rags we used in the hospital. These rags are amazing. I will be buying more soon. I like that they come in fun colors too. Anything to spice up cleaning!

Works as good as all the others, I like it better than the bounty, and it has a better price for the bulk.  It lasts me about 6 months at a time for just one of these boxes of 24 rolls.  I love the different colors and the select a size ability.  It is a quality product.

review_title: Better than most no-name super cheap paper towels
review_body: Not great.  But good enough for the price.  It is in no way "BOUNTY" paper towel like, BUT NEITHER IS THE PRICE.. I've been buying this kind from Amazon for years, and despite my penchant for high end paper towel, this is really good enough, given the price.

review_title: Great paper towels, affordable, absorbent, convenient.
review_body: These are very nice paper towels.  I always have used Sparkle paper towels because they are economical and work very well. I don't have to constantly go out and purchase paper towels with this huge package either. I put them on subscribe and save Oct. 16, 2016.  I have been using that same box of paper towels since then! It's February 2017, and four months later, and I just received my second shipment, and I still have six of the twelve double roll packages from the first shipment.  I cook at home every day and send my husband's lunches to work. We used them throughout the day, and we still have plenty.  I really enjoy not running to the store and lugging them home every week. The paper towels also so have pick a size. That way if you only need a small paper towel you don't have to waste them, and I think that makes them last longer. It's economical for me to buy them this way  because there is no cost for shipping and I also get a discount for subscribe and save, which saves a few pennies too. I get 12 packages with two giant rolls in them for 25.41 delivered to my door! That's about 2.12 a two roll package delivered to my door. These are giant rolls too. They do last a good while, are absorbent and thick enough for every day meals and messes. I'm glad I purchased them and will continue to purchase them as long as the cost remains affordable.

I have used Sparkle paper towels for a very, very long time. The last batch I bought are terrible! They are much thinner, and remind me of those cheap generic/ store brand ones. I'll be switching to Bounty.

review_title: Unfortunately put these to the test when my chessie pooped on the floor...these saved the day...lol
review_body: Well, as the headline would indicate, my Chesapeake bay retriever decided it was time to deuce right on my floor shortly after I inboxed these and put everything away.. Luckily, I was able to pick up the mess (with t shirt over the nose) with no breakthroughs.

Great bargain, comparable in price to when a local warehouse like Costco has a similar item on sale (so this is cheaper than the warehouse regular price).  Quality and durability excellent - use them in a multiple animal household for all manner of cleaning tasks, to include scrubbing soiled carpet areas.

review_title: Sparkle is a good paper towel and they are those chose a sheet ...
review_body: I am a klutz.  I spill a lot of stuff.  We use a lot of paper towels and these are on our auto-ship.  Sparkle is a good paper towel and they are those chose a sheet size.  I am a man and I pull a bunch more than I need off the roll.  But at least we always have plenty on hand.

review_title: This is worth the price of Prime all by itself.....
review_body: This is THE best way to buy paper towels (and toilet paper) for a home that goes through them like crazy. We have a specific shelf we store them on so when they holder is empty we just grab another roll and go. With two day shipping we know when we get down to the last 2 packs we need to reorder.

review_title: The local dollar stores paper towels aren't as good, and we can't find any that have the ...
review_body: Hard to beat value delivered to our doorstep. The local dollar stores paper towels aren't as good, and we can't find any that have the 1/2 sheet perforations like these do. One box easily lasts our family of four over a year – simply because we so often use just 1/2 a towel!

review_title: Nothing quite like running out of paper towels and having them delivered ...
review_body: Nothing quite like running out of paper towels and having them delivered to your door. About the same price as my local wholesale club for nearly the same product without the trip to the store. Been repeating this order a couple of times now, I'm hooked on a case of paper towels at my door.

This mattress cover is so nice it fits the bed perfectly, no slipping off the corners. The sheets are not cold when we climb into bed but the cover is not heated or does it make you overheat. It's the perfect comfort. . Good quality material will last and not lose its shape.

review_title: Well made and should do the trick should the need ever arise!
review_body: Just recently received this and put it on the bed. It is very well made and it appears that it will block anything from going through to the mattress. I like that it fits the deep mattresses. Since it has not been put to the test, so to speak (no pet or kid accidents), it gets five stars. Should it ever fail the test, I will return and change my review! For now, I would definitely recommend this product to anyone wanting that extra peace of mind.

This is really quite a waste of money. One of our kids peed in our bed and it went right through. Quite the disappointment, going to buy a different one with a diamond quilted top that works amazingly well on our kids bed instead.

review_title: Great feel and protection as far as we can tell
review_body: Has held up great the 3 months we have had it on our bed. Does not make a crinkle sound when you are laying on it. Washes up well and fits our deep mattress perfectly. Only time will tell if it has longevity.

I’ve had this mattress cover for about 2 months now... it was bought because my 3 year old still climbs into bed with my husband and I and sometimes still has accidents at bed. It was doing it’s job perfect but after a handful of washings- it is no longer protecting my mattress. Disappointing after purchasing for $40 and only using for 2 months... would not recommend.

I've had this for a couple of weeks but today I finally opened the package and put it on the bed. I was pleasantly suprised at the quality. I've never purchased a plastic mattress cover so I was amazed that this has a terry cloth like feel; the under side is plastic. My mom's mattress is old and flat but this cover can accommodate a deep mattress. Again I was suprised at how well it tucked and fit the flat mattress. Hopefully the next time she has an accident I will again be pleasantly surprised at what a great job this had done.

review_title: This is a great mattress protector
review_body: This is a great mattress protector. I originally bought one of these for my son's bed when I transitioned him from his crib. It's very durable, definitely waterproof as my son was potty training when transitioned and thin. I like how thin it is as it is a layer to protect his mattress and doesn't need a bulky mattress pad. It also stays in place which is nice and the material is perfect (no crunchy sound like other waterproof mattress pads) Loved it so much that I bought another one for our camper. Great product, great price and I am bery happy with product.

review_title: Perfectly waterproof. No plastic crinkle or feel.
review_body: These protectors are fantastic. A few minutes after putting it on our guest bed my cat vomited on it, so I got to test its waterproofing right away. It worked amazingly well. While cleaning I had it draped over my utility tub, and it held a few gallons worth of water without leaking. When sleeping on it you dont get that 'sleeping on plastic' feeling or sounds, and I really like that about this protector. I also like that it is pretty compact and easily fits in my washer.

Had purchased a similar product from a bedding store less than 5 years ago, for well over $100.  After 5 years of washing and "wear and tear", the waterproofing material cracked and I had small pieces of plastic/vinyl all over my mattress. (Looked like billions of skin flakes....disgusting!)  I replaced the mattress protector with another product that was much cheaper and from a local discount store. Did not realize it at the time of purchase, but it was a pull-on protector that zippered at the head. What a hassle! And this discount protector billowed with air and really retained the body heat! Went on my favorite website, AMAZON, and chose SafeRest due to its reviews and materials. Boy, am I a happy customer! I have only had it for about a week, but it does not hold body heat, does not fill up with air, is easily washed and dried, fits very well, and does as it states...protects your valuable mattress from life's mishaps! I hope the waterproof backing holds up longer than my previous, more expensive cover, but if not, it is still very affordable to replace after a few years of washing and using.  Highly recommended product.

review_title: I would NOT recommend this product
review_body: This scale is VERY INACCURATE. For the first month or so it worked perfectly however, about a month after purchasing it became "stuck" on 116.8. No matter what time of the day it was, what I had eaten, how much water I had drank, etc. the number never changed. I finally took the batteries out and replaced them. This reset the scale and made it accurate for about 1-3 weigh ins before it would get stuck again. After going through three sets of new batteries and taking them out and putting them back in on an almost daily basis I have decided to return this scale for a full refund. I would NOT recommend this product.

Overall is good.. One thing i want to tell is about accuracy.. It has little bit error range. I tried three or four times at one time.. I'm using with kg unit. In my case the error range is almost ~ 0.3kg. But i think most of scales near this price, will have similar level accuracy.. Still i like it.. When I push to power on. It wakes up very fast.

EtekCity was nice enough to include a two free AAA batteries. It comes with instructions which are straight forward and can switch between Metric and American. 400lbs.| 180 kgs. I've had my Instant Pot for a month or so now. I am happy with the Instant Pot's performance on the tasks I have used it for thus far. For example, I have used it once per week to make yogurt, and it does a great job. The first batch required a little more hands on time, as I figured out the process. But subsequent batches have required very little effort. I recommend draining the whey off of the yogurt if you like it thick, but either way, it is nice to be able to control the sweetener and flavoring of the yogurt, which always tastes very fresh. In addition, I have used the Instant Pot several times to make hard boiled eggs. They come out perfect after 5 minutes of low pressure, and are extraordinarily easy to peel. I have used the Instant Pot to steam veggies twice, and to make beef stroganoff once. Those came out okay, but I think will improve if I make adjustments to the cooking time and / or recipe itself. All in all, I am glad I have an Instant Pot. But I am giving it 4 rather than 5 stars because I think it has some limitations - I don't think chicken would cook very well, texture-wise, in the Instant Pot. Although it advertises a quick cook time, usually the cook time does not account for the time for the pot to come up to pressure, so it takes longer to cook some things than you might think, to the point that you have to think about whether it's just more efficient to use the stovetop or oven. And, given the size and shape of the Instant Pot, making many things (e.g., ribs, certain individual desserts, pork shoulder, etc.) requires either odd cutting of hunks of meat or odd stacking techniques. For that reason, I wish someone would come up with a multi-function electric pressure cooker that has shorter and wider design.

Busy soccer parents and students alike, if you value your time this electronic PC is sure to give you more of it. The instant Pot 7-in-1 pressure cooker has drastically reduced the amount of time I spend in the kitchen. When establishing my rating, I took into account the price point, overall durability, ease of use, and wide array of functions provided.. Even at full price, this machine delivered everything it promised and then some. However, if their Cyber Monday sales are any reflection of profitable profit margins, it could be lower. For one day last November pricing of the 5-quart option dropped to $49; as a result, I picked up another one. As far as durability goes, the only issue I’ve encountered was due to user error.. Take heed and be sure to refrain from holding the Instant Pot solely by its lid, as it has a tendency to become unfastened. The only other grievance I have is the tone and frequency of beeps emitted when cooking is done or beginning, but this may only be an issue for those with a tendency to cook at odd hours of the night.. Of the many cooking settings, I have been most impressed by the yogurt maker, rice cooker and sauté function. Being able to sauté in the pot is a godsend, as it leaves all the tasty bits in the bottom not to be missed out on when other ingredients are added and set under pressure. Another example of versatility can be reflected by the slow-cooking application that is great for anyone who wants to draw out as much flavor as possible without using a separate appliance.. With the ability to set it and forget it, you can be in class and cook your lunch at the same time. Chili? Great. Carnitas? Done. Feel like hosting a spontaneous Friendsgiving later in the day? That completely frozen turkey sitting in your deep-freeze can be done in under an hour.. In summation, with so many innovative features the Instant Pot is a busybody’s match made in heaven.

review_title: Best cooker on the market when purchased.  Use it all the time.  Set-and-forget controls aare perfect, as is the food.
review_body: We have used this dozens of times since we bought this.  I grew up with an old fashioned pressure cooker with the jiggly regulator that my parents would use all the time.  So I am very happy to see they added a microcontroller and sensors to this old standard.  I takes the old pots from a risky method of cooking to a set-and-forget way of making great food in record time.  We have made many chilis, soups, roasts, and sauerkraut with pork in this pot, and the only thing that doesn't come out perfectly each time is the roasts, and I think it's more my fault than the cooker.  Chilis work the best in a pressure cooker because all the flavors come out and blend in 90 minutes for what usually takes 4 hours or longer in a slow cooker.  The steel pot is removable and can be washed in the dishwasher.  Ours is still shiny like the day we bought it.  We don't really use the plastic utensils that came with it since we use "real serving spoons" with it.

review_title: Come get mine. It's out on the curb.
review_body: I fell for the Instant Pot hype. It's changed people's lives! They can now feed their family healthier meals; husbands suddenly love cooking; it's so easy to throw a few frozen pieces of meat in and then Bam! you have dinner. Friends, I hate to disappoint you, but this isn't the miracle machine that you've heard about. The reason I pulled the trigger on getting  the IP, after reading countless 5* reviews, was to replace my rice cooker. I was excited to open up the box and immediately popped rice and water and hit the Rice button. Makes sense, right? What was produced was a gelatinous goo with a layer of water in top. And I burned myself. Twice. The area in front of and behind the handle is blazing hot metal! (You've been warned!). But I was not deterred. I read the entire manual and recipe book, did the water test, and realized that this is NOT a convenient "set it and forget it" appliance like my old rice cooker or crock pot. This machine is as needy and demanding as a sugar-crazed toddler. After the pressure cooking process, there's a whole dance of quick releases, natural releases, keep warm settings and a bunch of hot steam and potentially dangerous burns this working mom doesn't have time for.. I've tried at least half a dozen white rice recipes -- not free-styling it, actual blogs of people devoted to the IP movement -- with different time settings, different water to rice ratios, different brand of rice -- and none of them have given me delish results that I would share with my family. It's been too watery, unevenly cooked, or completely inedible. And unlike my rice cooker, the interior pot isn't nonstick so it's time consuming to clean out.. The IP and I had one last date tonight before I broke up with him for good. A "foolproof" " melt in your mouth tender" beef roast. The kind of thing I can put in my crock pot before I leave for work in the morning and come home to a delicious dinner (with al dente potatoes and carrots) in rich gravy. After browning the beef, sauteing onions and layering potatoes on top, I set the magic machine for 70 minutes (per a recipe I found online). After 70 minutes plus a 10 minute natural release, I had a watery mess of unseasoned shoe leather and disintegrated potatoes. I fished out the potatoes and did another 25 minutes, plus another 10 minute natural release. Still tough as old boots and tasted about as good.. I give the Instant Pot 4 stars for good construction (it's a solid, heavy machine). Functionality and convenience, zero stars. That averages out to what I think is a very fair 2 stars. I can't believe this is ALL user error. I mean, I'm not cooking sous vide or anything! Maybe I'm cooking things in too small quantities (like 2 cups of uncooked rice at a time)? Anyway, I'm not waiting around to find out what's wrong. The learning curve is just too steep and I'm just too busy to futz with another machine that's supposed to make my life easier but has actually added babysitting and cleaning time on top of my day.. Epilogue: I have bought a new rice cooker and couldn't be happier.

review_title: Can't get food smells out of the gasket. Yuck!
review_body: I like a lot of things about this pot, the quick way to cook rice with pressure cooking and the pot is not coated with plastic. However, the silicon ring holds smells so it always smells like old rice or broccoli and there seems to be no way to get the smell out. This is a game changer for me. I don't like it. I'll go back to the cheapie rice cooker i had before.

The first instant pot that I ordered was defective and was returned to Amazon. Amazon was great in dealing with this return. The yogurt feature on the first instant pot would not hold a proper temperature. I talked to the manufacturer and they said that the unit was defective.  (I wasted a half gallon of milk and a lot of time on it.)  The second instant pot worked perfectly. I have not tried anything other than the yogurt feature so far since I just got the pressure cooker yesterday.  Please note, the reason I am giving the instant pot three stars is because the manual that comes with the unit had limited directions.  I had to spend way too much time trying to figure out how to use it.  With so many features, the manual should give explicit directions for each function.  There is an online manual that is more detailed and helped quite a bit at the Instant Pot website.  I purchased a SS Presto  pressure cooker last year from Amazon.  Since I have used a pressure cooker for many years, I probably will stick with the Presto cooker most of the time.  I cannot see how the instant pot will really save that much time.

We have had the Instant Pot for a week now. I have cooked in it nearly every day. I've made black bean soup, PERFECT brown rice, roasts 2 nights, and pork chops with mashed potatoes. Every single dish was cooked to perfection. My husband swears that everything is more flavorful.. I love the fact that with the black bean soup, after it's initial cook phase, I added veggies for another 7 minute cook. The veggies did not turn black like they do when cooking on the stove. The celery was still green, the carrots still orange, etc. For one of the roasts, I also added carrots and potatoes. The flavors were so good and they did not mix wit the roast. One thing my husband does not when cooking on the stove is that the carrots make everything taste like carrots. Not so in the instant pot, everything kept it's own taste and did not mix with the others foods.. This is an absolute must in any kitchen! I may even get a second one, since with the roasts I had to cook the rice the traditional way so that they would be done at the same time.

review_title: Quality was good, buy the SMELL of the gasket, WHEW!
review_body: I am returning this item due to not being able to get rid of the smell of what I cooked from the gasket seal.  I soaked it in vinegar for over an hour and it still smelled of the pot roast spices so I am thinking it might harbor bacteria.  I did like the stainless steel insert.  I put in a totally frozen piece of rump roast and pressure cooked it for like an hour, even tho my temp gauge read 200 degrees it was still a little tough so I programmed it to cook for 9 hrs on slow cook mode.  The next morning it was tender.  So I am thinking I could have done this in my slow cooker I paid $35-$40 for.  I like the little beeps that is made that signaled that you were locking and unlocking the lid.

Got this item due to the high number of positive Amazon reviews and we currently live in an older rental with tiny kitchen and no outside exhaust hood. So in the summer you can imagine how hot the kitchen gets. Plus, cleaning up after cooking is a major PITA. Now with the Instant Pot, there's less clean up, the kitchen doesn't get super hot, and you don't have to supervise the cooking. It's fast, convenient and makes tasty food! The recipe book that comes with the pot is very good and the Internet is full of Instant Pot devotees sharing their favorite recipes, which makes learning how to cook in the Instant Pot easy.. Bought this on sale over Christmas and it's the best Christmas present! If you love to cook, you should get it. If you love to eat but hate to cook, there're even more reasons for you to get it.

review_title: Changes the way we cook dinner.
review_body: I've had my instant pot for 2 weeks shy of a year now.  I use it at least twice a week.  I use this as a rice cooker, pressure cooker, and occasionally as a slow cooker.  I have not tried making yogurt.  I prefer it over other devices as I can easily remove the pot and wash it without fear of dropping a heavy crock with slippery soapy hands that will break.  I have had some trouble in the past week with the gasket not sealing correctly, but it does say in the manual that the gasket will need periodic replacement.. My typical dishes I make in the instant pot are meats.  I can have a pot roast from fridge to table in 2 hours.  I have used it for soups as well as cooking sweet potatoes and spaghetti squash.. Over the past year the pot has held up well.  The unit itself is not to be immersed in water, but does have a removable power cord.  Programming is easy selecting between high, low, or normal pressure.  You can set a delay start time and then set the cooking time. While cooking there is some steam that comes out of the pressure and the overflow valve and it makes a gentle hiss/hum sound so you know it's cooking.  When it's done there is a beep, but not something you have to respond to.  It then goes into warm mode.  I've set things to cook on slow cook and went to work and come home to find them on warm for 45 minutes.  Cleaning is easy.  I'm not a fan of teflon as it will flake off so I'm thrilled that this does not have teflon.  For really tough suck on food, I fill with water and drop in 6 denture cleaning tablets.  The next morning I wash it out and store it.  The gasket is easy to get off and on for cleaning.  The only difficult part of cleaning is the drip container on the back to catch excess condensation.  I've only had to clean it once when I over filled the instant pot.. All and all, this instant pot has changed the way we cook.  It's great for this working mom.
