review_title: There are different models of the Genie system...different size refills. Use caution.
review_body: Use caution....Playtex makes different models of the Genie pail.  I bought these refills and NOWHERE were the different models described.  These refills are for the Genie models Essentials, Elite and Complete diaper disposal systems.  Ours is the Genie Expressions so these refills almost fit but not quite so the lid will not latch defeating the odor reduction feature.  And I only just now figured it out, so Amazon's non return policy past a certain timeframe works against me, even though the refills are unused, in original packing, etc.  Wasted money!!

review_title: The option.  Not perfect, but does the job.
review_body: We like our Diaper Genie.  We really do.  And these are the refills.  And they fit.  And do the job.. But every so often, we find one of the refills is very hard to get started.  And then you only get the middle of the plastic wrap.  And then the thing is done for.  And we have to either jerry-rig it or write off half the refill, or sometimes just throw the whole refill away.. But the diaper genie is the best diaper disposal product we've seen amongst the many at our friends' houses.  No smell, compact, easy to deal with.

Solid waste bags for diapers. The only thing I don't like is that you have to tie the bottom and the top of each bag manually which can lead to wasted bag space or if not tied properly, the bag can open from the bottom when you are attempting to remove it because of the weight of the diapers.

We have used the knock off poop bags and the name brand. I think these are more than worth the small difference in price. They last longer and are noticeably thicker. I wouldn't trust others to make my cylindrical poop keepers.

review_title: These fit the diaper genie great and make disposing of poopy diapers pretty easy
review_body: These fit the diaper genie great and make disposing of poopy diapers pretty easy.  The only thing I question is whether they hold as my diapers as the packaging says they do.  270 diapers means if you change 10 a day the refill should hold 27 days.  That doesnt seem to be the case but I admit I havent monitored it that closely.

We have the Diaper Genie, and this product is a must need so the diapers have something to go in... that just makes sense. It's a long garbage bag that you can cut to the length you want it to be. The Genie hides the diapers and the bag so well that I don't realize when the bag itself is full, so it's always a little disappointing when the refill cartridge runs out. We'll keep using it until we have no more diapers to worry about.

I love my Diaper Genie and therefore love the diaper genie refills. With all things considered, I don’t think they are that expensive, and since they are cheaper on Amazon, especially when using Subscribe & Save, than at several of my local stores, I think they pay for themselves. They hold the smell in, we only take ours out once a week and there’s no smell except for those few seconds when we take it out. It saves of from having to take out the garbage every time we have a stinky diaper, or saves us the walk outside to throw the stinky diaper in the outside garbage bin.. Simple to use, Convenient, and Odor free, highly recommend!

These things work great, the plastic could be a little thicker. My only complaint is the box says one ring will hold way more diapers than it actually does. I bought the "year supply" before my daughter was born she's 5 months now and I've already had to buy more rings. Hopefully this is helpful

Overall, it's more of a waste of money...ever since my baby started eating solids, the diaper genie trash can stinks and stenches the whole room. Even though the bags are super easy to install, they don't hold in the smell very well, and I don't like the fact that I have to use scissors to cut the bag and then tie a knot at the ends every time the can gets full (which is frequently). I started using regular trash bags, which serve the same purpose.... So annoying.. Better off investing in the ones that tie themselves off after each diaper...not sure what they're called. Or just use a regular trash bag.

Diaper genie refills are durable and a great value, these bags really lock in the orders and save us dozens of trips outside. I only wish the slot that the bag comes out of was made a little bigger my husband always has to cut it so that the plastic doesn't shred the bags but it's a simple fix for a good product. The diaper genie #Rewardsprogram is an added bonus it's nice to get something back for using awesome products!

review_title: It was the best photo booth for this winter
review_body: It was the best photo booth for this winter!. Everyone loves the lights!. And if you can, buy the gold-foil line curtain. It couldn't be better!. Love it!!!. But the problem was after using them to keep in storage..... Thank you!
Absolutely perfect!. Tip: hang them up where you want them before you unravel the rest of the lights, otherwise they will get tangled very easily.
Awesome lights!!!!
It made my living room so much beautiful and brighter

review_title: Nice for my paper flowers wall
review_body: Nice ... my wall look nice
Exactly what I bought them for. Great lights
Great product!
I've bought a couple already. Everybody, all ages, loves these lights
I LOVE these!!! So sweet! Very soft and pretty. 8 settings to choose from.

I did a total makeover of my 16 year old daughter’s room and she loves the curtain of lights. The lights have many different modes of blinking and they set a nice spa-like mood.  We definitely recommend!

review_title: ... been buying these for a couple of years and liked them fine
review_body: I've been buying these for a couple of years and liked them fine. This latest order seems to have a lesser quality than prior orders. Thinner, rougher, more store-brand than name-brand texture to them. I've always given them 5 stars, but the average quality gets an average rating.

Love that this comes in bulk - the entire family shares! The paper towels are durable enough to soak up a mess but soft enough to use as a napkin at dinner. They're perforated at small increments which is nice.

review_title: Work well but not as good as Kirkland Signature Paper Towels
review_body: Price is comparable to Kirkland Signature paper towels, but even though they work pretty well, they aren't as thick and absorbent as KS paper towels.  I've cancelled my subscribe and save and will be going back to KS paper towels when we run out of these.

Big brawny fan, but when they didn’t send for my subscribe and save, I had t quickly find. Replacement. Of course I wasn’t told that the order was canceled, so not pleased. Chose Sparkle because they were the cheapest pick a size. Very happy. Thanks Brawny, now I have found a better price and reliable paper towel.

review_title: all of the paper towels have a foul odor like a wet dog
review_body: Something is wrong with the case we received, all of the paper towels have a foul odor like a wet dog.

These paper towels smell like fish! So horribly that I had two paper towels sheets sitting in my large living room with a 10 foot ceilings and the entire living room stank so bad I had to air out the house! Yuck! Do not buy!

It’s good paper towel for the price, not the best but if u want to save some $$ so it’s worth the price. This one is pack of 2 rolls, each roll is 107 2-ply, pick-a-size sheets. The total of 24 rolls give 1373 sq ft of paper towel

These are a bargain. I use a heck of a lot of paper towels and I do not believe you can purchase the quality and quantity cheaper.. Oh-your mail man will hate you . All though very light, they take a lot of room in his Postal Jeep.

review_title: Absorbs like crazy, but doesn't scratch or tear and can scrub all gross kitchen stuff!
review_body: Love these paper towels! Absorbs like crazy, but doesn't scratch or tear and can scrub all gross kitchen stuff! Love that I can buy them in bulk!. Highly Recommended!

review_title: They're paper towels. They do what they're supposed to do
review_body: I mean, if you need 24 rolls of paper towels, you can't really go wrong here. I just got tired of going to the store every couple of weeks. These should last me until like November.

I can't say enough good things about this mattress protector!!! It is the first soft waterproof protector I've been able to find, doesn't feel like you're sleeping on a plastic sheet. It has stood the test of my son wetting the bed several times, and his mattress has been completely dry under the protector! That's enough for 5 stars any day for me!!

review_title: Coarse material is unnoticeable with sheet on. Effective pad.
review_body: Packaging feels like quality, which to me indicates that they strive for quality. However, when opening it, I was surprised at how rough it feels. It is a very coarse terry cloth. To me, it felt like an old, dried up, hotel towel (which was a big turnoff). But we decided to give it a try.. The material that tucks around the corners of the mattress is quality. Feels like it's built to last. And it easily covered our 16" thick king mattress with plenty of room to spare. It seemed to pull tight which is nice so that we don't get bunching under the sheet.. After we put the sheet on, we couldn't feel the coarseness of the terry cloth at all. And it seems to actually hold our sheet on a bit better as well. No longer slips off the corner of the mattress during the night.. We haven't tried putting it to the test to see how it handles liquids, etc. But I'm confident that it would repel any in the event that we have a spill in the future.. I'd recommend this to friends.

This mattress cover is great.  I bought it for my son.  He brings drinks etc up with him at night and I wanted to make sure the brand new mattress that I bought was protected.  It does a great job.  It does not make any noise when moving around which is very important because he would not sleep because of it.  He moves around alot, and this has stayed in place and I have not had to adjust it or fix it.. Great buy, would recommend and would buy again for sure!

I was trying to find something to reduce allergens in my bed.  I have never had a mattress protector before so I can't compare it with anything else but so far so good. It comes as a fitted sheet and it fitts well. Not too big or too small. It is pretty quiet. A little crunching here or there but nothing overly noticeable. And it doesn't slide around, it stays in place and doesn't cause my sheets to slip off the bed. For the price I would say this is one of the best mattress protectors you could find.

review_title: SafeRest Mattress Protector is a Great Buy in all Ways!
review_body: Purchased a new mattress protector for our new mattress - this fits the bill as it protects from most things including liquid.  The price was great and it fits like a glove.  Even though it is made to protect from spills, which I find important for a mostly foam mattress, there is no plastic feel and no crinkly noise when you lay on the bed.  It is a comfortable as any mattress pad - we were just due for an upgrade. Thank you.

review_title: I bought this mattress cover (and another Queen size one ...
review_body: I bought this mattress cover (and another Queen size one last year) because I have pets who have accidents. My fear was that the cover wouldn't really stop puppy urine from soaking through if my fur baby had an accident. But it did. I was thrilled. Would buy again for sure.

review_title: Easy to put on, very roomy
review_body: This an excellent mattress protector with a decent price. I am replacing my old one, which had no distinct corners, so it was difficult to put on. This one has easy to find corners, with a very roomy skirt that is stretchy, and fits over my huge memory foam mattress. I think my mattress is about 20 inches. I attached a picture of what the waterproof backing looks like. It looks and feels like a good quality product, I am happy with my purchase.

This is a very nice Mattress protector.  Fit my queen size bed prefect.  It Has a nice backing to it and did not feel like that cheap plastic with some other mattress protectors.  I still do use a mattress pad with it.  Put this under the mattress pad for extra protection.

review_title: Not a plastic cover, but very protective
review_body: Hi, I purchased this cover to go on one of the bed-in-a-box foam mattresses for an apartment.  Its done a very good job and I think it will be able to keep the new mattress safe.. The protector is soft and isn't something that I notice on the bed, I noticed more of a thick fabric feel than a waterproof feel, the pad also doesn't make any noise that I noticed when I move around.

needed this for my dog that loves to sleep with us . Just in case there is a spill or accident i know that i will cover that. These are so worth it because you are able to be safe and worry free knowing that your mattress is covered and we all know that warrentys do not cover if mattress is stained so i am happy to have found this product with great ratings!
Paper towels are nice and thick...I will continue ordering this product on my subscribe and save

review_title: I bought this and then also bought Sparkle. Plenty ...
review_body: I bought this and then also bought Sparkle. Plenty is thicker and stronger than Sparkle. So i am sticking to Plenty. Hoping they come up with a Select a Size. That would be great. Plenty is very good value for money. Cheaper than the brand names but quality is the same if not better.
Absorbent strong paper towels I will purchase again.
This paper helps to keep your buttholeus maximus clean of any fecal matter. I use on a daily basis.
Prefer the half sheets. Quality ok, but use them to quickly.
Very absent and strong. I love them so far.
Switched from another brand on subscribe and save. Same quality at a better price

review_title: For the price is good I guess but realizing I want a little better ...
review_body: Not enough sheets per roll and want something softer.  For the price is good I guess but realizing I want a little better quality.

My go-to for all household cleanup projects.

review_title: No extra options like estimated body fat composition or anything like that
review_body: Its a simple sleek and stylish weight scale that just tells you your weight. No extra options like estimated body fat composition or anything like that. Comes covered in warnings to not stand on it when wet as it would get really slippery obviously. For $15 I'd recommend it as thats the price you'd get at any local store for a scale. If you want all that extra stuff you'll have to pay more for a different scale.

My old scale said I was 187... I have been dieting for 2 weeks... I got this scale yesterday... said at first I was 194... then 164 then 187.. Got back on my old scale says I was less then 185... This is the worst scale I have ever used!! it is not accurate! After reading the bad reveiws today I see that the good ones are fake due to people getting free products for good reviews...

review_title: Great price and easy to calibrate
review_body: Great price and easy to calibrate! I checked accuracy by weighing gallons of water, and it's accurate within .3lb, which is an acceptable standard deviation to me. It automatically switches on when you step on, freezes the weight display for about 10 seconds so that you can easily read it, and then switches off again to save battery. Highly recommend.

Gives very accurate readings, if kept in same place. I was little concern of the accuracy of digital scales, but this one is doing great. I frequently check the scale with 10-20 lb brown rice/flour bags and the scale seems to be inline all the time.

Not pleased with this item, not one bit!! I spent approx. $30 in batteries thinking that was the issue and it wasn't. I used this scale several times and one day to the next it decides to no longer work..

review_title: Excellent Choice and Easy to Use!
review_body: The Etekcity Digital Body Weight scale arrived promptly and works exactly as expected. I ordered it for our office biggest loser competition so I knew it would be getting a lot of use and so far it's great! The numbers are very easy to read with the blue backlight. It's also lightweight but durable and a very sleek design. I like that it uses AA batteries so it's an easy replacement. I also really like that you don't have to tap the scale to "wake it up" before using it. It's very easy and efficient to just step on, get a quick reading of your weight, and step off. Our scale for prior biggest loser competitions wasn't able to hold up to the constant use and when the batteries went dead it was difficult to find and replace. I recommend this product for anyone looking for an accurate and easy to use scale whether it's for yourself or the whole office!

Very nice looking,  clean and modern with glass top. Weight is pretty reliable.  Unfortunately cleaner didn't see it under the sink and the glass shattered after it was hit by the vacuum cleaner. But I love it so much I'm buying another one
Purchased this scale to replace one that I gave away. The scale is very nice looking, thin and light weight. After the first use, it seems pretty accurate with the physicians scale.

I'm 6'0" 165lbs, depending on ever so slight changes in my posture or if I lean ever so slightly forward or back, I can get a reading of 168lbs and all the way down to 161lbs. When I say slight changes in position I mean emphasizing a toe more than the other. This makes this scale very unreliable for it's sole purpose.. It got two stars because it looks kinda cool?
Completely inaccurate.  Put me off 1-3 lbs as a stepped on and off.  AccuWeight's new scale was much better.. They include a card to get something for good reviews, shady.

Fast shipping!  Great Product!

Works Great
The amount of steam that comes out!

review_title: got the job done great for traveling
review_body: Really powerful, got the job done great for traveling
I love it! It heats up so quickly. My clothes are wrinkle free!
Heats up quickly and easy to use.
Love it!
Just boils water, no force to the steam. I sent it back.

review_title: Best new countertop appliance I have ever purchased.
review_body: This is by far the best kitchen countertop appliance I have ever purchased. I was convinced by a friend to give the Instant Pot a try, she even told me when Amazon had them on sale. I received my Instant Pot two weeks ago and have used it five times since then and every thing has come out tasting great. I first made rice just to try out the Instant Pot and make sure I knew how to work the controls, etc. My rice was light and fluffy, the perfect amount of moistness and no boil over on my stove like when cooking in a pan. Next I tried cooking chicken breasts (perfect), tomato soup, chicken vegetable soup and then baked potatoes. I am very happy with the Instant Pot and am looking forward to cooking  with it for years to come.

review_title: wow never thought i would dare use let alone love pc
review_body: I returned another pressure cooker for this one, and it was the right decision: this unit is better built and the stainless steel insert is a good idea. I thought rice would stick to it but it didn't. I made yogurt with whole milk, and will never buy yogurt again from the grocery store as the home-made tastes fresher and is significantly cheaper. I am impressed. Do buy another silicone ring (savory food smell will stick to it and you don't want the smell to transfer to your yogurt). I also bought the glass lid (nuwave 9") that fits the Instant Pot perfectly (about the same price but nuwave's lid is nicer quality, imho).. Update (3 weeks later): I made pork ribs, chicken and beef curry, rice, and yogurt in this pc. Everything came out really well cooked. I am sold on the yogurt function of this pc, I used mason jars (steam milk in them, no other pots needed), and we now enjoy yogurt every day! The beef curry is seriously addictive, and it only takes 35 min of stewing for tender texture (not mushy or tough). I do strongly recommend buying two more silicone rings, it is nice to not transfer smell from strong dishes (curry) to plain dishes (rice and yogurt). I also like the nuwave 9" lid very much, it is very useful when you are reducing sauces after cooking food in the pc. I purchased another inner pot, as recommended by prior reviewer, now that I find myself using the pc every day. I honestly prefer to cook with the pc than the stove/oven. As pointed out by other reviewers, this unit is very quiet, except for beeps from the pc telling you dishes/cycle are done, there is no sound at all while it cooks your food.. By the way, the white rice (basmati) takes 3 minutes to cook (plus another 10 min to cool down naturally). To boil the milk for the yogurt it takes 1 min (that's right, one minute). The chicken curry 13 minutes.. Outstanding purchase. Kudos to the Instant Pot company for this wonderful product.

review_title: The best present ever for expecting parents!
review_body: This is the most amazing kitchen multiuse device I've ever found. I WISH WISH WISH I had found it before our child was born. That would have made cooking with an infant just a matter of throwing everything in and waiting less than an hour.. A few of the yums this has already produced:. Chili from dry beans and raw meat in under an hour.. Carnitas that were some of the most flavorful and juicy I've ever had.. Beans that went from dry to ready to eat in 20 minutes!. A few notes: while this says it works as a rice cooker, a friend with the same model passed along the note not to use it for that. The seal for the pressure cooker tends to slightly absorb the flavor of the last thing cooked and impart that into your rice. You don't notice in anything else, but rice will taste like the last dish prepared. I haven't used it for yogurt yet, but I'm buying a set of spare seals I can swap when I'm ready to make cheese and yogurt in here.

review_title: As good as all of the good things you have read
review_body: I have had the instant pot for a few weeks but just opened it last night. I did the test run as recommended by the instruction manual as I had never used a pressure cooker before and then I made a 5 pound chicken. I was skeptical how it would turn out but it was fall off the bone tender and had great flavor. I set the timer and had steel cut oatmeal waiting for me when I woke up this morning and tonight my son and I made pulled pork in 75 minutes that shredded easier than any pulled pork I have made in the smoker (granted while this pulled pork was very tender the taste is nowhere as good as the smoked pulled pork IMO so I would only make it in this manner if I was in a hurry ... but I can't imagine a scenario where I needed to make pulled pork quickly). I bought this one specifically for the yogurt function (and dishwasher safe stainless steel parts) and will be trying that tonight.. UPDATE: In the last few days I have made homemade mac and cheese (from dry noodles to ready to eat in 20 minutes), yogurt, chicken stock (2 hours instead of a full day on the stove), homemade dog food (took 30 minutes when it used to take hours), beef stew and chicken noodle soup. I admit I am finding a lot of reasons to use if just so I can test it and will not use with this frequency in the future but it is awesome and will get plenty of use in my kitchen.

I am so happy with this Instant Pot. I have used it only for the slow cooker so far but it has gotten so much use so far. I love that I can throw my chicken and all my veggies in and let it cook for however long I want. I’ve been making bone broth, soups and anything that pops into my head. I am on a super restricted diet due to health issues and every meal has to be made fresh....no leftovers at all....so this comes in handy and saves me so much time. Plus it is super easy to use and clean. I have other crock pots but this size is perfect and it’s so easy to clean. I set the desired cooking time and then when it’s done cooking it keeps it warm.

And I have them all! This has transformed how I cook. It stays on my cooktop 24/7 and I use it all the time. I mostly use the pressure cooker feature but how cool is it to have the equivalent of 7 appliances out and convenient!. I have cooked mostly frozen meat in it and the results are always amazing. Quick, tender and delicious. Potatoes are a breeze.  I found a recipe for pressure cooker cheesy chicken, rice and broccoli casserole that takes 5-10 minutes to cook in the pressure cooker. I made pasta and sauce in it, putting the uncooked pasta in the sauce and letting the pressure cooker work. After 15 minutes, the pasta was tender - too tender, in fact. Should have quick-released the steam when the cooking time was up.. There are other units that look like this one out there but I chose this one because the company is constantly improving the models based on customer suggestions. It also has a stainless steel cooking pot, which I insist on. No non-stick in this house, thank you. It is a dream to clean and nothing sticks in it when you are using the pressure cooker feature.. There are websites out there devoted to pressure cooking. Check them out and be fearless! The old days of thoughts of exploding pots are over and I, for one, am thrilled. I have recommended it many times to friends and clients. All I can say is, What did I do before I had it?

Purchased this based on a friend's recommendation.  This is my first time using the pressure cooking method and I have to say it is quite fun!  I don't think I would say it is a big time saver since pressure cooking requires the device to ramp up and create the pressure seal before the actual cooking time begins and then there is sometimes (depending on recipe) time after the cook time completes where the device then has to come down in temp and the pressure seal to be released.. The pressure cooker method is not as "one and done" as using a slow cooker; most recipes I've tried require browning the meat first or doing a sauté before and/or after the pressure cooking is completed.  But the method does make for some great full flavored meals with meat that is very moist and tender.  And although I haven't tried the feature, I do like that there is a slow cooker option.. Overall it is a fun little device to add another cooking option to my kitchen.  It took a little learning curve to become familiar with all the buttons and options on this thing - but after the first use I figured out most of it.

I would give the product a second star, but the lack of support takes it away.  A little history.  My wife wanted to buy a rice cooker, I suggested an Instant pot instead as it would do more.  She was right.  We got a good deal($75) before the holidays and I put in a serious effort to get to know this thing.  Right off the bat, I got a lot of 'BURN' notices (sic, remember the show?).  Even when using recipes specific to this item?  BURN.  Usually 2-3 before actual pressure cooking.  BURN, open, scrape/stir/add liquid, repeat.  Tomato soup?  BURN!  Sauce, stew, vegetarian/chicken/beef chili, pulled chicken, chicken stock?  BURN!  It takes a lot of the speed out of the thing, especially if you're not watching for the BURN, come back expecting a finished meal only to be disappointed.  I researched, changed how I stacked things in the pot.  Stopped sauteing in it completely.  BURN BURN BURN.  So, over a week ago I finally after waiting too long for an exchange and possibly return,  contacted Instant Pot's support.  I got an open support ticket with an email.....that's it.  Eight days and not a peep.  They mention a holiday backlog?  The holidays that ended weeks ago?  I even tried replying to my own support ticket to see if it kicked the tires?  Nope.  Either they're completely inundated with problems or incapable of support OR maybe I didn't reach the level of deserving support?  Any way you look at it, if you're thinking of buying this should concern you.  I am ashamed that I fell for the whole 'cult' thing that seems to drive this product, I thought I was immune to and wary of fanboyism.  To be fair, all but one batch of rice didn't 'BURN' nor did the one time one made chicken soup, so it's not all failure.  This is supposed to be a time saver and my experience proves it's anything but.  Even as a rice cooker, I tested it side by side with my stovetop method and starting from cold, the Instant Pot is almost a minute slower.  Buyer beware of the product and the fanboys that guard it like it's their child.  BURN!

review_title: My mom fell in love with this pot after using it for the first ...
review_body: My mom fell in love with this pot after using it for the first time in a friend's house and we decided to get it for my new apartment. This is the perfect size for two people. It does everything. Probably particularly great for Asian cuisine.

This is my 3rd Instant Pot.  I already have the 6-Quart and the 8-quart  I bought another Mini for my sister as a gift, as she has a 6-quart also.. We are now "pot heads". (People who go on about how they love their Instant Pots)  It is important that there is the Yogurt setting, as I do cultured foods such as Natto and Amazake.  (I have a batch of natto in my 3 Qt now.). I made a huge pot of bone broth in the 8 Qt--letting it slow cook for 24 hours. The richest beef broth I had ever made.  I used to hate peeling hard boiled  eggs. Now, its 5 minutes to cook, 5 minutes to rest, and the shells come right off smoothly, not leaving any nicks in the eggs. I could go on, but the bottom line is you can't go wrong with an Instant Pot.

review_title: Durable, high quality, amazing fragrance eliminates the strongest of odors!
review_body: Glad trash bags have long been a favorite brand of mine, and have gotten me through the many smelly messes 3 children can create. Add to that the wonderful fragrance of Gain, and it is a home run for me.  These bags fit my 13 gallon trash can very well, they are snug around the top of the can and just reach the bottom. There is a decent amount of give without tearing, unless it happens to be an extremely heavy bag of trash, and even then it is minimal around the very top while trying to pull the bag out.  With a family of 4, I try to reduce our footprint as much as possible by recycling as much as I can. But there are still times where quite a bit of trash is generated.  Even so, we rarely use more than 2 bags per week, these bags hold quite a bit of trash!. The scent is wonderful, even with the smelliest of refuse.  Raw chicken and beef, the very odorous tuna can, normally it would be very unpleasant to walk in to these odors after sitting overnight.  These bags do not cover the smells, they eliminate them. I like these so much, I have placed them on my Subscribe and Save list for delivery!
I like the way this fits
Great price and quality

It's very convenient and easy to use! I didn't plan to have the diaper trash can but I got it from a friend so I started using this. It comes with three packs so now I subscribe it every two months to deliver. Highly recommended!

review_title: Not a year supply like advertised!
review_body: Low rating because it is false advertising saying it’s a year supply! I am on my 4th refill from the box, meaning I only have 4 left. Considering i ordered this 3 months ago, it’s safe to say the remaining refills won’t last me another 9 months to make it to the year mark!

A bit pricey, but the Diaper Genie takes the hassle of throwing diapers away much easier.  The bags are thicker than normal trash bags and have an odor eater function.  To save on money and refills, simply cut the bottom of the full bag (when already placed over the trash can) and let the diapers fall out.  Then re-tie the bottom of the bag, bunch up the extra bag back in the holder, and re-use.  The odor reducing capacity does seem to wear out with continued use, but it still helps.

This product is essential for all parents with newborns. Its a very easy to install on your Diaper Genie Disposal Pail.. The Bags are resistant to odors but you must change the bag at least 2x a day to prevent any odors from developing.. Even though the material the bags use are resistant, some odors may escape as you push more diapers into the Pail.. The pail should be re-design to address this slight faultiness.. Over all, this product works well, and its best to keep diapers out of the kitchen or bathroom garbage bin.

review_title: These are the original refills recommended by the manufacturer and work well
review_body: These are the original refills recommended by the manufacturer and work well.  They were packaged appropriately with shipping that was prompt and as expected. We experienced no problems with the order or product.

review_title: This is one of the greatest things to have for new born baby
review_body: This is one of the greatest things to have for new born baby. Long live diaper genie! The bag holds a lot and this is one of the cheapest places to buy them. If you don't already, buy one it's a great investment and worth every cent!

review_title: We buy a lot of these
review_body: With two little boys both in diapers, we buy a lot of these liners. They last us about a month each, or 3-months for the multi-pack. They do a great job of sealing in nasty smells and are far more rugged than a standard trashcan liner. If you have a Diaper Genie, you know how good it is and don't need a review to convince you to purchase refills. If for some reason you don't have one and are reading this review, go ahead and pull the trigger. They work well and fulfill a necessary purpose.

review_title: Almost 3 months in to twins, still using genies
review_body: Yes, plural.  I've got 3 genies set up.  I have two full size in their room so I can easily switch out in the middle of the night and then a mini in the kitchen in case I don't make it to their room during the day.. Everyone says not to bother and that it's expensive to use a genie.  But I haven't given up on them yet.  When I see the black line start on the side of the refill, I swap it out to the mini so I can get another (smaller) bag out of it.  I hated it when I'd get 2/3 of a bag and floop, the refill would run out.
Everyone needs a diaper geni so your house doesn't reek of pee and/or dirty diapers.  These are great to be able to use for days, then put in the trash.

I'm too lazy to try out a different diaper pail.  These work and are abit expensive.  Can't wait to potty train my kids so I don't have to use these bags anymore.  They still seep out some smell and that's why I put this in the bathroom.

I always got these bags from Target and loved them.  I bought them on Amazon and although the box looks the same they are much poorer quality. They do not fit snuggly on the garbage can so the bags fall down.
They dont grip the can and just slip down makung a huge mess.

review_body: Purchased on March 28th. Still had paper towels in the house (reason for late review). The paper towels smell like fish, no exaggeration. We thought that it might be a bad roll. Nope, every roll!! You can't smell it through the plastic, but once you open it you definitely smell it!

I have reordered this item several times. I find the price and convenience to be a big bonus. I really like the pick a size and that these towels really absorb well and are sturdy. I can clean up a mess, wring the Sparkle Paper Towels out and keep going.
Seem to work as well as the Scott select a size that got discontinued from subscribe and save.. Good price, Good scrubbing power. Good size for the towels and the rolls

review_title: Large quantity,  strength of paper, price, delivery.
review_body: I use Norwex towels and cloths as much as I can, but still need paper towels frequently.  I like that Sparkle towels are 1/2 the size of most paper towels, less to go in land fills.
Another win win. My son told me this is what they order by the case in Wal-Mart but I'm getting a better deal. I told him i know that's the reason i order from Amazon. Good strong paper towels.
We use Sparkle because we feel it's a better price than the expensive towels, but still good quality.
Were okay expected more from all the advertising this company does. Worked for my needs but they are thin and doesn't scrub well.

Most recent shipment was okay, previous was not and appeared to have grease stains on the end of some rolls of paper towels.  Quality control is lacking, this order of Sparkle will be my last.  Going back to a more major brand, or will buy local.

review_title: Outstanding Investment to Protect Your Expensive Mattress
review_body: Purchased as a back-up protection for our new mattress. Have not used it yet, but believe this product to be a good buy (investment) to protect our  $1, 000 mattress we recently purchased; should the default protection cover develop problems. We hope to use the SafeRest cover as an eventual replacement for the one we purchased at the furniture store because the SafeRest cover is a better buy.

review_title: We just got a brand new king sized bed, ...
review_body: We just got a brand new king sized bed, and coincidentally we're also currently potty training our two and a half year old daughter. I knew that meant that we had to order a mattress protector for our new mattress, just in case the baby had any accidents! Thank goodness nothing has spilled on the mattress so far, so the protector hasn't gotten tested out, but if/when we face that issue (I'm sure we will with a young child) I'll update this review.
Would be better if it encased the whole mattress, but it’s easy to put on and is comfortable.

review_title: I'm so glad I purchased this mattress pad
review_body: I'm so glad I purchased this mattress pad, it is perfect for my Zinus Memory Foam bed, it fits very well around all the corners, does not slip and slide, keeps my mattress cooler becasuse it is cotton and it is also a protector from spills. I like the fact of the fit, it is definitely a Premium mattress pad!

Claims to be cotton, but there is a plastic/vinyl waterproof underside. I am concerned it might be hot in the summer. Time will tell. Otherwise it was a good value compared to other mattress covers. So far, so good!

review_title: Love it! I got it to go along with ...
review_body: Love it!  I got it to go along with my Microfiber Sheet Set and Milliard 6" Memory Foam Tri-Fold Mattress for camping.  I like that it's waterproof on the back and terry cloth on the top - and yet not like heavy noisy vinyl.  It's lightweight and soft!!!  It's a tad bit big for the mattress, but I just tuck in the little extra underneath and everything works perfect together.  It's hypoallergenic - Glad I got it.  Makes camping enjoyable and homey!

I shopped around for a waterproof mattress protector that was not too "crinkly" sounding and was hesitant to buy an overpriced one at the department stores; I had no idea before how many there were on the market. I saw this one and took a chance. The protective surface is only on the top of the mattress, not on the sides, so that is good to know. I had no prior expectations, but I suppose if I had, it would have been that the protection would extend over the sides of the mattress as well. Regardless, it is not noisy at all and does not add any extra padding to the bedclothes. I like the way the side mesh lets the mattress breathe. Now my whole bedroom is hypoallergenic.

review_title: Worth the price and it is a good product.
review_body: I really like these. I purchased one for my bed and then just recently purchased one for my husband's bed. I am disabled and have special needs so it is necessary for us to have seperate beds. Besides problems with my illness, we have an aging cat who isn't able to jump down from the bed on her own. And sometimes my husband sleeps like a rock and doesn't hear her when she tries to let him know she needs down. This waterproof protector really works and washes up so well. We also both have foam mattresses that we want to protect from spills, accidents and keep them from getting dirty. I do recommend this product. It is worth the price and saves a lot of hassle and time :)

review_title: I read the reviews on this one and they were very good. When I received it
review_body: Our previous mattress protector totally fell apart, after many years.  I read the reviews on this one and they were very good.  When I received it, I was happy to see that it actually was the same type I had.  Quiet, not plasticky at all.  They take a while to wash, so include a towel in the dryer to speed up the process.  Fits our CalKing perfectly. Very happy with this purchase.

review_title: Easy to put it on. Great material!
review_body: Awesome bed protector compared to others. What I like about this is that it is easy to put on. It wraps over the top of the mattress, unlike others that go all around and you have to lift to mattress to get it on. The material also looks as if it can withstand any liquid.

I used it one day and it seemed like about the right weight then I used a week later and it said I had lost 50 lbs! I cleared it stepped on it again and it said I had gained 17! It's all over the board now. Would not recommend.

review_title: 6/24/17 - since purchasing this weight scale over one year ...
review_body: 6/24/17  - since purchasing this weight scale over one year ago it has performed appropriately; competitively priced.  THANKS.  Rb

The scale is very inconsistent. Step on and the scale displays one weight, step off and back on and its 10lbs more, then its 2lbs less, its all over the place. I have to stand on it 3 or 4 times to get any sort of mildly accurate reading. Don’t waste your money.

review_title: It's sleek and feels good to the touch
review_body: I bought this scale because my old one broke. When i first got it i noticed the glass surface and wasn't to sure but then i so the rest and it looks impressive! It's sleek and feels good to the touch. That was just what i saw. after putting in the batteries i noticed the blue light flash on! this was a plus for me since its hard to see in the night sometimes. The scales is fast at calculating your weight and that good because some take forever to way you. I say if your on a diet or just trying to take your weight and need a durable scale this is the one for you !

I've been using this scale for about 6 months now.  It is accurate, easy to use and looks elegant.  I can see nothing negative about the Etekcity at all.  It is clean, and gets the weight right every time.  Wish it would trend downward but that isn't the idea, is it?. I think it's a good purchase and I'd buy it again.

review_title: Not as reliable in the long run.
review_body: Good for what its worth. After 5 months, it's not as reliable. My weight can change from 2-5 lbs depending on where it is on my bathroom within 2-3 mins. Changed batteries. Still the same problem.

The scale would fluctuate the weight give or take a few lbs after stepping off and on again. So, the scale itself wasn't the greatest for us personally BUT the customer service was EXCEPTIONAL.

I am satisfied with my purchase.  It's slim and attractive looking.  I love that the display is lit.  Once you step on it comes right on and weighs you fast.  My only problem is it tells the truth about my weight.  HaHaHa  Being able to step on and get my weight fast has helped me losing weight.

My steamer was really hard to open. I was disappointed how quickly the water ran out and needed to be refilled to keep using. It’s kind of unrealistic to use if you frequently have multiple things to steam. But I had to wait for it to cool a little before I could open to refill. It did do a good job of getting wrinkles out. But for what i need it for, I wish I had decided to go with my gut and invest in a larger floor/stand up steamer instead.

Heats Fast, Light Weight and a Good Price

I got one of these and came back to buy one for each of my adult kids. And they each love this as much as I do and use it every day. Oh My Gosh! Everything you make in this tastes better! And who can beat a wonderful from scratch chicken noodle soup in 8 minutes? Where has this been all my life? It's so wonderful to know we can eat a delicious meal with no fuss even if I did forget to defrost things and I'm exhausted after a full day of work. Yes, I have put every frozen food imaginable in it, and just added a few minutes cooking time. Turns out great. My husband loves rice and he cooks up perfect rice every time. So far, we've used it for just about every kind of food without a fail. Plus, it's safe! I know pressure cookers have gotten a bad rap over the years. But this one is different.. I used a regular pressure cooker years ago but quit when my mom told me the story of her friend who had one blow up. The lady did survive, but I threw my old one out. The Instant Pot is different. It has 10 safety features to prevent a mishap. If the first one fails, the next kicks in, and so on. I don't believe it can blow up since these safety features immediately let the steam out to depressurize it. It really is safe because of all the backups.. So, if you love the speed of a pressure cooker but were ever worried about them, this is your solution. It replaces many other appliances, too, I keep it out on the counter, and our countertop space is limited, but it's worth it. It's always ready to go. If you use it as often as we do, you'll love getting an extra pot liner, too! Very convenient to store smaller amounts of leftovers in the fridge while you make a larger dinner meal.. If you are on the fence, go for it! You'll thank yourself!

I resisted this purchase for a year. I heard all the hype from friends and family but honestly thought I don’t need another kitchen gadget.. I received an amazon gift certificate, and since I had everything I could want after Christmas, I thought maybe it was time to find out what all the talk is about.. The day it arrived I scoured the cupboards for something to cook. I tried a simple penne pasta recipe found on the web. It was amazing. I’m not usually big on pasta, but the sauce was inside each penne, the pasta was cooked perfectly. We ate all the leftovers which never happens! In the first week I have tried chicken soup stock, minestrone soup, beef stroganoff, cream of mushroom soup, and salsa chicken. Every dish has been very simple, and very delicious. I love using only one pot to sauté, and cook the meal. So many less pots to wash. I love the heavy stainless steel inner pot. Not a fan of non stick coatings that eventually peel. Overall I am in love with this new toy, I really didn’t think I could possible love it so much! I would buy it again in a heartbeat!

review_title: One of the best cookware (Kitchen toy) I've ever had ... still learning and experimenting!  Top Chef ... Here I come!
review_body: One of the best kitchen cookware I've ever had except for ...!  It's not easy to clean.. For example:  The top is made out of stainless steel and plastic.  The problem is if food or liquid gets in between the stainless steel and plastic, there's no way to clean it easily without taking out you trusty phillips head screwdriver and separating the two pieces apart.  Then there's the recess area where the lid drops down into so that you can securely turn and close the lid.  Again, food and liquid can get into that area which can be difficult to clean.. Other than that, I found a new toy and it works wonderfully!  So far, I have made Beef Stew, Kalua Pork and a Roast.  All turned out excellent and it sure beats out the slow cooker.  Most things can be cooked within 1/2 hour not counting the preparation time.  It's one handy little unit and for a busy family that needs to get food out in a hurry ..... hard to beat!. Next up?  Hmmmmm, maybe short ribs?

review_title: Like it but item is missing
review_body: It is very useful, we already used it to make beef stew, rice porridge and steam chicken thighs.  Very convenient, but not sure if it shorten cooking time that much; however, it definitely faster than slow cooker and don't have to monitor it.. However, the trivet is missing.  I didn't notice it before.  And when I read the amazon reviews, I notice this is very common problem.  I wonder why the company has not fixed this packaging issue.

review_title: I love the Instant Pot and the customer service is excellent.
review_body: After a few months, my instant pot started to leak steam from the vent at high pressure. The pot still worked great at low pressure, but I wasn't happy with the steam loss at high pressure. The company worked with me and determined that the steam sensor might have been letting the internal pressure get higher than usual, thereby releasing steam to prevent a safety problem. (The weight in the vent will never allow the pressure difference to get large enough for a safety problem to occur. The weak point is the vent and it will lift if the pressure goes higher than intended.) The safety features on this multi-cooker are very well designed and the customer service is fantastic. I have a new cooker (works perfectly), and I am sending back the first one. I am at high altitude, so the addition of pressure allows me to cook things that just haven't worked very well without this cooker. I will be getting the 6 Q for Christmas this year. I note that it adjusts the programs for altitude. I've gotten rid of my slow cookers and my egg cooker. Corned beef used to take all day and is done and tender pretty quickly now. Rice on the stove takes about 45 minutes, but is done perfectly in half the time with this pot. Being able to saute ingredients prior to cooking at high pressure (stews, risotto) is a great option. I'll be keeping one on my counter at all times. I've never bothered to write a review before, but I am just that pleased with this item and the company in general.

The wife 'had' to have one of these. (because all of her friends had recently gotten them). When they were on sale for Christmas, I gave in. (We already have 3 crock pots and never use any of them). Fast forward 3 weeks, and it was still sitting on the counter un-used.. So, to keep from taking a sledge hammer to it, I decided to try it out.. (maybe that was her plan all along.....). I am not a fan of traditional 'crock pot type meals'!!!!!. (too many pot lucks when I was growing up). I have to say - this thing is pretty amazing and I am glad we got it.  Even if I am the one that has to use it.  I've made 3 meals so far, and every one has been delicious.  Even our picky 5 year old liked them!. (he normally survives strictly on chicken nuggets). 2 things to know....... 1.  Prep time is usually 30min - 1hr for most meals. 2.  It takes 10-20min to reach temp and pressurize before the cook time starts, and another 5 - 20min to cool and de-pressurize.. So,  if the recipe says 5min cook time = 30min real time. Still, I cooked a 2.5lb pork roast in 1 hour (plus 15min warm up and 15min cool down)

I purchased this pressure cooker earlier in the year but it's really only come into it's own in my house now that they holidays are upon us. Living alone it takes a bit of motivation to get me to cook in quantity so my use of the pressure cooker was limited until recently. It does a wondeful job with everything I've tried so far, but again, my use was limited.. Over the holidays though I decided I'd be a good guest this year and bring some dishes along with me. This pressure cooker makes it easy, and yes, even fun. My latest was a super simple Kalua Pig recipe (thing Hawaiian style pulled pork). The local supermarket had a great sale and I ended up with a 12 pound butt. I decided to take half to Xmas dinner and cook half later.. Because you really want to cook the pork down to the point that it'll shred easy with a fork a pressure cooker is great. It could take a day on the stove slow cooking, but in 100 minutes (and I probably could have done it in 90 but I wanted to be sure) I made short work of it.. The Instant Pot IP-DUO60 7-1 isn't the lastest version, that's bluetooth enabled version that costs about twice as much. I live in a small apartment so I really, really didn't need to be able to control things from my couch; it's a few steps to the kitchen.. The controls on the cooker are easy to use and fairly intuitive. A handy chart is included which I've put up on my fridge.. I've not tried the autosettings yet as most of the things I've tried have been from recipes that include cooking times, but I've no reason to doubt they work. Generally I use the saute setting to brown my meat; works great. Then I add some liquid, seal it up, and set the time. In a very short time I've got a great meal.. I have made both large quantities of single meats, like the Kalua Pig, as well as one point meals like a pork loin wit cauliflower (for mashing) with equal ease.. This is an electric pressure cooker so it won't develop quite the pressure a stovetop model would thus cooking times are marginally longer. However cooking times are so much shorter than they might otherwise be (100 minutes vs all day for instance) that it's not going to be noticeable for most things.. I'm very happy with this pressure cooker and am looking forward to my next challenge!

We all have our preferences, but I absolutely LOVE my Instant Pot! I've owned dozens of electric and stove top pressure cookers over the past 3 decades and the Instant Pot outperforms them all. I guess I should thank my husband for destroying my old stovetop nonstick Kitchen Essentials--an expensive but well-made pot...but if anyone can burn a quality cooking vessel beyond redemption, he's the guy! LOL Fortunately, he stays away from my electronic kitchen gizmos.. There are so many things to like about the Instant Pot that I can't name them all, but just to touch on a couple of them: The stainess steel inner pot is as easy to clean as it is attractive. The 2-hour time limit on pressure is perfect for things that would normally take much longer--like bone broth, for example. No need to worry about overfilling the pot, as in the old 2/3 full rule. At times I've filled my Instant Pot about 1 inch from the top and it's worked beautifully (tho I wouldn't recommend this as a rule or frequent practice!). Also, I detest the flavor, and usually the texture, of slow-cooked foods, but I've been able to make two dishes so far that are a-ma-zing and have no "crock pot taste" that was such a turnoff with other slow cookers. If there's one drawback, it's the way the silicone seal holds the odor of the last thing you cooked. Running it through the dishwasher didn't help. Soaking it in a vinegar solution was pointless. I'll get a replacement seal, and follow some of the ideas posted in the Q&A section there.

review_title: This is the way to cook!
review_body: I'm very pleased with the quality and performance of this product.  I am also amazed at all the EASY recipes that are available for instant pot cooking!  The best thing about this is how tender, juicy and quick you can cook meats with an instant pot.  It is also very easy to clean after use as the insert is stainless steel and washes great in the dishwasher.  The lid gets moist with the steam as it is released after the cooking cycle, and wipes clean very easily using a vinegar-moistened paper towel, followed by a dry one.

I love it.  I love how tender it makes meat and how easy beans are to make.  The best is how easy hard boiled eggs peel when made in this pot.  It can't correct all my bad cooking choices but sure does help with many.  Ribs that fall off the rib, chicken and turkey that is juicy, and pot or pork roast that is fall apart tender.  All made easy with this pot.. One note:  Never let hard boiled eggs slow release.  They still peel easy but no one cares because they are inedible.  Like I said it can't correct all my mistakes.. The best advice I read here was to get a second insert pot.  So often I make a meat and vegetables and having a second pot makes that much easier.

review_title: Although the diaper genie products tend to be pretty expensive, this system is great
review_body: Although the diaper genie products tend to be pretty expensive, this system is great. We keep it upstairs since it's a far away from our outdoor trash can and we don't want the upstairs to smell from a poopy diaper. In my opinion spending the money on these is worth it.

review_title: We ended up just buying a regular garbage can and an air freshener
review_body: We ended up just buying a regular garbage can and an air freshener. These aren't worth the money. The bag fills up in like four seconds and it smells instantly. Regular garbage can holds a lot more and costs much less.

review_title: No difference from competing brands, buy generic
review_body: This product does the job and is the same brand that makes the diaper genie but it's not the only product on the market. There are competing generic brands that offer the same quality but additional quantity for the same price, if not less. This product works just fine but I would save some money and go generic.

review_title: Still beats other alternatives, it works best for what it is designed to do!
review_body: We have tried every alternative out there (trash bags, grocery bags, ziplocs) and at the end of the day you cannot beat the genie refills in a genie system. Sure, other ways were cheaper but these are so easy to deal with. If you don't mind spending a few extra dollars to get rid of the "yuck" associated with dirty diapers, buy a Diaper Genie Deluxe and few refills, you will thank yourself later! Now, to find an "easy" way to clean the Diaper Genie itself!

review_title: ... after trying some other brands hoping they would work better. They don’t block odor
review_body: I bought these after trying some other brands hoping they would work better. They don’t block odor, the rip when you pull it through to tie the bottom and they don’t hold many diapers. I’ve gone through the three packages much faster than other brand I have tried. They are more expensive and don’t hold up. So disappointed

I've been purchasing these since my son was born.  The diaper genie and these refills really help to cut down on the odor in his nursery.  While I'll admit that if my son has a super stinky diaper sometimes you can still smell it lingering after opening and closing the diaper genie, it's a heck of a lot better than just putting it in a trash can, or the alternative of taking it outside to the trash can every time he goes #2.  I guess the only negative is the price, I wish they were a little cheaper but I'm willing to pay because I really do think it's worth it.  A pack of 3 usually lasts me a couple of months, but my nephew also stays with us a couple of days a week so that adds to the # of diapers.

I like the Diaper Genie system and these refill bags are a must. They work very well, however they're very expensive. Amazon is the cheapest source of these bags, but even then it's hard to justify.. Apparently I'm able to justify it, since we've been using them for almost two years and keep re-ordering.. Add it to your Subscribe & Save. Save a little money and you'll need them on a regular basis anyway. I believe a package of 3 lasts us approximately 3-months). When kids are younger they pee/poop more but the diapers are much smaller and as they age the opposite is true.

I buy Sparkle, and they're not like that at all! They're kinda thin and kinda rough, but they're absorbent enough for me. They cost less than the fancy brands. Maybe I would use less of the more absorbent towels to clean up the same amount of mess, so the price might even out if I bought the better ones, but I really don't mind my thin, scratchy Sparkles.
They don't have the softness of other paper towels, but the do the job and they pick a size.  This package is ginormous.

First one and then another very sick cat where the reasons I purchased two of these for my new expensive split king size bed mattresses. They both passed away before I received the product and could get a chance to see how effectively water proof they are. However, I was interested in these as they were not supposed to change the feel of the mattress. Since I spent a fortune on memory foam mattresses I was very concerned about that. They did not make a difference and in fact my other regular mattress pads had a greater affect on the feel. These were like sleeping directly on the mattress. It amazed me as waterproof usually means lots of noise and overly hot. I don't normally review products as I just don't have the time, but this product deserves the time. I will purchase more for my guest bedrooms, when I have time that is.

review_body: Fits well and is nice. However, I would not even chance drying this product in the dryer as it seemed to shed a tiny tiny bit. So wonderful product but I will air dry from now on. ( not sure if that is in the directions. mommy brain right now)

Its knitted fabric and so plush. It came early, and ill be seeing what else this seller has that I might need now. Heavily impressed.

This particular item is oversized so that it doesn't pull off the mattress.  Can't comment on the hypo-allergenic claims as I don't have allergies.  Really like it compare to some undersized ones I have had.

This is a must have for your mattress, especially if you buy it brand new.  I was delighted that this was the same quality and product for this purchase but a fraction of what we paid for the last mattress we bought at a retail store. I would highly recommend people seeing this first before  buying a new mattress at a retail store where store salesman's pitch and price for a this cover saying you must have to maintain mattress warranty.

It is thin and breathes well, yet is waterproof.  I have never lied waterproof mattress covers before because they usually are a lot of crinkle noise but this one is completely silent.  The price is great as well.  I would not hesitate to buy his mattress pad again.  In fact, I did!  I bought two others for the other beds in my home!

Low and behold when I opened this package, the product was made EXACTLY the same as the more expensive pads but at a much better price. I won't be fooled again. Safe rest has a new regular customer!

I bought a new Casper mattress, this first new mattress I've ever owned, and I want to keep it in perfect condition for as long as I can.  I purchased this mattress protector because I have 3 cats and they can be unpredictable (spill drinks on the bed from the side table, have accidents, etc.).  I waited until such an accident occurred before writing my review.. Today, one of my cats vomited her breakfast all over the sheets on my bed.  I pulled back the sheets to see the big stain on the mattress cover and thought surely it would have bled through to the mattress.  But this protector really does its job!  Not even a drop got through and my mattress still looks good as new.  I just threw the cover in the wash so I am looking forward to seeing how much of the stain comes out of the cover.

I didn't think we would need it so soon, but I'm glad it got here when it did or our foam mattress would have been ruined.  It's been back on the bed and washed a few times after and is holding up nicely.  We're glad we made this purchase.

Have had this scale for about a week now, it looks really nice in my bathroom.  Also the light up blue background is a help, as well as auto shut off after so many seconds.  It seems to weight accurately, though it does seem if you weigh yourself three times in a row you get a couple pounds difference each time.  The results to zero out pretty fast and you don't have to wait as long to step back on again.  Also nice that it uses regular batteries and not those annoying to find circle ones :)

Elegant. Futuristic. Accurate. These are words only reserved for the digital masterpiece that is: "The Etekcity Digital Body Weight Scale with Step On Technology." As easily as it adapts to the environment of every decorum, so does it too allow it's master the convenience of a hassle-free measurement of their mass multiplied by the acceleration of gravity.. There are no menus; no memory logs; no buttons (that I know of). It is it's simplicity that makes itself a glorious asset to any lavatory or gymnasium locker room. Step upon its platform and gaze in wonder at this modern marvel.. If you had any doubts about which scale to purchase online for under 20 dollars, you need look no further. Dismiss any contenders and enjoy the prodigy of Etekcity.

review_title: Be ready....what it says is right!
review_body: This scale is perfectly accurate.....unfortunately. My husband and I weighed ourselves and I thought that the scale must be on the heavy side. There is just no way what it said could be true....right?....wrong? Much to my dismay I put a 5lb bag of flour on it and it weighed exactly 5 lbs. Bummer for me..diet time. It looks great and is accurate. I will definitely buy Etekcity products in the future.

review_title: Works as long as you follow the instructions.
review_body: Works and accurate. Just make sure you are gentle with it and that you follow the instructions to keep it on a hard and Even surface like wood not carpet before using.

This is the second Etekcity scale I've purchased. Unfortunately, both of them have been inconsistent. Every time I stepped on my first earlier model, it would read a different number. Disgruntled, I purchased this new model due to the fair price and overwhelming number of positive reviews. However, this model also states that my weight dramatically changes between weigh ins. Between a 5-8 pound difference! Because I'm trying to lose weight, this scale is not helpful to me.
Purchased this in July 2015.  Still love it and it works great every single day.  No problem.  Just changed the battery out in May 2017.

review_title: Works great! And I had a doctor appointment and their ...
review_body: Works great!  And I had a doctor appointment and their office uses this scale, so I guess if it is good enough for a doc office it is good enough for my house!

review_title: When they weighed me when I got the doctors office I was amazed. They need to calibrate their scale too
review_body: I guess it works, but I honestly think it lies.  I believe it needs calibrating.  It seems to be 30 lbs or so off.  So the other morning I had a doctor's appointment.  I weighted myself just before leaving.  When they weighed me when I got the doctors office I was amazed.  They need to calibrate their scale too.  It said I weighed the same.

review_title: It is very easy to read the blue numbers
review_body: Delivery was very fast and well packaged. The scale is very attractive. It appears to be accurate compared to my doctor's scale. It is very easy to read the blue numbers. I don't have to put on my glasses to read them. This is a positive quality. The scale is very slim and compact. I am well pleased with t he scale so far.

Works fine as a scale at first, at least until the glass surface impacts, well, anything. Then the entire surface shatters into thousands of shards across the bathroom floor.. This product is far too fragile to be recommended -- I'd send back the 10,000 pieces for a refund if I could. Waste of money.. Edit: Seller contacted me and provided a free replacement unit, so I've raised from one to three stars for the customer service. We'll see how this one works out.

review_title: So far so good. I'm not sure I fully understand how to ...
review_body: So far so good. I'm not sure I fully understand how to use this yet but I've used it twice (it has taken longer to cook than what I've read it's supposed to take but I think that has more to do w/getting used to the settings and how to use it than it does w/the actual cooker) and have been satisfied both times. Not too hard to clean either. I couldn't decided on the size and went with the 8. I have a family of four and this is PLENTY big.

I have a multiple pressure cooker (PC) household. Small one for beans/veggies.  Large one for meat dishes. I didn't think I needed this. I didn't believe the hype until my 92 year old friend insisted I reconsider the instant pot. #1 This cooker has overhauled my rice cooking experience. Worth the price as a rice maker alone. No more pressure cooker mess with making brown/multi-grain rice. No more sprays over the ceramic cook top. No mess period. The InstantPot has helped me keep my stove top cleaner overall.  #2 I'm eating more vegetables. Steamed vegetables are a breeze in minutes. I have had some rookie mishaps though. Unlike with regular pressure cookers, this requires sufficient water for any and all dishes! It will not generate water for you by cooking down the foods as you can expect with regular pressure cookers.It does not function exactly like your existing PC.  If you can accept with that, you're good to go. I haven't tossed my old PCs. I find they cook dry beans down better. I may still be in learning curve for beans though.

review_title: Pot Only Worked Once Then Short Circuits
review_body: Loved the pot, it worked as described, very impressive. Then 2'nd time I tried to use it keeps blowing the GFCI. Confirmed nothing wrong with the outlet, pot is dry, no damage,  the pot has a short circuit, blows the GFCI, and no longer works.  Useless. Total waste. ???

review_title: Thank you, may I have another...
review_body: This is the first pressure cooker I've owned or even cooked with.  So maybe I'm missing something.  But at this point I don't even care.. I have been using this to cook for me and my wife.  We usually cook enough to have leftovers since it's generally cheaper to purchase food items in bigger quantities.  This product has met all of my expectations and even exceeded them in some ways (it steams corn like a champ).  I've cooked beef roasts, pork loins, lamb shoulder, pastas (comes out overcooked), yogurt (LOVE IT), potatoes, and our favorite thing in this so far, whole chicken.  I have only used it as a pressure cooker (not slow cooker) since it makes quick work of most meals.  It's easy to use, easy enough to clean, and easy to adjust most recipes for it.  If this one every dies I will definitely be getting another.. One downside I can see is for larger families.  Like I said, I am able to cook whole chickens in it (about 4-5 lbs).  But for those that have more than 4 mouths to feed I would take that into consideration.  Of course it all just depends on portion sizes...  Maybe you could just buy two?. Another downside is that if you like things crispy (like chicken skin?) don't expect it to come out of a pressure cooker that way.  It would take a trip to the broiler or a skillet to get that crisp back.  But that's not a fault of this model, that's a fault of all pressure cookers.  So I wouldn't knock it any stars due to that.

Once in a while, something comes along which actually works as well as it looks on the infomercials.  This seems to be one of those items.  I must admit that I have a weakness for kitchen gadgets and appliances.  So when I ordered this from Amazon, I figured it would be one more item that did not do very many things well, and I would rarely use it.  Being the eternal optimist, I figured it was worth a try.. The Instant Pot arrived a couple of days ago and I have put it through it's paces since.  I am all abut improvising, but to be fair, I have followed the directions to a tee for this cooker. After seasoning the pot as suggested in the operations manual, I have done several dishes.  I "baked" a large potato, made chili, cooked a great pot of oatmeal and pressure steamed frozen Cod steaks. Everything came out perfect.  I'm very impressed.  Tonight I am fixing pot roast with carrots and potatoes.  It should take about an hour, and I can't wait.  If my next few weeks continue on as positively as this began, I am planning to get rid of my stove-top pressure cooker, vegetable steamer & Crock pot and begin using this as my main cooking appliance.. The only negative thing I will say about the pot, is that I wish it were 8 quart rather than 6, but it works so well, seems crazy to pick it to pieces.. I'm very happy with this purchase.

review_title: loved it so much i bought another
review_body: i had one.  lasted just over a year and broke. loved it so much i bought another. i received my next one and used it once and the next time i used it i wouldn't even turn on!!! i went back to amazon to see if i could exchange it and its one day over the exchange date. i will not buy this product again. especially from amazon. i would buy it from a company that stands behind their appliances feror longer than 30 days. how was i suppose to know it would shell out after one use!!!

Arrived July 5th, 2015...Merry Almost Christmas to all, 12/23/15 my Insta-pot is malfunctioning. Doesn't stay pressurized. Starts to rapidly "steam out" loudly. Once recently semi-exploded! I'm now scared of the Insta-pot and regret not reading the lower scored reviews.

review_title: Perfect case of does many things "just ok," but not great in one
review_body: Perfect case of does many things "just ok," but not great in one. Does NOT cook rice perfect like the other rice cookers on the market that only cooks rice. Too many steps to start the cooking process and too many steps to wait in order to actually open the lid. Not convenient at all. In conclusion, pressure cookers are not ideal for rice cooking. The rice was a harder than normal, and when cooked rice was cooled down, it was harder compared to rice that was cooked in the other rice cookers. Disappointed that I fell for all the marketing and hype. Not worth the price, even the Black Friday price. Will return and purchase a cooker that specializes in rice only.

There is not a good enough word to describe how much I love my Instant Pot.. After ordering I spent about two weeks afraid to take it out of the box. Visions of exploded pressure cookers, and angry looking skin burns flooded my head.. Needless to say, I was being ridiculous. This is seriously one of the greatest inventions known to man and hands down my most used kitchen appliance.  This can easily replace a rice cooker, slow cooker, steamer, regular pressure cooker, yogurt maker and more.. I originally went with this brand because it was one of the only ones with a stainless steel insert as opposed to non stick, and also because it looked like I could get rid of quite a few appliances (haha, as if) and use this as a catchall.  It is very well made, has a large following and the maker provides decent customer service.. The only small complaint would be that the timing sheet/ instructions given with the pot are way off, and I had to seach out other resources in order to get the most out of my pot.. I used this  Instant Pot every single day for three months when I first started playing with it, didn't touch my oven/microwave or counter top oven in that entire time.  Originally I was afraid this wouldn't be very useful for someone who eats an entirely plant based diet but I was completely wrong.  Basmati rice in 4 minutes, perfectly cooked.  Vegan yogurt overnight at a fraction of the cost of buying it ready made,  soups, curries, tofu dishes,  steaming.. what can't this thing do?. Definitely give it a try even if you are a little bit hesitant!. To make your life easier I am going to link over to some resources that really helped me out with learning this appliance.. Jill Nussinow also has a great website, and her books have been invaluable, she has the most reliable timing charts in her books and is very active on the Facebook plant based instant pot groups!. I also really like JL Fields' book and website, and she is also active on a lot of the instant pot groups on facebook that are plant based.. Please feel free to ask me on here if you have any direct questions!

review_title: Quit Looking and Just Buy It!
review_body: I was hesitant to try this, since I already own a plethora of cooking appliances including crockpots and pressure cookers. Throw them all away and just get this! It makes the best hard (or soft!) boiled eggs, pot roast, soup, meats, etc. You won't be disappointed. I use it nearly every day. It is way easier to clean than my crockpot or pressure cooker. I also recommend buying the glass lid for this, I think it is $11 on Amazon. The other day I was cooking acorn squash and after 20 minutes or so, it started beeping and said "burn" on the display. This message didn't come in my quick guide, so I Googled it, and found out that the Instant Pot is smart enough to know when something is burning- so it lowers the temperature of the pot until it is safe to release. I had my acorn squash on the steam rack, and couldn't figure out why it would be burning, so I assumed this was a malfunction of some kind and started prepping to return my Instant Pot. Lo and behold, when I opened the pot 10 minutes later, I saw one of the halves had turned over and some squash-y goodness had seeped out to the bottom of the pot and it certainly LOOKED like it was about to burn. After removing my squash (which was PERFECTLY cooked, despite the burn notice), I quickly ran it under water and the brown spot on the bottom of the pan immediately came off. I was floored. If you have a pressure cooker, then you know there is a HUGE possibility of having it sit in the sink to sit for a few days to get off charred bits. I think my pressure cooker STILL has some residual burn marks on it. I am beyond pleased with the Instant Pot. I didn't think I would love anything more than my pressure cooker, but this thing did it. It's also great for Paleo/Whole30 diets, which my family sticks to 80% of the time. Also, unlike my pressure cooker, I haven't had any issues with the seal in the Instant Pot. I feel like I was constantly adjusting the seal on that sucker. Another big bonus is this guy is electric, and unlike my stovetop pressure cooker, this frees up my stovetop and sort of gives me an extra burner. I was hesitant on which size to get. When I called my mom for advice, she said, "I've never wanted a smaller dish before. I have only ever wished I grabbed a bigger one." and boy that is the truth. Also keep in mind, that if you do high-pressure cooking, you can't fill it all the way up to the top, so I recommend getting the 8 qt one. If you already have a pressure cooker, you will immediately fall in love- the process is very much the same. If you haven't ever cooked with a pressure cooker before, you might need to give it a few meals before you make any judgments. Quit stalking it and buy it already! This thing is legit amazeballs and I am sorry I didn't buy one sooner.

I've used a lot of steamers in the last several years, and the best is the big stand-up model...(I happen to have a Jiffy stand up model $$$$$!). "My Little Steamer is probably the best hand held model, because it holds more water, and so stays on longer.  The beef I have about it now is that it is starting to spit water at the cloths once in awhile.  But, all in all, I would recommend this little steamer.
